reviews.review: Must do. You can view the aquarium from the mall, or go inside and walk through the tunnel. Fascinating to see various fish, sharks etc., although it is expensive. We also went on the glass bottom boat ride, not really worth the extra money but you do see more fish close up

Short tunnel . Beware this is quite a short tunnel that you will cover in under 10 minutes if paying for the ticket
Better to enjoy it from the outside then take the tunnel tour
Great visit. A very good day out with our 2 year old, he loved to see all the different fish and animals. We got the tickets with the Burj Kalifa ticket so a good discount on the package.

Fabulous 'bucket list' for Dubai!. Absolutely loved the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo! Take your time to walk around it, take lots of photos. Even though there is an organised Kodak moment of your visit, this will cost you quite a bit! Super well-organised. Make sure you do the glass bottom boat tour.
Amazing!. We spend several hours walking through the various sections of this aquarium. It's fantastic and definitely worth a visit.

Good to walk around . We bought the cheapest ticket (100 each I think) as we were just killing a bit of time but it was quite good inside. (I'm sure families with kids would find it fantastic).The only bad things about it were the hard sell pictures. It was really annoying, at one of the picture stands the girl accidentally printed out the pictures and you would of thought she'd just give us one anyway with it being an accident but nope!Another thing is that all the animals seemed happy in the environment they were in apart from the massive crocodiles. I know it's a big exhibition for the aquarium but i felt bad for them as they were in such a small enclosure for how big they were, it was a shame and I actually felt guilty about paying money to see it.
Amazing. Right in the heart of the mall and quite amazing to watch the huge numbers of fish as you shop. Take the tour round, it is well worth it.

Third visit to the underwater zoo. This place is always a fun place to visit every time I'm in Dubai. The novelty may be wearing off a bit though. The underwater tunnel always fascinates where you are practically staring sharks in the eye. A worthy visit for anyone visiting the Dubai mall.

Just Okay. This is in the mall so you can see the fish from the outside without paying to walk through the "tunnel". We were able to see the same thing swimming on the outside as they see paying for and swimming on the inner side of the tube. I wouldnt waste $$ on walking through it.
Family loved it. We went with the boat package . All family members loved it.Worth visiting. but it is a one time thing. I recommend it for families with kids .

fun afternoon at aquarium. One of the best afternoons I've had in dubai. reasonably priced when compared to other family activities in dubai more than just an aquarium also includes some smaller winter climate animals such as penguins and nocturnal animal area was magical the world's biggest crocodile and the bird area with rare birds such as the golden finches were cherries on top spent several hours and didn't even realise the time passing my family included a 2 year old and 60+year olds and each of us had an excellent time the glass bottom boat was one of the best bits where we got up close to the fish didn't try the Explorer zone or swimming with the sharks but I'm sure the latter especially would be epic the kids loved having a feel at the star fish the variety of beautiful fish, the clean and beautiful created environment, the friendly staff and the educational information provided about each animal species just led to a wonderful and memorable experience

Great attraction let down by poor animal welfare. Visited with family, this is a seemingly great attraction in the middle of the mall however the living conditions for some inhabitants were shocking at least. The otter, water rat and penguin enclosures were overcrowded and the animals were clearly suffering from stress, overheating and looked pretty depressed! On this alone I would discourage people to visit until the zoo takes action on this. I'm no vet so would welcome any counter-argument from the zoo.

Great experience good collection of fishes. Great experience for children and families especially great pictures to be clicked as souvenir / remembrance. One can do the tunnel and glass boat ride as a one time experience with great collection of sharks and sting rays. The zoo has the giant croc, penguins, good collection of interesting fishes,
Great aquarium in Dubai Mall. If you travelling with children it will be great to visit aquarium and underwater zoo in Dubai Mall.

Fun educations and amazingly cleaned in zoo. Been in Dubai for nearly 5 years but just able to visit this place recently.Kids will definitely love it. We can learn, see, touch, hear, and feel it. Of course in the right context ... follow the rules!!Don't visit it at weekend bit crowded. Everything was soo clean, clear..All the animal looks very healthy and very happy!!!Tips:Its not a huge place so, enjoy it! Take your time in every attractions.Its consisted by 2 floor. Ground and 2nd floor.
Amazing. Excellent... The kids enjoyed the whole experience of having sharks swimming over their heads and a close up of Nemo and Dory

Hugeness!!!. A very huge aquarium with a lot of different species put together. A researcher ticket would be giving the maximum exposure which includes access to Tunnel, Submarine simulator, Underwater zoo and Glass bottom boat ride on top of the aquarium water. Very good for kids and teenagers. Huge sharks, varieties of rays are the main attractions in the aquarium. The Giant crocodile is a must see specie. Feeding time is 4PM for the Giant croc and if possible do not miss that time. Overall a good experience.

Best Aquarium. Visit this aquarium and your expectation will change, it has 20k fish inside, you can go round the top of the aquarium in glass boat and see all the fish and feed them, don’t touch them or else they will bite. Defiantly worth it. You can buy ticket on the door on the day. Quite times are after 8pm.

Really huge underwater zoo. This place is amazing, it is situated in the biggest mall in the world, Dubai mall. There are lots staff to see, fishes, wateranimals , crabs and snakes , they are all alive.
worth the visit. my child and i had a very nice time there and it is really well organized having the fishes and everything thererecommended

Bigger than you think!. This place is actually bigger than you think. At first I assumed it was just the underwater tunnel but actually there is 3 floors. Pretty good place to visit, kids will love it!
If you have the Dubai Entertainer Voucher Book you can get buy one get one free on the ticket.

A must do :). Compared with the aquarium from the Atlantis Hotel this one is more interesting and the experience is more intense. I totaly recommend this one. The underwater zoo is realy nice. It gives a lot of value to the money you spend here
to expensive.. shocked at having to pay 100dhs.. after going through the Atlantic aquarium I didn't both with this, just looked from a distantce.. was very disappointed at having to pay so much

Must See. It's really an Amazing destination for couples either families, don't miss the explorer tickets you will have a tour inside the laboratory and inside the Aquarium with a boat and also there is a underwater simulation good for kids

Excellant attraction. We visited whilst waiting for our scheduled Burj Kafekia time slot.
Impressive array of deep water species, very informative, worth the visit
Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. Overall experience is good but the Aquarium is not as big as I expected. The glass underwater boat is not worth for the money, advise not to try!
Great. Spectacular to see from the mall, even with out going in to the Aquarium, although I would recommend going in! Lots to see and you get free admission if you use the hop on hop off bus.
Under Water like expereince. It is underwater aquarium constructed in the middle of the Dubai Mall. Aquarium should be experienced by diving with different type of fishes including sharks.
So interesting. It's so interesting to see ! Full of life . Surprisingly beautiful animals . Makes you smile because of the beauty of the fishes and the life under water .

Childs Thrill. My 4year old G. daughter was thrilled when we travelled in a glass bottom boat, over the top of this magnificent Aquarium. She pointed out the large sting rays and sharks, it was so lovely to see her in awe of all the beautiful fish.

Great each time!. I have visited this aquarium many times and always like it. Its a great experience, kid friendly and the new "research" area is a very nice addition. Guests get information on animal breeding, conservation and research that is being conducted at the aquarium.
Great Sharks! Loved the Otters!. Everything you'd expect from an aquarium. The behind-the-scenes tour as part of the basic package is a nice touch.
Must have seen. It's a nice attraction in the Dubai Mall. Lots of big fish in the aquarium. This time it wasn't busy. Even inside or outside you can get great pictures.

Cute otters. This Aquarium is a nice break from the shopping. When we visited it was possible to buy four different tickets. Depending on what you want to see and experience. If you buy tickets at the groundfloor you have to stand in a line. If you buy ticket in the 2end floor there are almost none. But the tour "starts" at the groundfloor. We did it in the wrong direction. No problem! It is a good aquarium when you think of the location in a shoppingmal!

Not bad but avoid going during eid . Not bad at all.. We bought Explorer package. I love the ride whereby you can see fishes swimming underneath the glass boat. Stingrays and the sharks are really cheeky and they sort of knows that you snapping photos. Unfortunately, I didn't managed to upload pictures as I lost my phone in one of the residential area. Pick pocketed. Oh well
Nice place in the mall!. It's beautiful ,a really pretty place. The sharks are an important attraction.I really recommand it!!!

The Jr or Sr Aquarist ticket are good value. The tunnel is spectacular, and though the exhibit is not as expansive as Singapore SeaWorld, it was teeming with sharks and the shark week exhibits were informative. The aquarist programs at AED 150 were a combo of the Researcher and Explorer packs (so u get both the flat bottomed boat ride and the behind the scenes). The behind the scenes was largely about feeding these enormous sea creatures and their babies. But the guides are efficient while being patient with the kids questions. The boat (punt) just rides over the tank, but is a must see. The feeding is nice if standing in deep sea water till your knees among fast gliding rays is your thing. The divers seemed to be making heavy weather (just remember its just a large tank).The mall has cute views, with vast expanses of glass. Particularly liked the divers near the H&M stores who take pics of you when you are standing at a designated spot. The posed photos are borderline scam, but are fun if you are a large group.

The wonderful water world in the desert. the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo is the perfect break activity when you visit the Dubai Mall. The facilities offer a unique perspective into the life of fish of all sizes. The aquarium tunnel lets you walk along with the big fish surrounded by water. This is a must see attraction which you cant miss.

Magical. Good value for money paid for ticket. You can see very weird creatures in different colors. The zoo also is as attractive as the aquarium. Everyone will stay for at least 10 minutes looking at the alligators

Holiday sightseeing. We were in Dubai on a family vacation & decided to take my 1 year old to visit the aquarium after being recommended to go. My son loved the experience and was mesmerised watching all the variety of fish & sharks.The experience took us 30-45 mins & cost roughly £20 per adult with our son getting in for free.It was worth the admission fee seeing my sons face when we first went through the tunnel.

An interesting place to explore. Went there with my friends.. Had a tough time in the parking area almost roaming for 1 HR to find a place for the car to the park. The aquarium was very interesting place.. Lots of varieties of various types of fishes and various sea creature.s.will be liked by kids specially..amd a great place for pictures.. Max 4 hrs can be spent

Fun visit. Visited as part of a trip to the Dubai Mall, did not book anything in advance, we got the cheapest tick which was AED 100 each, spent around an hour and a half on our visit which had a 10 min guided tour to start. The place was lovely and clean and nice and quiet whilst we were there, we walked straight in no queues but later in the day the queues were getting very long. All the exhibits were great to see especially the otters, water rats and penguins. One tank which was especially worth a look contained each of the characters from Nemo!!Well worth a visit but no need to buy the more expensive tickets unless you so desire!

Denise. You can see a lot of the underwater zoo in the mall without paying to go in. The photographers are too persistent. They are intimidating and do not take no for an answer. I did not go there to have my photo taken and with today's technology who is going to pay for a photo. There was no clear direction of where you need to go after the underwater zoo as it is not clear it is two floors up. Some interesting animals but not worth an hour out of your holiday
an amazing site to see. The presentation of the Aquarium is superb the amount and variety of fish,coral and all underwater life was so varied and they even had a diver in their with the fish

Finding Nemo and Dory alive and kicking in Dubai. Wow what an experience have been twice now in the last year, last in August with the Shark week it was well worth the visit, the options you have go go around the Aquarium is great valve for money and if fancy it you can even feed the fish,you can even seen the fish food restaurant where they prepare the food for the fish. Nemo and Dory are there too. the price also includes the entrance to see the Croc.

At the Heart of the Dubai Mall. At first, I wasn't too impressed with the aquarium, but that was before I walked through it. While it was by no means the largest aquarium I've ever been in, it is one of the most unique given its location in the middle of a very large shopping mall. We received a free coupon for buying a two day ticket to the hop-on-hop-off bus and went through the aquarium and I'm glad we did because it was very interesting.

Great concept. As the aquarium and zoo is located within the mall. I was immediately interested in exploring the facilities. In my honest opinion, it's a good facility however it is not something that I would go out of my way to visit. It seems like a "if you have time" activity. Although the additional features such as stingray feeding and glassbottom boat are interesting, it's not going to out-do Atlantis. The initial tank has a fantastic visual effect, however due its location it's limited.

Interesting entertainment. There are several types of entry fees, according to what would you like to see. I got the Explorer ticket I could see the huge aquarium, could go through the tunnel and could visit the underwater zoo.

Very impressive. We went there coz we had an hour to kill but it was worth every penny. Only £25 for entry tickets and it's a lot bigger than it looks. There are other animals when you go upstairs and kids would love it.

Good to Visit. With time to spare we decided to visit this attraction and so pleased we did! For people who have a fascination about sharks to walk through the tunnel and see them that close is brilliant - those teeth!!! They are keen on their conservation so to do the guided tour was very interesting and then the underwater Zoo is great! King Croc is a must see but the story behind King Croc and his 'Lady' is so sweet. For such formidable creatures to read their story is just fascinating - to see another side to them. However he is one enormous boy!!

Good but not better than Lost Chambers. The aquarium is pretty much bang in the middle of the mall. We had a combo ticket for Burj and the Aquarium. We were planning to visit the aquarium first and then the Burj Khalifa, but we were told we'll have to do it the other way around - how odd! Nonetheless, the beginning part of the aquarium is good, you get to see all the sharks. At the entrance they take your pictures and price wise it's not worth it at all. Just another money making scheme, we were told that all the pictures would cost £70! Or if we wanted to buy one then £20. Not worth it at all, so we kindly declined. The underwater zoo is okay, smells quite fishy as it's more of an open tank area with a variety of fishes. They have penguins there as well. The underwater zoo is on the third floor so finding it and getting to it is a little tricky. All in all it was okay, but I personally preferred lost chambers at the Atlantis.

Best aquarium I've been to (Ray Encounter was great!). I've been to many aquariums, but this one was by far the best. The Underwater Zoo and Ray Encounter (where you feed the Rays in the water) was a once in a lifetime experience. Other than sharks, fish, and 6 different types of rays, they have owls, parrots, otters, two MASSIVE crocodiles, and penguins.
Dubai Underwater zoo. It was just as i saw in the pictures. very beautiful and safe. large display of aquatic life. we really enjoyed our visit.

Grate value . We decided to visit the aquarium when we had a few hours to kill, great because we didn't need to pre book tickets or queue for long to purchase on the day tickets.We opted for a one above basic tour tickets which got you full aquarium access along with the glass bottom boat ride.Great value and the aquarium itself lived up to it's reputation with thousands of fish, reptiles and aquatic a amimals to look at.Definitely woth a visit.

Impressive collection of sealife. Located in the dubai mall. Various ticket options. We seemed to get a deal by using our visa card. There is a tunnel to walk though where you feel part of the sea with sharks and enormous rays swimming around you. Then you move upstairs with various large tanks of fish all excellently displayed. Further along there are giant spider crabs, penguins and an enormous crocodile (eek). Really kept my 3yr old entertained. There is a large part of the main tank visible from shopping centre but there is much more to see when you pay to get inside. Well worth it and a good indoor activity to escape a hot day!!
very good for budget tourists. You can spend hours (while your wife is at shopping) watching the fishes without giving a penny for this.
great construct. to have such a setup in a mall and to maintain the facility in itself is a big achievement and worth watching and it is easily accessible by metros and nearby hotels.

Large aquarium tank outside... Have read that Dubai has one of the biggest aquarium in the world. After visiting it, I know now they meant aquarium tank, not the aquarium complex. Given the price (AED 100+), I was a bit disappointed. I do not understand why ppl would say this was better than Singapore aquarium, as the place was not big. It's good for small kids though, but I have seen better. The highlight would be indeed the king Croc..Indeed, what ppl say about the other fact is true as well; you can see the large aquarium tank inside the mall. No need to pay for the entrance.

What you see from the Mall is the most exciting aspect of the aquarium. Other than walking under the tunnel of the aquarium, there is not much to see here when compared to most aquariums. I don't know if it is worth the entrance fee when what you see from the mall is the greatest part of the aquarium.

Exciting. You can watch from outside without entrance fee, but in case You want to dive deeper into it you should go inside and book: a diving, a submarine, a boat ride with feeding sharks at the end! No worries, everything is on the safe side.

Amazing Sea Life. This is a big tank of sea life, you can spend hours just looking at the fish, sharks etc
It is a must go see

Good for young children. We came across this Aquarium as we shopped in the mall.The price was reasonable so we decided to give it a go.Quite a lot of waiting around in between seeing each part.Did not realise we would have to leave and go to other floors to complete the tour which was not the easiest the find.More signs directing would be helpful.The selection of animals was good though.The simulator was good for children.The boat was ok but a little slow.The feeding of the fish was good.

OmG great experience. I was definitely not expecting to see and do so much stuff at this aquarium. I fed the sting rays, I took a boat ride on top of the aquarium in the mall!! And walked through and seen crocodiles, owls and penguins. Not what I thought at all what this place was. I went in the tunnel at the end of my trip there and it was absolutely worth the AED 200. I would do this again but next time, I will make sure I plan for three hours to do everything again.

Very disappointing. There is very little to see. Once you get in, a couple of Philippinos insist on you taking a few picture swhich they will be selling to you at the end of the tunnel for 150AED in a booklet. No need to go inside you can as much from outside the entrance. Very disappointing the zoo is also very poor. Singapore zoo and aquariums are a million time better.

Nothing quite like it!. You would never believe that it is inside the Mall and what you can see at the Mall, inside it is so much bigger and magical. You are literally transported into another world and there's different levels to it. You can choose from different types of tickets. We chose the "researchers" ticket which is 100 aed per person. With this ticket you see the underwater tunnel, underwater zoo, back of house tour and glass floor. It's over 2 floors and even the windows of the shop that you come out of has fish in the windows, just amazing.All definitely worth the money. It is the biggest Aquarium in the UAE, second biggest in the world... you have to check this out if you're at Dubai Mall.

Good fun experience. It's a good place to visit but do not compare it to the large aquariums and Europe or the statesIf you are in Dubai mall and you have children or teenagers just take them to see the aquarium they will enjoy it

Outside view. We didn't actually pay to go in as you can see all you need to by just looking from the outside as it is in the shopping centre. You can scuba dive the tank and go in a glass bottom boat but what for . We just sat in the nearby restaurant and enjoyed watching what was happening in the HUGE tank
Fish galore. Really enjoyed this place, saw a lot of sharks, took loads of photos, was nice with the fish swimming over your heads, well worth a visit.

Breathtaking!. This Aquarium is incredible. The only one that i had ever saw at the same level is the one at Ubatuba (Brazil).Not only the famous water tunnel, but also the other part. Visit both with enough time (reserve at least 2 hours). It is amazing!!!
Very Nice Aquarium in Dubai Mall. Right near the entrance to Dubai mall is the Aquarium.Not the best but very nice.Then you go to the 2nd floor for the zoo which also was very nice but not enormous .

The tunnel is one of the best parts!. Inside its not super special or engaging. I got the 'Explorer Ticket' but the glassbottom boat wasn't very interesting. Maybe a dive would have livened things up?

Amazed. Tunnel of water like structure is really amazing and it is situated in Dubai mall where you can enjoy all kinds of brands and it is place where you must to have go. Crocodiles and octopus is really most beautiful there.
Nice. Nice mall with great aquarium have to pay extra for under tunnel view of aquarium and extras but is a must see attraction
My kids loved it. My partner and my 2 year old and one year old loved it they kept saying fish fish fish for the whole day great for younger kids
Other world . Once you step there to the tunnel you feel you are in anther dimension. I guarantee that you will enjoy it as much as the kids. If you are in the Dubai mall , you must plan to visit it.

Short Trip to UAE. A very huge aquarium I have ever seen in my life till now with so many types of Fish, you will just want to see them for hours as much as you can. Very Beautiful and must visit place
it is inside a shopping center!!!!. it is amazing to be inside a mall,, the size of that, and the quantity of animals, Dubai no limits, only here you can find that
Great.. Lovely place.. my kids enjoyed seeing so many fishes in one place. The underwater zoo was also great.

Travelling with kids? Do not miss!. Dubai has a lot of indoor activities for kids. But this is something we do not get in any other city. The viewing area in Dubai mall alone is worth the entry fee. We were actually apprehensive that the under water zoo might be disappointing. But the whole visit was captivating. The Dubai nocturnal creatures was underdone. The visit to the Aquarium was the highlight of Dubai visit for our little one, and us. If we ever visit Dubai again, this is where we will go first thing.
Enjoyable. It is an ok place. The tanks on the superior level are ok. However you may want to pay some more en enjoy the one at the Palm a bit more. Choices
Amazing. I have no idea how they can create such an exhibition of underwater marine life in the middle of a shopping mall, but they did and it is truly amazing.
Stunning Aquarium in a shopping mall.. What a mall, every shop you can imagine ! The aquarium was amazing with over 30,000 exhibits. Great distraction from the credit card meltdown.

Well worth it. Really enjoyed this zoo inside. No way could we have seen a zoo outside plus I don't know how the animals would cope with the heat unless from hot countries. The aquarium and its lab is outstanding and the tour explains all they do to look after the animals. We only had the basic package but we got plenty for our money
Pay or free viewing. When you visit the mall head for the aquarium, you can even see without paying entrance brilliant.but whatch out for the sharks
It is ok.. No very special for people from a marine country. However it is really a miracle is desert countries.If I was the designer, I would make it as longer as possible.
Good Aquarium. If you have been to Bangkok, Malaysia and Singapore, you will not like it as those are much bigger and good. But OK for a first time traveller.

Fantastic. Booked dual tickets on line for both the Khalifa & the Aquarium, worked out around £78 for the four tickets which with hindsight was well worth it, was a great couple of hours spent wondering through the various areas & marvelling at the tanks & their contents, from Clown fish (Nemo) & Yellow Tang to Beavers & Otters , Tree Frogs, Turtles, Scorpions & octopus. King Croc was bigger than I'd expected as were some of the sharks, the whole experience was positive, my only criticism would be the management need to put another member of staff on to see through those who already have tickets as waiting behind people who can't make up their mind/what they want to do/see is somewhat annoying. As you filter into the tunnel you have the obligatory photo shoot. Would recommend as a must see/do when visiting Dubai, our tickets allowed admittance at any time regardless of the Khalifa time slot.
woow place. I do recommend for the family all my kids are enjoyed this place . thanks for the friendly staff attitude .

It was good. The Aquarium was full of different types of fish and it's fun if u have children otherwise not much of activity. And in the end u see crocodile and some other sea creatures. They will take u to a tour when u can see how they feed the fish and where do they keep the fish baby's. Over all fun to watch for the first time.

Amusing aquarium at the Dubai mall. You will be fascinated by the size of the aquarium at the Dubai Mall and the size of the fish. It is a must visit for every one that comes to Dubai and it is a fantastic family destination.

Loved the visit. As soon as I saw the aquarium from outside I wanted to go in. It was awesome if you take glass bottom boat ride along. There were son many sharks and the staffs were quite friendly too. Beautiful and must visit.

It's not just a tunnel!. There are two floors of attractions to explore, it's not just the tunnel that goes through the main aquarium! It's great value for money, especially if you are using the Entertainer. The staff are great at interacting with you and with so many animals (not just fish!!!) it is definitely worth a visit.

It's big. Visited here whilst we were at Dubai mall. This certainly is well done and the main tank is huge. There is also an area where you walk through and you get a really good view of all the fish above you. Particularly good to see the stingrays

Impressive Aquarium and Zoo. We really enjoyed this awesome Aquarium, you can see it from the tunnel, from the ground floor, and from the top, including a little boat trip and the simulator. This is a must-see in Dubai
I felt like Alice in Wonderland. It is an indescribable feeling when you seat on the boat and you see a lot of different fish just under your feet ....

One time watch if never seen an Aquarium. While planning for my Dubai trip I had come across this tourist spot. I was quite intrigued by the photos. Unfortunately the Marine life is encased in an overhead plastic case/tank in the Dubai mall. When you try to click photos of these, the photos dont come clear due to light reflection. So didnt enjoy it :(

Over Rated i would SAY. Very Small aquarium where no people to guide you. Staff was not that supportive. Very Expensive Tickets and photographs.
Zoo is very small but clean and nicely maintained. Zoo is the main attraction.

Small but nice. If you have not been to an aquarium before then its ok to visit this one otherwise its small and pricey. Small kids love it anyway. They take photos inside price from 150 aed each. There is an elevator to use if you are with a baby trolley. Check in was fast.

A must see in Dubai. A spectacular exhibit only the UAE could put somthing together like this - if you have young children they will be amazed - it is also pretty special for adults - you can spend a whole day if you have the time

Absolute waste of money. We chose this as a package along with Burj khalifa from level 125. This was located in Dubai Mall. Though we had a pre booked ticket, we had to stand in the same queue as for those booking at the counter. Though the queue was small yet the wait was long as those selling the tickets were trying to make a sale of different offers and packages. But the most disappointing part was that there was hardly anything. No sooner were in that we were out. And we didnt miss anything as we did the other floors as well. Having seen other aquariums in the part of world we certainly felt cheated.

A must see for marine lovers. I live here and Dubai and take my son (2 years old) every couple of months as he loves aquariums. The location could not be more convenient. There is always so much to see and there is never a rush. Make sure to tour the marine behind-the-scenes section on the upper floors. You get a birds eye view of the tank. There are busy periods and slow periods during the day. I would recommend visiting the tank when you first get to the mall (opens at 10am) and ask when the slow parts of the day are and going then.

Omg . Well worth a visit amazing to see. Lots of interesting information during the tour and would recommend doing the full tour It take time but we'll worth it. If you want to swim with sharks you have to book 2 days in advance Not my thing but saw some divers in with them and it looks fantastic

Unique 😊. This was part of the attractions we visited on our first day in Dubai. We paid 100 dirhams each for the tour, but it was limited access to some parts of the aquarium. You can choose to pay more for a complete tour. Suitable for all ages!

An excellent indoor aquarium with lots to do. We received free access to this aquarium by purchasing a bus tour ticket . It's definitely worth a visit. Lots to see and do, lots of interesting areas including a bridge walk. Great for all ages.
Best Aquarium ever. The biggest aquarium in the world. Best view of different underwater creatures at the same place. There some other activities there as feeding the fishes and the glass boat.

IN the Dubai mall. This is in the Dubai mall the biggest mall in the world. It's a huge aquarium inside one wing of the mall. You can see it free but to get up close you must pay. You can also choose to swim with the fish

Lots to see! . I went to the aquarium as a last minute decision and was really glad I did - it was a lot of fun and there was plenty to see! Kids will love it and there is the option of interacting with certain animals (otters, Rays etc). Got some great photos, the glass bottomed boat was amazing. If you don't have time to see this attraction, there are huge tanks you can view without even paying in. Defo worth a visit.

Dubai Aquarium & under water zoo- Dubai Mall. Dubai Aquarium is the best thing in Dubai Mall. You need to spend at least 2-3 hours in the aquarium and zoo. Great place to visit with family. Add a fish feeding session for 10 dhms.

Worth of time and money. A 10 million liter of water with hundreds of fish amidst a mall is something unique per se. I was a little bit concerned of wasting my time (and money) but I ended my visit (slow pace) after about 2 hours with a more than positive feeling.I recommend the explorer pass that gives you access to the underwater zoo and a tour on a boat with glass-bottom: navigating above sharks and races and dozen of fishes is quite impressive. The zoo deserves visit as it includes wonderful jellyfishes, dragon fish, nautilus and finally the BIG King croc. Despite having already visited several other aquariums this showed me some unknown creatures. Time well spent.
Awesome . Must go to this place. It is so fab. You could even swim with the sharks. I thought it was beautiful. Will go again.

Unlike any other . First I thought, an aquarium is an aquarium. There's fish. So what? Well this place changed my mind! There's sooooo many different types of sea creatures in here and it's the most massive glass aquarium in the world it's hard to not be impressed. Depending on your pace it can take a good half a day to wander around, looking at each thing, reading up on the inhabitants and generally making to most of it. It seems quite expensive at first, but then actually, when you realise how much there is it's really worth it. I think they do family tickets too which would obviously be a bonus for those with kids. My friend and i opted to go on the boat trip at the end of our tour which although well planned and safe wasn't really for me, more for little ones who have maybe never been on a boat before and would be excited to see the fish from above. Get this place on your itinerary!

Awsome Experience. Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo is one of the most famous attraction in The Dubai Mall. You need to book Ticket online from many of the Websites or can buy at the counter itself. The Experience had been amazing. This is one of the most well Decorated huge Aquarium with uncountable beautiful creatures to showcase. You have different Packages for visiting the same like Aquarium only, Explorer Package or Higher Package where you get to feed the sharks.The place is huge and takes a good 1.5 Hrs time to cover non-stop with photo shoots. So keep good time in hand. Interiors may be confusing and you may skip few areas so be careful to cover all areas.
Less than I was waiting . I was waiting something different Of course is a good option but in my opinion is nothing different In few minutes you can see everything

Underwater Aquarium..!. This place is constructed differently and maintained well. It's in Dubai Mall. Children would really enjoy being here as they could see different kinds of fishes and other aquatic animals.

Mesmerizing!. My husband and I entered the underwater tunnel and the aquamarine zoo as well and it was simply breathtaking! Highly recommend. Even if you just see it from the outside its truly remarkable!
Family fun. This is good for all ages, we did the tunnel and the under Water zoo if you such do the tunnel it's very expensive for what you get but all together it's much better value

A very good aquarium. The Dubai Aquarium boasts the largest shark collection in the world, and seeing these magnificent creatures at such a close distance is truly wonderful. There are also scuba diving opportunities inside the main aquarium, but unfortunately time didn't permit.The glass-bottom boat ride is also quite enjoyable, but one sees the fish better when walking through the glass tunnel.The underwater zoo is epic in the number of fish and other water creatures that are kept there, and one can easily forget the time when looking at the various displays and reading all the information.

Beautiful but not what we expected . When someone tells me we are going to an aquarium I do envision a large building with several tanks of fish. This is not the case with this attraction. It is truly unreal and a must see if you are a true tourist with little regard for value for money. Unlike its name leads you to believe it is not an aquarium as such but rather an underwater 20m tunnel with fish all around you, because of the mass of people you will be pushed through it in about 5 minutes. Then you go through to the other side and it's over. So I'm glad we did it because we got to do the level 125 Burj khalifa and this as a combo deal for cheaper, but if we were to go back to Dubai I wouldn't do it again.

Amazing animals. Amazing animals we both loved it with the mrs the fishes where amazing and all kinds of fishes one thing that got me sligtly scared was there was a tank full of piranas and there was no protection on top of it if you out your hand.in accidently then you can be eaten.

Excellent. At first I don't like go there but when I go I don't like go out.it is really perfect.you can choose different packages.at first you go inside the tunnel and see marine animals.then go to 2 floor of mall and see other marine animals at the end you can go by boat on the aquarium and feeding to animals and take a photo it is really fantastic.i love this place.you should go and visit it.

A little pricey but regardless a great experience . Went to the Dubai aquarium with my brother and had an amazing time. We opted for the 150 dirhams package and got to walk through the tunnel of fish (absolutely beautiful by the way almost breathtaking), go on the glass bottom boat where you drive in a loop and see the fish underneath you and there is also the opportunity to feed the fish. Then we got to go to the zoo which had mini aquariums and was pretty cool. Their king croc was hugeeeee bigger than anything I have seen. It was a good trip and would be amazing for kids. Only reservation is that they have many photo stops for you to take pictures and pay (and they are quite pricey)

Nice to see from outside but not to pay the ticket. I would not pay tickets to go there. I would prefer to see it from outside as there is not that much to see from inside and there is no need to have the hastle to go in and have the tour.

More than we expected. We first thought it's just the aquarium we walk past in the mall. How wrong were we! This place is huge from inside! In addition to the underwater tunnel there is a tropical forest-like area with fish, birds and amphibians from the Amazon, there's a nocturnal section with reptiles and insects that live in the UAE desert, a Penguin area, an Otters area, a monster Croc area and a boat ride on top of the aquarium where you can learn a lot more about the aquarium and the fish and shark species. You can even go on a shark feeding experience in an underwater cage.
Cool Experience. Well worth a visit. A wonderful place to spend time as an adult or as a child. Great indoor activity. Very beautiful.

Quite good. I'm a sucker for aquariums so we went here while at the Dubai Mall. I enjoyed it. It had all the usual things in the tanks (sharks, stingrays etc) although not particularly long. I really enjoyed the Penguins (I always do!) and the massive saltwater croc (he was imported from Aust naturally, but I've never seen one that big in captivity at home!). I suspect it gets crowded with tour and school groups, so we got there pretty much at opening time to avoid the crowds.

Amazing tunnel, huge king croc!. We got a master card deal on entry for the tunnel/underwater zoo (2 for 1 - 70 dirhams) and then paid an extra 100 dirhams for both of us to go on the simulator/glass bottom ride.The simulator was a let down that last around 4 mins, a little cartoon turtle takes you through the aquarium and into the ocean. I expected it to be a real life shark experience! The glass bottom boat ride was OK (but then again we had just been snorkelling in the Maldives so maybe weren't too impressed as a result) You don't get to see that much variety either , a few huge rays but they are quite deep below but mainly a few species of medium fishes that swim right under the glass)The big Wow was walking through the tunnel as it's pretty stunning and you see a lot of sharks , rays etc We personally would have given the simulator/boat thing a miss but I guess for kids it's another "fun" activity.Overall, the walk through tunnel was pretty impressive so I would say take your time and really take it all in.To be fair you see a lot from the outside so if you don't want to pay you do see all the big sharks/rays for free from outside.Seeing the display from the outside is pretty impressive as you don't get that view inside the tunnel. Plus side of being in the tunnel is getting close up to sharks, seeing all the teeth etc, and he obvious of being surrounded by a nicely filled tank of everything ! Overall : must go
Impressive . An impressive aquarium with a huge size, sharks, stingray and scuba divers swim around side by side.
Mashkoor. We enjoy the trip to the under water zoo. It was amazing to watch live sea animals and we took selfies.
WOW. Amazing place to see all varieties . Best to pay extra to walkthrough and go upstairs !!! Diving is also available with extra cost !!Rare sharks !!!
*****. With the small kids best thing you can do in Dubai.....Many sort of fishes and see animals.....All familly will be happy and share with your friends nice fotos....

Realy nice aquarium. This is a really nice aquarium, apart from the fantastic front wall, the tunnel is really great. If you are not into fish you may not want to bother but as a diver and someone who loves marine life this was a great place to spend an afternoon. The range of sharks and rays is really fantastic and I especially loved the eage rays in the entrance to the underwater zoo. The crocodile feeding wasn't the most exciting but it was still great to see the size of crocodiles.

Remarkable Collections of Sharks and Stingrays and a King Crocodile. It is astonishing view when you are inside the tunnel. There is a countless amount of different sea species.Inside the underground zoo, there are 2 king crocodiles, penguins, red jellyfish, otter, star fish, and other sea creatures and fresh water fish.The place is worth visiting specially with kids.

Ok. Worth going to.Paying extra to walk threw was worth it. ( paid £7 on groupon b4 going ) Upstairs in the zoo was bang on! Although paid for this wen I got there. Sadly the toilets in the place was totally grim !! Which is why it's a 4 not 5.

So Much More than we expected - BRILLIANT!. From the mall you get to see a lot of the marine life. However that is only the tip of the iceberg. Once inside the tunnel, the first thing that greets you is the astounding sight of grey nurse sharks in the cave section. For us that was worth the entry price alone. We were in the tunnel for 20 minutes just taking it all in. If that was it and there was no more to the visit, we would have been happy. However there was so much more to see. The zoo section was awesome, endless amounts of creatures to look at. Being Aussies we have seen our fair share of crocs, however to get up close to the king croc was a highlight. We also partook of the glass bottomed boat and fish feeding experience which was great - even more exciting knowing all the rays and sharks were just swimming around beneath the boat. The "Explorer" simulator experience was a bit of fun - but probably more so for the kiddies. Allow yourself plenty of time - if coming by metro, the walk/travelator just to get to the mall and into the acquarium is around 30 minutes. Allow a couple of hours for the aquarium and another 30 minutes to get back to the metro - and that's a 4 hour outing without even looking in the shops in the mall.

Fun. This aquarium was great!!! The initial is a walk through of the large aquarium tunnel. You the can opt to go through their land based aquarium and it's awesome!! They have Penguins and all sort of other animals. We also got the glass bottom boat tour option. It took us about two hours to complete but it was great. As two grown adults we loved it- kids would be over the moon ! So many sharks and various wildlife !
Beautiful. Lots of marine life. Watched them feed the fish at 2:00 pm. Great for anyone especially families and children.

Definitely worth it. What an amazing place! I had a few hours to spare after work so decided to go and check it out! I'm glad I did well worth the 120ued the glass boat ride was ok but I wish I'd done the tour guide instead.

Amazing staff brings this attraction to a new level. An aquarium in the middle of a mall, what a great attraction. The size of the tanks is incredible and the shark tunnel makes your skin crawl as these sharp-toothed carnivores swim all around you. We took the behind the scenes tour which was enlightening in all they do with breeding and managing food for the whole aquarium. This is also the home of a massive crocodile who they refer to as The King and getting up close and personal with this beast is an attraction in itself. A wonderful place to spend time as an adult or as a child... crowded on weekends and evenings so be prepared to wait your turn at the most popular exhibits.
Sea life, comes to life. This is a world class aquarium. The tunnel walk underneath is spectacular as are the other activities you can undertake.

Giant Aquarium. This is huge, the tunnel inside the aquairum is fantastic. It is pretty expensive but you probably will not see this in our country, in Brazil for sure no ! Lot of fishes, animals and a Zoo inside ...
Trip out. Great couple of hours spent looking at the fish etc. Even the cheapest tour is worth the money. The underwater zoo is excellent
not too bad. I went there few times every time was deferent experience and I realized is that its better to not go in weekends or evening time u will get board and sweaty
Great to see . Well worth a visit if you love animals the staff interaction was great an we spent a lot of time here expensive however but it's what we choose to do

Another World!. For young and old - a venture into what conservation is all about. We spent about two hours in this sanctuary and, for kids especially, there is much to see and learn about. A wonderful way to balance out a holiday. The cost is high but ... why not?!

Good and relatively cheap attraction. Great little attraction in Dubai. Visited it for the first time after residing in UAE for 8 years. I always thought it was a bit of a tourist trap, but quite on the contrary it is pretty decent.Make sure you go before the shops open. Good time to visit is first thing in the morning around 10am before crowds show up.

One of the best aquariums. This is one of the best maintained aquariums.You cannot compare it with Singapore or Kulalampur aquariums.It is a different class.Entry fee starts from 100 AED.Underwater tunnel is good.If you go around afternoon,you can see the feeding of fish from outside,without paying any fee.
Interesting place for kids. We spent nice time observing the water world of different ocean creatures, kids were happy and so were parents!

Worth it! Lots to do!. Lots to see and do. Takes up a lot of time to complete the entire tour, so it is worth the money. Take your time and enjoy an aquarium like no other! Very child and family friendly. Not sure about handicap accessibility as there is a portion of the exhibit with stairs and a (very sturdy) rope bridge walk. Very cool to see the aquarium from the open above area!! Scuba diving available as well! Queue (line) is sometimes a bit long.
Dubai Aquarium and water zoo. Nice to see and took pictures of Fishes and animal with wonderful environment . Its totally different feeling from other zoo.
Best place in Dubai Mall. Fun place for kids and adults. You should choose Explorer package or get into the underwater cage that takes you close to shark. Also the heaviest crocodile is amazing.
Very nice. Kids love the aquarium and the other attractions. Highly recommended at least once. A very nice attraction.

Pleasantly surprised. Make sure you add the zoo and back of the house tour - only AED 20 more and well worth it. The aquarium is awesome but without the zoo and back of the house tour I would have been disappointed with the value. Highlights were the crocs, night creatures, fish feeding and glass bottom boat. If you have the time and you are in the area check it out.

Nice Experience. we decided to take the tour inside Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo-largest acrylic panel according to Guinness- after witnessing it many times from the outside. it was really a different view. as you are surrounded by all kind of sea creatures and you are able to see them up-close . further more they let you feed the fish, a great experience because the minute you start throwing food they form a circle and roam around to catch it,,, it was really spectacular to see the bigger sharks taking the lead and fighting to get to the food first. while The Underwater Zoo is on three levels and it hosts different species of aquatic animals plus a few crawlies. we enjoyed it thoroughly.

Aquarium,,, Fun for kids. It located inside dubai mall... I found it interesting as it is not just an aquarium but it also has different activities to do like submersible simulator in underwater zoo, glass bottom boat, pass by aquarium tunnel, Ray feeding, King Crocodile encounter etc etc.... I recommend this specially for families and kids.
brilliant. loved it.. Really well maintained & very enjoyable. Can get crowded at times. went with my 2.5 year old who loved it as well. Dont miss feeding the fish, its a fun lil extra.

Great for children, and ok for adults too. Enjoyed our trip to the aquarium and underwater zoo. Lots of vibrant colours and some interesting species. The large aquarium could actually be better seen for free from the mall than in the underwater tunnel as the curved glass in the tunnel made us feel a little queasy.The king croc was good, and the many other unusual creatures in the zoo were fun to see.The professional photos being sold inside the attraction were very expensive, so it may be better to take your own.Recommend you arrive early (it opens at 10am) as the crowds are minimal then - so you can enter without a queue, see attractions more easily and take photos without strangers in your photos.
I was not impressed. There are a lot of Aquariums in the world which are much better in terms of fish variety as well as information system for visitors

feel the stingray blessing you. amazing place to be while you walk down the aisle its you tend to relate to the aquatic experience and the sight to see so many different marine life in one tank a truly blissful experience

It's ok . I went with my kids the first time. It's amazing but I'm not so crazy about these Kind of things. They under water zoo was such a disappointment. Basically just going through a small tunnel. Mayb will not go again. Money can b spent better elsewhere.

Best acquarium in the world. Everything is bigger and better in Dubai. The acquarium is just awesome. You can snorkel and swim with sharks. The zoo is amazing they have a king croc in the zoo. Nice way to past time in the mall.

Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Wow, Wow and Wow. Amazing display of undersea creatures and coral. If you cannot see these sea creatures in the wild then I highly recommend you visit this Aquarium. We leisurely strolled thru the displays seeing one beautiful creature after another..A must see!. Take your time, budget 2.5 hours or more to read, see, take photos and enjoy everything from sharks to a giant crocodile, to penguins to Nemo. Its all there. I would pay to see it all again.

Didn't go In but underwhelmed from the outside. Went to Dubai Mall and kids wanted to go to Candylicious - whilst they were deciding which candies they were going to spend their allowance with, I popped across and took in the view of the aquarium.Whilst the mechanics of it all must be quite remarkable, but the numbers of fish seemed extremely low compared to the size of the tank! I think I would bypass Dubai Aquarium and head to Atlantis for the worlds largest Aquarium with over 65,000 marine animals in it.
Awesome experience. It's really an awesome experience. I recommend it to all of you and it is one of the 'must see' attractions of Dubai. They have variety of fishes and many unique types.

A nice afternoon.. I'm not too sure how best to describe this but I'd first and foremost say that it should definitely be visited. I'm a bit of a marine freak so I'd been meaning to go to the aquarium for a while. There really is an incredible array of marine species which catches you off guard considering you're in a mall. The croc was huge. :-) We went for a little tour which included information on incubation and development of some of the eggs such as the Sharks. I must say that I was impressed with the tour guides. They were really nice and more knowledgeable than even I'd hoped for. My one gripe, which is why it didn't get 5 star is the lack of info on the various species. Although there are labels on the second part of the tour I didn't feel they were particularly well positioned. Specifically in the huge tank there was no explanation (as far as I'm aware) on the various types of sharks, Rays and other fish. This is a shame as they are such beautiful creatures and I feel for the sake of education, fun and conservation there should be a greater awareness of the types of species on show. All in all though a wonderful experience and I'd recommend it for friends or families.
Fantastic. Hard to find something similar in other cities in a fantastic shopping mall! The time you spend there is complementary to shopping and if you wish you can even enjoy ice skating

Lots to see, worth the money. If you visit the Dubai Mall its worth paying to walk through the aquarium. We paid our money and started walking through the tunnel and actually thought when we got out the other end that that was it, thankfully not. It actually takes about 45 minutes to go through it all. The big croc is a sight to behold and we love the rays - so much in fact that we paid for a 'Ray Experience' where we got to feed them - do it if its in your budget. They will get you to post for photos and try the hard sell, but you dont have to buy them.
Amazing!. A must visit place, ensure you visit the sharks tank as well. We enjoyed it a lot. Try as well the boat trip, it is worth it.
Amazing under world . Amazing selection of fishes and sea animals, big aquarium and lovely tunel where u can see them. Restaurants in the area where u can sit and enjoy the view
largest aquarium. it was a nice experience seeing all those animals and fishes in the underwater zoo and the boat trip is also worth it

Impressive. It's expensive (what's not expensive in Dubai) but it's really worth the visit, not only the aquarium but also the zoo ,e ven if it's a little noisy it's worth asking questions to the guide. A refreshing escape from the mall !
Wonderful!. If you take the red On & Off Bus this is free. We really enjoyed the exhibit. Very well done for the size.

Big aquarium with various collection . Visited this aquarium as my daughter love to see fish and crocs. This aquarium has a lot of unique fish. 1 big giant crocodile which is brought from australia, it was a king crocodile. They also have a shark shows as well. Very entertaining show.

Existing . I was with my 8 years old son and we did the cage diving it was an exciting experience for him the team was so friendly. Water in the cage us up to 2m deep from the top of the aquarium and you see the fish surrounding and under the cage.
Impossible. They make it possible through imagination coupled with resources. If you have money you can catch and hire any idea. If you have an idea you can cash it in Dubai.

Amazing how much there is to see! . Sheer variety and colours. It is hard not to feel disappointed when you visit your next aquarium when you look back and compare.
Visit but use a BOGOF offer to maximise value

The great things come after the tunnel!. As we walked through the tunnel, we were slightly disappointed. It is smaller than it looks on pictures and not very versatile. However, we really enjoyed the aquarium part on the third floor. Wonderfully presented aquatic animals, with trees and sounds to create a very natural vibe. Especially enjoyed the great croc!

Impressive Aquarium. The tunnel is such an amazing experience, having the fish and sharks swimming over you and marveling at the engineering behind the tank. the experience continues upstairs with the underwater zoo, definitely worth a trip here.

Great from the mall. From the mall, the aquarium is amazing because it's so big! And it was fun to see the divers. Plus it's FREE. But I felt that paying to enter wasn't worth it, even when bundled with the ticket to the top of Burj Khalifa. Other aquariums are better - this one is small. My 2-year-old who is typically adventurous cried and didn't like being in the tunnel (he was ok in Singapore, maybe because the tunnel is bigger? not sure). The crocodile in the zoo (2 floors up) was huge but again, I felt it was not worth it. Because we visited this one, we didn't visit the Lost Chambers at Atlantis but wondering if we should have gone to that one instead.
Good for Family. kids loved the experience and very educational for them too. give it a try when in dubai mall. good one~

If you need Moneys worth get an Encounter . Encounter was really fascinating and children would love that , else feels expensive yet talk to the ticket counter and get informed about the packages so you wont have a surprise ! Underwater Tunnel was quite pint sized , tanks are neat and eye catching well maintained.
Amazing . A must do, the aquarium and the hotel are amazing, so many fish, jelly fish, sharks etc with plenty of staff to tell you about the fish as you look at them

Something worth doing . Loved the service by one of the staff called rahma? But definitely worth doing in Dubai mall the staff are friendly the place is set out well people with families would enjoy this

6/10. I wouldnt particularly tell someone to go to the Aquarium in the Mall but it does the job when killing time.
Nothing that cant be seen at your local aquarium in your country. Shocked at how they build a mall with an aquarium.
Would be perfect for family with kids

Aquarium visit. My two boys love marine life. In fact at home we have an aquarium and they are well conversant with all types of fish. There was so much excitement during this trip. The amount of marine life is astounding. Kids enjoyed thoroughly and highly recommend this visit. In fact, they opted for this visit as compared to other attractions at the mall.

Excellent and Huge... I have never seen a aquarium like this before. What a beauty and beautiful fishes in it. I got to see many and different kinds of fishes. I have never seen a shark or a sting ray fishes from such a close distance. And there are many other fishes which i have never seen before. Also you can just stand there and watch them all the day.
good experience. it will be a very good experience to see this large amount of different fishes sharks and so others in one place...go have fun..it will be worth
Magic for children. Entry ticket is quite expensive but it's really magic to see the fishs above your head, particularly for children who will enjoy it!
An insightful visit. A really good aquarium which has three types of tours that are given by knowledgeable individuals giving an educational insight to the world of fish and water!.

Very nice Aquarium. The Dubai Aquarium is located in the Dubai Mall. While not the best aquarium I've ever been to, it was still a very nice diversion and good use of a couple of hours. The price of entry was decent.
complete waste of money and time. Literally walk through 50-60 meters and you have various sharks above your head, the view from the 1st floor of the mall is actually better..
Excellent. This is a must see destination in Dubai especially if kids are travelling with you. Very well organized and entertaining dolphin show.
Beautiful aquarium!. Our 4yo was so excited to go to this aquarium, and he had a great time! The highlights for him were the glass boat ride and the penguins. Great indoor activity. Very beautiful.

Unexpectedly bigger and more fun. For an animal attraction in a mall, this one does surprisingly well. Level 2 is when you will really forget that you're in a mall and actually in a zoo of sorts. There are many more enclosures with creatures, but little or no decipherable information I could find on them near said enclosure. The fish feeding is a must-do with kids because the fish are huge and many! It's not always the most stroller friendly because of the multi-storey layout and some stairs in a couple of areas. Note that some activities aren't available to smaller kids and pregnant ladies, which you'll find out when buying your tickets. Remember that it's Dubai Mall so be ready for scamming-tourist-prices. Those touristy photographs they photoshop with crocodiles and sharks and try to sell you are AED150!

Fun and educative . Fun place for the kids while learning interesting stuff about aquatic animals and some birds. Bought the researcher tour ticket so some aspects of the tour was slightly limited. Low points: the place could be hot and smelt funny due of course to the various animal stuff there, agents outdoing themselves to get you to take expensive pictures (who does that nowadays with the advent of smart phones ). High points: multitudes of fish (over 1000 species) in the fish tank including rays, eels, sharks etc. The more adventurous visitors could take a dive in the tank with the sharks. There was also other animals such as 2 giant crocs (they were completely stationery throughout my visit that I started doubting if they were alive), a family of otters(?), seals, birds and snakes. The involvement of discovery TV gave the park more authority.

Fun place for kids. This is located inside Dubai mall. The aquarium is huge and provides a good photo op with marine life. At the upper level is a small zoo and there are penguins and some aquatic wild life. Tunnel provides a unique perspective to observe the aquatic wild life especially sharks.
Beautiful . The glass tunnel underwater was the must beautiful place but not the only one. There you can see the biggest crocodile you must visit it

OK. The main reason to visit the Dubai mall in my opinion. its a little bit over priced but if you have bought a 2 day sightseeing bus ticket you get a reduction which makes it worthwhile. There are the standard things to see as mentioned by others.

The underwater Zoo is the attraction.. The tunnel is impressive, however you see little more that you can see from the outside (for free). However the underwater zoo (just a zoo) has some brilliant animals. The otters (more like swamp rats) are incredibly impressive, and very cute. The king crock is the biggest i've ever seen, and i've been to Australia and Miami! The behind the scenes tour is fairly naff, not really worth the long wait to get a tour.
Nice place . Great aquarium , we have fun the kids so enjoyed. To see all this fish and to be wonder about all this mysterious life under water . Still in this life things to search and learn.
Our kids love this place. They do a great job enhancing the offering over time. The kids never get bored of coming to Dubai for the aquarium. King Croc is interesting to see.

Don't go in. Better from the outside. Perosnally, I didn't see the added value going inside. The place is enjoyable just by watching from the Mall. There is several floors you can enjoy the sights of fish and sharks etc. Paying 70+ AED will get you in the underwater corridor...not so cool.It gives you excess to the mini zoo as well, that is also fin but nothing special.

Excellent Attraction for children. If you have children it is a place to see in Dubai. Its amazing how they built such big Aquarium. If you come to Dubai you must visit that place or else you have not been to Dubai.
Underwater education.... We visited while in Dubai and thoroughly enjoyed the attractions. It was amazing to see so many colourful and intriguing creatures. Well worth a visit!

Adequate aquarium. I was very excited to see the shark exhibition they hosted recently. After all the advertising it was only the initial entry way with a semi-overhead tank that housed sharks and stingray. I was somewhat disappointed, I was expecting a whole section maybe. It felt a bit cramped and if you do attend I suggest to go at a time with less people about because space is not available and you won't get any pictures without someone walking in front of your lense. The whole aquarium is smaller than most I have been to The staff were a bit pushy but beside the sharks the crocodile exhibit was pretty good.

Interesting and educational. After the tunnel which was not so interesting after 10 -15 minutes we had to go up two floors to visit the underwater zoo .Here a staff member did not allow us to look around but instructed us to wait in lines . 15 minutes had gone this way queueing and not even knowing for what . Then a guide came and we had to go down to an area where we could see the Aquarium from above . We learnt a lots of interesting things about marine life . Then we went up to the previous level and were free to roam around and see the water tanks with individual species . It was quite large area I became exhausted by the end - I read the big croc story but I could not find it ... it was closing time when I noticed the penguins ...:( come here ready to spend minimum 3 hours !
Ok. Ok if you want to waste an hour or so....we did the boat trip and it was good but nothing special...
great place to view,must see. wicked place,ideal family trip,i went there august there too much to see,so you will need lot of time,
Honeymoon . Visited here as it was only down the road from our hotel, it was fab and reasonably priced. Very knowledgable
Good one . Visited with family. Took a package including back house tour with glass bottom ride, etc. Check the price of different packages before buying.

Great aquarium although I expected it to be bigger. This was a really lovely experience and I am sure you will love it. The tunnel with the fish and sharks and sting rays was amazzzing and then walk through afterwards with the other type of sea creatures and other animals was great as well. This is a great activity to do if you have a couple hours to spare in the Dubai Mall.

"Inside Waterworld ". It's the amazing area I visited in the mall it's so so awesome that u can feel like you are inside the water and between the water world all the fished many many types of them are flowing over your hear . So amazing seriously . Highly recommended in Dubai .
Nice aquarium. A little expensive for what it is however it is well made and it is a nice experience. Perfect for families who don't know what to do on a very hot day!

Amazing experience . I went with my wife and we enjoyed it.
Especially feeding the fishes. They gave us an offer. an upgrade of the package with more activities.
Don't MISS IT.

Great for kids!. We buy the season pass for the family (250dhs/person) and go weekly during the hot summer months. Each week something different seems to catch our eye there. My children are too young to go on any of the boat rides or guided tours so I can not give any reviews on those items. The new Discovery Shark exhibit is a nice exciting edition to the Aquarium. It's a great way to spend an hour in the mall.

Fantastic attraction. Our kids were thrilled with the aquarium - by far the best one we've visited. Amazing animals and pristine tanks. Worth paying for the kids to feed the fish for an extra 10 dihrams. It was the only paid attraction we did in Dubai and it was well worth it. It's situated in the Mall of Dubai which is vast and has wifi and loads of interesting shops & restaurants - I'd schedule a whole day and you can see the dancing fountains and Burj Khalifa on the same complex as well.

Dubai Aquarium. having been several years ago I was surprised how the attraction has developed,We only bought the basic tickets and you do have various offers to upgrade your tickets.The Aquarium is fantastic and you can take as long as you like walking through it,after this you can then explore the underwater zoo and this too was well worth the visit,look out for the crocodile
Boring. Waste of money, boring and very small. There's better things to do in Dubai, don't waste time here; I've seen better fish tanks in restaurants.

Fascinating display!. The fish in this aquarium can be seen from the Dubai Mall but the experience is much better from inside the aquarium. There are several viewing options at different prices. We chose the second cheapest which included the underwater tunnel, where you see all sorts of fish very close up, the glass bottom boat and zoo afterwards.

Visit to Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. I was expecting a lot from this activity but it was very disappointing. There was hardly any variety and nothing was new. May be because in March, we had visited Singapore zoo and Aquarium which is world class, we found this disappointing. May be for someone who has not been to better aquariums, this may be good. Overall, we wasted our money.
a definite must see in dubai. my 4th visit. I really like this place. the tunnel & aquarium is world class. well maintained attraction with exotic animals. truly amazing

Amzaing. The site looks deceiving and I was not sure weather to buy tickets for it but the place blew my mind it was amazing my children loved the whole experience with every kind of water Animal it's a.must vista's place

Visiting of aquarium. It is nice place also the ticket is not expensive.place for all family members they can enjoy and take some photos.also it is good that some information about the type of fish and animals.

Too expensive for what you get. The only good thing about it is that it is located within a mall where you will love to be if you come in the summer. Apart from that, the most impressive was the big aquarium glass you can see freely from outside.
There are much better aquariums to pay for all around the word.

Truely Amazing. Great place to visit on your stay in Dubai. A lot of activities to choose from and can buy tickets a the counter.
Its a 10 million-litre tank inside the Mall and is one of the largest in the world, containing more than 33,000 aquatic animals and the largest collection of sand tiger sharks anywhere

Good experience. Very good experience especially for the kids, had variety of fishes in the main show especially sharks, you can have a glass boat journey @first floor or you can get in a cage and dive with fishes and sharks ... the second floor full of unique fishes and octobus in large no. Of pools also have crocodiles and some of night animals of UAE
Amazing aquarium. The Aquarium is located within the Dubai mall and it has sharks inside. You can also see divers in scuba diving gear inside the acquiarium.

It's ok only 3 stars in my opinion . We as a family of 4 which is 2 adults and 2 kids decided to book this only because we got a deal with going at the top of burj Khalifa and seeing this at a good rate so wud recommend doing that booking both together if u do decide to see both as we did anyway bk to the visit here too be honest wasn't as good as I thought it wud be as from standing in the mall near the aquarium u can really see most of it without going through the tunnel the tunnel is very short and can be bzy at times too many people staying put in places taking pic after pic so in my opinion wot u see outside for free is basically wot u see inside on the other hand they did give us tickets to go to the zoo which is upstairs and that was more interesting and can take 1 hr going through seeing all the animals etc there that was the only bonus bit about this visit hope it helps u decide and by the way only my opinion

Amazing must see!. This is one of the best parts of dubai. Was a very nice experience. We got to see some amazing sharks and rays as well as other nice exotic fish. We also took a boat ride on top of the massive tank and got to see the fish being fed etc up close. Definetly amazing experience..a must to go too
Interesting . The place is huge.It seems interesting only for some fishes.Except some, it feels similar to the other aquariums.But good for the first timers.
Amazing. Went there with my kids was amazing going through the tunnel aquarium .Seeing the sharks so closely
Amazing. Had lots of fun at the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. Wasnt too expensive however gave for a great time by the wife and I. Didnt swim in it but would have loved to.

It is certainly an aquarium. Nothing much to say about it really. it is an aquarium and there are lots of varieties of different fish. Killer Croc was monstrous and scary yes, but it is lethargic and lazy, so be ready to be wowed by a very still creature.

Breathtaking. The Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo are in the middle of the the Dubai Mall. The main tank in the aquarium is huge. Absolutely huge. Loads of fish, rays and sharks, and divers swimming about. The tunnel through the tank lets you get up close and personal and see them really near, too. The underwater zoo was also great, with loads of fish and sea creatures, as well as King Croc (an enormous crocodile). Pictures of this place don't show the true scale of it. Well worth a visit for an hour or so.

Kids loved it. Took my three girls. They loved looking at variety fish. Disappointed at the submarine, was only simulation. Thought it would go into water like a ride. Had to pay extra to have boat ride but was enjoyable on the whole. Lots to look at. Kept them happy though.
Best aquarium I have been. The Dubai aquarium is a must seen, and not just the free part you can see from the Dubai mall, it's worth to visit and spending couple of hours in there.

Amazing. We visited the Dubai Mall unaware of the aquarium and just following a dive trip to the Maldives. What a wonderful surprise. The aquarium is outstanding with lots of varieties of sharks and rays and we especially enjoyed the visit to breeding area and seeing the 'back end' operation. This is a 'don't miss' spot if you visit Dubai.
very nice. the size of the aquarium is impressive, such a huge tank in the middle of a shopping mall, wow. . it was nice to stop by and visit the aquarium while enjoying the rest of Dubai Mall
Nice maintained aquarium. Aquarium is good. maintenance is also good. enjoyed watching different types of fishes. Overall it was good.

It's Not What I Expected. I am a lover of all things aquatic so I was super excited when I saw there was an aquarium AND a zoo in the mall. To put the cherry on top, it was Shark Week in Dubai so my excitement went through the roof!Every city I travel to with an aquarium, I visit. This was...a tunnel of fish. That's is. You see more on the outside than the inside. The zoo...I walked through so fast that I don't remember anything besides the crocs and penguins. Nothing noteworthy here. Save your money.
Best Human made aquatic zoo. Underwater zoo and aquarium are the best part of dubai mall and burj khalifa tour , a day is well utilized there on dubai tour

King and queen croc. The underwater zoo is really interesting with lots to see as well as seeing the biggest croc in an aquarium there are wooden bridges to go round and look down on the animals too. Very interesting.
amazing experience . I have a 2 year old boy and we went there and the whole family enjoyed. Amazing value for money, friendly staff made it double the fun.

I expected more. I got the researcher ticket.. Cannot really complain but I expected a bigger aquarium and maybe a bit more of interaction with animals.. you can hardly see the fishes and sharks.. it is just a pretty attraction for picture taking.. You also get to ride a boat though, so you can see the fishes underneath you and beside you.. Good for family outings.

Nice zoo and aquarium. They had created nice zoo and aquarium in center of dubai mall.kids loves to explore aquarium and the zoo where u find many species of fishes and some insects too and yeah u will also see a CROC
Interesting. Nice place for Couples, Families and Kids.The price is quite high but still its a new experience. You can also get free view from outside.

Only King Croc Interesting Tunnel Not Bad Rest Average. Only the king crocodile is very interesting, other species are standart, I recommend Boston New England and Los Angeles Long Beach aquariums if you have the chance

Nice Aquarium. One of the good aquariums I have visited so far. Some people just moan about everything, it's aquarium and has lot of species to see. Water is very clean and has good friendly staff. We visited the aquarium and fed the fish. Kids love it. There are other activities too like boat and diving with sharks. Due to my son 18 months old not allowed in boat. Overall excellent aquarium.
Ok for kids. Good for the kids. Make sure if you get a 2 package deal ie burj Khalifa you allow yourself plenty of time as the mall is huge!

Kid's and family day out. Loved our visit last time to the aquarium tunnel and the back end of the aquarium. Got a chance to see the fishes beibg cultured, the water treatment, and the feeding cycles.Great walk around and explanatio s by the team.Would recommend the trip for families where make sure that you are taking to indoor zoo and the back_end of the aquarium.Once again a memorable experience
Underwater experience!. Walking through the tunnel under the water was an experience itself with all sea creatures around you - good fun with excellent photography.

Great interest to the children. A large number of fish including a shark. The Dubai Mall is the largest in the world and the aquarium is located on one of the floors. There are many signs for direction to all Mall Features

Great afternoon filler!!.
