The aquarium is nothing more than a walk way and the zoo is a posh pet shop of aquatic life X however it's a haven from the unbearable heat and set amongst the Dubai mall X so it breaks up a long shopping trip X worth a visit but your not missing out if you don't get there X

not very impressed. nice to but nothing over special about the tunnel walk through avoid the photographer at the start the final picture they impose you and the group into is very poor quality child's play photo shot

Underwater beauties. My husband decided to see the aquarium and underwater zoo while i wandered the Mall. He took lots of photographs. According to him the aquarium is what one can see for free from outside, but the zoo was better. He compared it to the Singapore underwater zoo which he said was much better.

Its whale-shark huge!. Seriously. As you pass the 10-million litre Dubai Aquarium tank, located on the Ground Level of The Dubai Mall, one of the largest suspended aquariums in the world, you can see the crowds mesmerised by the graceful rays flying past. It is the best hook to draw in visitors. And it's worth every minute to go in there. With literally thousands of aquatic animals,including sharks and rays, you can even book a glass bottomed boat ride or get right in there to cage snorkel with the fish.Must visit! Worth every minute spent here.
Average aquarium. We think the aquarium is a bit pricey and nothing much to see. Not all the exhibit was free but something to do when you have a few free hours.

Not worth the money. Queued up. There was a queue. Only two people on the desk. We purchased the explorer tickets that gives you sea aquarium, glass bottom boat and zoo. As you enter, the sea aquarium is just that bit of the tunnel you walk through and can do in about a few mins. Then you go to another part where you see more sea life but a small tunnel then you go onto the Dubai aquarium explorer. The kids found that a little boring to be honest. Then onto glass bottom boat to see the fish and sharks etc that you saw from the tunnel. Extra to pay if you want to feed the fish while you are on the boat. Then there's the zoo part, you will see penguins and all different type of fish and sea life and you get to see the alligators being fed at a certain time in the day. We saw it at 4pm and then you're pretty much done...just too pricey and no cheaper deal / price For kids... Shame....

Beauty blue . I went today with my son to the aquarium tunnel and there is two level floor for it , we enjoyed it so much and saw all kind of fishes and the crew there are very helpful , i have to admit that the entrance tickets is a bit pricey but it's great experience
Fabulous main tank. We love fish and really enjoyed our visit, the main tank is huge and we spend a while just sitting watching all the different fish.

Interesting place. We visited on a whim as we were at a bit of a loose end in the school holidays, the place is very interesting and they are hot on conservation and breeding programmes. I was expecting there to be fish but upstairs is a whole cacophony of animals including 2 huge crocs, amphibians, mammals and giant snow crabs! The penguins were hilarious and playful and all the creatures seemed happy enough and well looked after. I don't agree with placing wild creatures in pens or tanks but its a chance for kids and adults alike to see things out of the ordinary.Overall a good place but can be busy.

Exciting experience for children and adults 😀. It was nice to spend time in Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo! One of the the biggest aquarium in the mall in the world! Really very exciting for the children! Sharks, sting rays , a lot of different fish's! And you can watch them only for one glass above you! Good experience for everyone's !

A must do when in Dubai. We loved the Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. You start by walking through a small tunnel then go up two floors to a submarine simulator ride and a glass bottom boat ride where you can feed the fish. You then walk into the zoo, as it was late evening we only spent about an hour in the zoo looking at fish, rats, snakes, otters and penguins to name but a few. There's also a glass floor over two very large crocodiles .Ticket prices start from AED 100 (£21) they charge more for the submarine, glass bottom boat and food to feed the fish

Nice to see. During our biz trip we had time to go to the Mole of Dubai with all the shops. We stopped to drink some fresh juice just on a terrace in front of the water jet show. The show last about 20 mnts and was really nice to see. It was just very hot outside abt 40•c under the shadow and so very wet. I recommend this is something that need to be seen.

Okay. Nice place, but not a huge place. The tunnel is fun, great photo opportunities. Simulator isn't very good, you just stand on a wobbly board and its very hot inside.Glass bottom boat is pretty, but only the people at the front got to feed the fish, they didn't give us anything.The Croc is cool. He's very big.Otter experience wasn't available on the day we visited.
Nice. Very impressive aquarium integrated in one of the best shopping centres of the world, the Dubai Mall.

A must see. Visited Dubai Mall on Sunday & went to the Aquarium & Zoo, excellent place for all. At first, you go through a small tunnel that leads to an Exit sign, you then come out & take the elevator up two floors to start the Glass bottom boat ride - the guide was very informative & a great opportunity to take photos from above. After that you go into the zoo- fantastic place, tons to see, you could spend hours watching the two VERY large crocs in their huge tank, penguins, otters, tons of fishes. A great place for an educational trip.

Amazing, Amazing, Amazing!. This is one of a kind Aquarium. You feel you are underwater with the seaworld when you initially walk through. Then if you choose, you can have a boat ride (with a glass bottom) above the aquarium itself, whilst being given the opportunity to feed the fishes, is a brilliant opportunity. You get a chance to see the seaworld firsthand looking down into the aquarium, then thereafter walking through the zoo and seeing so many different sea creatures including the biggest crocodile you'll ever see - is amazing, amazing, amazing!
Very nice . It's not the best aquarium I've ever been to, but I love the underwater tunnel and the glass bottom boat was really cool to do. It's a fairly big aquarium but it has less than I expected.

waste of time. this aquarium is overrated. there are many better aquariums throught asia . moreover the ticket prices for underwater zoo are exorbitant given the small size of the tunnel limited variety of fish. the academic part is good though.

Underwater magic. Dubai aquarium is an attraction not to be missed! A most amazing place for both young and old. There are lots of aquatic animals to see and then there is the huge aquarium, which you can actually walk through! I actually laid down to watch the fish and sharks swim around me! Awesome for little ones!!!

Aquarium and zoo. The indoor aquarium is a good fun. The same is for the underwater zoo. Both being indoor are a true experience. Both are located in Dubai mall and entrance tkt can be purchased together.

Kids loved it. Very different kids enjoyed alot
Something for the kids to see and experience.
Has many different types of sea creatures.
An activity for the kids.
Can see it without charge.
Enterence available depend how much you want to see.
Atmosphere us great very busy alot of people.
Amazing to see. Dubai aquarium is located inside the Dubai Mall. You can pay to go in or just admire from the outside free of charge. Its worth a visit if you are inside the mall already.

Walking & Snorkeling with the Sharks. As a birthday treat my daughter walked with the sharks and went Snorkeling with the sharks. My daughter went walking with the sharks in order to do this you first have to watch a safety video and we both had to sign a number of times conditions to the fact they didn't accept responsibility if something went wrong. They supply the wet suit and towel. Walking with the sharks you have a helmet on which is continually supplied with air so you can breath normally the glass front allows you to see all the fish around you and the cage is lowered quite deeply so you are submerged. Fish can swim into the cage as there are openings. The diver in the cage with you will take photo's or a video with the camera you can hire and they then give you the SD card. My daughter enjoyed the experience. Snorkeling with the sharks I felt wasn't that great as you can only see the fish at the bottom of the cage (obviously turning your head to the side water enters the snorkel). I removed the snorkel as I can hold my breath for quite some time so I was able to view all round. As the cage isn't full submerged you can surface to take more air. Unfortunately due to the salt water the buoyancy is such that it is very difficult to swim under the water so I floated sometimes like a beach whale. You get about half an hour each but although it was an experience I was a little disappointed in the fact that not any fish can into the cage and the fact you saw more of the fish outside of the cage through the outside viewing area than inside the cage. It isn't cheap in fact quite expensive.

Enriching experience !!. The Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is a very good experience for a marine life enthusiast. The creatures on display inside the zoo are very rare and from across different regions of the world. The tour starts with the tunnel on the ground floor where you get to see thousands of aquatic animals up close, including sharks, sting rays etc. As we move on the floors above, we see different unique kinds of creatures in separate enclosures, like octopuses, squids etc. Don't miss out on one of the world's largest crocodiles kept inside the zoo. Ticket prices start from 100 AED.

Good..... I did the aquarium trip including the glass bottom boat. The underwater tunnel is cool but sadly does not feel much different to other such tunnels, the tanks upstairs in the aquarium are cool, and the penguins, and turtles and also the beavers are pretty awesome. The crocodiles are huge. The glass bottom boat ride is kinda fun. Sadly though its good fun and maybe really worth it if you love your fish and aquariums but ultimately its an aquarium in a shopping mall, better to look at it from the outside i think.

Fantastic for Children and Adults alike. Forget you are in Dubai Mall and enjoy this great interactive experience. Our family group was aged between 6months and 55. Can't vouch for the 6 month old but everybody else had an enjoyable time. From recognisable penguins and star fish to monsters of the deep and a 750kg King Croc. Educational and fun for all.

Mind-blowing. Really great experience!!.... this facility is in the middle of a huge shopping mall and is breathtaking in its sheer size! Shark swim right up close so you can see their teeth!! Really great for families

Very underwhelming . Having such a massive entrance display you would think that there is so much more to offer inside. But unfortunately it's very underwhelming and crowded. Wouldn't recommend doing, just take photos from the display.
Nice. Going under the tunnel watching sharks an other fishes that was so incredible..and the 'king croc" u should see it

Great facility and staff. I visited with my family during my recent stay in Dubai and I have to say this was well worth while and made a great break from shopping. I have to say how surprised I was to find an attraction as good as this in a shopping centre as it must really limit them.We picked one of the more basic tickets and had a great wander around. The displays were excellent and there were lots of additional options on the tickets if you wanted. There were a number of staff around the exhibit and they seemed happy to assist. I have to say the Archer fish demo was pretty cool.Well worth a visit especially if you are spending the day shopping. My only comment would be that the ticket choice should be simplified and inclusive with a medium price.

Great Experience. Since this is located in Dubai Mall, you could shop, eat and enjoy at the same place. Great experience, zoo is well maintained. Basic ticket is 100 AED per person and it worth the price.

Good place but costly. Initially thought that I made a mistake of buying the tickets as people outside were seeing the same thing... but was wrong, the real aquarium was on the higher floor. Had a good spread and is really big... my son enjoyed all the species a lot....

What a day in the Aqua world. Visited with mother to the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo and it was completely worth it. Used my Hotelier offer and got to see almost the entire world of fishes. Almost got my hand snapped of my 2 sharks ha ha . They thought it was their lunch . THe crocs are very lazy though ..

Good value considering. I suppose when you consider the available space it comes across as good value although I would not go back. The staff are tired and the attractions limited. The cages do seem a bit small for some of the animals on show!!! I would not bother with the glass bottomed boat ride.

Lovely change from all the shops. This made a lovely change to all the shopping that can be done in this oversized mall . Children had a lovely time cost was more than fair for the time spend there. Beware of the splashing fish at feeding time :)

Not as expected. When i heared about this place i had much more expectation about it... But when i went there its just a small tunnel walk, lots of different species of aquatic life... but didnt feel worth the money...

The best part of the Mall. My wife loves to shop, me not so much. So this attraction, located centrally in the Mall is a perfect waiting point. Visiting the attraction is great and larger inside than expected, however, for long suffering partners who have stood patiently outside shops like palace guards, hand the credit cards over near the enormous viewing tank and tell her/him to take their time; you'll actually be thanking them for it.

Mixed review. We checked out the attraction because it was there and they have a wide variety of species in the aquarium. Short trip to the tunnel though with the amount we paid for the entrance. As adults looking at it? It was okay but short, it is different for a kid-it will make the day.

"Experience it to believe it". This is one of main attractions of Dubai. Its an experience one must have if you are living or visiting Dubai. Fantastic under water tunnel thrilling boat ride on top of aquarium, live shark feeding, underwater dive are life time experience. Big Crocodile is show stopper... Avoid it if you do not like the smell of sea water.
Nice to see the fish!. The Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo was a nice attraction in the shopping mall! It was nice to see the fish and even people swimming in the fish tank!
good for kids. this aquarium is located in side Dubai mall and main entrance of aquarium is amazing and this place really good good all age of kids and i saw all kids were enjoying in side aquarium.

For all ages! . This is a lovely activity to do with family or just couples. We went on a boat ride in the aquarium, the bottom was glass so you could see all the fish below us! There's also other animals as it holds a little zoo that you go around. Well worth a visit!

It looks small from the outside but well worth the money to visit. This was full of surprises! Loved the large crocodiles and walking on glass above the tank! The boat ride in the tank was great seeing the fish and divers below through the glass bottom was amazing!

Breathtaking. My son and niece loved this place the found it breathtaking there is much to see
We liked how you can do as much or as little as your time or budget lets you

A big crocodile . I always pass by any aquarium, I need before to this aquarium twice but this time I needed to go, I needed to see this massive crocodile, it is this biggest one I ever saw in my life. You got to see it.

Good experience. It is an experience to have.
Got to watch the King and queen crocs being fed.
There are different packages you can purchase.
Staff are polite and are there to support you if you need any help.

Normal experience. It is not so great, avoid the simulator and the glass boat, complete waste of time and money, if not big fan of fish, there is nothing more than what you see for free. life vest are dirty and old, simulator is a joke.

Good one!. Well kids will love it! Located inside the Dubai mall one if the biggest Aquarium you will see how amazing it looks and how magnanimous it is! Surrounded by lots of restaurants and retail shopping outlets this is the best place to beat the heat and you can easily spend a whole day inside. Underwater tunnel has a ticket, you should try once as kids will love to see the sharks and fish closer!

Nice Aquarium . There are multiple tours and tickets but the main difference is the tour in the beginning of the visit. You will have a guide who shows you behind the scenes for about 10minutes. You will see how they breed the fish and clean and maintain the water and aquarium. Afterwards you're free to visit the "Zoo" by yourself. It's an array of small windows and displays that show you the different species of sea and land animals. The 5m Crocodile is amazing. I find it amazing to have this in a Mall but I was wondering a few times how happy the animals are in their limited spaces. The whole project is worth seeing and a welcome disruption from the Shops in the mall for sure. Definitive recommended for anyone visiting Dubai Mall for the first time.

Top top-floor zoo. Dubai Mall is best summed up by the observation, that, if your thing is diving with sharks and exotic fish, you go to the TOP floor of the world's largest shopping centre to do it. The zoo is a rather amazing collection of colourful inhabitants. Something for everyone : for Aussies like us, a giant Australian crocodile, serenaded by a small bunch of kookaburras brought up some rather eccentric memories of home. The small collection of local desert animals was also very interesting, and the Aquarium very diverse and interesting.
Great views. Must see this it is really good for the kids we enjoyed it took lots of photos also the Dubai Mall is a great place

Day out. Dubai Aquarium is just one tunnel walk which lasts 10min and has various species of sharks, rays and other tropical fish. Then you are asked to go to the underwater zoo which is on the 3rd floor of the dubai mall, here there are more variety of fish but probably the best animal to see is the King Crocodile which is absolutely ginormous. Really don't think this excursion is value for money!RegardsMr.Singh

A good one time visit. I had little expectations for this attraction. Why, it's just a tunnel, I said to myself. But having been through the tunnel, I can safely say that it was a fun five minute walk. Ample photo opportunities. However, what I really enjoyed was the experience of going behind the scenes at the Underwater Zoo (The king croc was fun!) and then taking a boat ride above the auqarium, where we saw how the staff all work. We also go to see the tiger sharks that were brought in from Australia. I recommend that if you go here, do pay extra and visit the underwater zoo.

The aquarium and underwater zoo was quite good!. The proximity to a shopping centre was great but overall, unfortunately, my partner and I did not fi d it as interesting as the Melbourne aquarium, which is spectacular. The Penguins were fun though!
Excellent break from a shopping marathon.. Leave the wife/girlfriend at the shops and head for the aquarium with the kids. Once you have overcome the amazement, consider it is in a MALL.
Overpriced and there are better aquariums. I thought this aquarium was overrated, overpriced and not worth the time. We decided to visit the aquarium at the Palm Atlantis and it was far better.

King Croc v great white shark. Absolutely amazing place. See the biggest crocodile in the world. The sharks are amazing too. Lots and lots of sea creatures to see and you can go behind the scenes to see how everything is maintained.

Good experience. It is a nice experience inside as it is too hot to walk around outside. It is a nice walk through the tunnel, however it could be longer as you can see most of the fishes from standing outside in the mall. I bought a Groupon ticket, which is highly recommended as we went upstairs to see the fishes, birds and the big croc upstairs and was a nice day out. We also managed to experience the boat ride and simulation (Children may like this, but not much fun for the adults). Overall it is just worth a visit to stay out of the heat. Good couple hours out and restaurants are close by to be ready to have something to eat.

Not to be missed !. You are easily transported to another world when you enter the underwater zoo. The variety and layout of the place makes it an enjoyable experience for all members of the family. Very educational.
Good experience . Good experience if you have come to dubai as a tourist. We have seen better aquariums, but this one is also pretty good. The tunnel is super cool.

Need not book ticket in advance !!. When you book a trip to Dubai then you must have heard or read over net to pre-book the tickets to Burj Khalifa Top as you will end up saving some moolah which is indeed true and while booking you will see an option to club Burj Khalifa Top with the Dubai Aquarium.. Just dont buy that offer as Dubai Aquarium is a complete waste of money..

Beautiful. You could stand there for hours just watching the fish, very entertaining and so many fish. Because we were u a club room we got free entry. The children loved this but it is only small so it would not take long to see it all.

Amazing experience . Had visit this place while I was on holidays. A few frnds suggested a long time back. This was my chance..... Reached the place it was fully crowded with people and children around. The staff were very courteous and friendly guiding people around. We bought tickets and entered also I was accompanied with few of my colleagues. The aquarium was well maintained with different variety of flora and fauna. ..I enjoyed it a lot. Worth the penny..Highly recommended if you are accompanying kids...

Sharks and Rays all around. Beautiful experience! Aquarium tunnel entry is amazing with sharks and rays swimming all around you, joined by the other sea creatures. Those who are willing to spend a bit more cash can dive in and get first-hand experience. Make sure you visit accompanying zoo as there are lovely creatures to see there.

It is interesting. It is an interesting place where you can see different types of fish and other living creatures. You feel as you are walking in the see between these creatures. it is an amazing feeling you feel when you walk through the tunnel specially the first time you visit.

always so fun to visit the Aquarium. When visiting Dubai Mall you cannot avoid visiting the aquarium that is so amazing not huge the perfect walking into the tunnels or go swimming in a cage with the sharks… or if your budget is not within simply walk on the ground floor and walk along the glass of the huge aquarium or go up to the next level and kook strait or next level up down all views are good and free.

Good place for the kids.. I half-expected it to not hold my attention even for a while. But it turned out quite good, given the really small space I would say, that is used to build the aquarium in. There are tickets for the same but even without, it is visible to the other tourists visiting the Dubai Mall. But a good place to spend a couple of hours.
Education meets entertainment. Great attractions. Beautiful set up! I really enjoyed the underwater zoo and the bottomless boat rides. They have good packages to choose from.

A lovely morning. It is a lovely way to escape the heat of summertime Dubai with the family.The dsplays are well done with a great variety of fish. We only did the basic tour, there are some super add ons though if you want to see back of house or croc experience. They could do with introducing a family ticket year-round. We were lucky and got the summer pass which was awesome value including cinema, sega world and kidzania, recommended.
Amazing. A very different location for an Aquarium but it makes a good break for those who don't want to shop

Just a typical Aquarium, but very expensive. Just a typical Aquarium, I was not amazed by anything, alot of sharks and fish everywhere, and If you want to make any extra thing, you pay alot,so If you are not ready to pay to dive with sharks or any more activity, save your money if you visited any good aquarium before

Worth going while you are visiting the mall. \my son and i came here and it was worth the visit. The aquarium has many sharks, rays, and all sorts of tropical fish, you walk thru a tunnel in the beginning and it is about two or more stories high. Take your time to walk through so you can see all the different species. Then they have a section where there are tanks of several different fishes, anemones, etc. You also get to go and see how they prepare all of the food for the fish and how they are fed. Everything is made in house and it is quite the production producing all the different foods. Worth going in for a visit.

Worth the admission price. While you can view the large tank from the Mall, it's worth the admission to go inside and see the animal hospital and also to walk through the tunnel. The underbelly views of the sharks are amazing!
Amazing . Its just amazing place to visit, close to different other places Burj khaleifa, Dubai mall, downtown and city center a place that you want to visit over and over!

Awful experience. So me and my family came on holiday here as a stop off from going to Australia so we tried to make it great for my daughter . We chose the explorer package which really for the money was a rip off . A small tunnel and a 4 minute simulator . So we got on the boat which was the highlight off this to us however it ended up being a nightmare ! So we got on the ride and got to the first turn the rope that the driver was holding on to snapped and the boat began to rock , my daughter was terrified . The divers cleaning the tank had to help us get back on track . On the ride there was a British man who started kicking off shouting stressing everyone out . He asked the driver of the boat when was the last health and safety check to the response of a mumble . The British guy started cussing and threatening to kill the tour guide . Luckily we all got off ok . We complained to the manager who didn't even give a formal apologie but said we can have a refund . As we got to the kiosk we explained we needed a refund and the woman said a 150 aed dollar refund for the boat ride but the tunnel and the crocodile weren't included . We eventually got 360 aed cash back . Relectuent for your money but not so much when they have to give it back .
Worth it. I have visited it two times. Always had fun. Every tour is worth the money and your time. Allso unique :)
Nice variety of creatures, including one huge croc!. I think we enjoyed this one almost as much as the kids. Very commendable set-up and an interesting assembly of aquatic denizens.

Good afternoon adventure but........... Even by pre booking you still have to wait in the queue to pick up your actual ticket. We waited for 20 minutes in the queue and then went into the tunnel. I didn't realise that the tunnel is all there is for the aquarium then you head upstairs for the zoo part. The tunnel is massive and worth a look but the Zoo on level 2 is much better. The kids really wanted to see the giant crocodile and he didn't disappoint. The fish and the various attractions are great, and a welcome relief from the heat of the day.
Incredible!!!. the sheer size and species inside- amazing!!cant understand how this was humanly possible but increadile-almost like diving on a real red sea reef

Favorite place in Dubai. Fm the Dubai Aquarium was such a fun activity. After visiting the Burg Khalifa, I was walking though the Dubai Mall and noticed the aquarium. The multistory aquarium is captivating and is incredibly inviting. After purchasing tickets, I went through the underwater zoo. Really cool views and tons of photo opportunities. Getting to the aquarium main entrance on the 2nd floor is a little tricky as the flow is not well-defined or easily labeled. Fortunately, friendly staff are able to guide you around. The aquarium as a whole is impressive and the exhibits are well put together. The crocodile and saltwater shark tank exhibits were my personal favorites. The nocturnal animals and the bat exhibit were a close second. Enjoy the photos!

Amazing!!. Mistakenly thought it was just another aquarium, how wrong was I!It starts with the tunnel, there were many sharks and rays swimming past, beautiful!. Of course, there was the obligatory cheesy tourist snaps.More attraction was on the 2nd level, were you could view sharks, all varieties of marine creatures, UAE night creatures, puffins and of course King and Queen Croc. It was a fun, educational and interesting afternoon.

Wow . You get amazed as you just look inside and watch the creatures swim Very very nice place Lots of new additions and more interesting now Don't forget to pay extra 10 dhs and feed the fish You get to stand at the top of the aquarium and throw the food down to the fish Be prepared for big splashes so make sure you step back

Highly recommend. My daughter loves this aquarium, underwater zoo. It has varying sea life, huge crocodile and some creepy crawly things on the upper level! Great learning place for children and adults alike. It's been recently upgraded with interactive style touch pads and a new shark entrance which is a nice addition.You can ride on a glass bottom boat, go behind the scenes and dive in the main tank and more. Staff are generally helpful and great with the kids.In summary it's a great attraction for all!

Outstanding enjoyments . Outstanding outstanding time, its a must go place, no way anyone comes to Dubai without going there. Very reasonable ticket prices, many choices, you will enjoy. I went to similar ones in different countries but i never had such a great time. Its enjoyment every second place.

Great for little ones. My kids love coming here, even if it is a bit limited. I would recommend using the entertainer vouchers to reduce the costs however as it is a little pricey and would also suggest if going to just do the tunnel and aquarium upstairs and not purchasing anything else. Thats what my kids love doing. I have also got them membership at a good price which enables them unlimited entry for one year which is real good value for money.

Extraordinary & FUN!!!. First of all, it's an aquarium & underwater zoo in a mall!! Awesome!! So many activities are offered; Underwater Tunnel, Clear Bottom Boat ride & feed the fishies, Dive into the tank with all the sea creatures, Aquatic & Nighttime Zoo, Virtual Reality Submarine experience, & more! We had an absolute BLAST!! Highly recommend!

SEA LIFE AQUARIUM. Similar to the likes of many aquarium & aquatic zoos from all over the world ie. Singapore, it doesn't amaze me at all. Really felt the fee is not worth for a visit although it is a good venue to kill time in the mall if your companion is a shopaholic.

Not great for the animals..... All the tanks were so small and the place smells unclean. I usually love aquariums but I was aware of how tired the place seemed. There is a huge croc there and he is in such a small tank. :/The entrance was included in our ticket for the Burj Khalifa, which is why I went. On a positive note I'm sure kids would enjoy it.
Qin the mall. This is located inside the Dubai mall. Save your money and look at it from outside. Avoid the leg lines. Save that entrance fee for shopping.
Over priced. Great location but being in a mall then they should re review the admission cost! It is a key landmark of Dubai being in the largest mall in the world

Dubai Mall. Mall is great for shopping as it is open till 2am lots of shop with quality goods also there are plenty of good restaurants to choose from. Recommend choosing one of the many & watching the water display it just amazing
Many Fish!. There are many fish and several restaurants and shops next to it. There are many different types of sealife.
Great for kids. . Excellent attraction. The kids loved it. Different species of fish plus sharks. Totally amazing. A must go if you are traveling with kids.
Unique experience. The place is located inside the Dubai Mall. Good size with different kinds of sea creatures. A little over priced, but this is Dubai after all.

Top Attraction in Dubai Mall!. We purchased this as part of our 'City Tour' bus package and it was one of the highlights of our trip. The venue was accessible via Dubai Mall (largest mall in the world) and we were blown away with the vast array of underwater fish and aquamarine life all displayed in a very accessible manner. King Croc was amazing! Well worth a visit!
Great mall. Spent an entire day at the mall. So big! Had fun with the kids and bought some lovely stuff. To be repeated
Dubai Aquarium & underwater zoo. An ok experience but I do think it's more for children. Again for us as a couple it was pretty bland if the children were with us it may have been more interesting.
Dubai Aquarium. Its one of the main attraction in Dubai Mall. Been there once amazing ride inside through the tunnel with water and fishes flowing the other side is a great view.

Dubai mall aquarium . Went yesterday to the aquarium and I had many reservations but it's something I'm happy I did. The over head tunnel is great. It gives you a great view of the sting rays and other fishes. Variety is awesome. Something I enjoyed. Paid 100 aed pp.

Wonderful . The aquarium is large, Amazing and so wonderful to look at. It's another reason to go to the Mall. Free, your children will love it and may not won't to leave. It has all kinds of fish and sharks. Did I say FREE
.
Lost Chambers. Combined this visit with the water park at the Atlantis. Biggest fish tanks we have ever seen. Such a great setting. So many different fish. Great way to spend an hour.

50% off till march 2017. This aquatic extravaganza is available at 50% off for persons with emirates id card from 9 p.m to 12 p.m. The outside concave view of the aquarium itself is mind-blowing enough to attract person to take a tour of the tunnel which begins with an area dark enough to see the slow movement of the sharks giving you the chills and a "sleeping with the fishes" feel. This tunnel takes around 10-15 mins with a chance for some memorable pics.Then starts the zoo tour where you enter into an area showing the botanical features of the sea creatures( boring part) leading further towards a boat ride where the boat is pulled by ropes and one can see the aquarium from the top and the fishes circles the boat for food (feeding comes with extra payment) which shows the entire water network and UV lights which flourish the aquarium.This leads to the latter part where one can see an entire array of fishes starting from the piranha, archer, lionfish, gold fish and many more and a few otters and penguins in their artificial habitat.The next part deals with the under water creatures like seahorses,snakefish and a rope way leading to a dark area boasting about creatures like scorpions,bats and many others which are kind of rare in normal life.The whole experience is a colorful memory of Dubai and no other place exhibits such a vast fauna.
Pretty cool......but. We were fortunate to see this type structure in Shanghai, China, so a little under-whelming. The Mall was humongous, larger than D.Trump's huge.
Marvelous. A journey through the sea with real time experiences was exciting. The simulator then the glass bottom boat was breath taking

Small but good to visit . Our ticket to this attraction was included on our big bus tour so we took advantage of the place. It was worth it. Not so big but a lot of animals to see. My teenagers had fun so is my husband.
Huge Aquarium. I never seen such a big aquarium in life before . it is in basement and you feel awesome. you and see all see creature transperently and find amazing.
bundle this with the burj khalifa for a cheap deal. We spent a good part of our day in here. It was amazing enough to have an aquarium in a mall! Dubai is bananas!

Well worth visiting!. Lovely visit to the Aquarium and underwater zoo value for mone costing 100AED about £18-£20 depending on daily rate.. This visit is for everyone and the water water aquarium is amazing., the aquarium is free if you just want to see the fishes from the tank which is just as good.. But if you want to see others it's worth going inn. No matter the age.

Feed the Sting Rays!. At one end of the Dubai Mall, the Aquarium & Underwater Zoo are an interesting addition to your tourism schedule. We took the package with the glass bottom boat ride which was a good decision as that offered a breathtaking aerial view of the aquarium.They included a promotional simulator experience at the beginning of the tour which I could easily give a miss! Not great. I did watch some other tourists feed the sting ray and it looked thrilling. Something I'd like to do the next time I'm there. Also, make sure you keep a good hour for this tour and another hour if you're going with kids! Fun place. Affordable at AED 120 with the boat ride included. Try it out!

Amazing . I didn't realise you could do actually scuba diving while at the aquarium and I'm sorely disappointed I didn't do this however it's a pretty cool thing to see. Just wish they had more in the zoo part

Informative and entertaining. I have visited this place several times. Esp with my mom when I went had a bunch of excellent memories there. Accessible with wheelchair. Very entertaining for kids and adults. Lots of promotions going on.

Better than we expected . We really enjoyed this place , the aquarium was amazing you could stand there all day just watching the SeaWorld . We didn't expect much from the underwater zoo but it was brilliant we really enjoyed it .Even with our kids being 12 and 14 it was still very entertaining for them . So many fish and animals , the otters were great to watch . I am not a fan of zoos but was pleasantly surprised
LOVED . Loved visiting here! Made our hoiliday it was amazing!! Espically CROC!!! Well worth a visit to young or old.

Incredable once again. It is an understatement that things in Dubai are done to the extreme. To build something like this in the middle of the Mall was unexpected. The show and the entire display was fantastic and well worth it.

Watch from outside. The underground tunnel is really just a small walk, really not worth the money you pay for it. you can however watch the aquarium from outside. That is free and you get to see everything
Fish fun. Only in Dubai can you go to a mall and have a wonderous aquatic experience. Beautifully designed and a pleasure to experience.

Must visit. This is the best ever aquarium I have seen in my life. If you are a guest of Atlantis, The Palm then you have free access to this aquarium. You'll see varieties of underwater species in this aquarium.
Incredible ray encounter!. We had an incredible experience in the ray encounter, as it was very funny and we enjoyed a lot while feeding the animals.

Nice awuarium. This is located in the dubai mall. They have a huge variety of creatures. A different section for all night creatures. The crocodile they had was so huge. One of the largest crocodiles I have ever seen.

Underwater view . I absolutely love aquariums. It's right in the heart of the Dubai Mall. It's just a small walk way tunnel you can enter and you real like you are swimming with the fish. We also did the package deal so we could go upstairs and see the aquarium from the inside where they have small like fish farms and you take a small boat and go around the aquarium from up top. The children will love it and if you love the Sea like adults will love it too. They offer photos for you to purchase to capture the experience.
Its a must go. Great day out kids loved it as did i once again made to feel welcome Lots of knowladge and good valued staff on tap to help you with your family needs

great aquarium and very well organized. get a combo ticket for aquarium and burj khalifa visit. it is cheaper and it is in the same area. aquarium is extremely large, get into the underwater tunnel and the sharks and fishes are around you everywhere. you can feed sharks at extra cost. also the zoo on 1st and 2 nd floor is very nice place for children, you can see all kind of fishes, penguins, crocodiles etc. also a place with night life very dark with bats snakes etc
Again Amazing one.... Aquarium is not that interesting as the underwater zoo is... remember, there are two floors in it... don't miss out the upper floor...
Definitely something to see. Great mid morning break and outing. Was educational and entertaining. Well controlled access and numbers so never felt as is it was overcrowded.
Beautiful. Dubai aquarium is awesome and a must see place in Dubai but lil bit costly. Its better to see it only from Dubai Mall.
Cool !!! . Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo is the biggest attraction of Dubai mall . Very nicely built with varieties of fishes in aquarium . Nice place to visit !!!
Good shark exhibition. Very good and entertaining Shark exhibition was very informative and children and myself learnt a lot. The King croc was particularly impressive

Enjoyable and educating. Took an afternoon trip to the aquarium and thoroughly enjoyed the many varieties of marine life. The workers were very friendly and knowledgable. The different tours were very informative.

Great evening out !!. We went to the Dubai mall to watch the fountains and we decided to go to the aquarium and zoo! It was a lovely evening out and great for all ages we had a 12 year old 18 and 19 year old and we all enjoyed it! Lots to see would recommend you pay a little extra for the glass bottom boat my son loved that part!
Ok but not worth the money.. The only animal worth seeing is the King Croc, everything else is average including the boat trips (hardly a trip)....
Aquarium. Beautifullll view . Awesome experience .well guided to the the bus route by big vus crew. Appreciated

Good place for kids . Personally i like such a place but more important that my family members like too. They enjoy every moment during their visit. I recommend such a place for families with young children.

Amazing. The attraction is great right from the time you enter.
Don't forget to get the ticket that allows you a ride on the glass boat and see the fish under your feet.
Great family time.

Free from outside, but good viewing. Here's a tip. To the right of the Aquarium, there is an escalator that takes you one floor up. You end up halfway up the Aquarium space and can go right up to the glass walls, real up close with the fishes (if they swim your way).I always find this back view more rewarding than the view from beyond the ribbon on the ground floor. Hope they keep it open that way. Kudos, Dubai Mall
Unforgettable experience. Great choice to go with the children or people visiting. Never seen many people in the place, so you can enjoy the areas and experience touching some animals. Good service
The Dubai Aquarium . Had a wonderful experience. The way you walk through and can see all of the fish is truly amazing. There appeared to fish and other exotic fish from around the world.
Free for what its worth. If you have seen one you have seen them all. This is a nice draw card to the Dubai Mall but nothing exeptional
Great Family Experience. This was a nice experience for a family. I wasn't extremely excited but if you have kids they will enjoy it.
Fascinating trip. Excellent trip, however, avoid the evening shift as it's so crowded. Try to go early around 10 or 11am.

Irresponsible . Should not have penguins, otters, beavers and crocs in such tiny confined spaces - these are unsuitable and not in line with big enclosures that the rest of the modern world use.
It is however well laid out with lots to see and interesting fish.

Excellent yes but... I was warned and should have listened. The most memorable thing is the vast tank which you view from the the mall.The ticket takes you through the short tunnel in the picture and on to the crowded aquarium beyond which are smaller tanks that fade from the memory after a comparison with the vast exterior tank or the Lost Chambers at Aquaventure. Sad but true.
Very Nice. When you see the tank from the outside it looks incredible. Once you are in is less impressive but equally nice. Hihgly recommended.

Interesting to see. The aquarium is located in Dubai mall. You can find your way to it by viewing the interactive maps or asking at the information desks located in the mall itself. The aquarium features different species of fish and is quiet big of size. There are many paid packages available however viewing from outside is free of charge and I would recommend the view from outside as it is not as different as the quick tour inside for +100 AED more. The most expensive package features diving & fish feeding if I am not mistaking.
Awesome!!. It was very nice experience to see all different different type of fishes in dubai aquarium. Aquarium have a little shark fish.
Outstanding. Wonderful experience. Huge aquarium. Feeding sessions etc. Penguins were ace to see in such ectreme heat! The old crocodile is massive and gets a big audience every day.

The first impression does not support the actual content. From outside, the gigantic fish tank was very impressive. But once you are in, the aquarium housed in the Dubai Mall is not as spacious. The displays are not that impressive either in comparison with the others such as Singapore and Osaka.

Walk among sharks. It is an interesting and impressive experience for kids to walk among sharks and other sea creatures, as well as to see the underwater zoo. Anyhow, artificial corals, submarine simulation and boat ride are not worth spending your time.

An interesting afternoon. We were blown away by the size and scale of the water wall tank when you enter the Mall of Dubai. The Aquarium is similar to others you will find in some countries but it is worth a visit if you are interested in fish/animals and would like to pass an afternoon. I enjoyed it.

A wonderful experience. I went to the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo with my wife and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Our visit coincided with the Discovery Channel Shark Week in Dubai Aquarium. It was amazing to see all these species of Sharks. Majestic creatures and great survivors. I have to mention that this aquarium is huge with very impressive variety of fish species as well as the beautiful Rays that comes in different sizes.The Underwater Zoo is amazing too with the different varieties but the one that stands out is the King Croc. I can't explain how impressed we were with it's size. The first time my eyes came across it, it took my breath away, a moment that'll stay in my memory for a long time. It left a lasting impression on me. A great survivor from ancient times. That alone was worth every penny we spent. Bottom line, a highly recommended attraction if you happen to be in Dubai.

For little researchers.... When shopping becomes boring to the kids in Dubai's largest mall, there is a good alternative directly in place. The aquarium has several options for the visitors, we selected the researcher package includes the water tunnel, the underwater zoo and a visit at the shark research lab (don't forget to by the fish food package for the lab). The aquarium is really large, nice fishes and good setup of the trail. The lab visit is interesting and the fishes are crazy for the food :-) With kids you should not miss, when in Dubai!

Great Experience!. You can view the massive tank from inside the mall, or you can pay to go into the aquarium itself. Depending on what you want to do, you can pay to do more (e.g. Shark walk) but we payed 100 AED for a "researcher" ticket which gave us access to the aquarium and zoo, and a little behind the scenes tour at the start. It was really good value, we spent quite a long time there and the exhibits were really impressive. The King Croc is a must see!

Visit only if you are there and have extra time.. If you are at the mall walk by the aquarium wall. The interior that you must purchase a ticket for is not really worth it and I would do it only if you have loads of extra time. Submersible simulator is a joke!

Good. This was an on the whim stop as we had time to kill it was good but again nothing special the highlight was seeing king Croc he was impressive and reading all the stuff about him and seeing his lady and his babies was good but apart from that it nothing u haven't seen before
Excellent value. We bought the lowest ticket (100 DHS) which gave us access to all the aquarium and zoo. Great enviromental focus.

Good experience, make sure you do the Boat & Zoo too!!. Great to go and see through the tunnel and the boat over the top with the zoo.Only let down again is that the front of house staff you meet at the pay area and this time we found the photographers were very unfriendly and lack customer service by UK standards let alone the higher Emirates standards!!Don't be put off though, just ignore them and enjoy the spectacle including touching a star fish and seeing the King Croc!!!

Impressive but not necessary to pay to see. We've paid to get inside a couple of times with family and visitors. While its kind of cool to stand underneath the fish and see the zoo you get most of the same effect viewing from outside which is free. It is an impressive aquarium - along with the Lost Chambers at Atlantis it must be among the best in the world.
Older family visit. Spent a great 2 hrs at the aquarium. Large sharks in the tunnel, new croc exhibit. In the mall so easy to get to
Dubai Mall. Located inside the Dubai mall , its a very good activity for children as well as adults . The biggest attraction is probably the King Croc all the way from Australia .

A different world. A must try experience. You walk through the tunnel and instantly it feels like you in a different world. You see some of the most amazing and rarest animals. Only downside was that the crocodile was asleep/not moving at all.

Poor experience. Maybe it is not good rate this place after visiting Loro Parque on Tenerife island, but this underwater zoo is really poor. The wall aquarium you can see from dubai mall is the best part, so don't waste your money and enjoy it from outside. Arrogant, unwilling staff and loooong line to get inside even when you already have your tickets. The fake photos are really the unbelievable way how to "steal" your money.. You with octopus, you with shark :D :D :D never seen such an awkwardness before.

Spectacular place for under water experience . The Dubai Aquarium one of the amazing tourist places must visit always you will live a new experience. Rare fishes, sharks and huge aquarium will blow your mind. Underwater zoo you can see different kind of underwater animals and visit shark growing area, and feed the fish. Ride the boat or dive with fish.
Great organisation. Loved every piece of it! KingCroc could have had bigger space as well as some other creatures ie Kraken but amazing set up and great layout. Kids loved it!
Dubai Aquarium. One of the best attraction in The Dubai Mall. If you are with the kids it is must visit. You can get to see various fish and it is maintained well.

Great Aquarium in a Mall. When you visit Dubai Mall one of the first thing you see is the aquarium free viewing window thousand of fish of all kinds freely swimming in the giant tank. A special feature is the underwater glass tunnel to view the fish up close and almost personal. The Underwater Zoo was also included in your ticket. It is also a free entry with Big Red Bus tour of Dubai.

An amazing experience. The Dubai Aquarium is amazing, with exceptional underwater creatures. To be THAT close to sharks is awesome! The Underwater Zoo is really interesting and being so close to THAT huge crocodile is truly awesome, albeit un-nerving! A must see attraction!

Dont pay to go inside. The Aquarium itself is very impressive but I cant help but feel like I was duped into buying a entrance ticket. The aquarium is visible from the outside. Asking people to pay an entrance fee to only pass through a tunnel where the fish swim above you doesnt add much to the overall experience

Fun . The whole experience was very nice. You can seen from the outside before you go in the underpass. We put our fingers to the glass and a fish came over to kiss it! My son liked the story on the history of the crocodile.
Dubai Aquarium. What a wonderful display of fish in this underwater zoo. So many varieties and so well displayed for all to see.

Wonderful aquarium. This is a wonderful way to end a shopping trip! It is very reasonably priced too. The tanks are spotless, and the variety of animals they keep here is unbelievable! However, be prepared to do a bit of walking - we ended up at the other end of the mall by the end! They also have other animals here - not just fish. Crocodiles, penguins, you name it. They were unexpected! I do recommend this, as well as the Atlantis aquarium on the palm. All the best for your Travels.

smaller than expected. Seeing the aquarium from the outside is better.
Expected to see bigger tunnel, but it was very short comparing to the rate! the underwater zoo is also a waste of time! very small!!

Just nice. It was a nice place but did not worth paying for because you could see all it's fishes from outer side too! The only difference was that when you buy a ticket, you go to a tunnel and you can see them swim above your head.

Value for money missingg.... A large part of the aquarium can be seen from the outside. Paying to pass through the tunnel under the aquarium didn't add much to the experience. The crowd and the noise people bring along further makes it less enjoyable. Though appreciate the effort to create such a place in the heart of a shopping mall. The zoo is a bit more exciting wherein you can experience the sea creatures really close. Some fishes, tortoise are kept in open water container, though you are not allowed to touch them. :-(

Best pictures of the Aquarium and a must for any Tourists.. For the entrance fee you get lots for your money. If you have a few hours to spare in the mall or if your visitors want great pictures then it's perfect. The tour of the 'behind the scenes' is great and the variety of animals is great too.The main thing is that all the Fish and Animals look healthy and happy (certainly not showing any signs of stress at all).Go, enjoy, take a million pictures :-)

Large collection of underwater species. The dubai mall aquarium has good number of wild sea creatures, you get to see sharks, rays and many differeny wild fishes from very close and its a very nice experience when these wild creatures pass right over your head and you see them very closely. The underwater zoo again has alot of different kind of sea animals. Some are scary and weird looking, some are very cute and tiny. Overall its a good family experience. Time and money well spent.

Something new every time. I went in with a friend visiting I never thought I will be amazed as much as she was having visited so many times beforeThe new huge crocodile omg the size of it,I didn't see such a huge crocodile in Australia
best. a very beautiful experience.. better than the lost chambers.. if you have kids, surely take them along..

could be better for the value. very nice idea and they have their good points and also bad points. The staff could be better and the type of tickets could be more explained. missing the directions signs espicially for the rides inside the aquaruim

Worth seeing . A visit to The Aquarium is a must if your in Dubai. The huge tank on view from The Mall is spectacular. It is the height of the ceiling and full of sharks and other impressive creatures. We even watched two divers in it swimming amongst them. The King Croc exhibit was also very cool. Reasonably priced and good entertainment for a few hours.

Underwater zoo. The Aquarium of dubai which located at the Dubai mall it is not too big in comoare of the others which i seen before any how they arranged lots of attraction in small place and well organized.This week is shark week but it seems to me they shown baby sharkGenerally its attractive for the Kids actually

Eye opening experience Dubai sets the standard. A nice dayout with the family my 4 year old daughter absolutely loved this Aquarium especially the crocodiles who were so still she thought it was a painting till the moved !!! You will enjoy definitely a place to go

A site to sea.... What a great experience. My wife and I visited this aquarium while visiting the mall. It's another 'must see' for any visitor while at the mall. Make sure you have a good camera which can take photos in low light conditions.

Aquarium wonder. Visited with family situate at the Dubai Mall. Different species of Sharks, Ray's and many species of fish as well as penguins!It's a gigantic Aquarium and we paid 120 Dhs pp. This included a small boat ride with a glass bottom and it was a great experience. Easy to buy tickets right there at the mall as there were no ques. Maybe because we visited during the summer! Could be busier in the winter I guess!One thing to take note of is the massive ques for taxis (only available at designated areas). So at mall closing times be prepared folks!
Good for a change. Its a good place to take the kids with the huge and different type of fish. I highly recommend this place for fish lovers, teenagers and kids

Must Family Visit Place. One cannot imagine the place without visiting it once. It is the most expansive collection of all water species from Gulf to Red Sea. You can closely watch all kind of Fish, Water horse, Sea Flora & Fauna, Crocs, Jelly Fish, Penguins etc etc, And there is ample information about them for one to read!!! They have been provided their natural habitat in the zoo. A shark would just swim above your head without your knowledge!! Very interesting & different place to take your children. Unique experience, one can spend 5-6 hrs easily looking at these creatures.

Not to be missed. As with many attractions in Dubai, the Aquarium is a magnet, wonderful setting and a must for Selfies and family photos. The variety in the Aquarium is amazing and feeding time not to be missed.
Beautiful . God's creation of underwater bought by humans to see such beautiful creations and varieties of fishes.. cost of viewing and going underwater is not epensive.

Big Surprise. I expected a small token aquarium when I saw it listed on the places inside the Dubai Shopping Mall but it is the real deal with a most impressive collection of many difference species of fish including sharks. It is well organized and well presented. Definitely worth a visit.
Part of the Mall experience . The aquarium is very nicely done plenty of places to view the sea life from all levels.There was a line to go thru the tunnel so I passed on that.

Worth a visit. We did this trip in connection with the burj khalifa. Well worth the trip! Better than the London on.There is a tunnel to walk through on one level and then the actual animals are on another level.Great fun for an afternoon out.

average one. i have seen a lot of aquariums across the globe, compared to those, this one is quite average. Not huge, it seemed to end where it started, however the optional ones are nice. Go for the one where you can feed the fishes, those seem to be quite interesting!
Very well designed . It's worth seeing it. Children will love it, cause they can see animals everywhere around them. Like, everywhere. Very nice.

An aquarium inside a shopping mall!. This was a great experience, going shopping at the Dubai Mall we saw this huge aquarium inside which was great to see. We booked some tickets to go in the tunnel which allows you to get real close to the marine life, and with the tickets there was a tour into the zoo and area where a guide showed us how they feed the huge fish!
it was great experience. The experience of the aquarium was amazing specially in Dubai mall and in front of candy shop. and lot of peoples whom was looking at the fish inside of that huge aquarium.

My family loved it.. Very well maintained, and worth paying a visit. One of the places, not to be missed. Even the basic package, is worthy, unless you really want to go deep and explore the real encounters.

Water and Wildlife at the Mall!!. I'm the tourist who looks for deals and discounts. One of the places you will visit multiple times during your stay is Dubai Mall, whether you like malls or not. We debated whether we wanted to pay money to see "fish at the mall" but we got a special. Discounted savings at the Aquarium/Zoo after our tour at the Burj Khalifa. I can't remember the exact percentage off but it was more than 40% and included the highest level aquarium visit. It was like any other aquarium zoo combo and I would have skipped it if we didn't stumble upon the discount. The aquatic life was nothing you couldn't see elsewhere. Something fun to do on a hot day when you don't want to be outside. The staff members were pleasant. They would stop and answer any questions you had about the aquatic life. We did the "boat ride" at the Dubai Aquarium which is a circle around the tank and saw one of the largest crocodiles from Australia. Nice time but definitely not a "do over." If you just have to go see if another nearby site is offering discounted tickets. DO NOT PAY FULL PRICE. I didn't realize there was an aquarium at The Atlantis before we secured the tickets. I would have much rather toured The Atlantis Aquarium instead based on what we saw during our stop there. Oh well that's my two cents on the subject, you have to decide for yourself.
Must See. The experience of the aquarium and zoo were amazing and not to be missed. The price was reasonable and well worth the experience.

Animals not really put first. . Even the coral is plastic. We booked the otter experience which turned out to be an otter performance with them doing circus tricks. Not what modern zoos or animal parks are really about any more. They printed off a 15 page photo booklet with my families photos before I'd even left the place "with no obligation to buy". I was annoyed to see that the booklet had suggestions on how to conserve resources - I did suggest that perhaps not printing off pages of coloured photos would be a good start but I doubt it will do much good. If you have kids then it's a rest from the shops but it's not as good as it could be. In fact the Avenue has a better display in my opinion and it costs less.

Happy. The dubai aquarium is the place to be. For those that live nature like me. It was nice to see all those kinds of fish in a large group swimming towards and away from me as if under instruction.
Worth visiting. Decent value for money, it is what it is Aquarium with lots of fish, the extra part with the other types of creatures is also good, definitely worth a visit, kids will enjoy.

One time visit. It is a bit costly, but its an experience that needs to be taken once at least. Its great to see the animals right above your head and its great for the children. There is the opportunity to go diving as well but that is something I didn't try. But its a great experience. Try and get the tickets from the website and you might get a better rate.

Good day. I thoroughly enjoyed our trip in the aquarium but I do not think it was worth the prices they are charging. It is not something you can spend a long time in for the price. However I did enjoy it.

My boy loved it!. Booked a ticket via the website which cost is the cheapest way to buy it but if you want to visit this and the Burj Khalifa then book via the stall next to the aquarium as it is cheaper than to buy individual tickets for both.We picked the package with included feeding the fish. As my son is one he didn't do it but watched.He really loved it and looked everywhere around him as there was so much to see!Definitely worth a visit if you have a family.

Amazing. Did the whole tour, glass bottom boat etc. Absolutely wonderful to find this aquarium right in the middle of Dubai mall and very reasonably priced. DONT buy an ice cream inside as it cost us a lot of money
Little bit overpriced . Honestly was amazed me at all, have admitted that aquarium is huge, you can see there lots fishes... even divers. If you wish you can buy tickets and go under water
Aquarium. It's ok. Nothing special. Similar to Atlanta aquarium in USA. Which I think is a bit better though. The crocodile is worth it though. It was massive!

Simply the best aquarium! . This was our second visit. Dubai aquarium is beautiful. It is well thought out, very reasonably priced and worth every penny. It's hard to believe it's within a shopping mall! You even ride a boat trip across the top. Great value for money and you can spend hours here as there is lots to see.

Very interesting. Worth the money seeing behind the scenes of the aquarium and the zoo. I would definitely visit this attraction. You get to feed the fish and see fish etc which they are breeding. The guides are very good.
Good to visit. Its located in the Dubai Mall and from outside its huge and looke like a wonder . But to buy tickets and visit inside its similar experience like any other

Fun but not a big aquarium . It was fun but compared to other aquariums we visited in Istanbul and Kuala Lumpur, this was small. Would take an hour max. Booked it with the Burj Khalifa tickets on offer.

Absolutely visit. . This is spectacular in size and quality. There is a tour that lets you dive in the aquarium. The variety of displays around the main aquarium is good. The displays themselves are well thought out and colourful.

It's an Aquarium. It's a cool thing to do with the little ones. It's an aquarium , the bonus is it's also located in the mall so you can go shopping or eat at any of the restaurants there. Did the walk through, which I always like feeling as if I'm under the sea! The zoo was cute, penguins being the best part to me. Did not like the glass bottom boat ride. The glass was not clear and didn't see anything (waste of money)

Worth the visit. An aquarium and underwater zoo in a shopping mall? It works! The zoo is quite small but well kept (and more importantly the animals all looked well). The aquarium walkway is a fantastic experience - yes, you can see some of it from outside but the tunnel through the middle really does give you a different view. I'd also recommend the boat trip on the surface of the aquarium - a glass-bottomed boat trip totally different from anything you've done before.
Exotic to Marvellous. The range of animals and fishes is exotic and the feeding tour for some extra charge at the aquarium is informative. The crocodiles and penguins are marvellous.

Aquarium at Atlantis . Just unbelievable and great value. Best aquarium I have visited and nearby water park make it ideal for families. They even do a family ticket which includes lunch. You can rent a towel and locker if you wish

Remarkably average. Not exceptionally different from your typical aquarium. The giant crocodile was fun to see and research and the aquarium tunnel was a good touch. Worth visiting, but don't expect to be thrilled.
Worth a visit. It is a nice place to visit especially for families with children. The tunnel was amazing but not as big as I expected. The glass bottom boat was the best part.
Best fun place . Dubai aquarium and under water zoo is one of best attraction for young children.It is best location in the mall for fun for all age group.

Average aquarium - fun otter experience. I'll be honest I personally found the aquariam not very impressive but once you have been to one they are not very different.The tunnel is on the lower level which is cool as you can see all the fish and sharks above you. Then you have to go up to the top floor of the mall to see the rest.I found the aquarium really hard to navigate as you had to keep going back on yourself and there wasnt a clear flow as to where you need to be.We did however pay to go the "Other Encounter" my partner didn't pay to go in as he didn't want to but I booked the 6pm slot and no-one else did it so because it was just me they allowed my partner in there aswell which was nice of them.In the encounter you sit on these seats behind a plastic barrier so you can't actually touch the others but you see the trainer play with them and tell you loads of information about them. They have holes in the plastic barrier so you can touch the otters hands and can take photos. It was a nice change to an average aquarium and was fun - I think kids would love the otter encounter as they were so cute!!.

A good attraction for family days out. Embedded deep within this glossy mall, the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo is arranged around a long walking route of passageways, pipes and tunnels, many of which are surrounded by the aquatic exhibits - swimming in abundance around the visitors in glass tanks and tubes. Really good displays of fish in motion and a great experience for kids especially, though stroller access is difficult in some areas. One note of caution: visitors who do not favour the training of small animals to do 'tricks' that do not come naturally to them may not wish to visit the Otter display area.

Dubai Aquarium – A creditable indoor aquarium. Overall, Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo is compact, not very big but it is a wonderful effort at this scale in the Arabian region of the world. Overall it can take about an hour to complete visit to Tunnel, Zoo and the feeding area. The initial big tunnel is visible even to mall visitors from outside; it is not too big but nicely done and one can see a number of species there. After exit one has to go up two levels in the mall to access the Zoo, feeding area and other attractions. I have visited a few aquariums at different places and in that context didn’t expect too much from this one but must say that it is a creditable, well presented and compact indoor facility created by its developers at a premium mall in Dubai. There are a number of attractions, the biggest being the crocs. Fish feeding area has been done well. You can also touch and feel starfish and crabs in designated areas.  On the flip side I felt that the directions once you are inside should be visible and clearer as in the Zoo area in particular people get confused and miss direction. Also there should be an inner way to go from Tunnel to Zoo rather than the common mall escalators. Some of the enclosures and aquariums could have been bigger but then the credit cannot be denied for a wonderful effort. Both children and adults will enjoy the visit. It is slightly expensive but then they have maintained the same very well which needs to be lauded. Since there are a number of attractions inside Dubai Mall try and check online options or discounted passes at the venue which can help you cover multiple attractions at a lower combined cost.

Big Bus Tour. This visit was included in our ticket with the bus tour. Worth the look. A good place for families with small children. Just outside we had the best ice cream - a little like Cold rock in Australia.

Just watched from outside..... Has a massive tank in the mall. We looked from outside and this was enough for us although tickets were pretty cheap (250 DHR?) If you like fish this is the place for you!

It's alright.. Not the most amazing aquarium I've ever seen, but something to do if you want a break from shopping in the ridiculously big mall. They have some cool jellyfish and a HUGE croc. Probably good if you have kids, but kids annoy me.

Best Aquarium I ever seen. I was totally blown away by this aquarium during my visit. From the amazing tunnel and outside viewing area in the mall to the unique creatures you can find inside. The King Croc is worth making the visit for alone.

Great Displays and Range of Marine Life. We popped in for an hour after some dinner and weren't disappointed. The presentation of the fish and other life is stunning. Nice too that it's not just fish too. Some lobsters, crabs, seahorse and jelly fish. There are also some cushions to sit and take in the large tank - and by large I mean uber-big. This tank must have over 1,000 fish including sharks, rays and everything else with fins and scales!There are a couple of areas where you can get up close to starfish and crabs which is good for younger visitors to appreciate these incredible creatures.Took about an hour to work around it but you could sit down for longer and it could well become a two hour trip.
Dubai aquarium. You can go inside the aquarium for 100aed you will see 35000 matiné animals you can have access to underwater zoo good for the children

Average at best. . Visited with my boyfriend last week. Costs about €30 per person. Not worth the price in my opinion. It's small. The aquarium at the Atlantis hotel is a lot nicer. And if you are visiting the water park there, there is a ticket including access to water park and aquarium.
Into the blue. We visited The Aquarium as part of our stopover in Dubai. The tunnel was a cool experience and the rest of the zoo was an educational walk with information on signs and touch screens.
wonder. cannot imagine a huge collection of sea life in the desert inside a mall. its magnificent. well maintained as well. cool attraction.

An underwater tour. This is great for all ages. The promotional photos can be a little expensive, but then it is not something you experience every day. There are some activities for the kids where they can touch and get close to some of the sea-life on display. Well worth an hour or so of your holiday time.

Out of this world. Absolutely great attraction ..the place well cared for the staff are exceptional and helpful...
a must do whilst in Dubai ..
Woow. To be there in special under the Aquarium and through tunnel is just amazing as well at the zoo, clean and beautiful. Highly recommended!

Water water everywhere. This is one of a kind of attractions that you could not forget in your life time. Dubai Acquarium & Underwater Zoo has an amazing display of creatures of water. It has variety of fish including Shark etc. Once you are in dubai it is worth visiting it. It is centre of attaction of Dubai Mall. Dubai Acquarium is free for viewing, but for underwater zoo you have to pay.

Great for kids. Visited here with my six year old in mid July and she absolutely loved it. She was totally enthralled for a good couple of hours and her favourite part was the glass bottom water boat ride, which was part of the package I payed for (slightly more expensive than the basic package but worth it). Great experience which the kids will love.

Family trip. It was a long tiring day already but the kids still want to have an adventure. So we tried the aquarium and it was so fun. Brings back the old memories when I was still a kid. We enjoyed the crocodile and the fish. Also the tour glass boating. Additional just need more fun activities.

fish fish and more. best aquarium we visited. the coloures and the huge species of water animals are unbelievable. animals in every colour and kind. nice aquarium to visit with children. the price for entry is ok.
nice place. Amazing place i advice everyone to visit itnice and fantastic place ever in Dubai you should go there while you are in dubaithank you

Beautiful. Lovely place to visit and good outing with kids you will see all kinds of fish and massive fish you will have never seen before very beautiful also professional photos being taken I sis you can pay and go in the water with special clothes and life guard with you

Surprising. This aquarium holds all sorts of wonders! I was amazed by the sheer size of it and so much was available to view just as a shopper in the mall but when we paid entrance fee and walked through the tunnel then climbed to the second floor and saw the most unusual exhibits we were totally surprised. We saw jelly fish from home that we had never seen before showcased in such a way that we got a really good close look at them. We also saw some really strange looking fish that permanently have their mouths open scooping stuff up. Fascinating! There is a pretty big croc and his partner in there - taken out of Cairns in Qld. The story of their trip is well documented too. Well worth the visit.

Good value. Amazing what engineering achieves - an aquarium in the middle of a shopping mall! You could easily get away with not paying and seeing the aquarium from the outside but it is good value for money to actually go in. Tickets are reasonably priced (200 dirhams, Aug 15) to walk through aquarium then have a tour behind the scenes (probably a publicity ploy to show they're being sustainable). For not much more (can't remember exactly but it honestly wasn't much more) you can feed the fish, or.... get in the tank with the sharks!!! Really amazing experience. After which you can walk through the rest of the aquarium to see King Croc (massive!) and more sea life (I got to touch a starfish!) Then onto the rip-off gift shop - the only downside to the attraction. £18 for a keyring with a picture of you standing inside the aquarium. Not. Worth. It. Take your own camera/phone!But overall, really good value for money to be inches (glass is 7 inches thick, I believe) from amazing sea life. A must see.
Wow. This is breath taking. More Marine life in one place than expected. Two people in SCUBA gear were feeding at the time of our visit. By all means worth the price of admission

Great for curious kids!. The Dubai Aquarium, although small, is an extremely interesting place! It's worth paying for a behind the scenes tour to see how they raise and take care of the animals inside.

Good POI to place on you visit.. The aquarium is great and well maintained, it contains a good amount of creatures and wide array of species, sharks, rays, reef fish, anemone, etc.. Just beware of rush hours and holidays, you won't even be able to hold your camera steady to take pictures!! Aim for the middle of the week and before 7pm.

A welcome break from retail overload!. The Dubai Mall is the largest in the world apparently - same shops and same concept as every other. The twist here is that bang in the middle is a great aquarium. Initially viewed from the mall itself it's worth paying the minimum entry of 100AED per person - kids a little cheaper I think. Lots of fish and the like, great sea rats and the biggest crocodile I've ever seen! Oh and there's obviously a shop!!

Sealife coming to life in the middle of shopping. One of the unique experiences in one of the Dubai shopping malls is also the Dubai Acquarium. You walk through a tunnel made o very thick glass and different species of fish combined with sharks swim over your head. There was also a diver in the tank and we were able to take a picture with him. Would definitely recommend the visit, especially to families.
