Just Wow!. We visited during a visit to Dubai Mall and came across the Dubai Aquarium. It is absolutely stunning and an engineering feat. It's been built within a shopping mall! Over two storeys in height and about 10 shops long. It's huge and contains an array of beautiful fish including rays and sharks. There are lots of different species of fish in there and you have an opportunity to dive with a professional and hand feed the fish. This wasn't for me but I was very impressed with the way in which this aquarium is built and sited. The fish don't appear to be shy and are swimming about happily. It's as others have said deceptively big. The Perspex tunnel that you can walk through and under the fish is very daunting too. It's not a full half day for this attraction but will easily soak up a couple of hours.

Rip Off Prices. You see everything outside. Just check youtube videos if you really want to pay over the top prices. Watch out for the cowboys who wish to take your photo then charge a fortune for it. Bored staff hang around.
Good Aquarium. i like the sharks specially the price is really over for access and it's super crowded , you can't enjoy well .
very good. its very cool .. me and my family liked it very much >>> only the picture thing its very costly and they should make it less
Worth the visit. Certainly worth a visit. Its the second largest aquarium in the world. They have 4 different packages you can choose from starting at AED 100 per person.

Time spent well. We purchased the explorer tickets- went to aquarium tunnel, 5 min submarine simulator (not so good), glass bottom boat and under water zoo. The ticket price is 120 aed. Worth to spend for one time experience. The aquarium has full of sharks and ray fishes. The underwater zoo holds various species of fishes, along with crocodiles, penguins,gizzards and many more
Must see.... One of the biggest aquariums in the world. Full of sharks for sharks lovers. You can feed the fish or dive with them. They have a long tunnel.

A one time must visit attraction. Aquarium itself is free to see from the outside. A site to behold in itself but if you want the full experience then tickets are 100AED a piece. You may find discounts on groupon or cobone do check them out. Its 50 % off if you have a military card. If you decide to buy the tickets it wont be a letdown. You can walk underneath the aquarium take pictures of the numerous types of sea life. Subsequently there are three floors. Each floor houses sea life in small aquariums. Worth the watch. Very entertaining and informative for kids and adults both. They also offer a small guided tour at the end. No extra charge. Remember it takes at least 2 hrs for the complete experience. P.S. The aquarium is inside the dubai mall.
not bad. if you have seen other aquariums in the world , will this is in the middle range due to the size of it being inside a mall

Good displays. The majority of the zoo is taken up with the massive fish tank but little time is spent under it. The extra bits are hidden away upstairs but are presented well with friendly staff. The kids loved it. It is expensive, but so is Dubai.

Amazing and deceptively large within Dubai Mall. My opinion it's in the top 3 after visiting many aquariums around the globe.. Kids will not only get to experience and learn about many species in various tanks but can also take a boat ride with glass bottom which including feeding the fishes.. For one is tempted for a dive, can arrange to dive in the aquarium to feed the Sharks...A must see/do experience when visiting Dubai!!
Wow experience in Dubai. It was definetly the most amazing atraction experience in Dubai. When you visit Dubai its a must to see spot !

Well worth a visit . I visited last weekend with my husband and my elderly parents including my father who is in a wheelchair. The wheelchair access is brilliant and we were all amazed at how easy it was for my father to see everything everyone else could see.Although my husband and I lived in Dubai for 7 years we had never actually visited the aquarium before, but it was amazing. There's is so much to see and do and absolutely well worth the visit. It is also very good value for money.

don't miss the crocodile feeding. it everyday at 4 pm and u'll wanna be there 10 minutes ahead so u'll book a nice view, also don't miss the penguins they r super friendlyand there's a boat tour i don't recommend if u r visiting with little kids.the sharks are the stars of the day if u want my opinion

For families with young ones. This feels like ordinary at first but the shark encounter and glass walk is a little bit bone chilling. You can stay here all day if you want but once you step out, you cannot go back in. I really can't say much because this is like a field trip but my kid really enjoyed this plac. Watch the king croc feeding time and get your souvenir pictures too. :)

Nice from the outside.. It's nice from the outside specially when it's almost the first thing that you see coming in to the mall.The tour inside is not longer than about 100 meter.If it's something that you need to do? No. You can see the fishes from the outside.

Otter Experience and Aquarium visit. We did the Otter Experience which was very good. The otters were very entertaining, we got to stroke their paws and feed them. They did a few tricks, vert well trained but very smelly.The aquarium had a great selection of animals, the Crocs and the penguins were our favourites.The big underwater tunnel is great... having sharks swim over your head.
Amazing. Be sure not to miss this free treat. Amazing Rays and basking sharks and tuna fish. A must for the kids and adults. Great photo opportunities

Beautiful Attraction in Dubai Mall. You can get a walk-through inside a glass tube at the bottom of the aquarium. You get to see a good glimpse of marine life. They have rays, jelly fish, and all kinds of species, and additionally you could feed the fish in a glass bottom boat. All of which is chargeable. If you don't want to pay, you could still get a free glimpse of the aquarium through the almost 12 feet high glass wall. Great view. Do visit this spot !

They Lie to people. Never pay for pictures if they ask you. Before me and my family go inside the aquarium they took pictures for us and later they ask you if you want to pay for the pictures to have them. I have paid 110 AED and been told from the staff there that within three days I will be able to download the same pictures they showed me there. One week later After I have been checking almost everyday there are no pictures. I have sent them three emails by now and nobody even replies.I am so disappointed of that place how they take money from people. I will never go there again.
Fantastic for kids. I took my 6 yo granddaughter in here and we had a ball.It was clearly markd out, not too crowded and full of interest.We loved it.
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo Review. Very nice place, especially for families. You can even swim with the fish if you want. There you can see many interesting and exotical fishes.
Aqua fun. Amazing place..Having seen it many times on tv shows you still aren't prepared for the size of the aquarium! A must see in Dubai..

Worth the visit!!. This was part of our tour package and we are happy that the kids fully enjoyed this tour, this is situated inside Dubai Mall, and the moment you enter just walk 50 meters and you will see huge fishes consisting of Sting Rays and sharks swimming in front of you in huge glass enclosure, they have built in such a way that if you dont want to but tickets then also you can watch few of the attractions, all in all a good place to visit while in Dubai

Nice to see. We visited Dubai Mall, and decided to visit the Aquarium in the mall. It is a bit on the expensive side, but in this heat, we had to do something indoors. It was nice to see, and loved the water tunnel with the sharks and other species swimming over you

Try Shark Walker. I've visited the aquarium for several times and it is very big and good. But I want to write about the Shark Walker. You don't need to know anything about diving and even about swimming. but you can wear the helmet for breathing and dive with the cage in the aquarium to see the sharks and all other fishes. In the cage there is also a professional diver to assist you and take your video with GoPro cameras. So if you have a chance, just try it.

Not the most amazing aquarium I have seen. Yeah, it's pretty nice to see this big "window of water", but you can see it for free from the mall. When you pay the ticket you can enter the tunnel you see in the picture, but it's pretty much the same thing as from outside. In our tour was also included some Explorer tour. We went on a submarine simulator that was basically a cartoon for kids. We also went on a boat with glass bottom, to see the aquarium from the top, it's okay but kind of the same thing. Wouldn't pay again the ticket, just see it from the mall for free. They have some additional service like diving inside, they are expensive but that would be probably the only worth thing to pay for.
Best getaway with family. Informative and fun clubbed together. There is not a single damper moment during the visit. Perfect with family
Day visit. Visit to Dubai Mall taking in a visit to the aquarium the biggest in the world. A fantastic day out plus you can book to dive in the aquarium and feed the fish
Into the blue. Always enjoyed the dubai aquarium whenever i have visited.My son also loved it.I love watching the jelly fishes swimThis time we got to see the crocodile too.

Largest indoor aquarium. This is a must visit place when you are visiting Dubai with kids. Situated inside Dubai Mall, the place is easily accessible. There are different types of package available and tickets can be bought online or over the counter.

the doze of blue in the city of gold..... amazing view from outside as well as inside thou a tad on the expensive side but i do suggest to visit and do the underwater scuba diving conducted here totally worth every penny situated inside the Dubai mall a cool place to hang out and lots of pics to be taken......

Average (quick visit). I had a free ticket with our purchase of the City Sightseeing bus (48 hrs) so that is the only reason we went, with this ticket we didn't had to wait in line, so it was worth a quick visit, its nice to walk around all the sharks and fish and rays, and zoo its just average.
Very impressive . But as an animal lover don't like to see anything outside its natural habitat. It was clean and they are fed well. So it could be worse
Very impressive . But as an animal lover don't like to see anything outside its natural habitat. It was clean and they are fed well. So it could be worse

Just enjoy the big aquarium in the mall. In my view its enough to enjoy the big aquarium in the mall itself. That is free to watch. Paying the entrance fee for this one doesn't give you a lot in addition. .
Ok. Very beautiful to see so many fish just in a mall. The under Water zoo wasn't all that as it's just more fishes. There's also sharks and crocodiles included.
It's nice!. The Aquarium is nice, but it's missing more species and more thing to watch, it was not what i expected! the best thing is the tunnel!
Fantastic experience. Great design and collection of fish and attractions. A must see. Walk in buy a ticket and escape into the underwater world.
Exciting. If you are planning to visit the aquarium pointless buying a ticket and walking through the tunnel but the underwater zoo is for sure a must visit place. Kids will love it.

The experience. Good aquarium and underwater zoo. I felt harassed after the visit to purchase photos which were not of good quality . I would advised not to purchase the photos and take your own photos .
The photos they produce are of poor quality and they keep changing the prices of the photos.

Nice break from retail. I wasn't expecting much from this and almost didn't go as we're not really fans of zoos or aquariums in general, but kids were bored of the mall and we needed to kill some time before dinner so we went. I was pleasantly surprised. Lots to see and do for the price, including a behind the scenes tour, though they have WAY TOO MANY fish in that one tank. They get pretty aggressive during feeding time so you can tell it's every fish for themselves, they need to reduce the number. Good tour guides.
Very fascinating especially being in the Mall!. The kids loved this (14,12 & 10)! Definitely worth a look when you are shopping & trying to stay out of the heat.

Ok. We booked this mainly because it was another thing for my little 3 year old to see and enjoy and we had the entertainer voucher for the event. It was ok nothing spectacular and actually not the best dolphin show either. The guy talking was appalling and spent the entire time advertising raffle tickets and other random extras which I found hugely irritating. The park outside is nice but far too hot in July! Although my son loved the camel.

New Expat Experience. We visited The Aquarium in the Dubai Mall as part of our relocation journey. The tunnel was a good experience and the educational walk through the live animal / reptile area. The boat ride was a non event. This is there more to keep kids entertained than adults.

Aquarium 😁😁😁. Me and my girl friend had a wonderful time seeing the different species of fish ... We got to touch the star fish and took a round in glass boat where we could see the huge tank from top .. Its great fun for children and educating for them

Disgraceful. They must be ashamed. Tiny sized aquarium for such large fish, Sharks, Rays etc. they need much more room. Watch 'blackfish' film and you will understand if you haven't previously thought about it. It's time to get rid of places like this, just horrible for live sentient animals. Unfortunately typical of UAE the way exploits anything And everything in the name of consumerism.

Worth a couple of hours of your time. Buy your tickets on line in advance and save on the queues then just go with the flow. Despite being basically a very large fish tank there is enough here to see and even do to fill a morning or afternoon of your time. The boat ride is most enjoyable!

Worth a visit on a rainy day.. If you have an hour to spare and don't mind crowds and forking over a bit of money then this is worth doing. It is pretty impressive to view from the outside which draws everyone in. Once paying your admission the facilities inside are decent and you can see how much effort they put into keeping this a world class aquarium. Wide range of tropical, exotic fish and sea creatures which brings a smile to your face. Again, it's worth doing if you can part with a decent amount of cash.
Loved It !!. People got opportunities to swim safely with sharks !!! Got to learn about survival challenge for infant sharks and the Tank is enormous !

Complaint. Yesterday we were at Dubai mall and we decided to check the Aquarium as the view from outside looked absolutely amazing. However at the counter we were given two options you buy ticket with boat ride 120 Aed or 100 without boat. We were told you will enter tunnel then zoo and boat ride, the whole experience will last for an hour. The tunnel journey is for 5-10mins nothing spectacular. You then come out to area where you started queueing up for ticket wondering around for 10mins & so thinking where to go next. You then enter Zoo which has very small quantity of fishes again overall 10min experience nothing special. If you've purchased the boat ticket you will go into stimulator for 5 mins, not for adults at all, you then asked to wait for 15-20mins before you could take the boat ride. We were absolutely disappointed and decided to leave the aquarium and asked for refund.We spoke to manager Hafeez who was extremely rude,we were called a liar in so many words that staff at cashier desk explains the whole experienced therefore we knew before purchasing the tickets. When I challenged this he refused to listen and refund our money in full, refunded 100 dirham only. I'm disgusted the way we were treated was very embarrassing. We've never complained about anything but yesterday was a complete shocking, we were insulted , we've spent a lot of money to come to Dubai to explore sight seeing etc not to be treated like criminal. our expectation was bigger and the price you've to pay is shocking, place is not impressive at all. The giant tank from outside is the most there is to see.

Average Aquarium. Short, crowded, expensive for what it is. What is impressive is the fact that it is inside the mall, so you REALLY don't need to buy tickets to see the fish, you can see them from the huge tank wall while walking in the mall. Don't waste money on it.

Average but still quite cool . If you want to do the burj khalifa and the aquarium then I would definitely recommend buying the joint pass; it is ~180AED pp and so will save you money! The aquarium is pretty cool - there is a huge tank which is visible from inside the mall to the general public, this contains sting rays, small sharks and many fish. With the ticket you can walk through the tunnel with the tank all above you - this is good, especially for kids! There is then an upstairs section which has more variety such as penguins, King crocodiles, sea horses, jelly fish etc. There are good fact boards about each species so it is good for information too! I would say it is a little expensive for the money but if you're looking for a fun activity (especially for children) around the area it is good!

Inhumane, disgusting! . I was really shocked when I came to the zoo - I had to leave the aqua zoo straight away! The fish are in such small containers, it's awful! In particular there was a catfish in such a small tank it could hardly even move! And the crocodile that you so often talk about can't even swim around its just terrible! They must be depressed! It was so sad - I didn't expect this from Dubai. I won't be at another aquarium again and I am disgusted at the way those fish are treated and will be making a formal complaint! You should be ashamed of yourselves!
Good enough. I have done loads of these around the world and this was one of the better ones with lots to do,I took the boat ride ticket and it was good fun

A lovely experience. The number of species at the aquarium is truly fantastic. Everything is very well organized and systematic. A must do specially if you have kids as its a great visual experience for both adults and kids. They also the new BIG crocodile which is relatively new and he is really huge.

nice to see. I have been there ten time, it is very nice.
when you go there you can avoid crowded from place and go to the second floor next to h&m behind the Aquarium and be so close to it, it is like being inside the tunnel :)
Love it. Just amazing to watch... you can see loads of different species... sharks manta rays... you cant get enoughof taking pict ir es of it... with kids or alone

Under the sea. Must see attraction at Atlantis. This was amazing you feel like you have entered a series of caves. An extraordinary display of underwater life in very natural looking environments. Wonderful detail every room tells a different story. You have guides available to assist you with any questions you may have. We met Shunali, one of the guides working there. She was very friendly and knowledgable and taught us a lot about the various fish species and their behaviours. We had a great time finding the lost chambers. Put this one on your bucket list !
Worth the visit. Catch the metro to the mall, buy in advance.Pose for the obligatory photo and make sure you go upstairs after.Some people we met didn't and so didn't get maximum enjoyment.
Dubai aquarim. Dubai acuarium very beautiful place and more type fish in under water may be chargesable and make a sutting under water

Plenty to see. We visited here whilst I. The Dubai mall. There is a lot of sections to visit and we particularly enjoyed the behind the scenes tour. We learnt a lot. The aquariums are huge and you can spend a good amount of time looking at everything.

Tunnel Aquarium is unique & photogenic. I took this place in Combo with AT THE TOP (125th floor) for 180AEDs.Although i felt its costlier but for a tourist like me excursions were more important than budget..the Tunnel is really awesome.Biggest Aquarium that i have seen ..

Dubai 2016. Very well kept, OVER PRICED! standard aquarium prices only include the tank area, but to see the giant croc, you need to pay extra tickets are sold for each hour, over all good, Main attraction is the huge tank and variety of fish, but i would rate Sealife London better.

Disappointing. I paid for a joint entry ticket for the Burj Khalifa and Dubai Aquarium and under water zoo. Overall I found the whole experience disappointing. The aquarium only consists of one moving walkway through the main tank in the Mall. It's free to stand outside the tank anyway. Then you leave and go 2 floors upstairs for the zoo bit. My teenagers were a bit bored to be honest. The crocodile is great to see and the giant water rats sitting up eating their carrots were fascinating but apart from that it was not great. I would not go back and would not really recommend for on doer children.

Baada Umrah. Breath taking. Spent more than one our just lost in the aquarium world. Better than many I have visited in Singapore Denmark n Africa. Cool 100DH TO HAVE THE REAL FEEL IS ON THE HIGH SIDE. Security of no touching n almost no photo is a negative. Very disciplined sea creatures...

What a super day out. The aquarium is superb.We all had a great time and all have our favourites things that we saw.The most amazing thing though was the glass bottomed boat.You could get the best view from the glass of all the unique creatures that lived in the aquarium.

Sad to See. Having just returned from a diving trip in the Philippines it was sad to see beautiful sea life that I has traveled around the world to see and did not see them in the wild. The tank in Dubai Mall is filled with beautiful Rays and Sharks. It was sad to realise that part of the reason that I did not see rays in the wild was because they were living in glass boxes in a shopping centres around the world. The tank is over packed and I watched for 10 minutes as the rays were chased constantly by smaller fish biting their tails. It was apparent that they were stressed by the constant chasing and biting. There was a SCUBA diver in the water with a guide and after 1 or 2 minutes the diver starting to panic and was flapping around. He was kicking the fish and was clearly distressed. The instructor had to hold the man still to stop him kicking up the plant life or ascending to the surface. Inexperienced people should not be placed in a tank that full of fish it was clearly overwhelming to have such large fish such as sharks swimming so close. I am not against all aquariums I think they hold great value in educating people about oceans but the tank was too full and the fish were overly aggressive. If you want to see beautiful fish buy a snorkel and mask.

Average experience. It is a very small aquarium with very few knowledgeable staff members. The people who worked there didn't seem to know or care much about the animals.I asked at least 3 different staff members where the profits of the aquarium go towards and none of them knew. I expected to hear of proceeds going towards conservation as they do back in Australia, but nobody knew or mentioned it.The animals were very playful and lively so they were good to take photos and videos of.

Nice aquarium. This aquarium has a huge tank that you can see from inside the Dubai Mall before going into the aquarium. There are many encounters you can do inside the aquarium including otters, rays, sharks and crocs. you can even scuba dive in the big tank. The tanks within the aquarium are all spotless and well looked after. Worth a trip inside

Amazing Water World. It was an amazing Experience in my life ever had. I wondered whether I reached beneath the ocean. The coolest place released all the stresses and strains in my life and couldn't realize the time passes me by watching the ocean beauties in the aquarium. Really, it's an Amazing Water World.
So cool. my kids love the Dubai aquarium , I recommend going first thing in the morning once the mall is open as it can get very crowded and you wont have as much fun.

Fish aquarium in a large shopping centre. Wow, this catches your eye. Lots of different fish from all over the world on display. Massive fish aquarium in the middle of the shops is Definately worth a look.
Close to the nature. The tunnel where you walk through to view the sharks and other fishes was really fantastic.This is located inside the dubai mall, it´s amazing.

Not for aquarium lovers. For little children, and people who have not seen an aquarium, this tour is fine. There are many fish closeby in the overhead tank. You will peer into individual tanks and enclosures with interesting fish and animals. But there are very limited species, and there is no imagination in their pens, habitats, etc.You will not find any docents along the way to answer questions about the animals. Many enclosures are extremely small for the occupants. The penguins don't do the playing you will see at many other zoos, since the enclose is tiny, with few attractions for them to climb, slide, etc. Again, stop in if your group has never seen an aquarium before. Otherwise, you might be disappointed.
Dubai Aquarium must watch..!!!. It was awsm experience feeling Sea life so close to you. Yo can enjoy multiple activities inside the aquarium, make sure to buy the right ticket..!!!

Expectation was higher!. In my opinion the entrance fee of 100 AED (~28€) is too high for that what can be seen. A tunnel through the big aquarium and then upstairs to some aquariums and terrariums. Nice to see but not recommended.

Perfect - worth of visiting. Briliant experience for everybody. We went their with our two kids (3+6) and we all had fun and we really liked it. Worth of time and money. Don't miss the underwater Zoo two floors above the tunel. It is good to book the ticket before you go. We bought ticket as combo ticket with At the top at Burj Kalipha - very good price. If you booke upfront, can save time at the entrance. Mainly if you plan your visit for Friday (day off in UAE and other arabic countries).

Always a good experience. Lots of fish to see: the most interesting are the stingray, the sharks and the new albine alligator . Be in mind that the aquarium is under the building and you do not see the fish at " open air"
Very Nice to see it. Very Nice & Big aquarium , i'm really enjoyed with my family to see the Sharks, Turtles & Manta Fish
Enjoyed Completely. Children's will Love it.. Numerous species of Fish, Children's will enjoy completely. Boat ride was Nice and Experienced the underground submarine simulator.

Don't pay to go in. I wouldn't pay again to go in.. You can see most of the fish in the aquarium for the outside... The fish are off course beautiful and majestic.. but I wouldn't pay to walk inside for less than 5 min!

Amazing place in the mall. Over all it was an amazing place. Sharks close enough to touch, Stingrays flying by. Visually incredible. We went on a holiday so was quite crowed and very noisy. Lines were still small. The only real negative was the cost of the souvenir pictures. If you wanted the pictures it was more than the cost of admission for both of us. About 300AED for the pictures, kind of outrageous even for Dubai. I can't imagine paying much more for pictures than admission. it would more than double the price. We took our own and they came out nice.

Sort of underwhelming.. One would think that this place would be huge, but it's not. And that's okay too, except there's nothing very exciting about this place in the general tour. Part of our tour also consisted a boat ride, which was again, nothing special. It felt like we took a ride around a really really deep pool. The king crocodiles (really large ones) were great to see. This is a tourist spot but to be very honest, you wouldn't be missing out if you missed this.

Inside Dubai Mall. I mean everything is right there. I enjoyed it quite a bit even when I personally do not like captive animals, but again I was surprised with the good care the zookeepers had. There is scuba diving for those interested, but to be honest the Aquarium is tiny. I finished it and was like what? I got a bundle of Burj Khalifa and Aquarium + Zoo Entrance so it was not too bad, but the aquarium is small

Great aquarium!. Glass bottom boat is great. Large tank is amazing but then you get inside. Loads of small tanks where you can actually see all the sea life, visit the crocodile and have a ball. Great day out!
Nice. Very nice experience.. I went there with my wife during our honey moon in dubai, good for one time experience in dubai...

Ok, nothing special. Visited the aquarium in november 2015, having visited many other such aquariums around the world over the years we found it was just alright. Nothing different or special then the ones in australia, singapore or the UK. It was also absolutely packed with families who would bump into you, shove you out of the way the get their very noisy ill behaved wee little kids to the front. Not that enjoyable all and all, also we found where the aquarium was located very disappointing....non of the restaurants were open at 2.30 to even have a drink.....treated like cattle and not very relaxing.

Largest Aquarium in the world in Dubai. we visited one of the largest Aquarium in the world in Dubai Mall. It feature one of the world's largest viewing panel at 32.8m wide and 8.3m high. Dubai Mall Aquarium has more than 33,000 living marine animals, representing more than 85 species including over 400 sharks and rays combined
Amazing experience . We went to the Aquarium in the dubai mall and it was absolutely amazing... we loved it we went in and look around and saw the king croc, wow its a must visit!!

Worth visiting. Dubai Aquarium is a must see when in the Mall. It’s such an amazing sight to be walking past shops and then to see the massive fish tank and see sharks swimming around. You can view the outside of the main tank for free, however if you want to see more than that you do have to pay. There are a range of packages you can do depending on whether you want to just wander around, have a glass bottomed boat trip around the tank or scuba dive etc. We went for the basic package so this review is based on that alone.Once you pay, you are directed around the tank to the underwater tunnel. This allows you to see the fish from inside the tank. It really allows you to appreciate the sheer size of the tank (and of the fish in it). After you exit the tank you’re directed up to the 3rd floor of the mall where the rest of the aquarium is located. Your journey continues with a tour of the tank from the surface of the water. The tour guide gives you a bit of information about the filtering process, shark preservation and about jellyfish lifecycles. The talk is scripted but informative; our guide did lose his flow at one point and had to start that section again repeating his previous few sentences word for word. You get to stand in a glass box slightly submerged in the tank so that you can feed the fish (costs extra to do so) or just watch everyone else do it. Although feeding the fish sounds exciting to some people, all you do its throw pellets over into the tank and watch the fish swarm so in my opinion it isn’t worth paying for.The rest of the aquarium showcases a range of aquatic life from otters and octopus, to crocodiles. It’s a great opportunity to see a range of bizarre aquatic animals that you may not have seen before.The main attraction of the area is the crocodile that they have named ‘King Croc’. This huge crocodile has a couple of viewing areas you can have a look from so that you can appreciate how big it actually is. While we visited there was an additional exhibition on nocturnal animals showcasing hedgehogs, bats and more.
Great attraction 🐠. I wasn't inside, but I was satisfied. I saw everything what is in aquarium too. I think that ticket is too expensive for short passage between aquarium. But great attraction

Nice. It is nice to visit this aquarium, is big and they have a lot of different species of fishes, sharks and sea animals. Also you can see 2 crocodiles and penguins! The only negative thing is that it is a little bit expensive and there are a lot of people!
Amazing. Amazing, 3 times i visited over the years and always something new, new creatures and new features, the fish tunnel is rather limited but the other parts are nice
Amazing aquarium. You will be blown away by the aquarium, it is amazing with too many fish to count, rays, sharks etc, can stand here all day watching the fish.

Plenty to see and do.... We planned to visit here on our Dubai trip and didn't realize the entrance was in the actual mall, however seeing it inside the mall like a giant aquarium makes it's even a bigger attraction. There are a few tours to choose from but we picked the "researcher experience" which was quite good but kind of wished we did more. Make sure you don't miss the giant crocodile.

Just a little disappointed. In our travels we wanted to visit to mall and the aquarium & underwater zoo so we did the walk in the mall. Loved the mall! It was the largest mall I had eve been to. They had the aquarium incorporated into the mall with a very large wall of water with lots of creatures. As we paid for our tickets and were standing in line we noticed three young men that were not in line for the aquarium staring at my daughter. I asked them to stop following us and staring, but they would not. They aquarium people said there were hippos and such so we were looking for those types of animals, but we never saw them. We did take a little boat ride with a glass bottom so we were able to see the sharks and other sea creatures. We had a very lovely visit, but when we came out the other end those boys/men were waiting. They followed us everywhere even when we went outside to see the water fountain . We had to walk pass them so ask I was walking pass I said I was going to call the Police. They must have gotten the message and left. My daughter is a beautiful 16 year old and did have her shoulders showing. I had been told after this that could have been the issue so be fair warned keep a close eye on your children.

Variety of fish and sea creatures is awesome. We spent a few hours viewing the fascinating sealife. Amazing the size of the aquarium with so many stingrays, sharks, fish all sizes and colour. then there's the zoo!

Well worth a visit if you are going to the Dubai Mall. Worth booking tickets on line if possible. Great experience. The aquarium is larger than you think, the back scenes and zoo area are great to visit, the children loved the entire experience and it is well worth the money. Breaks up a lot of walking around the mall if you have time to spare.
Day outing. It is located in Dubai mall,just opp to cheesecake factory..Kid's will enjoy to see big fishes. My 2 year kid was all thrilled and excited to see these..
Amazing!. They have four different packages. I took the one which cost 120 Derhams. Very fun and I had one of the best times there. It is located in Dubai mall.
A little expensive. It is a nice aquarium, but the walk is small for the money you pay to see. You can enjoy the front of the aquarium without paying.

Thought it would be bigger. I assumed it would be a much larger area. My ten year old and I were thrilled, my 3 year old....not so much. Can't think why because there was a lot to see. It was fascinating. It wasn't very busy when we went so we didn't have to wait or hover behind people to get a closer glimpse of the animals. We got a proper photograph ( taken prior to going into the aquarium) but in all honesty don't waste your money. It's nice and bound in a leather (ish) folder but I don't think it's necessary, unless you are desperate for a memento.I would visit again, I felt my toddler being grumpy and begging to leave, robbed me of the opportunity to really enjoy it.
Aquarium in Dubai Mall. An excellent day out. The underwater tunnel is amazing and the upstairs area with the crocodile, penguins and beavers is super. Highly recommend.
A must to do and see.. Seeing is amazing. Great for all ages. The aquarium in the middle of a mall where else but Dubai. So many fish it is a sight.

Well worth the money. . It is amazing just to see from the outside, a huge glass fronted wall in the mall. Starting in the tunnel, lots of sharks rays. Going on to the zoo, far larger than expected ,lots of tanks with fish, the otters are cute.highlight the crocodile it is HUGE, film about how it was caught and brought over to Dubai. Behind the scene visit is interesting, feeding the fish you can get a bit wet. We paid for the first option 100 aed each, this was for the aquarium,zoo,back scene. You see the otters,Ray's and crocodile very well without paying more money. Would say this is a must do.

Impressive aquarium. The huge aquarium is an incredible feature in the middle of a mall. The tank has one of the biggest if not the biggest acrylic pane in the world and you don't need to pay in to marvel at it. The tunnel is nice for kids though it's very short and not much to it. There is quite a lot to see for a place built inside a mall. The behind the scenes tour is very interesting and the guide explains how the place is run and conservation efforts the aquarium is involved in.

Biggest and the best. Very enjoyable trip. Far more to see than just the aquarium. The crocodile is enormous and the Beavers aren't Beavers (much to the annoyance of an American) they are Water Rats. The array of fish is vast and the behind the scenes tour is worth going to. The staff are friendly and knowledgable. The whole visit was good value for money.
Excellent place for kids. Excellent place for kids, My kids went there with their father, 6 and 5 years old.. and were so scared in the beginning but they enjoyed it a lot

Unexpected gem in the mall. This is an amazing aquarium within the Dubai Mall, while my wife and daughter were shopping my son and I enjoyed looking at all the different fish. Don't go to the Dubai Mall without checking out this aquarium. I have only given four stars as the Atlantis aquarium is a better experience ... (but for a shopping mall this is 5*)
Amazing. It was amazing the stay near the huge walls of the aquarium during the sharks float arround in the mall.
Was worth the visit. Enjoyed visiting here was so many things to see and pleanty of time to take photos :-) can be busy at times but staff very good well worth the visit

Experience how its like to be a fish!!!!!. Had an amazing experince in underwater zoo and aquarium. Walking through the under water tunnel surrounded by specticular vivid sea creatures and blue water, took us the another world for a moment.
Awesome experience even for adults!. I can recommend that place to absolutely everyone. Interesting lesson of biology in the most exciting way! Worth every penny spent on it.

A nice trip in Dubai. Dubai Aquarium has many levels , At first I thought it wasn't worth going since we already see the fish from outside but I was surprised that there was alot to see insideFirst you walk into the tunnel that has the fish all around u with a glass that gets the pic closer you can take amazing pix Then the second level has a lot of department Different fish species, the king crocodile, penguins and very rare species for crabs , night creaturesIn addition to a part called the explorer shows you the way they preserve the food and the fish There is also a small boat that takes you a quick tour inside the aquariumVery interesting for children as well as adults You can buy it with entertainer voucher for a very good deal
Aquarium Dubai Mall. This is neat place. It was fascinating too experience the tunnel section of the aquarium and see all the marine creatures swimming around.

Weekend visit. We always enjoy going, we have season passes do do try to go ever 4 weeks. There is always something different to. On this visit, the Sharks were great, but in the zoo part several attractions were being upgraded.

Massive aquarium - great behind the scenes tour . Massive aquarium with a great range of aquatic animals. The researcher pass was good value. Make sure you ask for the behind the scenes tour as this was a highlight of the visit.
Nice option to spend time with family. . I visited Dubai Aquarium and Under Water Zoo with my family last week. Nice place to spend time with family. You can enjoy the Dubai Water fountain as well.

amazing experience. Great experience took a couple of hours and we still didn't read everything! Wonderful exhibition, especially when we went upstairs to the zoo. Saw an Australian Croc and viewed the video of his capture. Lots of amazing underwater creatures to see in easy to access tanks with clear views. Then you get to view everything from overhead as well, quite a different perspective.
Good. It was a very good place to admire sea creatures. The boat was a nice experience. I hoped there would be more interaction with the animals.

Simply mesmerising. Dubai aquarium is in Dubai Mall.We were thrilled with both awe and exhilaration at the sight of this wonderful aquarium cum underwater zoo.It has varieties of sea fish of different colours, turtles and sea creatures.Prominent among them are sharks ,unknown big-size fishes and other sea animals swimming leisurely inside the closed but huge aquarium.Most captivating is groups of colourful small fishes move together -an Eye-Catching experience. Corals of different species add glamour to it.Two three persons with snorkels and oxygen cylinders are seen move inside the aquarium . Visitors can go under a tunnel with tickets to see the aquarium atop.Under Water zoo has sea creatures ,notable among them is a huge crocodile.All types of spectators from young to old get thrilling experience here.One wonders as to how this has been constructed containing gallons of water and sea creatures.A must visit place in Dubai.

See it from the shopping centre. Yes it looks impressive when your in the shopping centre but not so much when your inside it looking outwards. Save your money and skip this. You see far more from the shopping centre which is free. The underwater zoo was average at best and if you have been to any other aquarium in the world you will see its pretty lame.

Expensive a bit. you could get the similar feel from the visit to your Hotel Atlantis, in the Palm islands. They have free access to a similar set up which is built in the concept of lost Atlantis; But if you are looking for an adventures like getting into water, this would be the best place;

New Experience. Going out Saudi Arabia, this was one of the highlights of our Trip. The place is greatly maintained, with a lot of aquatic animals together with some of the history of UAE.
Kids enjoyed all along and it was a new experience for all of us. A must go in Dubai..

Great family outing. Must visit if you are travelling with kids... Great place to see different kinds of fish, octopi, small sharks, baby crocs and other underwater marine life...expensively priced. Be warned about the group photo, initial impression of it being free is actually a cost of 140 AED ( about 2500 Rs.). In addition, you have to wait in queue for an hour or so while you wait for the cab to go back to the main city.
We didn't even go in. We spent a good amount of time standing outside just watching the huge wall of the tank with all the fish. If you're in the mall, do stop by.

Aquarium Diving. I've been to this mall and looked from the outside many times, but diving in it is a whole new experience. Being up close and personal with many species including sharks is something you will never forget. The underwater zoo also has many fish, penguins, and jellyfish,,,etc to look at and see up close with your children. I would advise anyone to try this at least once. I have a great time and my dive buddy was great!

Enjoy marine life without Sea :). You can not imagine Sharks, rays fishes, penguins and many more in world’s largest mall(Dubai mall), but Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo made it possible having thousands of aquatic animals, comprising over 140 species. The 48 meter long aquarium tunnel feels you to be alive with Sharks and rays fishes. The underwater zoo located on second level having Piranha, Seahorses, Humbolt Penguins, Crocodile, Jellyfishes, Starfishes, Water rats and many more amazing aquatic animals in 40 individual aquatic displays. The most amazing part is Glass bottom ride. Having bird eye view of all the fishes and aquatic animals on the surface of aquarium tank containing 10 million litres of water was an different experience. Overall it’s an amazing and worth visit of Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo. Tips.Don’t buy souvenirs from aquarium as they are expensive. You can get so many from local market.There are number of packages available for visit the aquarium and zoo, so choose the package wisely.
Nice. The beauty of it is something that it has been built inside the mall. You can take stairs to see many different areas of this zoo but you have to buy the tickets!

Very interesting place. It's very huge fish tank hosting thousands of fish and other underwater wildlife, its located in Dubai Mall, it has a tunnel that you can enter and see many kind of fish on the ground floor, also go to level 2 to visit at the Underwater Zoo

Amazing. Everything about the Dubai Aquarium is amazing, especially the under water zoo. I try to visit the place over and over anytime I'm in Dubai because my visit is not complete without going there.

A very unique place. Its a unique place in the heart of dubai mall. Before you enter you think its a small place because its inside a shopping mall. But believe me you need at least 2 hours to see what inside. Visit it! :)

Wonderful visit. What a lovely attraction, walk around slowly watching the large and small fish and sharks, great when under the glass tunnel as the fish swim over you. Some playful penguins were great to watch at feeding time. Huge live crocodiles in full view. This was a reasonably prices attraction.

Good but I don't recommend the "simulator" for adults. Well the family had fun, lots, the issues: The u-boat simulator is not worth a visit, in the boat ride the life jackets had a bad smell. Be aware of the kodak moment! they want to charge you 75 dhr for a photo.

Something different. By now I know Dubai likes to go big and do it like no one else has done it before or do it but better. The aquarium in the Dubai mall is something very different and worth a visit if you're there. As we didn't have a change to visit the lost chambers at Atlantis hotel we decided to get tickets for the aquarium. This included entrance to a tunnel which passed under the aquarium, a glass boat ride and underwater zoo. The tunnel was small but gave you an opportunity to get close the fish and sharks. The boat ride was very restricted to a small circle above a small part of the aquarium, I was wondering how they would have fit this in there in the first place. Also didn't see very many fish under the boat itself to take advantage of the glass bottom. The zoo was full of different species of fish, and underwater animals, this was nice to walk through. Highlight was a big alligator. I would say look into the options of the tickets before hand and see if they interest you otherwise it won't be money well spent.

Very disappointed. Whilst an aquarium and underwater zoo located in a mall does sounds very niche, considering the vastness of the mall and also the quality of the mall the aquarium and underwater zoo were dissapointing on numerous fronts. Firstly, I loved the tunnel this was very good, however signage to the underwater zoo was appalling and no wonder there seems to be quite a few people who have commented that they thought that it was not value for money just being the tunnel! The quality of the interior of the underwater zoo was poor considering the quality and vastness of the mall and could have been better designed and to a higher standard. In addition I was shocked to see a few of the animals in what I would deem unacceptable space for their breeds and size, namely some 13 beavers in a very small enclosure and also some tanks with much larger species of fish were in my opinion far too small for them and as such they were stationary as no real space to move around.. You then had much larger tanks for much smaller fish.. The 2 crocodiles were also in a very small enclosure. It just did not make sense to me and I then ended up considering the welfare of the animals that I saw rather than enjoy what I had paid for. Granted there were some unusual species there which were interesting to see. So all in all, I thoroughly enjoyed the tunnel part but would not pay to return again.

Wonderful experience, poor service!. Although the overall experience of the aquarium was fantastic, but there is almost no guidance and help throughout the experience path. Even one must find his/her way by asking passerby!

One of the world’s most diverse collections of marine animals!. Aquarium of the Dubai mall — showcases one of the world’s most diverse collections of marine animals with more than 300 species including sharks, rays, giant groupers and massive schools of pelagic fish. You can view quite a lot for free from outside or pay to access the walk-through 270-degree acrylic tunnel, which makes for an incredible close-encounter experience with underwater animals. Tickets also include access to the Underwater Zoo on the 2nd Floor. This is a menagerie of rare and unusual sea dwellers; whose undisputed star is a 5.1m-long Australian crocodile named King Croc. He is 40 years old and weighs 750kg. He's joined by his female companion Queen Croc. “Al Boom Diving” offers various add-on aquatic experiences, including a shark dive and cage snorkeling.
Fantastic. Great aquarium and even though in the middle of the mall you get the impression of being in the sea. Fantastic variety of Fisk in all sizes!

DUbai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Situated within the Dubai Mall this is a fantastic attraction for any weather and anytime of the year and if you really lucky you may also be lucky enough to watch a diver feeding the fish in the pool - it actually stands as high as two floors

A 'wow' experience!. This is the largest aquarium that I have seen in my life and that too in a mall. It offers a wide variety of fish and underwater animals. Another attraction here is the underwater zoo that has the large octopus, crocodile and many other species. I even loved the rope bridge in the zoo. The penguins in the snow look so beautiful.It was worth the visit.

great aquarium. Although the review were not good we still went in. I think that some people just assume that it is just the tunnel in the mall which yes you can see without paying. But when you go up to the upper floor you see lots more, we had a behind the scene tour which was good.

Wonderful but had bad luck. The aquarium is huge and has lot of fish, the tunnel and boat ride was awesome but we paid for another feature with was to go into a glass window in the tank but they said it was not in use.. So they gave us a 5 minute tour back door showing us the fish clinic but we were not impressed for what we had paid and what we experienced in the last feature!

Tick in the box Dubai Aquarium.. Long story short. What should be a spectacular tourist attraction was average and poorly planned. A missed opportunity. Everything in Dubai Mall is big and shiny but this attraction was a let down. You can literally stand in the shopping area and watch the best parts of the display for free. Why deal with a long queue to walk through an underwater walk way (too short) to then queue again. You are then directed up two floors on an escalator and meander through a crowded and poorly (over lit) series of tanks. The glass is dirty and very scratched. (What are the staff doing?)The large alligator is impressive but looks dead. We almost ran through there just to get out through the gift store. We had been on the red bus / big bus tour the day before and had tickets to the Atlantis (Palms) aquarium included. In my opinion Atlantis aquarium is far better, well maintained and has smaller crowds. The subdued lighting made it more of an under the sea experience.

Totally unexpected attraction ........... Located in the biggest Mall in Dubai, and probably the world, this outstanding attraction is like a jewel in the crown.Whoever had the vision to establish this attraction should be congratulated as it would rank with any similar attraction from around the world.Aside from the many species of fish and water animals from around the world, the standout is the biggest crocodile that I have ever seen. Worth the visit alone.
Aquarium Zoo. Underwater Zoo is great . It's great to see sharks and stingrays so closely. Acquisition is a superb image . I really liked it . I recommend to all!
Unbelievable . It's located in the mall.. It's unbelievably beautiful. They was so much to see and do. We spent four hours walking around and enjoying the many animals!

The best view is outside. The major drawcard of this zoo is the glass wall of the main aquarium, which looks out directly into the Dubai Mall. You'll get more thrills watching the aquatic life outside than you would inside, as the aquarium is essentially one tunnel. Unless you're REALLY keen to see the giant croc or try diving into the tank, I'd save your money on this one.

Didn't go inside. I've just seen it from the outside and I find it a very nice addition to the Dubai Mall. It's pretty impressive to see 'cause it's quite big. If you're in the Dubai Mall you should check it out, but it isn't worth it to visit just for the aquarium in my opinion (at least not for the outside view).

Ocean in the Desert. This underwater zoo was very interesting to know that they made it possible. I mean Dubia is only 105 degrees everyday so quiet intriguing to know that they've managed to keep the water from evaporating and species alive. Cool thing to visit.
Great visit. Really interesting for all kids and good value compared to anything else in dubaiWorth a visit but get 2nd level ticket

Great family experience. We enjoyed our visit to the aquarium - the tunnel was really good with heaps of sharks, rays and lots of other fish species we haven't seen before. My 4yo loved it! The underwater zoo is upstairs and has some fantastic things to look at. Allow plenty of time to see and do everything. We bought a basic package that included a tour which we ran out of time to do.

Very educational. Of course in many places in the world you can observe the underwater world. In the Dubai Aquarium you can be educated on a lot of facts that make the underwater world so interesting. Do not forget the nursery in the zoo

More than you think . It's more inside. Don't know if many people think that it is so big?It's not just a tunnel to go through, when you get upstairs you really have lots to see.My daughter really liked it and so did I.Take your time and look at the beutiful animals inside.Can be a little crowded, so go when it opens is my suggestion.

Huge. Definitely one of the best aquariums we have seen. You can actually view the aquarium from the outside (The Dubai Mall) for a sneak peep. Wherever we go, aquariums are like a must visit - and this one did not fail us. They had a wide collection of sea creatures.Before you actually get to see the sea creatures, there was a short tour on what is going on behind the scenes of the aquarium. From the breeding to the feeding to the cleaning of the site. It was an amazing experience that came with the package.Other than the aquarium, there is also a mini zoo which i guess most aquariums do this these days as they dont just focus on sea creatures.
Just view from outside. I preferred viewing from outside to going inside. Nothing out of this world about it. I think it's overrated to be honest

Can view from the outside. The aquarium is really nice especially since it is in the middle of the mall. They have a wide collection of marine animals.However, the views you get from the outside are the same you will get from the inside. The tunnel is big but can be done in 5 mins and hence the entry fee is a little expensive.

Huge sharks and stingrays - really impressive . The aquarium has a huge glass window which can be seen without paying for. You see huge sharks of different kind, stingrays and big and small fishes in all sizes and colours. It is really impressive and beautiful to be so close to these amazing animals. If you go into the aquarium you can go into a tunnel and be surrounded by all these wonderful creatures without getting wet.Furthermore the connected zoo is really nice and shows a lot of different animals. Like always in Dubai everything is really clean.
Fishy. Good experience with wide variety of fishes and other water creatures. Kids will love it. Can have so many selfies with the fishes! Must visit in Dubai!

Spend money on something else. For 100 dirham each this was pretty average and didn't meet our expectations. The underwater tunnel was large and held many varieties of fish and sharks however literally walked through in around five minutes. You can see just as much from outside the tunnel from the mall as you can inside. The underwater zoo was also part of the entry fee and while more interesting than the the aquarium its no more spectacular than any other aquarium. Wished we had of saved our money and spent it on another Dubai attraction instead.
Well Worth the Visit. A good selection of specimens well presented. Finding the Underwater Zoo after the Aquarium could be better sign posted. All in all a nice experience.

A Very Fishy Affair. Located in the huge shopping mall is this giant aquarium, you can see and take some good photos of the aquarium without having to pay. You will need to pay (or get a free ticket when you purchase a two day ticket for the sightseeing hop on hop off bus tour) if you want to go under the tunnel and up to the underwater zoo. The zoo is the highlight that has been done very tastefully which includes a large octopus, otters, penguins and crocodiles to name a few of the attractions. You can also go diving with the sea life for an additional cost.Overall it is very good.

The aquirium is good, but it is over sold. We have been to Dubai Aquarium couple of times. Kids took boat ride was exciting for them first time around with a see through floor, but nothing outstanding. the walk through the tunnel is also exciting for first timers but if you don't go through you wont miss much.

Interesting but too much tourists. Everything is in the title ! You want to be impressed, see cool sharks inside a Mall well it's possible because this is Dubaï !!! On the other side it's too crowded with tourists mainly...

Worth a visit. When we first entered the aquarium we weren't sure about this attraction but as you get further in it is very good and the underwater zoo was amazing. We didn't have time to visit the other parts but really enjoyed what we did see. We didn't have children with us but still thought is was a very good attraction.

Must do!!. The aquarium in the mall is breath taking as it is, but I would recommend paying and getting the full package. You go through the tunnel which is superb you can get great pictures. You then go on the glass floored boat which is amazing you get a wee tub of fish food and get to feed the fish, they go a bit wild and splash about at the surface of the water but such great fun. Have a look at your receipt as we paid for 4 tubs of fish food but we only received 2, a worker by chance asked us and when we said 2 he went and got us another 2 and took us to a different area and got to feed the fish again - great service!! The aquarium on its own is outstanding but the underwater zoo is amazing too so many other animals there

Fun Experience. The Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo are pretty fun to visit. The fact that they got the attraction built into their mall is a big seller. It is a little pricey to gain entrance, but if you're visiting Dubai with kids, certainly worth doing. The aquarium itself is nice, various species of underwater life to marvel at. The King Croc is also housed within this attraction, and the size of the creature itself is astounding. They've managed to create an interesting assortment of habitats between the aquarium and zoo. You could spend a couple of hours going through it. The glass bottom boat ride however was a bust...you are really just floating about the top of the water really slow, in what seems like a circle. If I knew in advance, I wouldn't have paid the extra for the simulator experience or the glass bottom boat.

King Crocodile . The aquarium isn't so large, but, contain a large diversity of marine life and exciting activities..Exhibited in a nice categorized way, with a multilingual information on a touch screen about each animal in the underwater zoo

Great for kids but way too quick. the tunnel is not very long and it is over in the blink of an eye, its great for kids and if you like sealife.Have done this a couple of times but the tunnel just seems so small and its all over way too quickly for the money, the underwater zoo is ok and again cool for the kids but as adults its not very exciting.
Great. Great place for the kids and elders but should buy tickets in some scheme,i.e. 1 for 1 free, can easily spend couple of hours in there............
Superb experience..... You can buy tickets to this attraction in combo with Burj Khalifa from their site....absolutely amazing sea world experience....the crocodile and sea horse were superb!!!

Great views and sightings. a must do specially with kids, Try buying the entatiner app, one gets excellent discounts with the same across activities. A huge variety of Marine life, great to see the Fishes from up close. one can spend a good time viewing them. There after go to the Zoo in the Mall itself, excellent collection , great knowledge sessions. Kids were fascinated and also very educative.

I Just Love Aquariums!. If you want a free view, just stand outside. This huge aquarium can be viewed inside the Mall. I bought tickets which is worth the price. You get to go inside and literally feel like you are inside the aquarium as one section of the aquarium is inside a tunnel within the entire aquarium. Having sharks and rays swim right over you is just awesome. Somehow watching fish lazily swim by just soothes me senses and takes away stress!

Lovely. It was amazing for me to see many kind of fishes as well as animals just upstairs. Lovely atmosphere and the price is quite suitable (80 aud for basic tour). It takes an hour to finish the journey. Definitelt suggested.

Great time. Visited here with my friends, we had a great time. It was strange that as we were going around we felt like little children pointing and laughing and taking selfies with sharks behind us. This is a complete must do on a visit to Dubai.

Ideal for Families. Great fun for the whole family, walking inside the aquarium and getting as close to the sharks is amazing.
Personal favourite part of the tour would be the penguins at the zoo, crazy to meet these guys in the middle of the desert.

Great for the kids. The aquarium is visible from the Mall and you don't have to pay but the kids wanted to go in the tunnel and to the underwater zoo - they enjoyed it so i guess it was worth the visit.

My Dream land. For a person fond of aquarium this is a fantasy come through , to start with the tunnel is spectacular, the aquarium above it has a varied collection of fishes, snakes, and reptiles , to top it all they have penguins too . simply an amazing place too see when you visit dubai
not great for adults. this was more for children and would not recommend if you are part of adults only group. it wasn't very interesting

Dubai Under water Zoo Aquarium + Burj Khalifa. We went on Dubai underwater zoo + Aquarium + Burj Khalifa package. It was an amazing experience with the family. We really enjoyed the under water zoo, especially the jelly fish and octupus section. It was educational for my little kid to observe the sea creatures. We really liked the architecture of how the zoo is built. It was really a good experience for me and my family.
Wonderful attraction for the family. To be so close to these underwater creatures was a bucket wish list. Highly recommend attraction time permitting.
VERY NICE AQUARIUM. I was very impressed by this indoor/mall aquarium. Worth the price. The experience was great. I recommend it.

Definitely worth paying to view it properly!!. Spending a day in Dubai Mall can be quite a lot so this is a great way to break up the day. I went on holiday with 5 other adults and we all really enjoyed it. You can spend as much time as you wish in the aquarium and then visit the underwater zoo, you can split it up. We went to the aquarium first, took a break for lunch and shopping the went to the underwater zoo later in the day. No point going all that way and not experiencing all the nice things. Cost was around 120 AED per person based on adults.

"Thousands of Species Of Fishes...". To dive the Dubai Mall aquarium will be an interesting experience to even seasoned divers. It will most certainly be an unforgettable experience to new or non-divers. The fact that you will be in a tank (albeit a giant one) full of many different species of sharks, can be a bit unnerving, if not crazy, for new divers. The common knowledge however, that sharks are typically shy creatures and tend to avoid human contact, should be of some comfort for the inexperienced. Nonetheless, the Shark Dive program at Dubai Mall is an exhilarating underwater adventure that you can experience in half-a-day, with complete safety and airconditioned comfort.

Dubai Aquarium, inside a mall.. We enjoyed this experience on our honeymoon. We coupled it with the At The Top experience and saved money doing this. The sheer size of the underwater Zoo is captivating as soon as you walk into the shopping centre and King Croc is indeed a very big Croc. It was interesting to learn about his journey to Dubai from Australia, there are also rumours of Great Whites coming, how on earth Dubai Aquarium are going to accommodate that, I don't know.

Impressive water tunnel, average underwater zoo, good back facility tour, good value. Went in to the aquarium with a little scepticism given the short tunnel walk. However, once inside the tunnel, the collection of fishes, the sand tiger shark community and other species was truly impressive. The underwater zoo is a bit underwhelming, nothing that stands out, the King croc exhibit is impressive. Back tour facility was very good, kids enjoyed feeding the fishes and the splashing and thrashing when the guide fed the Sharks. Did not do any of the snorkel or underwater scuba tours, but saw some folks seemingly enjoying it.
under water zoo. This is in dubai mall where you can spend wonderful time with your kids , very good place to see ..cheers
Very nice for adults and kids . Nice experience, be sorround of water and fishes. Very nice place to take some photos if you have time and pacience.

Average. This was not the best aquarium I have been to. We got through all the exhibits very quickly. The tour was the best part. We got to help feed the fish. I have been to way better aquariums for a lot less cost. I'd skip this in the future.

Worth visiting. We spent 3 hours here, we got the Researcher tickets. My 19 year old daughter loved this. It was the one thing she really wanted to do on our 2 day stopover in Dubai. She was not disappointed. In all honesty you would not need to spend this long, she just went really snap happy, I had to drag her out of there!

small, but good!. You can do this quick. You can spend some extra time if you want to take a dip in the water. It is right in the Dubai Mall. So a very pleasant place to eat, look at some sea creatures and spend a full day. We spent about 3 hours here. The croc was really big. The penguins were really cute.

Amazing!. Best aquarium I've ever been to! Never seen such huge fish and had the opportunity to get so close. We got the tickets that included the backstage tour which was good and very informative. Great variety of fish and reptiles there. Truly impressive
Okay to just visit from outside view. Didnt go inside the attraction but nice views from the shop floor. It situated inside Dubai Mall but if you want to visit you can pre book or pay at the door.
aquarium. Easy to find in Dubai mall.Can enjoy for free from side or buy ticket for see it from tunnel inside of aquarium

Up close and personal with sharks. Spent an afternoon here and really enjoyed it. The underwater tunnel is great and the variety of fish and aquatic animals is amazing. Learnt a lot about king and queen Croc too. Highly recommended.

A brilliant outing if you have toddlers. We always love going to the aquarium and under water zoo, whether taking visitors or just for a morning activity. Best to get there at 10am when the doors open!

Definitely worth visiting! . We had a good time here, the tunnel is great and then we went on a behind the scenes tour over the other choices that were available and learnt a lot of interesting things. The zoo section is quite interesting as well. Definitely worth visiting next time your in Dubai.

Cool underwater walk through. Really nice underwater walk through, must have been at least 20 sharks in that tank and seeing them up close was incredible. We paid extra for the boat trip but this didn't actually add an awful lot to the experience - save your money. Very cool aquarium and worth a visit
Always fun. Love the aquarium and the tunnel walk. Underwater zoo is interesting. Dont forget to see the penguins and the new crocs they just got

Good fun, kids love it. Great aquarium. Can't get much closer to sharks than this with your heart rate still within acceptable bpm limits. Neatly done, well presented, engaging staff. Bit pricey but discount vouchers generally available will take c are of this for you

Great sight in the mall. Dubai mall is huge and what more could you want than to have a giant fish tank to look at! The whole aquarium is great there is so much to do and see while in there. It well worth buying a ticket and having a look round.

Well worth a look . The aquarium is stunning, but you can pretty much see most of it from the mall. The underwater zoo however justifies the ticket price. Different marine life for the kids to see, which they can be amazed at and scared of at the same time. Makes a nice change from the endless shops in the mall.

Good fun - would recommend . It's a good aquarium and also good value for money compared to other aquariums around the world. The variety of species are good and you get the sense they are well looked after.

Amazing Aquarium. Visited Dubai for the first time and decided to meet my friends in Dubai Mall, when looking for a place to eat, i cant resist to stop and take few photos with this giant aquarium.Its just amazing how they created this kind attraction in the middle of the mall.
I like it. Aquarium is good, glass boat is amazing and underwater zoo is perfect, if you want to see this 3 area then you should buy a ticket for it because they sell various tickets.

Not your average mall.... Like many locations in the area, nothing is average about the trip to Dubai Mall and the fact that it houses an aquarium. Consider it an opportunity to entertain your child, or even yourself. Like most aquariums, there is a price that comes with the visit, and the more you want from the visit the higher the price. We did the boat ride and fed the fish, so it costs a little more. If you don't want to enter the actual aquarium, the huge tank visual to all mall visitors, is a nice addition as well,

Fabulous . Visited here after going up the Burj Khalifa and shopping in the Mall. What an experience to get up close with so many species we never sea in our waters. We had the pleasure of going behind the scenes and saw the fabulous conservation work that goes on and learnt facts we never knew about the different species in the oceans. Our guide was great and answered all our questions. Feeding time was awesome. Highly recommend a visit here.

Quite special. The aquarium is quite well developed and ranks probably just next to the Singapore one. The speciality of this one is that it is in a mall.Do check if they have combo offer with Burj Khalifa going on. They have four/five packages for different type of visitors. So read up on your preferred option before landing up at the Aquarium. At times there is a mad rush at the ticket counter and you may not get time to make the decision.In one of the option they allow you to dive as well.

Nice place. Situated in the Dubai Mall , this place offfers a great view of the aquatic life .However , one thing that I did not like ,was that, it did not seem humane to me , to cage the fish into a small area, which are used to swim in the open sea

Unique experience . Amazing! Both shopping and a visit to d aquarium. Que can be long in december with alot of tourist. But they have a very efficient service at d reception. Therefore, shorter waiting time with an usher present to keep pple goin to buy their tickets accordingly.
very good. Good experience, very pricey, but somewhere the adults like but the kids where a bit afraid of the sharks, very memorable
Probably great with children. Not the best place to visit as a couple, but I can see the educational side for children. Not the biggest aquarium I've been around and everything is an extra

A must do, especially for nature lovers and children.. . Has to be one of the best I've visited, beautiful fishes and the settings in actual aquarium is gorgeous. There are photographers available at a charge to capture every moment. The location is ideal as its set in the Atlantis hotel itself and is walking distance of the Aquapark. Makes a great day out..

Best time with family. We was here with two 15years old boys and one 8 year old boy and all three child was shocked how nice, big and amazing is this aquarium.
Aquarium is in bug shopping center so after aquarium you can shop :-)

GREAT AQUARIUM. I hate malls but Dubai has truly re-invented the experience. Each mall has "an attraction.." and the Dubai Mall (not one of many, its the name for this one) has the aquarium which is excellent in every way and unlike the (better) one at Atlantis, its mostly free
Good value for money. The zoo is spread over 3 floors in the dubai mall. It features the tunnel and the highlight of the upper floor is the giant aligator.

A welcome break and an interesting visit.. An aqarium and zoo under a shopping center sounds crazy, yet it works. The main tank is incredible but the glass is so think that photography is not viable but it is a worthwhile visit. The other animals in the zoo were well kept and well presented although the guides battled a little with their English.

Not great. Its average / above average....size wise as well as species wise.....especially when compared with other aquariums around the world.....glass bottomed boat is one special attraction....simulator ordinary....lots of varieties of jelly fish which are very nice

Under the ocean. The beauty of this aquarium is that you think that you know what you will experience how it feels inside when you look at the aquarium and the fishes from the outside but trust me it is a whole different experience on the inside !! The Sharks ,the starfish, the sea horse and the tiny glowy fishes you never thought existed. Every fish has an interesting story written next to the tank and overall it's a lovely experience ...a must if you have kinds !!

Good family fun !!. We'd heard alot about the The Dubai Mall Aquarium but how could it really be? Being slightly skeptical we paid for the basic viewing experience. It didn't disappoint. You could spend hours gazing at the the aquarium wall you see when inside the mall let alone all the stuff you pay for. It was amazing. Walking through the aquarium tunnel was spectacular. We touched starfish, got within glass thickness from two incredible crocodiles, saw some magical jellyfish and were amazed at the size of the water rats on display. A family must do.

Good to pass the time. In general I enjoyed the aquarium in the Dubai mall. However I would still prefer real zoos where you can see a lot of different animals. In this aquarium there are lots of fish, shark, jelly fish, octopus.... Also you can see real crocodiles. The sharks are not wild though.

Must see croc... and specially its feeding!. Seeing sharks just swimming over your head is a great experience! The same for the other species of sea life. Only once you go behond the scenes, you realize what was actually flowing over your head în the aquarium tunnel! The underwater zoo shows you great species from sea life like the neon fish or the clown fish. I had the opportunity to touch a star-sea, which was great. The lady facilitating that was also providing additionally details on it.The greatest thing was by far seeing the croc and even more croc feeding. This is a must when you visit the location!!

Worth visoting. It is an inexpensive interesting place to visit. Plenty of different tropical fish, otters, penguins, crocs and other animals.The best part is that the let you access the behind the scenes and see things like how they feed the animals or the Sharks eggs!
Beautiful. My daughter wanted to see this, we walked around and enjoyed the Aquarium. Highly recommended for families.

Disappointing to say the least. I am saying this because we have a much better aquarium in Cape Town where I live so this aquarium is in the mall which is impressive but it is actually just one big tank. The Underwater zoo is also very small, rather come to Cape Town and have a much better aquarium experience.
Fun Experience. Something to see in less the 45 minutes, great experience seeing different times of spices. Friendly and helpful staff.
The main aquarium is awesome. The main large aquarium is the best part of the Dubai Aquarium and in my opinion you shouldn't spent your money on extra attractions.

Fish tank? Thats not a fish tank - THIS is a fish tank!. Came across this whilst walking through the mall - this is awsome, its huge with all types of fish including large sharks and stingrays. We just ogled from the mall but its probably worth paying to go through and experience from within.

BEAUTIFUL DESIGN. Once of must to see in dubai
it is very big and very beautiful neat aquarium and millions different types of fish are there..
Not worth for 100AED. If you love sea creatures...you must go. I am not very found of sea creatures so found it Ok-Ok type. Not worth of 100AED. time required is 1 to 1.5 Hrs

A large aquarium inside a mall. visiting Duabi mall you will notice the largest indoor aquarium with the walkthrough tunnel make an incredible close-encounter experience with some of the most fascinating underwater animals on the planet
