It's also located inside the Dubai Mall which is another wonderland of shopping and people watching. Don't miss it. And it's free.

Tunnel visit is interesting. The view that is available from outside is breathtaking whereas the tunnel is very short and crowded. It is advisable to get a ticket with the combo of underwater zoo, aquarium and burj khalifa. It is a great place for children.

Family must do. A must do if you visit Dubai with the family, especially with children. Small and large fish which you can see from up close. Especially interesting is the part where you feed the fish.
Excellent. Amazing experience with Kids, one should visit this Aquarium. Specially with kids and family. Spare atleast 3-4 hours to visit this.
Indoor fun.. Unbelievable amount of sea life on display. The closer you get, one feels like you are underwater. Great photo ops.
Shocking. It's great, it's not very long but then again how many aquariums do you see in a mall!! Very nice must see

Nothing fishy about this place..... ...... Just a fantastic attraction that is well worth your time! There are a range of options available which will help you decide where you most want to focus your time, the cheapest is 100AED the most expensive 200AED. I was running a little short on time with only an hour and a quarter left so I picked the 'researcher' tour, at 100AED. It was a great experience and I'm really glad I did it. You start your tour with the towering tank and underwater tunnel. The fish, stingrays and sharks are plentiful. You can see so much going on, especially from inside the tunnel. Then it is up to the second floor for the underwater zoo. WOW! The habitats look great. There are dangerous fish to see, otters, some hairy beavers which were all wet from a recent dip, crocodiles, sea horses, frogs, jellyfish.... The list goes on. My tour also included a behind the scenes look at how the aquarium operates. It was great to get a look out the back and see how baby sharks are born, crocodiles are hatched and the fish fed. The crocodiles were impressive. The whole aquarium is well presented and informative. If you're in the mall dive in to this experience.
Nice sharks. Nice sharks. I'll definietly come back there. Also I can recommend the underwater zoo and the nutrias :) Really nice animals :)
Only worth if you discounted vouchers. As we were a large family we used the entertainment vouchers, buy one get one free, otherwise it's not worth it for the full price.
Best aquarium . This was the best aquarium I've visited. It has amazing aquariums and a lot of attention to detail has been considered. Kids would love it and loads of photo opportunities.
Huge Aquarium. One of the must visit places in Dubai/Dubai Mall. Peeple of all age group will love to see different kind of fishes in this huge aquarium

A wonder worth seeing!. I love the Dubai Aquarium in the Dubai Mall, there's huge stingrays, a variety of sharks, groupers and so many other species of fish to see. There's also a selection of experiences to pay extra for such as scuba diving in the tank with the sharks, certainly worth considering!

Good for kids. We booked before arrival but the check in was very slow.
The actual aquarium was great and the tunnel good fun...even my teenage daughter enjoyed it!
The underwater zoo was ok but could have been better.

Great fun!. The entrance is awe inspiring. You can see the world's largest single piece of acrylic which houses nurse sharks, huge stingrays and the odd diver! The animals inside include otters, penguins and of course King Croc! Currently 40 years old and over 5m, he is quite a sight. We were able to touch starfish and happened to pass as the giant octopus was being fed, so also touched him! We also stood over the main aquarium which holds 10 million litres of water! We bought the cheapest ticket and it was well worth it, we didn't feel as though we missed out on anything. The animals appear to be well fed and housed properly.

Close encounters. we got free tickets to go in on entering you have to have a photo taken even when you say you don't want one.it was good walking through the tunnel&you also go to under water zoo we found the Beavers & otters very small and also some others also.dont think I would go again&eglantine it was free

Tunnel view. When visiting the Dubai Mall, one should also try to find time to visit the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo (as well as the Burj Khalifa). With one ticket, you can avail of several activities - from viewing the "Aquarium Tunnel" to the underwater zoo, or alternatively take a trip on a glass bottomed boat or see what the scientists do to keep the aquarium going. And for the brave and gutsy, taking a dive in the cage with the sharks! Whatever you do, you will surely have a great time!
Dare to go underwater diving. Those who want to experience underwater diving... there are eels, too so wonder if the suit is short resistant :)
OK. No great shakes really. Good big crocodile but otherwise quite ordinary. Good to do if u have time in the mall. Ticket combines two attractions so make sure you have time.

Okay experience . It is good to visit if this is the first such aquarium you will be visiting . If you have already visited any such aquarium in past then you may want to skip this one. Please do not get fascinated by the glass bottomed boat because it was monotonous. They have multiple packages. I will recommend the basic one if you really wanna visit. I can't comment on the shark dives because I could not try them. Also, if you are along with kids and you wanna go fr the encounters as encounter with crocodile then try gng in afternoon as these have timings.

A short walk through the tunnel. I was rather disappointed tn the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. I believe this may be since I am from Florida and have seen many Aquariums in the past and this was nothing new to me. Yes, I did take pictures out of respect for the developers.
Dubai stopover vacation . Sharks in the middle of a mall? Whoever heard of such a thing? Great experience to see such a diverse range of marine creatures in such a well organised and compact space.

Nice aquarium. This is a nice aquarium, especially with kids inside Dubai Mall. The sheer size of the single pane of glass through which you can see the whole thing is amazing. You can enjoy this part for free, from a distance though. However, if you pay extra, they let you walk through an tunnel and then get a visit to the under water zoo. The star attraction in the zoo is the huge salt water croc. There are quite a few activities as well that you can do, if you pay up. This includes feeding the sting rays, diving etc. The cheapest paid package, which lets you walk thru the tunnel and visit the zoo, IMHO is a bit expensive at 100 dirhams. All other activities are over priced as well, in my opinion. I have been to bigger and better aquariums for the same cost or may be cheaper. That does not mean this is a mediocre facility. Considering what they have done and how well they have kept this place and being in Dubai, this is a must visit. Just that, IMHO, it may not be all that worth paying up, because you are getting an amazing view of the aquarium from the public viewing place.Would I go back and pay again, NO. Would I go watch from the public viewing area, DEFINITELY YES.
Nice and air conditionned. Nice moment in particular if the outside is very hot (summer time). Clean - pleasant - not too expensive

Best Aquarium Ever. I've been to many aquariums in several US cities, and the Dubai Aquarium overshadowed them all. The largest tank is visible from within the Dubai Mal without buying a ticket, but if you buy a ticket you can walk through the tunnel on the inside. The biggest sharks could only be seen well through the tunnel, because they liked to hide out under the rocks. While walking beneath them, you can see rows of sharp teeth inches from your face. The fish like to swim directly toward you, probably because they think you're going to feed them. This allows for some great photos, just be sure to set your camera to shoot through glass and cut glare. Upon exiting the tunnel, you can go upstairs to see the smaller exhibits. This is where things get even more exciting. The very first exhibit is a tank full of piranhas from the Amazon River. If you look closely, you'll notice the bones of some larger animal in the bottom of the tank. The decoration around each exhibit adds to the whole experience. One of my favorite exhibits was the fish that squirt water into the air to knock flies off a food plate suspended over the tank. Be ready to get wet if you visit them during feeding time. There is a large and very active octopus, several species of jellyfish, and giant rats. I elected to do the otter encounter. You can add an encounter to your ticket for a little extra, and you can choose between 3 types. The otter encounter allowed me to go behind the otter exhibit with the zookeepers, where I met Cato and Diego. Those little guys put on quite a show. The zookeepers were extremely knowledgeable and friendly, and you can feed and pet the otters carefully.Before leaving the aquarium, you'll see the King Croc; the largest crocodile in the world. This croc is like the size of a small car! You can get a feeling of how terrifying it would be to run into one of them in the wild. It absolutely looked like Godzillla. The croc was the perfect way to end the visit.

Good Experience. Was looking forward to this visit, but was quietly disappointed. The ticket collection point was badly managed, if at all. No one to help direct online ticket holders, no line to speak of, so people just kept trying to push in or left confused. The entrance points were disjointed, behind the scenes tour not clearly signalled, glass bottom boat had air bubbles underneath, so can't see anything. King croc feeding was disappointing, as they didn't bring a spare chicken when the feeder dropped it before the king croc got up to eat it.The Otto feeding was the only highlight of the visit.Overall, not the excellent experience I was hoping for.
best place. this was amazin .kids luvd the place defo will go again .so much to see couldnt get anybettr realy happy ovrall 10/10

If the kids love sharks, this is a must see. A great stop inside the mall. While not a mega aquarium like the new Georgia Aquarium in Atlanta, this is a must see if the kids love sharks. Been here on several trips and it can get crowded at times. I find it very relaxing watching this fish. There is a large variety of aquatic life with a top notch shark exhibition.
An ok aquarium . I didn't spend too long here maybe about 20 minutes but it would be good if you had children. Very similar exhibits to The Deep in Hull, UK.
zoo. there are alot of different spieces to sea , I have seen first time a big elegator , and King Crabs , scary but really definetly go if not you miss a lot of things
Incredible. So enormous. Didn't expect to see such a gigantic underwater zoo in the midst of a shopping mall. Hugh fish and even scuba divers. Amazing attraction.
Different. To see the marine life inside t h e mall is jaw dropping.even though the fish should be free to swim in the ocean.

Very impressive - go early to avoid the queue. On ground level of the Dubai mall this is one vast aquarium with a large number of impressively sized fish including sharks and rays. There is a tunel though and under the aquarium which can be entered with a ticket which allows access to the underwater zoo also. The aquarium can be viewed for free however. If you want access to the zoo go early as the queue is also "impressive" by midday!
good place for visitors. good place for visitors with lot of varieties there. well maintained. clean, ideal for families to enjoy

I like the fish. We didn't go inside the Aquarium, but did enjoy watching the fish from the mall. Aquariums are always my favorite. I've heard, however, from some others that this one is not so highly recommended. Anyway, I still liked watching various fish swimming in the huge tank from the mall.
what a view. I spend more than one hour just looking at this aquarium in the Dubai Mall. It's just fantastic to see the undersea world in front of you
Good but small. Very good and adventurous place but small. I liked the shark. No much species, anyway a must see in Dubai, it's usually crowded you have to go in the morning to find space for photos.
Exlporer experience. We booked Explorer ticket & we had a very good experience, spend almost 2 hours. Just amazing view & rare collection,
Dubai Mall. It's really crowd! The place is nice but it shouldn't be inside of a mall which makes it more crowd.

Amazing to be inside a mall, range of things to see, interactive.. When shopping in the mall it is very temping to pop into the aquarium in order to go through the under-water viewing passageway. The price was 100AED each. The first section of walking through the aquarium is great, amazing view of the sharks and fish in the water so close to you. You get a talk about the feeding of the sharks etc. which doesn't last long but quite informative. I think you can pay extra to actually feed the fish (but didn't seem worth it as you're just throwing it into the tank). Walking around the aquarium you can be as slow or fast as you wish. There are posters of information about each fish etc. and the range is very impressive. The large crocodile, penguins and octopus stood out to me. Great to do at any time of the day with friends and family. There are little coffee areas as you walk round if you need a rest! I would recommend but not more spectacular than other aquariums around the world (apart from it being inside a mall!).
A pleasant Sight. A good viewing of the marine life. A cool experience. It is lovely looking at the amazing beauty of marine creatures.
Kids Loved it. Very well laid out aquariums, not enormous so quite expensive for a small trip but thoroughly enjoyable.

Nice a with clean clear water and plentry of marine life. Too my kid for a tour of marine animals and it was amazing, the numerous aquariums they have with all the different marine animals made it a very nice tour.
Note: Take your time to walk through.

Tunnel of fish. You wouldn't expect to see this aquarium where it's located but the environment that's been created is magnificent. The Sharks patrol the waters with Ray's and many other specimens joining them. There is an opportunity to walk through the area via a tunnel and be surrounded by the Beauty.

Wonderful aquarium if you enjoy watching fishes. The aquarium is easy to reach for many people because it is in the Dubai Mall adjacent to Burj Khalifa. So while you are getting familiar with this mall, you can also find it easily. Sincerely, I did not enter the aquarium, but watched it from outside, where you can see great fishes. If I had more time though, I would definitely visit, and I would suggest to visit if interested in maritime life and animals. Plenty of big exotic fishes.

Awe inspiring . Wow, just wow. All of our jaws were dropped from the moment we walked in, until we left. The fishes on display and are some we have never seen or heard of! Immaculate venue too. Highly recommended

enjoyable & worth it esp if you have kids. The tunnel was short, so don't rush out. Take as much time to look and take photos as you can. You then go upstairs for further displays... Check out the feeding time, they have talks about the animals as well. There are several fee level, I paid for the glass bottom boat ride & the underwater simulation. I thought the simulation will be similar to the Legoland Windsor attraction which had the small submersible go into the tank. No, it's just animation - it can only be enjoyed by small kids. The boat ride was worth it. For 10 aed you can feed the fish, which my kids did. The lady guiding the boat knows her stuff and was accommodating.We stayed for the crocodile feeding. I recommend you go to the Mezzanine Level where (IMHO) the view is better. I will not recommend the "crocodile experience". You don't get to feed the croc yourself, you will only feed the birds in the enclosure, unless that's what you want.

Nice . Very nice but if you are going to stay at atlantis then no need to waste your time and money. Otherwise you must watch once. As we also stay in atlantis these things was also there provides to us complementary.
Amazing Experience. A multitude of Different fish species and other underwater animals within a close proximity was a wonderful experience. Again the accessibility is amazing.

I really enjoyed myself.... I enjoyed the personal tour that we had of the aquarium. We were able to feed the fish and ride in the glass bottom boat. Were also was there during feeding time for the extremely large alligator. The ice cream that we bought was delicious. I felt like a kid again.

Wow.. The entrance fee of roughly the equivalent of £25 seemed a bit steep but included a glass bottomed boat ride. But it was worth every penny, we spent nearly 3 hours in there all together and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. There is a huge variety of things to see.

Must see if you're in Dubai. Although me and my husband had no plan to visit Dubai Aquarium, We decided it at the last moment to come back to the place where we had our first date in Dubai 8yrs ago.. as We've visited Osaka Aquarium Kayukan in Osaka,Japan few months back. If you are in Dubai and are a first timer for visiting aquarium for an experience you can visit it from outside by walking around the aquarium in the mall and just admire the fishes and aquatic creatures from the outside. However, its affordable and fun for the family and It's not just about aquarium tunnel you'll get to see the underwater zoo, bottom-glass boat, etc., Very clean, nice, tidy and organized.A must visit and Highly recommended to everybody.
Good for kids. It is very very flashy place. All the setup is very carefully organized must visit pls. Bring your kids and spend the day..

Great experience. The aquarium is huge and has lots and lots of fishes and other aquatic creatures. You could spend hours there watching the fishes. Great for children, they were amazed by the various species.

Great half day activity. This is a great half day activity. We went in January and the lines were not long. We purchased a pass that allowed a behind the scenes look at the aquarium as well as the regular pass and this was worth it. It is actually quite a big aquarium and there is a lot to see however it would not take more than half a day to enjoy all there is to offer here.

A fantastic zoo!. The zoo is well maintained. The sting rays, sharks, big sized fishes, etc are in good numbers and you get a close view of them. Taking pics would seem futile as the clarity of the pics are compromised, but capturing them with your eyes is a better idea. The monster Croc was my favourite display and truly i haven't seen such a big croc in my life. The zoo inside Dubai mall is a must visit for sure and worth your time and awe.

Fascinating Aquarium in Dubai Mall. Although I had plan to Visit the Dubai aquarium I dropped it at the last moment..as I ve visited Aquaria KLCC in Kuala Lumpur and SEA Aquarium in Sentosa Singapore few months back. The aquarium can be well visited and admired from outside by walking around the aquarium the mall. If you are a first timer for visiting aquarium for an experience you can visit it definitely.. Else you can just admire the fishes and aquatic creatures from outside. Hence I went to visit Lost Chambers Aquarium in Atlantis Palm Jumeirah resort the very next day. You can see tourists and visitors gazing around and taking selfies.

Must visit for children.... This place has lots to keep kids and adults occupied for a few hours. Viewing sharks, rays, penguins, octopus, otters, crocs and fish from different oceans of the world was a great experience.

Dubai Aquarium . Aquarium of this kind in the mall is very special, most of it can be viewed from outside. Basic package costs 100DHS, which allows you to go through a tunnel. Interesting for young kids or for those who hasn't been to a similar kind of attraction. I am not sure if it's worth the money you pay for the entrance!!!
Really nice. This was great. Very peaceful and I would do again if I went back. It was amazing to see it in a shopping mall. We don't have anything like that in the US that I know of.

Nice. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo, managed by Emaar Entertainment, brings the marvel of the ocean floor to life. The aquarium, located in The Dubai Mall, showcases one of the world’s most diverse collections of marine animals with more than 300 species including sharks and rays.

Beautiful..... The aquarium is beautiful beyond words...with an array of fish to gaze at..Unfortunately couldn't take more photos since my phone battery was down.One of the finest experiences I had during my stay in Dubai...must go back!!

Free from in the Dubai Mall or pay to go through the tunnel. Amazing range of really big fish in a huge aquarium. This is by far the most impressive free aquarium I have ever seen. Yes, you can pay to go through the tunnel but I didn't because it is fantastic just from the mall

fabulous place. Loved it here. It is hard getting your head around the fact that there is an aquarium in the mall. Its a stunning display, fish Ive never seen in my life before. My son was totally gobsmacked. Really good display

I love the aquarium in the dubai mall. . Took my neice to the aquarium inside of the dubai, mall. She lives in dubai. But never saw it inside before . Untill my husband and i took here. Here are some great pics.
Fantastic. Very interesting , especially for kids. The different species of sea creatures was amazing. My grandson loved the Sharks.

Must see. Great place to visit if your a child or adult. Check out the anourmous fish tank which you can walk through and view them swimming around and above you. The underwater zoo well worth a visit, it has a vast variety of animals to see in their semi natural habitats, all in very good conditions. Watch out for the crocs being fed, check feeding time.

Underwater Aquarium. Saw this at the Dubai Mall. Took some photos from outside.Fascinating in the middle of a Mall. Didn't go through the tunnel but happy with what we saw from the outside and it was free

Brilliant . Situated in the worlds largest shopping mall is the worlds largest aquarium. Not the longest of trips, it only took us about 15-20 minutes at the most to walk through, but you get incredible views of underwater life. Our ticket also gave us access to the underwater zoo on the next level which is worth a visit too. You are free to roam at your own pace so you could spend longer here if you wished.
Interesting. Went finally after 4 years living in Dubai with the wife and my 2yr old. Really interesting since there also the bugs, night crawlers, a huge crocodile and many other cool creatures
Under water experience at the best. If you cannot visit Atlantis aquarium, this is an alternative or trail version of Atlantis. Worth being atleast once. Highly recommended.
Its a nice visit . Its nice and worthy a vist.It could also be viewed from outside...some parts of of courseNot much to see inside though.

WOW Attraction. I literally could not stop saying 'WOW' every few minutes here! You will see fish and animals you have never ever seen before and so close up and in such beautiful surroundings. This is a superbly well thought out attraction, well worth the entrance fee and perfect for all ages.

Great place for kids. I took my son there and it is amazing how they have built all this and gathered all these exotic sea creatures in one place. Information is on each display label. Worth exploring with kids to see life they can't otherwise encounter
good and learning experience. While walking in the tunnel, we experienced the sea creatures, really had a feel good factor. Wonderful and a must visit

Great for younger kids. The most impressive part of the aquarium is the giant tank that you can see from within the mall, full of fish, sharks and marine life. It's beautiful- worth going to check it out.It costs around 100dhs per person to get in- for the basic package.You walk through a glass tunnel, watching the fish swim all around you, which is pretty special. Then you have to take an escalator or lift upstairs to the 2nd floor to continue. There are water rats, otters and many other fish to see, plus and night animals section and an enormous crocodile (which we found pretty funny as he just lies there doing nothing whilst they play a rahhhh noise sound track to make him scary) he probably would be scary if he got mad though. He's huge.

Interesting. I was actually recommended to go to the Atlantis aquarium, but my trip was short so I visited the one in Dubai Mall instead. You go to the front desk and get tickets for what experience you want and the aquarium and underwater zoo are a package. Many people are standing outside to look and take pictures instead of going in as they can also see the fish from outside, but being inside and seeing them from either side and on top of you is a nice experience. They take your picture once you go in and they have it in a frame and ask you if you want it after you leave. I do not know how much it costs as I did not take mine. The most prominent fish to see are the sharks and the stingrays as they swim around the aquarium. It is a very short walk, so you can finish in about 10 minutes if you stop to take pictures and videos. If you are really into it, you can stay for as long as you wish, but I think I finished in 10 to 15 minutes. The underwater zoo was nice with a lot of different types of fish, frogs, and turtles. The sea turtles were my favorite to watch. This is a nice family activity. I went alone, but it seemed that families with younger children were enjoying it the most as the children were so excited and curious.
Good. Good and nice fishes there. Must think we are in middle of sea nice work dubai.I reccomed for travellers

I wouldn't recomend this place to be honest and I'm not one to complain 😔. Welcomed by very rude busy staff who I can only imagine were on commission to be fair , issued with upgraded tickets without being asked , they simply took our money and gave us behind the scenes tickets .... And no change , we were headed around in an overcrowded pack and could not hear a word that was being said , we lost our guide after 10 mins and wandered off on our own , not great , you can see most of it from the mall anyway ! Save your money

Nice place. I visited this place with my Mom and brother. They enjoyed a lot. big marine creatures exhilarated them for sure. The Zoo and glass bottom boat was added bonus and it was really amazing experience in total.
What a view. Myself and 4 children of the group spend close to 2 hours watching and enjoying at the aquarium. It is simply amazing.

Awesome. Special piece of engineering for all to enjoy free of charge. There is a section you can pay to go in which is well worth it and highly recommended. A must see attraction from the many in Dubai.

i did the whole thing. boat ride and walking though the tunnel. if you buy a two day unlimited city tour bus ride. then you can get this attraction for free. otherwise, i think it was about $50 or so.

A surprise. The Aquarium in the Mall is quite a surprise and a pleasant one.
The size and the fish are amazing and worth a visit but I did think that the entrance price of equivalent to GBP £20 per person was steep.

Serene and breathtaking at once - pay for the boat ride!. This is what it feels like to be mesmerized. This is a huge tank. A 150 feet long. With thousands of fish ranging from massive sharks to big schools of other fish and elegant Rays...do yourself a favor and pay the extra bucks for the boat ride. You won't regret it. AFTER you've paid for the inside visit, come back again and again to stand outside the massive viewing window and meditate...the viewing window is Free

over priced, but interesting. The tunnel in the aquarium is quite short but you do get a close up view of all the fish. They can all be seen for free from outside. The underwater zoo is ok, but isn't a real aquarium,(can't touch starfish for example). full price is very expensive, we did get a 2 for 1 voucher in the entertainer magazine so was reasonable
Must visit. If you are visiting the dubai mall the aquarium is located not far from main entrance. Free visit and a great attraction to visit with family to have a look around. My babies loved it!
Good experience!. We enjoyed the aquarium however it wasn't really what I was expecting. It is mainly aimed at children! If you have free time I would suggest visiting but not top priority!

Dubai Aquarium & underwater zoo. Before you go in you get a great view of the fish from out side. Then comes the tunnel which is great seeing everything from below. Then you go up to level 2 for the zoo the otters are great fun when they are being feed and so are the penguins. The croc,s were big and then you have the spider crabs and various other water creatures.
Amazing Place. You have to see it to believe it. We visited this place last year and it took our breath away. The visit was worth every fil we spent. Had a wonderful time.

Underwater experience without getting your feet wet!!. Fascinating experience. You get a really up close and personal view of a variety of aquatic species from all different angles. Great to be in amongst the Sharks and large Ray's. You get the feeling that they make the effort to come and observe you and not the other way around.

Over priced no value for money. This is way too expensive kids like it I liked it but not worth cost of ticket. very nice big sharks and all sorts of other fishes could be better. The security guards need cheering up they look so miserable and can be rude.

Great visit and learning experience. We went to see the aquarium and the underwater zoo. I was well impressed by the 'trip' to the behind the scenes that showed us how they looked after fish, grew fish food and even looked after sand shark babies in the eggs! Really impressive.Visit to the underwater zoo was excellent as well with the super croc being the star of the show. He is huge and fierce, so it's amazing to learn his story.
True ocean view. if you want to see the shark, sting-ray, dragon fish and all kinds of fishes you see on Natgeo wild, then bring yourself to this Aquarium. Truly unbelievable...
Unusual. Crazy to see an aquarium inside of a shopping mall.. The tunnel is very small in comparison the the zoo which is quite big!
Relaxing visit. This is an impressive aquarium for a mall. It's worth the trip, especially if you have kids. I enjoy just standing at the railing upstairs and watching the fish. It is relaxing.
Nice place. Nice visit if u like but the night creatures section is the bestI liked penguins and the king crocodile
One of the largest aquarium. Located inside Dubai mall. Dubai aquarium is definitely a place to visit. With the display of more than thousands of sea creatures, this is a must visit place in Dubai
Great time with kids. If you have toddlers and aaa lovers, this is a must do in Dubai. They have so many varieties of fishes and good education for kids to see the variety of Fishes..
Really good and kids will also enjoy . Me and my wife visited the aquarium. It was really good. The aquarium is really huge and lots of sharks in side there too. Tickets were around £40 each.
Tunnel. Amazing tunnel with big fish and most near. Little prize for visit this attraction and little zoo with animal. And all this into a first Mall to the world
Bizarre but good. Not only is it huge you can also go in a glass bottom boat on top of the tank & feed the Sharks!! Braver people can actually scuba dive in the tank or even feed the Sharks!!!
Great attraction in Dubai Mall!. It was only 100AED (£20) per person for the "basic" package which allowed entry in to the Aquarium Tunnel and the Underwater Zoo. Definitely worth it!
An Ok Aquarium.. I had expected more of red sea life, and also because I had seen so many pictures I was very excited to go here but I was not at all the size I had imagined.

Nice Activity. Many people gather in front of the underwater zoo in the mall because it offers similar views of the ones you pay for. It is impressive but you can take pictures without paying for entry. The other part of the activity is up the escalator and it offers nice views of sea-life. You're even able to pet a live starfish. There are other experiences that you can have, but they cost more. This was a nice activity, but I feel a bit overprice.

Perfect Aquarium. This one of the most aquarium I never seen before it was perfect viewing especially if you have kids I'm sure they will enjoy it much because me and my fiance we are very much enjoyed it.
amazing. the giant aquatic creatures and roof touching aquarium were marvellous. a walk through the underwater zoo with glass walls was spell bounding
Amazing sights in a mall!. Fantastic setting. Well presented. Excellent value with further opportunities to explore the background or take a glass bottom boat . Do not miss this beautiful aquarium.
The biggest aquarium all over the world. The biggest aquarium two floors hight. Wonderfull scenes from outside. Wonderful kinds of fishes. You take a ride there. You'll really enjoy
good experince. its a good experience but expensive. you can see a super big aquarium with many fishes. its fun and nice

crocodiles, bats and owls impressed me. at the aquarium, seeing fish, sharks, jellyfish, octopus... would not surprise u. seeing 2m long crocodiles, bats and owls surprise me a lot. never seen them be4 in my life.there's an education guided tour (around 20 mins), included in the pkg. the guide showed me the labs, kitchen (for preparing food for sharks and fish), tanks for shark eggs and baby jellyfish, and demonstrated fish feeding. amazing!!!

Well worth the visit. The aquarium is so large and visible from the Mall that you may think I've seen everything just by walking past it. You would be wrong. You see so much more actually I visiting and there is so much to see. The underwater zoo is excellent with a huge alligator (and I mean huge). The behind the scenes tour is great- prepare to get splashed at some point. Well worth the visit.
Great experience. Costs a tenner to walk under sharks, wraps and loads of big fish. It is well worth doing as the view is better than from outside..

awesome place, must take kids if you are in dubai. Awesome place to be, the experience is too good of being inside an aquarium. This is the biggest aquarium in the world and a great place to get your self clicked. The glass bottom boat ride is nice. you an hour to get the whole thing done. don't miss the fossil park.

Awesome. Can't really describe the aquarium good excuse to put on a bucket list
You can arrange to put on s wet suit and swim with the fish if that 'lights your candle'

Great Aquarium.. As with everything in Dubai it is one of the biggest free standing aquariums in the world with over 10 million gallons of water. A guided tour is included ours was a Mo Farah (lookalike). Try to hang around for feeding time

It is ok!!. The tunnel and other things they offer are not good. Glass bottom boat is not worth it and also the simulation. Only the aquarium is good. For that I am not sure whether the entry fee is worth.

Dubai Aquarium - A must see in Dubai. Wonderful
Kids really enjoying ....
First time for boys to see so much if sea life in the comfort of a Mall
Good for young ones and elderly to stay only in basic activities as adventures can be taxing for them

So...so. Some of the statistics about this aquarium are amazing!But fish are fish.The behind the scenes breeding/feeding bit was interesting I suppose.The actual rest of the zoo was pretty average.I far preferred the Atlantis aquarium (free with the Big Bus Tour when we went)Yeah it was OK. Costly for a walk through a tunnel, upstairs for a tour around the feeding/breeding area, then around water animals in a zoo like environment.

Astonishing. We had heard about the Aquarium in the Dubai Mall so sought it out - absolutely amazing as we turned the corner in a shopping area to be confronted by such a huge tank with many varieties of fish swimming about in what are excellent conditions for captive fish. We took the 'free' option of walking around the area, including the level up which gives a different perspective, as you could see plenty varieties of large fish including rays and sharks - a real bonus to find this in The Mall and we enjoyed watching for quite a while.
Dubai aquarium. This is the biggest aquarium in the world also the most beautiful from my point of view i think you don't need to pay money to enter the aquarium you can see everything from out side

Oh yes!!! it is wonderful. It is insider dubai mall and nearly 60% of its part is free for all. I suggest to have free view rather then going for ticked as it is less than 100 meters of walk inside after paying a handsome ticket charges

Average and expensive... Too crowded..over rated..expensive..huge water tank with fish..thats basically it..inside Dubai mall..young kids will enjoy..only once enough to see to be checked on your list..

Nice. A lovely place, it is interesting to see the fish from outside and inside the tunnel. The underwater zoo is great, with lots of different types of fish, otters, crocodiles and penguins. Only reason this is a four star and not five star review is that I think it is a little on the expensive side. I do think you should visit the place, though. It is worth it.
Nice . The aquarium is nice. Located on the Dubai mall. It's not free. Prices start from 100 Drms. It could be A Bit more realistic..And the gift shops need to improve!

A big tunnel.. Then it's finished.. . I was really curious before about this big aquarium.. I'm thinking what was inside.. Of this big aquarium.. Then when i experienced.. I asked to myself.. "That's it?!.. It's finished?!"..

Expected more. Apparently this aquarium is one of the largest aquariums in the world, But i found it very small. It is a tunnel 48 metres long where you walk inside the tank. It was beautiful, but I expected more. I have been to many other better aquariums in the world. Take your time in the tunnel, because you can walk past in 30 seconds and its over.

Fantastic experience. After seeing the Burj Khalifa we went into the Aquarium and underwater zoo. Being in Dubai we expected the aquarium to be the biggest, and it was certainly impressive having placed it slap bang in the middle of the worlds largest shopping mall. Without buying a ticket you can see most of the fish from within the mall, the ticket gets you access to the underwater tunnel which gives you a closer look at the fish. Very impressive, but was maybe expecting a little more from the Aquarium.After leaving the tunnel you have to go up two flights of escalators in the mall to the underwater zoo. This was a great way to spend an hour, so many different types of animals and fish and the habitats that they have created was stunning.Check out the King Croc - definitely one not to be missed.The only down side is that you are in the middle of the Dubai Mall and have to walk a long way to get to the taxi rank, otherwise very good.

A decent experience. The main highlights of this visit are the under water tunnel and the king crocodile.. We took a basic researcher ticket (100 AED) as we were short of time.. However, we still ended up spending 2+ hours here.. Interesting place of you are accompanied by kids.

Experience under the sea. Enjoyed the Dubai Aquarium. got to see a lot of rare species of fish, the penguins were too cute and very playful. The feeding of the otters was a funny thing to watch. Had a lovely time

Fun but $$$. A neat attraction, especially wandering through the tunnel. We ended up with free passes as part of the hop-on hop-off type we took otherwise it's unlikely we would have spent the money on the actual entrance fee. Lots of the display is freely available in the mall.
Too crowded. The ques to get into this attraction was enough to put me off. The Mall itself is good but the aquarium was too crowded.

Not something that cannot be avoided. This Aquarium is situated inside the Dubai Mall and houses marine and desert species with a lot of information about them. It is huge and has various sections for different marine varieties.
Although it is a good place to visit, I do not place it on a highly recommended list while travelling to Dubai.

Just fantastic. A must if you have kids (or even if you don't), we purchased a ticket that included a backstage tour which although very quick they threw in feeding some of the large fish which we all enjoyed and got very wet!

Amazing experience. The Aquarium is in the Entertainer and we got a combo ticket that includes the Tunnel and Underwater Zoo. It was our first visit to an aquarium and it was a great experience. Superbly designed and a large variety of marine animals. Definitely worth a visit.

Disappointed. Hopefully we had a free ticket.
We Aquarium is nice but really small... it's just a tunnel...
The underwater zoo is small and the smell inside is quite strong.
We visited many aquarium and underwater zoos around the world, and this one was really disappointing.
Dubai Aquarium in Dubai Mall. The aquarium is fantastic not only for kids but also for elders. You can see various kinds of fish. The ticket is sold on the entrance.

Impressive!. This is a great experience for family with kids. Our daughter loved it to pieces. We took the basic tour as the other activities were not suitable for a 3yo. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable throughout the visit. We had a tour of the upper level of the aquarium and got to feed the fishes (need to pay an extra for this but is only 10 dirhams). The tunnel underneath is literally breathtaking. I would really recommend it.
Nice experience. A good experience specially for children. One can enjoy aquarium, mall,burj khalifa and dubai fountian all at same day with a dinner at night.

Dubai Aquarium. Its good when you see various types of Marine Animals like Sharks, Mantra Ray, etc.. in middle of mall with height of more than 1st floor and dubai mall also have snow skating park in it
Good for kids. After Burj Khalifa, visiting Aquarium & Underwater zoo was taxing it is a lot of walk:(, however kids loved it and the experience is amazing, well defined and informative.
Really good. Walking underneath sharks and other fish was amazing it was really good and you could take lots of photos and was told many things by a guide what was very interesting .
OMG!!. Simply awesome. Cannot believe how they have built this. Its free to watch from the outside, but pay the extra 50 AED and go thru the tunnel. Well worth it.

rip off. once again rip off you pay to get in with one thing to do then loads more to do anything else you can stand outside and still see all the fish all they what is your money in Dubai dont go there .

Unique experience. This was my first visit to any kind of such aquarium. And my wife and I were blown away. The tunnel was a brilliant experience and to see the collection of water species was amazing. The ticket prices were a bit high, but we have to accept that it is Dubai and this is an unique experience.The souvenir shop was also a bit on the costly side vis a vis the size of the souvenirs
Under water world in a mall. Dubai mall has everything including the aquarium. Very well done and plenty to see. Allow your self a good hour to get around this if not longer.

Not as great as Singapore or KL, but the giant croc makes it worth it. I've been to many such aquariums - like those in Kuala Lumpur, in Singapore and in Hong Kong. This one, as compared to those, is average, and comparatively smaller. Does have a wide variety of fishes, and what made is worth while was the giant croc it has - we were in awe when we saw it. Try to go there around 330 in the afternoon so that you can see the feeding of penguins, and then at 4 the croc feeding. Recommended purely for the croc.

Its Great as Something to do. . You have to go to the underwater zoo in Dubai Mall. Its basically a sealife centre in the UK but in a mall in Dubai. Its not enormous by any means but the kids love it. Even if you only ever do it once you have done it. The crocodile is quite a size, it finishes off the experience of the aquarium.
Amazing experience. Everything about this visit was awesome. The staff are very helpful and the King croc is class so many brilliant animals to see.

Good value. Quite expensive but lots to see over two floors. Easy to break for lunch in between. We did the glass bottom boat which was fun and different. Pay by card or in advance to beat the queues.

Exceeded expectations . I did not even realise there was such a large aquarium in Dubai mall. I thought it was just the tunnel. I had the 100Dhs package and it was excellent value for money. As an adult I found it really interesting and loved seeing King Croc! A child would be amazed!I would definitely recommend this if you are in Dubai.
Must visit place of Dubai. Dubai Aquarium and Under water zoo are one the must visit place of Dubai. Its located in the Dubai mall itself.
amazing place. The aquarium of Dubai mall was the best place which I see in my trip. It was very amazing place with a wide range of fishes.
Underwater zoo. Was an ok experience, visited lost chambers so found dubai aqua average. Very short like 150metres only but you can see the sharks closer to you.

An Aquarium in the middle of a Mall!. My Wife and I visited this attraction while we were wandering the Dubai Mall looking for things to do, we found it and it was totally worth it, first they take you on a behind the scenes tour of how the aquarium si fed and how the fish are kept clean and safe etc, and then you get to walk through the aquarium that is centrally located in the mall, there are many onlookers taking pictures of this aquarium and you almost feel like a star walking through it with all the cameras going off... it was a unique experience that we would do again.

The animals . Amazing experience! Huge tank and you can get so close to the fish (and sharks!!). You can see the aquarium without paying but the tunnel gives you a much better experience.Paid around £20 per person, which is pretty average for an aquarium. With this we got the tunnel, the zoo and the behind the scenes experience.Staff were friendly and helpful and the zoo was clearly laid out. Definitely go again and well worth it!! If travelling with kids this is something to break the day up from shopping.

takes a few hours. We spent part of the day visiting the Dubai Mall, and after seeing the aquarium, we had to visit. What a sight to see in the mall. The tunnel walkthrough is great and the experience over a few levels is something different. Very enjoyable.
Attraction inside the Mall. Yes, a very open mind man who choose this attraction inside a so big Mall. It is really a place to relax

Aquarium & Zoo - Dubai Mall . Good experience. Little costly to do the activities. But some may find it worth. You need to spend more time to fall in love with it. It's right in center of the dubai mall. Outside viewing is free.
nothing great. if you have extra time definetley cover it, family with young kids will love it. in dubai mall, go for it if you have extra time.
Wonderfull experience. Had the privilege of visiting this wonder world. What a great attraction. A must for people travelling with kids.

Overall pretty good fun. My son is 7 and somewhat of a aquarium connoisseur and was pretty impressed with this one. There are 4 levels. We got the basic level plus the burj khalifa as a deal. The basic level was descent. Good range of sea animals. My son was especially excited by the ENORMOUS crocodile. A good couple of hours.
biggest aquarium screen in the world. you can experience underwater world during passing this tunnel . visiting big sharks and many kind of fishes during your visit .

Fab!. We visited the aquarium on a rainy day fir something to do. I also wanted to see the crocodile! It isn't expensive and there is a lot to see. It's a little confusing as you start on the ground floor where the tunnel is but then you have to go up to the second floor to carry on the tour. I would recommend going.

Good fun. Quite amazing to find this spectacle in the middle of a shopping mall but as I was to later realise,this is how Dubai rolls!Enjoyed the experience. It is not cheap, but then nothing is in Dubai. We all had a good time and were very taken with the extremely large croc!! Worth a look.

great place for Marine life lovers. The way this has been presented is amazing. there some off the rarest spices of marine life.Place is very popular with Kids and families, My 7 Year old son enjoyed a lot.there is also an option to book ticket online

Quite expensive but great experience. This was a very magical experience but it wasn't for as long as I anticipated and it costing nearly £40 for one adult and one child I think is but expensive but was worth seeing my child smile.I would definitely recommend going as its a great experience
King Croc is great. Really good few hours spent. Great for kids. Amazing to see such big crocodiles. Worth gong in and not just looking at the aquarium from the public areas of the Dubai Mall

good experience especially with kids. get your ticket in advance so you avoid the long waiting queue. you can have different types of activities depending on how much you want to spend. we booked the 120 AED ticket which allowed us to do and see most of what this attraction has to offer.

Dubai Underwater World. During a visit to Dubai, we visited the Dubai Mall, and one of the attractions was the Dubai underwater world.All species and types of fish in a huge tank.I must admit that you can see as much if you stand outside the main glass wall which faces the mall.You don't pay an entrance fee and you get to see most of the contents of the aquarium.Your entrance fee allows you to walk in a glass tunnel under the aquarium which is nice as you get a closer look at the fish and sharks and other sea life from underneath.The visit to the internal operations of the aquarium and their research projects was informative and interesting.A worthwhile visit if you are there

Beautiful not overrated. Let me first start by saying that I did not go into the tunnel. The aquarium is beautiful but the biggest complaint that I have about this attraction is that it is too short. Once can look into the tunnel from the outside.

Nice underwater zoo. It was a realy nice experience .. but because we were on Friday it was a little bit crowded.. The staff was very kind and organized but in a hurry with explanation bc a lot of ppl were waiting to get inside..Nice underwater zoo.. But something that surprised me was the price of the photo that the staff is offering to u as a memory or souvenir of your visit in aquarium.. anyway good experience

Just Amazing. We went as the researcher there where 4 of us meaning we had some looking round to do the water tunnel was amazing being able to get close to the marine life everything was perfect to 0 fault no long waits no hussle all was amazing and that was the tunnel we also had chance to go in the under water zoo and a tour round the facility we saw all the amazing word they do there and we got to go in the underwater observatory very cool simply amazing being able to see them being fed and in their habitat the zoo was outstanding smelling nice and looking clean the place is truly amazing the close encounters the child friendly feel and theme overall amazing would go again (tip: there is a woman with a cash machine next to the real line you can pay her with card and skip the line only card no cash that's the line :-) )
Spend some time away from the shops. You can see a lot for free.Spend a little more and you can go inside.Its worth the money and is good to see all the hard work that goes on behind the scenes

Well worth a visit.. There are a whole range of ticket options available from a normal walk around up to a diving encounter with the fish. The Aquarium is basically one long tunnel which takes around 15-20 mins to walk through. You then get the escalator a couple of floors up the Mall to the underwater Zoo, which is brilliant.There is so much to see there including the star attraction which is the totally enormous Crocodile. Great value for money and broke up a long shopping trip in the Mall!

Amazing attraction right in the mall.. I did the boat ride and it was great to be so close to the fish. It was great to ride around and learn about all the wild life. I never felt crowded, and got to see everything. There was a good flow of traffic and I really enjoyed myself. It was well worth the price.
Enjoyable. A varied and enjoyable experience. Lots of strange fish and good tour. Everyone enjoyed it. Children got a chance to feed the fish and took great photographs.

A miracle in the desert. If I mention that there is a large aquarium in the desert, people will laugh at me. But, it is right there, at the Dubai Mall. It is large, quite a place to add to the variety of things you see at the mall. Also, it is free to watch. Children will live it!

Impressive. I was impressed with the fishes and different species it housed and how neat and clean place was. And you get to sip on a cup of coffee or treat your self to ice cream in the midst of the underwater zoo. Definitely, a family stop in Dubai. Educational, informational, and entertaining. You can take souvenir photos with different backgrounds if you are willing to foot the bill.
Red sea. It is incredible!!For a moment i felt at red se.There any kind of fish i enjoed it.you can see the aquarium for free
Good. I don't think its worth going the underwater zoo for the price. But its very good. The Aquarium is huge. I think its the world's largest indoor aquarium.
Nice experience . I loved to go there and see all the fishes .it was not to crowded there and no one trying to sell you nothing . Worth every penny.
Amazing. This is a must see my little girl just loved this with sharks going over our heads and in the mall crazy

Best aquarium we have visited. We were choosing between Lost Chambers and Dubai Aq., and most of the comments spoke in favor of the latter. We bought the Explorer package (120AED), you go thru the tunnel, the submarine, the glass-bottom boat and underwater zoo. Go on a weekday (Friday is a holiday) and preferably in the morning, when it is not too crowded. The Underwater zoo was especially good: the variety and design of the exposition is fantastic. My favorite - jelly fish and octopus. Visited March 2016

Superb experience - all inside a mall!. a whole sea-world experience inside a mall! quite an architectural feat though steeply priced. Experience viewing some really rare and beautiful species of water creatures..

Dubai Aquarium. The Dubai Aquarium is one of its kind, situated in the luxurious Dubai Mall. It has hundreds of marine life. The tank has light that changes color shade and hence making the aquarium acquire a different ambiance. It is a recommendation to see for both adults and children. It is especially recommended for folk from land-locked countries that do not have oceans. The different variety of marine life that one sees swimming around is so beautiful and endears a sense of peace and tranquility in the observer. As I watched the enclosure I had a strange feeling that I find hard to describe, except just say it was tranquil.

Short but very interesting . Not a long trip but we only opted for the researcher pass for 100 Dhm. The walk through aquarium is very nice and such a strange thing to find in the middle of a shopping mall. The explorer part is a little less interesting as your given a short guided tour around the back scenes of the aquarium. The underwater zoo is really quite nice with a good selection of creatures and a huge croc too. It's a once experience but a worthy way to spend an hour

Great attraction but a little bit expensive for a family. We visited the aquarium as a family of 4 and so found the admission expensive for us. The attraction itself is very interesting and in particular the back of house tour. We are please we visited the attraction but as I said it is a bit expensive for families.
Less the expected. We were expecting more for the price... nice in the tunnel where you can see the sharks swimming above you.

Good for everyone . This was my third visit nothing change from first visit of my since 3 years. Anyway I was with my children for them it's really interesting. Children have big opportunity to know all animals during 3-4 hours. Staff is helpfully as always. Keep like that.

Good aquarium. Impressive aquarium in Dubai Mall which we visited after going up the Kalifa. The huge viewing panels of the aquarium are visible from the mall but we decided to buy a ticket to go in. The tunnel was well worth the ticket prize with the sharks swimming right next to you and above you giving a very close view of their teeth! You then go back out into the mall and up two floors to enter into the zoo part, which all felt a bit odd but the Zoo was very good. The huge Crocodile was very impressive.

Worth the money but maybe more time should have been given. It was a pleasent experience.... Our guide was amazing in her presentation.... I was really shocked to see these many water creatures however the time given for the whole adventure was may be not enough secondly the tickets were 100AD whereas i guess 60-70 was enough

Beats Shark Week on TV all to heck!. Wow, just wow, simply breathtaking; the layout of the aquarium, the size and the variety of aquatic denizens (especially the sharks and rays), and the size of the facility. Just one fair word of warning: when you walk through the tubular tunnel portion and look upwards to gawk at the sharks pressing right up against the Plexiglass, you might get a little dizzy, so proceed with caution.
Good!. It was a nice experience to stand under a tunnel and gaze at sharks and rays that swam right above our heads! Very beautiful sea horses.....
A wonderful place. A place to see and must to visit while in Dubai. You will not just enjoy Seeing the fishes in the ocean. You will also enjoy the shopping spree.

Amazing tunnel aquarium . Went to the mall so also visited the aquarium and underwater zoo. Great place to spend a hour or so. Kids loved it. Got to see the fish and sharks being feed. Would recommend a visit

Spectacular. Visited here today and decided against queueing to get through the tunnel. Instead, took the escalator beside Gap up to the next level and looked through the windows there at the Aquarium. Practically had this area to ourselves, so found it very easy to see the huge array of marine life in the massive tank.Kids loved it and us parents did too.

Surprising bonus to the Dubai Mall experience. The aquarium has wide array of both plant/coral life as well as fish, sharks, sting rays, etc. Ticket price is reasonable and kids will be memorized. The thing that is truly amazing about it, is the variety of activities offered for example glass bottom boat, scuba diving in the aquarium, divers feeding the 'residents'. For the cost and the simple fact that it is in the middle of a mall, it is well worth the trip.

Good for young kids. Ideal for young kids. The cheapest tickets are available at the emirates kiosk at the main entrance of dubai mall.It is 70 AED for adults and 55 for kids for underwater zoo + aquarium while if you buy the tickets at the counter inside it is 100 AED per adult and 70 per kid.

Good aquarium, lots to see, very educational.. Underwater shark tunnel is amazing! Background scenes of the aquarium very educational. Good range of sea life, all appear to be well looked after and tanks well maintained.

Amazing Experience. The enclosures have whole array of the most amazing sea life which also included the Great Crocodile. The tanks have got excellent views of the creatures and is a must for young Children, teens, adults and aged personnel alike. It has wheelchair access.

Dont be cheap go for the most expensive ticket.. We took the Explorer's ticket which was the middle priced ticket. I felt that the attraction started off slow but once you had completed your visit there was a lot packed into the ticket. I wish that I had paid for the full ticket with the behind the scenes laboratory visit. One starts the experience by paying your money for the ticket then you walk around the outside of the Aquarium feeling a little cheated as all the non paying people were seeing the same as you. turning the corner at the end you walked back through the tunnel. OK is that it I asked. then you had to leave the attraction and go up stairs (Top Floor) to the submarine simulator - Not too impressive. then you are moved into the waiting area for the glass bottom boats (Perspex not Glass) Once you tour around the top of the aquarium that is it. I was left with wanting more and feeling slightly short changed. Perhaps I should have purchased the full behind the scenes ticket where you have the opportunity to go into the lab and speak with the scientists. The attraction lacks that "Disney Razmataz" if you know what I mean.

Amazing experience. Awesome breathtaking seaworld and aquarium...
Its a man made miracle that you see sea world and fishes from so..so near.....i loved it....worthwatching in a life time

Fantastic experience, worth every penny.. Kids loved it and for us it was also interesting. The tunnel experience is nice, definitely not the same like standing outside two meters from the outer wall. The zoo is also cool and worth the visit. With the entertainer voucher this is a no-brainer, but even without it it is worth the money.
Such a variety of fish. A great experience, with a good variety of habitats included within the aquarium to suit so many different fish and sharks
Beautiful. Not sure what to say on this.i love sea life and had to take the opportunity to visit this place would recomend it
Good place for kids to understand the sea life. Very well-maintained and organized. Kids will love the show by divers feeding the aquatic creatures. Variety of colorful fishes is a feast to the eyes.
Beautiful Aquarium. A very good aquarium with wide variety of fishes and water animals. loved the underwater tunnel a lot. The highlight of the aquarium is king corc and penguins.

Underwhelming . The aquarium is beautiful but I found paying 120AED to enter was an underwhelming experience as I could have gained more from just watching from outside.
The area with the glass bottom boat ride smells horribly fishy. The giant croc was impressive though
Fish and more. Spent a couple of hours hereof you do not want to pay the entrance fee you can see the large tank from the mall. Much more to see inside though. Worth a visit .

A great visit. We umm'ed and arrr'ed about going in as it didn't look like anything special could be inside (the outer views of the Aquarium are amazing, how could it get much better) but we made the right decision. Massive sharks and Ray's swimming over our head was just the beginning of this experience.

Confusing but impressive . The tunnel was pretty much obvious to anyone in the mall therefore easy to find and extremely interesting with the different range of fish they hold. It depends what ticket you get but all ticket holders as I remember gets to go through the tunnel. After the tunnel I had the Explorer ticket which allowed me the tunnel, simulator, aqua zoo and the glass bottom boat, so we went to the zoo after which was strangely on the second floor so we had to leave the area go up an external escalator then find the zoo which I found odd but we found it quite easily after asking for directions. So when we arrived at the zoo there were three different tiny tanks and then we went on the simulator which I must say was aimed at aged 6 and below. So after that we got confused thinking the whole zoo was just the three tanks so we weren't impressed. After we went down stairs and put in a life jacket without assistance so everyone including little children were just yanking off the closest jacket to them but after that the glass bottom boat was by far the best part as the lady who gave us a tour was very informative and knowledgable of the aquarium, impressive. So when we got off we were directed into another gift shop (by then this was the third I think) then it carried on to the rest of the zoo which I was pleased about. The rest of the zoo was inexplainably outstanding any fish you could name it had and alligators, owls, frogs and so many creatures I've never even heard of! AMAZING

Fascinating!. We loved this and loved the fact that inside a huge mall, there are 2 King crocodiles!!
There was a good range of fish/sea dwellers to see and we got to see some research they are doing which was quite fascinating.
We wouldn't go again but we really enjoyed it while we were there.

Done well. Was free for us as included in out city sightseeing ticket,oherwise probably wouldn't have gone in. We did because it is open until 11pm and we happened to pass by at about 9.30 and thought why not.Now you can see an awful lot of the aquarium for free in the Mall itself, if you don't go in I could almost guarantee it will still be the biggest fish tank you have ever seen.However if you enter you will walk through theglass tunnel with the sharks and ray swimming over your head, the kids love it, everyone loves it.Only in Dubai would you have to UP two stories to an underwater zoo! This was better than I expected and interesting for adults and children, look out for the croc

Nice experience! . Lovely trip for an extremely rare rainy afternoon, kids loved it!! Only thing is DO NOT BUY THE PICTURE SOUVENIR at the end of the underwater tunnel, very EXPENSIVE!!! you will probably take better pictures with you smart phone.
I love it !. Don't miss out this venue !! a wonderful place to see several types of water creatures including sharks !! :D

Super cool!. My two year old just wouldn't enter at first. After much coaxing and bribes he entered the zoo and was stunned! He enjoyed it so much that he refused to get out. Made quite a scene before he would come out! Recommended for tourists with little children.

Great learning experience. It's inside the Dubai Mall!! You can arrange shopping and learning at the same time. You will get to learn new knowledge on how they preserve the living environment in the zoo. Get close to the animal and see new creature that you might not seen before. It takes times for actually walk all the zoo and see each animal in detail. Spare more time to enjoy this.

Absolutely worth the visit.. The aquarium at the Dubai Mall is a top attraction. Worth a visit to the Mall just to see that. Make sure you view from all levels, as you see different things from each. Can get crowded, however not hard to get a good selfie!

Stunning Aquarium. We enjoyed the Dubai Aquarium and underwater zoo, it was spectacular! We did the glass bottom boat ride and although it was quite short, it was a great way to see the fish up close. It was nicely laid out so you didn't feel to crowded either. We entered the aquarium from the upper level of the mall, even though the queues on the ground floor were quite long, we walked right in. It was worth the trip!

OK, worth a visit if going to the Mall or Burj. My kids love aquariums and in particular sharks and crocs. These had both so thought we were onto a winner.We wanted to go to the Burj and had a few hours to kill before our allotted time, so headed to the Mall via the Metro.We went for the researcher package at 100 AED per person. Under 3s were free. This included a talk at the beginning showing how they looked after the fish etc... And then access to the underwater zoo.We loved the jellyfish, sharks, rays, crocs. There was only one place where you could touch anything, but we did (starfish). Best bit for the kids was the crocs, but I liked the frogs, and penguins too.We spent just over an hour in there. Wouldn't make a special trip for it, but worth a go if you are there to visit the Mall or Burj with kids.
Impressive. Beautiful aquariumGreat explanationGood place for entertainmentInteresting views for taking photosAbsolutely worth to visit

Impressive. It is a very impressive aquarium, especially the first part with the big tank and all the different fishes, sharks, rays, etc. swimming around.
Good place to go if you have kids.
You can see most of it in around 60 to 90 minutes.
Well worth to visit if in Dubai
Totally worth it. Magnificent experience, worth the money - we went with a 3 years old kid and she enjoyed it very much, highly interactive.

Always a great time visiting this place. New enhancements at the dubai aquarium with the King Croc and the baby croc.penguins are always a visual treat to see. The aquarium has a depth of around 33 fts with provision for various diving activities. True to the spirit of the sponsorship from blancpain, the place is a visual treat.The collection of fishes are amazing, and the Sharks too!!

Shopping break. Fantastic experience but very busy. This is a good educational place to visit and the exhibits and fish in both the zoo and aquarium are of the highest quality. We booked both and was well worth it. Would like to have spent longer in the aquarium section but it was so busy I felt we had to move through quickly due to the amount of people in the viewing galleries. Overall though we would re visit this on another visit to Dubai.

Not bad, but overpriced for what's to see. First, I need to say we visited tens of aquariums in different countries, so I guess our expectations were high considering the pricey entrance fee.Overall it isn't a bad visit, but there is nothing that stands out and it goes by pretty quickly without any impressive station. The sharks are nice and there nice fish and animals to watch, but considering the price, I would rather just watch the huge fish tank from outside the aquarium, which is free and still is the best thing to see.That would be my recommendation, just spend some time enjoying the fish tank from the outside, that one is nice and impressive.

Interesting, but poorly maintained.. It was a nice break from the sensory overload of all the shopping at Dubai Mall, but was a bit underwhelming because the aquarium was not all that well maintained. Some of the exhibits were just empty or had dead animals inside (two of the cuttlefish exhibits had dead cuttlefish floating at the bottom of the tanks and they had Ben there for quite some time), however, it was good fun and I respect a mall that puts that much effort into an attraction that is not just all about shopping.
under water walk. I have been to singapore santosa island which is equal wonderfulbut this one is good. it was enjoyable
pretty cool. try to get a combo deal as when youre in the mall they have sega world and other things you can combo it with

Shopping with fishes. A wounderful underwater experience in the middle of a shopping centre. You can feed the fish and learn about the work going on ,you can even put on a wet suit and swim with the Sharks. Only in Dubai would they think of this.

Great experience . I'll start with the negatives : the tour guides were not audible and they were in such a hurry to get to the next group of people that one actually refused to answer my question properly. (I asked "what species of fish did you say these are? " To which she responded "Oh they're just fish ma'am all the same. Please move to the next section so the other group can have space to stand." Smh). It's a bit smelly down there but hey, what should I have expected here :D. Lastly, it's super expensive to buy a printed and branded picture from there. I know itwa tourist destination but gosh! The positives: it is absolutely stunning and beautiful. The glasses that house the sea creatures are like magnifying glass so you get some extremely detailed views. It's breathtaking. There's also a kinda creepy but awesome section with desert animals, bats owls, rats, lizards etc. I enjoyed squinting my eyes in the dark to find those critters. Finally, if you're not from sub Saharan Africa (which is where I am from) , and you've never seen a Nile Crocodile before(Um, I've seen a great number), then you'll be utterly petrified lol, maybe, but also awe-struck by the ones there. Particular mention to the King Croc (affectionately termed), it's humongous. You'll love it!

Kids Overjoyed. The marine wildlife variety is amazingly diverse. Place for plenty of pictures.. Sharks, sting rays and the pretty fishes are big in number making for a great experience. The souvenirs can be quite expensive.
Dubai Aquarium a must see. During a visit to the Dubai Mall, the Aquarium is conveniently located within the mall along with the fountains and tallest building.

Really really small 'aquarium'.. Its actually just a tunnel under a big pool of water. The Plexiglas tunnel is quite short and frankly unpleasant when full of screaming kids and noisy families. It also distorts the view. The upper areas are, lets say compact and again, unpleasant when full of screaming kids and families. Ive seen better and bigger. The behind the scenes tour was nice but underwhelming. Its just a big fish tank in a shopping centre. Nice but meh.
Great place for kids to get acquanted with under water life.. We spend lot of time on watching how the sharks get food. It is having very good collection of under water fish.

Nice thing to do while in Dubai Mall. The Aquarium is basically just the tunnel, you can see the same fish as you see from the panel outside for free, but from "within" which allows for better pictures.The zoo part is really great, we loved it! I would suggest you do both attractions together.Won't take more than 2 hours... Unless you have kids, then it might take longer.

You will love this!. You don't see this every day! Such a big aquarium in a Mall! In Dubai everything is big! don't miss to go through the tunnel and be as close as it gets with all the sharks around! And then go shopping!

What a treat in a shopping mall. This was an amazing feature in a shopping mall, we thoroughly enjoyed our trip here and especially loved that the manta rays could be seen above us in the glass tunnel that you walked through.
Nice place. The place is huge and awesome, i`ve seen it all, but didnt have a chance to dive in :-). recommended for visit
Great outing!. Spent atleast 4 hours here and was amazing considering that it was in a Mall. Loved the glass bottom boat and the big crocodile feeding
Amazing attraction!. One of the best Aquariums I have ever been to! Big selection of things to do and see for adults and kids!

Nice attraction in Dubai Mall. Located inside Dubai Mall, this is very good attraction among kids and adults as well. Apart from many varieties of fishes, there are many other creatures in underwater zoo located on Level2.
Commendable..... Dubai being Dubai... everything is grand and big... the zoo is well maintained and the tunnel is amazing.. probably the best underwater aquarium in terms of sharks per sqft....
A must see in dubai . This aquarium is so big and lots of creatures in it. I did the glass boat ride and the underwater zoo. Really lovely and I was quite excited. Highly Recommended
worth a visit if You have time. It's worth a visit when staying longer than one day. I recommend to use entertainer coupons (buy one get one free)

Amazing aquarium. We visited the aquarium a few days ago. No queues, clear information about what to expect and an impressive amount of all kinds of fish. The aquarium is easy accessible and there are many employees willing to tell you something about the aquarium and its inhabitants. You can choose from a ticket menu in order to personalize the visit up to your interests.

Must-see attraction. This is the most amazing place in Dubai. Wander through the glass - domed tunnel as though you are under the ocean. See the penguins and Sea-lions. By far the best aquarium I have ever seen. Get a free view just by entering the Mall.

If you love sea life, you have to go - at least once!. You start with a long tunnel where you get very close to sharks, rays and fish. Fantastic. You have a number of options from here, We did the researcher where we went through their breeding program and feeding. These guys are seriously concerned with conservation! The range of fish in the aquarium tanks was really amazing, with the way they are treated and fed first class. Must do the dive next time!
Very cool sealife. Worth the money. Cheaper than going to seaworld in the states that's for sure. Very cool and to imagine this is inside a mall. Love the variety of sealife.

Not the greatest aquarium.. There are many species of fish and mammals, but there are so many people in a restricted area. Also we have already booked a promotion coupon to see Burj Khalifa and the aquarium, and instead of passing through the crowd that did not have tickets, we were obliged to stay in the queue as well to check the ticket!!!
world of fish. Good place to enjoy with family, different kind of sea living from world wide, every one can enjoy the place
Nice. Interesting place, in the "hearth" of big shopping mall. It is something that should be visited once you are in Dubai.

The biggest in the world. It's the biggest in the world.Wide varieties of fish and huge sharks.they have a glass tunnel to walk through the aquarium ,and diving activities.Laction is excellent in Dubai mall.very nice for the whole family.
Beautiful and calm!. It's really an unexpected experience to see an aquarium in a shopping mall. It's beautiful with great variety of big fishes and you can dive in and play with them!

Expensive but good!. The aquarium is a great insight into sea life. It's quite awesome to see the whole underwater park from inside. The inside zoo is interesting with lots of attractions and loads of animal. It is great for kids as there are tours and displays with interactive explanations. Its expensive though. If you are on a tight budget you can pretty much see all the fish from outside in the mall.

Great aquarium in the middle of a mall!. The aquarium is really nice! The tunnel is really cool since you get to see many sharks all together plus other species such as fishes and rays. The water zoo is also very nice with several specis, such as king croc and queen croc. The display of the zoo is really beautiful. Eventhough is not as huge as a normal zoo you could easily spend two hours or more there contemplating the animals. Really cool place!

Great place but........ It is a great place to see lots of fish, there are plenty of them and great varieties.They even have penguins.My concern is they have now got a massive Aussie crocodile and birds such as owls. Not convinced these animals should be kept in such an environment.It is worth a visit.
Fantastic. This is a fun activity for all ages. I recommend the combo ticket that includes this and the Burj Khalifa. It is cheaper than buying them separately.

Cool Aquarium with nice species. They are trying to increase their offerings. Although it is very expensive to dive or do shark cage here.
