It is fun to know that you are doing all that in middle of a mall. The way it is kept is amazing and I can't believe who had an idea to keep 100s of shark in middle of the mall. It is fun activity while you are leisurely walking around mall.Penguins and Alligator are fun to see too.

Dubai in 1/2 day. You can see a lot of it from the outside, and go in for a very high price to walk through the tunnel. Not worth it, unless you are determined to spend a lot of money at every mall corner.

amazing. it is very cool and to take picture in it was cool with all the fish and shark behind us as well the location in the mall make it easy to every one to visitit not like you are going to some place far
Very nice!. This attraction exceeded my expectations! I simply loved the aquarium and the decoration of it!!!!!!
Maybe only if it rains in Dubai... It is pretty small so maybe you should attend this only if you don't have anything else to do, like in a rainy day
Aquarium . Its a beautiful place to visit in dubai mall in a reasonable price. There are two crocodile couple which the royal king kept in his house. Too many aquatic animals.

Every time there's new stuff to look at,,sooooo relaxing and binding love. Me n my baby live to sit there for 1-2 hours just looking at fishing and taking our sea book and comparing with what's inside the book with what's alive..and each one of us gives points and at the end we reword our self with a delicious ice cream..

Great way to spend a few hours.. I went here during a stop in Dubai. The aquarium is great and has lots of fish to look at. There is plenty of other things to do and see such as insects, smaller fish, reptiles and other mammals. A great morning ideal for people of all ages.

Fantastic!!. Located In Dubai Mall,both aquarium n zoo cost 100 AED per head.aquarium is in d ground floor,comprises of a tunnel with marine life all around.you can see a large variety including sharks and Ray. The Zoo is in 3rd floor and is famous for the King Croc,the huge crocodile.they also have penguins,otters and dont miss their feeding by experts esp the Croc.Kids enjoyed the visit and clicked pics with all of them.Very well maintained too!
WOW. The aquarium is really good, so hard to believe it is in a shopping mall. Children love this place. We did the glass bottom boat which was okay but not amazing.

Good view. Good view inside the Mall has a massive window lovely watching all the fish etc. Also saw several people doing diving and swimming with fish. We did not pay to go in as we had a good view from outside, lots of other things to do in there but we were happy viewing from outside.

Not the beat. We got this for free with our hop on hop off bus ticket and decided to use it. Thankfully it was free because I would've been upset if I would've paid for it. The "aquarium" is a tunnel you walk through and fishes/sharks inside. Then you expect more but there's not any more. The "underwater zoo" is just a few fish in tanks, some otters and a HUGE alligator / crocodile of some sort. The croc was probably the most interesting thing in there. Wouldn't go back. Also ticket staff was extremely rude and almost didn't let us use our free ticket.

Great way to kill time but.... It's a beautiful aquarium...but it's just an aquarium. The behind the scenes tour was interesting, but pretty short and not worth extra money. If you're in the mall and need to kill 30 mins, this is a great option. Highlight of the aquarium is definitively the underwater tunnel towards the entrance. Book tickets online or look for combo packages with the Burj Khalifa for discounts.

Good one ... can be viewed from mall. It was a good experience walking through the tunnel and in the glass cabin inside the tank. We took a basic ticket. There are higher tickets and experiences offered like diving. However, the tank can be viewed from the mall without any fee. The ticket will provide a walk trough the tank inside a tunnel and see from top of fish tank, and a walk through zoo. The tank has lots of varieties of fish including many sharks and rays. The zoo houses a lot of marine creatures like jelly fish, crocodile, tortoise, sea horse, star fish, crabs, penguins, etc. The crocodile is a really big one imported from australia weighing around 750 kg and still growing at 40 years of age. Recommend this attraction for kids, and diving for enthusiasts. And for those who want to click pics with these creatures.

Nicest aquarium I´ve ever seen. This aquarium is the nicest and cleanest aquarium I´ve ever seen. perfect clean exhibit windows, backstage tour included in the entrance fee (if wanted) and very helpful personnel and of course nice variety of species.

Fantastic chance to get up close and personal with marine life.. This is a chance to actually swim with the sharks. This is an educational and fun opportunity for the entire family. The location is awesome because if everyone in your group is not into the marine life, they can shop or have a fantastic meal. I loved the sting rays!

One of the best places for Famlies in Dubai. We've been to this area several times and had no idea the tour was so great. We thought you just walked through the tunnel and that was it. Wow is all that I can say, the place is beautiful and what they're doing for the animals is just amazing. My son and I asked tons of questions and they answered them all. I was really amazed and this is 100% one of the best places to go if you love underwater life. It was pretty big too, and the KIng Croc is HUGE and awesome.
Dubai Aquarium in Dubai Mall. Nice place to visit. Situated inside Dubai Mall. Various kind of combined tickets are available. Boat ride and dynamic simulation are worth to avail.

magical family time. We visited during our stay at Atlantis and young and old were all transfixed with the awe-inspiring sights to behold. We can compare this the our visit to The Great Barrier Reef and found our time at Dubai Aquarium just as fascinating . Look forward to our return in July

Shark Dive at Dubal Mall Aquarium with Al Boom. We dived in the aquarium at Dubai Mall with Al Boom on 2nd March 2016 and had an amazing experience for a special birthday. We were fully briefed about shark behaviour and rules of the dive with regard to controlling buoyancy and breathing by both written booklet and watching a short video. The kit was great and our instructor, Lito, was knowledgeable, skilled, patient and attentive. He used a Go-Pro camera to film our experience which was an amazing added extra and well worth it to relive the memory since coming home. Diving with the rays, sharks and array of species in the aquarium was a once in a lifetime experience. We moved through the tank guided by our instructor, stopping to rest on the bottom and on strategically placed rocks to enjoy our surroundings whilst being filmed and having pictures taken which was watched by hundreds of people watching us from the Mall. Truly unforgettable and well worth the money (With Go-Pro / filming the cost was approx. £330 for 2 including free entry to the Underwater Zoo afterwards) and a shark dive certificate at the end which was a lovely touch. A very unique and special experience made so easy by the professional team at Al Boom! Aside from recommending this experience, we dived with Al Boom also in Fujairah and they are exceptional in all aspects of kit, care, knowledge, skill and attentiveness. What made this experience so special and amazing for the shark dive was that we may or may not see these species in their natural environment on future dives, but we will never see them and be able to learn from and enjoy them altogether without having done this. The free entry to the Underwater Zoo afterwards finished the experience off perfectly! Truly amazing!!! Thank you to Lito and Al Boom...

Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Its a one time experience , but I would not highly recommend this place specially if you have visited Singapore zoo as that's the benchmark of all aquariums in the world. Dubai aquarium can be missed.

Interesting aquarium in a mall. The aquarium is in the centre of the Dubai Mall next to the food courts. It's a little pricey but a nice walk and relatively interesting. It's right next to the food court and in the centre of the mall so well located. Definitely don't miss the tunnel 2 floors down.

Nothing Great. Nothing that great. Maybe I have seen the Singapore Aquarium and the Crocodile Farm in Chennai. So did not find anything really special about this. My ticket to the Burj Khalifa included this attraction. So visited it. I wouldn't recommend paying separately for this. The Aquarium can be seen from outside for free.

Enjoyed. It was fun for me, took a lot of pictures.
It increased my knowlodge very much about sea creatures. I bet it will be much more fun with friends and family members.
Combine with the red bus tour. Use the red bus tour ticket for a free entry into the aquarium. it was a time worthy experience and i would recommend it

Reasonably Priced Fish and some Bored Staff. I personally found the aquarium in the mall to be pretty good overall, and not too prohibitively expensive, which surprised me. The engineering alone behind this feature is breathtaking, with two stories of window stretching up from the floor, housing 300 sharks and rays as well as a myriad of other fish-type creatures.You dont need to pay to go into the aquarium to see the fish - you can just as easily stand in the mall and watch them swimming and undulating by for free. If you do want to see them a bit closer up, there are some different package options available.The "researcher" ticket goes for 100 AED (about 20 british pounds) entry and allows you to go through the underwater tunnel; see behind the scenes and go into the underwater zoo. The next package up is the "explorer" ticket (120 AED) and includes the above, plus a glass bottomed boat tour and submersible experience. There are a couple more options above this that include different configurations on the theme of fish and water, including cage diving, close-up animal experiences and scuba lessons at a mere 2,500 AED. The website has more detalls.We took the most basic researcher package because, actually, the submarine experience looked a bit naff and something of a side show. Also, the boat would have just been looking at the same stuff from a different angle, but we saw a boat leaving and the passengers seemed well kitted out with life jackets and excited kids. Other reviews didnt seem too enamoured by the boat, though.In total, the researcher package took us around 1.5 to 2 hours to do and i felt this was worth it.The tunnel was pretty good, but can clearly get quite packed. Its around 50m long running along on the bottom of the tank, so that you get to see close up the sharks and rays swimming by. Many of them rest on top of the perspex so you can see their mouths and gills flapping around, so its educational and there are alot of selfies being taken. The sharks were congregating at one end when we visited so we felt very close to them and their teeth and you can get some interesting pictures if you can figure out how to focus past the glass. There were quite a few people here using flash photography, but if this bothered any of the fish, they didnt show it and had opportunity to get away. Many of them, it seemed, quite liked the attention.The behind the scenes tour was a disappointment and the reason the attraction dropped a star in my review. We were whisked as a group into what appeared to be either a giant laboratory or an ice cream factory and advised that the tour would take about 15 minutes. In a rather rushed introduction by a rather humourless guide, we were told it wouldnt be advisible to slip and fall into the shark tank; we should stay together a group while being passed baton-style from station to station around the lab and were welcome to ask any questions at any time. She then gave a bored and hurried glance around the group and muttered "any questions, no?" before shooshing us onto the next guide and repeating the whole zestless speech again for following group. The next guides were somewhat the same, albeit with a different fish speciality and i just felt in the way as they burbled through their lines. I didnt really get the chance to ask any questions, since i couldnt hear a word anyone was saying, and was honestly glad when it was over.The underwater zoo, thankfully, was much better. Plenty of both fresh and salt water fish, well presented and laid out in a thoughtful and interesting way. Lots of conservation information, including reference to CITES (trading convention on endangered animals) and description of the natural habitats in both Arabic and English. There was a touch pool where you can reach down and pick up the starfish and some very weird-feeling horseshoe crabs. There were also some more traditional zoo-type animals, such as water rats, otters, penguins, a couple of enormous crocs, owls, beetles, chameleons, octopus, cuttlefish, moray eels, bats, spider crabs and some australian frogs. My only criticism of the zoo was that i thought the owls and the bat (surely more than one?) could have done with alot more room (which i fed back to them via the e-invitation to do so at the end) and that the otters could have had a few more playthings.Saying that, though, the animals looks healthy and interactive. Although there is a video paying of them catching the croc and i did wonder whether they were still actually allowed to ship in live animals like this from the wild. Being a member of WAZA, also, gave me some confidence in the place, so overall i would give this a good review. However, have to say the tropical "soundtrack" blasting out in the background (didgeridoos and kookaburras) gave me a huge headache and they could easily have turned this down since it sounded a bit like a bad rave track.I think the first package was enough and probably wouldnt bother with any of the others, but if you are bored of shopping and feel like a couple of hours in a different world, the aquarium is worth a visit."

Fun Excursion. At first walking through the aquarium tunnel it just seems like another money sucking tourist attraction but then you get to the aquarium and realize there is a lot to do and a lot to see. A range of aquatic animals and some other unexpected animals like the huge croc

First aquarium experience in a shopping mall!. We had a free ticket from our Hop On, Hop Off bus ticket and enjoyed an afternoon viewing the various underwater wildlife of the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. It's enjoyable and you easily spend a couple of hours looking around (or more if you're crazy about animals like me).
Lovely Aquarium. In the middle of Dubai mall. this is free for public. Adjust your visit time in such a way that you can spend 30-45 minutes here before seeing musical fountain ./ burj khalifa
Nice, but limited, Aquarium. I was disappointed by the size of this Aquarium---really 20 minutes is all it takes to see most of the fish and sea life.

I wasn't that impressed. There are some interesting areas on display. Your tour starts with an audience with some exotic reptiles, followed by a tunnel which gives you a better view of the aquarium. Not worth the money (around $60) in my opinion since you can pretty much see all the fish from outside the attraction. I also didn't think that there was very much to see overall.

Huge Aquarium - Enjoyed. This Aquarium is gynormous, so many species of fish definately worth a visit, very educational for children and adults alike. Bit on the pricey side but worth a visit.The Aquarium is situated in the Atlantis Palm shopping mall, and wow what a shopping experience that could be (if only I had the megga bucks to go with it )We enjoyed our visit

Dubai Aquarium - fun for all the family. We spent a pleasant couple of hours in the Aquarium at the Dubai Mall. Our family group got free tickets as part of the 48 hour hop on hop off bus tour package. Our young granddaughter enjoyed the visit as did the adults in our group. Plenty to see, including the 5 metre long " King Croc." Apparently has the world's largest Aquarium viewing panel ( Dubai likes to do everything "large scale.")

Great :). The aquarium is fabulous & they have a lot of rare animals there.
It has a great design specially when you are very close to huge fishes in the underwater zoo.
Also they have a great small & dark places to feel the real wild life

Great Aquarium. As we booked the city sightseeing tour for 48hrs we had free entrance here. It was very good and alot to see and look at, Was actually surprised how long we stayed was over 3 hrs, because it was very interesting and lots to see. Would recommend going here more than the Lost chambers at Atlantis, This aquarium is much much better i would definitely return and pay their prices.

Definitely it is not an aquarium from Dubai!. It doesn't look like an aquarium from Dubai, where everything is so BIG, beautiful and detailed. Visiting the Aquarium was a bit disappointing: you just walk trough a short tunnel where you can see some fish. It is not very different from what you can see, from the outside, without paying a ticket.

Beautiful but expensive. I was really excited going to the aquarium since it looked really nice already from the outside. Even more thrilled was I when i read about the different encounters you can have & we picked the king croc encounter which i regreted afterwards. we could go inside and watch from the top how they feed the crocs. i just feel the encounter they offer wasnt that special especially since it wasnt exactly cheap. We couldve seen the feeding from the outside, it wouldnt have made a big difference. In the encounter included was feeding the birds that were inside which wasnt that special either. I couldve done that in any other country. I just felt like its totally overpriced for what you get. The staff giving us the info was friendly though.

Average, less than expected. We visited this place in March 16. This aquarium is located in Dubai Mall. Though it is creditable that they have managed to set up an aquarium in a mall. It is much smaller compared to the one we had visited in Singapore.
Aquarium. Quite interesting experience especially for kids. They were so excited of sharks. But I was very disapointed of boat - very boring and nothing to see at all...

Amazing aquarium - great for young children. Visited this on a rainy day (I know, outrageous!) and it did not disappoint. Even if you don't pay to enter and are in the mall - there's an impressive huge wall where you can see in... We went in (with a BOGOF voucher from the entertainer Dubai) and loved the tunnel - fish and sharks all around you. We then went on to the exhibit which wasn't as good after the brilliant start for a young toddler - but nevertheless still very interesting and plenty to do - she loved her time.To be honest we'd return - even if it was sunny - which must say something!
Very good!. Aquarium and underwater zoo were bigger than we thought! So many fish and animals to see. Good value for money if you bay a normal ticket.

Worth a visit if you're in the Mall anyway. From the reviews I had already read I was expecting more. The advertised '3 floor aquarium' was not as obvious as I had hoped. You only got to see the bottom of the aquarium from the Mall. Assumed that you paid 1 price and got everything but the pricing was confusing. Also you had to leave one section and go down 2 floors and find the next entrance for the other section. Sometimes felt a bit 'herded' rather than being able to wander. Amazing variety of animals though, penguins, otters, water rats, rays, squid, crocodiles, turtles, sharks, bats and obviously fish

Interesting for children. You can visit this place if you have children with you, they will be astonished by the variety of marine animals they have, but other than that there's nothing special about it. Even more, the smell could be unbearable.
Perfect. Perfect place for adults and children. The variety of activities and marine life was amazing. My 17th month old loves it! It's a must go.

Its feels like....... Dream..... I don't have word to describe ...... The things....I feel like owsome ... When I enter I was shocked what is this ..... Good guys .... Definitely I visit again with my family.....

Something out the Ordinary!!. Visited in Nov 2013. Amazing, a Must see when Visiting Dubai.
Did the Cage Snorkeling with my Wife, the staff was was really nice ad helpful. One for the Books!
Amazing . Amazing experience over 20000 fishes in tank only....the king Croc you could never imagine the share size until you actually see it. WOW

Wouldn't bother. The most impressive part of this aquarium is the giant wall of fish, which you can view for free in the mall. From then on, it goes downhill so save your funds and admire the spectacle for free, whilst indulging in some retail therapy!

Great experience. one of the must see attractions at Dubai Mall, recommend anyone going there try it. there are many different varieties of fish and sea life and walk underneath is fun. for extra's one can go diving in the tank but I am not sure of the cost and its timing. overall a fun thing to do as a family.

Expensive..but still. I was doubtful entering this spectacle at first since the price was quite steep. But I did just so as not to waste that opportunity of experience.It was worth it. I actually can't remember much of what I saw, but the feeling of being there, especially in that tube with the marine life swimming around was astounding.I was particularly mesmerized by the sand tiger shark, with its menacing yet serene look. What was lacking are the whales, the great white, to really make it a 5-star. Then again, they will need the whole of Dubai Mall to accommodate such creatures.I'll definitely go back, and that time, I'll take a plunge!

Do you know what happens behind the scenes in an aquarium?. I visited aquariums previously, but it was the first time I knew that we could actually see what happens behind the scenes. I bought a "Researcher ticket" where I went with a tour to the backside of the aquarium; we saw how they feed fish, and we learnt about various types of fish they have, and how is it to be working in an aquarium.
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Grate place to take Kids ,it was something different to what we had seen before. 5 year old loved it!!
The best deep sea experience you can have in the world. wow I have no words to explain as you should experience the varieties especially for kids and family it will be an wonderful experience.

Nice place to go with the kids. Never thought that there can be so huge aquarium in shopping mall, but it's Dubai, so anything is possible. You have to go there. It's like a dive in the ocean. A lot of exotic fish close up. I recommend.
Glittering eye.... It is a worth visiting wonder of Dubai... I enjoyed alot with my family... The effort behind the Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is appreciable
Half a day underwater. So much of aqua life and so many things to do. Very good. Must visit. Will attract kids and adults alike. Dont miss the king croc.
Average. There is an underwater tunnel which was the highlight. Hordes of fishes- sting rays, sharks etc would swim over you. Saw the king croc too. Not worth the price of the ticket.

Too Costly. There is just an Aquarium but you will see many different kinds if fishes.
Good for children.
We did nit liked it much.

Underwater Zoo. The Underwater Zoo in an amazing aquarium experience. It is by far the best aquarium I have visited. I visited with my 3 grandchildren 8 years, 10 years and my 18 month old granddaughter who was mesmerised, they loved every minute of their visit. Not just fish, crocodiles, penguins and an overhead walkway. There is a glass platform to view the crocodiles and sharks are you brave enough? Refreshments available as you wander around. After a visit to the Zoo your ticket allows you to walk through the underwater tunnel. An experience not to be missed.

Must se inside the Dubai Mall. If you are in or around Dubai Mall, you should see this.This aquarium has the worlds biggest one piece front glass wall of an aquarium. When you see it, you can not believe if it is true or not, but it is.So many species inside all together, which surprises you the most.

Lots to see...... This was my favourite part of our trip to the mall. You can also get a tour behind the scenes and check out some of there breeding programs. It was a very interesting morning. Really Enjoyed the tour

Family loved it. Really nice place, especially for the kids. My 6-year old boy loved each and everything about it, this was our second visit from Pakistan. Next time we are definitely buying an encounter with the stingray or sharks

Great fun!. Its not just an aquarium of marine life, they also have a 2m crocodile and reptiles in there. All good fun and lots to see. Great walking through the tunnel under the aquarium to see the Sharks and rays.
Beautiful place. Not going into the wonder how they made it, it is a beautiful place to visit. For sure it worth the money you spend. A must see in Dubai

Fun Hour. If you have an hour to kill and the Dubai Mall shops are exhausting you then you should definitely take an hour or two to visit the Dubai Mall Aquarium! it starts with a walk through the main aquarium, initially you will be shocked at how many sharks are actually in this tank... A LOT! the next surprise is how large the Zoo is, it always amazes me how large this mall is, hidden within this zoo is a HUGE tank with quite possibly one of the largest crocodiles i've ever seen 'Big Croc'!! definitely fun for kids, however i'm 27 and I've been twice!! if you live a little more on the dangerous side you can go into the tank and scuba-dive, however i'll just settle with the glass bottom boats that float across the top of the tank!!

Dubai does everything big!. Biggest mall in the world, next to the tallest building and the world's largest fountain display-- too keep up this place had to do something big. So of course they have the world's biggest pain of glass on one of the tanks. It's world class, but of course it is-- what in Dubai is not?
THE BIGGEST ON EARTH. it is free on a side and you can go and visit all on the other sideeven have explorers experience, and they offer sharks cage go for it
Amazing aquarium with sharks and stingray. Huge aquarium at the Dubai mall. You can walk thro' the path with sharks and stingray swimming past you.
Cloud 9 experience. yeah.. I was on cloud 9 when I had been there with my family... the experience is beyond words guys.. must pay a visit.. :) :D

Best aquarium I have seen in the world . We visited the Dubai aquarium in December 2015. As I love travel and sea life I like to visit the local aquarium in the cities we visit and I can say that the aquarium at the Dubai mall is probably the best I've seen in the world and its more then just the large tank you see from the mall, deffinatly a must visit for all tourist especially children as the guides that take you through the displays are very knowledgeable,funny and speak excellent English. It is a little pricey but worth it for the experience. King croc is a main attraction for all to see
Very good experience but overpriced for...the researchers. 4 stars..overpriced if you go for the basic tour..100AED for 15meter tunnel..bit better if you go for the rest tours.
family fun. as having seen much better ones it was still satisfying I admired the big glass window and tried to understand how once it was installed
Good break from shopping . Enjoyable... The size of that saltwater Croc though!!! Very educational and some great opportunities and the main tank has a great array of fish..

Amazing experience. We spent a couple of hours here on our last morning in Dubai and thoroughly enjoyed it. The fish are wonderful and its an experience going through the shark infested tunnel. There are many packages that you can buy depending on what it is that you want to experience. We opted for the basic package of the tunnel/behind the scenes tour and underwater zoo and it was well worth the price.Having stayed at The atlantis we thought maybe a waste of time- but it definitely wasn't. Noy to be missed
A good attraction ! . This is a good attraction right in the Dubai mall, plenty to entertain all ages, you can get close up to all the zoo attractions and the huge aquarium tank is quite amazing.

Best Day Ever!. Going in a shark cage is something that I have always wanted to do. The staff were very polite and helpful. They went through the safety program quite thoroughly and made sure that we knew what we were doing and how to communicate under water. He even took photo's of us while we were in the cage which turned out pretty amazing. I recommend purchasing the USB with them which wasn't expensive at all.  One tip that I would give would be to wash your hair afterwards. They do provide showers for you to clean up afterwards but I didn't wash my hair since it was only slightly wet and we still had some shopping to do afterwards.Pretty much for the rest of the day all that I could smell was fish leftovers and salt water. It wasn't pleasant. I would have rather walked around with wet hair rather than strangers wondering why on earth I stink.

Interesting visit, many different species. Enjoyed this visit seeing many different species up close, especially through the tunnel. Interesting also for children to witness underwater life firsthand.
Excellent. Excellent value for money, enjoyed the new added shark tank tutorials given. Very accessible and easy to navigate around. Loved the added addition of King Croc!

Good one time visit.. It's good to explore for once. The concept being in a mall is fantastic. Similar thing in Atlantis but this is much bigger and better. The fishes are beautiful. Overall, a worth one time visit.
Enjoyed. Informative and enjoyable. Must visit place. Esp children. Children under 3 free. Takes about 1hour. Sharks, ray's, crocks, otters,

Wonderful experience at Dubai Aquarium. It's amazing to see really large fishes and sharks swimming right in front of your eyes and you feel that you can actually touch them. Take photos which shark behind you. Will feel like a hero!
Worth to visit. Every time i visit Dubai, i must see the Aquarium, it's amazing, many types, when passing through the tunnel, you feel great, really worth a visit.

Beautiful place to visit. This place is just awesome. Have to visit if you are in Dubai. If you miss this the you have to come back to Dubai. It's located in The Mall off Dubai. The place to visit if you are in Dubai UAE.

Aquarium & zoo inside the Dubai mall. My 5y/o daughter had a great time in the aquarium and the underwater zoo inside the Dubai mall. A little expensive but when I see my daughter smiles and gets jittery from excitement who cares right! This place is small but we actually spend 2 1/2 hrs visiting this place because of my daughter.

The underwater zoo is well worth a visit. You can see a large part of the large aquarium from the Dubai Mall but to experience walking trough the underwater tunnel and to visit the underwater zoo you must buy tickets. The tunnel obviously provides you with a different perspective of the aquarium. The underwater zoo to us was more interesting with the range of species you can see. Make sure you take your camera.

Splendid. Went it finally together with my family. Great thing, especially the behind the scenes on a higher floor, showing the fish growing and other. The zoo is also great. Super clean, large selection of fish and other animals, definitely worth a visit.
mesmerrised with stunning views of all sea creatures in one place. Amazing day tour with all rare sea animals including some rarest species.Awesome experience to catch penguins and Croc at one place.

Wow!. Just walking by the aquarium is spectacular but take the time to go inside. There are a variety of tours. On this visit we did the tunnel walk . It was like scuba diving without getting wet.On an earlier visit we did the complete tour; the tunnel, the zoo, and the glass bottom boat. Each of them was great fun.

Experience the sea world around you. Great for children or people who don't live by the sea. It's a beautiful aquarium with many types of fish. Highly suggest to visit early mornings during a working week. On the weekend it can get really crowded.
Very nice experience. My husband and I visited this place for the fist time travelling from Abu Dhabi. We had great experience and would visit again.
Very instructivef!. You can decide to just see it from the mall or you can choose to go inside.You have different choice depending of your budget.

Disappointing. The queue was quite long and the tunnel was a bit of a let down. There are so many fish crammed into the tank it was insane. I didn't like how they are recreating algae and baby sharks and crocs... Just for the benefit of the zoo. Felt a bit like Jurassic Park all over again and that they were playing God. You also have to pay for extras all the time like photos, feed the fish, scuba dive... The main attraction were the crocs and penguins which I am sorry to say did not have big enough enclosures. The croc especially was ginormous and needed a much bigger tank. I left feeling very sorry for the animals and ripped off to be honest.

Excellent value!. It is one of the best things to visit in Dubai. Access is very easy since it is located inside the Dubai Mall and the metro service will take you directly to the mall. I took the Researcher Experience ticket for 100 AED. It was definitely a good choice and worth the price. We had an extremely nice and enthusiastic guide. She went an extra mile to show and tell us everything about the Aquarium and answered all our questions. The rest of the visit was on our own, without a guide so we could take all the time we needed to observe all the animals. Beautiful and great experience, especially for families.

Impressive!. This is located within the astonishing Dubai Mall and the 'wall' of fish that you see for free while you walk through the shops is amazing. The tunnel itself,which you pay to walk through, is good too but perhaps not quite so exciting as your first view of the aquarium. The underwater zoo is actually very good, with a guide who explains their breeding programmes for creatures such as seahorses. A really pleasant visit!

Worth a look. Well we enjoyed it and if you are in Dubai Mall, why not. Not too expensive given the high prices here. Kids will also love so many different marine variations. The first under water tunnel doesn't last very long but it then all comes together.
Take Your Time. This is an experience, not a walk through. Take in all the fish and sea life; go "behind the scenes"; talk to the otter, and for heavens sake see the croc.

amaizing!. the closest I have ever come so close to a shark and ray. the price was included in our 48-hour sighteseeng ticket. they are too smart for that. they have included in the ticket price. But it seemed like a small prize in a city that is expensive!
Great experience. Many kinds of sea specious. Very calm place.Have different packages extra charges for photo and gifts. Bit costly i think.Diving allowed if u have license.Overall good experience
Great for a day out. It is located in a very good mall and we had a great day out here and seeing the aquarium! Very recommended

The Jewell in the Crown of an expensive Shopping Mall. Worth a visit but bring plenty of money for the shops in this very expensive Mall. The Dubai Shopping Centre is a vast up-market shopping centre in the heart of Dubai.

Amazing aquarium!. Bought the basic tickets, with this package we could walk around the aquarium, which has lots of creatures including sharks and otters! We were able to go and see live feeding and behind the scenes where algae is grown etc. These tickets then allowed us to go upstairs to the zoo where there's a giant crocodile and penguins to name a few, we were here for hours. Can't recommend it enough, and you can buy the cheapest ticket.
Big Shark. Had some time to visit the mall and see the aquarium .... Amazing, search for the giant shark and get astonished!!Advise to spare not less than 3 hours to enjoy such visit

Great aquarium in Dubai Mall. Spent a couple of hours here and was very impressed. The ground floor underwater tunnel is great for a close up view of the Sharks and Rays although there were a few too many people but the 2nd floor displays are excellent, particularly King croc who is the largest crocodile I've ever seen. Amazing. Excellent use of a couple of hours.
Dubai Visit. Its little expensive if we compare with Indian money but its good experience for kids.with small kids you cant take full ticket which includes glass boat ride and diving

An amazing thing, not just the tunnel.. The tunnel is amazing with sharks, sting rays and countless fish swimming above you bu the best is yet to come! We only had basic entry tickets but was pleasently surprised when we went upstairs to the aquarium zoo, Very informative and very well displayed, Bring that camera!
Great aquarium. One of the best aquariums I have Sen. The fish are huge, colour full and in various shapes. The kids love it.

Good for young children below 3 years. I went with my nephew who is 14 months and he loved it. Through the tunnel and then the aquarium. It was short and sweet and kept him occupied for half an hour. I even enjoyed seeing some of the strange creatures. Better if you have entertainer vouchers.
Must see.. Also go on the boat ride around the aquarium. Not sure if it's expensive still. Maybe something like ten euro. but it's a good memory.

A great experience at the Dubai Mall.. We really enjoyed this gem of an aquarium and stayed for 3 hours along with the underwater zoo. The story of the moving of the crocodile pair from Cairns was so interesting. We loved it.
Extremely real life encounter!!. The sharks are extremely close!! You would imagine it is coming to get you :P I have been to aquariums around the world. Nothing as big and as rich as this one.
lovely water creatures. this aquarium and under water zoo is just so beautifull it has been well maintained and all ages groups can enjoy this place
Amazing. I could not believe that such a massive aquarium was based in a shopping mall! The fish are so close to you as you walk through the 'tunnel' the scenery is amazing
Nice Experience. Although one would expect a bigger setup, it is neatly done and and nice experience. Would recommend to visit should you be in the area.

Annual pass is worth it.. When we were among to take our year and a half old son to Aquarium, a colleague suggested to buy an annual pass. The pass was priced at AED 250 (not sure of current price) and it allows kids under 2 for free.That was Feb 2015 and since then it was kind of a weekly tour there to explore the fishes.We just completed our first year of membership and now all set to renew our passes.
Dont have to get in. Well the giant water front is the most amazing and it is for free, paying well get you through the tunnel above which is not bad but th wow is the open front panel

Best Aquarium. Journey begins with the underwater tunnel. Apart from the aquarium and zoo you can go for scuba diving with more than 100 species of fishes, take a glassbottom boat ride, feeding session with sharks.
Amazing. Another example of the magnificence of Dubai. The master tank had HUGE rays and sharks. One can only be in awe.
Small...Too small. It starts and ends. You have to appreciate the marketing, but the aquarium is saw here is a joke. Too Small
First visit. Very bug aquarium with very lot of différents fishes, very food for kids,We Also have lunch in Atlantis very food restaurant but expansive.
Worth visiting!. Aquarium was nice and you can see the fish and sharks very well. Fish feeding, seahorses and the crocodiles were also fun to see. We had the explorer tickets.
Fantastic!. Well worth a visit, the tunnel is fantastic. Best aquarium we have ever been to. Feeding the fish was a highlight and the big crocodile from Australia who really put on a show.
Wow. We got entrance free with a Emirates hop on hop off bus so couldn't complain but it was great never seen so many varied fish don't miss

Good experience. The outside view of the aquarium is free. However if you want to see it from the tunnel there is a fee. We took a package which also covered underwater zoo, glass bottom boat ride, educational tour and feeding area visit all for just 125 AED. It was part of some promotion going on as you would exit Burj Khalifa. I recommend to take this tour.

Watch from the mall... While you have the option to go through the aquarium and the underwater zoo at 100 AED each unless you are mad about fish or have children the view from out in the mall is just as good the aquarium tunnel is only about 100 meters and a little disappointing

Good - provided you like visiting Zoo. This is really amazing - in terms of having an underwater tunnel in the middle of a Mall. If you want to go inside you need to purchase tickets - different options like Explorer view, Sting Ray Feeding etc.
I enjoyed this as I love animals and zoos. On my visit I had availed Explorer Ticket.

Have to do in Dubai Mall. We spent a few hours in this place and its well worth it. It is fascinating to see so many fish small & large. They are so graceful. Feeding times in some parts of the aquarium are very entertaining and it's worth it to note the feeding times as you walk about.

For families. It's worth it for families. Otherwise, it's impressive but a little underwhelming. The walk through is immersive but quite a short stretch. The zoo itself is expansive for Dubai. Overall, worth it.

This is a must see. The best way to see this is to go on the 2 day sightseeing bus tour, The Aquarium & Underwater Zoo tickets are then free. The aquarium is located in the Mall. its one of the biggest in the world and has an amazing variety of fish, the under water zoo is upstairs in the same Mall and is also a must see.

One of the best aquariums . Visited here on a sight seeing day and would thoroughly recommend it. The variety of fish and the display methods are amazing, there were times you just wanted to sit and be mesmerised by the beauty of the fish and their surroundings.
Unbelievable!. Couldn't believe the collection of fish! Very good, clean...we also did the tour to learn how they maintain the Aquarium and fish, very interesting!

Shark dive. Very recommended and very clean. Before the dive the instructor will brief you and provide all details. He will of course join you.Fish will come very close to you and your bubbles. LIKE VERY CLOSE. But it's safe. You can only hire their camera (they will use)If your there then do not miss it.

Good if you love sea.. its a very well designed place. specially for kids they enjoy it a lot. don't forget to take the boating option. its worth watching from the top. very well managed and safe for family members.

Good acquirium a little expensive. Good acqurium a little expensive, also was a little rushed when doing the tour of the feeding areas etc as there were a number of groups waiting to go on the tour as well.

Was nice but over rated. The aquarium is nice, I think the best part of the whole aquarium is the passage where you can see the fish swimming over your head. Other than that, I have been at much better aquariums.
Take the kids. This is something you should do if you have kids. My One year old and 4 year old loved it very much. I also took the in-laws and they were in awe.

Can get costly. If you have a family, including all the extras on offer can make this quite expensive.You also get to see most of what is on offer as it is on display in the Mall, so if you were on a budget, I'd settle for that.However, there was plenty to see once you went inside and I suppose we spent a couple of hours there all together. I'm sure the kids would be happy to go again.
Visiting the malls of Dubai. Incredible to see an aquarium and underwater zoo in a shopping mall. Very well set out. Lots of variety of fish and animals.

More than a giant fish tank in a mall.. We were attracted by the giant fish tank, but wandered through the exhibits. Got to see some of the fish and other creatures from on top. It seemed strange to see penguins as part of the zoo. Signs are bi-lingual.

Expensive 400 dirhams (£80) for family of 4 but excellent. Expensive 400 dirhams (£80) for family of 4 but walk through tunnel gives excellent views of sea life. Behind the scenes tour included was informative. Didn't pay extra to feed the fish but the guide will do this on tour to show you agressive fish fight. Underwater zoo also included on ticket - Penquins crocodile, fish - all water base animals

Maybe we re too spoiled from living in Scandianvia. I think you pay more then what you get fo this one.. In Sweden´s west coat we have Havets hus. It´s cheaper and gibve you so much more than this. I think you pay more then what you get for this one. It´s really nice but to expensive to actually give you the value back.

unique place inside a mall. its a huge aquarium inside a mall which is a wonder. However the entrance to go inside is bit expensive , I guess its targeted mainly for tourists. there also needs more lighting since the aquarium is pretty dark. Understandable due to marine life is always in darkness. overall thumbs up.

Worh stopping by. Is inside the Dubai mall. I did not purchase a ticket to go inside but enjoyed the view from outside just as well. Had a large number of fish including a few sharks and sting rays. You can see that they offer a glass bottom platform if you go inside to see the fish up close, and watch a feeding. Also could see a open cage that you could go in with scuba gear. Was told you can even scuba into the aquarium itself but didn't see anyone do that while there.

Go on the glass bottom boat. The Aquarium is a nice way to spend an afternoon. We got the package which included the glass bottom boat which was one of the best parts about the aquarium! You can see so much more from above including the sharks and rays.We then went to the underwater zoo and saw various animals from Penguins to Jelly fish to the 5 metre King Crocodile. We even had the opportunity to stroke the starfish which was a cool experience.We finished our tour by walking through the underwater tunnel and taking a few photos.

INFORMATIVE.. A very well built and maintained Aquarium. They have a lot of varieties of fish there. The Zoo part is on first floor and is really worth every penny spent. The educative tour by guides there is very informative and shows us the effort taken by management for conservating the nearly extinct marine species.
Ok but not worth the money. If your in the mall you can visit the aquarium but it's only a 100 meters I would rather recommend that you visit Atlantis then this 2 minutes walk aquarium.
Definitely worth a visit. Do check this out if you are even a little bit interested in nature. It is a magic feeling to walk "with" the sharks and other fish in the underwater aile.

It's an ok experience . Seeing the aquarium from the mall invites us to go and experience it inside; and we decided to go with the explorer package.It is on the expensive side, but this is Dubai where EVERYTHING is expensive.The aquarium is not that long, but they have a good variety of marine life and it's slightly better than the aquarium in Berlin.The submersible simulator dan big screen theatre was a bit of a joke, but we did enjoy the underwater zoo, the king croc and glass bottom boat.Will I go see it again? Only from the mall side which is free.
To pass time. Tunnel walk is the only good thing to see. Cost around 38$ not worth it. Trip upstairs is not worth it.

Fascinating. This aquarium doesn't need to be described. You can see almost every kind of fishes even from outside. But being inside the tunnel is more exciting, especially when a shark stopped just above you head or in front of you. Feeding fishes is also a great exprience. However, photos for souvenir are very expensive.

Go PADI qualified . If you have the spare time and are PADI qualified. It's worth taking the time to do the PADI speciality. You get to spend a lot of time with so many species that you could spend years and 100+ dives and not see them all, especially so closely. It is a sad they are in a tank, but it is huge and clean. The end of the speciality is in a cage while they feed the Sharks, this in itself was a very good experience.
Fishyyyy. A very well made Aquarium/underwater Zoo, Very catchy, Get yourself photographed, A very exciting experience for children & The entire Family.

In the middle of Dubai Mall.. This is stunning. We viewed from the 'outside' having been to the aquarium in Sydney did not feel the need to pay entrance price. From our view point we could see all the life including divers feeding the fish. In amazIngly clean condition. Well worth a look.

Interesting -. I got an entrance ticket as part of my hop on/off bus tour and it was worth a visit. Some of the sea life can be seen from inside the Mall itself a huge glass wall but you get better views walking through the glass tunnels and then on to the other displays.

Amazing . I have been here many times with my family and we always love to visit this place it's beautiful and amazing the way they built this huge fish Aquarium and underwater zoo in Dubai mall it's breathtaking and underwater zoo is beautiful as well as bit scary with 2 huge alligators I will love to go again when I will visit Dubai next time if you are planing to visit Dubai you must visit this place and you must buy voucher book call entertainer DUbai with thousands of buy on get one free vouchers fir anything and everything

Awsome . The Positives points :1. The Design the place. 2. Many sea creatures. 3. Wide area to walk on. 4. Inside the mall. 5. Many area for taking pictures. The negatives points:1. The price. 2. The activities is not too many. 3. The number of guides staffs is law.
Superb . Very educational. Great for kids. Very conveniently located inside of Dubai mall.Highly recommend it.
Average Experience. Not up to the expectation. Staff member not friendly when explaining things around.No value for money and time spent.

Variety of Sea creatures... This place is in Mall of Dubai , tickets vary from choices of entertainment , but in 100 dirhamns you can visit aquarium and underwater zoo, good two hours of fun and entrainment , kids would love it .
Aquarium in a Mall. Amazing to see in the mall. Can be viewed from the mall or purchase a ticket and view closer. You can also take a boat trip on top of the aquarium - the kids loved it.

The water tunnel was nice but overpriced.. The water tunnel was nice. But otherwise it wasn't much different from any other aquariums.. Half of it was in a different level with no easy access or signs, so many might completely miss that part.

Exotic and different. This is a lovely place for both adult and children, to see a wide variety of creatures in the place, in a cool environment. You can take lots of photos. If you get a bus to the mall for 48hour s gives you free entry to the aquarium so it's worth it if you like to travel around I the bus to see lots of places.

Not so big just perfect. For our family of 4 it was just perfect as we were there for about 2 hours and seen lots of interesting creatures.On site They serve coffee to go so you can walk and drink coffee if you are coffe freak like me;)Defiantly worth visiting especially if you are traveling with kids!This is definitely more interesting to see than "Sealife" in England!

Sharks & Stingrays in the Mall. Set over 2 levels with a tunnel where sharks and stingrays are swimming over you. Take the full package and you can walk the tunnel (spend as long as you like in there, then up to second floor for the Zoo and research area. Was amazing...particularly King Croc. He was HUGE!!

Under Water but Over the Experience. One of the Thing you shouldn't miss if you Visit Dubai is Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. Especially for Kids is most exciting. Take high ticket enables you to have a feeding option for fish or entry to Zoo part and see the MEGA CROC.

Doesn't worth of payment. The aquarium is cool by itself, but the thing is you can see it for free. For an extra payment you'll be able to go inside for very short walk inside the aquarium. Most of people who came in together with us were saying something like "Is that all?!".Oh, and you'll get access to the souvenir store which is actually bigger, than the walk path inside the aquarium.So, my advice will be to enjoy it for free :)
This is Dubai.... Your children will be very happy to visit this beautiful place.very well done, full organized, secure. this is Dubay

Nice little attraction. From the various combos, we selected the Tunnel ride and the underwater zoo. The tunnel ride was short but it was filled with a large variety of fishes and its fantastic. The underwater zoo is large and again has a large variety. You would be tired by the end of it all.

The tunnel is awesome!. Best bits are the tunnel and the underwater zoo. The tunnel is truly awesome. The crocodile in the zoo is massive. So many beautiful fish. The glass bottom boat and pretend submarine are not that exciting.
Day trip with kids and friends. This is simply stunning. Its not cheap in Dubai, prices seem to have escalated recently, but you do get top quality here.

Not bad if you time on your hands. I bought the Explorer ticket which includes the aquarium entrance, the glass bottom boat ride and the zoo entrance. You might be surprised by the size of the aquarium, it's a tunnel of a 100 m length; quite beautifully made though.Staff were friendly and clear with the info and help.The glass bottom boat ride isn't that big a deal; u surf the aquarium for about 15 minutes and get to see the aquarium from up down.The zoo has some exotic sea animals; super cute.There are further options to your ticket (which I recommend you buy online); like feeding some fishes...The overall experience wasn't very impressive but kinda cool.

Go early, No queues.. This attraction takes about an hour to go around, and is good fun for adults and children alike. It is worth paying a little extra to go on the glass bottom boat. If you are really adventurous you can go scuba diving here! Plenty of fish including some sharks.

One of the best. I love aquariums, and I have visited few of well-known aquariums like the one in London, Toronto, NewYork and Greece. Dubai Aquarium is one of the best. It is located inside Dubai Mall. You will not miss it. Take your family and enjoy the beauty of Dubai Aquarium.

Amazing experience. Even though I am an experienced scuba diver and have dived all over the world I was amazed by this huge aquarium and by how close one got the the thousands of fish, rays and sharks when in the tunnel or at the top of the aquarium. Children and adults alike will be mesmerized!

Beautiful place to visit. Very good place and well designed , also the price is reasonable ,
if you are there its a good idea to visit Khalifa Tower and the dancing fountain

Amazing. Very fascinating, different types of fish in the Aquarium, and a very close view of underwater zoo.
It was an amazing experience to see different underwater species in the sameplace.
The stuff are very respective and patient towards all questions.

Money trap. To be honest with you I think the view from the outside is much better than the one from the inside- not to mention it's about £20 cheaper. My sister and I wanted to do the shark dive, unfortunately that cost came to around £200pp which we felt was very unreasonable for an aquarium dive. We decided to dive elsewhere in the ocean in the end. Get yourself a cupcake from upstairs from Lola's cupcakes where the seating is the near the aquarium glass and enjoy the view for less than £10 and a full stomach to go with it. In other words don't pay for entry unless you have money to burn.
worth a visiy. we visited the aquarium the same day as visiting the khalifi tower a long day with fantastic shops to strollround

Worth a visit, mostly childrens attraction. Nice place to visit with children. The fish tunnel and the outside are fun as you can see most fish and sharks from very very near. The rest of it ( the aquarium zoo) is mostly for children and not too special except for maybe crocodiles

Good weekday break. Went to see the King Croc and was genuinely astonished by the size of the reptile as well as the amazing video showing the story behind his coming to Dubai. The rest of the zoo is pretty normal, though very impressive in the layout and the sheer size of the aquarium. If you have the time, some good vantage points are offered to observe the ways of the different species on display...Did not try the other activities offered there. Good value when using the Entertainer on a bored weekday...
Woow. You never travel to Dubai without this amazing revue of Underwater Zoo. Experience for small and adults.
Interesting experience. Very nice entry, some cute fish species but limited variety. However the lab and research part of the project is quite note resting and unusual

Well worth it! . Go and see the Sharks! It's amazing and beautifully set up so you walk under the Rays and sharks, so much to see and marvel at. You can see the teeth...There are lots of levels and animals to see in and out of water, many species and it's well worth the money. If you pay more you can dive/swim etc and risk your life and limb!A lovely antidote to shopping!

Walk-through aquarium and visitor centre. Located in the Dubai Mall, you see a lot of what awaits you from the mall. A tunnel brings you through the fish's habitat. This is an escape from the buzz of the mall, but may be very busy itself.A King Croc awaits you in the zoo. After the tour of how they preserve coral, create fish food and manage the habitat, you get to see the croc. He's BIG!!

Crazy about fish. We enjoyed the underwater adventure. There are a few options to choose and we picked the less expensive and had a great time. There was my wife, adult daughter and me taking the tour. It was nice to take your time and look at all the underwater creatures.

Good for both children and adults. Staff are well informed and happy to answer questions. Lots of options and always something new to see or do- I've done the behind the scenes tour, glass bottomed boat and school trip and all have been successful.
Must to be here. If you are in Dubai you have to see it.Very interesting ,A lot of what to see. Huge crocodile,many sharks. I woud go again.

World Underwater!. The Dubai Aquarium was one of the best places I have ever been too. It amazed me with its vast species of fishes in the tunnels and others. The tunnel was my personal favourite and I would recommend it to tourists and those who love sights of nature.
Very Interseting . Very nice, lots of sea creatures to see. I enjoyed the above aquarium boat trip to have amazing overview. Organization is amazing, staff well trained, kind and warm welcoming.

Fab, but quite expensive. We took the researcher tour and it was brilliant. Not sure how real it all is but the guide was informative and the behind the scenes tour was excellent, especially seeing the baby jellyfish, sea horses and the grown up tuna. Perfect for the young scientists in your family, but not cheap for a family of four, hence slightly reduced grading.

Amazing find in the Dubai Mall. We spent a delightful few hours wandering around the aquarium and underwater zoo. There is lots to do there and it's amazing to think this is in the middle of a shopping centre.We got our tickets from a sales rep in the Burj Khalifa shop and saved a few pennies.

In the Heart of the Ocean. At the heart of the Dubai Mall you can find these impressive aquarium which makes you feel in the middle of the ocean. You can also rent scuba diving services to dive into the aquarium in the midst of many types of sea life including sharks, hammer heads and amazing animals. Very worth seeing it and participating.
just nice. Not worth the money, but nice anyway, specially for young children. The aquariums at the end of the tour, with beautiful creatures have a lot in common.

Wow!. We didn't pay to go in - we heard that the inside was designed mainly for kids. We did however wander around the tank through the mall watching the fish. Such a huge aquarium filled with some beautiful fish. Worth a visit if you can find it in the supersize mall!

Indoor attraction well worth a visit. We live in Dubai and have an annual visit to the Aquarium especially on those hot humid days as we tend to spend our few rainy days outside making the most of it. There is lots to see and they keep adding attractions to it every year.You can just walk around the outside of the aquarium and will get a good view of the divers cleaning the tank and this is free. You can just buy a ticket for the shark tunnel, skip all the business and crowds of people if you do this as they usually arent queuing just looking. Or you can buy an aquarium ticket with the shark tunnel. We have done the glass bottomed boat trip and the fish feeding both worth it as the children get to see so much. The glass bottomed boat is not in a vast amount of space but the children get up close and personal with the fish. I usually let my 3 rush their way round it knowing I will catch up with them at the cave style glass globe which they can crawl into and be part of the fishes scenery.We then usually backtrack through and take a good look at everything once their excitement of being in there has diminished. Upstairs is bugs and a mini forest again good for the legs to let off a bit of steam. It is probably one of the only place in Dubai where the gift shop is situated before you can actually exit but no fear there are bits and bobs of memorabilia you can pick up for the 30 dhs mark - around 5 UK pounds.My favourite is the otters and the enormous crabs. You can spend as long as you want in here and do not feel pressured to buy extra extra extra. Again the 2 for 1 entertainment book vouchers are great and it keeps the costs down.So much more to do after in the mall itself and if you time this well you can get the free fountain show in the early evening.
Amazing...must visit. Fantastic attraction to visit. Entrance in shopping mall...massive fish tank on display. Fascinating displays .Very interesting.

Otter encounter was brilliant. We bought the otter encounter ticket which included entry to the underwater zoo and aquarium tunnel, the otter encounter was about 30mins, we were in a small group and the encounter centred around education which was really interesting and the otters were so clever and cute! The whole experience took about two hours, the underwater zoo had loads of creatures, including fish, frogs, penguins and a salt water croc. Not your typical mall visit but well worth it. (The encounter ticket cost approx £40 which included tunnel and zoo entry)

Interesting. if i can recall my experience correctly, the aquarium in Singapore is slightly better than this. however, it is still very good. a lot to see and to get little closure to the animals. it is recommended to any first timer visiting Dubai.
a good outing ... its not too bad ... kids will probably love it ... also helps that you can manage the burj khalifa and the dubai fountains at the same place ...

really good place to visit. went to see the the aquarium with my mum and cousin on a visit to see my dad who works in dubai, after watching this being built on the discovery channel was really good to actually walk through and see the finished result. basic package was brilliant for us as we were just there for a few hours walking round, seeing the animals in the main tank. then going upstairs to see the top of the tank area where the crew work feeding the animals and marines research they carry out. for a little bit extra ya can even feed some of the fish in the special viewing area at the top in side the main tank. once you have walked around you can then go and see the zoo area with all kinds of different fish and animals from the area, with the 2 largest crocodiles i have eve seen. get up close with penguins who will play with you while swimming in there enclosure. this is something that is a really good thing to see specially for kids who love to see all the snails and feed the fish. well worth a visit if you have a few hours.

Amazing fish tank - the biggest I've seen!. This is a great aquarium - a bit different from others, mainly because it's in the middle of a shopping mall - but it still offers a great variety of aquatic life, amazing big fish tank and many different things to see - great for kids!

The biggest fish tank I have ever seen. The variety of sea creatures and the shear size of it is impressive. We went on the behind the scenes tour, which gives you a great insight into how you manage a tank on this scales, highly skilled, very clever.

Best way to sea up close sharks for kids. Well suited in the Dubai mall, the aquarium & underwater zoo is worth the visit, if you have small children and want them to understand and explore aqua life from sharks to large scale crocodiles. A bit expensive, but worth the full tour.

Lots to See. This is an amazing place to vist. If you wantca different day to beach sun this is it. There is lots of fish reptiles to see you walk through underwater tunnel at first with sharks and fish all round you it is fab. You can take uour time then you go on to enter another part with so many different types of sea life to view again the surrounding is fab. There is a rainforest cafe inside to if you get hungry. Children and adults just love it. Worth the money

One of the most interesting places to visit while in Dubai.. To me the Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo is one of the most interesting places to visit in Dubai.There are many advantages of the venue - family or solo, paid or free, while shopping or dedicated visit - the aquarium offers unique experience and enjoyable time to spend. Just stopping outside the enormous window glass, watching hundreds of not thousands of sea creatures wandering in the waters, makes you to forget everything around. Special attraction is the feeding time when divers feed the sea creatures. For those willing to spend some reasonable fee the joy proceeds with entering the underwater tunnel. The view of sharks and skates just a centimeters away is unforgettable. With the same ticket you can proceed to the upper level into the zoo where many of us for the first time meet the cute penguins, the dangerous piranhas and many more known and unknown water animals from different corners of the world. I saved for the next visit to try the raft with transparent bottom. And for the bravest and able to do it and to spend more an aqualung dive is on offer. To me the aquarium rivals as experience the Burj Khalifa observation desk visit. Luckily they are next to each other and compliment one another.
Good Experience. Good experience and not so expensive. For some extra money you can dive with the sharks and feed them. You can see, inside, the biggest crocodile in captive.

Nice activity with the kids. Nice aquarium with feeding the fishes - fun for the kids - It is in the mall so you can eat after the visit. Very nice staff but it was a little crowdy.You can peek at the fishes from the side front before deciding to buy a ticket.

Fishy encounters!. Amazing .Loved the glass bottom boats with huge fish coming right upto you.Very reasonable ,approx £20 includes boat ride,walk through amazing aquarium and underground zoo with penguins ,crocodiles and much more!

Fantastic. Dubai Aquarium is a breathtaking one,as you will be attracted since you see the aquarium from Dubai mall and you will love the experience when you book a ticket and visit it from inside and to have the chance to feed the sharks and to also check the zoo...
Dubai Mall. You have a very good view of the Aquarium from the Mall, without having to pay an entrance fee. Easy to get to by Metro, but can be a family long e=walk from the station to the Mall.
Very Good. Very good to see it from the inside, and do recommend to get on the boat and to check the fish from above

Amazing . I really enjoyed this. Very reasonably priced approx €12 and it spans over two stories and is situated inside Dubai mall. A huge array of different fish etc and they gave the biggest stingray crabs and sharks I have ever seen. The penguins also provide some entertainment for you!!

waste of time & energy. Exhibits are not worth paying AED 120 to see, the best view is from outside. The tunnel walk is overrated and zoo is so-so. King Croc exhibit is additional charge, so all over much ado about nothing.The best part is if you had never seen anu aquarium and don't have time then its a good option. Since I had seen quite a few so for me its waste of time & money.
Large Aquarium. I have never seen this type of large aquarium in my life in which lots type of fishes and sea animals .it was really great experience which has no words..
Must see. Great experience. What's more interesting than the aquarium itself is the zoo next to it. It is a kind of a small zoo with different types of animals. Highly recommended
Nice view. Inside the Dubai mall, I visited the aquarium. Since I had seen Atlanta aquarium, I did not feel this as good. But first time visitors will enjoy this.

Never disappointed!!. Had several visits to the aquarium, always take the full tour and never felt bored or the kids complained.
Always worth it.

Breathtaking!. I'm a lover of aquatic life so when my husband took me to the aquarium I was thrilled! Seeing the sheer massiveness of the water life left me speechless. The glass boat ride, water zoo, and underwater aquarium was definitely worth it!! You feel like you can touch the sea life!!

Fabulous!. This is a great aquarium with lots of marine life represented. It is well maintained and the information boards are easy to read and well researched.
The highlight is walking through the underwater tunnel.
We thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
Experience of underwater in a mall. You get the full experience of aquatic life and underwater feeling but in a mall. This is an amazing feat to build such an aquarium in a mall

Decent priced and good to kill time. This is great to kill time when in Dubai. the price wasn't too bad and the sights were good. We went whilst in the mall but I probably wouldn't go out of my way just to go to it.

Worth visiting with children !. It is situated in the Dubai Mall and the Aquarium can be viewed from the Mall itself without buying the ticket.
This was included as part of our trip. Mostly tourists and others with children were excited with the Aquarium and zoo.
It is worth visiting whilst in Dubai.

The most impressive thing . The most impressive thing is that this aquarium is in the middle of a shopping centre. No need to pay to walk in the tunnel as you see more fish from the outside. I did enjoy the glass bottom boat ride although it was a very short circuit. There were several different sea creatures to see inside but only one touch/feel area. It's not some thing i would pay to see again

A Benefit of Hop In Hop Off Bus. We would have been disappointed if we had paid for an expensive ticket to go through the aquarium, but it was free with a 48 hour ticket from the City Sightseeing Dubai Hop on hop off bus tour. The walk through is lovely because we could see a lot of different species of fish, but our home town has an award winning zoo and aquarium - the best in the US - so it's hard to compete with that. This activity would be really good for families because kids could learn a lot while enjoying the sights. I rated it a three as if I had paid for the ticket.

Not worth it !. Exhibits are not worth paying AED 100 to see, the best view is from outside. The tunnel walk is overrated and zoo is so-so. King Croc exhibit is additional charge, so all over much ado about nothing.

Underwater Zoo is Great !!!. Dubai Aquarium "tunnel" is a little bit short.. Almost similar view outside (without pay)...
The most thing and your family will enjoy is the Underwater Zoo... Explorer type will be enough,,

THE SEA WORLD AT YOUR FEET.. It was exhilarating just seeing the gigantic fishes including sharks,eels and other sea creatures swimming freely in this giant aquarium within the mall. it was a wonderful sight - the sea world brought to your feet for your entertainment.
Should not be your first choice. Was very disappointed specially for the aquarium, was expecting more, too expensive for the value you get

Tunnel of the Aquarium - a must watch!. The Aquarium can be seen from outside without paying anything, so naturally the question arises why anyone should pay 100AED to just go through the tunnel. This was the question we had when we finally said "lets see what the 100AED offers extra" and we were impressed with what it did.First - Yes, you can see the aquarium from outside and appreciate it, but you cannot get near enough to click meaningful photos. Second, the tunnel experience is so different and unique to justify the ticket price. It is indeed spectacular to see the sharks swimming just about 3 feet from you. You can even see the sharks and rays from their under-side and the feeling is literally as though you are in a glass enclosed submarine. Third - The underwater zoo is brilliant with a huge octopus and not to be missed - King Croc - the monstrous crocodile. So, if you can spare 2 hours, I recommend to buy tickets and enjoy the aquarium, if you are in a hurry then don't waste the money!We took the explorer package priced at 100AED per person and entered the tunnel. The tunnel provides a close view on the swimming fishes, sharks and rays and provides ample photo opportunities. Be mindful that there is a blue tinge in the tunnel and make sure to apply the correct WB correction to photos. It is a wonderful experience to get so close to the fishes and fully appreciate the marine life. We could see divers feeding and cleaning the aquarium. The tunnel is short but it took us a lot of time to cover it as we were lost in the water-world. Exiting the tunnel, you have to get to the second floor where you are taken to the top of the aquarium and the staff explain some interesting facts about the aquarium along with a live demo of how the fishes are fed. You can see incubators, food processing bays, shark feeding cages, etc. and learn a bit more on how this huge aquarium is managed. This tour takes about 10-15 mins and then you are sent to the Underwater zoo area in second floor.The underwater zoo is a collection of various aquariums with different types of sea animals for display. There are very different kinds of fishes, turtles, otters, frogs, crabs, etc. It is a treat to watch so many colorful fishes and sea animals. Do not miss the KRACKEN - A huge Octopus - we were allowed to touch and feel the tentacles - that was amazing! The highlight of the underwater zoo is the monstrous King Croc. It is 5 meters in length and weighs 500 Kg. The Crocodile is enormous and there is a queen croc as well. This is the most crowded place and the last attraction in the zoo. It is almost unbelievable that such a giant creature even exists today. The croc is fed around 4pm so, it is worthy to be around at that time.Dubai Aquarium is very different from the Lost chambers aquarium at the Hotel Atlantis. Both are unique and offer different experiences. Many people (including us) are confused which is better, but honestly if you are going with kids, then I recommend to include both in your itinerary. Reserve at least 2 hours for the Dubai Aquarium and 3 if you also want to include the glass bottom boat.

Superb Aquarium. I would not normally have bothered going to an aquarium but we had complimentary tickets so decided to use them. What a great aquarium with so many species of unusual fish and of course the delightful penguins. Particularly enjoyed the huge viewing panel and underwater tunnel - totally wonderful. Everything was so well presented and was great because even if you don't want to go into the aquarium you can view the massive fish tank from inside the Dubai Mall. Kids will love it.

Meet the King Croc. The king croc is the main attraction apart form the underwater view... For those who have visited Santhoosa this is pretty small... you can also take a boat ride and feed the fish..

Spectacular feature of this shopping mall. Spectacular feature of the shopping mall, and a great place to visit whilst shopping. If you are taking a hop-on hop-off bus trip, entrance to the aquarium is included.

This is rather a rip off!. You can stand outside and see just about everything without paying 100 AED plus. The concept is great and from outside you can see almost all the fish. Everything else is pretty uninteresting and an uncharacteristic (for Dubai)money trap starting with 200 AED for a photograph of oneself followed by displays of cheap trinkets. Maybe great for young kids but unlike everything else we have seen here not good value.
Lovely. Very Very new and cool attraction, all animal are kept n very different and best suitable area.Worth for MoneyGood for Kids

Kids will love it....and most adults.. Entrance to the Aquarium and Underwater zoo was included with a city tour, so very good value, the Aquarium tunnel was very short and you could see just as much in the mall, but the Underwater world was a a revelation, we were not expecting much but we we very pleasantly surprised , very well laid out lots to see, the otter enclosure was lovely, I thought the penguin enclosure was a tad small fo the amount of penguins there and that was my only criticism otherwise would have given it an excellent.

Ocean Fantasies. One of the best places I have gone to. The beauty is breath-taking. A lot of information and details about the life under the sea.Very beautiful and enticing. The tunnel is peaceful. the sharks and fishes live in peace. I've been here loads of times. It is after all the biggest Aquarium in the Biggest Mall

Good One !!!. We went to this lovely Aquarium on 03rd Feb 2016 after visiting Burj Khalifa, the whole of Dubai Mall was wonderful, Entrance fee of 100 Dhirams for walking through the glass tunnel which was awesome, then we have to go to 2nd floor where under water Zoo was located with beautifully designed Aquarium with natural environment. Must visit for all age groups when we are in Dubai, please take your camera as it offers a lot of opportunity to take fabulous photos and videos to cherish.
So many different animals!. It was probably the less overcrowded attraction than everything else. It's really interesting because they explain how they grow the fish, how they feet it and more.

Good aquarium. Enjoyed our visit. Good for little kids with lots of variety and species. Keeping large crocs in small captivity not great though. There is a 'behind the scenes' tour at the start of the visit, which we thought was best avoided if you've got little ones (like us). Left half way through and started our walk through the aquarium as our 2 year old's patience was totally lost within minutes. Wasn't clear that you didn't have to endure this, worth knowing you can politely decline this if it doesn't suit. But overall, this is a great aquarium.
