Fun Afternoon at The Dubai Aquarium. We enjoyed the many exhibits and especially the extra tour on top of the giant tank. There you will learn how they feed the fish and also how small fish are bread to feed larger fish. The small group of about 10 allowed for questions and the guide was knowledgable and spoke English well. The rest of the Aquarium was so-so but still worth the time in my opinion. The fish tunnel was the highlight but other exhibits were good too if you take the time. A small coffee shop allowed us to take a break and get off our feet. It's not expensive-consider the add-on tours.

needs a "quick walkthrough" option. with limited time, we ended up not seeing it, because the shortest package was an hour, would have been great to have a minimal package that just allowed a walkthrough the tunnel and out, but saying that, even from outside, its an experience worth seeing
Just WooW. You must check out the crocodile they got inside its just unbelievable. so many interesting things to do, see and learn. I highly recommend this place for everyone

love the water zoo. This attraction is located in dubai mall the biggest mall in the world and burj Khalifa the tallest building in the world, so this attraction is having the biggest fish tank in the world too,Well you will start by walking through the tank and you can see the sharks, and huge fish swimming over your head, then you proceed to the fish zoo, you will be able to feed the fish and see hundred types of fish, you can see behind the tank how they take care of the fish health and how they prepare the food, finally you can dive with the sharks with the support from the zoo divers
WOW..... 11 meters high and 50 meters long........10 millions liters of water.you pass in the midle of the sea fish...

good experience. Loved walking through the tunnel with stingrays, sharks etc swimming over you head and along you. Worth a visit, we paid about £20 each. We took the hop on hop off bus the next day and we could have gained free entry with our bus tickets.

Feeling a bit let down..... We have high hope for the famed aquarium with the world's largest panel but felt a bit let down with the overall experience when compared to those we visited in Australia or even Malaysia for instance...
The glass bottom boat ride and the sea otter presentation were the highlights to us ....

Great experience but what a rip off. We entered as part of the Big Bus Tour with tickets valid for entry to the Aquarium. However when we finished the visit we decided to purchase the photo of our group at a cost of what we thought was less than £10. I have just opened my visa bill and it actually cost £53!!!! Ouch what a rip off. How can they really justify that cost. I have contacted them to complain and will wait for a response.

Fabulous mall with an amazing aquarium. A trip to the Dubal Mall is worthy of more than one visit. At the heart of the mall is the aquarium. You will certainly spend some time gazing at the plethora of fish. If you are lucky, divers may be in the tank.

Always impressive for young kids, boring for older ones. This was my second visit with the family in the space of two years. My son, 7 now, was less impressed this time but still liked the experience. I guess though that this will be the last time he agrees to come unless they introduce something new to it.

The Kids will love it!. What a concept! Could honestly watch this all day! The children will love it, the size of the mammals and fish are unbeleivable,. Even the most dedicated shopaholic will stop for a while to look at this amazing spectacle.

Awesome experience, must visit for kids. The experience of going through the aquarium is unforgettable, with all sizes of aquatic species like stingray, sharks, star fishes etc etc..the underwater corridor thru the aquarium is something kids will not forget. The ride in the glass bottom vessel is something which can be ignored as the area is restricted but the overall experience is nothing short of awesome.

Fabulous ! Mother Nature at her best - many thanks. Our afternoon at the Dubai Aquarium And Underwater Zoo went 'swimmingly' (excuse the pun on words haha) - the ground floor Aquarium Tunnel corridor where we began, made us feel as though we were swimming with the 15' -18' or so swaying Sharks, majestic Rays, and several superb specimen of healthy and sometimes 'curious' fish - Up two flights of escalators was the underwater Zoo where a glorious afternoon was spent watching the Otters playing, the bright yellow fish fry swimming spontaneously while being separated but next to their parents, the large alien looking crabs, the colourful jellyfish and a myriad of other sea life and water creatures. The climate of the day was the family of Crocodiles - Dad was said to be about 30' long and at a mature 40 years of age he turned out to be a bit of a 'Sugar daddy' as his life partner whom had just become the proud parent of 12 little baby crocs, was herself said to be 80 years old!! The Mother croc had one eye open as if 'keeping an eye on me' while I filmed three of her offspring cutely fighting each other for the heat lamp ! How delightful they all were! The animals where all well kept and in an appropriate environment for their natural habitat - The tanks were well maintained and we saw some frogmen in their diving suits swimmIng IN the Aquarium with the Sharks in order to suck up the debris at the base in order to keep the water at the correct levels : A real MUST DO in my opinion folks - especially if you appreciated The Animal Kingdom as I do - EnjoyEven if you don't enjoy the 'Animal' stuff, the Dubai Mall in which the Aquarium and zoo is situated, is also well worth a trip with all it's Designer shops and International Cafes. Hope you have a glorious time ✨
Amazing!!. Just Amazing!! Loved the aquarium & the animals in them. One of the biggest aquarium that i have visited.
I was in awe. The Aquarium and Underwater Zoo is a must see, at least once. You get to see so many species of fish, birds and reptiles, with information on each of these to add to your knowledge.

Very interesting place. Dubai Aquarium is amazing contains different types of fishes which some of them I have never seen before. It is really worth it to visit although it is expensive but still worth it to see.The zoo is very attractive especially the very small animals they have. but the most great part which is my favorite is the Penguin's area, waw it is super nice, I'm ready to spend hours watching them.
Amazing. Well worth a look this is situated at Dubai Mall worth paying to go under the Aquarium and onwards to a further attraction of animals would go again. We loved it

A unique expensive journey?... I do think so. But we must go there? Well, if you're in the Mall with your family, taking a shopping ride or simply looking around at the nice fancy shops.. go there, but prepare your wallet. Too expensive? No, but.. And whenever we place a "but", some doubts stayed in your mind. If they stayed, for sure they had a reason. :)The place is very nice and you can see grand part of it, outside. Prices?Between Eur 25 (Usd 28) and Eur 49 (Usd 55).. per person.Guys, i like very much to see fishes (my father was a fisherman) but to pay Eur 75 for 3 persons?.. i prefer to go to a nice restaurante and eat the fish! If my son wan to see a fish alive? Well, i pick up one from the river and give it to him or simply go to the nearest Aquarium in my hometown! :)Cheers
Beatiful. Just looking from the mall, this was spectacular. A lot of different species, including sharks and napoleon fish.

Very interesting. I was surprised by the Aquarium as i thought it was just the tunnel, it is far more if you do the whole package, each floor has exhibits and the top floor has a glass bottom boat. Me and my daughter really enjoyed it, worth a visit.
Excellent attraction. You can just go round the aquarium or go diving with the sarks it is up to you how much you want to experience

Expensive expereince. Yes, the aquarium and the zoo are both in the Dubai mall!!! Entrance fees are super expensive and I wish they would've offer package for family who would like to visit for places on the same day. The walk through the tunnel is very short and there are way too many of those annoying "stops" from the staffs who would take your kids and had them make cheesy pose to take pictures and they would do some photoshop and sell the picture at an exorbitant price. Overall it's quite an experience for the kids as well as for the adults and despite the price, I would say it should be included in your "to-visit" list in Dubai.
Expensive FIsh. I love aquariums but found this one to just be bigger than others but not more exciting. Very expensive entrance fee. If you have kids great day out.

Aquarium in a Mall. Perhaps only in Dubai- a large aquarium in the Dubai Mall, including a ride on a glass-bottom boat, with numerous species of fish - other display areas for sea creatures and a giant crocodile and his mate - interesting film on how the croc was delivered to Dubai.
Excellent. Walking through the tunnel is nice and you can make good photos. The underwater zoo is interesting, too. Many species that live in and around the water. A good excursion.
Very Enjoyable 2 hours!. They have over 33,000 sea creatures! We rode the glass bottom boat, walked through the tunnel, enjoyed the underwater zoo an relaxed from the chaos outside in the mall!
Expensive but worth they effort. The visit was worth, however ther were too many add ons.... Why can't they just be upfront t with the price and offer better discounts for those who want it all!

An aquarium in a shopping centre. If you like fish this is the place for you
Site in a restaurant or wander around to watch hundreds of fish from small to large
Better Than we Thought!. Great attraction in the Dubai Mall, the tour was much better than we thought it would be. Very informative and enjoyable. Well worth the price of admission.
Attractive to see. The aquarium is very attractive to see. It is quite expensive but the kind of experience you will get is worth-ed.
Spectacular. Never seen such collection of marine life before, specially recommended for children's, they will be thrilled and won't let you leave .

Well done. We only visited the aquarium/zoo as we had free entry as part of our hop on/ hop off bus tour and we are glad we did. Situated in the middle of the mall the walk through aquarium is certainly a sight to behold. After passing through the aquarium you are directed to check out your photo and then take the escalator up two floors to the zoo. This wasn't signposted very well and it took us a while to find the entrance. The "zoo" part is very well done, and the fish and other creatures are very visible. I had to laugh at the info sign for the kookaburras, stating that they were native to "Papua New Guinea, Australia, and Tasmania". Well worth the visit, perhaps next time we will upgrade to the explorer section.

Amazing . Absolutely amazing The biggest single pane of glass in an aquarium in the world.Thousands of fish species and of course the sharks are menacing and imposing.It's a tad pricey so look for voucher books and coupon dealslocated in the mall it's easy to find as it's not hard to miss
Worth a visit. Great day with the kids, they loved seeing all the different fish. Staff were very helpful and informative

Tropical visit in mall. Really enjoyed it. We took the Explorer trip for just 20 dhs more than the basic ride and it included the simulator and boat ride The animals and fish exhibition was great lots to learn and seeWouldn't recommend feeding the fish
Interesting mix of sea life. It was interesting to see all the various fish in their special tanks. I think the huge tank in the mall which is like a large movie screen was amazing.

Huge aquarium. Nice and huge aquarium and pretty fish and another water live
very attractive place for young children

Impressive but expensive. The aquarium can be seen in the Dubai mall to everyone. However, if you want to go the underwater zoo, you have to pay the entrance. The whole is very impressive and gives you chills if you never did something similar before. It's even more impressive if you check online how the place was built ! The Underwater zoo is a bit pricy though and it's quite a short walk though... but it's pretty cool :)
Very attactive. It will be very attractive for both children and parents.Beautiful fishes and nice place to discover under water world.
Well worth a visit. The aquarium is very impressive in size and variety and number of fish / creatures – don’t miss the zoo part very interesting.

Enjoyable visit. We were traveling with our elderly (one of them with wheelchair)The Q was long bcos it was Friday (weekend), only 2counters were opened. If you want to avoid the Q, u can purchase the ticket online but bcos we were using the entertainer voucher,(buy1free1) we had to stay on the line. We paid 140dhs for 4ppl which only access to tunnel & aquarium zoo. Also limited access for wheelchair. Will then walk passed the grand aquarium outside, it was wonderful & beautiful. Then go thru the tunnel wich was abt 10m long. You able to find sharks, stingrays & lots of fish. Then proceed to aquarium zoo wich located on 2nd level. It was wonderful experience.

Small and Crowded. We started at the ocean museum, the fact that you go behind the scenes and watch as they actually take care of the fish is quite nice. Our guide rushed a lot and within 5 mins we were on the actual exposition hall. The place was very crowded, so if you wanted to actually look into every tank you'd have to spend a lot of time waiting. The exposition wasn't very big at all, so we thought maybe the aquarium would be better. On the opposite, the aquarium is just a little tunnel with fish arround you. Very dissapointing for the price.

Awesome experience. Having seen a few aquariums around the world, was dubious at first what to expect. Was a fantastic few hours of fun & have 100's of photo's to remind us of what a truly fantastic job they have done in Dubai to bring so many different species together in one place.Strongly recommend for families.

Excellent attraction. The actual aquarium looks more spectacular from the outside than the inside.......never the less packed with fish and diving opportunities available if that's your thing...,,,The aquarium part was a wonderful gem of a place and an opportunity to see creatures you wouldn't normally see in a zooLovely and clean, no queues, great value
Stunning!. Best experience in dubai..... Loved the underwater experience.We hadn't done scuba diving ever.... overall fantastic...

It's ok. We enjoyed our visit to the aquarium, which is inside the Dubai shopping mall. There's a walkthrough tunnel to see a big variety of fish. However we had already been in the Atlantis Palm aquarium, which I have to say was so much better. The zoo is 2 floors up, which is a bit weird. It's not very big and feels quite crowded.

Bit to expensive. Visited 06/02/16 with my two boys, variety of experiences to choose from ranging from 100UAE to I think around 250 UAE. Not sure I would see the experience as value for money myself but each to their own. Judge for yourself. The shark tunnel was awesome and the huge croc is fascinating to watch.
Loved the Break in Scenery. When you have been walking and shopping for hours the Aquarium is a nice break. I loved that collection of deep sea animals.

worth paying for ticket, but you can also see it for free from outside.. Aquarium is inside of Dubai Mall. We chose to pay for tickets and we do not regret it.Walking inside the tunnel where only centimeters divide you from open mouth of a shark is unforgettable experience. My kids were both scared and excited -and not only them. That comment comes from experienced diving family :)It is also worth to take the trip by boat for little extra on the top and see the zoo.We did not dive with sharks due to limited time, high cost and my wife protests :) for me wanting to take the kids diving with us :) but seeing divers inside next to sharks was also experience. Let me just say after walking through tunnel I agreed with my wife that asking for diving with kids among the sharks was a bit too much to ask her for :)If you like under water animals you will love the place - and sharks are of course top interest. Do not miss 750 kg croc :)If you are not sure, you can check out aquarium by peeking from outside for free - and then decide but in my opinion if you can afford it- it is one of best things to see in Dubai. We did not wait in line at all. You can also combine it with Burj Khalifa and Fountains.

its really not animal zoo but underwater fish & crocodile. many types of fishes some are big,different shapes ,different colors some you may see it first time in life & huge pair of crocodile donot miss to see for adult its depend upon your test to see Aquarium but for kids its worth to see

wow!. For visitors, who have never been snorkeling or scuba diving, this gives a dramatic view of what is "down there" in the ocean.This aquarium gives the Mall a special touch, as this aquarium is very special with a large variety of fish life.

Average Aquarium, stay on the outside. We got free tickets through the big bus tour. The cool thing about the aquarium is that it is in the mall.. But I would not pay mooney for the entrance ticket. It is nice to see from outside, and you don`t really need to go inside.. They got a big 750 kg Crocodile, but else wise it is pretty average.
Aquarium. It was very good you get to see a lot and it is very big you can go in the tank and feed the fish. Great few hours.

Close encounters of a Jaws kind!. We purchased the Researcher ticket which entitled us to a walk through the underwater tunnel, a view of 'Behind the Scenes of the Aquarium, and a visit to the Underwater Zoo. It was quite scary to walk through the tunnel and come literally face to face with a shark and to see its rows of razor-sharp teeth. The Rays were beautiful and the size of the Groupers was amazing. The Behind the Scenes Tour was very interesting and a pleasure to see what care they are taking to look after and breed the fish. There is even a hospital and maternity ward - but visiting hours were over! The underwater zoo was well laid out with close ups of beautiful tropical fish, giant rays and other fish. The highlight was another close encounter, this time with 'King Croc" a 5m Crocodile that had been brought over from Cairns Australia. The sheer size and power of this animal is awe inspiring. My only reservations were the Otter and the Beaver sections. I felt that the Otters were trying to find a way out of their concrete environment. They had water to swim in but I felt that there could have been some grass or plants to make it seem more like home. I also felt that there were too many beavers for the size of tank - bearing in mind that their native habitat is the woods and rivers of North America.

Great Fun. My son loves fish so we had to go in the Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. It was quite nice to start off with but the first section is quite small but when you go upstairs for the second bit, that's not too bad. It's a good experience and not too many people to make you feel rushed. They have a massive crocodile there which is worth the visit alone.
Nice but. Nice aquarium, but pity one has to go through a massive shopping mall (a real pain for someone who hates shopping malls).

Interesting. We went for the cheapest 100 AED tickets. Great mini tour of the workings and conservation programme of the aquarium. Mini zoo also good. They have one huge alligator. We still felt a. Bit guilty about enjoying seeing the animals in such a restricted habitat.

Fun for your Kids. It is just like any other Underwater Zoo only Attraction that makes it stand out is its 750 kg Crocodile and Penguins. You have a long tunnel and a walk in tour after the tunnel . There are 5 to 6 Packages you can have a pick from it . It is a bit costly but you can go for it if you have never watched it before. It will be fun for your kids .It is situated in Dubai Mall only . You have metro connectivity too.

Dubai Mall Aquarium. The Dubai Mall Aquarium and underwater zoo is something really worth seeing when visiting the mall. The zoo is situated on the upper level and has species from the Amazon and other parts of the world. The main attraction is the king crocodile. He is really huge. On the lower level is the aquarium, hosting a vast variety of sea creatures. Really worth seeing especially if you have kids.
Fabulous place. It was wonderful look and great place to visit who couldn't get into deepsea. Amazing and good view arrangements.

Beautiful . The aquarium is absolutely gorgeous in the mall. You walk by and see walls of this beautiful aquarium. We got a combination ticket for the aquarium and zoo. Great family outing. Reasonable priced. Allow yourself at least 2 hours to do both attractions. They take good care of the animals and aquatic life. If pushed for time, skip this one.
Nice. From the I.st floor of the mall to the ground floor you can see it for free and take good photos as well

Just okey. We paid 100aed to visit the aquarium and the zoo. The aquarium was huge with gigantic rays and few sharks. We visited in some area where the quide told us how they are producing food for fisch and more fish and how the aquarium works. The zoo was okey, quite small places for fish and crabs. Most i enjoyed to see otters because they were so playful and active. The king crocodile was huge but quite sad to see in so small area.
Impressive!. An aquarium in the middle of a shopping mall, only in Dubai...It is huge, quite imressive really and full of fish, rays etc...Definitely worth seeing, above all with young kids.

Really fun experience. A great experience with our kids, really interesting and great chances for photos. Easy to get to and no massive quests. We did the behind the scenes tour which was well worth the extra money.
Massive!. This is great. we only did the basic package and that was more than enough. The kids loved it and it was unbelievable how close you felt you got to the sharks!

Better than I thought. I liked walking through the tunnel and having sharks and sting rays above your head. Makes for some fun pictures. The giant crocodiles were good too. Be sure to have enough battery in your camera! I ran out before I got to the crock.

Rarest of rare species. Amazing experience truly.....every next step puts you in a deep thought of how such species survive...right from jelly fish to penguins to octopus and huge crabs .....simply superb
The Dubai Mall was incredible!. Huge shopping experience but have plenty of time...and more money. Many US chain stores but the best was the Aquarium and The Souk.

NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!!. Save your money and look at the aquarium tank while standing in the mall like everyone else!! Paying an extra $25 to walk through a 2 minute tunnel was a waste. Its nice to see but you can see it for free standing from the outside. When you go upstairs for the zoo you go on a 10 minute tour which is interesting but NOT WORTH THE MONEY!

Value for money. Firstly, purchase your ticket at reception on the UPPER FLOOR to avoid the queues by the shark tunnel entrance.Wepurchased the basic Researcher' '100 Dhm entrance (£20) each as my husband had done this visit just 4 weeks previously. This ticket provides everything to see, and there is lots to see including a fish hatching & nursery area, BIG crocodiles & walking through the tunnel. There is a cafe inside where you can purchase basic food & muffins with drinks. Allow approx 3 hours.... its worth it!

Beautiful . Very nice gigantic aquarium. A trip under water followed by a boat trip on top. U can even feed the fish if you desire. Did not like to see all the Sharks apathetic and dull. It seems that they feed them too much to keep them peaceful. But they are pitiful to see. However it is a very nice tour to do if you visit dubai mall. The zoo however was disappointing. Maybe young children would be more interested.
Marvalous. Insde the dubai mall. 2nd place I am like to be afte the Burj Kalifa. Differant type of Sea Fishes can be sea here and we can Dive also.

wasn't my choice of activity. Being totally honest I've walked past the aquarium many times and never wanted to go in. However my last trip to Dubai my friends did, and I was impressed. The size of the tank and the fish inside isn't understood from the mall size. we got on the boat to go across the top of the tank. very much a experience looking down the glass bottom boat. worth a few hours and its not expensive. Children would love it. in fact I would say a most.
I love those attractions. I must see if you are a nature lover, impressive.Clean and with a huge variety of sea life animals.

Only an Illusion. The outside attraction makes the aquarium like a must see but this is not anything extraordinary. It's small and basic, I have seen larger aquariums. The sight of it been in a mall and the many different fish you see is trendy but seeing from outside is just as good, not really worth the ticket for inside view.

Loved it. Went here today and loved it. Well worth a visit and suits all ages and also it the biggest crocodile there!
All of it was brilliant and really enjoyed it
Wonderful Experince. Its amazing, wonderful experience to be there. Its like you are in a transparent sub marine and watching under sea life from very close. over all great experience.
Nothing special. I feel the Aquarium at Atlantis is way better and once you see it, you don't need to visit this one.
Nice visit. It was my second visit and I enjoyed it as much as the first time! A nice family outing. I loved the walk under the tunnel.

Not wow . Expected better. It was enjoyable but i expected better. After enjoying aquariums around the world this is by far my least favorite Maybe because it is located in a shopping mall and have pits and pieces all over three floors makes it inconvenient.We have booked the explorer encounter because the vip one did not make since to pay double price. And we didn't want a tour guide. Kids enjoyed feeding the fish. The simulator ship didn't make sense. Next time we may only see the fish from outside for free

Mediocre!!!. Those looking for any fun in Dubai Aquarium will get disappointed as it has nothing much to offer ..yeah those traveling with young kids must visit as kids enjoys a lot or people without kids could save precious 40 or 45 mins for shopping or other activities.

Mall Highlight. Great to escape the mall scene and wander among all the sea life. I stuck to the basic "researcher" level and it was worth going behind the scenes. An ideal spot to bring young children!

Surprisingly good.. I'm not normally in to Aquariums etc. However, I really enjoyed this experience. It's well presented and the variety of marine creatures is unbelievable. You also have the option of going behind the scenes to see how the work is done. It's was a surprisingly enjoyable could of hours.

Wow wow wow. Amazing place. Could have spent days in there, the variety of fish to see is wonderful, from huge Sharks to tiny jellyfish, including two massive crocodiles, unbelievable place in a shopping mall!!!! Must see!

Giant croc is here !!!. One of the main attractions in Dubai Mall , it now houses a giant croc which is let out at certain times during the day . Although free , you can walk through the tubular aquarium and also dive inside though the prices tend to be not the higher site . Good family activity specially for kids .
Quite amazing . It will be quite hard to find and aquarium of this size in a shopping mall anywhere in the world ! There is also a science bit so do pay to go in it's pretty cool!

A must visit place. A must place to visit with your family.
lots of variety of fishes. King Croc was the best. were luck to see him feeding. amazing experience.

Worth it!. I took a package of 120 AED pp and it was worth it!
It's fun with family adults as well as kids.
They have good collection of fishes.
My package included Under water tunnel, intro simulator ride, glass bottom boat ride and most amazing underwater zoo.
almost spent 3-4 hours in there.

Worth it. Visited the mall before and viewed the tunnel outside. This time we decided to pay the extra to go inside and then up to the underwater zoo. Really glad we did. Our toddlers had fun too with lots to see including at their height.

lovely concept. I want to At the top burj khalifa. As we derided to take round at Dubai mall. after a round we reached to Dubai aquarium, all most all parts are visible from out side, A hues aquarium with lot of fishes. we resided to visit underwater tunnel . i love it big big different varieties fishes just rooming around 1 ft above head

Nice excursion for Kids. The Dubai Aquarium is very easily accessible from Dubai mall and houses a wide range of aquatic life. The Section where one is surrounded by sharks is absolutely amazing and provides quite a few photo opportunities.
Visited Dubai 25- 28 January 2016. We managed to watch the largest aquarium in the world. Full of people and tourists. Full of shops. Very clean environment.
Very impressive. Although you can see the main tank from the shopping mall it is worth paying to experience everything.
Amazing . It is veryy amazing and a must see for anybody who visits Dubai mall. A huge aquarium to see from the outside and a beautiful tunnel to ho through.

It's ok.. After the Big screen outside hard to better itself inside. The tunnel is good But then it all gets confusing. You have to go here there n everywhere. In my opinion once you've seen the big glass outside for free. It's not worth what they charge for you to go inside
aquarium. A key attraction of the Dubai mall. Pulls in the crowds but really ... should this be in a shopping centre?

The Aquarium inside the mall. Though it was attracting great number of toruists when they saw for the first time such a huge Aquarium built inside the mall, The Under Water part did not live to his expectations compared to the one in Singapore. We did take the full tour feeding the fish, etc. but felt there is alot to improve to bring it to World class standards in the future.

All this...in a mall. The Dubai Mall is luxury on steroids. Huge. Clean. Wonderful stores for every budget. AND it has the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. Well worth a 2 hour (or so) visit just because...it's in a mall. The zoo is well laid out and spotless. 2 floors down is the aquarium which is an engineering marvel and it's so much fun to walk through.

Good for children's. I have seen the Under water world in Singapore so I guess that is the reason I was not pretty impressed with the aquarium. The only animals I was impressed with was the giant crocodile.

Aquarium inside Dubai mall. Close to the main entrance of the mall you walk right into this aquarium, looks great to see all kinds of (big) fish swimming in a mall!!! You can walk around it without paying a fee, or go in the tunnel that goes right through it. Scuba divers can enter the aquarium as well ( at a fee)

'Controlled' environment. The aquarium is a great thing in the middle of the huge Dubai Mall. At around £20 a head for the basic package you can easily while away a couple of hours going through the plexiglass tunnels, the various exhibits and the underwater zoo. More expensive packages are available if you want a trip in a glass-bottomed boat or to go diving in the tank. Seeing the rays and sharks so close by is an amazing experience and this is richly enhanced by the various exhibits on the upper levels. The backstage tour was a little disappointing as you were passed very rapidly from guide to guide at virtually every the stations that showed how fish were farmed and fed. The Aquarium was a welcome relief from all of the miles and miles of shops, you get much more from going inside than just gawping at the huge tank from the concourse of the Mall and is pretty reasonable value for money given many of the exhibits.

Interesting & Educational. I always make an effort to say something that I haven't read in the reviews, but let me say ahead of time that the reviews are all correct based on one's observation.In one of the tours after going through that famous tunnel, I have learned that baby sharks eat each other in the womb. They showed us a short "movie" showing what was going on in the womb of a shark. It was barbaric. It was survival of the fittest. This particular shark gives birth once every two years. That was pretty interesting to know.I also saw a lot of colorful fishes that were so mesmerizing.
Very interesting. Quite 'blown away' by the numbers and species of marine life. Staff were knowledgeable and helpful and the glass bottom boat quite informative.

Amazing experiences. This one is worth visiting in the Dubai mall. Go for underwater tunnel and other activities. Some of the activities are too good. We had a great experience. You get to see some really good fishes . there is one king crocodile also. Crocodile is worth seeing. If you going with kids this one is for you.
Giant aquarium . Amazing sight inside the Dubai mall. This is the largest pane of glass in the world holding back the water from entering the mall.

Awesome experience..!!!. This is situated inside the Dubai mall. You can directly buy the tickets from there. If your hotel is near metro station you can easily reach here and buy tickets no need to pay extra to the tour bookie. What a place. You can see sharks as soon as you will enter the place not 1 or 2 but plently of sharks. And after that a large variety of fishes. You don't want to miss it for sure.
Huge Aquarium. This is probably the best and the biggest Aquarium i have ever visited. The aquarium is spread into many levels and took a lot of time for us to see the full place.

a family adventure. the aquarium is big, most of the aquarium can be seen for the outside but to see the inside & the rest of the aquarium we have to get a ticket, its a must visit for families with little kids.
Gorgeous place.. Very nice experience. Huge sharks and rays with a gorgeous panoramic view. All sorts of amazing sea animals I had never seen before despite living in an island surrounded by the sea.

Fascinating!. I could spend hours watching the fish in this enormous aquarium set in the heart of the world's largest shopping mall. It's particularly interesting at feeding time, when divers appear and play with the fish. Highly recommended family fun.

Excellent for a couple of hours entertainment. We have visited the aquarium and zoo a few time. It is always a lovely thing to do with kids, lots to see and you could spend 2-3 hours if you go slowly but it gets really busy (even if you arrive early) so you get pushed through faster. The majority of it is clean, tanks etc clean and fish look healthy. The king croc and mate are a star attraction and have to admit not my favourite as their enclosure is ridiculously small. There are lots of packages so you can taylor it to your interests to a degree. The basic package (in the Entertainer!) is enough for little people on their first visit but they will want more on the next visit!

Interesting, and educational for my daughter. This is a huge aquarium located in the Dubai mall, which is also a huge mall. My daughter enjoyed it very much seeing all the different fish, sharks and reptiles. We also got an educational tour where we were shown and explained about the reptiles that they keep there. The glass tunnel is also nice, where you see fish all around you.

Amazing Private Tour. We decided to pay a visit to the Aquarium. I can tell you that even if you chose the basic option, the Aquarium is amazing. But we opted for the VIP Tour and I can tell you it was worth it. We got Lilian as our guide and she was the nicest guide we have ever met. She walked us though every single place of the tour, explained everything in detail and even took the time to take pictures of me and my girlfriend. The cool thing is that she ensured we didn't miss any of the good bits of the Aquarium and even talked about how they operate everything and fun facts from everything! The whole thing took a little bit over an hour and it was amazing!We were enjoying Dubai, but after the tour, she really made our day! We will definitely come back! We felt like true VIPs the whole time! Thank you so much Lilian!

Much more than an aquarium!. The aquarium is spread across multiple levels in the dubai mall. You can choose from different packages such as Researcher, Explorer, Discovery, etc. These are all priced differently and have some differences between each packages. We had chosen Explorer package for which we had to pay 100 AED. This was the basic package. The aquarium is beautifully maintained with huge variety of marine life. The aquarium also has sharks, penguins and crocodiles. Visit to the aquarium is a must especially if you are with children. The place is so much more than just an aquarium!
good. saw this in Dubai mall, but didnt get the ticket as it was late night 11pm, had chance to view it from outside

interesting experience. the place is very lovely but if you like diving and snorkling you want find most of it interesting except you will see a lot of sharks :)
you will see a lot about the sharks, fishes and their feeding and you can have some lovely photos in the place
Long walk inside Sea. Beautiful aquarium which reside inside a mall. It gives a feeling that we are walking inside sea.You can see so many sharks and stuffs

A great way to spend a couple of hours. Walk through the glass tunnel and see the varieties of fish, shark and Ray's. The underwater simulator was disappointing for adults without children, and the little ones (with other pants) were a bit frightened. The glass bottomed boat was great fun and plenty to watch. The zoo was surprisingly good and interesting. A pleasant surprise and most enjoyable for both of us.There are various grades of tour. We chose the second most expensive, the Explorer due to time factors. You can have an underwater swim. Or a cage swim with sharks if you want, but as you'd expect, that's a lot more expensive.

1st Time Visit. Love this place. huge area well done. The staff are friendly and helpful. There is two section, one is the aquarium and the other is the zoo. Get to see the largest crocodile...its really huge.
Nothing special. As someone who has been to many sealife centres, there isn't anything special I find about this apart from the fact that it is in the middle of a mall. Quite pricey to get in also.

king croc stole the show. honestly, what you see from outside is a lot like inside. you don't need to pay to enjoy watching the fishes go by. but if you do, you'll get access to king croc, bats, octopus, etc. we only bought the tickets because we wanted to see king croc (and boy is he huge!!) besides that, nothing else was worth the money spent.

Not as grand as it looks. Dont be fooled by the tunnel.. that is only the entrance to the aquarium. The tunnel being the major attraction is crowded all the time and the rest of the place is over rated!

Good for Kids. Visited this place in December 2015 and although it does have a few attractions I reckon there are better aquariums in other parts of the world. If you have been to one of them it is ok to skip this. With that being said it is a good way to kill an hour or two if you have nothing much to do and you are bored going around in the mall and window shopping.

Sharks in a mall!. It's not really a full on aquarium, more like a large fish tank in a mall which is interesting and unusual. Walk through a little tunnel under the tank and see the sharks and stuff. Live the dream. I believe in you.
Fantastic place. Good aquarium... Created in heart of a mall... Must visit for people with children to get insight of SeaWorld in short ...

Very good. I loved experiencing the underwater zoo. Three times I passed through the tunnel when I had friends visit and each time was just as good. There is an opportunity to get inside and feed the fish I believe and there is also a water boat that you can ride through the underwater zoo.

Nothing fishy here. We had been on the Big Bus Hop on, Hop off sightseeing tour and entrance to this is included in your ticket price, you don't have to queue to get in just show your ticket, they had written research on it so once we had gone round the outside, which is visible to anyone walking through the Dubai Mall, we went in to walk along the tunnel, loads of photo opportunities with loads of different species swimming along beside you and above you and once you come out the other end you can then go round and look a more individual large tanks with various fish species and frogs, otters, the largest pair of crocodiles and their young, penguins and many more, you can then go through to see what you could call behind the scenes and see how they make sure they have enough food and get the opportunity to feed from above the tunnel you walk through. There are also places to shop and eat so a good way to spend the day and get out of the Dubai heat when it rises.

No mall can ever compare to the Dubai Mall. This mall has a freaking aquarium!!! Look, I don't give a flying fig about malls as I'm no longer a teenager how cares to be one or one of trendy socialites who lives for shopping. And with this being the luxurious Dubai Mall, I know I can't afford half or more of the stores there ---- but the aquarium is worth going inside the mall to see. Now this isn't on par with a full building dedicated as an aquarium, but the lighting and fx windows are amazing. No mall can compare to the Dubai mall ---- well especially those suburban strips in the USA :D
Nice Place. It was very crowded and small. I was underwhelmed. If you want the free experience, the aquarium is visible from the mall.

very well maintained Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. very well maintained Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Also have crocodiles, penguines in a Shopping mall !! OMG... it's amazing place to visit while you tired on shopping .
Amazing Aqarium. Massive aquarium from outside makes you want to go inside and view the amazing sea views, good clean fun loads of photo opportunities, recommend it .

Nice experience . We enjoyed the visit a lot, took a lot of pictures and had fun. Nice to feel back to the childhood for a while! There was a group excursion included into the price of our ticket so they explained to us what they feed the fish with, how it grows etc. definitely recommend for family visits.
it was a good way to pass time at the mall. the tunnel was the best part, the underwater zoo was really good as well, it was 100 dirham which was a bit much but overall ok.

Excelent!. The visit to the aquarium starts with a huge tunnel. You really feel like getting under a mini sea. Later a large number of aquatic species are available for watching. There are a few activities which you cannot do if you have infants. Please plan accordingly.Over all its a pleasant experience. They have a few offers for local credit cards, so if you are a resident here, just a little research before going to the aquarium.
Fantastic Place. Really enjoyed visiting, King croc was a major highlight as was the aquarium and tunnel, and all this in a shopping mall

Amazing!!. It's an incredible experience!! The tunnel is mesmerizing (even though I felt bad to see the sharks there mostly gathered in the dark side of the tunnel), Id go again to visit the underwater zoo, great for the kids too!

Impressive but expensive!. Great work to have this big aquarium in a shopping mall. Unique.
Now, there is no reason to pay such a crazy amount of money to see what you can see from outside.

A bit pricey, but lots of fun!. We did not expect to find this kind of attraction in the Dubai mall and had some reservations about paying so much money. It's a splurge, but worth it if you are into getting close-up views of marine life. The views of the manta rays are what got me while others I was with found the sharks just as captivating.
feeling yourself a child!. really enjoy this wonderful aquarium, too much emotions about everything! you can feeling yourself like a child!

Don't miss.. The aquarium is in the Dubai mall. The entrance fee of 200 AED looked exorbitant but you feel ok after the complete tour. The aquarium per say is small compared to what you see elsewhere. But its more than that. The water Zoo is superb and the walk around through the aquarium feeding station was a new experience. You can also have a boat ride inside the aquarium. The water Zoo has a huge crocodile, shark fish, sea horse, penguins, octopus and variety of sea creatures making it worth while.

Amazing sight. In the middle of Dubai mall it's amazing to see , lots of various fish and sharks and things really worth a visit. You can pay to go in but you can see it just as good for free from the mall.

Wow!. Quite an amazing feature of the Dubai Mall. We didn't pay to do the walk through but ogled with all the others from outside. It's a must see situated in the central mall after the main entry. Just follow the overhead signs straight to it. You can stand alongside and see straight in to the tank full of a huge variety of fish.

Great way to break up a day at the mall. A fantastic way to break up a day at the biggest mall in the world. It takes about 1 and a half to 2 hours to look around the who attraction. The large aquarium on the bottom floor is extremely impressive however the view is probably best from the free viewing gallery in the mall rather than the tunnel which you have to pay to go down. With a ticket though, you get to go backstage in the aquarium which was the best bit! The underwater zoo was also very good and the highlight was the King Croc, which makes the trip all worth the money!

Fantastic aquarium!. We went to this aquarium and underwater zoo as my husband desperately wanted to see the King crocodile. The aquarium was amazing.. But this can be seen from the mall. The only bonus on purchasing a ticket is to go through the tunnel through the aquarium. The behind the scenes tour was great and not anything I had seen before in an aquarium. In terms of the underground zoo.. Good selection and the King croc is clearly the Main selling point but it was not very big and I have seen better underground zoos much more locally!
Unique . Worth to visit , tickets are not very expensive, but if you have plan to visit Atlantis or you have already visited, then it's quite boring,

Aquarium in a Mall!. The aquarium is impressive because of the size of the tanks and the size and number of fish. The zoo, 2 floors above is also interesting and well set out. Both are particularly worth a visit using the free admikssion provided bygthe hop on hop off Big Bus 48 hour ticket

ONE OF THE BEST. I really like going to aquariums, it is fascinating to see (well I find anyway). The Dubai aquarium is pretty awesome too. And like the rest in Dubai; big as well. Great time to spend a few hours when tired of shopping and wandering through the Dubai Mall

Animals everywhere! . Perfect day for families and animal lovers!
Spectacular tour through the fauna of this incredible acquarium, perfect place to take amazing pictures ! If you are in Dubai don't miss this place!
breath taking underwater world!. Its amazing how in this great mall ,we can enjoy the luxury of the underwater world and see so many different species.My favorite are the stingrays/mantas.
Aquarium for the kids. Attraction for kids or for elders to have fun. Its too small but very pretty and full of fish species.

Amaxing children attraction. This is must for kids and children enjoyment and can be covered alongwith Burz Khalifa.Its comparatively small as compared to world aquariums but yet enjoyable.Give one hr prior to climb Burz Khalifa.Its must attraction.

Interesting to see. Amazing 2-3 story aquarium with sharks, tunas and other fish.
Going through the tunel is wonderfull experience.
Underwater zoo is so well organized, so nicely presented. Favourite was Finidng Nemo tank with all the fishes from the cartoon!
Heavenly Creation!!. The most fabulous human-made creations I've ever seen ...The view was simply breathtaking, a feel of heaven on earth..
amazing. it is located in center of Dubai mall in three or four floors and there is a great collection of marine life in this complex.I recommend it for once.

An Ocean View. The aquarium is on three different levels. It is more visible on the outside to passerby shoppers at the Dubai Mall then is the Mall of America Aquarium in Bloomington, MN. There are many different opportunities within the aquarium besides just a walk through such as glass bottom boat rides and shark dives.

A wide variety of fun. This aquarium is located inside the Dubai mall. We discovered it by accident, it's pretty small but it has a bit to do. Apart from viewing the fish behind the glass, there's a nocturnal area where you can see owls and other animals, there's also a boat ride, where you ride over the aquarium. It's pretty cool and fun. They offer a photo service, the pics are nice.

Amazing is the word !!!. My first time for underwater world and absolutely loved it.. It is Dubai mall... you can see the fishes from outside free of cost,, but to experience it from inside the tunnel, it is worth the penny... my kid just loved it and i still have memories of those beautiful fishes which you can see from finger distance...

Superbe experience. This is one of the aquariums that contineousely amazes me and i will not hesitate visiting it everytime. The number of schools of fish of all sizes is amazing in addition to the size of the aquarium. The tunnel experience is quite pleasant and unique. It gives you the safe opportunity to get as close to sharks as can be in case you do not want to scuba dive with them in a cage. The only downturn is the crowd which makes the experience a bit daunting and noisy. We also entered the section reserved for marine life. The space is somehow tight so chlostophobics have to be careful before venturing in especially in high season. At the end of the section a huge croccodile is displayed in a pool which gave great joy to my 6 years old son. A unique experience in the region which should not be missed.

Amazing Aquarium in the middle of the mall. I wasn't expecting muchfromt this as the visit was spur of the moment, but it was very entertaining. I did not like the size of the enclosure for the HUGE crocodile, there was barely enough room for him to turn around.
good place. i go to it with my family and we interesting on it. there are a lot of kind of fish on it. it is expensive and not clear about the program of it.
great place. great place , so much fun everyone should totally go and visit this aquarium, especially if you were with kids they will love it.

Definitely worth a visit! . We visited the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo all on the same visit to the mall. We firstly visited the Underwater Zoo which was very interesting! It had a variety of usual and beautiful species from all around the world! They even had 2 crocodiles one known as "The King". They had a very interesting video about the King and how they found him and got himInto the zoo which is worth watching! It's brilliant for young children, my daughter was 2 and she loved it. She particularly loved the Aquarium and the giant tank! The best part was walking through the water tunnel and seeing all the fish, sharks and Ray's! Which was so amazing being so close to them! I would definitely recommend doing this if visiting the mall as it is something very interesting and is very entertaining and educational for oldand young children. The price was quite reasonable for the both and I would definitely advise doing both.

Very Entertaining. We've been there for the 2nd time with visitors from outside Dubai and this time we took the explorer package. Plenty of interesting activities; The glass bottom boat was awesome so make sure not to miss it.There are also other animals, reptiles and birds to see.The only downside we find is the narrow space for moving around. SO make sure to pick your visiting time carefully

A the story aquarium. While the upstairs portion of this aquarium is informative, save time for the underwater tunnel. The aquarium is 10 million liters! Two of the biggest rays I've ever seen. Don't forget King Croc!

IS IT WORTH LEAVING THE AIRPORT?. On our way to Bangkok we had a tranfer at Dubai. We could choose: or a two hour stop over, or an eight hour stop over. Both Johan and I never had been in Dubai before, so we choose for the eight hour linger in Dubai.We checked on the internet if you could leave the airport and how far the city centre was. Should we take the metro, a taxi or should we book a touristic bus ride on these double decker busses? We choose the last option. Already on Madrid airport we checked the rates Citysightseeing Dubai was asking. For a 24 hours “hop on – hop off” ride they charged 240 AED per person, which is around 60 euros. With this ticket you did not have to pay an entrance fee at the Dhow cruise boat, the Abra water taxi, all kind of museums and included an audio commentary in 12 languages. When we bought our tickets we got also a free entrance for the Dubai Aquarium, which was normally only offered at the 48 hour ride.We stopped at two shopping malls: The Dubai Mall for a coffee and a visit at the aquarium and at the end at The Mall of the Emirates.We definitely wanted to have a little peek at the beach to see The Palm, an island built in the sea by Dutch engineers.On our way to the Atlantis Hotel, where you can swim with dolphins, we got stuck in traffic because of a car which was on fire.So driving back from The Palm we really had to hurry to the airport. We hopped off at the Emirates mall and got on the metro, which was going much faster than the tour bus. When we wanted to pick up our backpack which we had left at the luggage drop off, there was a big line. Finally when we went through customs we were exactly on time. All the gates of the flights leaving before our flight were already closed. At least, we thought! On a sign was written that going to our gate would take 19 minutes.“What … 19 minutes?? How is that possible? We should run!!” I shouted to Johan.The reason was: we had to take a train bringing us to the gate. So running faster would not help. But we made it just in time!Would we do the longer stop over again?Dubai is a beautiful city in the middle of the desert with a great skyline. But we would not book an eight hour stop over again. We have seen all those beautiful buildings now and this holiday we could not do any shopping, because we are traveling light with a backpack. Or we should stay one night there to see the city by night.But the Citysightseeing of Dnata is worth it’s money if you can visit all the attractions. So with a hotel night in Dubai we would book it again.
Good Place. My Family enjoyed a lot. Major attraction is king Croc and penguins. Though the area is small it is well maintained and it is very good.

Interesting collection of marine animals.. This attraction was included in our 48 hour City Sightseeing Bus ticket, making it good value. As Australians from North Queensland, it was interesting to see King Croc and the three baby crocs in such a high quality display. That it is located in a mall is both amazing and convenient. We enjoyed our visit to this high quality educational attraction, which was completed in just over an hour.

A great facility and fantastic attraction. We've visited twice in recent month when we had family in town. The aquarium itself is interesting but with the addition of the underwater zoo, glass bottom aquarium boats etc there's lots to see here.We took the 'Explorer package' which includes seeing the Aquarium, a glass bottom 'cruise' of the aquarium and access tot he underwater & UAE desert night night creature zoo.The aquarium is very impressive and houses lots of interesting species. The glass bottom boat that cruises the top level is a good addition and with a guide helping explain some details gives a bit of extra background to the facility.But each time, we've enjoyed the zoo most - seeing the otters, beavers, turtles, penguins and crocodiles. The facility is really well looked after and nicely laid out.As animal lovers this is one of our favorite attractions in Dubai.
The aquarium is huge!. We loved the aquarium and is comparable with Singapore and Thailand's. The glass boat is a must to. Take the second option pass as it will suffice the attraction
Magnificient. Unbeliavable aqurium located inside a shopping mall. Do not hesitate to visit this attraction, does not cost much.

The kids loved it!. One of the many fascinating attractions of Dubai that have made it such a popular destination for people of all ages. A walking in Aquarium in the middle of one of the poshest malls in the world. Quite a combination! Expensive, but worth it!

Loved it for King Croc. It's an ever age aquarium and therefore I think it's overpriced for what it is, however we were lucky to see king Croc had just arrived with his family and we had used Entertainer vouchers so made it worth it.
Nice place. One should visit this in case he have not vistted aquarium of London London aquarium is far better then this

Too crowded and quite small. I expected more space inside and a longer tunnel. What you get is crowds taking photos with flash, lots of kids around, you have to squeeze in between people to see the animals. Nice and huge crocodiles and crabs.

Average experience, poorly managed by the staff!!. I was looking forward to the Dubai Aquarium, but honestly I was underwhelmed. If you want the free experience, the aquarium is visible from the mall. However, we bought tickets to go through the tunnel, see the underwater zoo, the submarine experience, and the simulator.The simulator is a waste of money. If you have been to Disney World, you have experienced way better simulators. The tunnel itself is not bad. Its fairly small, but you get to see the Tiger Sharks, different fish, and sting rays. The underwater zoo was worth the experience as well with penguins and alligators. However, the staff managing the simulator and submarines do a bad job of managing lines. There were people who were behind us who boarded the boat before us. When we asked them, they said something about only 10 people allowed in a boat etc. Either way, the 20 minute wait is not worth the experience.Overall, I would just pay for the tunnel experience that comes with underwater zoo. I would avoid the simulator and submarine experience.

impressed. sightseeing in Dubai is very easy this attraction is located in the Dubai mall after seeing the aquarium we took the sightseeing bus located at the mall for a full day of sightseeing around the city well worth the price you can get on and off at your leisure

Average turistic experience. I went to this place just to find out how is it. Apart the big tank, the aquarium is small and not with any special selection of species. Is good to be with family special with small kids.

One of my favorite attractions. This is one of my favorite Dubai attractions and second time coming to see this. It is such a grand display with the world's largest acrylic glass tank. This provides for great photos from both outside and inside the tunnel. If you had to choose between this and the Lost Chambers Aquarium at the Atlantis, the Dubai Mall Aquarium is definitely the winner.
Beautiful place! . Beautiful & very clean! Lovely place to take the kids! Awesome aquarium with many varieties of fish! You won't be disappointed.
Great feature. Always enjoy stopping and staring at the fish floating around after a hard session shopping or browsing at this mall.m

Very nice experience. This aquarium is a must go for kids and grown ups. We enjoyed very minute, very instructive portion behind the scenes of the aquarium and the tunnel at the entrance is something to remember.
My 3 young children and I enjoyed it. My 3 (9, 8 and 4 years old) children convinced me to take them. It was actually worth it, even I enjoyed it. I've never seen such humongous crabs.

Excellent place to visit near the Burj Khalifa with Kids. The Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo hold various Aquatic creatures. It is situated in the Dubai Mall close to the Burj Khalifa. Experiencing this Aquatic life with your Kids will be a Great experience.
Great Sightseeing!. Dubai has some of the most amazing places to visit. The Global Village and Dolphinarium should also be included here. A must visit to these 2 places.

Interesting for animals lovers. Sea animals . D under water tunnel finished before it begins so go very slowly through it. Watching every second. Enjoying it. Aquarium is really nice and quite big for indoors. The zoo which u Hv to pay for is worth going. N feeding d fishes, kids will enjoy.
Average. Average, its a very limited aquarium in dubai mall and separated in two parts. the lost chamber at Atlantis is better.

Something easy to do for 1hour whilst shopping. This attraction is alright! Nothing spectacular. It is rather small, but you get to see a lot. It takes about 1.5hours maximum to walk around and check everything out. You can get some photos done inside which cost extra, and there is a gift shop as well.If you're going to do a lot of attractions i would suggest purchasing an Entertainment Book, as there is 2for1 offers in there for these types of attractions.

Do Not Underestimate this one (Lots of Sharks here). I have been to the Underwater Aquarium in Singapore, so was not sure if to visit this one or not, coz from the outside this looked puny and I thought not much would be different coz after-all both are aquariums, but my thoughts changed once I reached the counter to purchase the tickets.This place is very unique.First of all some advice:1.Advice to Save Money: But the Entertainer Book : This book would give you coupons from which you can save 50% on entry tickets : This book is available in almost all supermarkets or boo/gift stores also you can purchase it via App (even save more money then).2. If you have time + you are lucky - Do book the scuba slot. You would get to fish in a tank full of sharks, and mind you, I am not talking about the baby sharks, here the sharks are pretty huge unlike Singapore. I was not lucky enough to get a slot.3. Don't take the most basic package, take the one level above that at-least.So the underwater aquarium is very small when you compare it with Singapore, but the fun begins when that part of the tour ends. You would notice a lot of sharks but unlike Singapore, the ones here are huge. After that they take you to the Top of the Aquarium where you can sit on a glass boat and take a tour from the above. So basically when the different species of fish swim underneath you, thats a whole new experience. After this ends there is this whole mini fish zoo which they have. To add the icing on the cake, they got 2 full grown crocodiles inside plus their small foot long kids.
Interesting feature in the Dubai mall. This aquarium isn't very big but it is quite the sight. Standing in the middle of the mall it's very imposing and fascinating.

2 hours of fun. If you find yourself annoyed by the endless shopping opportunities get the Aquarium opportunity for spending better 2 hours. Most suitable for families with kid(s), friends, even hanging solo grants good time. Take the boat ride on the third upper floor or whatever is called, see all the spieces ezhibited, make some photos and you are done!

Too quick, too grim. Visiting the aquarium takes only five minutes, as you only walk through the tunnel. No one is stopping you, but the shape of this tunnel is in itself an invitation to walk. If you compare to the aquarium in Atlantis Aquaventure: over there they have installed carpet and cushions, so you feel like sitting and contemplating the fishes. No such feeling in Dubai Mall.The underwater zoo is very grim, the worst being this gigantic crocodile, imprisoned in a cell so small, it looks as though the poor beast could not even turn on itself.After all, what could you expect from an aquarium and a zoo in a shopping mall?

Beautiful Aquarium!. Beautiful Aquarium with plenty different types of fishes and adequate information of each. Feeding fish was good experience. Underwater zoo was awesome. Very much informative. But it is in cramped space. It should be situated in a bigger space. Very wide variety of fishes across the world!

Excellent for one visit . This is a must to experience. The underwater zoo has a large variety of sea animals to see. However, I feel the aquarium is better viewed from the outside than from the tunnel.

Deepest Aquarium. I recommend this specially for kids, It's deepest aquarium has 2 levels. 1st is aquarium (you can see in photo) here you'll see different type of fishes including sharks & Stingray. In 2nd level, you'll sit in a boat to take a short tour of aquarium (10-15 minutes) with guide and there you'll get food to feed to fishes.They offer diving also in aquarium to see sharks and other fishes. This dive is totally safe as they'll put you in a cage while doing diving. I'm not sure if they offer dive without cage also.Once you are done with above activity, you can move to other area of this aquarium where you'll see almost all species of aquatic mammals and the giant crocodile.

Great for the kids. As part of our hop on hop off Dubai bus tour we received complimentary tickets to this aquarium and underwater zoo. I'm a sucker for free stuff so we were straight off the bus at the Dubai mall to use these freebies. And I'm so glad we did as it was a really enjoyable couple of hours.It's not hard to find the aquarium as it is sign posted from every area within the mall and once you near it you definitely can't miss it. The huge aquarium tank sits inside the mall by the shops and crowds often gather at this spot just to marvel at the size of the tank. It is an impressive site and is worth a quick look even if you don't fancy going inside. The start of the aquarium is probably the best part of you do choose to pay the entrance fee as this is the huge shark enclosure that you can walk through via the immense tunnel. This is there for the area wherein everyone is trying to capture that perfect photo so it does get a little busy but once you're through this section the crowds thin and you can enjoy a relaxing stroll around the tank enclosures. The aquarium is pretty much like any other aquarium. All the usual water life is on display. Although there were a couple of exotic creatures that I'd never seen before. It's done quite well too with a tree house style walkway in one section and octopus creatures dotted around the walls. There is also the main attraction of King Croc which is basically the biggest crocodile in captivity and possibly in the world. If you like aquariums or wildlife in general then this place is for you but it's basically the same as other aquariums I've visited so wouldn't necessarily top my to do in Dubai list if I was pushed for time.Definitely one for the kids or if you've got plenty of spare time after doing the Burj and the bus tour.
Spectacular!!!++++++++++. This is one nice thing to see in the mall, getaway from your shopping and go here. Not only fish to see, they have lots off other animals.
Loved this aquarium. Biggest I have seen, fun even for adults, good tours, not to crowded when we attended later in the evening. Would highly recommend for family visit!
Excellent place. This was si amazing, a dream and testimony to how great this nation is. Our kids loved this so much. Would recommend it.
Many fishes. Its also a great place and kides like it, here in one place a lot types of fishes and other sea world members, u fee u r in the deep sea

Family . I highly recommend this place to families cuz its full with adventure surprises thingsStarting through the tunnel ending with feeding sharks Book online you will get awesome offers and you will save time to stay in queues
Amazing location, but overpriced and so busy!. Its amazing to see this in Dubai mall however over priced and so crowded all the time!!Worth a visit but now ive done it once, doubt ill do it again!

The tunnel is the best part. Our 7 month old loved the tunnel. We probably could have spent all day in there watching the fish and sharks swimming by. That said - the rest of it was a bit of a let down after seeing the huge wall and going through the tunnel.

Very entertaining and a great learning experience for the kids. Booked for the researcher package which allowed us to go on the study tour. It was nice to see the fishes up close and kids were really excited. Happy we payed to enter the tunnel and not just view it from outside. Had a nice picture taken together as a family which was really nice. The zoo was fun and again so much to see. My favorite were the colorful fishes and seahorses. Will recommend for families with kids.

Good experience . We decoded for a little adventure package to the aquarium and we didn't regret that. Broadside over the top of the aquarium with a quite was great. But in the tunnel it gets a bit crowded but overall we loved it Thanx
nice but over priced. kids loved this - bit pricey , esp since you can see it for free from the outside! but fun nonetheless.

Woww. Really amazing place ! Well done ;)))))
Looks so nice and really impressing aquarium. And beautiful fishes and shark ;)
Such a lovely place

Underwater Zoo was the best part. We have visited aquariums all over the world since our young daughter wants to be a marine biologist. The Dubai Aquarium certainly wasn't the best, but it wasn't the worst. It is located on 2 levels of the Mall. On the lower level is a walk thru tank filled with rays, sharks, and fish. It is nice, but you can see the tank in the mall without paying the ticket price. Up a level is the Underwater Zoo. Your "behind the scenes tour" that is included in your ticket price is first. I didn't enjoy it. Our guide read facts to us while trying to keep us together as a group and shuttle us quickly through. It would have been much more enjoyable to look and wander on our own. I was thankful I didn't pay for the glass bottom boat ride when I saw it. You are on a boat that is pulled through the water in a circle by a guide rope. The Underwater Zoo saved the day for me. I really enjoyed walking at my own pace looking at the animals.

A Wonderful Attraction. It's the perfect place for beginners as well as for marine life lovers, who would just love the visit to Aquarium as well as the Underwater zoo with a variety of collection of marine life i.e aquatic animals as well as aquatic plants too. A Had a wonderful experience being there...........

Nice family facility. My son enjoyed visiting the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. Overall the facility felt a little cramped to me but not so much as to make me feel uncomfortable. Worth a stop to see the sea life and animals during a day out at the Dubai Mall!

Excellent visit, beautiful aquariums. It is definitely a worthwhile attraction, from the eleven meters deep tank to the extensive research and breeding program to support the endangered sharks. Don't bother with the boat tour, it's a little silly. But do listen as they tell you about their program to help the different species of sandshark.
Aquarium. Beautiful to see all type of fishes in the world. excellent for kids they will love it. we all like it specially my kids love it.
Good. Good aquarium in Dubai mall. Interesting enough, but SEA aquarium in Singapore is much better. Just one visit is enough. More interesting for children.

Been to 2 aquariums this trip :(. This was not the better of them, the tunnel is just that, a pointless tunnel where intact the best views was the free view by the mall, the vast facade where you can see it all for free. the experience was pretty pointless as you saw most of it by the mall, free part. the animated simulator was poor and ideally suited for the little kids which would of been great for them, not me who'd already been to one aquarium a day or so before so frankly sick of fish! The circular boat ride at the top of the tank was gimmicky and pointless really, all you saw was grouper fish and it went round the circuit and that was it.....pure pointless waste of time and effort. The zoo part was alright I suppose and it was great to see King Croc, if not the biggest croc in the world- worth it but he did nothing apart from moving a yard or so. Not the better mall as the Lost Chambers is better in my opinion.The free bit is all you need to be honest.

Shark Walker & Dubai Aquarium. The Dubai aquarium is a lovely feature in the middle of the Dubai mall, and it is always so fascinating looking at the variety of fishes through the glass wall. My friend and I signed up for the Shark Walker experience - it was nice getting upclose to the underwater fishes but disappointing that there was only a single shark that came by. I had expected more. Once in awhile, we would get a lone puffer fish drifting into the cage and we could clearly see them upclose. No need for prior diving experience as we were on the SeaTREK helmet.The ticketing price also includes entry to the Dubai Aquarium. Not a large space but I enjoyed the crocodile exhibit that is newly-installed on its upper floors. A good afternoon spent.

Nothing over the top, Ok for a one time visit with kids. Not much in terms of vast space. A lot of things within a small space. Ok for a one time visit. Lucky to get a work discount. Cannot really compare with similar setups in Singapore/Sentosa.

You can't go wrong . A Dubai must see - the pure size of the fish tank is just immense - literally thousands of fish. From sharks to tuna to stingrays and moray eels - it has it all; that being said, the real highlight for the kids is in the aquarium above the tank, especially the two enormous crocodiles. Who would have guessed ? When the kids are tired of shopping this will prove a big hit.

Amazing Place. The aquarium is a wonderful attraction to visit for grown up and kids alike. The best part of it that it's located inside Dubai Mall - almost at the mouth of it as you enter from main entrance gate so it's like 2-in-1 package. Tickets are available right there along with complete package details. You can have take photos on the outer side of the giant aquarium without even buying a ticket but then you'll deprive yourself of the amazing inside aqua world. Even more enchanting than aquarium is the Underwater Zoo which is just Wow! With so many species of underwater creatures one simply cannot help feeling awed. You can also enjoy a boat ride on top of the huge aquarium and see the fish from above from a glass-bottom boat, touching the water on your sides :)Tip: Don't pay for feeding the fish... It's not like feeding the fish by actually going inside the water. They only give you a small box of fish feed n you drop it from above. Plain boring! Also, don't get trapped by the photographer(s) while entering teh aquarium. It's not worth taking an expensive photo with a plain wall in the bg.

wonderful surprise in the center of Dubai Mall. a great experience whilst shopping. An enormous aquarium with a huge variety of fish and the opportunity to go behind the scenes to see how they are fed and taken care of

Good Place. Since the aquarium is situated in the Dubai mall itself I will recommend travellers to visit it. It is a good experience. Though you will find the same in other parts of the world children will enjoy the experience.
Nice to see . I must say it on of then nice things i done in dubai, nice experience and.You can visit it while walking in dubai mall.-externally over priced. -unfriendly staff and management.
A very pleasant walk-through. Every age group would love this place! Its worth it to go inside and have a closer look at the huge variety of fish. And you get to see penguins! :D

Excellent idea to have this acquarium so easily accessible. Less so to put too much stuff in it. First time we saw it this year it was packed with kit and an ugly sign inside of it. We could barely see the fishes. Next time we saw it this year all that kit had been removed and the acquarium was an acquarium again. Much better that way!

Ok. For me this attraction was ok. A few sharks and a behind the scenes but there is not a lot behind the scenes. A little boat ride was included but was a bit pointless to me. Good for a break in the shopping but Seaworld it is not.

NICE TO WATCH THE SEA LIFE. For every tourist visiting Dubai, one of the must see, is definitely this. Though it is small in terms area, but some value for money.Why the ticket should be so expensive, one cannot understand.But good range of sea life is on display

Journey to the hidden treasures... It was an amazing experience.. we were able to discover loadz of creatures hidden thousand miles deeper in the sea.. staff was very supportive and informative.. Best part is the Penguin section oh i can be there even for a week looking at what these amazing creatures are doing...
Expensive but good. It was an expensive visit but was informative, plenty to see and the guides were very friendly and knowledgable.
Wonderfull. There is many thing to see and enjoy. we really enjoy the tour of Aquarium. Many thing new for me. Nice
Fantastic. We went to aquarium as i really wanted to have a look . Delighted we went as we did not expect the zoo afterwords . Both were amazing and the staff very informative .

Lovely Aquarium. This aquarium is located in the Dubai Mall. You will need at least 2-3 hours to tour the aquarium. Lots of fish, sharks and other creatures. Its is a beautiful aquarium and definitely worth a visit.

Must see. The aquarium is amazing, even from just inside the mall. But you should take the time to go through it as well. I think the best part is the clear tunnel below the huge tank. You have fish, sharks, and stingrays swimming all around you!
Great adventure place. This place provides a great adventure with maximum safety. Though it is not in sea bit inside pool but the huge size of underwater gives a great experience to the divers.

Money Making rip off. Right so we about to go to Dubai and being avid divers we decided to do this dive experience in the Aquarium. Ive done others before and they general cost around R500 to R1000 ($60). The quote I got for Dubai was R3300 (About $200). To top it off I am not allowed to take pictures unless I have done their specialty dive course, even though I am an advanced diver with a photographic specialty. Sorry Dubai mall/Zoo...we decided to give you all a skip and take our money elsewhere.
Expensive. Very expensive. Not worth the money. Rather view it from outside. Arrogant staff.Maintained wel. Kids will enjoy it.
Interesting attaraction in Dubai Mall. Visited aquarium during visit to Dubai Mall. This is a definitely money worth for the price we paid.

Zoo area makes the aquarium worth it. The large aquarium can mostly be seen for free from inside the mall. The entry fee gives you access to a tunnel and platform over the the aquarium. However, after going up two floors to the zoo area, you see a LOT of smaller fish, reptiles & amphibians, birds, the cutest sea otters ever, insects, etc. It was really nice and we enjoyed it.
