Humongous indoor fishtank. The Aquarium was nice, but it wasn't something that you would go out of your way to see. They also blocked off about 10 feet of space around the perimeter of the aquarium so that people can pay just to get a closer view of the fish. It was okay, I guess I've been to one too many of these. I guess it's cool if you are seeing this for the first time and you want to take a closer look at marine life.

Definatley money worth for the price to check it out. It was fun for my six year to check out, a change of pace from just walking the mall go early to avoid lines and pay extra 10 bucks to feed the fish. just did the normal tour which took about a good 1 or so to get through. souvenirs not pricey, so good stuff to pick up.

Great experience. I decided to try it and it was a great experience for my 2 kids as they lived seeing the fish and marine life moving up their heads while in the glass aquarium. The tour of the way they maintain the place was educational and fascinating. Prices are a bit high. We took the 100 dirhams tour per head ( kids under 2 are free ) and it was more than enough. Recommended for kids as well as marine lovers.

Quite good on a cloudy day. We went down to the Mall as it was a really cloudy day. The mall is super busy and a real headache in my mind so it was nice to do something. Kids like the backstage tour and the crocodiles are really quite impressive.
Free Of Charge. The first aquarium ever built inside a mall. Very interesting and you can see many species of fish inside it. And its free.

Unique experience seeing the underwater fish varieties!. My wife and i stopped by the aquarium while shopping at the Dubai Mall. Its a nice experience and we enjoyed experiencing the underwater fish varieties in the aquarium. Worth a visit!

swim with sharks or just see them behid the glass. the dubai aquarium in the dubai mall is a place with many interesting and extremly curious animals...gathered from around the world. includeing some endangered species.... please check thier website before going there.in the underwater zoo ask for feeding time...when u get to see the feeding of different animals like the penguins and crockdials...carry your camera non the less...it has some great photo moments.

Beauty's paradise. One of the nice attractions of Dubai......nice under water arrangements.. Experience of sea dive....excellent help desk and nice directions... Peoples used to vist from all around the world..

Descent infraestructure and overcrowded. Surely interesting for our kids to see what the Aquarium has, but it's small and when we visited overcrowded not nice to appreciate in a proper way.The complement of the visit from the second floor was nice, but again over 20 people in that part to see fishes from its upper side was too much.

Interesting and exciting.. - This is a well curated aquarium and delights the senses.- If you are interested in marine life, this is a good experience.- Take the basic ticket, it covers your visit through the tunnel and a small overview of the operations (you need to visit the 2nd floor of the mall) that go in keep the aquarium up and running.- Many people say that one can see part of the aquarium from the mall itself, but I recommend experiencing it.- There are other aquatic creatures also that you can see and experience.- To make a good visit, allow 2 to 3 hours time.
Interesting acquarium with peculiar fishes. Great acquarium, wonderful and colorful fishes, some rare species. Nice to see divers feeding them from the mall

Dubai mall. This was a very pleasant experience and wonderful experience within the busy mall of dubai , the sharks and jellyfishes inside the mall aquarium was simply beautiful . It certainly relaxes the eye and me and my partner were enjoying each and every bit of it clicking pictures from every possible angle .

A very large fish tank. Its an experience. You can walk through the shark tunnel and become a caged animal with sharks swimming around! There are a lot od educational materials for the children as well. Worth visiting when you are in Dubai Mall.
Amazing. A huge variety of fishes. The kids liked the tour, due to the size of the aquarium. You just need to go to Dubai it is inside the mall.

An aquarium that is a wonder. The aquarium at Dubai mall would be most attactive to people of all ages especially kids and teenagers. Very awe inspiring and the variety and sizes of the fish is a sight not to miss. I stood for a long time gazing at the fish and wished we had one like that in our own hometown.
Aquarium. This is a very cool place , very fun for anybody either child or adult, also very educative and informative. It has different activities

Worth but not much excited. - Underwater Zoo is small and low light.- Aquarium has many sea species and in different place.- Spend at least 2 hours for this attraction.- If you plan for city seeing bus then the Aqaurium ticket will be free of cost.
Not even worth money you spend. too small and even boring for kids. it's very expensive as well so not worth for the money you spend.

Great for the children. We visited on a Monday morning around 10.30am. We used a BOGOF voucher from the entertainer, this made the visit approx £25.00 for family of four , 2 adults, 2 children. This included the aquarium and underwater zoo. Firstly it was a great time to visit, no queues at all, we walked straight in and made our way through the 'tunnel' where you view the aquatics. Then made our way to the underwater zoo, which was a hit with our girls. Lots to see , they touched a starfish and put their heads in the mouth of the crocodile ( not real of course) made their way over the rope bridge and had a really good time. You finish with the gift shop, normal stuff on offer, not too badly priced. Overall I'm pleased we did it, was happy with the price we paid (with a voucher) not sure I would want to,pay any more. Definitely visit early in the morning to avoid queues and I guess avoid weekends!
Not what is advertised!!!The. The fee was $27.50 and almost all you do is walk thru a tuNoel and see some fish. You can see the same thing from the mall without paying. I expected a real aquarium.

Better than expected. On a very unusual wet afternoon for Dubai we spent a very pleasant couple of hours at this rather good aquarium before the skies cleared and we went up burj khalifa. We bought Q jumper tickets on the spur of the moment which we thought were a good deal

Not worth the price.. I expected a lot more when visiting the Dubai Aquarium and underwater zoo. Not very satisfied. You can watch the aquarium from outside. Its better to take a picture from outside rather than spending so much money.

Excellent. We went to Dubai mall several times.. This one we said, lets see the tunnel.. We bought tickets (about $30 per adult) and we has access to three attraction including: the underwater zoo and two others in the 3rd floor.. Amazing experience and our daughters loved seeing big sharks and rays in front of them.. In the third floor you can buy food to feed fishes in the top of the Aquarium.. Really good experience

Amazing experience. Absolutely loved this experience, great place to take the family when holidaying in Dubai.Always look back on this holiday with great memories, would definitely return to the underwater zoo. Magical part of the holiday!
Post new year. Situated within Dubai mall.There is under water tunnel, glass bottom boat ride, submarine exploration.

Very cool but you don't need to go inside. It is crazy how huge Dubai Mall it is and crazier that it have an aquarium inside, just insane and great! A lot of stars for that but I don't know if the experience of the underwater zoo filled my expectations. I have been in better aquariums around the world and I think that is OK If you see the big aquarium just from outside.

Huge and safe Aquarium. I want to introduce my small kid to nature life since her early age without put her to inconvenient and dangerous place. Dubai Aquarium is one of the place that meet my criteria. I can introduce my daughter to many kind of fish, the cute one to the great one such as shark and even giant salt water crocodile. She is really exited and enjoy it. Is located at the second to the ground floor of the Dubai Mall. Definitely very nice and interesting to visit.
Pricey without content. If you have not seen an aquarium before, this is a good place to be. If you have seen other international aquarium like in Perth and Sydney
Could be better. We did expect a lot more for the price. The aquarium and the zoo were rather small compared to other zoos we have been to. The prices were definitely too high.

Amazing this is in a mall!. We did the explorer pack and really enjoyed it. Allow at least an hour. Prob 2ish to really look around and not be rushed. They show you the back area where they have the baby fish and food preparation. Pretty amazing given you're in a mall. Only thing that was troubling is some of the holding pens are quite small for the animals - not much room to have much of a life (Esp the crocs). Lots to see and vast array of animals from around the world. Great for kids.

Nice . The only thing that ruins this experience of the type of people there visiting. People pushing, shoving you constantly, people that do not know what a proper queuing system is and also just jump in front of you when they can clearly see you are taking a picture. If you can handle that, this is a good experience for people of all ages. If you get the basic 100Dhs tickets you get to see the tanks, walk around the 'zoo' and also the tunnel. Will take you about 2.5 hours and there is a lot to see. If you're in the Mall it's deffo worth a visit. Any questions welcome
Very cool. The location inside Dubai Mall makes it easy to get to and the aquarium is really nice. You can see a lot with just the basic ticket.
Absolutly perfect!. You need to reserve 1 hour for this place! I feeled like underwater with sharks and with other fishes. It's not like anywhere else. Go and visit!
Amazing!. Great experience!Lots of sharks and cat fish!It worths taking the boat ride and admire this waterworld right down at your feet!

For me it was definitely not worth. nothing specialThe only impressive is the tube where you go and you can see the fish around you, but you do not have to pay so much, from the outside it is equally beautifulFor me it was definitely not worth

Loved It. This is a must see if you have kids. It's captivating! Our son loved it as it is probably one of the best aquariums in the world. Not only were the fish amazing they had a crocodile and birds.

It's ok, too expensive for what it is. Small compared to some others we have seen and not as much species and less well done from an educational standpoint. The acquarium in Okinawa were much much much better.
Beautiful. Loved the way they conserve and take care of the numerous types of fishes and other sea animals. Lovely place for adults and kids too.

Marvel in Dubai Mall. This aquarium is a marvel- millions of gallons of water in the middle of mall with sharks swimming without eating other fish and king croc too. I liked the short underwater tunnel will all types of fish floating around me followed by a "researcher" experience explaining about marine life and told us that the sharks are not eating small fish as they are satiated with tuna and shrimps daily so are not hungry at all. A Glass Boat ride and a submarine simulator ride. Very informative.

Worth the visit.. There were several package options to visit this aquarium. I chose the adveturer. To me this was worth it. Enjoyed the feeling I was walking under and next to marine life and then a small glass bottom boat ride for viewing. Would be great for kids.
Moments with my BF. It was very awesome experience in Dubai Acquarium, great place to watched sea lives, amazing adventure seeing animals fishes it's a package to see all in there.

Spectacular view of the underwater. I have to say I was amazed at the size of the glass viewing panels of the aquarium. Like everything I found in Dubai attractions like the aquarium were larger than life. I will always marvel at sea life and being able to walk under and around it. I won't say that this was the best aquarium I've been to but it's certainly worth a look. I think that kids would be overwhelmed by the sheer magnitude of the aquarium and the fact that it's part of the shopping mall. Worth the look if you take the time to experience without rushing.

A refreshing concept. This is a truly surprising concept. An aquarium right in the middle of a mall surrounded by a creek/River and the tallest building in the world. This whole concept works very well. It's great for a small or big family visiting Dubai.

Great fun and variety!. Very nice to see. Sharks are cool. Feeding of the Giant Croc was not so special, so no need to wait around for that at 4pm. But seeing the Croc was worth the price of admission. The forced tour got old, but did not last that long.

Disappointing. Had high expectations but was disappointed with the short underwater tunnel, large crowds and generally very quick experience. It took us less than 20 mins to get through the aquarium and to be honest hardly justified the entrance fee. The crocs worth a visit but if you're pushed for time don't bother, the London aquarium is much better.

not worth the bother. had a new year visit with friends, seriously walk through the tunnel, thats about the best it gets.all the sharks and rays milling around is amazing.depending on what you pay for there are several levels of paying for stuff, for example you can view through the tunnel, then go on a "boat" trip.you queue for too long, for little interest.its not worth the admission fee, and in my opinion the venue is quite dated

Crocs & Octopus are worth a visit . Went with my kids aged 4 & 6. The Dubai aquarium is not that big but the underwater zoo is really good for kids.They have got two big crocodiles from Australia. Octopuses are so big and a rare species which I have never seen in any aquarium.Worth a visit with young kids.

Nice experience, great variety. First of all it is amazing that an aquarium of that size is four inside a mall, I would say 'typically Dubai'.Indeed the first amazement is over you get into another world, the sea world with a great variety of fish swimming in the aquarium. I think anybody from any age could enjoy him- or herself.What adds to the experience is that there are a few options which could be included in your ticket. Diving, a "cinematic" experience, feeding the fish...it's all possible and really adds to the experience.I would say to definitely go see the aquarium when visiting Dubai, it's one of the interesting spots in Dubai.

variety of fishes, big and small. This grand aquarium sits at the ground floor of Dubai mall. It hosts a huge number of fishes. The view of swimming fish is amazing, very pleasing for the eyes of all.

loved the aquarium. went there wid my family. the price is little high 250 dirhams per person. but worth seeing the beautiful fishes and underwater world.
in thr last they took and pic and said if you want a copy. we have to pay 300 dirhams :/
Seen much better Aquarium. It is good for people who haven't been to other aquariums in the world.It is not that big as it claimed to be.
Nothing out of the ordinary but may be better for families than couples. We went as a couple but didn't find it anything out of the ordinary, but perhaps it would be better for families.
Not worth the money . Over priced and too small. The only positive is the glass boat ride but even then still not worth the money paid.

Worth a visit. My little one enjoyed colourful fish and the crocodile feeding show. There are lots of colorful picture opportunities.
Gift shop has some nice souvenirs. Don't forget to check out the restaurant.

"Not so Attractive it was". The Underwater zoo is good place to show the kids the different animals the specially the giant crocodile of 750 kgs. But i guess the aquarium in The Atlantis is much better and this one.

Fantastic Attraction in Dubai Mall!. The Dubai Aquarium is fantastic! There is a gigantic glass wall in Dubai Mall that gives you a great idea of what there is - which is already mesmerizing in itself, but once inside it is absolutely breathtaking .. walking along the tunnel you can see the manta rays and the sharks SO CLOSE! Worth getting a ticket with extras such as a tour aboard the glass bottom boat.The only tiny mistake I did was that I visited the Aquarium after shopping at Dubai Mall (the shopping bags are somewhat a burden!).I totally recommend spending time at the Aquarium and do shopping later or on another day.

Well done, book at least an hour.. With my daughter, we visited the aquarium in other cities. In Dubai is generally interesting tour for adults and children. Advantage that you can take photos even with the flash. Here are some photos.
Great experience. You can visit Dubai Mall and see part of this for free, or you can pay and see a whole lot more! Enjoy!
Worth a visit. We spent a morning here and enjoyed all the different attractions and talks from the guides at the end, well worth a visit.

Reasonably priced and plenty to see & do. Visited on my own during a visit to Dubai Mall. Entrance fee was cheaper than I expected. The walk through the tunnel in the main tank is short but fabulous. Then you go up a few levels to the main section. Very clean and well run, good exhibits and informative about marine life of the Gulf area. Highly recommended couple of hours if you're in The Mall area!
A bit tiny zoo but nice.... A nice collection marine creature, and very friendly staff. Had a good time with our kids. We had to wait long queue to purchase tickets, but it was worth it....

Fun. The only other aquarium I've been to is in London and all I can say is that this aquarium is waaaaay better than the one in London. My favourite was the leopard sting ray- keep a look out for it!

Sharks and Manta Rays up close and personal. Great educational trip for the whole family. Can go up and feed the fish and lots of interesting species to have a look at. Definitely a must see when in Dubai

Underwater world. This is a fantastic way to see the creatures underwater & the glass bottom boat with these marine creatures around u is a real deal. The massive king croc,otters & penguins are worthy of a watch irrespective of your age. The boat ride stands out in the whole experience because your so close to these marine flora & especially the baby sharks

OMG!! One of the best aquarium I've ever been to. I'm a regular in aquariums and zoo. During my past visits, I've always been looking at the aquarium to my right in Dubai Mall but never thought that it'd be great. Recently during my family trip, I decided to visit this and man, what a great decision. Aquarium is great, glass bottom boats are amazing as you get clear view of what's beneath but the real highlight is Underwater Zoo. It has got some amazing species and I was blown away by Paddlefish, big huge crabs, octopus and various species I couldn't imagine I'd see in this avatar. We all loved this place and still talk about it.

Fishy Wonder. Even though there is an aquarium in the Dubai Mall, the visit to this Aquarium and Underwater zoo is much better and less noisy. The mythical touch of the lost Atlantis adds mystery and makes for a more interesting and memorable visit. The sea life swimming around is peacefully enjoyable. A must see...

Wow a wonder amongst the shops. Excellent idea to put it in the mall and wow what a fabulous place, from identifying Nemo to the King of the place, you must see hime in full glory at meal times. The boat trip with all the sea creatures under you well wow it's breath taking. The tunnels you can walk under, tanks full of fish and the boat with the glass floor it's a must for all to tick off the list and say you have done it. So much on offer for all ages!

Interesting to see. A really good attraction and learnt a lot walking around. The only problem is that they let too many people in at one time so we rushed around it a little bit because it was difficult to see it all. Tour guides were really good and informative.
Nice aquarium. Myself I love fishes and I thought that was amazing seeing such a beautiful decoration and fishes around the world

Great idea when the weather is just too hot. There are lots of ticket options for the aquarium so make sure you look at what you would prefer to see. The 2nd price package worked for us as it covered a back of house tour which was really interesting.The king croc is the main attraction at the moment and he is really worth the trip alone ! You have to see him to believe he can be that big up close.
Better than expected. This was bigger than we had originally expected. There's lots more to see on top of the giant walk-through tunnel. Would definitely recommend.

Kids loved it but I had some issues. I get the whole point (and I know it's a well contested argument) about the roles aquariums and zoos play in conservation and education but I had some real issues with this place Very crowdedVery very expensive Very focused on making more money from you -if I had to say no thanks to a photographer I had to say it ten timesWhilst I think fish in such enclosed spaces are fine, I have a big problem with huge crocs, penguins and even sharks

OK. After paying to enter we later realised that on the second floor you could see most of the fishes without spending a dime! We were badgered to buy a photo that we were persuaded to have taken, and ended up spending 300AED on a photograph and a complimentary mug which we didn't really want. The whole aquarium was loud and overcrowded, definitely not a serene place to relax and watch the fish swim. However if you are a family with kids looking for a change of scenery in the mall, it a great to see many different species of fish and turtles. My favourite were the otters who dived off the platform and swam right up against the window!Every level was set out for purchases, so be prepared to put your purse away and don't be tempted to buy their extortionately priced souvenirs.

Manmade wonder. The experience was superb, with close encounters with various species of aquatic animals. We also enjoyed the underwater zoo immensely, including the penguins and the big croc. Don't miss the archer fishes target practice for food.

A zoo in the city. I've always been in the Dubai mall and always see the big aquarium but never really have the chance to check what's in there. You should use an entertainer voucher if you're a group as the ticket price is quite pricey depends on what kind of trip you'll take. The first trip is the big aquarium where you can take some pictures outside then you'll enter the tunnel of the aquarium which is kinda scary as it is a bit small and there's a lot of people inside. But it s awesome to see the sharks in a closer view. At the end of the tunnel you can also buy the pictures/ souvenirs taken by their photographer. They also offer a jungle-like restaurant but it is close during that time. Then you'll head to the 3rd floor where they have different activities and depends on the ticket that you bought. We had a boat ride at the top of the aquarium where you can also feed the fish. There's a bit of hesitation here as the boat's flooring is made of glass. After the boat ride, they'll have separate tanks for different kinds of fish, turtles, and animals. Quite informative as they even put the scientific names of each animals. The main attraction is the king croc whic is really scary! The only wall that's protecting you is the thick glass with some scratches probably done by the king and queen itself. They also have penguins there and upstairs are the night animals. Quite interesting for kids and overall, it is good for a quick view but not worthy to come back again.
neat experience. The Dubai aquarium offers some great views of the marine life. The location is also so central that it can be combined with some great shopping

Amazing place to visit. Heard about this place and it was worth visiting. The tunnel is little bit short but you will enjoy every second of your time. Has variety of fish and animals. Definitely a good place to spend some family time

Awesome . Seen it from the Dubai mall. It is amazing and beautiful to watch. Kids will love it. Dubai mall is very big, we tried to exist from the place where taxi had dropped us but realised the taxi drop and pick spots are different so again we had to walk in different direction. Over took around one hour just to exit.

they have thought of everything. the mall is so modern clean and they really did it up right the sight of the aquarium is nice. It doesn't take long to walk through really there is a partial one you can see in the mall without paying for this one.
Good attraction but hugely overpriced. Amazing attraction. But if you compare to other zoo type animal attractions around the world it's pretty overpriced and does not show as much.

Below average aquarium. If you've never been to Monterey Bay Aquarium or the Singapore Aquarium, this is probably ok, but if you have, you will be really disappointed. We purchased the Aquarium and Boat ride package. The initial Aquarium walk through (through the glass tunnel) is pretty bad as there is nothing to see that can't be seen for free from the mall. Then you go up two flights to stand in an interminable line for the glass bottom boat ride inside an indoor fish tank (my 4 year old loved it, everyone else was bored stiff). But the best is last, when you finally get into the various aquarium exhibits (that may be available separately for people who eat at the Rainforest Cafe, not sure. Anyway in these exhibits the star attraction is a 5 meeter long crocodile that is amazing but plenty of other exhibits to see, definitely the last is best, but not better than most other aquarium exhibits I've seen. There is none of the usual starfish, sand dollar, touchy feelies for the little ones nor any vignettes or anything like that, but lots of colorful fish, could probably get the same effect going to a good pet store (except for the Cairns croccie.).

Neat Place to Visit. A really neat way to spend an afternoon. Besides the aquarium is a zoo, a behind the scene tour, glass bottom boat, and a chance to feed birds, fishes, and watch the feeding of the giant saltwater crocodile.

Go to say you went!. How dope is it to go to an aquarium in a mall? Pretty cool, actually. Lots of fish to see, walking in the underwater tunnel was fun to me. The boat ride was just ok. Even just watching the big tank from outside is a nice place to watch for awhile.

fish fish and fish!. This aquarium is a unique concept with the tunnel effect which allows you to walk under the fish and see the details of the underbellies of all and have a nice shot of the teeth. many fine photos here, as you can take a shot laying down and have a shark open his mouth and show you his pearly whites! there are so many species of fish that are indicative of this area of the middle east and the gulf waters. it is only 100 a.e.d. and you are given opportunity for photo to take home and this tour also includes a trip to the zoo up on the second floor. kids and adults alike will love this! you can shop and be in the aquarium at the same time. the mall itself is a fantastic large two block place with everything you can imagine or not imagine. There is also a restaurant inside if you need and it is a fantastic setting with much ambiance and wonderful food.
Spettaccular. Rally spettacular I'm animal rights activits and I'm just warried about fish because the aquarium looks very crowded........

A must visit especially for children. Really worth a visit. A real treat. Rainforest cafe right next door. There is a huge crocodile resident who is definitely worth seeing. Amazing variety of fish and other animals. Plus the air conditioning means this is the perfect place to stay cool and out of the daily heat whilst seeing some wonderful creatures.

A must visit place. Loved this place. They have the biggest fish pond in the world. 3 Floors big. View is amazing from outside of Aquarium in Dubai Mall.If you have never seen any aquarium, this is the best place to start. Nice clean and wonderful.
a unique place to visit. one of the largest aquarium you will see in your entire life, will design and operation, lot of visitors
Very nice attraction. A great activity to do with kids. Buy full tickets and enjoy the full atmosphere. See penguin feeding and all those animals all around the world. A must see in Dubai.
Nice For The Kids. For sure a nice thing to see but too many people at this event and it's crowded most of the time. Fish are fish !
A must visit place in Dubai. You will be lost in the Dubai Aquarium with all aquatic creatures wandering around. A must visit for every age and tourist attraction for Dubai
Nice aquarium but limited species and size. Nice aquarium to go and see but number of species could have been better. Also could have been better in size and extent.
Amazing. Something that you have to see. This is good thing to do when you would like to have a break when you spend whole day in Dubai Mall with your wife and two daughters for christmas shopping.
Amazing. This was a great experience, a must for kids. We took the glass bottom boats worth the extra money. At night it is very busy.

Well worth the money. Highlight of our trip if you buy a 48hr ticket with the sightseeing bus tour you get this free. You can see sharks and stingrays being fed by divers the glass tunnel you walk thru is amazing.

Interesting... But made us feel bad for the animals. We visited in a family of four. There is a lot to see, enough to keep you there for 2 hours, so it's a great activity. A lot of animals on display. Great service too, we could skip the queue because paying by credit card. So the attraction overall is definitely interesting, but the main issue we felt is that there are too many animals squeezed in way too little space. For the small fish it's ok, but it was a painful display to see larger animals who would normally roam large distances constrained in tiny spaces for their size (the crocodile, the owls, even the big octupus..). I understand the real estate space is costly for the mall, so i would recommend reducing the number/ type of animals in display by trnsferring them to more appropriate facilities and put all of them in more decent / spacious conditions. This way it can become a better and more educational venue than it is now!

Nice place to see all sealife. This activity is not only for adults an unforgettable trip into seaworld of this Country - very exciting and interesting place. Fishes, Sea Stars and are shown in real site scenes!:-) :-) *****

Great Aquarium, but odd behind the scenes tour. The aquarium had a fantastic variety of displays but many of the tanks had no names and no information sheets on them, so we were left wondering what many of the fish were and where they came from. The most amusing thing was the behind the scenes tour, one lady started the tour and told a group of twelve of us pretty much nothing and ignored us while we looked at a tank of baby sharks with no idea why, then handed over to another lady who yelled at us that they grow algae but not why and then just left us standing there with no instruction as to what to do next, we left having learnt nothing. It's still worth checking the aquarium though.
its beautiful from outside. its a kind of big version of aquarium its so beautiful and amazing and if you are a gold miner you could go diving in it

Amazing. I have visited some Aquarium but this one is amazing with the different options you have like behind the scenes visit, glass bottom boat, fish feeding etc. You have package starting as from 100 AED. It was a great experience.
not so special. Dubai mall is definitely a good place to hang out. But the aquarium is not so special, too crowded and loud.. Its nice to see but don't be sad if you miss it..

Couples visit , good few hours well spent . My husband and I had bought tickets for the aquarium and underwater zoo . The ticket also included the boat ride and a subliminal submarine ride . As other reviewers have said the tunnel wasn't overly amazing and lasted for 30 minutes if that. You basically just walk through the tunnel and see majority of sharks and sting rays, which you can briefly see from the outside display . The best parts come after when going onto the next level upstairs. The first thing is the subliminal ride , where you step into a machine which takes you on a very short animation journey where you are standing inside . The animation here was good but the machine ride again was not the best , it could be more innovative. Maybe have people sitting down and do it in 3D would have been better .After this was the glass bottom boat ride, this was ok. You wear a life jacket and it goes around the pool like area for around 5/7minutes and you can see the fishes underneath . Once this was done we went around the underwater zoo and this was brilliant , getting to see all the different species of animals , from bats, to lizards , to giant crabs, penguins etc , the best part was definitely seeing King croc and his girlfriend just relaxing , although it did seem like a small area for them .Overall I would say this is a good few hours well spent , maybe more could be done to enhance the experience of a few areas but kids and adults will enjoy this and it's not too pricey either which is a bonus .

Very nice. Wanted to see what alk the fuss was about... it didn't disappoint... A smaller version very small version of Sealife Centre. Best part was to see how they feed the fish..Take the tour it's worth it
Sea fish galore. Spectacular aquarium amazing experience and well worth visiting and photographing the huge array of underwater fish.

A surprise in the middle of a mall. A fantastic attraction day or night. Although a bit expensive hiring a guide to take you around really lets you see everything and ou beat the queues. Definitely worth a visit.
This caught me by surprise.. I think it was one of the finest freebies I have ever seen. An amazing assortment of fish. I was stunned that they were not all eating each other
Huge Aquarium. I loved walking through the tunnel and watching the amazing sea life swimming around. It is amazing to see from the Dubai Mall even if you don't go inside - it's incredibly huge!
A very good attraction in the mall. The attraction is well laid out and organized. Various aquariums very clean and not overcrowded. The short glass bottom boat ride was decent.
Dubai Mall Visit. It was an excellent experience to see.This shows how natural activities can be brought to your door steps without you going further to look for it.

You cant miss this!. This is a great place not only for the children, but also for every person who enjoys seeing nature at its best and pristine. I loved looking at the colourful tropical fish and also the sharks, turtles and the sea serpants.

Dubai Aquarium and underwater zoo. The tremendously huge aquarium is situated in the Dubai Mall sprawling across multiple levels.There is a short boat ride which takes you around the pool in a glass bottom boat. Where you can see various fishes including the sand tiger sharks. In case you are travelling with kids under 3 remember you cannot take them for the boat ride. You can tell the counter staff that you are with am infant and they will mark your ticket with an "alternate". Which means you can take turns in going in for the ride.

Not to be missed. Initially i thought to give this one a miss. But after my cousin insisted, me and wife went to the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo, and I can tell you that its like every penny well spent. Buy the explorer pass, as that gives you access to the Glass bottom boat as well.The underwater tunnel is good, just like the Aquarium in Sydney and Melbourne. But the glass bottom boat experience is unique. Its just one of a kind. Really amazed by that. Even the Giant croc is really amazing. The video showing how the croc came from Cairns to Dubai is so overwhelming.

Exceeded our Expectations. My husband and I decided to visit when we really couldn't think of anything else to do. We went in not expecting much but were pleasantly surprised. The place was very well organized and we had alot of fun. The penguins were the cutest.

An experience for young and old alike. An eye-catching experience which starts with the walk through/under the Dubai Mall 'Fish Tank'. Seeing the sharks and large schools of fish is unique and with the Underwater Zoo three floors up it completes the experience. Great for kids with loads of displays and the animals / fish up close and very personal.

Great experience for all ages. The aquarium is a great way to watch the creatures do their own thing, but the underwater zoo is an amazing opportunity to learn more about individual species, and has a wide variety of sea creatures you won't usually find.Overall, if a tourist in Dubai, this should we of top priority to visit for all ages.
Clean glasses . A lot of spectacle with that many variant of fish ,but also with the divers feeding the fish and /or cleaning glasses
Not worth a visit. The aquarium is just a small walk in a fish tank tunnel. Quite sad and boring. You can rather stand outside and enjoy looking at the fish from afar.

Good visit. Visited with a friend on my first trip to Dubai. The aquarium is lovely to look at from the outside but we decided to see what the ticket price would get us. It's nice as it kills some time and you never get bored looking at the different species in the tank. Underwater zoo was also good.

Nice aquarium and tour : make sure you take the extra 10$ feeding option!!. The dubai aquarium remains a very nice aquarium.But once you have seen aquariums like in the vegas hotels or the local one in Atlantas (huge one!) i'm not sure if this aquarium is the most beautifull in the world.They certainly have a lot of beautifull sharks in it and if you take the 10$ option to feed the fish you can get a nice backstage tour to see all of the installations etc which I liked a lot.

Good way to spend an hour/hour and a half. We had a couple of hours to spend so went here on the cheapest tickets, 100 Durham. Plenty to see and a large number of exhibits. Place was clean and tidy and not too busy.

A must visit..!!. A must visit attraction if you are in dubai.. Its surely a 1 time must visit with the sheer scale of the place & the location which is in the Dubai mall..!! The underwater tunnel is amazing as well as the small ride in the glass boat at the top. You can see the different species which will amaze the kids... If you can shell out some extra bucks you can dive inside the aquarium.. The underwater zoo also is nicely arranged with various species especially the giant croc (hardly moved) ..
Wow. Amazing ..... Loved the feeding times how gently they got fed very clean wonderful stingrays in harmony with many other rare fish

Nice fish but do not waste money on it if you have an infant.. The aquarium is very pretty and has a lot of variety of fish. They have nice packages for touring the back area and tunnel etc but with an infant we were not allowed to do 3/4 things and still they wanted to charge the full ticket price so that was not impressive.

Enjoyable and interesting - great place to entertain the kids. We really enjoyed our visit to the Aquarium. The researcher behind the scenes tour was really interesting. I recommend you go early in the day to avoid the crowds.

Awesome, awesome, awesome. If you are in Dubai, this is the place to visit, the fish collection is fascinating and spending few extra dollars you can have the feeling of being underwater with the fishes. Make sure you go on the boat ride, these are a must if you visit the aquarium.

Very interesting under water zoo, aquarium didn't do it for me. I have to review this in two parts:The aquarium part (apparently used to be free) is the underwater tunnel in the mall, interesting but not worth the money in my opinion. Suspect it was fascinating as a point of interest when free but was a bit gimmicky for me. Great experience for kids to see the sharks etc. though so well worth a look if you have a family. (3.5 out of 5)The underwater zoo (4.5 out of 5) had everything from amazing fish, large strange rats, otters, crocodiles and desert critters and I thought it was brilliant! Didn't like seeing the salt crocs in small area but fundamentally it gave a close up view of lots of the aquatic animals and lots of interesting information as well. Overall a good 4 out of 5 as the underwater zoo was well done in my opinion.....

loved it. We were visiting a friend who lives in UEASo enjoyed a guide tour, the big aquarium viewing tank is on the lowest level. You can go up a couple floors to the rest of it. Upstairs, however, the underwater zoo was fantastic Feature after feature of cool underwater stuff doing cool underwater stuff. Really well laid out. All up close lots of different species are on display to see. This aquarium rivals many of the nicer ones in the other parts of the world including sea world USA and sea-life centres in the UK
Amazing. No words can describe how wonderful this place is! Huge displays and aquariums for all sorts of amazing sea creatures including sharks. Truly enjoyable. Not to be missed.
World Class & Incomparable. Beautiful & Superb Aquarium between Dubai Mall. We got crazy by seeing huge aquarium with lots of Attractions & Fishes.

Much better than predicted. The main aquarium viewing tank is on the lowest level. From there you go up a couple floors to to the rest of it. So many different varieties are on display to see. This aquarium rivals many of the nicer ones in the USA I have been to.

Dubai Aquarium in the shopping Mall. Situated in one of the two main shopping malls other has a ski slope, actually these 2 malls are what Dubai is all about .... ! Am not a shopper but the aquarium is wonderful... !! A must see actually for most people its all there is to see in Dubai....! Bring a camera and you will get amazing shots! Suitable for everyone wheel chair access etc.. Could spend most of the day in there.................... Enchanting...
interesting. This was a very pleasant surprise and quite interesting to observe. It is also in air conditioned comfort.
Nice when you are at the dubai mall. Nice aquariumNothing out of the worldGood exhibits and details on conservationworth a tripSometimes it can get crowded
Its worth for the price paid. Go for the basic one, there is no need for more, you get to pass inside the tunnel with no hurries, after you see the back of house and the amazing zoo!!

Downstairs was good. Upstairs was great!. The ground floor and tunnel bits of the aquarium don't really let you see more than anyone who happens to be breezing through the mall. OK, so the tunnel is a little more exclusive but you're still looking at the same (admittedly pretty amazing) stuff.Upstairs, however, was a very different story. The underwater zoo was a perfect illustration of substance over scale. Feature after feature of cool underwater critters doing cool underwater critter stuff. Really well laid out. All up close. Amazing for the casual smartphone photographer. Would be very easy to convince your FB friends that you'd been scuba diving somewhere very exotic with some expensive aquatic DSLR rig. Atlantis has a much better aquarium on every front (if you're reading this, you should go) but the zoo at the mall stood this attraction apart.

Beautifull and Learning Experience. This place is in Dubai Mall and is mostly visited by families or school going students. If one can, one must take the swim course with the fish. The fish are of a very wide variety and are beautifull to observe.

Aquarium in the middle of a mall :-). The aquarium is one of the attractions of the Dubai mall. IT is a nice aquarium, but the services around it make it special: one can dive in the main pool,, one can take a boat tour on the water, it is possible to feed the fish, one can see how the filters work --- all of these are typically not possible in other aquariums. For me the tunnel was a disappointment, that's the only thing down there.

Fun outing!. A fun little outing to keep the little ones busy while you shop. However, even adults who love animals and marine life may enjoy. There's also a little boat ride available in the tank for an additional fee and you can even get a picture taken with a baby python.
Ok. Got in free as we had a 48hr tourist bus ticket, was ok. The best part was the talk from the staff on what they are doing and how. Did not take long to walk through.

Must do in Dubai at the Dubai Mall. This is an essential activity. You have to pay about 100 dhs per ticket but worth every penny. Seeing fish in an aquarium and experiencing them up close in a glass tunnel is very different. Besides the glass tunnel you have an aquarium and zoo on the upper floor which is worth seeing once. The variety of fish itself is mind blowing. There is also a separate section on night animals/ birds and insects which is also worth a look. Stay away from paid photos- please carry your own camera.

Good for little ones. This aquarium is in Dubai mall and is really good for a visit for those having small children . The variety of marine animals is good and one of the best places where kids enjoy.It is a paid attraction but worth visiting

Overrated. You can see the coolest stuff from the exposed part of the aquarium.m within the Mall. It took 1 hour to tour but it felt like too long. There are better aquariums and for me there was a distinct sense of confinement, probably exuded by the animals in overcrowded space - much like the Dubai Mall.

well worth the money. we paid 100 d.. and it was great .. the underwater zoo was spectacular ... u learn about so much i won't say as i won't spoil it... but the sea horses are beautiful ... just do it the kids would love it ... seeing different stages of how jelly fish grow even impressed me ...

Worth visiting. We had free tickets because we booked the hop on hop off bus for 48 hours.The experience you get while walking under a huge water tank in the form of a glass tunnelwhere sharks,stingrays and other kinds of fish are swimming all around you is overwhelming.There is also another two floors for underwater zoo ,some boats to ride (I did not try them),penguins,two huge crocodiles ...and a gift shop.I saw some people diving in this aquarium.

Incredibly Impressive!. This is an awesome addition at the Dubai Mall. A great way to break up shopping! The aquarium is huge and stocked with a wonderful variety of fish. Absolutely worth the time and entrance fee!!

You can take nice photos in the tunnel. It was a good experience, Most of the aquarium can be seen from outside (Mall View), but the tunnel is fine for taking pictures, the place is also very attractive for the kids, I recommend it if you have children, they will be very excited and happy...the only problem is that it is very expensive..

Several Floors. Went there with my Beijing friend, she invited me after we had dinner at the atmosphere, I actually would love to add photos, but in this window it doesn't allow me to do so. Loved the boat on the top, we did have a lot of fun with our life vests. Check which credit card to use for your buy 1 get 1 for free deal. Will probably go again.

huge aquarium. Situated in the dubai mall This aquarium is a stunner.. it is huge and the fish fantastic.. the third floor has a massive e crocodile..and cool aquariums. . If you like to see animals and their habitats this aquarium is a must visit.they have good behind the scenes and other underwater features too at an extra price

Place to go if you need a break from shopping. This is a massive aquarium in a massive mall. Interesting location which can easily allow you to kill a few a few hours while the keen shopper does more damage to the credit card

The best in the world Aquarium. I really enjoyed watching that huge aquarium with all those different kind of fish, I even enjoyed the clear water and divers swimming, feeding and cleaning all the glass.

Not expected in a mall. Very exciting.
Since ilast visited in 2008 there has been developement in the aquarium including an underwater zoo in top floor and also possiblity of feeding the fishes and even diving in the aquarium.
It worthes 100 dhs for researcher ticket.
The other classes are more expensive.
Researcher is the basic.
Take a look if you are in Dubai Mall.

Very nice aquaruim ... You can enjoy this beautiful aquarium while you are shopping or chilling in Dubai mall .. really nice lace to discover sea world nature live and also you can dive with sharks and other sea creatures with well trained coaches ..
Great experience. Great way to spend time wiith family and visiting relatives and friends. Not very expensive. I suggest the basic ticket of aquarium and zoo. Entertainers accepted.

Fantastic. My older girl wanted to go to see this. Its worth seeing but cost about 35 pound each. I suppose its ok for a one off. Next time we go to Dubai we wno't need to go unless its free. Mind you, you can see some of it from outside without paying.
Nice. Not a bad aquarium, over 2 floors, ok not the best I've been to but ok, not that good value for money but novelty in mall
In a shopping mall?. A must if visiting the Dubai Mall. Unbelievable experience and a good tour. Very knowledgable guide and a good conservation programme. Absolutely fascinating

Incredible visit!. For a reasonable price, the Dubai aquarium provides large access to behind the scenes of the large fish tank that shoppers ooh and aah at. We were able to see e breeding tanks and feeding areas of the animals which was very interesting to see. The exhibit is simply enormous and each section leads nicely onto each other so there is no worry about missing one. The aquarium houses 2 crocodiles, one that was shipped from Australia and was featured on a television programme. It's really amazing to see such a n incredible creature. I would highly recommend the experience to anyone remotely interested in wildlife.

Live this fishes . When I saw the aquarium from far I was like " oh my gosh" so many fishes. The good thing is if you are on a small. Budget you an watch it from outside while walking in the mall. The view is fantastic. As I had only a by pass in dubai for few hours I went inside to have a look. When you walk inside the tunnel you can see the sharks from down. Good few on their toothy (as you see on the picture) after the aquarium you also can visit the underwater zoo where you can see craps etc. Now they have a big crocodile. It's huge my gosh. Absolutely worth the money to visit. You gonna love it
Trip to the mall. If you are going to the Dubai mall you must visit the aquarium its a great way to relax and spend some time out the sun plenty of stuff to keep kids and adults amused

Looks nice. I didn't get in because I went in an aquarium when I was in valencia, however, I regret for that.
The aquarium is inside the dubai mall
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Loved it. It cost 100 ADE per person but it worth it. If you are traveling with kids then defiantly visit this aquarium.

Amazing place to scuba dive. We visited the aquarium (in the Dubai Mall, the largest mall in the World) and subsequently decided to do a scuba dive in the tank with 400 sharks and rays. The aquarium can be seen by all 3 floors of the mall and it's a little bizarre watching the public viewing you as you dive. Each diver has a dedicated instructor. Highly recommended.

Amazing!. It was a pleasant surprise to see a massive tank in the middle of a mall! It contains loads of different species of underwater animals, you can either look for free from behind a rope barrier or pay to get up close to the tank. We bought a bundle so that we could get up close, go through a tunnel under the water and go on a glass bottom boat on top of the tank, within an arms reach of the sharks below! Definitely recommend, fantastic for families.

WOW. This is located in the mall - its fantastic - ive nver seen anything like it - you can dive in it and do a glass bottom boat too - but otherwise you can just sit in a restaurant and look at the ocean life!! or walk past it and admire it! Fabulous!!
Nice Aquarium inside a mall. Lovely aquarium in Dubai Mall. A must visit if you happen to be in Dubai. Remarkable the way they have built such a huge aquarium inside a shopping mall.
Wow. It was a nice experience the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo which is located in the Dubai mall, they have some nice collections of fish and a massive croc

Marvelous. Among many beautiful things you will be able to see in Dubai mall, the aquarium is among the best and worth remembering.With different package (some are affordable, others somehow expensive. Looking from outside the aquarium is free, few meters away of the aquarium (5m or 4m) and you are allowed to take pictures even selfies ;)From AED 100 (approx. $28), you can pass in the aquarium tunnel and able to see a very good underwater zoo...

Very Average. The 3 of us, including our little princess who is 3.5 years, did it all - right from the aquarium to the glass boat ride and the walk through the zoo. It was alright, nothing phenomenally attractive or outlandish about this place. We have seen much better stuff outside.
Very Nice!!. A nice place to visit when visiting the Dubai mall and the views are amazing. This is the best attraction in the Dubai mall and a good place for children
Simply brilliant aquarium. Like everything in UAE, not inexpensive, but truly fantastic aquarium, and certainly worth visiting, especially for young children.

Pretty awesome . It's definitely awesome having an aquarium in a mall. It's pretty and well looked after. They have the basic sort of water animals and then they have 2 bug crocs. Its fun and they have activities such as feeding the fish and shark diving.

Nice view. One can easily see the aquarium once in Dubai Mall and on ground floor. Viewing from outside is free of cost. But if you wish to see the tunnel it costs 100 Dhirams. Which we don't recommend as you see the same thing from inside and oustide. It also offers scuba diving at the cost of around Rs 19000.

Break up the shopping with a visit to the aquarium!. Located in the huge Dubai Mall the aquarium is a break from walking around the hundreds and hundreds of shops. Walk through an underwater archway surrounded by fish and sharks and divers! We took the basic tour so did not feed the fish or dive with the sharks but it was a good way to while away an hour or so. Interesting talk about marine preservation and some unusual fish, crabs and frogs etc to see. Not too pricey
Awesome. Beautiful sight to behold. Very enjoyable. Would recommend this very highly. Always been fascinated with life under water.

A Whole New World. There are ways to market an there is a way that the guys here market ... its brilliant.The whole tour is almost like an orchestra. You decide from the options available... there is the acquarium tunnel, then an underwater zoo, a boat ride, a night animals zoo, an option to feed the fish or then go all the way and swim with the sharks. The aquarium leaves you speechless as you watch the 35000 odd fish of all shapes, sizes and colours swim all around you in a tunnel shaped structure. The zoo comprises of penguins and crocodiles apart from a host of fish and aquatic species. The dark zoo has some truly magnificent creepy crawlies.... and then of course are the customized mementoes. I didnt do the underwater diving but it seems to be an experience that you just have to do in a lifetime. If in Dubai, do not give this a miss.
Just seen it from the out side. You can see a big aquarium from the outside on the Dubai Mall, i didn't get in, but from the mall you can see a lot of fishes!!
Great experience. Wonderful experience. Close encounter with sharks and other huge fishes. Good learning experience regarding the marine life
What a great day out. This is one of the best things to do when you are in Dubai and is great value for money and you get to see some amasing fish
The Arabs Aquarium. its nice to see something great like this in arab countries ... its not like the one in Atlanta but it is good must see.

things to do at the aquarium. One will find 85 different species of sea cretures in a very well designed setting. They have an 11 meter aquarium (which u can also watch from the Dubai mall) along some other attracrions.They offer 4 different tours for 100,120,200 and 250 Dhs. I suggest the 120 with these things included : 1-The tunnel with sharks and everthhing swimming around2- 3-D simulator of the aquarium 3- The boat tour at the top of the aquarium where You'll see the fishes from above thru the glass bottom of the boat under your feet.4- Zoo where u can watch different types of smaller aquatics like sea-stars and crabs. They also have got pinguins and crocodile along some desert creatures from Dubai like  Lizards...Private tour will cost you more,but 120Dhs ticket will keep u busy for about an hour or so. Children would love this place

An Experience Worth Seeing. I went alone while waiting for friends to finish work. I found the exhibit crowded but worth the visit. The variety of fish is amazing. The walk through the tunnel is special to see fish through the glass swimming. This is an excellent experience for kids and adults. It is a nice break from shopping even though it can be full of noisy people.
Unbelievable!. Visit the mall and then visit this huge aquarium underneath the shops! Rather overcrowded fish tanks so some signs of stress in the fish communities. A great experience though.

11 million liters of water around..... You read the title right! 11 million liters of water with bright and fantastic aquatic creatures around you. It's not at all comparable to the one in Singapore which has a walkalator but it's still worth the visit. Situated in the Dubai mall there are quiet a few attractions in the place which is priced according to what you want to do, like you walk through the tunnel as you see in the pic but you can also get into a glass boat in the aquarium, you can feed the crocs and fishes, you can experience the simulation of under water walk, a guided tour about the aquarium and the creatures and many such things all at a price. It is differentiated into packages at the start of the tour and the complete tour will take about 5 hours for the last package all activities included, If I'm not wrong it will cost about 230 - 250 AED per person and the basic one starts at 100 AED per person. We did choose the basic one and added the fish feeding at a cost of 10 AED to it. Not to miss, the aquarium is maintained really well.

Stunning. Went to the mall on a whim as we had a six hour layover at Dubai airport.You can put luggage in the left luggage room and simply hop on the metro right into the city centre so much easier than fighting to get a taxi and for a fraction of the cost. The metro drops you at the Mall and you suddenly come across a huge fish tank full of fishes, sharks, rays and eels. We paid the 1000 baht each(20 quid) and thought it expensive at first, but once you get in the tunnel it becomes well worth the money. You are literally a couple of feet away from full sized sharks ....brilliant. There's no one pushing you so you stay as long as you like, but once you've had enough someone guides you upstairs where a guide takes you to the back rooms where you see baby sharks, sea horses and a host of other interesting stuff. You then go into the zoo bit which holds hundreds of animals, spiders, fish,penguins,, and many more.We spent 1 1/2 hours in there so it was well worth the entrance fee.

Unforgetable experience. If you are in Dubai Mall, the Aquarium is indispensable. Expensive entrance ticket but you can observe it from outside too. It is a huge bassin/glass wall with many many fishes. From the corridor the view is free.

Not to be missed. A place you have to see. Take the full ticket to see the aquarium, the zoo and the nursery. The tank is at the ground floor. After you visited it, you have to take the escalator and go two floor up. In the nursery you can see many interesting things. From seahorses to jellyfish. Then you can move to the zoo that includes many water tanks plenty of fishes to end with penguins and the biggest crocodile in this side of the world. The kids will love it and talk about it for weeks. The price, at first glance, seems to be expensive because you can see from outside only 30% of what is available. I don't think it is marketed properly. I suggest you to go for the full ticket all inclusive. You will have no regrets. By the way, if you are a scuba diver... You can dive with the sharks. Call them for more info, i am not sure how it works exactly. But a friend of mine did it, so i can assure this is feasible. If you are not afraid by sharks...
Dubai aquarium. Being part of Dubai mall,aquarium draws lot of crowd. It's large spaces and variety of fishes gives good visual effects. But it is not the best.
Amazing. You won't believe the size until your there! It's amazing .. you must see if you go They have sharks and everything !

What a fun place for kids. The underwater zoo is an exciting place to take kids. They get to feed the fishes too..which is quite a lovely sight. They have added some new species and I was quite stunned by the size of the crocodile they have. They have regular member passes for resident who wish to bring their kids and family often. I mean on a summer day with limited outdoors where else can you take the kids. This is thoroughly educative and beautiful to see the fishes and decor.
Huge Fishes. Wonderful experience, big fishes and we get to feed the fishes at close range. The underwater zoo was so informative.

Worth a visit. My fiance and i really enjoyed the aquarium visit.It was huge and had a very interesting story plot linked to its arrangement.The staff was ok. only a few staff who would go and friendly approach and you tell about the fishes or anything related.The aquarium also have a cozy sitting area for you to chill while admiring the beautiful sea life in the aquarium.

Nicely done ..... best in UAE ..... but not among the best in the world !. Small tunnel at the Dubai Mall aquarium. Good sight for first time underwater experiences ..... but not for those who have visited Sentosa at Singapore / the mega aquariums in the USA.

lovely but crowded . worth a visit especially with kids. the underwater tunnel full if amazing fish, sharks and rays. Then you go to the second level for the Underwater Zoo. slightly expensive on price

Different experience. Great thing to do if you are with kids. It is a different experience. Sometimes it gets confusing because it is not straightforward to roam in it. Make sure you visit it completely as it has a lot of sections and you have to make sure you visit them. You can ask the staff, they are very helpful.

Dubai Aquarium- A must see in Dubai. Be prepared to gasp in awe at the sheer scale of this huge aquarium which fills an entire wall of the building and is 2 floor high, filled with fish of every description, including sting rays and sharks which glide past you effortlessly as they swim throughout this vast aquarium. You will be fascinated by the colours and species of fish contained within this amazing structure, which includes a tunnel walkway through which visitors can walk to see the fish close up. Standing on ground level or higher up on the upper floors, you will be astonished at the beauty and serene tranquility of the moving fish; there is nothing else quite like it anywhere in the world!

Amazing place. The Dubai aquarium is a amazing place and its in a mall of all places, there is so much to see in the main tank, including the divers, once you have been through the main tank you go upstairs to see the rest of the animals from otters to bats and it's now the home of the King Croc, the kids will love it.

Wonderful, awesome. My sister and I visited this wonderful place in 2012. It contains various types of fishes and sea phenomenon. You could take many photos inside tunnel. It take about 30 min. For visiting this beautiful place.

Very good experience . Beautiful aquarium and enjoyed the majestic sharks hovering above the head in the tunnel.The zoo was nice and had a super giant croc.The fishes in the aquarium are so nice and beautiful.

So much more than the biggest aquarium ever!. My top tips ... Do your research (or get the kids to do it) online before you go.There are many options .. All good value but you want to pick and choose which highlights are 'must-sees' for you! This will also save you money by not being convinced to 'upgrade' beyond your selections. This options are endless, this activity can be seen from the outside for 10 minutes or you can spend up to the entire day in the aquarium and then underwater zoo with lunch inbetween in the rainforest cafe! You may be able to fit this in with the Burj Khalifa tour, or spread it over two days! Whatever you do.. GO EARLY!!! (Queue before 10am)

Good if you don´t have to pay. It´s nice to see from the outside... is really expensive if you whant to go in...
Take my advice, see it from Dubai Mall and safe some money

Not worth the money. I had been to this place in December 2015. Honestly, i felt the entrance fee of 100 Dhrms is not worth it.
I recommend to visit other nice places such as miracle garden in Dubai than this for a much lesser fee.

Good place but not much to see.. It is build in Dubai Mall. Entry fee was 100 AED which was very high compare to what they are offering. If you have a enough time than would suggest go. If left than don't regret.

very nice. very crowded place esp in holidays
and also expensive esp photos
good for both adults and kids
very attractive place

Very enjoyable. My husband and I visited the aquarium because we had seen it on the BBC travel show recently. We purchased tickets from the Arabian Adventures lady at our hotel which was a good deal at DHm 70. You walk through an underwater tunnel full if amazing fish, sharks and rays. Then you go to the second level for the Underwater Zoo. This was so interesting and we saw many creatures we'd never seen before. The big Croc was huge!!!This is well worth a visit. Thank you
interesting place. nice place to take ur kids to discover the sea animal life especially to see how they feed the crocodile and to see how they bring it to the aquarium...

Unique. They have different level of access/tickets and I would recommend going with the cheapest option. It includes a tunnel walk which is the most unique feature of this aquarium. You will probably end up spending most of your time there. Then there is also behind the scenes walk which was not that fun as the guide did not seem to be to much into it and just wanted to go through his words quickly. Finally you go to an underwater zoo which is fun as well. All in all, time well spent and this is very interesting and unique place.

Face to face with nature!. This was one close encounter with nature, saw all kinds of aquatic animals i had only seen on television. you can see the aquarium from a distance but you pay to enter the tunnel to see the fishes closer. It was a nice experience albeit expensive.

Unbelievable to be in a mall. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo has great collection of aqua life right from sharks, stingrays and a whole lot of other fish. But the most stunning thing is to see this in midst of a mall! It's surely unlike anything that you might have seen. The basic explorer pass include a walkthrough and the aquarium & underwater zoo and also the staff explaining you about how they maintain it and feed fish etc. The giant croc was a surprise!

Longest underwater acrylic observation tunnel plus largest croc in captivity. Dubai likes to boast the biggest of everything, and boasting rights are probably the most distinctive aspect of this aquarium. Your first experience of the aquarium is the huge glass wall to it facing the main corridor of the Dubai Shopping Mall inside of which the aquarium is located. This glass wall is probably one of the biggest fish tanks in the world, and the view from the Mall is for free.About AUD40 gets you inside on a basic ticket. More expensive options involve a boat ride or diving experience but these are pretty basic & not worth the expense in our opinion, as the area involved is not that big and is highly artificial.The tunnel is the highlight. The croc might be a highlight if he is moving, but otherwise it is hard to tell the difference between the animal & its fibreglass image next to his pen.There are lot of exhibits jam-packed into a limited space, but most are interesting & will demand a visit of at least 90mins.
Awesome Experience !. You can view a variety of Under water Organisms.Put it on your to-do list if you are visiting Dubai Mall.
It is amazing... Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo has very good collection of Aqua life. My kids very happy to see so many variety of sea animals.

Something You'll Never Forget. With Family, We Enjoyed the tour inside the Aquarium as you can enjoy watching lots of fishes you never seen before.
My kids were amazed and happy at the same time, except when they saw the largest crocodile they got scared LOL

Dubai Trip 2015. My friend and I went to Dubai last 25 to 28 November 2015. I made an online booking for our entrance tickets (120AED - Explorer Level). Although the whole aquarium is not a very big (only a few short walks), it is unlike any we've ever seen.

S7GUY. If you love marine life this is for you. There are hundreds of fish varieties to see from small to sharks and large rays. The tank is huge and if you time it right and they being fed by the divers its amazing. The walk through tunnels is much the same as anywhere what ever you do make this a must when in Dubai.
Unique experience. Me and my husband went to Dubai last March and visiting Dubai aquarium was a must.We loved the underwater zoo!This is an experience you shouldn't miss when visiting Dubai!

An Amazing experience. A really enjoyable time. We took the VIP package so had the full range. The place is great for adults and children alike. Was very interesting to get a behind the scenes look. Well worth it

How does it feel being on the inside of a fish tank?. Booked to go and dive and become used to shark being around you in the water.Was a little shy of diving in front of everyone in the Mall, however i must say I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and although I felt the routine was a very well practiced one I did feel under pressure at all and the guides where friendly and patient.We did three dive over two days and had some very good advice about how to take photo's and video underwater.Strange to dive in a fish tank, but it was an experience made enjoyable by all the staff there.
Awsome. So many fish, sting rays, sharks.. it is worth visitng it. Avoid the boat ride it's a waste of time and money.

Excellent. Incredible place to visit, lots for children and adults alike. Can see quite a lot from the mall, without going inside the attraction. It is well done and over the top as to be expected in Dubai.

Good way to pass a few hours. Various entrance fees depending on what activities you want but worth it. Amazing layout and large variety of fish/sharks /turtles and rays etc. There is a chance to go on a glass bottom boat ride which is fun as the fish swim alongside as you go round.There is an area where you are encouraged to touch the starfish and crabs Staff knowledgeable and friendly

Wonderful Experience. The Dubai Aquarium is a tunnel you go through where you get the view the various types of fishes in it, was a great experience.The underwater Zoo was very exciting, so many animals to see. Was a great experience.

Go see the Croc feeding. This aquarium is world class. All the animals are very well accommodated and the staff are super friendly too. The package tour is really worth the money as you are able to go out on the glass bottom boat and see the sharks and fish and learn a lot about their environment. The staff are very well educated and keep you entertained as weel as informed.The feeding of the Giant Crocs is well worth seeing and even my 5 year old was fascinated by this.
fantastic and different. this place is there Dubai mall you can shop and then visit underwater zoo . you can be in deep of see easily .

A Great Underwater Experience. If you're looking for a simple fun activity which would be great for everyone, this is it. Not only do you get the opportunity to see the aquarium, you'll also have options to feed the fish, dive in the water and go on an underwater boat ride. For the price you pay, it's actually good value.First of all, the queue is long so you will have to wait a while. However, the wait is worth it once you're inside. The Aquarium itself was fascinating although short, as it is one walkway with fishes and sea creatures swimming by over and around you. You can get up close to the glass and take a closer look, which is pretty cool too.The Underwater Zoo was personally more exciting as you got more time and space to take a look around. There are a lot of intriguing creatures, some I've never seen before and plenty of different fishes to look at too. There was a big promotion of the King Croc, with facts plastered around the walls, all leading up to the big reptile. But unfortunately, the Croc was a little underwhelming as he was hyped up to be ruthless and deadly (which I assume he would be if you let him out on the other side of the glass) but he was rather relaxed and lackadaisical, which doesn't offer much entertainment value.All in all, it was a great experience and I felt it was worth buying something from the souvenir store as a remembrance token. I wouldn't go again if I was in Dubai but it's definitely something you should do once.
Dubai Aquarium at Dubai Mall. The Dubai aquarium is a good attraction but not to the expectations. Its not as big as we expect. Also the fishes collection is so so.
Excellent species. Excellent species maintained and childrens would love it. The crocodiles are very scary and big. Again this is inside a mall and jaw dropping architecture and maintenance

Great idea to have this in a shopping mall. Who would think a trip to a shopping mall could be so much fun.Glass bottom boat trip over an aquarium with so many types of fish and sharks in.Also you get to see otters, crocodiles, penguins, jelly fish and so much more inside. And the tunnel at the end is great to walk through too.

Glass tunnel under the sharks.. Quite a long queue, so popular attraction, great variety of sea-life in the huge tanks, people diving in there. A relatively short walk through the tunnel though. Then short walk around to the zoo section, which we spent more of our time in. Some impressive displays and interesting exhibits.
Amazing experience. I did not expect to see so many species of fish and creatures! It was very educational for both young n old. I highly recommend everyone to visit this attraction at least once.
no point going inside. You can see the aquarium from outside, not much more to see inside, and the underwater zoo was rubbish
Family Vacation . The best and one of the most visit place in Dubai, Located in the Dubai mall, with all sorts of exotic sea creatures. Will definitely visit again.
It's a must visit if u have children . A nice experience. U will actually feel as if you are under water beautiful fishes. It's at Dubai mall & yes quite expensive.
One of the Best Under Water Zoo.. This is one of the best under water zoo I have seen. Its World,s Largest Water Tank Placed in Dubai Mall.All fish and Water creature are available in this zoo.
Been to better Aquariums. We expected a better aquarium and to be honest we weren't too surprised. What is cool about it is that it is inside one of the biggest shopping malls in Dubai.

Its OK. Definitely a cool feature in the mall, but didn't think it was worth what you paid for the actual tunnel visit. The aquarium at the Atlantis is leagues better. I'd just check this out from the outside like the rest of the gawkers.

One of the most beautiful aquariums in the world . We have been in different aquariums in different parts of the world, and this one is really one of the best!
It is really like if you have been in deep waters of ocean and watched all this sea creatures yourself. The most amazing is the king crocodile and the sharks, of course.
wonderful place especially for children. Many different kind of see animal is presented there and it was a huge area for such an exhibition. Sharks, piranhas.. Should have time there.
Nice experience. The aquarium was a great experience. There were a lot of families with children at the aquarium, so it was a bit overwhelming for me. The staff was helpful and very knowledgeable.

The biggest fish tank I've ever seen. We did not go in here but it is hard to miss as you walk through the Dubai Mall. The biggest wall of perspex you will ever come across. The fish, sharks, mantarays and every other fish you could think of are all on show for free. You can enter and walk through the tunnels or even scuba dive, we just enjoyed the view.
It was so exciting!!!. per person 100 AED for see underwater zoo and tunnel aquarium. it was so exciting to see kingcroc and the sharks.

This is magnificent. How a mall can have this amount of sea life it is truly amazing check out the crocodile if you want some fun for your photos put your head in the mock up life size one at the entrance Mr Bob

Good one.... Good place and another man made wonder in the desert, you can see the big fish around you when crossing the tunnel....Those who have seen the aquarium of Singapore might feel it a bit small but ya nice place to watch for first timers.

Very disappointing! . I have visited a few aquariums on my travels e.g. London, New York - and was really looking forward to visiting the Dubai Aquarium. I left very disappointed! The entrance fee was AED 120 per person (approx €30 each) and for that we got a short 100 metre walk through a tunnel with the fish swimming above us! This was a let down. To be fair there was a good selection of fish on display but very little information on different species or information on little else for that matter. We were then "treated" to a 10 minute trip in a glass bottom boat. Was ok but nothing memorable & certainly not worth the pretty expensive entrance fee! ****TIP***** - we found out later that if you buy a ticket for the "hop on hop off" bus tour you get entrance to the aquarium for a reduced rate.

A Research Centre - pleasing to see. This was not the fist aquarium we have visited, coming from NZ and Australia; however we were impressed with how they were presented. The talk through the Underwater Zoo section (where they do the research) was very interesting and we learned a thing or two.

A stunning aquarium in a mall. A must visit place for first timers to the Dubai Mall. The underwater zoo is also worth a visit, in addition to the underwater tunnel. Spare a couple of hours to enjoy the attraction properly, as it is quite pricey. The shark feeding time is interesting to watch. The people in charge, in the underwater tunnel, are polite and answer questions regarding the fishes when approached.
