Great entertainment for small children . I visited the Aquarium with my 3 year old niece and she loved every minute of it. The tunnel was one of her favourites because she could get close to the sharks etc but still feel safe. We then visited the zoo, which was also fascinating and kept the whole family happy.

Truly Amazing. Good place for Family outing (especially if kids are animal loving).Though the crocodile was not as big as projected but overall I would rate it better than Singapore's indoor Aquarium. Boat ride with transparent bottom is another great attraction (though its tickets are separate). Really nice place especially considering the fact that it is inside a mall.

Good Afternoon Visit. We visited in the afternoon and had a great time, lots of species to admire. We went for the Researchers Package which included the following:•New Meet & Greet Area•Aquarium Tunnel•Underwater Zoo•Behind the Scenes tour•Underwater ObservatoryThis ticket cost 100 Dirhams per person, other ticket prices available.It was great to see King Croc and all of the sharks and rays. If you are in Dubai and like this sort of attraction give it a go.

Worth visiting, good value. This attraction really is worth a visit, the tunnel on the lower level is just that and not so big but we did the explorer ticket whcich allowed us backstage at the top of the tank. This was really cool as we were guided through the care and feeding of the fish, saw the hatchling baby sharks, clown fish and sea horses,. Also coral being grown and jelly fish lifecycle stages. Finally we got up close to the tank and we also paid a bit extra to feed the fish some vitamin pellets. Our guide was knowledgable and happy to share information. The rest of the aquarium was also very good, some unusual species, we saw archer fish shooting their prey, large octopus and of course the famous large salt water crocodile. He really is huge!
just aquarium. Nothing special, just ordinary aquarium like everywhere in the world. Plus point is they have crawly zone with snakes...
Behind the scenes is the best bit. Loved the behind the scenes tour and the guides explanation. It is at the Dubai Mall which makes it a great addition to a days shopping and exploring.
Aquarium in a Mall. The Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is huge and great for close up viewing of many different fish. The sharks are amazing.
Unexpected . Didn't expect this place to be as big, beautiful and inspiring, great for kids, adults and very much friendly to disabilities and lovely to see.
Amazing. Would recommend this to any visitor going to the Dubai mall. Amazing what was done inside a mall environment
Fantastic. awesome aquarium like no other in the world i ever see like this & the fishes Are Like no other UNIQUENESS Overloaded in One Place

Nice. It's a great experience to have especially with kids. The only negative is lots of points where people offer to take your family photo and then later charge you a crazy sum! Abt 250 dhs - trust me it's not worth it. Do not get conned into getting your photos taken.

Excellent! An experience to behold!. The underwater tunnel is brilliant and the marine life is exhibited very well! Great experience for one and all. Got the access free with Burj Khalifa Fast Track Tickets! Do not miss this!

Close up with the fishies!. You don't expect to find one of these in a shopping centre - but that is Dubai for you!
Had a great visit peering in at all of the sea life, big and small. We found Nemo & Dory so that was good for me. Enjoyable visit overall.

One of the largest indoor aquarium. If you visit Dubai Mall, Dubai Aquarium is a must-visit place. One of the largest indoor aquarium of world with a lot of sharks and a load of other sea life. This aquarium is a big tunnel that you go through, so you can see all the fish literally next to you. It was amazing to see the sharks from such a close distance.
A must-see, quite incredible!. This amazing aquarium is a must-see, the sharks and schools of fish blew me away, again. This is an amazing achievement, take the trouble to walk through inside.
Amazing site. The Mall of the Emirates with its ski hill is the place to go but the Dubai Mall with the Aquarium tops that site. An impressive site.

Sunday to the Dubai Mall. The Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is located in the Dubai Mall. The aquarium is enormous with thousends of Fish swimming over the underwater path. You can take a boat ride which goes on the surface of the aquarium , the underwater zoo is also splendid with some very interesting species such as King Crog.

Amazing what they have in malls. There was one massive aquarium that the public can view from the outside however, if you have a ticket, you go through a tunnel so it is just like you are underwater. There were other displays on a couple of levels along with a massive alligator. There was a "hands on" area for children. A good break from shopping.
WORTH TO WATCH. Dubai aquarium is one the most watchable item in Dubai Mall. Kids will love to see this. You will enjoy to see this aquarium
Underwater Zoo. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is located at The Dubai Mall . there is entry fee but if you want you can see in mall also .
Fish but no fish. Bit samey didn't like the glass found the staff rude. Wouldn't visit that aquarium again, felt it was on the prices side of things.

Amazing experience !!. Huge collection of aquatic animals , fishes, very thrilling experience one should experience when they visit Dubai. The walk through the aquarium is so special and worth experience for all ..kids to the elders!!
Worth paying. Plenty of animals and sealife to see. Great if you want to learn more about how they operate as they do a back of house tour. Everything from bats to crocodiles !

Quite unreal. Wow. It was quite an experince to see sharks and sting rays just swim right infront of you. They seem so peaceful and they just float up and down as if they are just ready for a photo op. beautiful

A nice little attraction in the mall. We visited this attraction and paid the 150AED which included the little boat trip at the top of the aquarium. It was really nice and the guy on the boat trip was really full of information. The photos were really expensive - I paid 285AED for a photo in a leatherette frame and the rest on a memory stick.
Intresting place. Intresting place, really good aquarium. Nice interior. I really recommend to go. There you can spend half of day.
Very good. Very good place. It is really very big aquarium. Our kids enjoyed there. And we definitely come back again.

Amazing what the dubai malls offer!. The animals were diverse and interesting. The zoo was much bigger than I expected. The tunnel was neat looking, but nothing compared to the zoo. It's amazing to think as you are walking around viewing all these animals that you are in a mall!

Worth a look. Visited as part of the hop on hop off bus trip deal..otherwise quite expensive. Attraction is set out over two levels Aquarium tunnel and exhibits on the upper level including penguins otters and sea life. Impressive tank wall can be viewed from mall.
Expensive for what it is. The aquarium and it's inhabitants is impressive but expect to be hit by a wall of people. Crowd control isn't a strong point and people don't tend to move through quickly

Suprise. Was looking forward to this. However it far exceeded any expectations I may have had. One would never think that so much was on offer and that so much was behind the scenes. A definite must for all ages.
WOW!. Walk in and through the glass tunnel to see the fish large and small swimming above your head, with the usual photo opportunity!
Awesome Experience. A site and sight as well. Different species of under water life presented in fun and diverse environments which make learning fun and more engaging especially for children.

Dubai mall & aquarium. It is a real wonderful blend - shopping & an aquarium. Though there is an additional charge for the aquarium to go inside, it is not necessary. The aquarium, three floors high is visible almost completely from outside. It has an amazing collection of marine creatures. I have never seen so many huge fishes in such a "small" place. Zoology students & nature lovers can easily spend an hour or so watching these amazing creatures so close & alive.

Large & Beautiful Aquarium. Just in visiting the Dubai Mall you must walk by the aquarium. It is large, and filled with many types of fish, including numerous types of sharks. A must see, when visiting the mall.

Nice if you get free tickets. We got free tickets for this attraction and went to see it with our little boy.
It is nice to see though, however, would not pay for it.

Dissapointing. I would not recommend any one to pay aed100 to visit the aquarium while you will the same thing for free in the mall. The tunnel is too small and too expensive for what you see inside the view for free is far better

Who needs scuba diving?. They have some cool marine life for view in this aquarium. However, felt a bit sorry for them being trapped. Huge sharks and rays and somethings that were new to me. Didn't pay to do the extra walk through, but the free view is cool too!

Ok types if you have seen other such acquariums. I did not ride the tunnel, but just observed from outside (free). I have done such tours in Singapore Sentosa and kind of similar from reviews and didn't want to pay 100 AED for this attraction as didn't feel worth it. The tunnel itself is quite short. However the size of the glass panels are huge and very majestic.

Great for an hour. Bit on the expensive side for what you get out of it. The aquarium itself you can see in about 5 Min, still amazing, though you could do it from the outside for free. The underwater zoo was great with lots to see! The simulator would be great for kids and the glass boat ride was very fun (even though it went for like 10 minute)

amazing. This aquarium is amazing and inside a shopping centre. The experience is fantastic and worth a visit. The metro will be the easiest option and cheapest around 8/10dhms (exchange. Rate 5.3 to £1)

Very very expensive for an hours entertainment. Whilst the tunnel was very good and with a large varietyof sharks and fish,it is most certainly a very expensive outing.The glass boat and submarine simulator all need to be paid for seperate.

A wow experience. Wether or not you like aquariums this is something else. Imagine a tank of 10 to 15 meters and about 30 meters long in the middle of a mall... Impressive. You can enjoy it for free, but I recommend to pay and enter the tunnel.
I the shopping Mall. Amazing to find in shopping mall, well worth a visit and also do the back room tour great, learnt so much and the under water zoo was excellent
Beautiful. The collection of sea creatures at the underwater zoo is fantastic. A bit overpriced but great place for animal lovers.

Disappointing. . Maybe if we had seen this before the aquarium at the Atlantis we would have enjoyed it more. The best view is outside which you don't have to pay for. Once inside it's very cramped, very busy and surprisingly small. My advice would be to travel to the Atlantis to see the one there or just look at this one from the outside rather than going in.

Great for an hour or two . This is a small aquarium but there is plenty to see, lots of different package options - we chose to feed the fish which basically meant you threw food in from the boat (which is pretty small in itself).
Can be missed. You can miss this in your trip to dubai on case you have not seen better zoos around the world.Nothing great nothing bad

If you don't have kids -Avoid. A little bit of a tourist trap...great for kids... but unless you are into fish..no worth the large amount of monies demaned to get into this attraction....you might see as much from outside for free!
Fabulous. Should praise the organizers for a very great work. Very well maintained and really beautiful. Should not miss this if you are in Dubai.
quite god. Our 3 year old daughter enjoyed the same and so did we to some extent. Have seen some in the world and this one was elegant.
New experiment for us. New experiment for usWe enjoy from the start to the endFun seeing the sea live and more amusement The best is the boat ride

Enjoyed our visit. We used our entertainer voucher which was a great saving, enjoyed walking through the tunnel the most, great to have sharks so close to you. Also went to see the giant croc which I felt a bit sorry for, not a very large tank for him. Enjoyed the Penguins up there most.
Multi Level. One might think after visiting here , is it really possible, its a three floor aquarium with all sorts of species ranging from small goldfish to large sharks!
Interesting. A wide variety of fish and a famous crocodile :) U can't miss the penguins and the different aquariums with starfish and small marine creatures
Dont go in you see as mush walking on the outside. There were queues but dont bother its fascinating watching it on the outside with divers sharks and rays

Brilliant but do the VIP experience. Me and my Sister did the VIP experience on Sunday 15th November and it was brilliant. We were provided a personal guide who was very knowledgeable about the different marine life. There are so many species to view and you get to feed some massive fish. Only negative I would say is that I would have liked to have seen a larger area for the Penguins

Surprising and colorful. I went to Dubai Aquarium the first time I came to Dubai with my boyfriend and his brothers. We all had a great time. I didn't expect to be so many things to see. The boat trip wasn't that interesting, but all the rest was great.
A really good aquarium. This is a really good aquarium even though it costs 100 Dirhams. There is a lot of variety in animals and creatures.
Amazing, and unbelievable. In the Dubai Mall, which has over 1200 shops, you will find this Fantastic Aquarium. Seeing is believing, there are sharks, sting rays and many, many huge fish to be seen
A great View !. Thouigh I ofund the acquarium slightly over rated and over priced, still the under water tunnel is a sight in itself.
amazing. A wonderful experienceBeautiful environment, pleasant, relaxing, and beautiful underwater experience
Loved the aquarium . It was a wonderful experience. The variety of sea animals is unbelievable. The boat ride is a must to fully experience this attraction.

Very nice attraction - Awesome tunnel. We found a deal on the internet the reg price was 100 aed / person for the Aquarium and the underwater zoo situated at the 2nd floor, the deal was 65 aed, if you hav time and want you can book the big package which includes shark feeding , botomless boat small ride. The fish tanks are enormoussss ! The Lost Chambers Aquarium at the Atlantic The Palm is quite smallers but more scenary there .

Great day out. Went in while shopping and was expecting to be 10 minute thing which turned out to be around an hour and was cheap for to explore different part of the aquarium and see crocodile which was huge along with other fishes and penguins... For all ages

enjoyable but nothing special. it is something to do in dubai but not mandatory.
the tunnel is not very big, the sharks are too big for the aquarium.
past the tunnel, the working people nearly force you to go quick from a place to a place.
A 3 story aquarium in a mall....need I say more.. This was our first stop in the Dubai Mall and worth the 100 dirham each. 3 levels and many species to see.

Fun - bring your kids. It is a good experience, mainly the aquarium glass tunnel.
Bring your kids, they will love it for sure.
Beautiful space in a mall! . Shocked to find such a beautiful gem in a mall! We bought tickets on the sport and did the entire tour in about 45 minutes. Definitely worth visiting!

Nice. A really nice place to visit, we had the cheapest package and worth it for 100 aed each: you have a private tour in the back plus visiting the zoo (it's most an aquarium), so you can add on the list

Nice treat from the shops. The mini me fancied feeding fish. But we were told that was not possible. But then found we could pay post once up on the glass boat.
We enjoyed all aspects of the visit with interactive rides and video screens. The water zoo felt interesting but i felt some animals were a bit restricted.

Not worth it. My suggestion is to not to spend on ticket. You can rather view and get a full glimpse of this Aquarium from outside (i.e. without ticket). There is hardly any difference. Even after spending on ticket, the aquarium has jus one straight stretch.

Totally worth it. I can still remember how the sharks teeth look like because they were so close and you almost feel you are swimming with them.. It s a nice and quick entertainment that u can do while resting from shopping.
Watch from the mall for free. A big part of the aquarium can be seen from the mall for free. The aquarium is beautiful full of exotic fish, a lot o coral, and quite some angry looking sharks.

Superb Aquarium. There are a few options you can choose on entry to the Aquarium. We went for the Explorer package which gives you access to the main Aquarium and a behind the scenes tour. Highly recommended.

Nice breath from shopping in Dubai Mall. The aquarium has one of the largest basins that hold different types of fish including sharks. Better to visit with children or young adults. It takes around 2 hrs. Think about a visit if you accompany your wife to Dubai mall and you hate shopping !!

No tickets just to access the tunnel. We were in our last night in Dubai and we tried to access the tunnel. However, they don't sell tickets to go accross it. They just sell (expensive) packs that includes other things to do in Dubai (in which we weren't interested about). It's possible to see it from outside but that's really nothing special.

Really Awesome. Really spectacular place to visit in Dubai. The giant size fish tank is just spell bound and really amazing how an underwater zoo was built inside a mall. It is must place to visit in Dubai. A lot of photo opportunities and kids will love it.

Excellent value for money and plenty of marine life over-and-above the main aquarium. The main Dubai Aquarium tank is visible from the mall without having to pay any entrance fee. However, for only AED120 per person you get full entrance to the underwater tunnel as well as a glass-bottomed boat ride and admission to the marine life exhibits afterwards.The main tank holds predominantly sharks, rays and larger fish types. The publicly viewable areas from the mall are great but the experience is infinitely better if you opt for admission and get the chance to go through the underwater tunnel.The glass-bottomed boat ride takes you on a slow circular ride around what is effectively the top of the main aquarium tank. The guide on the glass-bottomed boat threw some food out and one point and it was great to see the fish jumping out of the water so close to the boat. Other than this, the boat trip didn't have much point to it but as something thrown in as part of the admission it was still a fun experience.The best aspect of the whole place for me is the main area you go to after everything else, where there are many tanks filled with different types of fish. There were piranhas that were fed as we watched, there are giant crabs in tanks, there are jellyfish floating around - in short, a whole lot of variety in one place. Compared to other attractions in Dubai I thought this represented excellent value for money and had a lot more educational value than a lot of other places nearby.
Not amazing. Best to visit at night when it's quieter, it's an ok attraction, expensive for what it is but still good to see.

Not so great as it is advertised. If you have seen any other aquarium in world then no need to waste money, 70% of the aquarium is seen from the mall and the rest is not so great. Fish feeding and exploer is just nothing only way to get more money.

See and click the Fishes of a big live Aquarium. A place to be in Dubai Mall, with pics with the live Fishes and nice lighting with underwater aquarium.Post that the underwater zoo will give you access to feed these fishes and they are alive fishes not artificial.

Ok without being fantastic!. This Aquarium is ok but far from fantastic! I've been to bigger ones everywhere else. Sure they have different fish to other place, but its quite small. The big water wall in the mall gives you the impression it's going to be massive but that part of it is just a small underwater walkway. The actual aquarium is upstairs and quite small. It's good but I have just seen and heard of much better ones. Melbourne & Sydey are better!

It's okay. It's a small "aquarium" (more like a giant fish tank) and a small zoo inside the mall. The selections are alright including a giant crocodile from Australia. If you have extra money, take a shot.
Amazing Must go.... I would rate 4.5 out of 5 it was really amazing to see Aquarium , zoo was ok. You need atleast 1 hr to see it.. you can go for it by paying a ticket of 100 AED.

Here come the sharks. Kids screaming, cries of oohs and aahhs, reverberate in the tunnel, whenever a shark passes with its jaws wide open, showing jagged teeth. Its amazing. there must be a 100 species of fish, moving gracefully, and the sharks(must be 10 of them) moving around like watchful sentinels...take your time enjoy that 50m walk and its very very affordable. Please do take a walk through the aquarium which boasts of an alligator, which is the star attraction.
It was awesome. The place is so cool and quite. It was awesome experience. though it seems costly on the first go, it is a one time visit for sure.
**Dubai love(hub)***. its in a Dubai mall, entry start from 100 dhirams .different types of fish, shark sea hores kept in one place.awesome place u must be visit once in ur life...

Lovely. The aquarium is spread over three floors. The aquarium has one of the biggest water tunnels. lovely to watch different animals like crocodiles and different species of fishes. This experience was a total surprise for us.

Awesome. Its in the Dubai Mall. You need to purchase tickets to visit this aquarium. The various live fish that are on display are incredible. We were lucky to see the big croc at close proximity. We had to wait a long time to see it move to believe it was for real.
Nice. We visited this attraction and we took the boat trip and we were amazed of the size of the place and al the species of life that were in it

Okay, I admit, This Was Cool. I was a bit overwhelmed by both the sheer scale of this and the size, quality, and number of fish in the tank.Against my better judgement I enjoyed it (even though it is in the middle of the horror show that is the Mall of Dubai).
Lovely. Very nice experience to see with the kids...the walk in tunnel with all the sea creatures swimming on top are a must see and the kids will adore it.
amazing. realy amazing attraction in the Dubai Mall, plenty of fish and underwater animals. huge and well reachable...
the size will impress you, that's for sure. If you have time and courage, get yourself inside to feed the sharks. So many different kind of fishes is very rare to see at one place.
Dubai Aquarium. It was nice to talk a walk in the tunnel but no need to take the glassbottom boatride, that didn't give much accoring to me.
Nice for the little ones. I took my 4-year old grandson to this as a treat and he loved the interaction and the idea of feeding the fishes; seeing them up close (safely).

Really Great Aquarium with a Lot to See. The underwater tunnel alone is worth the visit--you get to see sharks and stingrays as well as other fish so close to the glass--super cool for the kids and adults!If you have kids or if you're into sea life, I strongly suggest visiting the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. There are a lot of packages to choose from to fit into your budget and schedule. TIP: Since you'll be at the Dubai Mall, plan a visit for Burj Khalifa's At The Top and get in a show at the Dubai Fountain.

Was great , but im an animal lover and want them free. Was certainly an eye catcher and drew us into visit this aquarium. Looking back i wish i didnt as i want all animals and mammals to be free but it was a selfish good thing to do :)
Good value. Great value for money, you get to do the aquarium and the sea zoo, including King Croc, who is really impressive. Plenty of eateries nearby too
beautiful. So awesome to see so many sights in Dubai...they keep coming and coming...take LOTs of photos or no one will believe!!!

Was expecting better. An aquarium in a shopping centre is certainly a novelty, so I visited it when I had some spare time during a business trip. The entrance is around €20 at the current exchange rate and I found it quite expensive for what it was.The tunnel is probably the most impressive feature.

Perfect for toddlers . What an amazing water park! My son who is 3 years old now loves it! We've been going there since he was one year only and it's never boring for him! We usually do every 2-3 month so he won't get bored of it! And each time we do it's like a new experience all over again! Highly recommend it for all the parents with toddlers. Lovely place to go with a family! Gets a bit busy on the weekend. Best time to go is morning, I tried even Friday and Saturday mornings which was perfect. Not many people , no one is pushing.

Sharks, rays, unusual lil fishies, penguins and otter things!. Worth a visit if you're in Dubai for the different little colored fish on that side of the world. Not as large a penguin display as Boston, but still adorable and plucky. AND you get to walk through a tunnel with sharks, rays, etc., all around you and ride in a boat with a glass bottom looking down on them. Then, the underwater zoo has a great selection, including a few seahorses and jelly fish, baby crocodiles and more. We loved it. Fun for kids of all ages. Plan to spend some time.

Good.. But not the best. There are 2 parts of this activity.
Dubai Aquarium is located on Ground 0. It is a tunnel with fish tanks surrounding the tunnel. There are sharks as well.
The Underwater Zoo is located on level 2 of mall. This zoo has many sea creatures including crocodiles. Worth a visit for sure.

Quick visit . Not very impressed. Grumpy check in lady. There were 12 of us and she wanted to give a group ticket. So we all had to stay together. We said no as we only had an hour so we wanted to go at our own pace Some people staying longer with certain animals She was then so slow and grumpy issuing individual tickets It's ok. Particularly enjoyed the otters and penguins But zoo it's not. It's too small ! Water tunnel of fish is ok. No better than our sea life centres
good. if you are visiting aquarium for a first time than its a good place to be..has lot of fishes and glass boat..all in all good..
Too expensive as compared to waht you get. you can have nice selfie or a picture from outside the arena with same affect. its too small park as compared to the ticket they charge
Beautiful. Very well maintained Aquarium, with loads of species. The best part was feeding the fish and the tunnel aquarium. A must visit.
Visit when you are at the Dubai Mall. The Dubai Aquarium is indeed a sight to see. It is amazing and recommended to anyone visiting the Dubai Mall.
Wonderful experience . Decided to take a walk threw while I was in the mall , glad I did was 3 stories high could do numerous things and was great and would tell anyone to give it a go
Not Worth. Do check if they have got any unique species or it is not worth to go.....yes but children will enjoy - not for adults

Very comfortable place to vist. Ticket prices are little bit expensive but some credit cards are offering good packages.The Aquarium is very big and contains different variety of animals.It's a really worth to watch.The aquarium is spread over three floors,the ground floor consists of a tunnel and ticket counters and third and second floor shows different animals.

Amazing species and well maintained, don't miss !. I reckon you pay around $25, it is worth the money. Creatures of different species and closer look at them is breathtaking. Once you are done with tunnel, just head to the zoo upstairs, it is even better. Specially if you have young kids, they will love it. Now they have King Croc, you can view the croc from a glass floor, which is nice.Overall worth a visit when you are in Dubai.

Aquarium is great but souvenirs are expensive. Beautiful aquarium, you start out in the shark walk downstairs. Great amount of large sharks and rays. Then you go upstairs and get a behind the scenes tour where they show you how they care, feed and raise all of the different species. They have a shark cage that they get into when they feed the Sharks. Then you walk through the aquarium. HUGE crocodile, penguins, bats (not sure why but they were fun to see). Only downside is the cost of a tshirt was $53 US $189 AED. That was double the cost of the aquarium entry fee
What a show!. Incredible feature which can be viewed from the inside of the Dubai Mall so you don't need to pay to see all of the exotic fish within the aquarium

Good variety of species . Visited last week to show my 5yr old son. Taken the first basic package where they show you the aquarium and the underwater zoo. For aquarium the difference is you can watch the aquarium from a closer look (mall visitors can see the outside of the aquarium for free but from a distance). Then you go inside where there are fishes all over (a dome shape where you walk from inside which gives a real good view of species). The collection is very nice unlike other aquariums. Then they take you to a storage place where they show you as well as give you informations about the eggs, growth of species, about their eating habbits etc. You get to see the tinest fishes. You get to feed the fishes too. Other packages also allow you to kind of scuba dive inside with the fishes.Next is on the second floor where you see the underwater zoo having n numbers of water species including fishes, plants, crocodile, penguins, sea snake, turtles etc.Really get to see and learn a lot. A must see for children.

3 story tall aquarium!. its dubai. the biggest etc. and expensive to go the official route. but all you need to do is to step back, go around to the left, and you see all the fishes. and there really are lots of them.
we had a great day out!. kids loved every minute of the time we spend at the aquarium, the boat ride was basic but fun and we got to feed the fish. great attraction for all ages
A must if you have time. Amazing views and well laid out experience. A must if you are in Dubai with children. Educational as well as interesting. Even better than Monterey in California.

Amazing.. Don't miss it. Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo is located in the Dubai mall. Initially I was not sure if we should check this out but then we decided to go ahead and I swear it was the amazing! We did not expect to see so many species of fish and creatures. The way the whole place is built and setup is simply awesome. The kids had awesome time! It was very educational for both young n old. I highly recommend everyone to visit this attraction atleast once.

Not that much. This review is based on an attraction inside the Aquarium. As the name of it was "Shark Walk", I was expecting something more exciting. It consists on you getting into a cage wearing a helmet, so that you may breath under the water. Then the fish swim all around the cage, and eventually one or two sharks pass by. Of course I didn't want a shark inside the cage with me, but I imagined that I would see them more closely. They charge a lot if you want them to take pictures, and the feeling of wearing a still wet diving suit (recently used by another person) is not good at all.
dubai aquarium fastastic view. very nice and addorable view od bubai mall.. aquarium inside the mall where yoi can watch freegiving happines to people

Worth a visit. The Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo are unlike any other aquariums or zoos I've visited. This place is massive and the amount and types of creatures you get to see here are amazing. The place is well kept and clean and is usually populated with tourists, like myself :) I went with a middle-aged friend, but its definitely a place anyone could visit and for all ages. Their are various ticket options, but ours cost about $35. Definitely recommend ppl check this place out :)

The best. in my opinion, this is the best aquarium that i've been into. it's almost full of swimming species wherever you look.
singapore, osaka, pier 39, and so on, they're couldn't deliver what this aquarium can offer.

Good few hours to visit. We decided on visiting as wanted a quiet day. Spent a good 4-5 hours in the end, lots to see, the back room tour was interesting but a bit rushed. He told us timing of feeding that we didn't quite catch but when asked afterwards were told conflicting information and then weren't allowed out to re-enter the tunnel to see the shark feeding. No signs up about when various things are fed. Simple café and ice cream available inside which is good as no re-entry allowed.
A1. This really is a first class experience well worth a visit ,a visit to the big croc. is a must, the rest of visit was really good.

A Truly Amazing Aquariam. A fantastic aquarium. Awesome main tank visible to all the mall shoppers walking by. Inside , it was well organized. Try to time it so you can catch feeding times at the aquarium, river otters and penguins. Very well done. The Giant Alligator exhibit is really a giant. Everything is just so and super organized and clean. A great way to spend 2 to 3 hrs.
Great to visit once. Very interesting for children and for adults too. Fishes and 5 m long crocodile were very impressive. Must visit in Dubai

My 2 year old loved it!!. The aquarium was soo nice. We all enjoyed it. There was so much to offer. We purchased the basic package because of my son's age and because I'm pregnant. (no glass bottom boat). It was well worth the money. Also on the receipt is a voucher for 5 Dirhams off at the gift shop. They have long hours, which is great. It was a last minute idea, but we had plenty of time to see everything.

Loved it! . This place is amazing, being able to go in the underwater tunnel gives you the opportunity to take great photos... Including a selfie with a shark lol! You feel so close to them it's great. The only thing I'd say is that once you go to the zoo area the amazement dies down slightly and it's tiresome saying no to the photographers all the time! I'd Deffo recommend a visit though.
such a little treat. Defiantly recommend this attraction - was so much to see and do and we loved going around the attraction.

Worth checking out while you are at the mall. - An interesting aquarium for a mall.- Worth taking a look while you are in the malltip - its on the main levelcons- if you want to get a good picture of the aquarium it is hard to do because of the number of people standing in front of it
WATCH THE CROCK. Not bad for an aquarium on three floors of a mall. You must see the 18ft crock on the third floor. If you purchase 3 days on the city hop on hop off bus, this is free.

Very enjoyable visit. My family enjoyed the aquarium and underwater zoo. Our ticket was actually free, included with City Sightseeing open top bus tour. Even if our tickets hadn't been included, we would still have paid to go as well worth a visit.

enjoyable experience. Overall I thought the whole thing was good, and surprisingly educational. There are several different ticket types available however, which may affect your experience.I went for the 'researcher' ticket which includes a 'back of house' tour as well as the regular underwater tunnel and zoo. The other reasonably priced ticket was the 'explorer' which included a glass bottomed boat rather than the back of house. The regular underwater tunnel and zoo are included on all ticket types as far as I'm aware.The underwater tunnel was fascinating (don't understand how a bunch of large sharks swimming 1" away from you could get 1 star in other review...) and was filled with a good selection of *enormous* fish and sea life. There were several divers in the tank at various points, and some of the manta rays were far larger than the divers. As a bonus, rays do always seem to be smiling, which helps lift the mood!After exiting the tunnel, one needed to go up to the second floor for the remainder - the zoo and the 'back of house' tour.The back of house tour showed some of the breeding programmes they ran for sharks, seahorses and so on (who knew that baby sharks were so cute!) and if one took the time to talk to the staff, they were proud of their work and knowledgable.The zoo I found to be pretty extensive ... considering it's in a mall! and had various zones including 'king croc' (the biggest crocodile you'll never want to meet), night animals, reptiles, penguins and of course loads of sea life. Frankly I've not been to many aquariums before, but I personally found the sea life easy to view through what seemed to be clean and decently sized tanks - and most tanks also had descriptive plaques next to them.Perhaps the only part that made me feel uneasy was a 'petting zoo' where it was possible to pet a starfish.Not sure how humane that is - although I'm no expert so I guess it's possible that the starfish didn't mind in the slightest!Anyway, for me overall the aquarium gets a thumbs up.
Worthwhile. It worthes every penny ... have many aquatic specious and spot for taking momories homeAlso have area for snacks and coffee

MUST GO PROGRAMM. Since you are at the Dubai Mall, you can see the Fountains and the Aquarium. Do not miss the Zoo (you need to pay an extra for that) and you can also dive there, with sharks and everything. Awesome !!!
Loved it. Totally over the top, so amazing to be able to get up and close the fish. If we would of had time, we would of went for the dive option go you will love it
Great Value for Money. Great walk through tunnel, and underwater zoo. Shame under three's are not allowed on the glass-bottom boat.
was not bad. we got it with a package with the atlantis; without the package it would have been boring. except if you did the scuba diving.
Amazing for a Mall. Having a big aquarium and underwater zoo in a Mall is amazing. I take my son constantly for a visit and we both can't get enough. A great destination during hot weather.

Great small aquarium, full of surprises. Having visited most of the large aquariums in the US, I found this a delightful little aquarium, full of surprises. Loved the freshwater fish exhibits and found the night time dessert presentation fun and interactive. It was a part of the bus tour options and we were not going to go, but had extra time and were very glad we did. Delightful.

An excellent experience. I would say that it will be great missing, if you avoid to visit this wonderful world of marine species. Absolutely, 100 Dirhams worth for spending. The walking inside the aquarium is amazing experience with our children.

Value. The Explorer ticket is about $35pp and includes a walk through their underwater tunnel, glass-bottom boat ride, and water zoo, so it offers quite a bang for the buck. The tunnel is impressive and provides a unique view. The view from the boat wasn't as good, but the kids will likely enjoy it. The water zoo was Dubai size and there were many animals on display; the chief of which is the 10'-14' King Crock that you can view from a glass bridge or through a glass wall.

It was just OK. Perhaps I am spoilt (as I have been to many of the worlds top aquariums), but I didn't find a whole lot to be amazed about with this aquarium. The main (publicly visible) aquarium is huge and quite breath taking, but beyond that I was a little underwhelmed.I think if it was your first aquarium experience though, you may feel differently
small. This is not very big but i enjoyed it, walking through the tunnel was a cool experience got good photos and i would recommend it.
Another usual place for an Aquarium, in the middle of a mall.. We only looked st the aquarium from the mall, looked really good, would be great for children to go to.
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is good with family, but not worth the cost being charged - about ADH 120. Yet you cannot miss it.
once need to see. aquarium is in dubai mall is one of the bets place to visit in dubai inside aquarium variety of animals in the Underwater Zoo if you came in dubai must you visit one time this place
What a beautiful sight!. An indoor underwater tunnel aquarium with plenty of fish to see located at Dubai Mall. There is also cage snorkeling which I was too scared to try.

Beautiful and Creepy. Walking in a tube, sharks swim around and stalk you from only 7 inches away, you can even count their teeth , so creepy!But I enjoyed it overall, the staff take memorable photos of you, but they're pricey.You can also feed the fishes if you pay a little more. Budget Alert ! But hey! It's Dubai, and Dubai ain't a cheap city .

Bigger than expected. I liked the aquarium. The layout was good and I enjoyed the underwater tunnel. Though I booked on line I still had to go into the queue for a ticket replacement, so actually I gained nothing - a let down

Brilliant attraction. We took our nephews who are 4 and 8 years old here and they had a great time - and so did we. Enter via the 2nd floor, (it's quieter) and you can access a little submarine simulator and also take a boat ride across the top of the aquarium where you can buy packets of food to feed the fish. There are loads of exhibits, all very well laid out. A good couple of hours of entertainment.
Very nice for kids. This is an aquarium located inside the mall. Its full of beautiful fishes like sharks, rays, groupers, etc. Very entertaining and educative for kids.

Refreshing evening. . The aquarium here in Dubai is sooo huge , beautiful , well maintained and a treat to the eye.. kids loved it and spend most of their time taking pictures of rare fish and others too
Wonderful aquarium in a mall!. I enjoyed this aquarium alot. Certainly one of the better aquariums I've been to. Get the additional glass bottom boat feature.
Fascinating but very short. Lovely to see different species. Great for pictures. Service was not so great as staff were not enthusiastic or much helpful. The is a walk from the aqaurium to the other.
Brilliant. Brilliant if you have children although out little grandson was just as happy looking at the fish through the huge outside window! Well worth a visit though. Highly recommended.

Time well spent. The Dubai Aquarium and underwater Zoo is a treat to your eyes. Its beautiful and well maintained. There are variety of animals in the Underwater Zoo. Crocodiles, penguins etc.,,, The Penguin Feeding was amazing. It is a must visit place while you are in Dubai.

Disappointing aquarium but great underwater zoo!. Yes its a massive tunnel with lots of sharks in BUT that is the whole aquarium! There is nothing else to see! You can see more from outside in the shopping mall without paying than you can paying to walk through the tunnel! The underwater zoo is great... loads to see and clean tanks with well kept animals. Don't miss the unexpected upstairs as there are great facts to be found including a giant crocodile skeleton!

Great collection of aquatic animals. The Dubai aquarium is an architectural marvel. It is completely inside the Dubai Mall and is spread over many stories. The various animals are a treat to your eye. This is an attraction worth seeing from inside.
Seaquarium!!!!. If you visit the Dubai Mall , please don't miss the Seaquarium ,it's a spectacular place containing different species of fishes !!!

Amazing aquarium that can be viewed fro outside!. You can buy your way into the aquarium and zoo, but there are some fantastic views from outside in Dubai Mall at two levels. It is probably the biggest 'fish tank' I have ever seen with some fantastic fish on view. Takes a little bit of finding but track it down even if you don't pay to go inside.

Underwater world. The Dubai Aquarium like most things in the Emirates is huge and spectacular. Although much can be seen externally you really should pay to go through the tunnels linking the huge tanks and also visit the underwater zoo on the second floor.

Time Of Your Life. Swimming in the cage is what I experienced and trust me the title says it allThis experience was a toatal surprise for me (birthday treat) and I wasn't disappointed The Aquarium is a shopping Mall and yes you guess right.....everyone is watching youIncluding in the price is also tickets for the underground zoo, which too is fabMy only negative comment is during the snorkelling you have a guide with you, would be great if he/they got you a little more active during the 2 hours your down there We paid the extra fee for photos and filming which you then get to keep the SD card, later when looking at them.......bit disappointment but then again wouldn't of got the pictures for what is a truely a chance of a life time

worth a visit. We've bought a ticket which includes the submarine adventure which was kind of disappointing but if you have kids they would appreciate it. The highlight is the zoo itself. Nothing really that breathtaking though but if you compare it with other dubais attractions its definitely worth the time and money.

Wonderful. We went to the mall and definitely did not expect to see an aquarium as wonderful and full of beautiful and various types of fish and other creatures in there. Not a waste of time or money. LOVED it.

Amazing!. This is by far the best aquarium that my family has ever been to.The fish are amazing, and they seem to have loads of space to swim around in.A huge variety of things to see on two floors of the aquarium.We bought the standard entry fee at 70 Dirhams which gave you access to the underwater zoo and tunnel. It was enough for us, but you can buy loads of other experiences.The huge crocodile was incredible to see.A very good way to spend a couple of hours.
Great to break up your shopping day.. Good selection of Marine life and small creatures to sea. The Aquarium is particularly fascinating. A variety of offers with varying degrees of interaction.

Great for all ages. Easy to find in Mall, easy to purchase tickets at entrance. Several type's of adventure (tours) offered. We took to cheapest one and it still was a nice educational tour, although I felt a little on the pricey side.
Wow. Watching aquatic life at such close quarters is a treat. You almost feel a part of the marine life. Must visit.

Dubai underwater zoo. Worth spending 100 dirhams that is around 35 usd. Short but sweet zoo... Almost all underwater animal can be seen there. Moreover it's an differ experience to be in the glass tunnel initially with fishes around us and later is the real zoo thing. Kids will enjoy ..

A fun side trip at the mall. I love aquariums and have been to some of the best in the world. I enjoyed that this one is free to view (in part), and if you want to pay some $ you can get a behind the scenes tour. Got to see the food prep and shark artificial insemination area and the sick holding tanks and the little jellyfish and brine shrimp they grow and then you walk through an area that has some cool critters. I lucked out and caught the otter feeding (it was at like 11am I think). The otters are trained so they run up the ladder and wave to you and then leap down the slide. The giant crabs were freaky and the pineapple fish were the weirdest I have seen. The croc is huge and taking photos won't do it justice when you show your friends. The free tunnel is 100% worth going through. They have an option to scuba but the price was like $280 for a 30 minute dive with a 60 minute briefing (and that is with a PADI card-without is like $100 more for a lesson) so I passed. Tons of sharks and rays and a guitarfish. The place is worth a visit
TOTALLY CAPTIVATING. It was breathtaking walking so close to the sharks and stingrays. It is situated in the Mall of Dubai and very near the metro as well.
Great experience. Aquarium is excellent. Recommended for adults and young children. Scuba diving option also available.

Wonderful place. Definitely a place not to be missed when in Dubai Mall. They had a huge collection of marine life. The researcher tour which costs 100 dirhams is worth the money and a minimum time of 2 hours.

Dubai Aquarium small journey in the sea world. Although Dubai aquarium can't be compared to Singapore aquarium but it's very good. The aquarium is inside Dubai Mall on the ground floor it is fun and you get to feed fish but I think a little bit over priced
Fascinating Aquarium. Imagine a 3 story aquarium. Walking among sharks, stingrays and too many others to name. Quite an experience.
must visit experience. must visit for anyone visiting Dubai. children will love it as you get up close and personal with the fish

Enjoyable experience. We combined the Aquarium & Zoo with a glass bottom boat trip....took about 1.5 hours in total.....lots of good sights....very interesting....ample unique photo shots.....worth the money.....we did it at 7.30pm and it was still busy
A wow for the children and adults. An amazing experience for all, and the children loved feeding the fish. Be careful not to miss the upper levels.

Ocean within the mall. This is a brilliant concept of having such a huge aquarium within the mall. There are options to dive and interact with sea life as well. But i would prefer doing it in the open sea.

Worth the visit and we'll set up Aquarium. Dubai Aquarium is in the Dubai Mall which is attached to Burj Khalifa. It was very well set up with interesting way to view the exhibits. There was an Australian section with Crocodiles and Birds which was well done. An enjoyable couplemofmhours spend here. I think it was 100 Dirham entry for two of us around 50 Aus Inthink
Dubai Aquarium. It is located in the Dubai MALL. Entrance fee ( but not very expensive). Visited without additional software, although I really wanted to swim with sharks in a big aquarium)
A must visit place in Dubai . It was awesome, the time spend here will cool your mind and body. very much relaxed and enjoyed the day
Super. Went to this during bus tour, it is in the Atlantis hotel and well worth a visit. Fantastic place to visit

Imagination runs wild!. If you do not want to shop, or are finished, the aquarium will be a great diversion. Educational with the ability "to walk under the sea", it stands alone as a stellar three story attraction. Lots of inhabitants to wonder about, just takes you for a tour of the sea, right in Dubai ! Great fun, memorable stop.
good for an hours entertaiment. we had walked past this quite a number of times in the shopping mall. we decided to give it a go. it was interesting but I think something you do once.

Definitely worth a visit.... Situated in the Dubai Mall you can combine a trip to the aquarium, Dubai waterfall in the mall, Dubai fountains and Burj Khalifa all in one day. We spent approx 2 hours in the aquarium which starts with a long tunnel with a good variety of sea life. I booked an explorer ticket but I did this online before I visited so it saved me approx 30 dirhams. I went in the morning and mid week so wasn't busy at all allowing you to have a leisurely stroll through the aquarium and underwater zoo. The explorer ticket gives you a behind the doors access tour with a guide showing you the labs and the science behind the aquarium. I also visited the Atlantis Lost World aquarium and I would say this one is far better!!!
Worth a visit . This is maybe one of the most interesting thing in the Dubai Mall. Many fishes and a lot of explanation about the underwater life makes it exciting.

Don't Judge too quickly. As you walk into the mall you can see the huge glass aquarium which may not seem interesting to some, but as you buy a ticket and go inside you will experience the reality of it.. Tunnel is so good and the UW Zoo has limited but very good collection of animals and fishes are exotic and colorful. Worth the price paid for..
Amazing. Great attraction for the mall....huge aquarium with a lot of fish but it didn't have colorful tropical fish as it does at the Atlantis.

Look it is a shark!!!. A very nice experience. We got the adventurer package if I remember right. It is a little pit expensive though.Walk under the aquarium, ride the simulator submarine, the glass boat and last but not least, the zoo. The aquarium is just fascinating with so many fish beyond counting. With every turn you see a new type of fish. This is a very good place for kids to visit and learn.The zoo was my favourite part of the visit. Lots of colorful fish and other animals too. You can see the king croc here.Good place to spend time but you can skip it and just take photos from outside if your are travelling on a budget.
Low expectations proved wrong!. Walking by in the Mall the tanks did not look impressive..BUT go on, pay the fee it is well worth it.
very beautiful aquarium. visting dubai mall already is an attractive place, and visiting the aquarium give a wonderful attraction to all members of the family.
Unbelievable!. It was just amazing, having the sharks and all sorts of sea creatures swimming above you! Would recommend if going to Dubai with Kids

Tunnel vision. Enjoyed our visit. We choose researcher ticket which gives you the aquariums and the zoo and also back of house with a guide. Good fun and our son enjoyed the Sharks being just over his head in the tunnel.

Nice.... I took 120 AED ticket which includes submarine simulator, glass bottom boat ride, zoo and tunnel.
Submarine - It was use less, even kids will not enjoy.. what else should I say.
Glass Bottom Boat : Very Nice experience.
Zoo - It was ok type.
Tunnel - Again It was Ok , Was not that good.

Fish paradise. place to be! very big aquarium to see different kinds of fishes
you can also see other animals/reptiles (crocodiles, birds...). you can give food to the fishes - is nice! there are also the sharks and cramp-fish to see.
Oceania in a desert.... It's not super big but it's super cool as you get to be upclose with sea life for free and why not? An extra fee for more but affordable...

Amazing experience. I have visited some of the best aquariums over the world, but I can say that this was one I have enjoyed the most. The stuff was great and you can do different activities to enjoy inside. Fantastic!!!

Sharks and fishes...... We went to the aquarium at the request of my daughter. We used a voucher from the entertainer book, so saved one entry fee. Found it a bit crowded but loved the different fishes and creatures, although they can keep the giant Spider crabs!
Highlight of the visit was the underwater tunnel where you could almost touch the Sharks.

Very Nice.. A small aquarium located inside the Dubai Mall. Not the biggest aquarium I have been to but still worth going to if you have some time. The King Croc was the best part for me. I have never seen a crocodile before but I must say this thing was huge.

Zoologically fasccinating. The big crocodile, color fishes, sea horse, tortoise.... what not. Its an amazing world of 1000+ species brought to you in a modern era. Don't miss. Those with passion for photos, please carry a memory card when you visit this place. Lot to click!

Beautiful. Dubai Aquarium and underwater zoo is the main attraction in Dubai.Dubai aquarium has a inside tunnel with fishes swimming around in the tunnel.The underwater zoo is amazing with king crocs and baby crocs around. One must visit the aquarium and the underwater zoo in Dubai.

Nice. It's one of the largest attraction in centre of dubai mall.the aquarium is home for the different aquatic creatures which can be viewed for free from the mall trough the acrylic panel. They have glass bottom boat ride which is good.

A must if your visiting Dubai Mall. Have been to the dubai mall twice with different visitors i have had over here and its a must to anyone visiting dubai mall. only 70 AED for 2 people with the entertainer voucher and with that you get a lot for your money. first you are amazed with the world largest aquarium then you go upstairs to the zoo and see all sorts of different and amazing animals.
An aquarium. In a mall..... We loved this! It was nice to get a break out of the mid day heat to do this! Highly recommend especially if you have kids with you.

Good, but not that great. You get to see sharks, ray fish and a lot of other fishes, while walking through that 100 or so metres of tunnel. Then, inside, if you chosen to visit the zoo, you get to see some more of the marine life like some piranha, star fishes, tortoise, a couple of huge crocodiles and then, some night birds.It was not a great time, but good for kids.

Family visit. Nice place to be with the kids. Kids can see up close all the marine lives best time to visit is the feeding times where the divers feed the fishes in side the huge tanks quite attractive feature located at the Dubai mall

Fantastic esp. the crocodiles!!. This was a freebie with our city sightseeing tour. Not bad as a ticket would have cost us around £20. I enjoyed this a lot and although we did not go with family and kids I think it would have been better for kids to enjoy. They would love it.

Awesome Aquarium experience. Wide variety of exotic underwater sea creatures. The tour is children friendly and well organised. Staff are helpful. Tickets can seem overpriced, but once the tour is complete you'll feel that the price was worth it.

Biggest aquarium i have been to. This is a place to spend a day in. If you're interested in wildlife then don't go in there thinking you'll be out in a couple of hours. Depending on your interest, it could easily take up to a whole day. The collection of fish is the most diverse I have seen till date and they are all very well kept. The king crocodile is a massive attraction and the underwater tunnel is breathtaking. Plan a second visit to Dubai mall just for this.

Good for kids. if you are on a leisure trip with your kids then you must visit this one , shall take around 2 hours . You can book tickets online to avoid the ticket queue. Its a well maintained aquarium, one of its kind .. You can make it a full day tour shop in the mall and the see Dubai fountain show in the evening . Had a nice time.
Good summer activity. Great for kids to visit, although some exhibits seemed a bit tired and therefore a bit depressing to see. Great for summer, given location inside the AC.
unforgettable. wonderful experience !!! surprise within a mall... one can spend hours viewing the huge aquarium.. and the visit to underwater zoo is awesome ... kids enjoyyyy
Amazing. Take the time to go see this aquarium, it's not just for children. We found it amazing. Even if you go to escape the heat as the shopping centre is air conditioned.
Nice place. I went there with my family and In enjoyed the place a lot. Really the place was very awesome.Good trip in Dubai

Nice place to see. Dubai Aquarium in Dubai Mall is a nice place to visit. This especially during the hot summer days and when ever the temperature is high out side. Fish of different colors and sizes are kept In the Aquarium. Some fish come in groups, For kids and for those who see the aquarium for the first time they may stay for hours.

ONE WORD WOW!!!!. What a amazing experience , the underwater world , well made, shark is swimming just above your head ;-) , most of the marine species are there , who love underwater animal or fish like me , this place is heaven , Must visit , high recommended

Up close n personal with great sharks n crocs. A must-see, while at Dubai. The acquarium offers a close peek at the underwater wild life. Best place to take the kids along too. Among others, there's jelly fish, sharks, ray, penguines, turtles, star fish and the giant croc.

Good!!. The aquarium in Dubai mall is of course beautiful.The view from outside is itself quite good that you can avoid going into the Underwater world if you have lack of time.Kids will surely love the experience.

Our 3 year old loved it. We spent a couple of hours here and our 3 year old loved it. it has a strange collection of marine life, along with some crocodiles and kookaburras. They could do better with providing more informative signs of what you I are looking at. Some tanks had signs and others didn't. Great way to pass the time for young kids.

Disapointing. When you visit the mall you can see the majority of the Tank without paying. The only benefit of paying is the small exhibition. Is it worth it , in my view , no. Just spend longer observing from the side.

Shark Diving. I tried shark diving here last weekend, and it was an absolutely amazing experience.The dive is organized by Al Boom Diving, and I had scheduled everything with them in advance. The dive in the aquarium was wonderful, although it felt a little weird to be photographed by so many people. The space in the aquarium is tight, and the marine life is available in abundance, so everywhere you look, you are bound to see something beautiful. My dive buddy and dive master (both from Al Boom) were both extremely professional and made sure I had an excellent experience. We went to see the King Croc after, and we were amazed to see its size. I had seen these crocs at a distance on a recent trip to Africa, but I haven't managed to see them up close until I visited the Dubai aquarium. They also have a caribou café in the aquarium to satisfy those caffeine / sugar cravings.Its one of the touristy things to do while in Dubai, but well worth it!

Amazing attraction in shopping Mall. Big and amazing Aquarium to visit while you are shopping in a biggest Shopping mall in Dubai , yes it is Dubai Mall , you could stay all the day here and you need more days to finish and see everything in this great place

Its a nice place to go. Very nice to watch the beautiful aquarium and the zoo very nice place with a wonderful feeling of peace also if u want to enjoy the max dont go on weekends and try to go in the morning very nice plae little bit pricy

Dubai Aquarium from outside. One of the MUST DO stop attraction at Dubai Aquarium and Dubai Fountain within the Dubai Mall. The underwater world is paid attraction, while the view of the aquarium from outside is also equally worth watching.
Amazing. Visited the aquarium at the mall. Unbelievable that this is in a shopping mall with over 300 different species of fish. It is well worth a visit.
A must see!. A must see in Dubai Mall but beware of indulging in shopping. There are sharks outside the water too!!!

Not that extensive, but fun. If you are expecting a massive aquarium with mind blowing stuff (perhaps like Simgapore) this may let you down. This is rather more educational stuff which will take care for a couple of hours spent with your kids and they will love it. Book online and get 65AED tickets on various online portals to not feel the heat incase you dont like it much!

Made me feel sad. We regret going to the aquarium (went upon a recommendation of a work colleague). The large tank you see from the mall looks impressive but when we went into the underwater zoo it just made us feel very sad. All enclosures were extremely small. I felt extremely sorry for the lizard constantly digging at the glass to get out, the Octopus in a tank so small it was only double its size, the two very large crocodiles in an extremely small enclosure for their size and the penguins to also in a small enclosure. I left feeling disgusted with myself that I went and just felt sad that this is their life. I am all for protecting species and other aquariums/ zoos I have been to have had plenty of space but this was just not nice. They really need to expand the enclosures if they have any heart rather than just making money.
Good one. Worth for each penny...its a spot to enjoy with kids. one time spot with friends.spend 1 hour there and enjoy

Well worth it. We visited the Dubai Aquarium and Zoo recently on a 4 night stopover. Plenty of ticket options however we purchased the 100 dirham Researcher option and it was just fine. Other more expensive tickets obviously offer more bells and whistles but for us we just wanted to see the fish and others. Yes well worth the 90 minutes it took us to explore.
Biggest Aquarium in the world!. Wow... wonderful and fantastic aquarium in the wold! with a lot of under water species with good atmosphere in The Dubai Mall.

Huge. didnt actually pay to go into this as someone told us you see just as much walking round the outside and wasn't worth the entrance fee. I suppose it depends on how much you want to see walking round the outside was enough for our family, it really is huge.

Great innovation. Such a beautiful innovation by Dubai, the habitat for all living sea creatures is a high tech state of the art deployment. Make sure you get the researcher tour, it will show you how the fishes are fed, how the water is pumped and kept at sea salt levels, pH and much more. It's a must when visiting Dubai

Excellent value for money. Great for Kids. Dubai Aquarium is for me among top activities to be done in Dubai. The aquarium can be seen free of cost from outside but if you want to go in the tunnel, you have to buy the ticket. It is value for money. Kids enjoy it a lot. Once inside the tunnel, lots of photo opportunities. You are surrounded by sharks and stingrays. At the end of the tunnel you can go upstairs and see the Zoo which I would rate very high just for the fact that we are talking about a zoo in a shopping Mall. At the top level one can enjoy boat ride in the aquarium. We found the boat ride really good. A bit expensive, but worth the money.
Great for Kids!. The Dubai Aquarium is great to visit with kids. However, be ware that you cannot take kids under 3 for the boat ride, etc.

Best Place In Dubai City. If you don't want want to go out in hot sun or you want to stay within the city yet spend some good time. Dubai Aquarium & underwater Zoo is the best place. Very Informative, Entertaining & Refreshing

Fun indoor activity. This was a nice experience if a little short. Navigation was a little confusing since it is split between floors and directions are not exactly obvious. Overall it was a positive experience and feeding the fish was really fun.
Fun visit . This was a fun visit. Did it in about an hour and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Loved the behind the scenes tour and got some great pictures too.would definitely recommend a visit.

Good value for money- do the explorer!! . This was a great way to spend a few hours in dubai! The aquarium is impressive and the underwater zoo upstairs great also! The fish, penguins and crocodiles were impressive! However for me the best bit was the glass bottom boat it went over the top of the aquarium! It was such a nice experience- well worth paying the 20 aed more for!
Great attraction. This is a great aquarium with plenty to see. Use this in with your visit to the Dubai Mall. Good Rain forest exhibits too!
so funny and interesting. aquarium is so big and you can see real shark! if you want you can swim inside of aquarium ( in special cage)
Amazing. You have to go and see this amazing aquarium. I just can't explain how big and incredibly vivid the experience is.

If you like Aquariums - YOU'LL LOVE THIS ONE!. I've lived in Dubai for 4 years and I can't believe it took me that long to visit the aquarium and underwater zoo. The entire thing can be done in just under 2 hours - or more if you like to linger around. I took my little sister and she loved it - we even did the boat ride and fed the fish which was really fun. Skip the simulator - it's really dumb and a waste of time. Be sure to bring your camera and get some sweet shots in the aquarium tunnel!

Marine Wonder. I have went Scuba Diving there in the Mall with the Sand Tiger Sharks as well as taken my family to see the aquarium. They have a wide variety of marine life as well as the Salt Water Crocodiles from Australia. It is definitely on the To Do List when you are over in Dubai.
Dubai Aquarium. My husband and I took a tour of Dubai Aquarium. We enjoyed the tour and spending the day exploring. It was our second trip to the Dubai this time we decided to take the tour.

Opulence of Dubai Mall. Dubai mall is awesome.. and this aquarium adds to the opulence of the the mall... but if you have been the aquariums of US and Europe.. this can be skipped... I'd better spend time in chocolate land... a shop near this attraction.

Biggest Fish Tank in the World. This has got to be the biggest fish tank in the world, it holds 10million litres of water and 34,000 fish, it has the longest underwater glass tunnel in the world and it is all inside a shopping mall (opposite probably the biggest sweet shop we have seen.The aquarium offers you the chance to scuba dive amonst the sharks and fish. They say the secret is to keep the sharks well fed and then they will live amonst all the other fish without eating the contents of the aquarium.Also you can put on a life jackets and have a trip in a glass bottom boat. where else in the world can you find such things in a shopping mall?.It is well worth while taking a slow walk around this place and try to take in the variation in size between some small reef fish and the large sharks and rays this aquarium houses.You can also walk around the small zoo with its nocturnal creatures and crocodiles. there are other things to do inside like the simulator. Well worth a visit at any age.

Spacious. Makes our aquarium laughable! I found it amazing that it's surrounded by shops, you do your shopping then pop into the aquarium next door, why not? The kids absolutely loved it, they could almost touch the Sharks and stingrays etc. they even have divers in the water, beautifully kept, worth the money

Doesn't live upto the expectations created by the branding and steep price tag. Its a giant aquarium, giant in comparison to the ones you have at home. The ticket prices are too high and its definitely not worth it. You anyways get a decent sneak peak of the aquarium from the common area of the mall. The purchase of tickets will let you entry to the tunnel, which ends too soon!! But the highest disappointment is yet to come. You'll realize later that all the pics you took inside the tunnel, has reflections of all those people standing outside and clicking snaps!! The underwater zoo has some nice collection of animals, but again the collection is not too awe inspiring. Full marks to the management effort for managing and maintaining this facility so well, in the middle of such a harsh land mass. Key advice, avoid purchasing tickets from the counter, plan your trip in advice and look for online deals.
Great experience. it was wonderful, great experience, enjoyed a lot. it was great to see lot of variety of fish. this is the first time i have seen this large aquarium

interesting, those behind the scene is better than the aquarium itself. the aquarium is just so so...nothing special except it is inside the mall and u can see in other country anyway. but what make it special is that they let you to see what behind the scene and how it is run. thats the special part. the zoo is quite interesting as well. worth a go.
Grand Experience.. This was eyecatching! I could not leave. Gave a feeling of being underwater with the fish. The experience was delightful
Kid friendly, must see. KING CROC!! it is a fun and informative place to spend some hours. Guaranteed to keep the kids entertained for hours.

A nice experience. Worth it the money.you will go through all under water fish.also the Emirates section is nice.
take a Selfie with the white owl.it enjoys flash of the mobile.enjoy and select a souvenir

Dubai Aquarium.. This was one of the highlights of my trip. Amazing experience and a must see.
Only £20 to get a guided tour and you can take photographs. Sharks, crocodiles, penguins.
A great place to see different animals and species.
Well worth the money.

Amazing & Great Value. Popped along whilst we were in Dubai Mall - Purchased a combo ticket for my Wife & I and spent a very enjoyable hour or so firstly in the Aquarium and then the Underwater Zoo.
Really good value for money and enjoyed ourselves immensely - Would definitely recommend
Neil & Jill
Oct 2015
Great experience. Enjoyed visiting the fish in these acquariums and seeing some divers venturing into the pool with sharks to take a look around. This would be good for families with young children.
Every rare creature found a home. Home to species from the globe Hawaii to Australia and antartic to the South Pole what a collection of fishes crocodiles and other species never seen before
Big water tank with lot of fish. Huge water tank in a huge shopping mall, nothing special. You can see almost every fish from outside, doesn't worth to go inside (max 30 minutes visit)

Cool Ambiance and a lot of sea life. If you visit Dubai Mall, Dubai Aquarium is a must-visit place. One of the largest indoor aquariums of world with a lot of sharks and a load of other sea life. Boat ride, fish feeding, diving and other activities are also available besides a walk through glass tunnel. Buying a combo ticket is highly advisable.
I loved this.. we had a great time here, first bit is not as good but it's gets so much better. Great for pictures. Not sure the boat ride is a must but good for small children.

Diving with the Sharks. Dubai is hot, and while we are not mall people, we we told to check out the largest mall in the world. It's a bit overwhelming, but the aquarium glass walls open to the mall were stunning. When we saw divers we inquired and my husband signed up. I went in to take pictures. Wish I knew how to get the picture off Flkr to post here.

Owls don't have enough space to live in.... Went there for the first time with my sister, after living here for more than ten years...don't really believe in zoos or aquariums to tell you the truth,It was amazing to see the sharks from such a close distance, but then again I left feeling sad for them specially for the owls, they are in such a tiny space, forget about flying altogether .Not planning on going back.
overhyped aquarium. One can see the aquarium from outside without spending. The entrance fee to the aquarium are too high and does not justify the visit

Impressive attraction but over priced. Was pretty cool walking through the tunnel and then seeing the part you don't actually see when admiring it from a distance. Yet, for what it is, it's pretty overpriced and you get bored pretty fast.

Amazing!!! Out of this world!!. Been here a few times now, AMAZING would be an under-statement! Just one thing though, check the timings before you visit. If you would like to watch the fish being fed then check before buyng the tickets and re-schedule... Otherwise, it's a great experience just to walk through the tunnel, with all the fish surrounding you everywhere!! Make the most of the time in the tunnel as you will not be returning once you have walked through it. I made that mistake on my first visit. Try to go in the afternoon/early evening (depending on the feeding times of the fish) and give yourself at least 2-3hours if possible, so you can spend alot of time looking at the aquariums and other small animals too.

Plenty of interesting attractions. We purchased the cheapest ticket, the researcher, and had a great time. The scale of the tank, in the middle of a shopping mall(!), is inedible. You walk through the under water tunnel and this is great fun. From here you then go up two flights of escalators and resume the tour. You are then walked through the labs and workings of the aquarium, which is interesting. Finally you then take yourself around the zoo area which has all kinds of fish, animals and a few new large occupants!! All in all we spent about an hour and a half and this flew by.

There was so much more to this attraction than we expected. We visited at 4.30 pm and thought our visit would not last longer than 30 minutes, expecting it to be a walk through a tunnel looking at the fish and then view a few animal displays, but it was so much more. It cost 100 Dirhams per adult for entrance but it was worth it. We were in the attraction for about 90 minutes in total so do allow enough time for your visit if you want to see all the areas that your entrance ticket is valid for. We walked through the tunnel then had to go upstairs to see other aspects of the zoo. The penguins were really nice but we were particularly enthralled to see an Ethiopian hedgehog that we have never seen before. We saw areas behind the scenes on escorted visits with staff explaining how they maintain the water conditions for the aquarium. We also saw their fish breeding centre, where they had tiny baby seahorses in a small tank. There were some huge crocodiles on display and lots of baby crocodiles that they were rearing in the breeding centre. You are really missing out if you don't allow yourself enough time to see all of this attraction.

Very nice. Hi all it was very nice to visit the underwater zoo and the aquarium. When went inside the tunnel it was wonderful and it seemed that ww were under the sea and watch the wonderful creatures of god in water.It waa really wonderful and we enjoyed a lot

Fantastic. It starts from 150 dirham 300 dirham there are different things you can do depending on what kind of adventure you like. I opted for the 200 dirham which was a picture when you first walk in and if you want to buy at end you can do . Then you walk through a tunnel which is 80ft under with amazing saline you will really enjoy taking pictures as its beautiful to see then i went up the escalators to a 4d experience which lasted 4 mins then we was given life jackets and went in a glass bottom small boat with around 8 people and you was at the top of the 80ft aquarium with amazing fish and sharks and stingrays . after that you got and look around all the different sea life and you get to see a big Crocodile i can't remember how big it was but i will attach a pic. You will be very happy going its absolutely amazing.
Good, but busy. Quite a short experience but well worth the money.I have been to loads of different aquariums and this is up there with the best.
Good time pass with spectacular views. Located in Dubai mall. You can’t miss this attraction as kids and families will be around the place. Excellent if you are watching such an aquarium.

Not a must see attraction in Dubai. The aquarium and zoo was ok. It was nice to see the animals in the zoo but it was nothing special. The aquarium was mediocre. It was basically one big tank which you can view from different angles -- there's a view from before you enter the aquarium (everyone in the mall can see it), from up top looking down where you can ride a little boat that goes around in circles (not a lot of space), and from a tiny short tunnel that you can walk through. Overall nothing too spectacular, good if you have time to kill.

I cheated. Having just gone to an aquarium in Paris, I didn't feel the need to go into this one. Especially as there was such a vast amount out on public view. We enjoyed watching the divers and all the fish. Quite amazing
