Fun for all family. located inside the Dubai Mall, the aquariam and waterzoo is something that you should really do specially if you have kids, for sure they are going to love this.The main attraction is the tunel underwater and nowadays the crocodile.You will see a lot of diferent species and still be inside the mall.You can also dive or go on what I call panoramic bottom boat.You can buy the tickets on the spot or book it prior to your visit depending on the month.

Not a bad price and got the chance to see behind the scenes of an aquarium!. Me and my group chose the 'explorer' option which gave us access to the underwater zoo and the aquarium. It was a good price and covered everything we were after. The aquarium is set out nicely and is very pretty. One of the benefits of the explorer package was that you can go behind the scenes of the aquarium and see what it is like at the top of the tank. We also got to see different sea creatures growing in different stages for example jelly fish and sea horse. There are other options available where you take a short trip on a glass bottomed boat across the top of the tank to see the fish. You get a good view without doing that though but it is something to consider. Overall, an enjoyable hour or so.
Fish sharks turtles rays. If you like sea life then visit the Aquarium it has massive array of sea creatures and information on local turtle sanctuary and rehabilitation program.

Amazing!!!. Well worth a visit if visiting the Dubai mall. Thus aquarium offers great interactive experiences which the kids thoroughly enjoyed. Floor to ceiling glass display is amazing. Great photo opportunities.
Small Zoo. It is small sea zoo but the height of aquarium is number one in the world! Also, the ticket price is little high!

decent aquarium.. its located in Dubai mall. its takes around 1 to 3 hrs to visit depending how much one is interested. its has got huge crcodile and there are sharks too and different breeds of fishes.

Love the sharks . This is my second visit to the aquarium, and my first with my wife and son. To have an aquarium in a mall it's self is an amazing Attraction. So many people just gather around the place taking photos and videos or just watch the flow of time, in that case fish time . The tickets was worth it 100 AED each, you will get unlimited time under the aquarium, we spent 20 min, then went up 2nd floor, to check out a 10 min educational tour about the fish and a close look above the Aquarium which was so amazing. You might need to be patient especially in rush hour. Finally, the zoo which was also unlimited access time, we spent there almost 45 min, Checking out the amazing animals and fish etc. My son and many kids there loved the place, from crocodile, penguins to sharks, which were many compared to Atlantis lost chambers Aquarium. There is a bathroom and a caribou coffee plus an ice cream shop in the Zoo, to refeshen up and take a break a bit. The place is a bit humid, so wear casual, shorts and light. Tip:Make sure to take antiseptic clean wipes or gel, since kids are playing all over the place and keep scrubing there eyes, mouths and nose. Highly recommended for every one.

A Must See Must Visit in Dubai. When visiting Dubai you have to see Dubai Aquarium. It is nice for both children and adults. You need a whole day to check out everything in there. You get to see all types of sea creatures and experience feeding the fish or diving. It is very entertaining. Don't forget your cameras.

Go the Zoo. We brought tickets on the City Scenic hop on hop off bus, which included access to both the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo, the Aquarium can mostly be seen from the Dubai Mall area without the need to pay, although there were a few Grey Nurse sharks and Rays that were hanging around the Tube area, but in my option, I wouldn't pay the price just to see them.One the other hand, the Underwater Zoo was well worth the trip, very cleverly setup and a big hit with all the kids that were there, especially when it came time to feed the "shooting fish" Gary

Dubai Aquarium. Dubai aquarium housed in Dubai mall is a must visit of one enjoys aquatic life. one can get up and close with the King Croc there. also, there is a facility of going underwater in the aquarium.
Big deal. The aquarium was nice, but nothing special. The skating rink was an oddity too when the outside temperature was well over 100 degrees.
Wow. Unbelievably good and very good system of maintenance of place and animals.....some of them rare and beautiful....enjoyed the place and animaks
A must!. If you have young kids this is the place to go! The aquarium is so lovely the boat ride was fun and intellectual! Finished off the evening with dinner at the Cheesecake Factory!
Amazing. We all loved this activity!!! it was fun...exciting...educative!! Kids haven't stopped yacking about it. And the aquarium definitly makes an excellent picture background!!

A must in Dubai. Nice experience with wonderful views,Didn't enjoy the pressure of the photographers to take your pictures and charge you over the roof price.30 odd quid for a photograph was a bit too much in my opinion!

Fab on the outside but not the experience I was hoping for inside. This is spectacular when you see it in the Mall! It's huge and very impressive.My friend and I paid to go through the tunnel which was great but a little disappointing. After you go through the tunnel, it continues upstairs on the second floor but there's no guidance as to where you can view the other part? We walked along it and viewed the aquarium from above but I have to admit, it was a bit disappointing!I'm not sure if we missed out on much but other than viewing it from the outside, there isn't really much to view on the inside other than being able to walk through it. Personally, I wouldn't pay to go through it again.

Worth a visit... Its a great weekend place to be in Dubai..especially for families with kids..the underwater zoo & glass bottom boat ride are also fun to experience. The collection of aquatic world is amazing..especially crocs..

Waste of money. Don't bother paying to go through the tunnel. You can see just as much from outside. The "back of house" tour was interesting enough but we were rushed through and could not hear the guide over noise of machines. The underwater zoo was underwhelming.!!! A rip off.

Absolutely loved it. This is a must see and must do when in dubai. My kids are aged 4 and and 1.5 years old. They absolutely loved it. It Is definitely worth the entrance fee. It's an unforgettable family experience
attraction worth and fun. the fish moves in the aquarium will grab your all the time.many kids where playing with the fish as they move up to the other side.many animals to see.worth to visit
Amazing visit. You will feel that you live in the water, different style of fish and other section for animals.Take your time there

We go every week!. If you are a UAE resident you can buy an annual membership for this place for 250 dirhams - that gives you unlimited access (one adult, one child under 3). we love this and take our two year old every week! it's stunning.

Big is definitely better.. The Aquarium can be viewed when you are in the Dubai Mall (its 11m high and 30+m long) and you will be mesmorised by the selection of marine life inside the tank. For an enhanced experience, go behind the scenes of the Aquarium and see the Zoo. If you dare, you can also scuba dive in the tank. Good value for great experience.

Not to be missed. Dubai Mall Aquarium is the biggest in the world. As soon as you enter the Mall from the front entrance you cannot miss the immense crowd who is looking at the massive Aquarium window. If you buy a ticket you'll have a privilege to see it also from the inside of the 20m glass tunnel. After you finish viewing the Aquarium you are invited 2 floor up to walk trough the Underwater Zoo, and believe me, there's lots to see as well. I have never imagine to be standing so close to a 6 meters long crocodile...

Cool aquarium with BIG Croc . Went here whilst visiting in June, booked this before as I read up that it was a a good aquarium and in the dubai mall which is very central. The front is massive and having also been to Okinawa aquarium it definitely rivals it. The tunnel walkway is cool walking in and around the sharks and the rest of the aquarium is a good past time. Main attraction is the crocodile that is absolutely massive!

Best Mall experience. Have some extra time to burn? Enjoy Aquariums? Find yourself tired of shopping inside the Dubai Mall? This was a very welcome respite from shopping and more importantly people watching in this insane mall. The view is impressive and was interesting to see a few species I have never seen before.

WOW!. This was brilliant! The aquarium is breath taking. The amount of fish is unreal! Really Is something different having an aquarium in a shopping mall!! The zoo is good too and the penguins are super cute!

Mesmerizing view of the ocean creatures. Extremely nice view of the marine creatures, lots of variety of fishes, especially sharks. Feels at a touch distance and mesmerizing for the kids. The King Croc, , the massive crocodile which is the star attraction was sleeping throughout my visit and couldn't get a closer look at it., slightly disappointing, but otherwise, worth a visit.
Visit to mall. For only 100 Dirham you can do this, good value for money. And it's very interesting and lovely to see different fishes, creatures, animals etc! Especially the crocodile!!!!
Dubai trip. It was really nice to be here. I enjoyed to see this kind of amazing creature within Dubai mal. My baby too enjoyed a lot.
Not that great. A good place but similar to other under water aquariums around the world. It is situated in dubai mall and has easy access.

Unexpected attraction. We didn't expect too much. To be honest, it is not the best aquarium we have been to, but the nice part, which we have never experienced before, was going with a guide into the working area of the aquarium where breeding takes place. very interesting
Good . Really good, couldn't believe how big the fish tank was but aquarium needed to be bigger! Would visit again, somewhere else you need to go in Dubai....
lovely experience!. my son enjoyed this very much!!! they've got a very large collection of fishes and the tunnel gave us a close encounter with the fishes! great experience!

Window fish gazing. Outstanding quality of exhibits. My only disappointment was how small it was. I had envisaged an aquarium like those in Sydney, Cape Town or the such like but this was more like a taster. So whilst they have done it very well I think it needed to be much bigger. For this reason I found the entry tickets pricey. I had no problem paying the price but by the end of the short visit I was left with the thought "Is that it?! That wasn't cheap".

better than the lost chambers.. I took my daughters to the aquarium. It was very good value for money. The walkway was outstanding. You see a lot of marine life over your head. Many sharks. We had a short boat trip in the third floor and that was great. The demonstration of the type of fish was good for the girls. Different part of the zoo was about night creatures. My daughters enjoyed it.
An aquarium with a difference. A very interesting take on an aquarium and a very nice break from the normal shopping mall routine. Quite pricey, but worth it.

An aquarium ...... In a mall?. So you're bored of shopping, what do you do??? Feed the fish and watch sharks! Couldn't imagine in the UK it would work but in Dubai.... It's fabulous!Reasonably priced. We paid extra to feed the fish. Works largest crocodile is terrifying! Young children may get a little scared in the shark tunnel. We loved it. Every minute. Would recommend an go back in a Heartbeat.

The Aquarium. This is the most amazing place not to be missed !! Worth every Dirum of the entry fee. You can dive wIth the fish with experienced divers. Go for a cheese cake in the Cheesecake Factory opposite you won't be disappointed.

Really a Fun.... Huge Aquarium...... Dubai aquarium located in Dubai Mall....There is free view also towards the Dubai Mall.... you can pictures too there... miniumum charge is 100 riyal each which will take you to the underwater tunnel... awesome view.... loved it and to the under water zoo.... small aquariums and different types of fish and a giant crocodile... about 1hour tour.... optional picture also but it will cost u minimum 125Dhs if go for it....

worth a trip. was an amazing experience walking in the tunnel and seeing the fishes all around. It literally transports you to another place.
Booking a boat ride is a good idea. It gives you an idea of the depth of the pool and the sheer marvel of having this in the middle of a mall.

Great Experience. The dimensions are great and the animals have enough space which is super considering that we are in a mall. Between the aquarium and the zoo, there are many things to see. Also, the tunnel where we see the sharks, at the beginning of the visit is impressive. Nevertheless, too much people trying to propose photos. They take pictures usually without asking you, prices are insane and the way they sell is too much.
Overpriced . This place is overpriced and nothing special . I was disappointed . It didn't wowed us at all . I will never vist it again .

Dubai Aquarium: A place for fun for every one. I joined my children and wife when visiting the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo in Dubai Mall. It was a fantastic experience for all of us, particularly my little girl who loved the place very much and had fun.  The Aquarium is full of different types of fish, birds and animals, including the largest Alligator in the world and penguins. The Price of the ticket for the basic places is 300 Durham which is some how expensive, but it worths it. I highly recommend this place for all families visiting Dubai.
Good. Same as other aquariums. Cannot say it was anymore special but it is one of the cheapest activities in Dubai.
Amazingly Huge Aquarium.... We simply love this huge aquarium inside the mall!Very relaxing to look at.Don't forget to have you picture taken in front of the aquarium!! :)

You can just grab a shark!. We bought a ticket for underwater tunnel, behind the scenes tour, fish feeding and underwater zoo. The ticket are very expesive, this cost us about 30 eur per person, but you dont go every week to see an aquarium in Dubai. Averall the tunnel is nice, you can see the sharks really close, you can't see them from outside. Behind the scenes tour could be a bit better, they show you how they reproduce all the organisms (fish and plants). In my opinion the best thing was underwater zoo. You can see different fish species, the biggest crocodile in the world. Everything looks so natural, there is so many plants and the aquariums are open at the top so you feel more close to the animals.
Perfect place for visit. A breathtaking spectacle that in many places of the planet really can not find. Direct access from the Dubai Mall, pleasant atmosphere and fun.
Cool experience. Its a nice experience but short. A lot of sharks and other fishes. In the middle of Dubai mall so its very easy to find. Its enough to make one visit.

Fantastic way to spend the day!. As a family of four with two young toddlers we thoroughly enjoyed every single moment of the aquarium and zoo. We would have expected to pay much more than 300AED for what we experienced. This is a must do for families!

Dubai Aquarium is worth the money. Gorgeous attraction in the amazing Dubai Mall. The exhibit is absolutely wonderful, and it is not overly priced. There are some very rare display animals, and this exhibit appeals to all ages.
Very impressive. Wow so beautiful and so many fish! Really impressive and a must see while in Dubai. Will have to walk through next time.

Give yourself plenty of Time. Excellent experience and would recommend , situated in the Dubai Mall , just make sure you have plenty of time to look through thoroughly as it is easy to miss different sections if your in a hurray as I nearly did . The Aussie Croc is gigantic and is worth going just for that .

Loved it. The aquarium is amazing with alot to see I opted for fish feeding on my ticket which was fun to do. It is massive and is within the mall. You should take an hour and abit out for this activity as it takes a while to get around. I paid for the researcher ticket which included a tour.

Fascinating.. We bought the basic package as my little one was too young to do anything else but we did pay a little extra for her to feed the fish. We all loved it, it was a brilliant experience and our 2 year old was amazed especially in the tunnel. Feeding the fish after the tour was quite cute our daughter received a little pot of large pellets that she enjoyed throwing in and watching the fish eat them.

Beautiful and informative. Fun way to spend and afternoon in Dubai. The underwater zoo houses the largest crocodile in the world and also different kinds of animals, reptiles and aquatic life. Worth a visit.

A good experience for all!. Lovely fish and other species. Loads of things to see! There's a souvenir shop at the end. There's also a chance for you to take a photo and they edit the background in, the only problem is that is is quiet pricey and they aren't willing you give you just the picture alone. But overall amazing!
Awesome Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. Awesome experience at the Dubai Aquarium and underwater Zoo. Also enjoyed other attractions at the Dubai Mall
Its a miracle. Its a miracle,the aquarium built is very good,awesome and nice.they have kept all the fishes and mini sharks etc. in this, very much great and nice place to visit.

Variety of marine species . No need to be diver to watch how looks like the underwater life. You can spent longer time in the tunnel to see a lot of different kinds of fishes and they only less than 30 cm away from you. I forget how much ticket cost but it deserve. After I you enjoyed watching the underwater life, I went at the top and feed those fishes. It was good visit in the aquarium and I hope you like it.

Unique Experience. It was a very nice experience, another one after Singapore. They have made it very well that too in a mall....appreciate the engineering marvel to have a aquarium - walking size in a mall. The kids just loved it to run in the tube with all the lovely fishes around them.

A wonderful experience for the younger members of the family. My granddaughter loves visiting here, she will happily return time and again. It is a wonderful experience for all the family. Highly recommended you visit.
Amazing. Not just your ordinary aquarium- its fab. Paid the basic, explorer package about £20 each, well worth it. So much too see and do.

Big & Amazing Aquarium. This Aquarium is soooo Big. If you Visiting this Aquarium you can see so many big fish, sharks, big manta, many kinds of fish. Time you can spend arround this aquarium is about 1 hour will be enough i think. See and Enjoy how magnificent Dubai Make all the Special Attraction.

Spectacular display of fishes. Located inside dubai mall this attraction is exciting for all age groups. My little one went crazy with excitement. Get a picture taken, feed the fish, take a glass boat ride within a few inches of sharks, or dive in with scuba gear in a cage to feed the sharks. Its all there and the price is acceptable for the amazing experience it provides. When in dubai it is must visit attraction.

Something you have to do.. My son did the discover scuba dive. It was fantastic! Lots of time with the sea life and truly a once in a lifetime chance to get nose to nose with a sand shark. The instructors took an underwater film too which cost about £40, which was ace. Organising it was a bit of a challenge, but that's the same as everything else in Dubai. The tunnel, zoo, glass bottom boat etc were excellent too my little one really enjoyed. It was reasonably priced too...about £150 for the dive, with free entrance to the aquarium etc. entrance to the aquarium alone was only about £25, which I thought was reasonable.
Nice display . When you visit dubai mall,seeing the aquarium and the undersea zoo is a must . beautiful display of fish and animals. Some cages are empty but all in all its a must see

This was a fun time.. This aquarium is very good for being inside a Mall. It has a diverse collection of fish and critters. I paid the basic entrance fee which included the aquarium and underwater zoo. I can't remember what the price was, but it was reasonable.
A must, when you visit Dubai. It was a family visit to this place. A very good collection of rare species of Sea Life. The best part was the Penguins.
Good place to spend time with Kids. Nice Aquarium right inside the Mall. Huge tank and lots of fishes. Kids had a great time running around and admiring the collection of fishes.
Beautiful aquarum. Huge Aquarium, full of sea creatures (Sharks, fishes, sting ray etc.) Its almost three stories tall. Inside Dubai Mall. Free entrance.

A fantastic place to visit.. Instead of being one of those hundreds of people who take pictures of the outside of the aquarium why not pay the entrance fee and visit the aquarium tunnel and then afterwards visit the Zoo (included in the ticket price). The sea life is stunning and the mainly aquatic animals and fish in the zoo are great to view up close and enjoy.

Swimming with sharks. This aquarium is impressively massive as it is, BUT they offer an up close and personal glass bottom boat ride and a chance to swim with the large and small creatures in the tank. I decided to take a life time opportunity and took a dip with ferocious sharks and rays in the water. The experience comes with wetsuit and snorkeling gear. Once geared up I jumped into a cage inside the tank and enjoyed my under water experience up close with the marine life. This is much more thrilling than a camel ride.
Expensive and kitsch but fun. Great for kids. Close up views of the fish and sharks. Great photo opportunities. You can let your kids roam free in the aquarium.

Much better than lost chambers at Atlantis. You have various options to pay- clearly detailed by staff at admissions kiosk- the underwater tunnel, then the shark tank and hospital/rearing section is done by guided walk with someone explaining whats going on.Then up a floor to the underwater zoo, which has allsorts from otters, Penguins to a giant crocodile! Filled in a good hour- the usual café and memorabilia store-

great family activity. Great activity for the entire family. went during a sandstorm and spent several hours inside. what many don't know is that there is a great indoor zoo in the back. we also opted for the boating experience which was underwhelming as you really could not see much and it was something like 3 mins only. you queue longer. you should visit if you have kids as they will love it even more. the giant crocodile is sitting in a small enclosure and there are dozens of people in front if it taking pictures. the same applies to the penguins. the only criticism i have are the sizes of the enclosures.

Get the Package. We got the Researcher Package which adds on a few attractions. Again we went there in the morning and we were the first ones and had the whole tunnel to ourselves. I was very impressed with the number of sharks they had and since there was no one around we took our time to really enjoy the experience.

Must do!. Purchased the passes on myconcierge.com and the experience was absolutely fantastic. a must do for every visitor to Dubai. The Aquarium has a tunnel which is phenomenal and the zoo itself is very interesting. Great for the kids to keep entertained.
Fun dive. went there for shark diving. Great experience. TicKet included zoo & tunnel as well. Tunnel is more for kids/families. Aquarium is nicely arranged with interesting animals.
Impressive. Its amazing the way they have built this inside a mall. Attractions are good loads to see price is reasonable. Can be enjoyed from outside too. A lot of add ons can also be enjoyed.

A Main Attraction in Dubai Mall. Every time guests come to visit Dubai, I take them to Dubai Mall and I make sure they see an amazing Aquarium. This is certainly the main attraction of Dubai Mall. There are three different view that you may see. I can stand there all day and watch the fish moving from one side to another. There are many fish species in the aquarium and they keep on adding them. This is not the point to be missed.
Worth the experience. Similar to most acquariums everywhere worth a visit atleast once. Shark tunnel not impressed starts and finishes in no time....

Worth every penny. It was an amazing experience as we saw it from the Dubai Mall first. Having been to Sea World and similar attraction we thought maybe been there done that. An incredible experience it turned out to be. We had an amazing time and the different fish and other animals were definitely worth every penny.

One of the best I have seen. So I have visited a lot of aquariums on my travels but this one is incredible and one of the best I have ever visited. The attention to detail and scale is incredible and in some you visit there are maybe 10 or 15 sharks, this one had over 150 and in the correct type of habitat for scale.Some people have said there are alligators but I can confirm these are Australian Salt Water Crocs and one of them is over 5M long and you can see them being fed.Staff are very knowledgeable and we just did the basic Researcher package and I feel we got everything out of the visit.

Nice tube in the middle of the huge tank !!. I went inside the tube for 120dhs I think it was per person ! Also , did the fish feeding from top ! Nice for all ages ! If you are the adventurous type then you can per book to dive inside the tank too !!
for visting zooo. Underwater tunnel under a huge shark & ray-filled tank, plus a creepy crawly zone with snakes..wd lot of water animal's Superb for kids and family

Great zoo. The zoo is excellent with a great range of fish and animals. The aquarium is impressive but when we visited was incredibly busy and was a bit difficult to enjoy with all the people taking selfies getting in the way! I would recommend trying to go at a time when it is quieter and you can walk more freely in the aquarium and not be punched in the face by people trying to take photos of themselves.

“A journey underwater”. Your journey at Underwater Zoo and learn more about what amazing creatures inhabit both our rivers and oceans. Located on Level Two above the Aquarium tank, Underwater Zoo leads you through three ecological Zones; Rainforest, Rocky Shore and Living Ocean. Watch out for these aquatic creatures at Underwater ZooAttractions on the tour: * Otters, Piranha, Humbolt Penguins, Giant Pacific Octopus, Caiman Crocodiles, Lionfish, Stonefish, Horseshoe Crabs, Giant Spider Crabs, Leafy Seadragons, Seahorses, Garden Eels, Archer-fish, Arapaima, Water Rats, Paddle-fish, Cichlids, Nautilus and many more…This is a very educative place for the kids and adults. You will be amazed what the beautiful world has to offer and you might want to go and visit the places.
AMAZING. A really beautiful one and had quite a large selection of sea anim als in the aquarium. Its a nice place to visit with kids.
Breath taking. A huge incredible aquarium in the centre of the Dubai mall filed with exotic fish and after there is a small aqua zoo you should not miss the chance to visit it

Wonderful. An interesting place, we enjoyed the animals, fish and of course the amazing aquarium . My kids loved the shark tunnel, the variety of fish and the enormous crocodile. The ticket was reasonable and service efficient. I strongly recommend it for families.

Better than expected. This was a lot better than expected. You can see most of the aquarium from the mall but as part of the admission ticket you get to see behind the scenes of the aquarium. The underwater zoo is really good and was much better than expected. Worth the visit.

Wonderful Facility and Service. The Tour with a guide is well worth the time and expense. My guide was Ms. Benna and she was a delight. Very interesting and awe inspiring aquarium. I spent a little over an hour and went back the next day just to watch the fish again.
INTERESTING.... it was really nice ... my son (8months old) did not like the crocodile statue.. it sure is fascinating for older kids, they should visit, very informative for them.

Gorgeous Place to visit. I love aquariums and this one was so nice and they offer a lot of experiences that allow you to interact with the fish. Don't forget to check out the huge alligator they have - its massive.

Best aquarium I've been to. This was great.
The package we paid for got us a submarine experience (which is probably more exciting for kids),
then a glass bottom boat ride, access to the underwater zoo and of course the aquarium tunnel.
An aquarium is just an aquarium but there was something just that much better with this one.

Incredible . Absolutely unbelievable, what an amazing experience. I went for my best friends birthday and we really loved it, she had such a good time. So much to see, you'll be in there for hours, would definitely go back, sa so many mind blowing species, great stuff
Ultimate Underwater experience. A walk through the tunnel is just half of it. A visit to the the underwater zoo makes the experience more memorable. Souvenir store has some interesting items.

Very well maintained Aquarium. .. Big sharks and the Giant Croc seemed so unreal. There were laboratories inside the
aquarium incubating eggs of fishes and turtle. lot of information on the different species was available. All in all a good time inside the aquarium.

Truly amazing. When you get to see a huge 15 meter wall with all sorts of fish, including a few shark species, your jaw will drop to the ground!This attraction is location inside Dubai Mall, next to Burj Khalifa and is one of the many "the bigger, the better" attractions in Dubai. Don't miss it.Oh, and you can see it (partly) for free!!!

Facinating. This is lovely. Well worth going to. It's pricey but it is well worth it. There can be long enough queues so it is better to go in the morning. Everyone seemed to really enjoy it. It is also worth standing and watching he aquarium in the mall. It's lovely.

Sharks. This was our 4th trip going back over about the last 6yrs. Each time our son has come (he is now 6!!) and each time it is fantastic to see the new enjoyment he gets from it as he gets older!! Sharks everywhere and stingrays and manta rays as if as a mini!! The back of house feeding is well worth the extra dhiram to do as the staff are lovely and very passionate about their job and more than happy to answer questions!! A must if visiting the Mall with children and well worth the money!!
Beautiful. Amazing - went snorkelling. Very fun experience, would definitely do again!Lots of different animals to see - some never seen before. Very beautiful!!
Treat for all ages.. Nice walking tour with options for additional scenic things to do and see. The boat trip has simple access and is non-threatening. Kids will love everything about this tour.

Wow. It was wow experience visiting Dubai Aquarium and underwater zoo having sharks and other fish close to us. Kids may get scared to see sharks but it's a worth visiting to this place. Ensure taking plenty of photos and enjoying the movements of underwater creatures.The official camera photos are too expensive so be warned.

Under the water. Nice aquarium, I enjoyed to the most. From sharks to tiny fish, colourful fish and what not about the fish. After Aquarium visted the Zoo, but nothing great as most of the spices are seen in India. But of couse the way it is maintained is good and that's what it attacts public. Very neatly maintained. I must mention that they need to have wheel chair or guided tour in this.

Recent trip to aquarium. Dubai aquarium is a very good because it has a lot of fishes. After passing the huge viewing window you go though a glass tunnel. Then you go upstairs to the underwater zoo. There is petting area for starfishes and you see king crab, jellyfish and sea horses and penguins. Then you see the night zoo with nocturnal animals like fruit bats, mice, owl with a climb over a rope bridge. All in all good fun for children for about 2 hours.

Aquarium and underwater zoo in a mall.. crazy but amazing!. The thought of going shopping in a huge mall is crazy, but the underwater zoo and aquarium was great to experience.We purchased a passed which gave us 5 deals for the same price as 2, so was even better.Worth a visit inside just to believe this is real!
dubai mall aquarium. the biggest aquarium in the world you feel as if you are deep in the sea when walking in the glass tunnel and you can also dive in the aquarium and thake pictures
Good One... Very good. to big as a aquarium, Under water driving and boating is also available in the aquarium. Not very costly if you want to have a boat ride.

Wow factor alright.. This was jaw dropping amazing and would recommend doing the explorer tour and go behind the scenes. Also found the zoo amazing after being sceptical about a zoo in a shopping centre. Great choice of animals not normally seen.

Worth Visiting the Fish. We visited the Dubai Aquarium on a Friday morning (July 31st). We debated as to whether to go inside because some of the Tripadvisor reviews indicated you already get a nice view of the fish from inside the mall. Since it was not crowded, we decided to buy tickets. There were three levels of tickets and we chose the least expensive at 100 dirham each ($27). It allowed you to walk through the tunnel which was similar to other aquariums we have visited. Then you go back out into the mall and up to levels using an escalator to see the rest of the exhibits. At first you have a guide who walks you through the behind the scenes and gives you brief explanations regarding the work of the aquarium. You get to see how big the tank is from the inside and preparation of food for the animals. After that you get to walk through the exhibits which I thought were very good. They had a variety of sea animals including penguins, octopus, spider crabs, jellyfish and piranha. There was also a nocturnal desert section which included scorpions and bats and a separate bird section. The final exhibit was for the king crocs one of which was extremely large. There was a video playing showing how they captured and brought the croc to Dubai. As you walk out, you pass through the gift shop which had interesting items for sale at reasonable prices. It was nice to enter at 10am on Friday when the mall and the aquarium were not crowded. We had the ability to spend as much time as we wanted looking at the exhibits without anyone around us. However, I can see how the place could get very crowded and uncomfortable as some of the spaces in front of the exhibits were small and would fill quickly. There were clean toilets near the nocturnal desert section and places to buy coffee and gelato as you viewed the exhibits. This attraction was definitely worth the price we paid and there is much more to see than just the large aquarium from inside the mall. Our 9 year old son was very excited to see each of the exhibits.

dubai aqurium not to leave. it is in dubai mall n seeing from outside cost u nothing going inside will cost u but it is very big unbelivable somuch fish n many sea crature n r of many colour very very good once u have to visit

Splendid design of Dubai Aquarium. This aquarium and underwater Zoo is fascinating !! Splendid design of the aquarium and it is indeed a must visit place for tourists who would like to see something unique!
Not bad. A very good aquarium but for a country that is trying to be the biggest and best in everything there are certainly better aquariums in the world
Nothing amazing !!. Its an aquarium in a mall !! Nothing here that you've not seen before...I would save your money and do something else that you can't do back home!!

Delightful Visit. Situated in Dubai Mall, Dubai Underwater Zoo offers a refreshing break from the scorching outside temperatures and the bustling crowds of the mall. The zoo itself has been welcoming visitors since the mall first opened and this is not the first time I had visited this attraction. However, the draw of the aquarium's latest attraction, King Croc, was enough to encourage a return visit. The price of entry into the zoo and a walk through the aquarium's tunnel is approximately 70 dhs; however, there are a variety of packages available including a behind the scenes tour, a boat ride on the large aquarium tank itself and diving experiences with the resident sharks. On this occasion, I simply chose to opt for entry into the aquarium and tunnel.The zoo itself is of a fairly decent size and there are certainly an array of creatures to delight and intrigue all ages. The addition of the night-time creatures, including hedgehogs and bats, were worth seeing, but there is no doubt that the star attraction -King Croc- steals the show. King Croc is truly a natural marvel and visitors can find out more about how King Croc came to be at the zoo through the brief information video, which is worth stopping to see.If you have not yet visited the underwater zoo, or haven't been there in a while, it is worth a trip if you are in the vicinity. The fact that Dubai Mall, the fountains and the Burj Khalifa are all nearby means that you can incorporate a visit to the underwater zoo as part of a day out in the city.
Underwater aquarium. Beautiful aquarium in Dubai. A must visit place. The collection of variety of see animals. You will feel like as if you are going under the sea.

Diverse underwater life to see and a fun day!!. I took a friend here for her birthday and we loved it. It is not the best aquarium that we have ever been to, but it definitely a good one. There is an underwater tunnel, glass bottom boats, scuba diving, cage diving and numerous types of sea life on display. We had a fun day here, but our feet sure were tired at the end of the day. It was 240 AED for both of us to see the tunnel, glass bottom boats and underwater zoo. This is a must do if you have children. Have fun!!!

Impressive aquarium. As its inside one of the largest malls in the world, you expect a large aquarium and it doesn't disappoint. Plenty of exhibits and very well maintained. Worth a break from the shopping.

AWSOME . Vest experience in dubai.. The variety of fish Is fantastic.. Very good setting and if you are a fish lover you will go crazy.. They have king lobsters.. Crocs.. Octopus.. Penguins.. Turtles... I mean it's just amazing....

Aquarium @ Dubai Mall. A great place in the vast Dubai Mall !!

Lots to see and do, need more than a 2 day stopover to do Dubai justice.. Well worth seeing, amazing to see such a huge aquarium and underwater zoo in a mall. The amount of different varieties of fish is very interesting, not to be missed.

Great place for kids. you should try it really amazing

Beautiful view of the world under. Based in the dubai mall - one of the largest malls in the world....make sure you visit the aquarium and underwater zoo.Its a tunnel / walkway and is surrounded by glass walls so that visitors can view the fish moving around in its natural surroundings..Alternatively, one side of the wall of the aquarium faces the shops in the mall & is glass thus passing shoppers can get a breif glimpse from there tooYou can just keep starig away and awe at the beauty of this attraction

I recommend also doing the glass boat ride, as it allows for quite a different perspective on things. The zoo itself offers great crocodiles and penguins, which are worth a visit beyond the great aquarium.

Informative recreation. It always amaze me the story of huge aquarium inside the mall as in Dubai Mall. Therefore when I got a chance to go there finally with my family we were not miss the opportunity to enter the Dubai Mall's aquarium. The ticket price was quite pricey though for us. The lowest price package was Researcher pack for 100 AED in that pack we got aquarium tunnel, underwater zoo, back of house tour and underwater observatory. As we started our tour we found out that yes it was huge but we've seen bigger aquarium than this one though. However the most interested part was actually not the aquarium to me but the back of the house tour and underwater obaervatory where we were grouped for about 10-15 people with 1 official tour guide from Dubai Mall Aquarium and during the tour she explained what this company has already done to preserve the nature of the ocean. It was a comprehensive explanation included how they managed the aquarium. We also got a chance to see how they fed the fishes and led us to one level down to see it ourself. Some people bought additional pack to fed the fish so we saw how those group of fishes were coming and grabbed the food. It was quite fun though and the best part after roaming inside the aquarium when you finished you could continue your journey for shopping for sure.. Coz why not you're already inside Dubai Mall anyway :D

Great attraction, great staff. In my opinion, the staff of attractions like these are the make it or break it point of reference, and at Dubai Aquarium they passed with flying colors. The staff willingly open up dialogue about the animals and the aquarium. It did not seem like they were doing a job, but more a hobby. Also importantly, the aquarium itself was awe inspiring. The huge main aquarium really is something to behold, but behind the scenes is also a nice treat as you get to see the animals on the inside and more up close. The main attraction when we went was the King Croc, and while the animal is impressive, there was not much to see as he was simply lying there doing nothing (a feeding/activity would have made it so much better). I do recommend this, especially for families.

Evening adventures. A lovely addition to the mall and a must go for children and couples, we did a boat tour above the main enclosure with a open bottom boat and it was certainly memorable. A really enjoyable outing for the evening.

Awesome View, rivals any aquarium in the U.S.. A great place to visit, with a very large selection of fish. You can view the aquarium from every side - up, down, inside and out. Take the background tour for an even better experience and understanding of how well they truly care for the aquarium and the fish inside it.

Watch out for Crocodiles!!!. This is a welcome diversion from Retail heaven for the ladies!, the Aquarium has plenty of of fascinating fish species to watch and the underwater tunnel is good. The most awesome site is the huge crocodile and its mate which has to be seen to be believed ....just how did they got in there!!!?, watch the film to see!!! and do wait for feeding time and keep safe!!!

Worth the Cost. We visited, two adults and one six year old grandson. We had not booked in advance but went in on impulse. The exhibits are well maintained and the archer fish put on a splendid display of shooting jets of water at targets above them which they took to be flies as they hunt in their natural environment. My grandson was amazed, especially by the nurse sharks which he seemed to be well informed about. The crocodile exhibit is quite awe inspiring to see such large creatures up close and safely.The only down side is the constant pressure to have one's photo taken by staff at almost every turn.

Dubai aquarium : Too good for kids. Its just superb. Fun and good learning experience for Kids. A great place in the Dubai Mall. Different types of fishes and sea creatures are there in it. Worth doing if you have a lot of time. The aquarium is smaller than many aquariums in the United States (New Orleans, Omaha Zoo, Florida Aquarium in Tampa); however, this still has many great exhibits. You can see the largest tank from outside of the exhibit for free - and that alone is super impressive.It is very expensive for the amount of time that you will spend here, and it falls short on the educational opportunities like other (larger) aquariums. There are still many experiences that looked cool like scuba diving inside the large tank - it's just super expensive.If you are visiting here from the US or have been to a large aquarium before, save your money. There are so many other things to do in Dubai that you simply cannot see anywhere else. My suggestion is to grab an ice cream cone, head up to the second or third level and enjoy the people watching / viewing of the large (free) exhibit.

Divers were in the water hand feeding sting rays, fascinating to watch. When we completed the walk we entered the tunnel and straight above us were sharks, so still you'd be hard pushed not to believe they were plastic, then, a swish of the tail and it peel away further into the depths. I must admit as I suffer from Meniers I got extremely giddy at this point but the said tunnel is not that long, loads of fish to see up close, wonderful. Then we were off to see the tanks, specialist fish in each one. Giant crabs, otters, water rats, fish that spit to get prey ( I our case bait) we took bets on which fish would get the food and for small fish it was amazing how large the bait that they "caught". We saw a wonderful crocodile and thought it rather special until we saw its roommate - it was humongous !There were tree frogs, lizards, gerbils, owls and many more.They have also added a conservation talk and area, alas the boys are far too young to understand, they just couldn't wait to see the next item.Well worth the money. Well worth seeing the excitement on their faces. Would go again without a doubt. Throughly enjoyed it. There is also a boat ride with a glass bottom, but again, boys didn't want to know.

A very enjoyable experience!. We were able to visit the aquarium for free as we had bought a 48 hour "Red Bus Trip" ticket and it was included in the price together with a few other Dubai experiences. We really enjoyed the time we spent here. To get up close to the fish as they swam over the glass pedestrian tunnel was amazing and it was incredible to see the shark's teeth so closely. Many of the other exhibits were so interesting ie the crocodile and the Penguins and we saw the octopus having her meal of prawns which was great! Altogether a very worthwhile visit.

Underwater Splendour. Had spare time at Dubai Mall so decided on a vip tour of aquarium and underwater zoo two and half later we emerged from the most comprehensive and wonderful display of marine life. We had our own guide who had plenty of knowledge.The single displays of sea creatures was very interesting like Water Rats,Otters and many other marine life that we would not normally see in the wild

Lots to see. As a resident in Dubai iv done this a number of times and would recommend doing the full package which gives you access to the aquarium, zoo and the glass bottom boat. This is a nice family attraction and will pass 3 to 4 hours. The glass buttom boat is on top of the aquarium and is not amazing but nice to do.

impressive. The acquarium is amazing in size but I have not been to the underground zoo. As it is in Dubai's biggest shopping Mall in fact the biggest Mall in the world and next to Burj Khalifa and soon the Opera House it is worth a visit as you can pack it all in together on the same day.

Great for the kids. Second time doing this. And just as good second time around. The tunnel is fantastic as my eldest really thought the Sharks were floating above his head! They now have a 5m salt water croc which is just massive when seen close up and truly impressive, as are the Penguins and the giant Pacific Octopus. Over all, a great experience but again, slightly hampered by Hello, this is an important message from Argos. Due to unforeseen circumstances we will not be able to deliver your order today. Your delivery will now take place on 08/05/2015 and you can track your parcel on the day at www.myyodel.co.uk. Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience caused over zealous official photographers everywhere
Unbelievable!. Beautiful aquarium and zoo, do the live feedings of birds, fish and croc, you will love it. The indoor zoo is amazing, never a dull moment.

Interesting if you have never seen an aquarium like this. We elected not to do more than view the aquarium from the Mall- rather than paying to walk through - or even get into the water and interact with the sea creatures. Whilst it was something to see on a hot day in Dubai- it is not the largest aquarium of this type- nor the only one you can do a walk- through so it wasn't particularly remarkable to us. Also, the entry fee (like everything in the Dubai Mall) was expensive. I am not a great fan of confining sea creatures in this way anyway ( I would rather go snorkelling and see them in their natural habitat)- so I was not inclined to financially support the attraction.

Inside a mall that is like an underwater city. If this scores at number 24 in the World aquariums then the other 23 must be really good. A lovely afternoon spent here after being of-loaded by Emirates (don't fly Emirates!!!!).

Three story Aquarium. If you can think it Dubai has it. The Dubai mall has many beautiful and fun things to see not just shop. The Dubai Aquarium is a must see. You can even pay to go scuba diving inside the tank. Where else can you do that ? The tank is huge about three stories, your paid ticket includes walking through the tunnel, going on top of the tank on a small boat with a clear bottom so you can see the sharks and other large fish. It also includes a walk through of other fish. Overall it was a great experience and when your done you can shop. Dubai is Amazing!

Excellent if you love fish. If you like feeding fish and watching them then this is totally for you! Make sure you do the boat trip and feed the fish because you get an up close experience with them that is worth it. The attraction isn't that big at all so it won't take you an hour to do the walking tour, boat trip and the walk through the small "zoo" that they have. Make sure you go during the day (2 PM they feed the sharks) and not at night because all the animals sleep at night.

The Paid For Part Was Distinctly Average. I would not recommend the Extras if you go to the Aquarium at the Dubai Mall, what you can see simply by standing behind the ropes in the Mall itself is pretty spectacular but the parts you pay extra for are distinctly average so save your money and in this case the best things are free!!

The Underwater World in a Desert City. The unique combination of Zoo inside a Aquarium. So big, so so many spices. Easy to keep you occupied for 2 hours. And need not to mention a paradise for Divers as well as non- divers.

Best View of Aquarium is from the Outside. This is my third trip to the aquarium, and I must say that you get the best view of the aquarium from the outside. You don't even need to pay to go inside unless you just want to. At arrival you walk through a very short tunnel (seen in profile photo). You get to see sharks swimming overhead. Once you exit the tunnel you have to leave the aquarium and take the escalator up to the next level where you can see a variety of fish, crocs, penguins, spiders, lizards, and crabs. After that you can stop in one of the gift shops to buy souvenirs. There are also opportunities to have professional photos taken (for purchase). The next time that I visit I'd like to try the glass bottom boat. Nice place to cool off with the kids when it's hot.

a great small attraction. I have been here a couple of times and there is much more to it than just the massive aquarium one can see from the mall. It is a walk through sea life tunnel which is teaming with life and a decent attraction in itself. Then travel on and up above the mall and see the full attraction. Giant crabs, Piranha and all sorts of interesting and well presented displays await you. Well worth the visit and not too expensive either.

fun day ïn. Great place to occupy the kids on a hot summer day, If you have the entertainment then its even better as both parent can go in in the price as one. not very big but it will keep them busy for an hour or so.

Cooling oasis of wonder !. Worth taking a break from the incredible shopping in the Dubai mall to experience the beautiful creatures of the deep.The underwater zoo is especially well done and is immaculately clean and well presented.
Truly amazing tour. it is just amazing how many different fish varieties and total number of marine life from around the world --
Great!. HUGE! There is so much to see at this place! It's well taken care of and has such a variety of fish, etc to see! Definitely recommend.

Misled on wheelchair accessibility. I am disappointed that when I originally checked with the aquarium (I went in person with my son who is wheelchair bound) to see how much of the exhibit is accessible. I was told that everything was accessible to someone in a wheelchair. When we arrived on 11JUL 2015 and tried to book the Adventure package (which would allow us to see the giant crocodile being fed) we were told that unless our son could walk down the stairs he wouldn't be able to go on that tour. I was miffed and when I explained that I had checked earlier about accessibility the staff member became argumentative and said that the whole exhibit is wheelchair accessible as long as he can walk down stairs! I tried to explain that stipulation negated the term fully accessible. To avoid further conflict we paid for the walk thru the aquarium and the tunnel. Not what we had prepared our son for and that was disappointing. and frustrating.

The world underwater................ To dive the Dubai Mall aquarium was an interesting experience to even seasoned divers. It will most certainly be an unforgettable experience to new or non-divers. The fact that you will be in a tank (albeit a giant one) full of many different species of sharks, can be a bit unnerving, if not crazy, for new divers. The common knowledge however, that sharks are typically shy creatures and tend to avoid human contact, should be of some comfort for the inexperienced. Nonetheless, the Shark Dive program at Dubai Mall is an exhilarating underwater adventure that you can experience in half-a-day, with complete safety and airconditioned comfort. The aquarium's visitor dive programs are managed by 'Al Boom Dive Center', which is well established and one of the oldest dive shops in Dubai. The aquarium offers dive experiences to both certified and non-divers. Al Boom Dive Center can be contacted by phone on +9714 342 2993 or email dives@thedubaiaquarium.com Certified divers must present their c-cards and make payment in advance to turn up for briefing at the Underwater Zoo (located directly above the Aquarium), whilst non-divers must visit the Al Boom Dive training center, located on Jumeriah Road (33rd St., Villa 254, corner Al Wasl Road, next door to the Iranian consulate and 500 meters away from the Iranian hospital) for the "Discover Scuba Diving Course" in the morning. This is an easy and very safe training session on Scuba basics in a swimming pool with full Scuba gear, followed by the Aquarium Dive (at the Mall) later in the day. Even children 10 years and older can participate. As I hadn't planned for this visit to Dubai to include diving, I didn't have my gear nor my c-card. Therefore I had to undergo the discover scuba program and train a bit in the pool at the dive shop training center in Jumeirah and drove to the mall (about 30 minutes away) afterwards for the briefing and dive. The Shark Dive briefing included key topics such as keeping your arms to yourself and not reaching out to the sharks etc; which took about 20 mintes. The use of personal underwater cameras are not allowed, but the souvenir pictures staff photographers stand outside of the aquarium to take your pictures, which you may choose to purchase when leaving. The dive itself was a fantastic experience with close encounters of some of the deadliest underwater predators, but the sharks always maintained distance and appeared accustomed to having divers in their space. The rays and groupers in the tank together with the numerous other fishes make for a dive experience that will be hard to forget. This is a must-do activity if you are in Dubai and like to indulge in exhilarating activities and especially if you are into water sports or diving. The cost may make a significant dent in your holiday budget, especially if you are a couple, but more than make-up with such a unique experience. I was told that it's also a favorite marriage proposal option for couples :).

So disappointed!. Today I was at the Dubai Aquarium and spontaneously wanted to go for a Shark dive. Of course the prices are shocking, but this was not the most embarrassing. I'm PADI AOWD and even EAX certified, last dive in May this year in Egypt, so just 6 weeks back. I use since 15 hours of dive a GoPro Hero HD, also for pool lessons, that I wanted to bring with me into the Aquarium. That was only possible, if I have the PADI photography speciality course, what nonsense. I tried my best to persuade, even had 10 hours of footage on my laptop to proof that I'm not a goofy, but had no chance to get in as wanted, unless they make a video of me. Naturally I prefer myself to film what I find nice. So I had to leave the place. This is by far the biggest single disappointing (PADI) dive moment in my life.

You can dive here too!. I loved this and I visit every time I'm in Dubai. The fish are awesome even though the big sharks look a tad tired or doped. I've dived with these fish and the experience is awesome. Where else are you guaranteed sharks only a few feet from your fingers? I dive the Red Sea weekly and this is the next best thing although the cold water can take your breath away.

Hard to believe!. Its somewhat hard to believe where the Underwater Aquarium is! I was in the Dubai Mall to purchase a hoody at GAP, and kept walking after my purchase and thought WOW IS THIS AWESOME once the Aquarium was viewed!!!! What a location to have an aquarium =D Money doesnt seem to be an object in Dubai or The UAE! There isn't much natural beauty, but more man made and paid for!

Sea meets Shoppers,. incredible experience: in an overwhelming mall, to find an surprising sea aquarium. Walking with sharks and many other fishes, with an opportunity to look behind the scenes! Excellent 'in between' for shopaholics, to touch base with nature.

deep. for children. cool. A little bit expensive, really i dont know if this is worth but the experience is fantastic, really i dont like to see fishs going and coming around but the children really loved it.
Great.... The place was both entertaining and educational...It's really worth a visit....The staffs were also nice!...
Amazing . What a amazing place I have been their few times and always love to see this attraction its massive and full of different sea animals my kids loves it too you can get very close to sharks

Good thing if you have spare time to kill. We had a couple hours to kill in the mall. Was an average price - although we have the entertainer where it's buy one get one free (well worth buying in Dubai). It is very basic, but also impressive as its in a mall. The photos they take are disgustingly expensive if you want to buy them.

Not worth the money. After cringing at the entrance cost 100DHS minimum each I was extremely disappointed with the aquarium. Yes some big sharks but otherwise Atlantis is better. However the underwater zoo had some interesting exhibits a 6m Australian crocodile next to a penguin exhibit. The Back of house tour was informative & with children it was worth paying the extra to feed the fish. Would I go again? Not unless it was free!
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. We did not actually pay to go in the aquarium but you can see it from inside the Mall and that alone is a great view.If you are in Dubai make sure you check it out.
Very nice. Nice aqaurium , you can also try for diving and can aslo take a boat ride inside, also has a little shop and situated in dubai Mall

Love the aquarium and the zoo is exciting for the little one but definitely for us big ones too.. I never go to Dubai Mall without stopping at the aquarium to see the rays, sharks and various species of fishes. It is free to view the aquarium from outside but if you want to go through the tunnel under the aquarium, you need to pay an entry fee which also includes entry to the zoo. I had always thought this would be a waste of money but was pleasantly surprised when we finally paid to see everything. While going through the tunnel, the views of the rays especially is great and we discovere a few more hidden away species and an eel. The zoo is quite big and houses all kinds of water creatures including king crabs (amazing), cute penguins and of course the croc family now including baby croc. We spent a good two hours at the zoo.There are also other activities available at an addition charge like scuba diving in the aquarium or a boat ride.

Worth if is for free. First of all: is an aquarium on a mall. You are just walking in there and you see sharks. I got it for free because I bought the hop in and off bus. If I had to pay it would disapointing and expensive. You can the see sharks very close and tons of fishes.

Great tour and great guide.. I paid 100 local to see the tunnel which was not so long and walked past it in less than 10 minutes. But was very nice and worth doing again. Then had a 30 minute guided tour of the background of how all things work and then walked past all the fishes, turtles etc... A very nice tour to do in the shopping mall.
Awesome place. what an unbelievable place. You can actually take a boat ride inside this aquarium, inside the shopping mall!!! Some great fish to look at as well.

If you have time to waste. The aquarium is nice but it is not a major thing, in my point of view (besides the fact that it is built inside of Dubai Mall). I mean if you saw other aquariums before I think you can live happily ever after without the one in Dubai. We visited it because we the screaming hot sun would't allow for outdoor activity so we had time to kill indoor. It is not cheap and the value of tickets is based on what kind of experiences you are looking for. You can go for a short boat experience or go in the submarine simulator and so on. For people with children it is a nice one because it is well designed and kinder friendly :) Otherwise, you can go and visit for the sake of King Croc that has 2,4 m in lenght. We actually liked him!

Too good not to miss. Its located in Dubai Mall & is a paradise for ocean creatures surrounded in their own habitat.. The entire area is huge with lots of attraction within the Aquarium, where one can swim with the sharks or be safe in a cage... Diving is allowed as well, but only accompanied with the experts. Besides the Aquarium, they have also quite a few exotic creatures on display within the complex.
malls become tourist attraction. Visiting the malls is highlight of visit to dubai, although dont expect cheap shopping - for that go to the souks - the malls is however spectacular and worth a vist.

World Biggest Aquarium in Dubai. i was just surprised to see such is big Aquarium, type of fish's were wonderful, environment of Aquarium. Also do not forget to see the top of Aquarium surrounding as they have designed night view, which really looks like skey & shining stars. Overall very nice place to visit to spend some time + more or less all type food is available within the mall.

The cheaper tour is sufficient.. We decided on the cheaper tour and thank goodness we didn't spend the extra. As with most popular tourist attractions there are photographer trying to get you to buy serially overpriced, tacky framed photos. Not necessary and they look so fake because they are! Taken in front of a green scree and superimposed onto a new back ground. Enough about that. Enjoy the tunnel and the insane amount of sharks and fish right up close. The rest of the aquarium is well kept and shows a big variety of species. Being an Aussie I didn't like the Crocodile enclosure, I prefer large animal in their natural habitat and they looked sad. The floor is just roughened concrete, plastic flowers and vines, not a single natural thing about it. Awful. I was surprised to watch the video about how these prehistoric creatures travelled to Dubai and again I felt for them. Anyway, if you can put your heart on hold for 5 minutes I guess it is the only way many people will ever see one...I am not a zoo person. Fish in tanks, thats ok, Crocs on concrete, not ok. Lots of people enjoying seeing them obviously. Overall, a great experience and worth a visit, especially in Summer as it is lovely and cool inside. An hour for a quick whip around or a few hours to study each tank. We did it in just under 2 hours. There is a cafe (closed during Ramadan) and bathrooms inside.

a break from shopping. My partner and i made this the first thing we wanted to do in Dubai. Sure we wanted to shop and experience the Dubai Mall but not all day. So we made a bee line to the Aquarium. The massive glass viewing area from outside is amazing enough. But once you have your ticket you can walk past all the shoppers with out anyone getting in your way. It kind of feels like you are a celebrity walking down the red carpet and everyone is standing back behind the ropes just for you to walk past. We did the all access pass which takes you behind the scenes as well. Great for kids as you get to feed the fish. Easy walking with some stairs for the behind the scenes bit. excellent value for money.

My nine years son. He was sooo impressed and you can imagine your self swimming among these tens of kinds of sea creatures its really amazing even my teenage son was astonished "thats rarely happens".It worth every Derham we paid i highly recommend it to be the first place to visit at Dubai Mall
One time experience. yeah, its nice to spend some evening but this is not necessaryly be the main tourist spot for any tourist,

Shark walk. My husband and son went for the shark dive. The experience was awesome. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. They take you through a safety video extensively explaining the do"s and don'ts. They provide all the gear and once you are ready they guide you into the water safely. All the time you are with a trained dive master who carefully monitors you. We opted for the underwater videos and photos and it was excellent. Value for your money experience.

Tropical fishes in giant tank. The extraordinary thing about this aquarium is it is inside a mall. They present you not with colorful reef fishes but rather the middle size fishes, such as the unicorn fish and puffers. They also got some other fishes schooling, yellow and blue. Though, if you have ever snorkel or dive in the real site, it's nothing. Nevertheless, it is a great place to see for the city dwellers.

A huge Aquarium right inside a MALL. Imagine shopping around and then tumbling upon a small shark or a big fish, ofcourse within confined glass walls. That is the kind of experience the Dubai Aquarium and underwater zoo offers.There are hundreds of aquatic fish and animals inside this aquarium and it is HUGE. The best part is that you don't have to go anywhere special for this as it is right inside the Dubai mall.
Nice But Expensive. Its a pleasant surprise to see the Aquarium in the malls . Its worth a visit but if it suits the budget needs.
A LOT of fish. Nice to see but a bit pricey,certainly take your own photo rather than buying the store photo of you at the end. That aside it is worth doing if you have children with you.
Amazing experience. Walk through a tunnel and you feel like walking on the bottom of the sea, surrounded my hundreds of different fishes and sharks. And don't forget to give a look at the penguins!

A must see if you have little ones.. My kids loved the Aquarium in the Dubai Mall. It was just an amazing experience to see an Aquarium of that nature in the mall and it had the worlds largest crocodile in it also. The Aquarium was astonishing.

amazing place, definately worth another visit!. I love all things animakls and this was amazing, I visited twice in one trip :)
I loved walking through and looking up at the animals above me, everythings always pristine in Dubai and u can tell the animals are very well looked after
xxx

Good diversion. Nice aquarium located in the Dubai Mall. There are a selection of experiences you can choose from, we did The Explorer which included walking through a tunnel under the main tank, a tour of the research centre and looking at the aquarium and zoo.The tunnel was good with plenty of sharks and rays etc, the tour I found a little boring. The zoo had penguins, beavers, water rats, crocodile and lizards. There was a good variety in the aquarium and the jelly fish were cool.A pretty good couple of hours diversion from the shops.
Stunning experience. It is a must if you visit Dubai. It's fun for everybody, children and adults. You can have a close look to sharks and other amazing variety of fish. Very interesting and fun!

An unexpected variety of animals and fun. I love animals and it was a very interesting experience. I went to a few of the talks and feedings which were educational and fun to watch (especially the penguin one as they all queued up). The tunnel was very good and clear to view plenty of animals. The underwater zoo was full of interesting species and two very large crocs. The aquarium is probably a place to spend less than 2 hours in. Some of the habitats of the animals can be seen as being a little small and plain but the aquarium seems to be clean and safe for the fish.

Research Experience. Bought the Aquarium tickets & didn't realise that the first part was a guided tour with explanations of the research the aquarium is doing with breeding sharks, seahorses & plankton. It was interesting then walking through the rest was worth the entrance fee especially being shown how Arrow Fish get their food. A really interesting experience.

Breathtaking. The scale of this aquarium is unbelievable. The glass tunnel is really cool providing plenty of photo opportunities. Great variety of fish to observe. The glass bottom boat ride is OK, but would recommend you try to time it with shark feeding otherwise it's a little lame. The zoo is really cool, plenty to view and learn. Overall a really enjoyable experience and highly recommended!

Fun. I give this an average merely because of the size. It is a beautiful tank with lots of animals and walking through it is nice but it is a little expensive and very small. The Underwater Zoo was nice as well. They have packages where you can take a tour on a boat or feed some of the fish and get a behind the scenes tour. A fun little trip, especially for little ones.

Aqua Experience. Worlds Largest indoor Aquarium with large assortment of sea life, you can even ride in a small submersible around the tank to enhance your total visit followed by shopping in one of the worlds largest malls.

It was okay!. At first, we got a tour around. That was so boring. I wanted to see the fishes. At the end, when we could go to the aquarium, that was amazing! I loved all the nice fishes, bevers, crocodiles, penguins, birds and so much more!
Great Aquarium inside a mall. one of a kind aquarium insie a shopping mall... so entertaining... great for the entire family... Kids will just go crazy about it...

Dubai Aquarium @ Dubai Mall. Very interesting place to see the underwater live. Kids would love this place. You can see the behind scens to keep a live the aquarium. If you pay the fee you can feed the fish. If you pay the premium fee you can even take a boat ride. Watch out with the photo scam. (at the entrace they take you a picture and at the exit they try to sell it as a souvenir very over priced). The ticket also give you access to the small Zoo next to the aquarium.

Well worth a visit.. Had a great visit with my mom. Having a wheelchair helped. We thoroughly enjoyed spending time marveling at these spectacular creatures! TIP:If you go early enough in the day by 11 AM to the Dubai mall info kiosks you can borrow a wheelchair (and strollers). You do have to leave some form of ID there which they will return when you bring the wheelchair back.
Aquarium dubai mall. Excellent,and so entertaining watching to real wildlife, like different spieces under water,and others animals like crocodiles.

a great experience - a must visit. visiting dubai aquarium and underwater zoo inside the Dubai mall was an unforgettable experience, from getting close to so many different species of fish to the information given out by the guide, as well the originality and upkeep of the facilities. Reasonably priced. The king croc is the best feature for sure.. what a beast! Keep it up!

The KING CROC, Sharks and 30000+ Species. One the most Beautiful place in Dubai, The Aquarium and the underwater Zoo is located inside the Largest Shopping mall in the world THE DUBAI MALL.. was very surprised to see so many Species including many sharks. and also got a beautiful underwater zoo with 30000+ Species which includes one of the Biggest Crocodile in the world (The KING CROC).

Go with a group or with children.. This is worth visiting but a little expensive. If you have a large group or children there are lots of things to do, but for a mature couple it is not so interesting. The rest of Dubai Mall is amazing, however.
must try. spent 1 hour visiting and with my wife and baby kid. He is only 17 months and will remember this visit as well as me.impressive and beautiful.

Good to visit if you have time and are interested in sea life!. Out of the world experience about the sea creatures. Amazing collection and good efforts in creating and sustaining it. Pictures will speak the words.

Super view. Hugo mas place with full of fishes and the view was really really amazing.. eye catching place inside the Dubai Mall ,. Must do activities.. awesome , under water zoo and Tunnel walk and glass boat ride etc.. ohhh simply super

Zoo and Aquarium in a MALL - ONLY IN DUBAI :)). We recently visited Dubai for a week long of 10yr Wedding Anniversary Celebrations. One of the major attractions was Visiting the Dubai Mall, which has SO MANY Wonderful shops, International Food Hall, Water Fountain, Gold Sooks, Ice-Skating Rink etc.... But the two fun things that are a MUST-DO are visiting King Croc and other small animals in the Zoo - yes that's right a ZOO in the MALL!! AND the Lovely Aquarium that also features in Dubai Mall. Loved it and Loved DUBAI :))

Interesting. I don't enjoy seing animals in cages. However, you can get a glimpse of complexity of life underwater which you are not always going to get if you are snorkeling or diving. A must see in Dubai and very much worth the price of 100 AED
Must visit. Amazing place if u love water animals. Just go and visit. U'll find penguins as crocs as well. overall Must See

Expensive. Well....it was expensive. That is probably like all of Dubai. Got to the Dubai Marina Mall and stand outside for five minutes and you will get 80% of the experience. Beautiful and grand nonetheless.
Nothing to see here!. Boring with little to see here. It is just a walk under the plastic dome and it was quite boring to say the least.

Beautiful but small. You enter the mall and are greeted by this massive tank. You go into the tunnel and immediately there are sharks with their teeth shining as they float above you.The prices for the souvenir photos are very over priced so take your own. We did the package that allowed us to do a glass bottom boat ride and the zoo. My son really enjoyed this and he got to feed some fish. We walked through the little zoo and saw some owls, piranhas, lizards and Nemo! The massive alligator was a good photo opp, and the otters do paintings you can purchase and we were told they know how to take selfies! The staff is very helpful and friendly and this was a great time for my animal loving son! It has a good set up and we would do it again. You can dive but that is NOT for me!!

Amazing creatures & fish species seen is the Dubai Mall Aquarium. An amazing variety of fish species, penguins, crocs, crabs, turtles etc. The aquarium boasts of the largest tank and the underwater zoo holds some amazing, uncommon species.

Fun thing to do in Dubai. The aquarium was really well presented, although it is only a 1 hour tour for the tunnel and main fish area. My toddler loved the tunnel and giant crocodile :) There is even a little touch pool. If you are a resident with kid, it is worthwhile buying an annual pass.
great place. what a fantastic attraction you can see the fish from all angles in the mall truly a great visit , but please beware of the photo guys they charge a fortune

Magic world. Nice place to spend some time in special when outside is so very very hot.
Lots of specimens to see for hours.

The biggest. The biggest aquarium I have ever seen. Each time I travel to Dubai I make it my mission to count the sharks. The turnel is a beauty. You cant believe the aquarium zoo. The different type of water animals. You can take the boat ride on the top of the aquarium. Loved it. My children thanked me for a long time.
Huge. Huge aquarium in Dubai Mall. Very interesting and fun. Nice for pictures, also very crowded during night.

Pleasantly surpised. I took some visitors with children to keep them occupied for an afternoon. I wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Although I'm not a fan of zoos the layout was good and there was interesting and informative information beside each exhibit. The kids enjoyed it.
Under Water in the Desert... Ocean in the desert. Very systematic. High Security and good administration. Variety inside. Especially the Giant Crocodile..Do not Miss.

a must see in Dubai. my wife and I were lucky to see the fish being fed at this spectactular aquarium in October 14 on a trip to the Dubia mall.It is a must do staying or just passing through.we spent about 3 hours on 2 floors just watching another world -- it kept my wife out of the shops.

Shark dive and croc visit. We really enjoyed the visit to the aquarium for my sons birthday. Having lived here for over 5 years you feel that you've seen it all, yet today we resisted the aquarium in order that all 3 kids could go into the aquarium and in the cage they snorkels and swam with the shark and fish. Certainly a bit different and they really enjoyed the experience. We also visited the zoo and crocodile, again, really good to see as well as the aquarium tunnel. If you are visiting Dubai, this really is a must do! If you haven't been for a while, pop along and definitely try on a wetsuit and get IN the aquarium.
beautiful. The Dubai aquarium is awesome. The zoo was delightful and had a nice collection of animals. Kids and adults would love it. It has sharks, need I say more??

Amazing. We had heard about the aquarium inside the Dubai Mall, but until you actually see it you cannot appreciate the size and quantity of water involved. Take a walk through the glass tunnel and get close to some impressive sharks and rays. Afterwards go up the escalator to an equally impressive zoo - a brilliant way to break up a days shopping in the Dubai Mall.

Amazing Tour. Enjoy a day of fun on your UAE holiday with a visit to the Dubai Aquarium.
