Marvel at the variety of underwater life as you walk along the Aquarium Tunnel and experience the facility’s ecological zones. Various add-on aquatic experiences give you the opportunity to get close-ups of many of these animals.Underwater tunnel under a huge shark & ray-filled tank, plus a creepy crawly zone with snakes.
Nice Attraction. A decent way to spend some time watching a few fishes, but one must take the boat ride as it offers a unique experience where in one can feed the fishes as well.
Mesmerizing!. The Dubai aquarium is an amazing insight into the underwater world! It's a must visit for all nature lovers! It's truly a unique experience walking under the sharks and rays!

Just for kids. I think it's better to watch it from outside then buying the tickets and go inside. U can see all the fish from outside also. It's just a small tunnel. The other paid options were stimulator ,it's nothing just a 5D movie for kids only. The glass boat was also basic, just a short ride to see the fish.

Pleasant surprise in the desert!. Breathtakingly beautiful and very impressive. Certainly not what one would expect in the middle of a mall. But with the Dubai mall being the largest in the world anything could be expected here!

good option inside Dubai Mall. the aquarium is nice, not as big as many outdoors aquariums but still a good way to see the underwater world of the Arabian sea. there are many sharks, some penguins and a gigantic crocodile.As the aquarium is inside the Dubai Mall, it gives you a good way to spend time during the pick hours of sunshine, so you can easily spend from 1 to 2 hours here.the prices are from AED 100 to almost 200 depending on what you chose to see, we got the 120 ticket with a short boat ride on top to the aquarium, that was very good as well.

Interesting. The aquarium is in the Dubai mall so you can't miss it ,it's amazing with all the fishes and sharks and stingrays. Could gaze all day but there are million other things to see ,love to spend the day just watching the fishes .

Great for sea lover. We visited in June. I did find it to be a bit over priced. But I have a 12 year old ocean fanatic and he ate up every bit of the offerings. While I found the glass bottom boat to be very boring, he loved it and would have stayed on it for hours. I thought the tour was a bit basic, but he was very into it and had good questions. He was fascinated by shark eggs on display, etc. The glass tunnel is great for viewing, though it made my husband motion sick. Our 16 year old liked the tunnel best. We spent 2 hours at the aquarium. Way more than enough time for 3 of us, but the 12 year old could have lasted the day. Take note: if you want to do the scuba experience, do not book Burj Khalifa the same day. You can't go up for 18 hours after. Big mistake on our part as the 12 year old is scuba certified and very much wanted to do this.

No match to Singapore Aquarium , Ok for a first timer to see an aquarium.. IT is an overambitious plan to have an aquarium in a mall. But it is ok. They have combo tickets which are better . but you will find at least one of the items in the combo useless, that is the hitch. Take time to choose the right ones. "Reasearch " is not interesting. Also 'simulator' and 'bottom view boating 'are not much to admire. But species in higher floor levels are good to watch. There are lot of fishes, reptiles different types of fishes they are interesting to see, at lower level, and through the tunnel like passage with overhead visible huge fishes are nice scenes but overall this open type aquarium part is smelly and cleanliness is lacking.Never think of buying the photos there costing 150+AED, they are a loot. It is unfortunate.Overall is is not bad.
Good. For people who have been to Singapore etc, its just ok. But for someone who is visiting an aquarium for the first time its a good experience.
Day out. It's nice not that big but worth the visit if you are willing to spend a day out in dubai mallGreat fun for the litte ones
dubai aquarium. It is fantastic aquarium we have ever seen. The glass tunnel is like that we are passing through the ocean and have a feel of the various kinds of water animals

Surprisingly great value for money!. As I was pregnant during my trip to Dubai, there were many activities that only my husband could take part in, so when we visited Dubai Mall I insisted on getting a ticket for this and not just looking at the giant tank from the outside. We purchased the standard ticket (called Explorer I think), which worked out to be £20 each and I was surprised by what great value this ended up being - especially for Dubai. The tunnel in the aquarium is fascinating - the rays and sharks are not shy and swim next to (if you're afraid of sharks then perhaps this isn't for you) and once you are through and you make your way to the 2nd floor they take you behind the scenes for a guided tour and tell you about their breeding programmes and how they care for the animals. After this your ticket then gives you access to the underwater zoo complete with penguins, reptiles and suspended walkways. We spent much longer there than I thought we would and it was so immersive that I forgot that we were still in the middle of a mall!

Expensive Tickets. This is located in the Dubai mall and it offers different entrance tickets in combo or single and the price is quite high. The underwater tunnel in the aquarium is disappointing as it is very short in compared to the price paid for it. The zoo is good and is worth going.

Excellent and in The Mall too !. When we first visited the Dubai Mall we couldn't quite believe the size of this Aquarium within a Mall. As we were short of time we planned a further visit. We were not disappointed. You walk through a tunnel and there are sharks, Rays and stingrays all swimming above your head. Got some fantastic pictures which you would never get in the sea. You then go upstairs and there are all sorts of tanks with different species of fish and a small zoo. My favourite was the Penguins. There is also a massive alligator in the zoo and I mean massive. Great place and value for money. Recommend especially if your a kid like me!

It's a big aquarium in a mall. After passing the aquarium on several occasions, we decided to visit this time.You can see the aquarium from the mall, no need to go inside. It is fairly expensive and you do not see a lot of extra inside. It is the underwater tunnel, a big croc and some small aquarium displays. The aquarium has been around for some time now so it is a bit dated compared to the new aquarium in Singapore.My son really enjoyed it though as kids enjoy animals and aquariums.

Great Aquarium, very crowded. The aquarium was really good, loved the layout and the selection of marine life they had. The only downside is that it was very overcrowded and they really should limit the number of people inside at once As the place is pretty small

A place to bring my little girl. We went to the Dubai Mall and decided to go to the aquarium. It is expensive to get in compared to prices back home but it was worth it. You have an option of different packages that you want to do. We did the package which included the simulator and glass bottom boat ride. The simulator I think was more for kids than adults so I prob wouldn't to that package again, also the glass bottom boat although it was good it just went round a short circuit which wasn't quite what I expected either so I prob would choose a different experience next time. The aquarium is set over a few different floors and has hundreds of thousands of fish and reptiles, insects etcYou could spend hours here and as far as I'm aware your not asked to leave so you literally could spend hours here. There is so much to see and the place is so well laid out and extremely well kept. I have been to aquariums before that seemed a bit passed their best and had a very fishy off smell but not here the standards were very high!!The only downside I would say if I had to was the price of the photos and photo gifts were a small fortune! It was approximately £28 for a photo, and £48 for your photo in a flask! Which is a shame, I would have bought some of the photos (as they are actually printed out for you to see) but there was no way I was going to pay that for a photo.
not bad for an aquarium in a mall. was good to see, they had some really big stingrays which was cool, the mall is great could easily get lost though

Not what you would expect in a shopping mall!. Decided to take a break from shopping and explore the aquarium .. good choice though slightly overpriced for the basics. First thoughts were i was unsure if it was just tunnel to walk through until you get inside and see the wide range of sea life, which makes it worthwhile.
Aquarium Tunnel - Dubai Mall. A must to visit when you come to Dubai. Enjoy the different kinds of Fish. Make sure you book a ticket and enter inside the tunnel.

not bad.!. paying for the ticket and going inside when u can actually see all the fish from outside. inside its only a tunnel in which you go through n see random fish. for the detailed tour you need to buy the expensive ticket and u get a personalised tour where a guide takes you in the zoo and tells you regarding the animals.

Nice to spend a couple hours. This aquarium has some pretty cool stuff to see but is fairly small overall. We loved the huge tank out in front where you could see rays, sharks, and tons of different fish. It was cool to go through the tunnel and the underwater zoo part. There were lots of interesting fish that I had never seen before and we enjoyed taking photos. They also had a section with night animals where we got to see an owl and glowing scorpions! We enjoyed the big croc feeding, too. I would allow at least two hours if you buy the cheapest ticket, because the girl who sold them to us said it would only take an hour to go through, so we didn't get to see everything because we already had a slot booked for the Burj Khalifa. If we had known it would take longer than an hour, we would've come back the next day. Overall it is a nice small aquarium, though I think it is a bit overpriced.

Underwater adventure. The underwater tube is nice, but its not until you walk inside to the small aquariums that gets you all excited, so many varieties of fish, otters, and other various animals.Great place for the family.

Overrated but may be worth a visit!. I saw some displays of the Dubai Aquarium at Dubai mall and thought to give it a try. They have several packages; all seemed overpriced. The basic one is about US$ 25, but doesn’t cover much. Main attraction is fish feeding, which costs additional dollars. Feeding the King Corc was interesting, which for me was the star of the show. Interesting collection of fish and marine water species. Bottom-line, if you have seen similar aquariums elsewhere, this is nothing special. However, worth a visit for first timers.
Nice family fun. Overall I believe this was a good value but it was smaller than expected and I would have liked a few more exhibits.

Worth a visit. 120 AED for a very entertaining 2 and a half hours. Easy to get to located inside dubai mall and very nice seeing all the different sharks and fish although if you wanted a quick visit you can view an area of the tank for free which is also very good
It was okay. I've seen many beautiful aquariums around the world and this one was nice but not outstanding. I wouldn't spend money on this attraction if I knew what to expect...
Nice. Nice experience for first timers... Not too big or elaborate. A drag if someone has seen this earlier in some other country. Personally think the Bangkok one is better.

Massive croc, some weird fish and all in all quite good. The underwater zoo is a mix of a lot of tanks each with some great stuff to see, including crazy looking American paddlefish, otters, jellyfish etc. penguin feeding was fun but the king croc stole the show, it is insanely massive! UAE night wildlife section was good too but tunnel is disappointing, you van see everything from the fire viewing bit so not worth going through.

Surprising. Wasn't too sure what to expect as this is based inside a shopping mall after all...but actually very pleasantly surprised. Lots to see and plenty of information on show to allow you to read and learn about what you are seeing. Genuinely a very good aquarium - and with a king Croc to see too!

Wait thats it? Oh ok much better. The tour starts with you walking through the aquarium tunnel....and then back into the mall. I was quiet concerned that my family had gotten totally riped off and then we went upstairs! The upstairs is another awesome area for fish viewing. I really loved that it was very kid friendly with all the tanks low down to the ground for my daughter to see into! They even had an area that was specifcally about the local animals to the UAE. HINT: If you don't care about a behind the scenes tour/fish feeding and just want the aquarium experience(cool for older kids but not much for younger ones) you can get cheaper tickets online. They dont offer the basic ticket at the counter

Marvel. Amazing place to keep you amazed. The Dubai mall is really blessed with this star attraction. Great collection of fishes, birds and even a giant crocodile!!! Not to be missed. the tunnel even-though bit short is spell bound. The zoo is just fantastic.
Enjoyed the experience. Had a good time with my family and it was a unique experience especially with the King Crocodile. It is an experience everyone should have once at least.

Incredible Experience. It was fantastic to dive with the sharks!We are divers AOW and the experience is unique.The Dive center Al Boom is very good, since de first contact I had with them I knew that we were going to picked them for our dives, professional and very clear with the information which is really important.

Fabulous and entertaining.. Entry to the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo was included in our bus ticket and we were not disappointed. There were additional activities available but unfortunately we weren't offered the opportunity to upgrade our basic tickets. Both attractions were really well set out and very informative, the film on how King Croc came to be in Dubai was brilliant, and we thoroughly enjoyed the tunnel. Both are well worth a visit.

Water Zoo. I guess this is biggest water zoo on the earth. You will be mesmerized from the moment you enter.The entrance is made of glass and beautiful water animals keep swimming very gracefully next to you .The kind of fish you see there are really unique and beautiful.Step inside the zoo and you get to see almost all the water animals from penguins to star fishes to jelly fishes.A must visit for the kids.For us it was like we are watching live discovery channel.It was super fun.Remember you have to walk a lot. Toilet facilities and photography facilities are available inside.The tour ends at the gift shop, where you get free gifts based on your ticket price.You can also buy gift from their if you wish to.P.S. - With an extra cost in your ticket you may also feed the fishes inside.
Very nice. Always a fun place to visit in Dubai, especially when you have kids below 10. The crocodile attraction is a cool addition.

Excellent Place to view Marine Life. Wonderful experience . Viewing the marine life away from sea.Main attraction was the Glass floor view of the crocodile . You can actually see the crocodile under your feet through a glass floor and sheer size of the croc makes the whole experience more thrilling. They have kept variety of marine life, ranging from small to medium sized sharks, sting ray and lots of other fish. It was really beautiful.

aquarium was a bit disappointing. the glass tunnel through the aquarium was a bit short, not even close to the Sentosa Underwater world in singapore. however, the underwater zoo was good. we were lucky to see the king croc (world's largest crocodile) move. go at 4 pm or 12 noon to see them getting fed

Fun to dive in. I went for a dive in the dubai mall aquarium a few months back and it was a very fun experience! The beauty about it is the proximity you get with all the fish in the aquarium and the diversity of fish available! I would recommend anyone to go for it!

Diverse range of creatures. This attraction has two parts – downstairs there is the big aquarium wall which you can see from the mall for free along with the tunnel which you pay for. This is where the sharks are. Then upstairs there is a much bigger exhibit which is really great. There is much more than fish and sea creatures. Other animals include owls, bats and crocodiles. One major disappointment was how the tour started. The first area was sort of a behind the scenes area where those doing the diving or the underwater boat did those activities. We had just paid the minimum – so didn’t have any ‘extras’. So this area for us was a bit of a waste and unfortunate introduction to the attraction.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. Located in Dubai Mall this aquarium is one of the favorite attractions for families visiting Dubai. We have visited multiple times. Walking through the tunnel, with sharks and ray's swimming over you is a wonderful experience and amazes the kids who feel immersed in this underwater world. The zoo that is located on the story above, has a wonderful variety of underwater life. Highlights for us are the unbelievably large king crocodile, the spider crabs, and the penguins. The aquarium also offers scuba diving classes and cage snorkling with sharks.

Excellent! Fun and Educational!. The "behind the scenes" tour, the crocodiles and the night creatures exhibit were the greatest. All in all the entire experience was quite enjoyable for my kids and me. We will return.

Mesmerising Dubai. it was a wonderful experience at the Dubai Aquarium and under water zoo. The glass floor crocodile view was an amazing experience. it had a lot of varieties of sea species and a very nice set up.

Expensive short walk in an aquarium. This aquarium is perhaps the most expensive aquarium I have ever been to in my life. The walk that you undertake is only about 25 metres. There are numerous types of fish to be seen which, as must people do, are watched from outside the aquarium. There are more people looking at it from the outside than people who go in. It would appear to me that the plants in the aquarium are made of plastic or some other material and are not real. Save your money and just view it from outside.

We worth to see once. A big aquarium with bunch of sharks and various other seaworld creatures!It is definitely worth seeing once if you are in Dubai, but there's nothing extraordinary about this place, except the size!

It is nice and greate. I think it would better if entrance fee would be lower. but I enjoyed from this Aquarium. I think It would better if this place would not exist in the middle of a huge shopping mall.

Aquarium inside the Mall. you have to see this when you are in DXB it is easy to find as it is inside the Dubai Mall. even the kids at heart will definitely enjoy here. the underwater tunnel was not too long but still you will enjoy seeing the creatures there. second floor is for the forest animals and lots of fishes. you must go here.

Average and expensive. Me and my Son purchased a combined aquarium/simulator/boat trip ticket and it was fairly interesting but we went on to stay at Atlantis a few days later and visited their aquarium which was free (to hotel guests) and far, far superior in my opinion.The staff were also a bit gloomy and didn't seem to enjoy being there at all.

Wow. The best a aquarium anywhere.. Amazing. 65000 fish. Full of sharks and Rays.We are going diving in the aquarium for £180 each. Massive aquarium. £10 each to go into museum. Expensive but good. If you have a suite in the hotel it's free. Better than the deep. So much to look at.

Much bigger than expected. Thought we should try this as we live close and it was too hot to do anything outside and it was a pleasant surprise. Didn't expect there to be so much to do and see within it, the penguins were a welcome surprise. Haven't been since King Croc but will be going back to see him and his family! Good value for money and something different to do.

Very vast variety of sea world and Majestic Crocodile. If you wanna see anything close to a real present day dinosaur, then visit the aquarium and see the King Croc. It will so near resemble the huge dinosaurs that might have roamed the planet earth in far distant past.Also, the jelly fishes, giant crabs, beetles, scorpions, bats, chameleons and obviously the vast variety of fishes will keep you and your kids engaged for a long time.

aquarium visit. Visited here June 2014 thoroughly enjoyed seeing the small and large fish. The biggest attraction at the time was to see the largest alligator. This was a good experience, but felt sorry for seeing such a large animal in an enclosed environment. The zoo was enjoyable too. Highly recommended

A lovely and novel experience.. Must do.. Great Experience. Squeeze this in with Burj Khalifa without fail. Especially enjoyable if with better half or children..Obviously. Is split in two parts.The tunnel is the entrance to this activity aand is what is known as the Aquarium. The Zoo is also great but atleast do teh Aquarium if the budget does not allow for both. Spend a lot of time in the tunnel/aquarium, as it is the better part of the two steps. Walk back and forth to your hearts content, as you can't come back once you are out.

A good way to kill sometime. Definitely this is not the best aquarium. Having seen the ones in Hong kong, Singapore, Kuwait, this rates low. Best thing about this is the accessibility. Located conveniently inside the Dubai Mall. The other thing is the Glass Bottom Boat. It is definitely worth the extra bucks. If time permits (restricted timings), definitely try the Shark Feeding. Ticketing is fast and convenient, no reservations needed. Otherwise it is very small and they tried covering animals across the world zones. (which was not needed I feel). The videos/movies which show are just crap. The walks are long across diff floors, which is very irritating.
under dubai mall it's grate place to visit. best place for kids tourists it's grate place and if any one been at Dubai need to be there ones . it's quite expensive but not bad .

Beautiful. There was everything you could possibly imagine from an aquarium but also a boat ride with the sharks, which cost some extra. There are many other aquariums around the world and this didn't differ from them.
A Faire. We took the full package and it's worth it.The richesness of the aquarium, cleanness and organization are quiet impressive.You can spend a good 3 hours.

Its ok. Well it was ok, nothing wow about the same. As and when you walk into the aquarium, it start to end in few steps. Then you have the Underwater zoo, good exhibits but nothing wow. Its nice the way they have planned it, maintained it. 5 stars for the maintenance.

It was decent ,kids liked it!. Price starts from a good 100 AED pp and you can pay extra for inclusions like boat ride with the sharks, diving with the sharks etc. However, having been to the London aquarium and Hongkong aquarium, this felt less impressive and smaller. Dubai Aquarium has more than 33,000 living animals, representing more than 85 species including over 400 sharks and rays combined. Every hour experienced Educators conduct regular presentations with Otters, Water Rats, Piranhas and Penguins.You can spend unlimited amount of time admiring the underwater zoo and fishes, sharks, penguins, king crocodile etc. We finished visiting the entire aquarium in about 1.5 hours

Nothing exceptional. It is a nice place to visit, however if you have been to Singapore and seen the same or to Australia, Melbourne, it is all the same.
Nothing very different, except that it is in the middle of DUBAI MALL, which is the only rare thing about it.

A huge aquarium, right in middle of the Dubai Mall. A free visual treat of huge aquarium, right in middle of Dubai Mall (ground floor of Burj khalifa), when you pass by.Entrance tickets are available at spot or online booking.There are 2 levels to see, one on ground floor and the other on top / 2nd floor.Ground floor has Glass tunnel to see all big & small fish passing by.The 2nd floor has various (interesting) types of Fish in small aquariums, like piranha, spit fish, etc. Attraction is "King Crocodile", world's largest crocodile. 2nd floor is slightly cramped, but don't forget its in "Dubai Mall", so every square foot counts. Good day

Huge aquarium. It's a huge aquarium in the middle of Dubai mall (an expensive luxury mall in Dubai). Many exotic fishes (including a few sharks) are swimming in the aquarium and they look beautiful.You can get inside and watch the fishes closely for a fee, or watch the aquarium from a 2-3 meter distance for free.

ok as an add on. This was a bit of a let down. It came as part of a day ticket booked to Atlantis. Glad we did not make a special trip as it was rather disappointing. if you are really into fish I guess its fine but if you want to see strange and wonderful things and get a little excited then this does not hit the spot. Bored by the end and glad to get out of there.

Fun for kids!. We had fun. Took the researchers pack and it was nice. Very informative. Kids loved it. Fish feeding was not so exciting because they give you the dry food the fish are not excited about...but when the guide throws in fish parts...boy, they fight for it in a spectacular way :)

Not just ab Aquarium, but a scuba diving centre too. If you thinking that this is just an ordinary aquarium with fishes in glass tanks then you are wrong. Yes they have a glass tank, but its way bigger than you can imagine. They don't cage different fish in different tanks. Instead they have all of them together in one tank and you can go snorkeling and scuba diving in it too.

Aquarium in the mall..... only in Dubai. We actually only saw this aquarium from the interior of the Dubai Mall. Surprisingly, a large section of aquatic life can be seen without actually entering the aquarium. We were able to see a few divers feeding & checking on some of the fish. The crowds that gather can be rather large but its pretty easy to navigate your way to the front to take pictures.
Unique perspectives. It is a wonderful place to observe various water animals, recommend that you take the tours of the facility to see the work they do behind the display

Great view of underwater life. There is a "tunnel" where you can look up at stingrays, sharks and other fish. Then on one floor up is the underwater zoo, which includes a huge crocodile and his female mate, originally from Cairns, Australia. Children would especially love the little swing bridges above the underwater zoo.

Worth a visit just for the crocodile. We bought the explorer pass.Which includes the underwater tunnel.. Boat ride... Simulator and aquarium.The simulator was a bit of a waste of time!We had the boat ride included over the top of the aquarium... The life jackets are so big you can hardly move to turn round to see the fish! We fed the fish as we were moving round which is worth doing to get them all to come to the topIn the actual zoo the crocodile enclosure is definitely worth seeing... They are huge!!Two massive crocs.I think we paid around 120 per person for entry for all of the above!

Cool but overpriced . Visited the Dubai Aquarium during my time in Dubai and I would personally say that it is a waste of money, maybe for 2 people it would be worth a go however going with a family of 4+ it is very expensive.

Shopping with sharks. I've met a few shopkeeper sharks in my time - but these are the real thing. Stroll through the Dubai Mall and there they are - sliding through reefs and rays and eyeing the designer shops. The aquarium sits centre stage in the world's biggest shopping mall and, if, like me, you like a bargain then keep your admission money in your pocket and watch through the glass walls for free.

Nice place for a 10 minutes visit. Nice place; looks much better from outside, when you see the big screen of aquarium.While you pay and go inside, the tunnel is normal but underwater zoo isn't worth the time.
Great underwater experience.... Great underwater experience in Dubai Mall.... U can have thousands of fish in the aquarium... shud go for it..

Worth the Money!. This was my second visit to Dubai Aquarium. I must say the collection is now vastly superior to when I first visited in 2012. The latest addition, the crocs, were awesome. I feel sorry for the croc for just sitting around there the whole day, but that thing is huge!
Unique. This is the biggest Aquarium one can see in the world, its dimensions will amaze you, located inside the Dubai Mall, main attraction and a must visit when in Dubai. beautiful fishes inside.

worth a visit. We visited the Dubai Mall which had an aquarium and underwater zoo, which was interesting, walking around with a dome above your head with sharks swimming above, really good if you have children. lots of lovely coloured fish.

Badly managed Great Place. Yousif, my 11-year old son, is a Down Syndrome child. We were told at the ticket counter that he was given a special discount. So instead of paying AED 120, we only paid AED 50. I was grateful and impressed by the treatment. Well, that did not last long. Some guy calling himself the manager insisted that Yousif would not be allowed to go on the boat ride because we did not pay for him in full. I tried to explain and he would not listen until one of his colleagues explained to him. There was no way we would leave Yousif alone which meant I or my wife to have to forego the boat ride which we had paid for. Then he asked for a UAE-issued special needs card. That is when his colleague interfered. Even then, the so called manager told us that we should be thankful as he had decided to let us go. The irony of the matter is that the boat ride was no more than a waist of time along with the preceding simulator or Explorer ride. We saw nothing more than the boat attendant throwing some food and some fishes racing to get it. The place was dark, humid and smelly to say the least.The better part was walking through the "Underwater Zoo" where we saw beautiful variety of fishes, underwater creatures and other animals (birds, snakes and lizards). The mismanagement manifests itself here too. We did not know where we were going; left or right, up or down! It is really confusing.Finally to go through the very short aquarium tunnel, we had to go out, take the escalator two levels down and find our way through the crowds to the entry area.
Smaller than expected but pleasing. a bit smaller but very good experience. People with kids should take them along as kids gonna love it. Lots of colorful fish. Also the king croc.

Unexpectedly pleasing. Surprisingly good, well set up and crazy that it's in a shopping centre. Apparently it has over 20,000 fish in the aquarium with a number of other exhibits housing everything from camel spiders to crocodiles. Okay to do if you have a decent amount of time in Dubai but I wouldn't recommend it...

Smaller than expected, but good way to spend a couple of hours. We visited with 2 adults and 2 kids to spend a few hours out of the hotel. The place was smaller than expected, but quite impressive all the same. Basic entry for kids is about 55 AED pp £10/€14/$15, (70 for adults), but doesn't cover the 'zoo' part such as feeding the crocodiles or bird feeding. The whole package is 200, although I'd suggest the explorers package at 120 AED is the best value. As its in the Dubai mall it's easy to get to, plus you have plenty of places to eat if you wanted to make a day of it.
Overrated! . Very expensive and small for the amount of money payed. It's more than enough just taking a few pictures from outside. I wouldn't recommend it.
Nice aquarium. Very nice place, very good position in the middle of the big mall, and the animals are beautiful, the service and the personal very nice.
Enjoy seeing amazing world . One of the best attractive place in Dubai especially for family Kids will like it Little bit expensive however it is amazing

Average . Visited this place during Dubai trip and it's located in Dubai mall. I paid 110 dhs per person and overall it was okay experience since it a small place and will hardly take 1 to 2 hours to cover and their aquarium is so small which end in 2 mins and u can even see it from Dubai mall without entering. So all I all its upto person to decide to spend that much for it or not
good to try. One of the affordable places to try swim with dolphins and pic and video at price of 600 aed is cheap in UAE
Kids and animal lovers will love this place. A must visit place in dubai. Here you can see all kinds of aqualife right at the center of a Desert.

Recommended for families with kids, not so much for adults. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is an attraction most appealing to families with kids. I dont recommend it for adults that much. If you have kids it is a different story becasue there are activities and things that children would find fun and exciting!Even though Aquarium Tunnel is beautiful, it only takes 15 seconds long to walk it from beggining to end. I am not sure its worth the $35 usd fee.

A Great Way To Spend A Few Hours. I'm not really one for this kind of thing normally but we had a few hours to kill at Dubai Mall so thought why not.First of all, if you want to pay for your ticket by card, do not join the queue, just ask a member of staff stood inside the cordoned off area and the will sell you tickets and allow you to jump the queue!The tunnel is an amazing experience but quite short. I wish we had spent a bit more time in it.The underway zoo has something for everybody, from desert insects to a huge King Crocodile. We were lucky enough to arrive at the crocodile enclosure at feeding time, it is a very impressive site!I'm glad we went!
The boat ride is super. Worth taking the kids .sharks, penguins and a crocodile too. The icing on the cake was the boat ride in a glass bottomed boat,,,,innovative. Worth a visit once

Well worth a visit. I have been to the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo several times now due to length of time I have lived in Dubai. Each and every time I have loved to go. Under the entertainer voucher book the buy one get one free entry applies to the ticket to aquarium and zoo only. None of other extras are included. I'm sure some of the extras are worth looking into if you are so inclined. I would not personally recommend the glass bottom boat tour, majority of fish are at bottom of aquarium so you don't really see very much. The 'glass' is also quite badly scratched from all previous occupants. The aquarium itself is an engineering masterpiece. Unbelievably huge with a tunnel so you can pass through the bottom central part of the tank. My one and only complaint about the aquarium is that it can be very hard to take great photos. The aquarium is very well illuminated, the mall corridor area around the tank is not, then the shop signage etc is well illuminated, this causes massive reflections on the outside of the aquarium which are difficult to avoid. Same applies in the tunnel, but instead of it being a reflection it's the actual store/signage you can see. After completing the aquarium you proceed up to the 2nd level of the mall where underwater zoo is located. This is great fun and has everything from fish, otters, beavers, creepy crawlies and as of recently a huge crocodile and even more recently some baby crocs! The new crocodile enclosure is great, depending where they are you can get a superb view of them from lower and upper levels. Aquarium and Underwater Zoo are both fully accessible by pram and wheelchair (excluding the adventure rope bridges) so is open to visits by all.
Expected much more. After visiting aquariums in Bangkok Singapore and Kuala Lumpur ...this seems very average.Not many varieties and a very small aquarium .

Huge Aquarium and Zoo !!. Worlds largest Mall - Dubai Mall, within the same Worlds Largest aquarium and a Zoo !!! Yes all these in a mall, this defines the mega-structures in this cosmopolitan city. The aquarium also has diving facilities and one could see sharks and manta rays all around.
Amazing. one very big aquarium!!!!!!!! loads of sealife to see, then experience the tunnel and underwater zoo before finishing with the glass bottomed boat ride kids will love it
Boat tour was unnecessary. In general, it was a nice experience, I really enjoyed the exhibition area. I think the boat tour was unsatisfactory. I really enjoyed the rope passages.
Brilliant . Kids loved it, was Free for us as Residents of Hotel, couldn't ask for much more, best aquarium ever visited, look forward to going again this year

See all the fishes you want without having to get wet. As an avid diver, I was interested to see what this aquarium had to offer - I'm not usually one for aquariums and zoos, but this one is fantastic. You get to see loads for free by walking past as a shopper, but pay the 100 Dirhams for the "Explorer" package which gives you access to the tunnel, surrounded by loads of sharks, and then you get to go upstairs to see what happens behind-the-scenes as well. All very educational and well presented, once you learn to see past all the fake coral!

Ocean on ground. A huge aquarium and ample collection of fish species. It's a awesome experience in underwater zoo. The fish collection is highly appreciable. Specifically Hamoor fish. Again a very big Glass facade. It must be aprox. 100 'X 40'. The glass joints are totally invisible. Very very very good. Must visit.

Check the website for lower prices. Cheapest adult ticket price on display at the counter is 120 aed. The website shows 70 aed for the tunnel and underwater zoo which are essentially the best bits. Either book online to get the lower price or mention it at the desk and you can buy it there.

Better than expected. This aquarium and underwater zoo are awesome. They even have a glass bottom boat that you can ride on top of the aquarium tank. The species at the underwater zoo were very unique and the Giant Croc is a must see! Loved it!!

far too expensive for a tour which takes about 45 mins.. essentially you walk through a tunnel which is a large water tank takes about 10 mins max. you then walk upstairs to level 2 and walk around the underwater zoo, which take abotu 30 mins max. you can get these tickets as part of the 48 hour hop on hop off bus, so it was free, but i would have been really annoyed if i had to may 70AED each for a family of five. doesnt make sense.
Sealife. All you need to do in Dubai at the aquarium feed the animals And see the birth af various Sealife animals

Buy the whole package and enjoy it all!. It was a great experience with the family with lot of things to see and capture with my camera. You wont believe the different types and varieties of animals there in a not so big space. It was well organized, staff were very professional and are fully confident and aware of what they are doing.Take the whole package to enjoy it all! I would go back and do it again

Sweet Escape. Celebrated my bday here for a change. Refreshing to the eyes, you will fall inlove with different underwater species that u didnt expect it is existing. First floor was the underwater tunnel then 2nd floor was more species. This is place not just for kids, but for kids at heart also. Aquarium inside a mall. Your dubai trip was not complete without going here.

Definitely worth a visit. Really enjoyed looking around the aquarium and underwater zoo. We bought researcher tickets which meant we went to see the crocodile and sea horse nursery, too. Really enjoyed looking around, all the enclosures were clean and a good size. This would be a great place to take children, too. The only creature we were a bit concerned for was the barn owl as it didn't have the largest enclosure, however all the other animals seemed very well provided for. Immaculate conditions!

Amazing Underwater Sight.. This is a must see when in Dubai. The display is so amazing and the live fish on display are of so many varieties, that it is is a unique collection of fish we have only heard about, never seen
As big an aquarium as the apartment building I reside in.... Beautifully presented aquarium, if not the world's biggest thenClose. Wonder who cleans the glass inside ?

Worthwhile visit. Enjoyed the Dubai Aquarium which has a tranquil setting and offers a good variety of marine creatures to see. We were lucky to be there when the crocodiles were fed along with the sea lions.Worth a visit. Entry fee is nominal and they provide you with a memorable family portrait to purchase if you are interested.Munir Daya
Not as huge as it looks. From the out side the aquarium seems massive but the part you actually walk through isn't that big, but it still is a sight worth seeing !

An Abundance of Amazement!!!. What an amazing experience ! Conveniently located in the Dubai mall as you enter the from the main entrance of the mall. Lot of choices when you buy your tickets, feeding the fish, general entry, submarine ride etc.Each option has its own charm and wonder. We had a 3 year old also so couldn't do the submarine ride. But he did feed the Sharks , up close and personal.There is so much good information given by your guide specially when you go to feed the fish. I just remember one part , the aquarium has 10 million liters of sea water!You need a good 90 minutes or so to really explore the place.Do buy the tickets online , they're much cheaper.A must visit when in Dubai. Enjoy!
Worth to visit.. Huge crocodile in the zoo! It is a pleasant brake from shopping in the mall. Many species of fish and other small animals. Worth to visit.

Worth a visit . We'd seen this from the outside a number of times but never paid to go in - until now.Whilst you can see all the fish from the outside, walking through the tunnel, getting up close and personal was a great experience, if somewhat short.Afterwards you go up the escalators to the zoo area - lots more fish plus bats, a spider, a beetle, turtles, frogs, penguins and of course the 2 crocodiles including King Croc. Very overpriced for what it is but glad we've been.Oh and watch out for the photo sellers. We refused their original price which was a ridiculous £60 after which they kept bringing the price down - we still refused.

Enjoyable few hours. We took the "researchers" package which was $30AD each. We saw the aquarium and the behind the scenes running which was interesting.Then the underwater zoo which was well done and nice. Very easy to get around and the children enjoyed it.
Lovely to see. Great to see the aquarium with a good mixture of different fish It's in the mall so makes it even more special It's well worth seeing and some great photo opportunities

SUCH A RIP OFF!!!. This was the by far the worst place on my trip and before going, one of the things I was looking forward to the most!!! I am a huge animal person as its my profession. I looked at trip advisor and the reviews were up and down, most said dont spend the money and just look at the giant tank from the mall side and I definitely have to agree!!! I went online and purchased the "gold" package which included what was claimed as a behind the scenes tour and fish feeding for 80AED. If you're in Dubai with very small children and need something to appease them ehhhh I still might rethink going. For the ridicculous price Its quite craptacular. The initial tunnel through the main tank doesnt even really allow you to see the large tank, not to mention the glare is horrendous. There are very few signs describing the fish or their environments. You can blow through this money trap in 30min which was too long for me and again zoo animals are my profession. The tanks for the fish suffice for the most part but when you get to the larger animals everything looks like they got lazy and built an enclosure to throw animals in. Nothing about the entire building was educational so dont think your child will take much away besides saying they saw some fish and animals. The king croc is supposed to be a highlight and while he is huge seeing him up close the video of this salt water crocodile being caught in Australia with its dramatic , music and narration had me disturbed at the fact they took him from the wild to be displayed on the third floor of a building in a thrown together enclosure. The part that had me FURIOUS I paid for the "gold package" and it turns into a hassle. I ask the employees at different checkpoints they have, where do we go for the behind the scenes and feeding and im told oh thats not on your ticket YET it clearly shows the price on my receipt was for that cost. I move forward to another checkpoint where everyone is handed food for feeding except me and when I say we didnt recieve a cup im told I dont have that package. YET AGAIN I pull out my receipt and she tells me it doesnt say gold package on there yet the cost is the exact price of two people for that package so I then had to pull up my email. All this for the crappiest tour ever. I completely wasted my money for literally 8 minutes of being taken to the back to see the filtration system and quarantine tank. What about the fish feeding u ask, we dumped out the food cups into the large tank and that was it, so let me take that back the tour was 6 minutes. It was such a rip off we thought they were joking when they said it was over. Please dont waste your money watch the large tank from the outside and move on with your trip.

VERY ENJOYFUL...!!!. Very wonderful place.. That underwater zoo place is suitable for couples and families. I never see like that underwater zoo and aqurium befor that.. And also never foget that experiance...Thanks...

The best of Dubai mall. The aquarium is one of the best attractions at Dubai mall. You can spend time staring at the underwater life for free or pay for a ticket to go through the tunnel & see the other exhibits including a crocodile!

Waste of time. View the aquarium form the mall. Don't oay to get in, it's a waste of time and money. Unless u wanted to scuba dive. The view from the mall is the only nice thing. There's nothing inside. Just a few small aquariums and 1 crocodile that doesn't move

Nice aquarium. I visited the aquarium in Oct 2014. The aquarium is decent. However, I am writing my review based on the scuba diving we did in the aquarium. The instructor was excellent. He documented our whole dive (photo and video) via a GoPro camera. We swam with a variety of sharks and fishes. It was definitely a great experience!

Amazing experience: Dubai Underwater Aquarium. Had a nice view of the Underwater Aquarium from Dubai Mall, before buying the ticket. It was simply Superb.....We bought the ticket and entered the underwater aquarium. Luckily it was not that crowded at that time. It was an amazing experience.We went to the Underwater Zoo. Saw the amazing king Croc. It was feeding time for the King Croc. Lazy King Croc was not ready to have food. We waited till King Corc had its lunch :) Nice. You are allowed to touch the Jelly Fish (sample Jelly fish is kept for us to touch). Penguin section was good.We did a boating at the top floor. The guide was good. He gave us some technical details about the Underwater Aquarium. The boating was Good.

Aquarium and Zoo in a Mall !!!. The variety of fish and other animals and the sheer size of some of them are incredible. The children enjoyed it a lot and also took amazing pictures. The tunnel too is a nice idea.
Aquarium in a Mall. Great aquarium with a walk through tunnel. Viewable from the mall at no charge, but worth the tour. The aquarium is so large there is a glass bottom bout tour on the top.
A bit disappointed.. Expensive for something that you can see for free while walking around the mall. The glass tunnel is very short. Wouldn't recommend it.

Amazing. This is a fabulous Aquarium inside a Mall it is fascinating and there are so many fish to see that it is mesmerising,there is a tour that you take to see the behind the scenes and you can feed the fish and go in a cage and swim with the fish ,there is a baby crocodile born three weeks ago and it is separated from its parents who are huge I have never seen such enormous crocodiles,it was a great experience.

Not the best aquarium. The aquarium looks impressive suspended in the Mall but I was disappointed at the experience. I guess it is a good escape from the heat if you have children with you but I rate it as average, I have seen better. To get the most out of it you probably need to take advantage of booking a dive with the sharks. Someone told me Atlantis would have been a better choice.

Great attraction. It is super impressive from the mall side and just as fabulous inside. We actually really liked the night animals enclosure and giant croc. We took our 8 year old who could have stayed for hours. A good choice now the weather is getting hot.

nice to visit. nice place to visit in Dubai mall need at a least 2 hours have no wheelchair facility, i have to get t form costumer service of the mall and the staff are not very cooperative , i think they need more taring how to cooperate with busy working hours and high number of costumers. the aquarium is very nice number and variety was great , have great collection , very clean .highly recommended to visit in Dubai mall

Children will love it. I was interested from just walking past so we went in. Fish are spectacular however the more I looked the more I became slightly distressed about the size of the aquarium they were in and how many there were in the tanks.The animals in the zoo looked also to be too small for either the size of the animal or the amount in there.The children seemed to love it lAlot of school trips there when we went.The simulator submersable was a bit of a let down and the glass bottom boat was also over too quick.This is great for educating children on fish and related water Animals however I still think it appeared cramped.

Disappointing. My husband and I stopped into the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo on a recent trip to the Dubai Mall. We used our combo entertainer voucher and also purchased a ticket for a ride on the glass bottom boat. The Aquarium was so busy it was uncomfortable to walk through and there were lots of rude and aggressive people pushing and shoving their way through the tunnel. This continued up to the underwater zoo especially at King Croc... people were just pushing in front of us, standing on our feet etc. We were told to be at the boat for 12.10 for the glass bottom boat ride. We arrived at this time only to wait for 10 minutes without any information from any of the staff as to what was happening. The staff seemed to be in bad moods and some were openly shouting at each other. There were lots of bored customers waiting around who were complaining that they had been there for ages. It would have been nice to be told that they show was running 20 minutes late before-hand so that we could have done something else with our time. The boat trip itself was not what we expected. As we waited to be taken on the boat, we were handed threadbare life jackets that smelled a bit funny to wear while we sat and waited for another 10 minutes in a different section. The continual bleeping of the underwater music was starting to wear a bit thin by this point. Also the AC was either not working or not good as it was very warm. We were led down to the boat and met our tour guide. She was friendly and gave us some information on the aquarium. I was surprised to see that we were pulled along by a bit of string, it looked very cheap. There were many boats on the water at the same time. The boat was full and there were children running over the glass so we didn't actually get to see very much anyway. We won't be back.
Beautiful !. This is well worth a visit, we loved seeing all of the underwater creatures and the tunnel is impressive!

Amazing!. It is amazing what the people in Dubai are capable of doing. Bringing all of these animals together in mall is spectacular. it is 100 AED for admission but the experience is worth it. Take pictures with the King Croc!

Amazing Experience!. An aquarium in a shopping mall? Only in Dubai! one of the nicest and coolest aquariums. tour guide helps you understand aquatic animals. wonderful experience and definitely worth it. photos can be pretty expensive, but you can always bargain with them.
Fabulous. A must visit with family and a great exposure for children to observe marine life.The guided tour is very informative and amazing the research being done to preserve the eco-system.

Awesome!. As always everything is done to excess and huge! A terrific site and visit. Very memorable. The variety of fish and the sheer size of some of them are incredible when you think its an 'aquarium' Also you'll be amazed by the variety anf vividness of the colours.

Amazing!. As you enter the Dubai Mall you come across this huge high water tank, filled with sharks, sting rays, wrasse and huge coral. You can pay extra and walk through the aquarium tunnel and get up close and personal to the fish. Great fun!!!
love the Aquarium. My children who love animals, didn't want to leave the Dubai Aquarium. it was one of the most beautiful places.
Dubai aquarium. we went to dubai mall to watch aquarium. Dubai mall it self is a huge one. aquarium is too good. they have many kinds of fishes and peguine also.

wonderful feeling. It makes you feel that you swim with sharks and other sea creatures
very amazing for family
it realy worth it

Great place to be with Family. Wonderful experience, specially for children. Beware of the photo professionals at the entrance since that cost is not included in your aquarium tickets. So if you don't want a photo, tell them so.

WoW !!. Just felt wonderful afer seeing so many species if fish under one roof. one should visit and dont miss this
Specially seeing sharks from so close gives goosebumps .
Loved it

Great experience!. Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo is a great place to visit with faamily. They recently got crocodiles and you can see also newborn ones. They are so cuuuuute. Do not forget to pass by nighl-life animals sector. It is bit dark area, but good enough to observe species

Dubai best attraction !!!. Totally blown away by the sharks, manta ray and more. My friends is right to drop by and watch the amount of fish you can see. Really good for kids learn the life underwater. If your lucky you can scuba dive and feed the sharks.

Thoroughly enjoyable. Having just a 1-day stop-over in Dubai, we were determined to get to see the Aussie crocodile which they have in the Aquarium/Zoo.Just getting out of the blistering heat into the Dubai Mall was a pleasure in itself and we spent a bit of time window shopping before making our way to the ticket office.Fortunately, there was no queue and we soon had our tickets. (if you do not want to pay for the complete experience, it is possible to watch many of the fish from the Mall itself).Ticket options are a bit confusing but we went for the Researcher option which cost 100 AED.This ticket took us into the aquarium proper on the ground floor where we enjoyed the vast array of fish to be seen, including the very large rays and sharks. These swim next to you on either side as well as over your head as you walk through the tunnel.We were there at feeding time and got a really good view of the whole process.When leaving this section you return to the Mall going to a higher level where you enter into the 'behind the scenes' area.Here, there is a guide who explains all the work going into the research and protection of the various species. Without going into a lot of detail, I found it very interesting as, I am sure, will most visitors.Up another level takes to you to the 'Zoo' with its variety of mammal, bird and aquatic life, with some magnificent specimens on display.It was here that we found King Croc and his much smaller 'wife'. It is worth the entrance fee just to see this magnificent creature and to know that he was spared from being turned into handbags by the Australians.All in all, we must have spent close to 4 hours in this attraction without getting the slightest bit bored.If you are in Dubai and have not visited the aqurium yet, go , spend the money and have a thoroughly enjoyable couple of hours.I would have rated the attraction 5 out of 5 but I do not believe that the enclosure for the crocodiles, and to a lesser extent, the fish, are large enough for them. Having said that, they have a very successful breeding programme (we even saw shark eggs in various stages of development) which seems to imply that the captive creatures are happy in their current environment as, otherwise, they would not breed.
Very nice. Very nice please and very interesting we enjoyed every minutes. You have to visit this places, !!!!!!
Really interesting. Take a glass bottom boat ride and see the amazing aquarium and fantastic collection of sharks, rays and assorted fish. If your lucky you might even see the fish feeding.

aquarium in a mall!!!. Located in Downtown Dubai Mall...I guess this would be by far the largest aquarium inside a shopping mall!!! They give scuba diving lessons!!! King Croc is like a Dinosaur!!! Kids would love it!!!

it's a must. this place is a mush when you crash to Dubai for even one night, it's so great you're gonna want to re-visit Dubai over and over. there's this boat tour on top of the Aquarium and if you're a fan of diving, you're gonna love it a lot. you get to swim with the sharks and it is worth it. I'm surely gonna re-visit it again asap. highly recommend it.
Easy afternoon. Ideal activity when the sun is too hot my sons (12 and 11) really enjoyed the aquarium as well as the glass bottom boat you feel up close and personal with the fish

Excellent aquarium for adults and kids. This is a wonderful aquarium inside the mall. There is a range of visit options at different prices and kids are well catered for. They have a huge croc and lots of tanks with many different species. Worth a visit and spend 1 hour or so here.
Great! . Amazing one of a kind aquarium! Tours are expensive however still worth going and as its in dubai mall you can think of plenty to do before or after.

Experience underwater life at your hand. Another must see attraction in my opinion. It’s a breathtaking experience from the first step I could say; because the first thing to do is passing through a tunnel inside a huge aquarium where hundreds of fishes are swimming. I felt magical being able to see the sharks or catfish swimming next to me. It gives you the impression you’re walking on the bottom of the ocean. Both younger and older will enjoy this special journey into the underwater life.Congratulations to Discovery and Dubai Aquarium for such a splendid place they’ve created.

Gigantic aquarium . The aquarium is gigantic in size - 2 floors high. If you wish to see it from inside it costs 100 dhirams per person, which I wouldn't recommend. If you can instead visit The Lost Chambers aquarium in Atlantis The Palm, avoid Dubai aquarium.

Interesting place. This place is very interesting and educational. You can use an Entertainer voucher. Make sure to calculate your time carefully as you may have to wait long queues on the way in and you may loose track of time when you get inside, so keep that in mind if you have a plan after that attraction or running on a schedule.

Amazing to see this in a shopping mall. From start to finish the experience was amazing, stunning, and really interesting. Thefish, sharks etc are cared for really well, the set up works like clock work and it is crazy walking through the tunnel with Sharks and sting rays swimming over head.A must visit whilst at the dubai mall.
Cheap fun. We thought the aquarium was a great place to visit with a 2 year old boy. Coming from Western Australia with an aquarium of the same par we thought this one is very accessible and cheaper.
educational and entertaining. So many varieties of species to see, needs about 4-5 hours to see all... Worth the money spent and good for a family with kids.. Easy access (inside Dubai Mall)...
Truely amazing. Beautiful aquarium . Well worth a look. Part of it is free in Dubai mall. Two stories high! Amazing and fun.

Decent. Only in Dubai would you find an aquarium in a shopping mall. Was a good experience to walk through the tunnel but you can see everything from the outside without paying. It's abit expensive for what you get but if you are on holiday, it's definitely something good to say you have done.
Enthralling!. A must visit! This was a fantastic experience! Amazing variety of fishes and sea-life! Trully enjoyed it!

Beautiful. It was really nice experience. Water tunnel is beautiful. Other parts of Aquarium with different kinds of sea creatures are also nice. I saw some kinds of fishes for the first time. I also cuddled sea cucumber and touch sea star here. Aquarium has it's own souvenir shop. Don't miss it if you're in Dubai.
Had Fun. This was such a fun thing to do. it was definitely a fun experience. If you ever in Dubai Mall go and check it out
Just do it ! It is in the Dubai Mall !. Easy to do, not really expensive, A nice break during a shopping craze. It is not really so exciting but it is convenient so why not doing it!
Fantastic. I truly enjoyed this! Take the glass bottom boat! It was a great view to look at the tank below you and the great species of sea life.

Great fun at a great price!. We had Entertainer vouchers which bought the cost of this trip down considerably, two entrees between three people, made it about £6 each for the underwater zoo and aquarium. The only thing that I would say lets this place down is that not all of the animals/exhibits have facts next to them so you're not always sure what you're looking it if it's not so obvious! We also felt that the two massive crocodiles were in a very small space given their size (although I don't claim to be a crocodile expert!) The penguin feeding was the highlight for me!! The tunnel is also great fun coming so close to a shark!! The children, (and adults!) will love it! - It's also a great way to escape the scorching heat in the afternoon!
Strange but true!. Easy visit to this aquarium in a shopping mall. Children really enjoyed the experience, it was entertaining and different.

Wow. Ok, so I am a big animal lover and recently watched in horror the documentary about Killer Whales at Seaworld, a place I will never go to. It does concern me that the fabulous creatures in the aquarium aren't swimming around in the oceans in freedom, but what you are told when you visit, is that many of the marine mammals in the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo would otherwise risk being poached, and many risk extinction. The Sheik of Dubai is known for his love and respect for animals and one of his intentions was to ensure the attractions at Dubai did not jeopardise any animal or mammals like at the US parks. He (and the Jumeriah Group) have invested in years of research with experts in marine welfare to ensure what is being offered here actually offers a sanctuary to some of these creatures. What you see therefore in the Aquarium are some of the World's most remarkable and endangered species.Now, when the adverts say come to our Aquarium and Underwater Zoo, and experience the wonders they are not over-estimating..... this set up is incredible. The Zoo and Aquarium is huge and awesome thus comes the expression again "Only In Dubai"! NO expense has been spared here, and the sheer size of this structure is frightening! Not cheap but again, what is in Dubai. What I would say is read all about it online before you visit, because there is so much to see, and experience, and there are special experiences you won't necessarily know about until you get there and you may need to make allowances for in clothing etc, that you'd do best to look first and not be disappointed. So, it does get very busy in season (May through August and December through January) so you will need to pre-book and get there early.
Gud.... Its gud bt could be better... Various types of fish can b seen. Bt the whole torn is if just 1/2 hour..

Great Experience of world biggest water tank. one of the world’s biggest water tanks is here. It is about 3 storied and includes water zoo. There are 3 types of entry tickets depending upon the activity that you select. But you must visit this. There is tunnel in which you will find all sorts of fish moving by your side and over head. With good description about various species available there.There is glass bottom boat ride, which is quite enjoyable. About 20 minutes boating, you can see fish under your feet from the bottom.On 2nd floor there is under water zoo where you will find again variety of fish along with biggest crocodile.

A Positive Surprise. An aquarium in a shopping mall? Well it works. Wife shopped, husband and daughter went to the aquarium. Lots of variety of fishes. Some huge crocs (which I thought were fake - until they moved). We also took the back room tour - they show you the inner workings of the aquarium (animal hospital, filtration area, new hatchling area, and food preparation area).

Expensive and not worth entering. It's impressive to see the aquarium but it's expensive to enter (and definitely not free what people suggest). You can see the aquarium enough from Dubai Mall itself and that's nice enough.

Underwhelming. It's an impressive sight from the outside - the huge wall of blue with many fish of shapes and sizes - in the middle of a mall in the desert! But, paying to go in falls a bit flat. It's not bad, it just isn't as great as you hope it might be. It might just be me, but seeing enormous Saltwater crocodiles, sweet penguins and even river Otters inside a facility like this is a bit sad. Not to say the animals are mistreated or distressed in any way, I just don't feel comfortable seeing them in such a place. It's a novelty, but one I can do without visiting again.

That croc is big!. Having an aquarium in the middle of a mall is probably only something you'd find in Dubai. Nevertheless, it was a nice break form the endless shopping at the Dubai Mall.There are a few unique attractions here including the underwater tunnel and that HUGE crocodile. Check the feeding times before hand as this is really a sight to behold.The rest of the exhibits are interesting but nothing really out of the ordinary. Good visit for the kids.

Very poor place to Visit.. very poor place to visit and very high ticket to visit this place. this is totally vest of money. staff are very unprofessional and try to sell you very inferior quality items at a very high price.

Amazing. Amazing to find this attraction in a mall but it is and we'll worth a visit, you can walk underneath and see all manner of marine life swimming around you. We took a trip on a glass bottom boat and you can swim in the aquarium too, we chose not too though.

Dubai Aquarium Visit. Dubai Aquarium is a must see when you're in Dubai. It costs AED 100 per person, which includes a tour of the back operations & aquarium zoo. If you want to go on the boat ride, add another AED 20 etc. Dubai Aquarium has a wide selection of tropical fishes & fresh water fishes. Our 2 year old totally enjoyed himself seeing all the fishes. It may be a little pricey if there are many of you but Dubai Aquarium is 1 of a kind & not to be missed! Two thumbs up.

Dubai Aquarium and Underwater ZOO from EmiratesYOO.com at AE65. It is really one of the largest in the world, bigger than S.E.A Aquarium located in Sentosa, Singapore. This world class aquarium boasts more than 33,000 marine animals -sting rays , sharks etc. It is a pleasure to see the fishes swimming around in the suspended water. The AED65 ticket bought online gave me the access to the underwater zoo and tunnel.

A good place to enjoy. Its the aquarium one of its kind. You can dive into the aquarium with the diving suit provided at a cost. You can have the real feel of the underwater world with all kind of fish including shark. It will be a new experience altogether. Go and see for yourself and ENJOY
Fantastic Place to Visit. A nice place to view different underwater animals. Underwater tunnel is designed exceptionally well to see them very close.
VERY NICE. The "Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo allows you to have a close look at many different sea creatures from very close.Children particularly willl enjoy this outing.Don't miss it!

Satisfied 60% only. I visited couple of aquariums in Asia and to be honest Dubai Aquarium is the most costly Aquarium I ever been to.They did try to make the environment right to its purpose but it should provide more underwater experience.One more thing , what the hell wrong with those photographer staff ,, $42 for one picture,,, No thanks, I got my mobile camera.

Lots to see close up. The underwater tunnel is designed beautifully and can get to see the creatures up close. Quite a huge one considering it is in thr middle of a mall. The boat ride did not have much to offer though.

Aquarium is grateness. I had heard about this in the middle of a mall. Had to see it. To my amazement it was huge. Several stories high with a massive viewing windows. Plenty of fish and scenery in the tank. After standing in awe for an hour or more i sat in an eatery opposite the aquarium and watched some more. A must is to do the tour... Fantastic. Overall a great experience. Never to forget...

place for a change. For people against locking animals up for human beings´s entertainment. Needless to mention about visiting a place like this.For an animal lover who doesn´t think much about locking animals up....It is a good breath of fresh air to see the animals living in their (man-made) habitats in this busy city with trafficking crowds in the mall all the time.I wouldn´t say it is particularly impressive as I have visited many Zoo/Aquariums in the world in my life. But I do have to say once in a while it is something enjoyable.You pay the ticket and you get to see the huge tank that you can see just by walking inside the mall, but most importantly there are other interesting animals living behind the whole venue, it is a whole other world.Only visit when you are sick of the malls all the time.

Great family fun. Our children enjoyed the experience, so did we. It feels like you're taken to another world. From desert creatures to penguins, huge variety of fish and marine life. Would recommend it to everyone.

Nice Experience for the Kids. This is not a whole day outing. Maybe 2 or 3 hours. Enjoy the tunnel area because personally, I felt that was the best part. We rushed through it because I expected more inside. We fed the fish as well... The main thing here is to remember that you are actually in a MALL and able to do such activities but if you have been to other aquariums that are outdoors and expecting the same or similar experience then you will be disappointed.

Good to Experience Only if you have not seen such things Before. I would suggest you go to the Atlantis Aquarium and Lost Chamber rather than visiting this place as it is average and nothing stand out like other places to visit in the city and the mall.

Best I have seen. I have been to a few Aquarium in my life, and whilst they have been ok they are not something I am over enamored with. However this one is perhaps something special, in the middle of the Dubai Mall, the Tanks are three stories high and there is also an under water walkway. The underwater Zoo had some exceptional exhibits and the huge salt water crocs were impressive. Best £11 spent and we were there for over 2 hours which is pretty amazing in its self. Worth the visit if you get the chance.

Very cute. Located in Dubai Mall. The aquarium is a little larger than the Sydney Aquarium and the Dubai has 2 giant crocodiles. We did the package that included the zoo and boat ride. The zoo was pretty cool. The boat ride was alright, it was a clear bottom paddle boat that runs on top of the aquarium/ shark tank.
Amazing experience!. A beautiful and HUGE aquarium inside the Dubai Mall! Like everything in Dubai: Spectacular! Definitely if you can, don't miss the chance to go!
Amazing sea life 👍. Lovely place to visit with children. Specially under water tunnel is amazing. You will see king croc , penguin and amazing fishes on level 2 . Absolutely lovely.
Good aquarium, first I've seen inside a mall.. If you have kids that enjoy aquariums then you must take them here. As an adult, most aquariums seems the same. You've seen once, you've seen them all.

Over-rated and over-priced!. Visited this place during a visit to Dubai mall and I have to say i regret every penny. The main tank is exposed to the mall so I thought for 110 AED I would experience something different. The glass boat is so lame and smells really bad that I had to splash perfume straight to my nose. Take some pictures from outside and save your money.
The most amazing coloring of underwater life. Don't forget you camera! This is an experience of a life time and a great opportunity to see things close up.
Nice Aquarium!. This is located at the center of the Dubai Mall. Nice place to visit with children.Has various kinds of aqua life.

Brakes up walking around the Mall nicely...... Soooo where can you go in the world and walk around a shopping mall and stumble across an Aquarium & Underwater Zoo! for around £20 you can go through a tunnel which overhead has all kinds of sea life ranging from shark to Dory from finding nemo LOL. once through the tunnel it's broken up a bit as you have to go up the escalator to the next floor where you are taken on a short boat ride above where you were looking in the tunnel strapped in a life jacket you sit in the glass bottom boat and watch sea life drift by, see the staff feed the fish or you can do scuba dive and view from a cage. once you have completed that there is the Zoo also very cool very geared towards kids. educational and worth a look, for most people it would be about an hour or two but I think my sister and I went around quite quickly doh!, you can then go back to your shopping experience...
Good Learning Experience. We went to show his to our kids and they learned a lot about sea life. worth seeing at least once. They can also improve/add more attractions to it.
Amazing experience. An incredible experience in the centre of this huge mall. A trip on a boat, an underwater tunnel and the zoo with huge crocs. A must for anyone visiting.

Impressive display of aqualife . My cousin and I were shopping in the Dubai Mall and came across the giant aquarium. The aquarium has all kinds of aqualife including sharks and sting rays which is very impressive! We then decided that we wanted to see more so we bought tickets for the underwater zoo. We could walk into a tunnel under the aquarium where we had sharks swimming overhead which was incredible! Then we continued the adventure upstairs at the zoo. the rest of the tour takes place 2 floors up from the aquarium. The zoo was decorated like a jungle with trees, vines and rope bridges too! We saw more aqualife, lizards, otters, owls, snakes and spiders. The big surprise was the giant crocodile aptly named 'King Croc '. There are plenty of viewing areas around him so you can take lots of photographs. It's a really fun experience and it's right in the middle of one of the biggest shopping malls in the world. I would highly recommend it. There are different packages that offer more to do but we chose the basic package which cost 80dhs per person which is great value for money.

Taking my little boy to the Aquarium. The Dubai Aquarium is a testament to Dubai and its list of biggest longest tallest superlatives. The ability to collect these large fish and reptiles and house them in the mega mall is truly impressive and an experience not to be missed. The only negative is that the place is very busy with trail of people and you feel the need to hurry on rather than take your time. If you do take the time and observe for longer than fleeting seconds the power and the grace of the oceans becomes apparent. As a Scuba diver who has been to the Barrier reef and other exotic locations you do not see this number of large fish in one location. So I loved the visit not my first and not my last and highly recommend as a break from retail therapy and perhaps an inspiration to go see these beasts in real life
a nice trip. a huge tank that you'll love it .do not miss the KING CROC .lovely for childrenFees starts from 80 Dhm / 90 / 225

Amaaaaazing . It was an amazing experience..Both the aquarium and the water zoo been fantastic..Lots of water animals and under water lifes to explore..Education and fund at the same time. .Located in the heart of the biggest shopping mall in the world...Huge glass to view thousands of different kindes of fishes and sea lifes living together.. so Amaaaaazing...The glass tunnel gives you the chance to look at the sea lifes from different angle. . Really superb A must seen in Dubai

King Croc is the new attraction. The tunnel is great as young children can get close to the fish. There are many different species of fish to be seen.The underwater zoo has fish,penguins and of course the new king and queen crocs. A good place for children for an hour or so

Avergae Aquarium, Excellent Zoo.. We travelled with our 3 year old son and I was surprised to find the entry price was the same for him. We chose the package for AED110 ($US30, 28 Euros) each which gave us a walk through the tunnel, a ride on the glass bottom boat, and entry to the underwater zoo. The tunnel walk through was average (you could see just as well from the outside which is free), the boat was very good, but the underwater zoo was excellent. There was a great collection of animals here, mostly aquatic, and also a section of nocturnal desert animals. It also houses one of the world’s largest captive crocodiles, known as the King Croc, who was moved here from Queensland after menacing the locals. We ended up spending the vast majority of the time at the zoo part and I would rate that alone at 5 stars. Still, a pretty nice (if not cheap) way to spend a couple of hours.

King Croc...you have to see it to believe it!. Recently went to the Dubai Mall underwater zoo, this is directly across from The Cheesecake Factory. After cancelling another trip we had time to do this attraction. If you are unsure just go! It's not badly priced and you can spend a couple of hours in there. Once you see the huge tank with King Croc words in an aquarium this is the start. Once paid you get to walk through a large tunnel where you can see many types of fish and sharks. You can get brilliant photos if you have a little patience. Before you enter they want you to pose for a photo with a blue screen behind you where they superimpose the tunnel behind you. Don't worry you do not have to buy. After you have done the tunnel they show you the photos and slightly worry that you paid ticket price for just that! But don't worry you need to go up the escalators that are directly opposite and then either enter another part. Here you seen many variety of tanks with many types of fish, Turtles, penguins, crabs and etc.That is when you come across King Croc and his girlfriend. You can not get over how large he is!!!
