No matter how many times you take a photo it doesn't do his any justice. Go up the stairs and watch the video on why he is in the zoo. He explains why he had to be moved. Then on the second floor there is bats and creepy crawlys which are very interesting. Me and my husband throughly enjoyed it and would recommend anyone to go.

Simply Beautiful!. Our entrance fee to the Dubai Aquarium was included with our Hop On and Hop Off Bus Tour ticket. It was everything you wanted an aquarium to be and more. The diversity was more than expected and was pleasantly surprised! Very enjoyable and highly recommend it!

Nothing special. I think this atraction is not worth of its price. It's only short tunel and zoo is quite small too. Maybe for people with children could be interesting. You can see almost the same if you stand outside the Aquarium.

Great way to end a few hours!. Visited the aquarium on our recent trip to the mall.Started off in the tunnel, saw all types of fish inc sharks.Moved on to the underwater zoo, was only ourselves and one other couple as we visited around 11pm on Sat evening so we had a super view of all the beautiful tanks and had a very informative talk with the keeper who looked after King Croc.Highlight of the visit was a glass bottomed boat trip across the aquarium.highly recommend this attraction.

for what it is..... a very good aquarium!. I was not expecting very much but was very surprised! Seeing the big aquarium was very good, but definitely you must see the exhibits upstairs where they have smaller tanks and very interesting exhibits! Very well done!

Nice- only if you really love fish. Let me get to the point here. The minimum cost here is AED 80, which includes a visit to the indoor zoo.The fishes are awesome and it's just amazing watching them. But one can also see them from the outside (ground and first floor). I really loved the Zoo more and the experience of feeding the fish and the glass bottom boat ride (this is not included in the minimum ticket cost of AED 80)

Aquarium at the Dubai Mall. As beautiful as the fish are, it felt like there are too many for the size of the tank. Of coure, I believe it's time we stopped moving animals to an enclosure for a human's moment of pleasure but that's another story. When it's to save a species, that's different - if their natural habitant is replicated. . . not the case here and some large species, like manta rays, are enclosed. Just not my 'cup of tea'. I didnt last an hour viewing this, maybe 10 minutes. Same with the Lost Chambres at Atlantis Hotel, although it appears a larger space.

World's biggest aquarium. Visiting the Dubai Mall you can see the biggest aquarium in the world. There are represented a lot of fishes coming from various seas. If you have enough time you can walk in the tunnel under the aquarium.
Very nice. Very nice and amuzing, we went into the tunnel and to the boat tour and the zoo, all are amazing and specially the zoo

Amazing and extremely inexpensive!. Best place to take your guest and family , and enjoy some shopping afterwards!
The sharks are not gigantic, right now thay also have a massive croc! you won't belive it's size!
Check it out!

Convenient. The Aquarium is conveniently located inside of the Dubai Mall (which has tons of stores and other attractions). We had entrance tickets as part of our hop on hop off bus tours (it was included) which was a good deal. The Aquarium is a good spot for families.
You will be Amazedddd. Must watch place..its amazing how a mini ocean can be set up in a mall. from tiny fishes to king sharks n king crocs...A must watch for one and all

Awesome experience.. A must visit for it surely is one of its kind in the world. Not from its inmates point of view as much but from its setup. In a small area and set up vertically the zoo and the aquarium is a marvel in itself.

The aquarium is a sight!. The best mall experience with kids. Both my kids aged 2-4 were awestruck by the aquarium. Though the tunnel is short compared to say that in Singapore, but whole experience itself is amazing. The Zoo is pretty nice.. must do with kids under 5.

BEST AQUARIUM EVER - A MUST SEE. It is a beautiful aquarium even though it is not that big.
It is like you are walking through the fishes.
The best that i have visited.

large fishtank. a bit pricey but well worth going to see, the aquarium and the zoodisliked the extra boat ride on top of the aquarium withn the glass bottom boat, you could see more when viewing from the sides, when the attendant threw in the fish food fish came to the top of the water in a feeding frenzy, but always threw the food behind the boat yhis part of the tour you had to pay extra for

Hiding in plain sight. My wife and I have walked past the Dubai Aquarium too many times for us to have not paid it a visit. We finally took the plunge as were happily surprised. Hiding behind the big aquarium out front is two additional floors of exhibits and tanks housing exotic marine life. We purchased the "Ulitmate" package and enjoyed the glass bottom boat ride much more than we initially expected. The aquarium is reasonably priced, and in my opinion one the mall's best attractions!

A MUST SEE attraction!. The aquarium itself is amazing and outstanding attraction that takes a few hours to wach. The best part of it is that it is in the mall and it gives you nice and relaxing time to do something else than shopping. Really worth seeing not only the aquarium, but the whole zoo!

Not Too Big, But of a Good Quality. The Dubai Aquarium is a strange attraction. It is not very big, and you can easily see the whole thing in less than 2 hours. What you will see, however, are excellent animal settings with a good range of species. It is rather expensive for what you get, but so is just about everything in Dubai. If you are at all interested in marine animals, the Dubai Aquarium is probably worth your time. The aquarium consists of two main areas - an aquarium tunnel and an underwater zoo. These occupy different floors of the mall, with the tunnel downstairs and the underwater zoo upstairs. The tunnel tank can be seen from the mall, so you can get a good feel for whether or not the fish interest you. There is a large viewing area at the main entrance to the aquarium. It will likely be populated with lots of people, but it is roped off so that you cannot get too close without buying a ticket. If you would like a closer view without purchasing a ticket, head up to level one (up the escalator) and you will find a row of windows across from some restaurants at the rear of the tank. These will likely be empty and you can get up close for a good view of the upper reaches of the tank.If the views of the tank from the outside are not enough, you can buy a ticket to enter the tunnel and the underwater zoo upstairs. The tunnel is nice on the inside and offers great views of the fish. There are several large sharks that hang out in the entrance and exit to the tunnel. You won't be able to see these from the outside, so this may be reason enough to purchase an entry. The underwater zoo is nicely arranged and includes a variety of aquatic species. There were a few highlights to the collection. These included the otters, who were busy guarding a baby. This was also my first encounter with archer fish. The aquarium staff have set up hanging targets above the tank. A staff member places food on the target and you can watch as the fish spray water at the target to cause the food to drop. The fish are surprisingly accurate and it is great fun to watch them in action. There is a catwalk above these tanks as well, so you can also get a nice view from above. The final attraction that surprised us was the saltwater crocodile known as "King Croc." This crocodile is every bit as large as advertised. We even got to watch a feeding of the crocodile, and it was truly impressive to see it leap from the water to grab the food and fall with a massive splash.If you have lots of expendable cash, there is no shortage of ways to spend it on additional options. There are several different photo opportunities provided by the staff and you can purchase these at the end of your stay. There are also several combo tickets offering different services. The cheapest entry is the tunnel/ underwater zoo combo ticket for 70 AED per adult (55 AED per child). From here, the ticket options scale up, some including a glass boat ride, behind the scenes tours, or even scuba diving in the main tank. My wife and I only opted for the most basic entry ticket and we were satisfied by what the aquarium had to offer.

Amazing underwater zoo. This place was amazing especially its inside the mall, so its very handy, the fees can be a bit pricey, as you can see almost everything from outside, free of charge, we chose the platinum? Where you can get the boat ride too? The boat ride was a nice experience where you can get up close and personal with the sharks and stingray. If you love sea creatures then you will enjoy this. If you are a bit skint, just enjoy the outside view.

Wow! Sharks overhead. Huge aquarium in the Dubai shopping mall. You can gaze in awe for free at the outside of the main tank which is fab, or pay to walk through the tunnel that goes through it and then visit the underwater zoo. I definitely recommend the latter. They have a large number of sharks, stingrays and other fish of many shapes and sizes which swim over your head. The "zoo" is so interesting, with a plethora of fish, amphibians, otters and the star "King Croc" - an 800kg male crocodile imported from Australia. It's a great afternoon out, well laid out, informative and fascinating.
impressive and rich. The aquarium is very large and contains a lot of interesting fishes from all sizes. But it is very crowded.

Too much hype. There is too much hype for this venue. This is small venue with big queues. You can go one time but you are unable to go due to time constraints, you are not going to miss anything magical. Low as per dubai standards

Excellent educational place for kids. It was a wonderful experience. Not only the kids but we grown ups enjoyed and learned about the water creatures. My kids were really facinated by the water world and the under water zoo. We plan to visit again soon.

Interesting place for all ages. The place is interesting, well maintened with helpful personnel. The kids of all ages will enjoy this journey, but also interesting for adults. The boat trip is very short, as expeted, but pleasant. We liked the most the penguins and the crocodile.

Love the location. Found this a very interesting place but the better pictures/views are actually from the Mall. I did find that the admission price is slightly overpriced but overall it is not to be missed and makes a change from shopping/
wounder full. should visit. really was interesting. i was with my wife. she liked it very mush, also amazing things.

Great for family. I did enjoy my visit to this wonderful aquarium and underwater zoo. I felt like a child seeing all the underwater creatures and admiring the nature! By the way, do not spend your money on boat trip though. It was just a 10-minute tour on a boat on top of the aquarium inside the building. No fun at all.

good. I really liked the Aqurium which is based in the Dubai Mall although a bit on the pricy side for a family. You can also see the many fish in the Aquarium free of charge by going to the balconies on the upper floors where the crowds are fewer and you can take pictures. The underwater zoo is nice and very informative and also has a nice little rope bride to have an Indiana Jones moment.
Fishy!. Unique 'underwater' experience - without getting wet! Nothing like it elsewhere that I've ever been! Zoo crammed with interesting specimens - all shapes and sizes. Well worthwhile

Best aquarium experience ever!. Loved the exhibits and walking through the underwater tunnels. Participated in feeding the sharks and the crocs. This is in the Mall and some nearby themed restaurants are also good choices.
Surreal!. Well worth visiting to alleviate the stress of all those expensive shops! Hard to believe this is located in the middle of a shopping mall, but that is Dubai for you!

enjoyable visit. The aquarium is in the Dubai mall so you can see some of it from the mall. When you go in you walk through a tunnel and see more and then there is more to see upstairs. Great for all ages. Lots of sharks fish crocs penquins etc. Don't think the glass bottom boat would be worth paying extra for.

a must see for everyone not only kids. its in the mall and you have the advantage to shop after, awesome sight seeing must see, the animals clean the underground zoo is awesome so much to see fun fun fun must go in the boat..
Awesome. Worth visiting with young children! I did not expect such a huge Underwater zoo inside a mall, there's even a King croc inside!

Impressive cause it's in a mall, but not a great aquarium. Our first aquarium in a mall, but for the price they charge and the size of it, it wasn't worth it. You're better off enjoying from the outside while inside the mall than paying and going into the small multi floor aquarium.
Brilliant. Worth the cost as the experience is worth it. Get there early and beat the crowds. Lots of great photo experiances, don't forget your selfie stick so you get those memorable photos

The Dubai Mall, Aquarium and underwater Zoo. Magic, this is one word that can described this underwater happening. From the time you enter this establishment, the variety of water related animals from every corner of the globe is there including King Croc in his own area from Australia.
Enjoyable. Best views are from the Mall though. There are plenty of sharks and rays to impress. Glass bottomed boat was a bit disappointing.
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is located dubai mall i enjoyed very much with my family.it is a unforgettable moment i never had.
Huge mall. Crowded all the time. Amazing ! Entertaining for kids and loads of shopping. The sweet shop will drive the kids crazy

Must visit with the kids!. Dubai Aquarium is a must visit with your kids but is also very fascinating with adults. I went with my 3-year old and he loved it. We even went for a boat ride in the aquarium with open bottoms, kind of scary being close to all those sharks! If you want additional thrill, you can have a dive session as well!When I was there, they had the king croc which was really magnificent and shocking! Pretty great place to go!

Pretty good aquarium. This was mine, my husband and our children's second visit to the Dubai Aquarium. The queue was short when we entered it so we managed to pay and get into the tunnel fairly quickly.The tunnel was fairly quiet, lots to see. My boys (7 and 9) enjoyed it a lot, as did my daughter (3). We finished the tunnel pretty quick and went up to the underwater zoo. We lucked out and were stood in front of the sea otters when a trainer came out to feed them. We all loved watching that, having seen the actual sea otter show last time.We slowly meandered through all the tanks, we stood above the tunnel on the glass floor, went up to the creepy crawly section, saw the king croc, watched the penguins. It doesn't take hours, we were there for maybe 90min total, but it's fun. We also had discount vouchers from the Entertainer, I believe giving us 1 adult and 1 child free, so worth the cost. Having been twice now I don't know that it would be on the top of my list of things to do in Dubai but it's well worth a visit for first-timers.

Lovely underwater zoo. It was lovely and beautiful walking in a tunnel and being surrounded by water and all the different kinds of fish you can think of. There's also a restaurant with the same setting and it's quite nice. There's a photographer at the end of the zoo and they take photos and can frame them for someone as a keepsake.
Fantastic. Went with my family and gran children and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Would definitely recommend a visit to the aquarium if you are ever in Dubai.

Wow. That's Impressive!. This is undoubtedly one of the 'must see' points of interest in Dubai. The aquarium is enormous and beautifully maintained for the animals and for visitors. Highly recommended but allow a couple of hours to get a full benefit.
Great Fun!. Spent a couple of hours in the zoo and the aquarium while visiting the Dubai Mall. Enjoyable for children , especially King Croc!
Very Cool. The aquarium is a must see, but the extras like feed the fish and the glass bottom boat tour is not worth the value they charge. Underwater zoo is cool.
Lovely world. I had enjoyed the most amazing time in Dubai and visited the Aquarium had established the new concept in me related to underwater Zoo. Try it and feel it.

Amazing!!!!!. The Dubai Aquarium and underwater park was AMAZING!!! Loved everything about it! Perfect place for kids and you can eat by a stunning rain forest themed restaurant! It was so beautiful and I learned so much! You also get your picture taken witch was great! If you are in Dubai you have to visit the aquarium!! You can also get a boat ride above the aquarium!! The boat has a glass floor that you can see through. They also have a lot of sick animals that they are treating, not so fun to look at but that really just melts your heart in a odd way. My 12-year old daughter also made friends with a penguin!?! The penguin followed her when she walked! The whole family learned a lot and bonded really well!!

Absolutely Fantastic!. I loved everything about this place.I spent over 5 hours in the aquarium and zoo. Everything is so big and fancy. Great enclosures/tanks for the animals. King Croc was amazing, definitely make sure you watch the feeding time! Walking around was nice and there was lots of information about the animals. I loved the Night Animals exhibit which shows some of the native nocturnal animals in the area.The staff are lovely and happy to answer any questions you may have. I think the price was very good, my package also included a behind the scenes tour and fish feeding which was nice.This is a great thing to do if you want to escape the outside heat and aren't a big fan of shopping. I hate shopping so just spent the day here! It was fantastic!!
Very Beautiful. I liked most of the things, specially different types of fishes, first time seen. Sitting inside the Boat and watching fishes from near is amazing
Impressive for its location. This is a very unique exhibit given that it is in a mall. The tunnel is far too short, but the view is amazing. Worth the fee, but skip the glass bottom boat.

Fantastic aquarium!. This aquarium was the best we've been to. Our 17 month old son loved the walkway and the various tanks. You can see the tunnel from the mall without paying but can't walk through it or go to the aquarium on the second floor of the mall. We spent a couple of hours here and paid to feed the fish. Feeding the fish didn't work well with our son (you couldn't touch the pellets and you had to throw them from behind a metal fence) but it was worth it to see the crocodile eggs and baby chameleon though.
Interesting. I t is located in Dubai Mall, you can watch different species of fish and underwater creatures.The aquarium is at the lower floor while the under water zoo is upstairs.
Nice stroll. This is a nice place in between the Dubai mall and have lots of variety of fishes the only con I felt was it was too short for the money paid. But worth a visit
Thrilling. Oh - what is there not to like about the underwater zoo - Its an awesome place for kids and adults and a must to visit when in Dubai.

A bit disappointing. Maybe I was expecting too much but found the aquarium disappointing. 2 little dimly lit under water tunnels which were pitch black in places so you could not see anything. We then had to go to the 2nd floor to finish the tour which is totally separated from the tunnels. Upstairs didn't seem to have any directions and by the end we just wanted to get out.
KIDS WILL ENJOY. Definitely a great work a 2 stories aquarium in a mall... never thought a zoo inside and boationg on top of aquarium , cant think of such design and management to manage all things

The Kid loved it!. Its not big, and somewhat reminds you of the Siam mall in Bangkok, or anything similar, but the aqua and nocturnal creature zoo upstairs is awesome! I loved it, and kid went going crazy giving air kisses to the fish in tanks, the crocs (there were 2) and the owl's on the branch!

Much more than expected. Really was not sure what to have expected here but really enjoyed the whole experience. The fish and all the other displays were excellent and well looked after. We paid extra for the fish feeding and this was good.We spent a very enjoyable afternoon here.

It was great, except..... I was very impressed with this attraction over all. The aquarium was clean and the staff very friendly. The giant crocodile was amazing and the glass bottom boat was worth the extra money (my six year old son loved it).However, be forewarned, IF you choose to buy any of the extra photos, be SURE to check your receipt before you leave. I got charged for 2 plexi-glass photo frames when all I bought was one. Unfortunately for me I didn't realize this until we arrived back to home. Be attentive to the clerks and what they say, as they do NOT always understand you.
nothing special. We visitied the aquarium a couple of days ago and honestly it is nothing special, i have visited more beautiful aquarium.

Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo @The Dubai Mall. The aquarium and zoo were really nice we were just a little disappointed by the glass bottom boat ride that seemed to last about 30 seconds. So visit the Aquarium but skip the boat ride.

Excellent attraction. My partner and I visited this aquarium during a holiday to Dubai in April 15. We had a fantastic time and really enjoyed looking at the wide variety of fish. It would be a great attraction for families, very engaging for kids, particularly the tunnel which seems to be visible on many photos. There are also a further two floors with many more fish species to see which is part of the standard ticket price. To get a reduction in the entry cost I believe there is a voucher available in the 2015 Dubai Entertainer book - which is very good value as it will save groups of more than two people a small fortune! 5 stars well worth a visit.

Dubai Aquarium. This is a must if you are in Dubai.Aquarium is part of Dubai mall, everything there is on the next level.Except maybe the parking (enormous by you have no air).All the rest is fantastic
OK. Wow! But if you've been to other similar aquariums (e.g. Aquaria KLCC in KL). This one isn't that much different. Stop by for the kids though.

Unusual location. Situated inside a huge shopping mall in the centre of Dubai, this is in the heart of a busy pedestrian area so was very busy when we attended. Spectacular views from outside the aquarium with multi level viewing from the different mall floor levels. Staff are helpful, welcoming and knowledgeable and we enjoyed the experience, although it was a bid of a procession due to the number of visitors

Well worth visit, good for families. Housed in the massive Dubai Mall this aquarium also impresses. There is a huge viewing window which anyone can look through. Our ticket allowed us to walk through the long transparent tunnel in the main tank, with many sharks and rays (up to 300 apparently) and then to go two floors up to the Underwater Zoo. Zoo because it also has otters, night creatures from the desert as well as some huge crocodiles. We paid the extra for a short boat (transparent bottom) trip with a guide on top of the main tank, well worth it. A couple of hours well spent.

Great distraction from the mall. We spend 2.5 hours here, included the boat ride. The boat ride was cool, but if you are watching your pennies it isn't a must. We used an entertainer voucher, so even better value for money for us. The croc is huge, and the penguins are adorable.
interesting work. its as good as any other underwater aquarium but its better if you take the package with the boat ride.

A stunning aquarium. I know the thought of an aquarium in a mall might put you off but this is actually a great aquarium and underwater zoo. Everything from manta rays and sharks to king crocs. Great for kids and adults alike. You can even go for a dive and get up close and personal.
SUPER. A super experience , once in lifetime.... The most beautiful part was the glass bottom boat. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Expensive for families. Its expensive if you have a 4 member family as each ticket costs 70 for adult and 55 for kids. this is the common package and higher packages costs from 110-250. Don't go for a package with Glass-Bottom Boat Ride cz its just a boat ride above the aquarium. Behind The Scenes Tour is just another cheat code as they play a video from youtube which you can watch for free later. If you are so keen to know the interesting facts, search it before you visit.

nice and fun. Sharks and fished live together in a small area , and you can find a very big Crocodile in the Zoo, also some animals you never see , 85-125 AED is not a big deal for all these amazing things

Really nice . The Dubai aquarium is amazing and much more impressive then the lost chambers of atlantis. Just visit the Dubai mall and enjoy for free or buy a ticket and visit also the Dubai underwater zoo. The zoo is really nice but the it would be good to make some of the tanks/cages larger. With so much money in Dubai let's also take good care of the animals.

Not bad but some long waits. Took the ultimate experience package which included a glass bottom boat ride. The aquarium tunnel was nice but rather short, then you have to go back into the shopping mall and go up a couple of floors to enter the zoo section (bad planning). The zoo was very busy and too crowded to enjoy. We took the boat ride but the process involved to get to the ride takes 15-20mins and is a real pain, walk here wait, sit there wait, go over there and wait, put a life jacket on and go and sit over there and wait. The ride itself was a boring waste of life. Suggest you take the cheapest package and stick to the tunnel and zoo only.

Exciting and exotic. This aquarium is huge. You'll need to give it 2 hours time if you want to see everything. In the first floor is the underwater tunnel and then big "screen" where you'll see different fishes, not the most exotic ones but the bigger ones like sharks. Then you go up to the second floor where they have the zoo and the rest of the aquarium. Here you'll see different animals that need to live in a water environment and the smaller fishes which are also more exotic. There are also animals that live in the desert. You can buy different tickets, and you can also make a boat tour and dive there. We didn't do that, we only made the regular tour which was more than enough for us.

Probably the best aquarium we've been to.. We had a really good day at the Dubai aquarium and it took far longer to get round than we expected. It was great to see that the habitats in the displays were so very different and there were no animal encounters or touch tanks which I hate. Animals all seemed healthy and well cared for and there was enough information to be interesting and the guides and staff are very knowledgeable. I wouldn't bother with the fish feeding as it's just in the main aquarium tank and you may as well be throwing pebbles on the scene for what you can see, it was also very rushed and all seemed a bit as if we were in the way.The king croc exhibit was really good fun and something that I've never seen before, in the jungle type or twice across the top of everything else would be great if you had kids with you.
Impossible!. Could you imagine aquarium with 34 000 of fishes? Diving courses inside? Boat trips? No? So visit aquarium and zoo in Dubai Mall. IMO the most impressive atraction in Dubai.

A massive Aquarium. This is packed with Fish sharks and rays right in the Shopping mal the big window of the Glass cen be seen from the upper Floor of the shopping Mal- the Tunnel ( have to pay to go in here), its glass tunnel that leads to the Aquarium. so lovely - but the shopping mal was packed out due to the Sand storm that looked like Orange Fog outside- you can sure make a day of this Mal. to many things to see and do apart from shops

One of the Best aquarium. The Dubai aquarium in the Dubai mall is very interesting . One can go thru a Glass walled tunnel and see Sharks and various other fishes and aqua life in the aquarium. The aquarium is over 40 feet high and has a very very large variety of aquatic life.At the top one can also experiend a boat ride with a glass bottom where you can see the fishes under then boat. .

The Aquarium at Atlantis is better.. If you have been to the Aquarium at Atlantis, then don't bother going here. Unfortunately it was rammed due to a sandstorm, and a cruise ship group going in at the same time, when we went, which really dampened the experience. The life jackets for the glass bottomed boats were an absolute joke and need replacing ASAP. The ticket desk on the top floor was seriously understaffed (luckily she told the queue jumpers to go to the back, or I'd have gotten really annoyed.) no info on ticket prices until you were at the till, which caused delays while people deliberated over what ticket to get. The fish were beautiful, but you can see all you need to see for free on the ground floor!
Small. If you have never been to an aquarium, I guess this would be interesting. But for someone that has been to a real aquarium, this is just a small fish tank.

Been to better Aquariums. The free to public view is not much different from the paid view. We paid extra to feed the fish thinking it might be fun for out 1.5 year old son, but it might be more fun throwing bread crumbs into a lake. There are many better aquarium experiences around the world.
a great experience. Remarkable and great educational experience for the younG and not so young. The experience of underwater life as only seen on TV was important

Try Lost Chambers - Atlantis in this place. This place is OK , but if have visited Lost Chambers - Atlantis, you will feel this place is not good at all. So, the recommendation is to visit Lost Chamber if you are able to else visit this place.

Average view compared to other places. Dubai aquarium is a part of the Dubai mall with a giant sized fish tank with a wide variety of fishes and a passage within to get a belly side view of the fishes. The tank is cleaned regularly, so offers a nice unrestricted view of the fishes inside. There is a ticket for the under the belly (tunnel) passage. My opinion is that the experience is not worth the charge. One can be contended with a side view of the aquarium which is free.
seaview. It was truly amazing to see all the different fish some we didnot know even existed.so colourful its a must see.please go as you will enjoy the amazing experience.

Check It Out - Especially with a Coupon!. An aquarium in a mall might seem cheesy and over the top – and it is. But it’s also pretty cool! Walking through the tunnel, it’s neat to look at the fish and sharks swimming overhead – especially for young kids. The aquarium has otters and lots of exotic fish that are fun to watch and learn about. King Croc – the largest crocodile in the world – is HUGE! The behind the scenes tour and fish feeding is interesting if you like to dork out on how things work, but you can skip it if you’re not interested in how the place runs. It’s especially worth it with a “by one get one free” coupon from the entertainer book.

Under water but in a mall. It is amazing to see this place. You cannot imagine a Zoo or aquarium under water. it is placed in Dubai mall and 10 % of the aquarium you can see from outside. if you have kids with you then it is worth going inside.

Welcome break in a busy shopping day. Like everything in Dubai expect the unexpected with the aquarium situated in the vast Dubai Mall for you to stumble on when shopping. Enjoyable break from the norm with interesting displays and the biggest croc I've ever seen . Definitely worth a visit.

Fantastic to see. To think this awesome aquarium is in a shopping mall is unliveable. There is so many fish to see and if you really want can even go in the water with them. Obviously that would cost more. Loved the underwater zoo also. Can be a bit pricey when buying the pics ect, so just be aware

Great Family outing. The aquarium is well equipped and has so many things to see and do that it is amazing to think it is inside a Mall. It truly is a wondrous place to take your kids as they can get up close and personal with all the aquatic life and the people working there are all friendly, knowledgeable and always willing to help. Even if it is busy there are enough places to go and enjoy with your family. I recommend everyone to do it at least once!! Thanks

Fun and beautiful. The Dubai Aquarium in the Dubai Mall is beautiful and a lot of fun. I think it would be even more fun with kids. The underwater zoo was amazing, I wish we had more time there. A little expensive, but still a great outing for the family.
Pretty awesome! . Went here today and was really impressed. Only bad thing is that it didn't last longer! If your not a fan of kids and prams, maybe stay away!

Very Impressive aquarium, and underwater zoo, but pushy photo sellers marred the experience for us.. I have visited Dubai mall several times but have never been into the tunnel or visited the zoo. To be honest there is not a great deal that you can see from inside the tunnel that you can't see from the outside, however it is well worth a visit because of the underwater zoo and the glass bottom boat ride. The zoo contains many different species of underwater life including a very impressive crocodile called "King Croc"You can spend a couple of hours visiting this attraction so for 110AED including the boat ride it is not too expensive. Watch out for the pushy photo saleswomen, if you want photos be prepared to pay through the teeth!
Awesome. Just loved the aquarium. .......was with kids. ......Best thing was the boat ride and the tunnel...it is a must to see if you are visiting dubai especially with kids

Great for kids - big & small!. We took twin three year olds & they adored the visit. True, it's not cheap, but it is an awesome experience. The concept of an aquarium in a mall is mind boggling , but this is Dubi, so anything goes! The range of sea creatures was great & the friendly divers cleaning the tank engaged the kids & made their day. The hands on part of the tour was excellent. Recommended.

Save your money. No sooner have you parted with a large sum of money for admission, than you are collared by the house photographers trying to get you to part with more. I recommend you view the fish for free from the surrounding shopping mall, avoiding the smell and claustrophobia of going in and have more money for shopping. I have visited better aquariums for less money.

Good experience especially for kids!. I went there with few of my friends as I have been to this mall in my earlier visit too bt had not visited the aquarium then.Although a decent collection of fishes, its quite grand from outside to view the aquarium... the walkthor' this tunnel is amazing but somehow I was not so thrilled when i actually went in...the experience has been worthwhile for one visit...fascinated by a huge crocodile & its partner croc that is kept in the zoo..you get to see wode variety of marine life...also collection of some birds towards the end of this visit is wonderful...

Overall good experience but beware of extras. I really liked the aquarium and how it looks and feels, fitting so nicely in the Dubai Mall. However, a a paid experience, I would recommend managing your expectations or trying to find as much information as possible before going in. The zoo is nice and lots of species but not really much different and of course less complete than a proper zoo. The boat and feeding experience was not really that interesting, plus it takes some time queueing and getting ready just to be on the boat for a couple of minutes, without much explanation or guidance from staff.If you have limited time and money in Dubai I would consider this careful before buying, in my opinion I enjoyed but I think the best is seen from outside, without having to pay anything.

Fascinating children love it. We went and had a good time. Took lots of snaps. The sharks in the entrance were intriguing as it was a tunnel so they were above and on sides. Lots to see and read about. I loved the see through on the outside which had lots of fish in it.

Mesmerising. It was the first time i had ever seen an aquarium in a mall with sharks, manta rays and fish of all shapes and sizes i had never seen before!And found it incredible that you could actually go diving in it!You can pay to go in the aquarium which is really great on the eye and takes you to another world it feels.However it can get too busy which effects the experience alot. The zoo you pay for is ok too but its nothing like singapore zoo or any big outdoor one, expsct to see the odd small crocodile.Great for a family with children but not all that for a group of lads
Located at Dubai Mall. Great for people of all ages. They have King Croc from Australia there as well as penguins. Worth the time and inexpensive
A must for all ages. This was a super experience for our family. So much fun and just so relaxing. I believe anyone and everyone would love this.

nice attraction for kids. I had already visited the aquarium in a few other countries along with my children so didn't take them inside as its almost the same but this one is very much different from the outside. You can see it from the 1st floor as well and the display is huge,unlike the displays at other aquariums around the world. It's a must see attraction for the kids regardless of that if you have seen it many times before.

Not worth the money. Aquarium tunnel is too short compared to the one in Singapore. Variety of fishes pales in comparison too.
Zoo is so so.
I'm here on a short trip hoping to visit at least a place in Dubai that would blow my mind. This is not the place.

Great experience, but falls short on expectations. We went for the Fish feeding experience, the knowledge provided was very brief and could have been made more interesting by a slid show and the actual feeding part was very very brief, so did not enjoy it
some place. You can not imagine how much stuff they had in the zoo in the MALL. This huge 12 + foot alligator, to sea life to animals. great for the kids and adults

It's huge!!. So many sharks, you get very close to them and start the trip with a boat ride across the top of the tank! Then walk through the tunnel!
Well worth it! Also get a couples photo as you first walk in!

Great Aquarium. Good value considering this is in Dubai. Fab aquarium with a whole lot more to offer. Very well run. Really enjoyed glimpsing behind the scenes on way to tank boat trip. Would love to dive the tank and wave at the people in the shopping mall!

Wonderful experience. Having been to the Dubai Mall the previous day and seen the Aquarium, I just had to go and see what it was all about. Booked a VIP trip with my personal guide Cari. Had a great two hours, Cari really did know his stuff. Fantastic selection of fish and marine life set in wonderful surroundings. Glass bottom boat trip was ok, some big fish in there!!! All round a great experience, really pleased I took the time out to do it. Worth a visit.
Beware of Sharks :). Great for kids and adults , see them feeding the big fishes , really amazing!!they have an option also so you can do a dive with the fish

Impressive. decided to visit the aquarium.. Was an amazing underwater experience.. And the boat glass tour was great.. My husband loved it... I loved walking on the bridge at the zoo.. We both enjoyed it very much...
Expected more. I was not made aware that there are two parts and after feeding the fished with the kids no one told us that we could move to the ground floor for the tunnel.
OK. The aquarium was nice but not worth the 70.0AED they were asking for. Lots of sharks but you can see that from the outside for free.

Joe. Fun and exciting.
Never been that close to a shark before ,
The species of the fish and other sea creatures were amazing to see. If you love sea life, that's the place to be,

Short and Quick.... If you compare it to the atlantis aquarium, way below average. The walk into the tunnel is just as good as the view from outside. IMO not worth the money. however, let me say that the staff were extremely friendly that should not be ignored.....

good aquarium.... The aquarium is very good .first u have to go through a tunnel where u can see a wide and rare species of water animals.Then u have to go to zoo where u will see the king crocodile and many other species. my experience at zoo was awesome....

"The tunnel's good ... Very nice ... We had fun ...'. Starting a review is the hardest part of the task. My secret? To ask my trusted companions what they thought of the experience in one short sentence. Then, having been jump-started, I'm away, as I weave my own impressions into the fabric of the review. I love to write. It's pleasing to see that other reviewers capture the educational beauty and excitement of this astonishing facility. Anything I have to say merely reflects their views. My advice. Visit Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. I can find absolutely no fault with it. Money very well spent.

Sharks so close. First we looked at the fish and the scuba divers while at the mall then closer in the tunnel with big fish and sharks. The fun part was the glass bottom boat ride goes over the area holding tank it was fun specially during repeated passing of a large shark we felt we were in the movie Jaws.

Fun and interesting. Few shows that are informative and fun, King Croc is a marvel on his own! beautiful wish, well displayed and well maintained. the fish feeding isn't worth it, you just go behind the scenes and throw some pellets in to the large tank.The tunnel is beautiful, definitely worth visiting once, entrance starts at 20$

Huge & Impressive. what strikes out is the massive single panel display - extremely huge. Tons of fishes, sharks, rays, eels etc.In fact if you go to the first floor, you can get more close to the fishes (without the extra cost).

The Amazing Giant Aquirium in the Middle of Dubai Mall.. What an experience this is really worth a visit. Really great it is really hard to believe you are inside Dubai biggest shopping mall. I think 10 million gallons of sea water. The variety of fish is just breath-taking. Book the short glass bottom boat ride included in your entry this is good value.

Great visit and a relief after all those shops. We took just the Aquarium and Zoo package 70 Dirhams per Adult and you enter through the tunnel to an amazing view and close up experience of Sharks, Rays and all manner of marine life mainly large one too. Then you go up two flights of escalators within the Mall itself to the Marine Zoo which was also an interesting experience and all in all both attraction exceeded expectations.
fabulous sealife. When visiting the dubai mall one should take a closer eye to the aquarium with beautiful sea life in side. You can see it from outside but you have to pay a fee to visit inside.

Aquarium in the mall. Easy to find, welcomed by a nice staff, they have an accomodating staffs as well, the tunnel was not so long but amazing, the other part of the aquarium is on 2nd floor. Over all experience was awesome!

Good Pass Time. One of the attractions Dubai has other than the shopping malls.
Good place to be, to spend a nice 1 hour time.
Amazing aquarium. It was a pleasant surprise to see this aquarium within a mall. There were different types of fish in the aquarium including sharks, rays, and interesting tropical fishes.
A must visit place in Dubai. I loved the way the place is maintained in the biggest mall which receives tourist all year around.The underwater zoo would be loved by kids.
One of the top Must-see places. The Dubai Aquarium and Ubderwater Zoo are amazing, so many animal and fish species to discover. It is litterally a festival for the eyes.

A big aquarium inside Dubai Mall. The aquarium looks big on the outside and it is free to watch from the outside. You will see sharks, rays and other fishes.
You can also line up and buy a ticket to go inside the tunnel, but it is pricey.
A place well worth a visit,- either just outside - or inside.
An aquarium inside a mall. It is located at the centre of Dubai Mall and the aquarium is an amazing sight and attracted the most people in the mall.
Awesome Experience. Beautiful under water tunnel. Huge collection of fishes & other underwater species. Kids just loved it
A Must Go!. You need to go especially if you are with your kids. You get to see the whole of "the underworld" here.

Amazing. I loved the fact that i had the oppurtunity to see lots of water animals, you can hardly find anywhere, but its expensive with all those photographers almost forcing you to take and pay for pictures
Beautiful . It's a beautiful place to visit in Dubai mall.. Kids will love it.. You will have to pay to visit the inside of it, and you should definitely do it, they have an amazing water zoo inside

a one time worth sea. unimaginable that such a park can exist in one of the most fashionable malls of the world the dubai mall the crocodile is an amazing sight and the story behind it incredible
the tickets should a bit more reasonable

Nice location in Mall but poorly conceived.. I was having great expectations about this aquarium. After all everything in Dubai is spectacular. Right? Wrong. Yes the aquarium is conveniently located in Dubai Mall and buying a ticket and queueing was hassle free. It had a massive billboard saying King Croc on the front alluding that they had this amazing massive salt water crocodile in here. On going in I found the aqua tunnel very short, dark and disappointing. Yes they had a few scary looking sharks and sting rays swimming around amongst the smaller fish but it I expected so much more. After walking through you had to go upstairs to the 2nd floor of the mall to enter the Underwater Zoo. A motley selection of marine fish and animals and then King Croc. What a let down! He was hiding away at the far end of his tank looking totally bored. There was a section on nocturnal land animals, what's that got to do with an aquarium? I booked the glass bottom boat tour aswell, you were ushered onto a cramped boat with 10 other people and I could see next to nothing on the glass bottom as the water was so murky. To be honest it was a waste of time. Not recommended.

Nothing special, literally they try to make money out of everything.. Does not deserve to be the biggest aquarium in the world lol the zoo itself is more interesting than the small tunnel of the fish...wanna see the sharks?? go to Australia but do not pay 300 aed for all inclusive lol

CRAZY!!!. Emiratis are amazing. They truly believe in the words if the mind can conceive it can achieve. Imagine this, an underwater zoo and aquarium inside the Dubai mall. There's sharks in there different kinds of marine life, crocs, fish, rays, i mean name it. They got it!! all under one roof! u gotta see it to believe it. plus, IT'S FREE!! unless you wanna get inside the tunnel which is even better.just grab your camera and go!
Beautiful!. Loved this in-mall aquarium as it had a wide variety and was a great price! Not to mention the location, inside Dubai Mall, makes it very convenient!

Awful. Animal torture!. Please avoid this place at all costs! Animals are suffering, kept in tiny cages. It's a disgrace for a wannabe modern place like Dubai. If you have a heart, this place should leave you feeling incredibly sad
Sharks. Dome is worth walking in with loads of sharks around you feels like walking under water current, museum along with it is ok nothin great about it

Kind of small. it is pretty small when compared to other aquariums i have been. its well maintained and clean. even though we went in December it was not as crowed as i thought. Only the tunnel had a long que.
Kids and parents loved it. This is so worth the trip! Well laid out, interactive with lots of information to read/share and get exited about.
Kids and parents loved it. This is so worth the trip! Well laid out, interactive with lots of information to read/share and get exited about.
Extreemely interesting. Good and interesting for everybody: little and grown-up. Very impressive and cognitive at the same time.

Excellent. It is an excellent creation and the collection of the animals and fishes are really nice.
Everyone would really enjoy the time spent.
Very nicely maintained.

Fabulous!!. An amazing Aquarium built inside the Dubai Mall,the worlds largest shopping centre.. It offers spectacular view of sea creatures and a boat ride on top of the aquarium. You can even watch the sharks being fed.Not to be missed..

Nice place. Place is good for kids but not that great as underwater world in sentosa singapore. Kids will love it. It has many varieties of fishes and you can also feel/touch and star fish. it too has an under water diving facility

kids really enjoy here. kids really enjoy here. Those who have seen Singapore/Thailand water parks and Zoos wont find it that good. Since we have seen the both, it wasn't very new for us but our Son certainly enjoyed.

Eat your heart out Atlantis Palm. Cracking attraction and very good value for money compared to the aquarium in the Atlantis Palm. Kids of all ages will love it. Plenty of different fish and also the king croc which is a beast!
Spectacular aquarium. Very well put together - excellent value for money. The underwater zoo (as they call it) is very well constructed. There is a children's restaurant/snack bar.
amazing. Well worth the cost although would not in future pay the extra for the glass bottom boat tour - more of a 5 minute raft ride just seeing the same things from a different angle.

Aquarium visit. If your just wanting the aquarium you can see most things from the mall rather than paying a lot of money and you don't see much more! If you have children with you the underwater zoo is quite interesting! Overall it's alot of money for a quick walk through the aquarium

dubai mall. After being in the desert for a few months, the group I was with certainly gravitated to the aquarium! It was nice to see all the water and the amazing variety of species that they had, in the middle of the mall

Fun for the whole family. There is the option of buying tickets for just the aquarium walk. But be warned that your children probably won't let you get away with that. The aquarium is lovely. We have been to different attractions like this, but this one is particularly nice because you can walk through a tunnel that runs through the aquarium itself, giving unparalleled views of the fish. You can also take a ride in a clear bottom boat. The underwater zoo has all sorts of little creatures. The otters are too cute, and they paint too. They recently acquired a fantastic new addition- KING CROC! He is absolutely, breath-hitchingly, huge! A truly awesome sight! all in all, it's a safe, indoor, fun, if a bit pricey , learning experience for the whole family. And who doesn't love that?
wonderful. Excellent experience And enjoyable. It has different kinds of fishs. Good to visit ones. Must for one who loves to know about underwater life.
Nice. Nice place to visit especially with kids. if you the time and inclination definitly go for the cage dive. Awsome experience.

Average. The place is okay, lots of fishes and exhibits but not worth the money. The fishes and all you can see from the outside as well, not much different from what you see in the tunnel. The King Croc was however the only thing worth seeing. Rest all was okay.

Worth a visit. This is worth a visit . Everywhere is spotless clean although like the rest of Dubai expensive . The aquariums are amazing and are the size of the building from the ceiling to the Floors, worth a visit

Perfect for certified divers. The place is great for the whole family, but it's a must for all certfied divers. The shark dive is just awesome, the staff very professional, if you are in town for a day or longer, just do it.

small compared to bangkok's underwater world. it has a very small tunnel to walk pass and explore the fishes :/ the zoo is good, maintained, yet SMALL, the good thing was the King croc. GOD!! foots long..

Waste of money. It is same as it looks from outside the only different is of the curve glass inside which is not even of half a minute juZ a small tunnel n u r out why waste money if u can c same creatures for free from outside

Can see everything from the outside. It's a massive aquarium (occupying three floors) located in the Dubai Mall. It houses a variety of species of saltwater fish (sharks, stingrays etc).I can see everything from the outside already so I don't see the point of paying to walk through the underwater tunnel.If you're brave enough, you can also dive in with the sharks. It's quite expensive though.

Best experience. this is my best experience with all the lovely creatures under water..watching them so close..with fishes aquarium at first and then the boat ride and then the underwater beauty..couldnt have been more serene

Good experience. There are sharks, octopus, sea horses, turtles, penguins, jumbo crocodile and many more animals to watch in the underwater zoo and aquarium! Its a must go for people who havent seen these things in other countries before.
The glass bottom boat ride is also quite interesting.
Awesome. This is certainly something to see and the fact that it is in the Dubai Mall. if you have kids with you they will be enthralled.

fun especially for kids. Inside the Dubai mall the Aquarium & under water zoo not only educational but lots of fun for ppl of all ages. It's worth taking the time off all the shopping and discover the sea world as a change of pace
Place Never to be forgotted. Real Aqua world experience never to be forgotten ever. Never ever encountered Shark and dolphins from such a distance.

10 million litres of water. As you walk through Dubai Mall, you cannot miss the Aquarium and even if you don't pay to go in, you can admire it. However it is worth paying the entrance fee, we enjoyed the short trip on the glass bottom boat. It would have been easy to miss what for us was the best part, had we not turned left where there are many different animals, from otters to alligators.If you wish, you can pay extra to go diving with the sharks!

Tank is big a la Dubai standard. I actually haven't been inside the aquarium (yet) so can't give a proper review. I'm struggling to see if there'll be any value for me spending that money going in when I can appreciate it for free on the LG and G levels. I also feel really bad for the fishes that areConstantly bombarded with crazy tourists and shining lights I even saw a shark bumping into the glass that is it's clear prison wall.

Take the kids take your gran. Yep it is a good as they say , pay to go on the glass bottom boat and then try to remember you are still in the shopping mall ! incredible , then read the figures how much water they truck in each day it must cost a fortune. its one for the bucket list !

Very interesting place but too crowded.. Dubai Aquarium in Dubai Mall is full of very interesting specimens of underwater life. From jellyfish to octopus, king crocodiles, sharks, turles, tiny little fish to penguins. We spent a very interesting day amazed by the colours and forms in the water. At around 11 am we saw the octopus being fed.Unfortunately though there were several school groups along with other visitors and it was too crowded. The kids enjoyed the aqyarium.
One of the biggest aquarium!. It takes 2-3 hours to cover full Aquarium, really nice to see and take background pics. ticket very cheap.One time visit and must visit when in dubai..

Great View. I visited Dubai Aquarium with my Daughter, it was amazing visit.
My daughter watched all fish from near and in big size. Children enjoy such places.
Beautiful!!. It a beautiful place to visit as it is already in the Dubai Mall andd it is tryly astonishing in size!
OMG. I was traveling with two children who were mesmerized as was I by this breathtaking adventure! A must see! so incredible with beautiful experience
A great family entertainment. The tunnel is very nice and the underwater zoo has lots of fish and sea creatures, also the night-life part was cool. My 3-year daughter enjoyed the place so much.

Different activities for aquarium/fish lovers. You may either opt for a simple Aquarium tunnel experience or try the 1-hr boat ride to give you a better view of the aquarium. There is also as guided scuba diving experience which can be beneficial to those who would want to try scuba diving but are scared of open waters. The ticket will also give you access to the Underground water zoo - the name may be misleading as this is actually on the second floor of the Dubai Mall. But just the same, it is worth a visit. There are multiple species of each kind making it really nice to look at, plus each tank has good information. One of the crew said that it is still under construction which is why there is no floor map yet and it lacks directional labels inside.

Expensive for what it is. I do not think it is worth paying extra for the aquarium tickets, when you can see some of it for free from outside. The final part of aquarium, which is on the 2nd floor, is free. It is very small and expensive, even for Dubai's standards.We paid extra for the boat ride, which was the best part. If you do decide to the aquarium, it is worth paying the extra, for the boat ride.
Huge fish tank!. Right in the Dubai mall, do your shopping and see some fish! It is a great experience being on the side of the very big tank.

Toddler and Granny Friendly. Enchanting way to spend time in Dubai. You are surrounded with an amazing and unique perspective of aquatic life. Sea life swims above, over and along side. The tour is truely an Underwater Zoo. All ages and physical abilities will feel comfortable, welcome, and experience awe.
It was amazing. Aquarium was like walking through sea bed...and underwater zoo nice place to see all creatures in sea

What you c from outside is just Trailer. Yes, what you are c-ing from outside is just Trailer, They have collected different type of fish and made suitable environment for each, ensured clean tanks all the time which is very important. Hats off the the people you have build and maintaining this.

Wildlife in a mall?. I understand aquariums can be places of education but this is not it. Keeping endangered species of sharks and other fish in a tank in a mall is sending out the wrong message to children! The sharks definitely don't deserve to be there. But, then it's Dubai....also expensive entry tickets.

Aquarium in Dubai Mall. Good time to relax...all variety of fishes are on display here...both marine and fresh water fishes are on display...ground floor has marine fishes and on first floor fresh water fishes are on display...over all spent quality time in this aquarium...

Very interesting being able to see animals close up but if on a budget just look from the outside.. It's quite pricey but is pretty interesting to see. You don't gain a massive amount by paying to go through the glass tunnel, you can see everything just as well from the outside. Go up to the next floor in order to be able to get closer to the glass. The glass bottom boat is quite good and the underwater zoo is full of interesting sea creatures. Unfortunately they do keep some animals such as owls, otters, beavers, crocodiles and penguins in very small enclosures which aren't big enough for them to have any quality of life.

Underwater Wonders. It is really a matter of amazement as to how the people have managed to cosntruct such thick/strong glass to hold the water in the aquarium and at the same time make it so transparent that you can actually feel like u r touching the fish. !

Better than what you first think. The mall you are first hit by the scale of the aquarium, but when you go through the tunnel, its a bit of an anti climax, when you reach the end. But fear not you then have to go up a floor to see the other attractions. Personally for me these were the highlight, I have attached some picture. In all well worth a visit
Fantastic Plaace. Amazing Experience.Wonderful enjoyment and experience, especially for kids.Must visit.Next time would do again. Scuba diving also on offer
Nice spot to relax. Nice aquarium in the mall. Great for kids. The sharks and crocs. are especially interesting. They do a nice job. friendly staff.

A remarkably diverse aquarium experience. I've been to entirely too many awuariums on four continents, so I didn't expect much from Dubai Aquarium. I was glad to be proven wrong. The aquarium has a good variety of displays and enclosures, but it's interactive elements such as the cage diving, glass bottom boats, feedings, and demonstrations that make it so enjoyable. It's not quite as good as the Monterey Bay Aquarium in the US, but trumps most other awuariums I've visited.

Snorkle with the Shark!. My Son booked me a suprise trip to snorkle in the Dubai Aquarium it was really good absolutely amazing to be that close to the fish and in a shopping mall!!! you get all the gear needed don't have to take anything (dry pair of pants would help) and just make sure someone is outside taking photo's - great experience don't miss the opportunity

Will keep you mesmerized for ages!. This thing was in the middle of the Dubai Mall and is HUGE. Lots of sharks, rays and other ocean fish. No whale shark or turtles, but who cares? The kids were going bananas of course, and the adults couldn't get enough. There were even divers getting into the aquarium to advertise their crocodile attraction, but you'd have to pay to see this, which is really unnecessary. You're better off sitting at The Cheesecake Factory, which is right there, and enjoying the view while you enjoy your meal. Great fun for the family, and at no cost either!

Brilliant aquarium. We visited the aquarium in February 2015. It was very impressive! I could have stood in the tunnel and watched the fish all day to be honest. Then when you go upstairs you get to see all sorts of fish and animals, from sharks to otters to penguins. There was every underwater animal you can think of. We paid to go on the boat over the massive fish tank and it was definitely worth it. The boat had a glass bottom so you could see all the sharks, fish and rays swimming underneath you. It was a great day out however it could be modernised a bit and some of the tanks needed the glass cleaning but these were only minor things. I'd definitely recommend if you're in Dubai.
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Well worth a visit. Situated in Dubai Mall.If you like medium sized aquariums this is the place for you

VERY impressive Aquarium. The Aquarium within the Dubai Mall is very impressive. You should go there early in the day when the mall is not very crowded or on any other dy than Friday or Saturday. Otherwise you will find yourself in a crowd of people trying to make the best foto ;). Very interesting fishes to see and nice environment.There is a tunnel through the aquarium where you have to buy a ticket for. But it's really worth it as you see the Sharks and fishes much better

Truly world class. A superlative gigantic aquarium, this is a true world class underwater experience. It goes with Dubai's flamboyant. The aquarium can apparently hold 10m litres of water!! The aquarium has almost all major attractions, except a whale :) They claim to have some 30000+ living animals including sharks and rays. One can also pay extra and enter this aquarium in water gears. It holds the Guinness World Record for the world’s “Largest Acrylic Panel”.

Typical aquarium and zoo. We paid 80 AED each for the entrance. The aquarium and zoo is well maintained. However, it is quite a small zoo (given that is inside a mall) which you can finish roughly in an hour. There's not much variety. The tunnel is not as long as well.If you are not a kid and have seen several aquariums before, I recommend to just see it from the outside for FREE while you shop in the mall. You can pretty much see most of the creatures. Either go early in the morning when the mall open so there is less people or go to higher floors so you can be closer to the aquarium (plus less people as well).
Marine World inside Mall !!. amazing experience to see sharks and thousands of species closely, the boat ride is awesum and worth
Amazing. We were lucky the aquarium is in Dubai Mall and whilst we're were there 2 divers entered the tanks to feed the fish. What a sight. The number and variety of fish is incredible.

Fantastic aquarium and Zoo. This was brilliant and worth a visit. The aquarium has thousands of different fishes, corals including Sharks . The Zoo has amazing sea creatures and I was shocked at some the more unusual creatures seen here. A must see in Dubai

Worth to visit. Pay 110 dirhams to visit all attractions and take a glass boat to be inside the huge aquarium.A visit duration is about 1 hour. You will see 7 kind of sharks, piranhas, 2 VERY big crocodiles, piranhas, turtles... the place is amazing, for kids and grown ups.

Aquarium looks better from outside. Rides r overrated.. They sell only packeges which include walking through a tunnel, feed the fish, glass bottom boat tour and feed the sharks. First one is good view and photo op. Next 2 are not worth it. The zoo is ok. Feeding the sharks might be good but the view of the aquarium is good only from outside that too for free.

You Shop - I Dive!. It is true. Dubai Aquarium is located INSIDE Dubai Mall. You can go with your family and as they safely do some shopping you can grab your diving suit and get into a challenge with a white shark! (you dont have to but the the choice is all yours). Dubai Mall has a metro station and thousands of taxis are there so you wouldn't have an issue of getting in/out.

It's OK. If you have been to any of the MAJOR aquariums in the world like Atlanta or Sydney, it will be a let down. But seeing as it is in a mall and many of the views are free, it's fine to seek out and see if you are already in Dubai Mall

Exploring Underworld. We visited this place with our seven year old daughter and five year old son.A great place and a big big aquarium with a big collection of different and unique kind of fishes. A big collection of Sharks. King Croc is really really big.

Madness in the mall. Whilst you're marveling at the diversity inside this "shopping centre" which goes from Bloomingdale's in one lane to Waitrose in another, pay to wander through the aquarium which costs very little and is very much worth the money. I couldn't get my head around watching a Tiger shark swimming next to a shoal of Tuna !

Interesting underworld species. Dubai Mall is very busy - 10 minute walk from the Metro, and not good if you don't like crowds, but fascinating. The largest underwater aquarium is amazing. So many species at close hand, a delight to young and old.

Guaranteed Entertainment. Imagine entertaining a 3,6,7 and 9 year old for 3 hours!! This is what we did whilst in Dubai with our grandchildren. We had a wonderful time and so did they. We looked talked and observed the many and varied marine exhibits. Grandad was a fount of knowledge and we have learnt to find funny and interesting things to see and talk about to lift flagging spirits - especially when you are only 3. There were place to just sit and watch and even in the tunnel we were able to sit on the floor and watch the littlest fish darting in and out of rocks etc.This is a great place to visit for adults and children and a fantastic way to view the fish - especially watching the stingrays feed. It can get very crowded so choose your time if you want to watch and observe.Our little ones loved the Penguins upstairs in the Marine Zoo. We found a spot to sit and they watched them for about 20 minutes.A wonderful day

Great collection of unseen underwater world. Its really a must see if you are an enthusiast for underwater world or even a nature lover.Located in the famous Dubai Mall, this is spread in 3 floors.The walk thru the glass tube in the aquarium and watching shark and so many other fishes was a great feeling. In the upstairs, there are variety of fishes and sea creatures and most of them are unseen or rare. My whole family enjoyed it.

Yep, you can dive in this aquarium!. Tons of fish, with high levels of attention to their health and condition. A little expensive to get the full ticket, but worth it to go upstairs and see the tanks of exhibits. Great way to introduce kids to marine and fresh water life. And for something a little different, you can dive-closely supervised of course- in the tank. Quite a hoot!

A wonderful Experience. Right in the heart of Dubai it is located in the Dubai Mall. There is a huge glass enclosure which is open to the general public for viewing the fishes in the aquarium. However if you want to go inside then buying tickets is a must. The zoo is also fabulous!

Give it a pass. If you have never visited an aquarium in Singapore Australia or the Western World it may be worth a trip but otherwise give it a pass. There is a much lesser known aquarium at the Scientific centre Kuwait which is far better except that it does not have the glass boat ride. First of all it is laid out in two levels and you have to get out of one and go to the next level to get your tickets checked. Nextly these guys are racists. It is funny because most of the receptionists are Philipinos and the security personnel are Indians and Arabs. In spite of that they will check your tickets multiple times if they see that you are from the sub-continent. They think that you are either a labourer or some other low paid employee just because of your skin colour. When they a see an Westerner they bend over backwards.Guys If you see my other reviews, you will see that I have been around a bit but most of the racist behaviour I have come across is in this part of the world and this is not from Westerners but from my own compatriots.Anyway the aquarium in itself is modest in its collections and fair in its presentation.You can easily give it a pass if you have seen others.
Worth Visiting. Definitely worth visiting as it is very enjoyable. Esecially if you are a couple or with kids. And its all indoor so you wont be stuck in the heat.

So much fun. Go eat in the café next door as sharks swim past then wander around and see alligators to stingrays and everything in between. Wouldn't recommend getting your photo taken as you get charged and the quality is not very good, take your own if you have a camera, much more natural :)
Pleasantly surprised!. Was not expecting much but was pleasantly surprised by this attraction. Its like a mini Sea-life centre. Worth going just to see King Croc! Boy thats one huge Croc!!
Excellent for kids.. It's really huge, and it's really full of life. If you go to Dubai with your children, they should have a look at the aquarium.
underwater life in dubai. It is one of the main attraction to visit in Dubai. You will have this unique experience to visit underwater life with other mall attractions.
Aquarium is Cool. Visit this Aquarium if you are a fish lover. Please don't get any picture clicked. They will charge you later to take that picture along, its not forcefull

Great experience right within the Dubai Mall. We chanced upon this just walking through the Dubai Mall. The glass bottomed boat trip was well worth the money, really good fun. Even without that, there are some impressive things to see in the aquarium and the kids loved it
so many better ones in the world. slightly disappointed because we expected greatest and best in dubai. ok not great, killed some time, moved onto something else.

good one. purchasing the ticket is not that necessary. u can have a good view from outside as well. Not something out of the world if u have already been to underwater world in Malaysia. I think buy paying money u may dive inside the aquarium and do shark and ray feeding. Good time pass

Amazing experience. We had an unplanned visit to the Dubai Aquarium due to a sand storm in Dubai, and we were definitely not disappointed. It is incredible that this is all inside a mall, but amazing to walk in the tunnel through the main tank. Not that much variety inside but the other big attraction is the big crocodile up close and personal. We also did the boat ride on the main tank to finish the whole experience. What was also interesting was the Arabian night animal. Definitely a must do. The Chinese dragon inside the tank was a nice touch for new year.

very impressive, larger in the world. Was there, really inpressive and large. Liked everything. Going through glass tunel is for additional price. But you can look to it from Dubai mall and see a lot of water inhabitants free of charge. It`s located in the middle of the Dubai mall.
Disliked that necessary to pay entrance fee to go through tunnel.

Dubai Aquarium. Enjoyed the aquarium. Yes the crocodile is delight to watch is is huge. For both adults and children. Lots to see variety of fish and other species all in one place within the Dubai mall.
Worth a visit if you are in the shopping centre. Definitely worth going to if you are shopping there anyway. Its a lot bigger than I thought and my 2 year old loved it.

Underwater Zoo_Dubai. I was in the big aquarium into Dubai Mall, and I liked to see at the exotic wonders and find self face to face with dangerous sharks.Aquarium located strategically in the centre of the mall.

A M A Z I N G !. The best aquarium in the world in the middle of the dessert!Many many species in one place, well organized and you can see them all since everything is behind glass walls.A real delight is the huge crocodile, many fish speciaes from all arounf the world. A real treat for the children and adults.Maybe the price is a bit high, however you see a lot in one place.
over priced. really nice aquarium, fun to watch but its over priced plus you can experience it from dubai mall without any ticket.dont buy ticket to go inside the tunnel.

Well worth the money. Nice. Plenty of different water life to view. King crocodile seemed at home there and we were shown the crocodile eggs on the behind the scenes tour included in the basic price. A bit confusing as there are two separate areas on two separate floors of Dubai mall. We took well over two hours just to walk around and watch. Very worthwhile, even with the really long walk to get to Dubai mall from the metro.

Surprising big for a mall aquarium. We had a pleasant surprise into the Dubai Mall, especially for my little daughter. Not very different from other aquariums around the world, seen before, still unusual for the location. Wasn't cheap but worth for the kids.

Best of all Aquariums in my opinion. Go early in the day so you don't miss the Otters, they go to sleep around 11am.Even if you miss them you will be amazed at the quantity and variety of water creatures and fish you will see. Recently a pair of crocodiles have moved in, they have been together for 20 yearsA must for anyone visiting Dubai, in the same Mall as Ski Dubai, so take a look at that too!
Aquarium family fun. A great way to entertain and educate the kids whilst in the Dubai Mall. Enough variety in the animals to amuse all ages.

BEST AQUARIUM IN WORLD - DUBAI AQUARIUM. I would say Dubai Aquarium is best aquarium in world. Specially its underwater tunnel... It was nice to see sharks over our head... if some one is interested then can do behind the scenece tours also.

Wonderful aquarium. Our kids were amazed to see such a huge aquarium in a Mall, it really is something else! The walk through tunnel is amazing and our children didn't want to leave. The zoo area was great too, so many different species I've never seen in an aquarium. We were fortunate to see the crocodile feeding and we all thorough enjoyed it. The zoo isn't huge but big enough before little ones start to get bored. We all enjoyed it!

Poor value for money. It is difficult to see the difference between the packages on offer. You could easily miss the fact that the ticket covers you to go upstairs and see more fish. Staff don't explain what ticket covers.
Another world. Indeed a different thing but could not find that amazing. However, a good place to roam about to have a different experience.

Good to watch and can avoid if no time. Aquarium has lot of species. But I think there is charm missing at the place. May be staff can roam around in the place to help the viewers about explaining the different species.
Nice brief experience. It was a beautiful, small aquarium. A nice experience after visiting boring repetitious shopping malls. It took only 5 minutes to visit it but was pleasant.
Good value. Good value, amazing to be in the middle of a shopping mall plenty of big fish ,being tunnelled underneath good fun,kids would love it.

Mind-blowing experience for all ages! . Absolutely breathtaking! This aquarium is so amazing and enjoyable for all age groups. Location is great and easy to access. The fish are so close that it feels like you are swimming with them. There is also a great variety of creatures.We booked an open bottom boat tour as well - so neat. The staff is extremely nice & great with children. Gift shop is a must. This will be a staple to every one of my Dubai trips!

Good Attraction Indeed. It was my second trip to Dubai when I get a chance to visit this lovely aquarium and really thought why I did not come here before..Very good experience and my family had lots of fun exploring it. Specially the acts of sea otters at Underwater zoo were mesmerizing.

A good mall activity. After a while, malls can indeed be boring and amongst the many mall activities on offer in Dubai, this one is pretty good. The tunnel is very well made and although a little worried that it would be a 2 minutes walk only, I found myself staying for a while.

As close to fish as if snorkelling. We thoroughly enjoyed the visit to the aquarium in the Dubai Mall. There was a huge variety of fish, including many sharks, which you could see at close quarters when walking through a tunnel under the enormous tank. The fish were very well cared for. Behind the scenes was interesting too.
Must visit. Enjoyed every sec. of the trip. Everything so nicely Created & maintained. Very nice experience & a must visit place specially with kids.....

if this is the first aquarium you visit in your life, then do it.... It is overpriced and overrated. If you have visited other major aquaria in Europe or US then dont go for it. The tunnel which is so vastly advertised is a disappointment.

Total waste of time. If you saw aquariums in Barselona, Lisbon, Monako, Xcaret and alike you would be bitterly dissapointed by rather poor structure of facilities and aquarium itself, and limited choices of species as well as geography of represented regions. If you didn't see any aquariums before, then it is certainly place to go for 1 hour.
