Charge your camera because you will want to use it. The presentation here is really wonderful. The creatures are all around you. If you don't pay attention, you may meet one.You'll walk under or through a huge aquarium - getting to see the fish from all angles. Then, you'll walk a path that brings the fish up to your face. You will want to put your hands in the water but DO NOT!!! You may find a shark lurking. A truly wonderful experience and I was frightened the entire time I was there. I would not suggest this for children who are rambunctious as there is lots of open water. You will not get wet but you will need eyes on the kids. One area allows you stand over the world's largest alligator in captivity. This takes a deep breath.I loved every minute and remind you that I was scared most of the time - especially in the darkened section that shows you what inhabits the desert at night.....egads, creepy!

entry fee to high same like other underwaterparks. if u have not seen the others it ok to spend so much money , if you have seen then just forget to spend money here , its all the same unless you are a underwater freak and are missing too much rest is same like other all have been developed on same theme , this one is no different !

Awesome place. If you git into the Dubai Mall, you'll see the Aquarium - blue glass cube with lots of fish inside.Entry fee is very reasonable - if you listen carefully and don't forget to go to Level 2 to Underwater Zoo.Prepare yourself for LOTS of walking, catch spare batteries for your photo - this is extremely needed.We've spent there 3 hours - and every minute was filled with pleasure.By the way - now it's not only "underwater" zoo - you'll see also desert lizards, bats, parrots and so on (level 2M).If you're tired - there are several coctail and snack bars right there.

Nice. Nice aquarium within the Mall, though small but have some wonder full fish ( like sharks). Have some activities also, under water zoo is also features some wonder full fishes & animals like crocodile. Can spend some time during a visit to dubai mall which has plenty of other activities too.

To high a cost for the attraction. We went to the oversized Mall to see the aquarium , paid 90 AED each for walk through and fish feeding . I agree with other reviewers you are on your own and have to shimmy round the photo touts throughout . Got to the fish feeding ,so crowded could not get in, without a wait so gave it up It is a spectacular aquarium but could be seen from the outside nearly as well . Save your money and view from outside the other attractions a large croc and some other stuff ,nothing special

Fantastic. Great experience. Where else could you find an aquarium in a shopping centre as good as this? Worth lingering to see such a variety of fish, rays and sharks, and not forgetting the alligator!
Great Fun. This is a great place to spend a few hours! Adults and children alike it's over 3 floors so it's bigger than you think.

Wow wow wow. This place is outstanding. Gorgeous. No other. Best time to go is on Friday before payer. Nobody is around. You can get the best pictures. Centrally located in Dubai Mall. It takes you to a different world.
brilliant. a bit pricey but as a one off brilliant experience the best thing was seeing King Croc it was one of the most amazing things to see it so close up and the penguins

Time your visit for King Croc feeding time!. We enjoyed this far more than we expected to!Not really being aquarium visitors - once you've seen one fish . . . we were pleasantly surprised at the extent and quality of the various tanks and useful information and it was easy to get around. The two storey tanks visible in the Mall are a fascinating introduction to the displays upstairs.

You can view the Aquarium from the outside , no fee. We paid to go in , bit you can see quite a lot free from the outside. What you are paying extra for is to go "under the tunnel " and if you have not done this , you might like to pay the extra. Also paying you can see the "crocs" but of course many zoos in uk have those .. So unless you feel you HAVE TO pay for the extra, you will see enough free from the outside . ( try to see dancing fountains, which are outside and" dance) I think about 6pm !) We ate ate the "choc heaven " yum !
Amazing. Impressive to pass beneath the sharks, it feels like you can even touch them. This days there is a big crocodile.
Nice. This was quite nice, but I liked Singapore one better. Anyhow big screen with very big fishes. My daughter liked pinguins and they were very friendly :) The place to visit
Enjoyable. I thought the aquarium was an enjoyable way to spend an hour. The new crocodile is quite large and amazing. Children would certainly love this venue.

Go at feeding time. We did the walk through tunnel to see sharks feeding, then had lunch in the mall (you exit into the mall before going upstairs to the rest of the attraction) which enabled us to see the penguin feeding and king croc feeding without having to wait around for ages or miss out. We just had a standard ticket but also options for boat trip and behind the scenes tour. Would recommend.
Wonderful. The aquarium can be viewed for free, but going through the tunnel (paid attraction) is fabulous. The underwater zoo is one of a kind, definitely a must-see.
Riveting. In the middle of Dubai Mall and all the hustle and bustle such an oasis of calm. Underwater zoo was brilliant and not to be missed
Self paced. Unfortunately there is no guidance or explanation, simply let you follow your own root and do your own discovery. Staff are only interested in sales of photos. Disappointing to be honest

Fantastic and must visit with kids. Went there with my wife and daughter. I have seen similar aquarium in Singapore. However this was good. This is in Dubai mall. You can watch fish and other animals while strolling in the mall. However I would recommend that you buy tickets and go inside the tunnel and then go to 2nd floor to visit underwater zoo. Underwater zoo is fantastic. You can watch Penguins, King crocodiles and several other fishes and sea creatures. My 6 yrs old daughter just loved it. Even adults would love it. Strongly recommended.
great day out. took a friend who was visiting me out here in dubai. the zoo had changed a lot since i last visited and i was very impressed

Nice attraction. It is a nice attraction in the Dubai Mall though I felt that it was a bit over priced. If you get the entry tickets to this as a package deal with other attractions then could be worth it.

Dubai Aquarium. Although it's the 2nd largest in the World, it is NOT worth it....there are better one. The glass bottom boat is about a 10 min ride and the tank has a small surface area. The glass tunnel...well Sydney is 3 times as long. Fish feeding...well you are given about 5 pellets. Okinawa is the third largest in the World and it has Whale Sharks!

Not too impressed. I was very disappointed with the underwater zoo. You see the same view outside (without paying) as you would walking outside. I felt it was a waste of money that I could have spent more usefully elsewhere.
Good but not the best. The Attraction is good but its a one time attraction.We took the best available ticket still there was nothing much to do for us.Recommended but just like any other attraction.
Good experience. It costs 80 dirhams and was excellent value for money. Excellent viewing areas and a very good collection of fish. Families will live this!

Dubai Aquarium. Aquarium TankOne of the largest suspended aquarium in the world.t houses thousands of aquatic animals, comprising over 140 species. Over 300 Sharks and Rays live in this tank, including the largest collection of Sand Tiger Sharks in the world.
excellent. this was inside the main shopping center it was great, lots to see and do. i would def recommend. we also went on the boat inside its a glass bottom one it was fab.
Amazing. Aquarium and a zoo inside the mall are one of a kind. Can't get enough of the aquarium. They should have added more animals in underwater zoo.

Great Aquarium in the mall. Dubai Mall has the most amazing aquarium which starts off with the tunnell and you end up having a behind the scene look at the conservation plus feeding the fish from the top of the tank. It's not to be missed.

Great. Underwater Zoo is fantastic - lots of different species to see. Aquarium is spectacular as well, most impressive the large rays casually swimming around. Went on a Friday which was a big mistake, quite a lot of people to compete with for the view.
A good few hours spent. Interesting, different, memorable and well worth the visit. This placed in the middle of a mall has to be seen to believe. You don't even have to go in to be amazed.

Underwater experience w/o getting wet.. Imagine having an experience underwater without getting wet in a mall is uniquely out of this world. Never I've imagine having a big aquarium about two stories high with different large aquatic creatures swimming right infront of you. This attraction is absolutely not just for kids but for adults to enjoy. Wow! Is about the word I can describe this awesome scene.

Must visit places in Dubai Mall. This is the biggest aquarium inside a mall. The size is huge of the aquarium and also there is a zoo on the 2nd floor. There is a option to even dive inside the aquarium for which you pay extra. Not as good as the one in Singapore, but still for Dubai it is a place to visit.

awesome. its worth visiting this aquarium and underwater zoo.....i guess instead of me describing how the feeling was.....one should visit this whenever you happen to be in Dubai....specially for the children

A Magical Underwater Experience. my family and I visited the aquarium and had the best experience ever. The children especially loved it and the boat ride on the surface is an absolute must. The boat has a glass bottom so visibility is fantastic. Not only is it beautiful but such an education for the children.
Nice. Best collections of aquatic underwater creatures. The rare collections like, Seahorse and many such can be seen here.

Nice experience!!!. I went to see this aquarium & underwater zoo along with my wife in the month of July. This was my first encounter with such an amazing aquarium though the tunnel was bit small as I was expecting bigger. They recently added one more attraction to the family which was a big crocodile. If you haven't seen such aquarium before, then it would be good experience. I would recommend it for all the visitors to have a look.

Beautiful. This aquarium is one of the best we ever saw, the tunnel is not very long and not so interesting than the one in Sydney (Australia), but inside : the zoo ,it is very well organised, with a lot of different animals. It is like if you were in a forest or a river with crocodiles.Nice decoration.Amazing place for children and adults.

Better display in my aquarium at home. Please do not ignore this review, DO NOT even buy the basic package. My wife and I visited the aquarium and underwater zoo whilst at the mall and now seriously wished we hadn't wasted our cash. You see more from the mall side and only have 10 yards of tunnel to walk through, before you have to go from the ground to 2nd floor to see anything else!! We paid extra for the behind the scenes tour and fish feed. We couldn't hear the guide and I see more action feeding my tropical fish at home than I did here. The King Croc was cool to see, but it looked depressed, which was probably down to the small enclosure and people banging the glass for a reaction. We felt absolutely cheated by the aquarium, there are awful displays, stressed and sad looking animals and bored/rude staff. Dubai has been wonderful apart from this little blip. I repeat DO NOT pay for this. Keep your money and treat yourself to something in the mall, it'll last longer!!

Big and huge Aquarium. We visited the lost chambers at Atlantis and than Dubai aquarium at dubai mall.. This one is just is amazing with 2 floors and you can even enjoy the under water zoo with activities. Good price if you buy combo ticket.. worth a visit
Awesome. Just amazing , you could spend more than one or two hours watching different types of sea creaturesDon't waste it , you must watch it

First aquarium experience. We did the standard platinum package which included a walk through the aquarium at your own pace followed by a walk through various other sea and wildlife on the second floor of the mall. I am normally afraid of sharks etc but decided to give this aquarium a shot and it was stunning I am glad I did it in Dubai! There were a lot of sharks in the aquarium and we got some really good pictures. The second floor was great and we spent most of our time here looking at the king croc which is humongous along with penguins, various fish and reptiles. Overall a great experience and would highly recommend!
nice experience. It was really beatiful :). Very nice underwater ZOO... We love it... You can diving in aquarium. :))

Kill a couple hours in the aquarium. The aquarium's standard package (platinum) includes a walk through the enormous fish tank, and a display of sea life and nocturnal animals in the mall's 2nd floor.You really can't beat otters but they have some other animals too. Including small penguins, a large crocodile, turtles and some... fish.An aquarium is one of the places where you go "oh, this is cool, I must take a photo of this!" but the reality is that there is very little light to get good marine photos. So maybe just enjoy the otters and chameleons and buy the photos from the gift shop :)

Beautifully presented. We were recommended the Aquarium and it is certainly worth a visit as it is beautiful and feels very new and so clean as is the whole of Dubai. It is very well laid out and this was another attraction we stayed longer than intended. The staff are very helpful and friendly and I think this is another must for Dubai.
best in Dubai mall. Situated in Dubai mall . . . .all aquatic species . well worth the trip . . .you can go for diving in the aquarium . . . . well worth

Shark Walker Experience. We arrived at our destination. The Dubai Aquarium, situated in the Dubai Mall. Today, even though Annette can't swim, we would be doing the shark walker experience. This involved being lowered into the aquarium in a glass cage while sharks, manta rays and all manner of fish swam past your eyes. We had booked through the extremely Al Boom Diving company who always put safety first.We entered the backstage area of the Attraction and were given our safety briefing by a knowledgable Philippino who took us through the various do's and dont's. After we had satisfied him that we had correctly mastered the hand signals we proceeded to change into our wet suits. I don't know if you've ever put on a wetsuit before but it's like a workout. You have to contort your body into Karma Sutra like positions just to pull it up your body.After all the hard work the result is tremendous. My jelly like body pushed at every seam threatening to tear at the fabric. Flattering they are not. Annette emerged from the dressing room looking far better than I and we set about putting our weighted belts on, this would help us sink to the bottom of the cage.Annette was started to panic now as we took our first tentative steps into the icy water. I went 1st and was quickly in the cage next to the instructor, whilst Annette stood shaking her head at the top of the ladder.The instructor told me to hold the inside bar, not the top ones as I didn't want to lose my fingers to a shark, whilst he went to help Annette. I'm sure bubbles poured from the back of my wetsuit. Once we were both in the water, Annette panicked as her feet couldn't touch the bottom. Also, giant fish were already inside the cage. Let me just explain the basic set up of this cage so you have a clear picture. It's a cage. It has a glass floor and the bottom quarter of all sides is glass too. The top half is all cage, no glass. Fish can swim in and out at will and if you put your hand outside of the cage, it's considered food. Got that? Good, I'll continue.Once we were both in position our helmets were lowered onto our heads and we were submerged.As we descended, all the wonders of the aquarium came into view, Manta Rays as big as blankets glided past the cage effortlessly, fish of all shapes and sizes came up to us for a closer look. Sharks circled as Jaws music played in my head making the occasion that more scary. Annette looked scared as fish entered the cage and the helmets we had on magnified everything.Underneath us people gazed up from a tunnel in the aquarium and to our left thousands of shoppers gawped through an enormous window as our instructor filmed our time under the water.We were dropped lower and a pain developed in my right ear. I had to put my hand underneath my helmet to equalise the pressure in my ears, by holding my nose and blowing until my ears popped.As I held Annette's hand, I mouthed "Are you okay?" But she wasn't. She was starting to get pains in her chest. Thankfully the attraction was coming to an end and as the cage rose from the water, our helmets were removed and we pulled ourselves onto dry land.After about 40 minutes, I managed to removed my wet suit with the help of a giant Hawaiian who just happened to be hanging around the locker room in the Dubai Mall. Lucky me.We collected our memory card of our time under the water, thanked our instructor and headed off in search of sustenance. A truly amazing experience that takes you safely into the underwater world, which is safe for swimmers and non swimmers alike.

Great Big Mall Pond. The first thing that one sees approaching the Dubai Aquarium from the Dubai Malls main entrance is a short side with the tunnel just to the right and this belies the gigantic side which must have been at least 30 feet high and perhaps 60 or 70 feet wide. Apparently some 20,000 fish reside here and comprising tiger sharks, eagle rays, guitar fish and schools of giant travally, a woebegone or two and certainly made for a fascinating view of the underwater world.Entrance to the aquarium at AED110 per person included traversing the tunnel directly underneath this huge fish tank, access to the underwater zoo and a glass bottom boat ride and fish feeding, although this comprised the boat 'guide' tossing four pieces of fish into the water for the schooling GTs.The underwater zoo proved a little more interesting and covered a range of fresh and salt water species and the highlight of which is a five metre long crocodile.Interesting subjects included king crabs, a lung fish, otters, and a small cooly of penguins although I couldn't find the literature on what species they were.If you happen to be at the Dubai Mall, do drop by for an interesting 1-1.5 hours of some pretty fascinating creatures. And oh, if you're so inclined and have around AED300, they'll even let you scuba dive in the giant pool!

AED 110. The dubai aquarium and underwater zoo was a little over priced i felt. I paid AED 110 for the Aquarium, underwater zoo and boat ride.The aquarium walk is the best part as u can see a lot of fishes and SHARKS. The underwater zoo is ok....the king croc and penguins being the main attraction.The boat ride is quite sad. you feel u r on top of a tank. Like most things in dubai its a bit over priced. But none the less for AED 70 u should do the aquarium and underwater zoo once as its only a different experience....nothing else.

Octopus!!!!!!. Yes I loved everything like everyone else. The only thing that really really upset me was the octopus. I've seen documentaries on how intelligent an octopus is. So I found the conditions this poor chap is enclosed in is unacceptable. He/she is in a small trianglular shaped tank that's it no entertainment no space to swim nothing! This poor creature must feel like he's in a cell. PLEASE put the poor creature in a bigger tank with things to keep him/her entertained.

Vast and free..........well you have a choice.... If you're in the Dubai Mall you literally cannot miss this exhibit. It covers three floors and everybody gets to see the fish in action without paying.The bit you pay for takes you into the Zoo and close ups of tropical creatures including crocodiles , pengiuns and undersea animals and fishes.There is also a boat trip above the aquarium where you are up close and personal with sharks and Giant Trevalley. The boat trip needs more activity in my view, such as a commentary. You also have access to the undersea tunnel where huge fish swim over you.On reflection I probably would not do the ZOO bit if I was to do it again.
Great for kids. Fun place. Fantastic for kids. Went as a couple and it was ok. Little pricey for what it was, but for a family DEFINITELY worth a visit.

Crocodile is King. This was an atraction we did not plan to visit, but the impressings big aquarium window at the mall was very exciting and inviteing. You will not regret this, no matter your age. Many interesting things to see for both the young and old kids. The prize goes to the Croco King who lives in the aquarium With his wife. An extra plus to the video telling the background og how the crocodiles ended up in Dubai.

Amazing underwater life up close:). Truly an amazing experience.. starts with sights of sharks when u enter the tunnel where it's nice to see them really closely..moving forward many small fish can be seen moving in groups..the tunnel ends near rainforest cafe.. entrance to the underwater zoo is on second floor.. all the fish in underwater zoo are mesmerising.. the colors, patterns and shapes are remarkable.. however the main attractions remain the otter workshop, king crock and penguins.. as u enter the underwater zoo there is a vending machine that offer chocolate, candy drinks and water.. inside the zoo there is Carribu cafe that offers coffee l, muffins and croissant.. so even if ur only visiting the aquarium and underwater zoo there r lot of refreshments available..over all a lot of fun..

Sharks Alive. Isn't the largest aquarium I've see, but I have never seen one in a shopping mall, it spans three storeys of the mall and a tunnel through the centre of it on the ground level. Worth visiting it and walking through the tunnel.

Should take the time . It is cool in a way hard to explain. A zoo and aquarium inside a mall! Way overpriced, but a fun experience for those wanting a zoo visit with a different setting than all others :)
Had a go, worth a visit. The aquarium is pretty amazing, sharks swimming over your head as you walk through a glass tunnel.The Mall is fantastic especially the musical fountains? A must see!

Heart of Dubai Mall. The aquarium is the centre of Dubai mall in my opinion, absolutely gigantic, besides being a natural gathering place for underwater fans it offers great insights for shoppers and tourists alike

The shark tunnel is good fun. It isnt the largest or eventnebest aquariumI'veever beento,but itis the only one in a shopping mall. the two storey tank is great, though the actual aquariuminside will appeal more to kids than adults. Make sure you go up to the second floor near Chilis and Macaroni Grill to get anupclose view of the tank.

Definitely worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit when visiting Dubai Mall. It is 18 months since I was last in the Aquarium and I think the attraction has improved over that time. The boat trip on top of the aquarium was a surreal experience but the real value here is in the excellent series of aquariums and the reptile zoo. On two levels it is something special.

The kiddies love it. Its a must see thing if you are in the mall .Plenty of variety of fish , lovely colours and a well maintained aquarium. Like everything in Dubai its bigger and better than the rest .

Take the basic package unless you really want to dive. It's an interesting visit though not a must see. The king croc is not as big as I thought. The video on the king croc flight from Australia to Dubai is eye opener.
Fantastic. This underwater having limited space is really above expectations. Having many variety of fishes... Collectively its a great spot.
Huge aquarium. We enjoyed the aquarium, under water Zoo & the glass boat we had fun, it is really huge, there are lots of rare animals, birds, fishes & crocodiles

Nice for the children. We did the package that has gives access to the tunnel, the underwater zoo and to fish feeding and the boat ride. To be honest, I wouldn't repeat the fish feeding or the glass bottom boat ride. But the tunnel and the under water zoo were both great. The walk through area kept the children busy forever. And they have this huge crocodile there too. The Penguins were nice to see too and there is lots of information on all the animals you see. I would definitely recommend it. We all really enjoyed it

Fun place if you like wildlife. Was fun to see the different types of wildlife and marine life. Well setup and easy to follow routes. Penguins were the cutest. Great place for family and kids. The glass bottom boat was alright but not an essential thing. :)

Awesome experience. The aquarium tunnel is small and nothing but the underwater zoo was great.All types f animals from tropical to penguins were there. But the main attraction was the 5.1m long giant crocodile.

Amazing Experience (Especially Children). Having an Under Water exposure inside a Mall is truly amazing. The boat ride was very good. Seeing aquatic life beneath (Glass Floor) your feet is truly an experience. Kids enjoyed the underwater Aqua tunnel. Especially the Underwater divers who were maintaining the Aquarium. "Scuba Diving on a large screen". The experience was good seeing different kind's of Fish on display. The STAR attraction was the KING CROCK. We are so used to seeing Aquariums as stand alone places of visit. This one has a good experience for tourist who do not want to pay and visit. Limited viewing from the mall but at-least they get a gimps of the aquatic life. Good souvenirs to take home. Worth a One Time visit.

A good view BUT VERY EXPENSIVE. A big size aquarium that too inside a mall is always breathtaking. And especially if you have so many sea creatures it makes the things more beautiful but the biggest downside is the cost associated with everything and that too phenomenol. The entry fee is too costly and if you have to buy something for your kids.......overly expensive. It is better to spend that money on other attractions in Dubai and see the aquarium from outside. It is clearly visible and you can take pictures. A slightly better pricing would result in all the crowd standing outside to come and visit inside but you see more people outside than inside only for the reason of price.
Aquarium. My kids like this place too much and me too. It has huge amount of aquatic organisms and also we saw the penguins there. It is very nice place.

A unique scenery, but over priced!!. Great place to see the sea creatures and take pics but a standard entry ticket costs 180 Dirhams, The gift stores inside are expesive, and an optional professional photo will cost you 250 Dirhams, You'd rather spend the money at other far more interesting places in Dubai :)

Nice place to visit and watch fishes and some not so common animal species. It is right in the Dubai mall. Aquarium is good but the underwater zoo is better. One can easily spend two to three hours watching various species of fish as well as aquatic animals. For a layman, it is a wonderful opportunity to see them.Little expensive for the tastes of common men and little less worth than what is charged, especially fish aquarium.

Aquarium in the mall?. Of course it's breathtaking when you see such a huge aquarium with sharks right in the middle of the shopping mall, but why then pay for a visit when the entrance fee is very high? For us it was enough just to stand outside and watch the fish.
What an experience. Fantastic place to visit especially for children. Amazing creatures and such a variety of sorts. Trully worth a visit when at Dubai Mall
Underwater world. I was shocked to see such a big aquarium in a place like Dubai. So well maintained, different kinds of fishes, big area, blue water, endless praise.
Amazing. This was just fantastic. Easy to see everything. Great fish. Some incredible sights. Really loved this. I thought the price was good. Well worth a visit

Stinky and Waste of time. It wasn't that awesome. half of aquarium is on ground floor and another on 2nd floor. It was ok not that many spices of fishes. It was have lot of crowd and small place, too congested.

well worth seeing. Visited the Dubai Aquarium with my family; two children. a well laid out attraction with lots to see and enjoy like the glass bottom boat, the sharks, the rays and lots of sea creatures. Souvenir photo was great, with Dubai aquarium frame too. price is reasonable for this attraction. we really enjoyed it.

Must visit. This is an excellent zoo and you can spend almost more than 2 hours in this zoo. Good underwater life which you can see through the glass..Different varieties of large fishes and reptiles.....

Whoa! Are we in a mall still??. What a pleasant surprise! I expected this place to be a tourist trap in the midst of the world's largest mall- how wrong was I! Nestled inside the Dubai Mall, a mall that not only covets the title for "world's largest", but also is home to the aquarium, a massive dinosaur skeleton, the cliff diving fountain, an ice skating rink, and so much more, can easily take you 2 days to see it all. But you didn't click on this to read about the mall. I only touch on it because it is so wild to experience this attraction in the midst of people eating cheesecake and buying shoes mere meters away from you!Anywho, this attraction, firstly, is a very high value. At just 70AED, you can easily be entertained for 2 hours. You start off from the outside observing the massive glass window of underwater specimens before you dive deep into the tunnel where you get a closer look at the creatures from the depths. Once you are done with that experience, you head upstairs to see fish and other creatures from around the world in a beautiful display of nature mixed with artificial plant-life.Finishing off the experience, you will pass by King Croc, a massively recognizable crocodile as one of the biggest in the world. Head into the less impressive animals of the deserts surrounding the UAE, and your tour will come to an end.Throughout the experience there are toilets and opportunities to buy some snacks and such.The biggest flaw that I saw is how confusing and over-crowded the inside area can get. They definitely need to improve their signage as well as there crowd-control. I would love to see them make it more informative and interactive as well.Thus, I suggest allowing 2 hours for this experience and being satisfied with the 70AED option. Other perks of more money are, I believe, unnecessary.Happy shopping explorers!
Kids loved it. They really enjoyed it and it's definitely great value for money. The zoo is very well done and lots to keep kids entertained.

Tanks too crowded. Large tanks absolutely full. Sad to see sharks with little room to move. Also the same story with a huge crocodile. Purely a money grabbing exhibit with little emphasis on conservation or teaching about various species

Not exceptionary. Wasn't amazed by the aquarium, maybe because i went diving at the red sea and saw alot more fish species, and alot more colorful corals. The water's smell stinksBut overall the place was goodDon't take the boat its a waste of money and time. The Zoo upstairs is nice

Unexpected Enjoyment in a Mall. Walk in aquarium with water tunnel. Upstairs is the underwater zoo - lots of fishes and other mammals too, including penguins and crocodiles. Not to be missed. Only issue is they are spread out and you have to hunt for the places.
Best and beutiful. It is near dubai mall....If u are interested in ocean studies it helps a a lot....I have visited twice to this place..... 30-45 min is sufficient to see...

surprising small aquarium, dissappointed. We were dissappointed that this was a surprising small aquarium. Tickets were not too expensive but not worth it. The aquarium was tall and pretty and had cool fish and sharks in it. I thought when we rounded the corner wall that we were about to go into the entrance of the actual aquarium but was told that that was the end! It was very very small, very short time to get to the end. Max 30min and we lingered for a while with the kids! wouldn't pay to go in if I knew that was what it was like! The one in the Dubai mall is almost exact same and free to look at!
A little dissapointing.. We were a little bit disappointed. A lot smaller than we thought. The underwater tunnel was awesome and so was the boat ride over the tank but the rest was average.
Not big at all.... Honestly, i expected a bigger aquarium, but its only the tunnel and 2 floors of small tanks.... there were some sharks, huge crabs and shiny fishes but it was a rip off!!!!!!

Very cool. Amazing fish , well kept aquarium . The place is huge and the amazing fish, Sharks stingrays. We got to feed the fish . There is a glass boat experience and not forgetting the king croc , not to be missed at all. Really smart!

Small aquarium. If you have been to aquariums in other places then this would make no sense to visit. The great big glass paneled tank can be seen in its entire length from outside while in the atrium of Dubai mall. All the sharks, sting rays and most of the fish are visible from here. Just stand in the Dubai mall lobby and watch for a while...its free. The cost is expensive and the only things of interest inside are the King Croc which was actually huge and the penguins. Rest of the limited variety of fish didnt impress. We opted out of the glass bottom boat. I would have rather spent that money on a good buffet meal for 2!

Enjoyable and educational. Located in the Dubai Mall, the aquarium is very impressive. You get a free glimpse from the giant glass wall that faces into the Mall. Pay the fee and you get to go inside the tunnel. The tunnel is not all that long, but there is a huge variety of fish to see, and the sharks and rays are favourites.It's then up the escalator to see more exhibits and tanks - we spent an hour here and it was not enough to see everything comfortably. We then went on the glass bottom boat, which is a nice perspective to see the aquarium. Enjoyable and educational.

Very Entertaining. Before Dubai Aquarium, I also visited The lost Chambers, but I would say that Dubai Aquarium is much much better. There are more variety of fishes here, and of course the attraction is the Aquarium dome at the entrance, it's unique. In the zoo, you'll find many species of fishes, stingrays, penguins, a 40 year old crocodile, turtles, sea otters. This trip was very entertaining, especially for kids. We also went for a boat ride, where you can look down into the aquarium. The boat ride was good but was for a very small time.The only thing that I disliked was that they took our family photo at the entrance, without informing that we'll have to buy it at the exit for 150 AED. I would say, that's criminal!!!

damnnnn. dont go to this small aquarium at all,me and my friend paid 220 derham for full package,but the aquarium is too small,just only 50 meter length!!!!! i saw much better aquarim in pattaya or in istanbul. watching fishes from glass boat also was a joke .i didnt liked it at all

Great Experience. Very impressive, would be interesting and informative for both kids and adults. Take the boat ride (the boat is made of glass) as part of your visit and you will be able to see fish swimming under your feet.
Very interesting. This was worth the time and money. Beautiful aquariums, well kept premises, and an amazing King Croc that you mustn't miss.Really fun!

Aquarium. Really good aquarium/zoo and well worth a visit...not overly expensive (around £20) and the King Croc is certainly an amazing creature....wide range of fish - colourful and fascinating...some of the information boards at rather low heights but this apart an excellent visit - boat ride not overly long/exciting but considering this is all inside the mall a fascinating use of space and design....

Great aquarium. I love aquariums and this one didn't disappoint. It's in Dubai Mall and we went for the platinum package which gave us a glass bottomed boat ride and a pass to the attached zoo. It was all very interesting and the boat ride was very informative. You can look right down into the aquarium and the guide was very knowledgeable.

Lots Of Marines But Same to others. Its very big one with lots of marines inside but for me nothing extra more than other aquariums in Kualalumpur or other Aquarium allover the world. i tried the glass boat but boring

Impressive inside and out.. I had heard of this aquarium beforehand, but actually stumbled across it rather than seek it out and find it. Its not massive like the Sydney Aquarium but to find one inside a Shopping Mall is highly unusual. If you pay to go inside you will be quite surprised by what you find. It is quite big in there and on several levels. I opted to feed the fish as well, and whilst not a long experience, it was fun.The biggest surprise was the other bits. Not so much "underwater" zoo, but reptiles, bird, insects and the star of the show - King Croc.Was really deceiving from the outside how much was available to see on the inside. They probably should rethink how they "sell" this attraction as I thought it was just underwater creatures. Very little was said about the above ground critters (and bigger)Worth the money and took a good couple of hours to see it all quickly. You could easily spend 3+ hours inside if you really like your wild life.

Like most Aquariums.. Visited with my 2 sons ages 6 and 9. It is in the Dubai Mall, and extremely busy. Whilst enjoyable it is very similar to most Aquariums that you can visit all over the world. It was super clean and all the glass was spotless so that was good.We did the behind the scenes tour which lasted about 15 minutes, but it was very interesting.Worth a visit if you haven't been to an aquarium before.
Nice experience. Was a very nice experience and took many selfies that look absolutely amazing with the water and all the fish in the background. Kids love it.
Amazing. Really amazing place where you can find a big number of different types of fish in one place. You can also go down the tunnel under the aquarium to enjoy the view from inside.
Awesome experience. To fish lovers, I recommend the Dubai Aquarium and Underworld water zoo. The tunnel at the entrance is impressive. You have different kids of fish. The setting is very exotic.

King croc looked miserable.. We visited the aquarium while at dubai mall. We were very impressed by the fact there was an aquarium in the mall.Waking through the tunnel with all the creatures swimming around was fantastic. After that is got very average and once i saw the giant Australian crocodile in a tiny pen i decided to leave. Previously king croc was a wild animal in Australia and his being on display there seemed wrong to me. Id recommend it for little children who would enjoy the smaller fish ponds but its no place for a King Crocodile.

A must do and you will find Nemo there too!. As adults we thought it might be a bit past us, but WE WERE WRONG. The aquarium is a must do as you get to see the fish as the really are, and the upstairs ZOO of smaller fish is an added bonus. We spent over an hour wondering around and checking out all the displays. PS, they have a HUGE 6.9 meter crocodile that takes your breathe away.

Up close with the fish. Compared to other famous aquariums (say London aquarium), this one is quite small. It still offers a welcome break from the shopping. Try to watch fish feeding when an attendant in scuba gear feeding all these manta rays and sharks. Unless you want to walk underwater tunnel though fish is visible from outside aquarium for free. Underwater zoo is not actually underwater, it is a collection of ponds and small aquariums with the sea life. Quite educational.

Expensive aquarium visit in the middle of a shopping mall. if you don't want to lie by a beach all day or shop 'til you drop then Dubai is probably not the place for you. Having found myself in Dubai whilst my husband was at a conference I thought The Dubai aquarium offers might offer those of us who don't want to spend all our time doing those things an opportunity to look at something different. It is however, like a lot of other aquariums world-wide and rather expensive for all that.It's highlight is a massive crocodile which is HUGE but in a pen rather too small for it and it's mate. There are other good exhibits but I was left with the vague feeling that I had been ripped off. -maybe I'm just a bit of a skinflint.

Wonderful experience. We weren't sure whether to queue and buy tickets to go inside the aquarium as you get a fantastic view just from the outside but it was well worth it especially the underwater zoo which is actually upstairs! We enjoyed the experience and , amongst other things, learning about the croc which was transported from Australia to Dubai. Luckily he has a little friend with him in the enclosure which looked a bit bleak but presume this is the habitat crocodiles like?
Lots to see. Really good aquarium but especially enjoyed the zoo. Loved the chance to go and feed the fish. Nice to visit especially if you are fed up of shopping!

Awesome Attraction. We visited the Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo. The highlight is the huge aquarium wall which can be seen freely from outside the aquarium and the tunnel for which you need to pay. After the tunnel, one can proceed to the underwater zoo which has displays of various type of fishes, turtles, sea creatures (Crab, jellyfish, sea horse etc.), reptiles. Overall, it takes about 1.5 to 2 hrs and is a good attraction. Tip - You can buy a cheaper ticket if you book in advance online.Very attractive design & atmosphere, we enjoyed the underwater zoo and Aquarium.
Huge. This is based in the Dubai Mall, it is in the centre of the mall covering three levels. Well worth a visit

Amazing Aquarium. Very attractive design & atmosphere, we enjoyed a lot 90 minutes round underwater zoo and Aquarium, we have taken a lot of Photos inside, photos taken by them are very expensive more the entrance ticket

A nice aquarium inside the mall. We visited the Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo. The highlight is the huge aquarium wall which can be seen freely from outside the aquarium and the tunnel for which you need to pay. After the tunnel, one can proceed to the underwater zoo which has displays of various type of fishes, turtles, sea creatures (Crab, jellyfish, sea horse etc.), reptiles. Overall, it takes about 1.5 to 2 hrs and is a good attraction. Tip - You can buy a cheaper ticket if you book in advance online.

entertaining but crowded. The kids enjoyed it, lots of marine species in one place.. they need better signs on how to get to the zoo section from the ground floor. Be ready for massive crowds (we went end of December).

Not worth bothering, and over priced. If you have seen an aquarium before then don't bother going through this one. It is not particularly spectacular to walk through. You really see enough of it from the inside of the Dubai Mall anyway.

Own GoPro not allowed for shark dive. An average aquarium but was well excited to do the shark dive, then found out that I couldn't use my own GoPro camera and that I had to hire one of theirs. It hardly seemed sensible that after spending a substantial amount of money for my own GoPro, to use for such occasions like this, that I would not use it and pay to use theirs. So I cancelled the dive and have booked a REAL shark dive in South Africa (own GoPro's or any underwater cameras are not only allowed but encouraged). My advice, if you want an authentic shark dive, don't waste your time with the Dubai Aquarium, fly straight to South Africa and do it there along with many other activities.

Wow Just Wow. Saw it for 2nd time, and it had not changed, rather tickets had.
Used Entertainer, buy the Zoo pass as well.
Photographic place and a very big alligator.
Some how it is crowded and Staff is nice.

wow fun time with family. Beautifully made.
I have got chance to visit underwater zoo with my family
and everyone have thoroughly enjoyed the time we spent.
Really a good place, beautifull view of Aqua life

An Amazing Aquarium. Visiting the aquarium inside the Dubai Mall is a great way to take a break from shopping. It was amazing to watch sharks swim above you as you walked through a tunnel in the aquarium.

Who Needs Submarines?. With 33,000 marine animals, and the horseshoe crabs that have remained unchanged to this day from 450 million years ago and considered living fossils along with the crocodiles, this place has something for everybody. The aquarium is magnificent and awe-inspiring, while the underwater zoo allows visitors to interact with some animals and learn about them first hand. The place is wonderful and is worth a visit.

Well presented and managed. Excellent Show of Sea life.. Liked the 3 levels access to The Aquarium. A wide range of tropical fish that included Sharks, Rays, Groupa etc. An Octopus was fascinating to watch and I had the impression that he or she was watching us as closely as we observed it.The place was clean and the staff attentive. Well worth a visit.

Fun. so I did a glass bottom boat ride & then tunnel under water.They had vast variety of fishes ( interesting for some people ) had 2 big crocks, an Octopus as well. Glass bottom ride was best of all attraction, where you see 100s of different type of fishes just floating under your feet.They also have option of diving, which I din't try.
Kids will just love it. My kids 5 & 3 years old just loved it, the younger one still asks us everyday to go back there.Shark, crocodile, penguins and various other fishes are the highlgiht.

Love It. Lovely way to spend the day. Many different types of underwater wildlife. Love the massive tank where you can walk through the tunnel and see all the sharks and stingrays and fish. King Croc is also pretty cool. He is one huge Croc that's for sure. All in all money well spent. Great for kids especially.
Awesome . It was an awesome experience watching the sea creatures. And the creativity of the humans.Definitely must go n watch attractions.

Scuba Shark Dive!. We upgraded to the Dubai Mall Aquarium Speciality course so it went towards our PADI divemaster, and we are so glad we did! The briefing was very informative and told us about the most popular fish & sharks. The first dive was an orientation and we stopped and knelt at the bottom of the aquarium at 4 different locations to watch the fish/sharks swim past. They get so close! It's amazing to be inside and see people watching from outside and in the tunnel.The second dive was all about identifying the different breeds and photography-getting the perfect photos of us and the sharks. We got some really amazing photographs. The third dive was in the shark cage, which was a bit daunting! Two staff fed the sharks with fish on poles through the bars, it was fascinating watching the sharks come in for the kill!Overall I would recommend this activity for any divers, it's a must see- a shark swimming straight for you! If you're not PADI qualified you can still snorkel or use a bubble helmet. Well worth every penny!x

Big collection. The big big aquarium is one of its kind and can be viewed without any fees from within the mall. It houses plenty of different fishes and you would love watching each of them move.
You should definitely check it out.

Size is impressive, that's about it.. Murky, confusing, dark, loud, crowded, unorganized, understaffed and just.... odd. Hard to understand the layout, you can see places with no clue how to get there. Inexpensive, as it should be. When you finish the "zoo" part, (which may or may not have a "petting" part, we were never clear on that) if you want to walk "through" the aquarium, you must kind of leave the exhibit, walk around outside the attraction a bit, through the mall, go downstairs, then enter the part that goes under the aquarium. Just odd. The exhibits are actually open to the public's ability to reach in and grope, drop items in, attract and annoy creatures, no matter the "do not" signs... and they certainly do.

Great sealife zoo. Really enjoyed this experience, the sealife zoo was high quality, very interesting, clean and well laid out. The fish/aquatic creatures looked well looked after and healthy. The tunnel experience under the large tank area was short and I enjoyed viewing the sealife from the large side of the tank available in the mall itself rather more than going underneath. We didn't do any of the added activities like behind the scenes but they did look interesting. This was a relatively low cost activity and went well with a visit to the Mall. The only confusing point was that the underwater zoo was 2 floors above the tunnel and it would have been helpful to have been told how to get from one to the other by staff in advance.

Great for children and adults. One of the best aquariums I visited bit place gets very overcrowded. I advise taking the package with boat ride which we really enjoyed and that is when you realize how huge is the tank in fact.

Unique tunnel under an aquarium !. Although this is not one of the greatest aquarium or zoo it is a very nice experience if you are visiting the Dubai Mall. The aquarium is 2 stories high and you get to pass under it with all the fish swimming around. It makes great photos. It inexpensive and you can have a break in the worlds greatest mall.
It doesnt reflect Dubai high standard. The place is just too small thus it gets crowded. Some display is intetesting but it is just not a reflection of Dubai standard of doing things

Dubai Aquarium. Fantastic place. Got so many species of animals. At first I thought the tunnel was all there was till I went up and I was just awed at how large the whole place is. Could do with more signs though. Looks similar to the Bristol aquarium but I must say it is more interesting. Must do is the boat ride just for an extra 30dhs. Really wish Id done the snorkeling though

Sharky!!. I'm happy we visited the aquarium especially for the underwater tunnel and the crocodile. If you are on a budget you get a pretty exhaustive view from the outside as well..The fishes are very abundant - the tank seems unnaturally overcrowded to me - many sharks that you can observe from really close bye. The Dubai Mall was really crowded when we got there, but we just had to wait 10 minutes in line to get tickets. Their website declined 3 times 3 different credit cards.
Shark-tastic!. One of the best aquariums I have ever visited. Worth taking the package which offers the glass bottom boat ride.

Lovely. The Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is an awesome sight to behold. Presented at the Dubai Mall, it is reported to be the largest aquarium in the world. An excellent variety of marine life is on display in an elegant, easy to experience environment. Wonderful & highly recommended!

Just amazing!. Well curated with an very extensive display. Excellent aquarium for all ages. The line up to enter can be quite long however the staff are very efficient processing your tickets. You can get your ticket at any time during the day/night you want to visit. I would recommend earlier in the day...opens at 10am....as in the evening it is extremely crowded.

Awesome. After visiting at the top, we went to Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. We opted for ultimate package which has glass bottom boat tour also. Turned out to be very good deal.Aquarium is nice, not too small as some people complained. I would say it was reasonable.Underwater zoo at higher level was also nice with lots of breeds of fishes on display and some fancy area (rope bridge etc). Glass boat tour was excellent they will make you wear life jacket and answer all the queries while this short tour. Boat driver cum guide was very informative.Very good attraction for families.

Pretty decent !!. Aquarium is in Dubai shopping mall is quite something. Aquarium itself is pretty good with the largest croc in the world, king croc and plenty of sharks around.It has many species, Good experience with the entire family as well.And finally if u get tired of the Aquarium, theres always a mall right there :)

Fishies and Sharks!. Our 20 month-old grandson can't stop talking about the "fishies" and sharks. Obviously, this was a great experience for him to learn all about sea life. The glass tunnel through the aquarium is amazing, and the sharks are especially impressive, but the rays are quite a sight as well. The variety and sheer numbers of fish are just, . . . well, amazing seems to be the best word! The underwater zoo is likewise a wonder to experience. We watched the handlers feed the King Croc - my what a big animal! And, all of this at the Mall! Wow!

Short tunnel. The tunnel is so short. .. but i got some photos. Nice concept. There were some very pretty n very ugly fish gosh some looked scary lol. I had a good walk around at the zoo. I noticed the lady selling tickets opposite the souk was rather impatient with customers on the 30th dec 2014. In general though most customer service staff in dubai are rude from my experience

Wow Factor for Young Children. We took our 3 year old and 18 month old on 30/12 and it goes without saying it was busy. We paid quickly, we got in quickly and the tunnel is quite small so it's like a traffic jam to be fair, but you get used to it, and my children's eyes were popping out at all the animals they could see above them, next to them, all around them! Lots of great photos of smiling children and cheeky sharks and sting rays. The aquarium itself only takes about 20 minutes to cover, but then you go up to Level 2 for the underwater zoo. We chose the fish feeding package for an extra AED 10 per person so our kids could interact with fish. Note: while Dubai Malls free prams are a godsend for the Mall itself, the aquarium and underwater zoo are not child friendly; the underwater zoo was great with the otters, fish, crocs, penguins et al; again for the children there was wow.We fed the fish, that was a little bit of fun, but you drop the food from 5 meters above the fish and we couldn't really understand what the guide was saying, so you could probably go either way with the optional extras.All up, a great 90 minutes or so for us and our children; on top of what you can see externally as a non-paying visitor, well worth the memories. If we didn't have children we probably wouldn't of done it, a lot of people have commented on other aquariums around the world, but say what you say, it is unique.

'Must visit' when comming to Dubai with kids. Visiting Dubai for Agency business and family leisure, I attended, with my wife and 6 years kid, Dubai mall and the ‘Must visit’ Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. We chose the 80 AED/Person package (same price for Kids) for an ‘Aquarium Immersion’ in the Tunnel taking photos of sharks, large and small fishes and visiting divers headed by local monitors. The most interesting part of the visit (80% of our visit time) was the Underwater Zoo with its numerous and well-presented and preserved species. Very instructive and valuable photos can be taken. At the end of the visit the Souvenirs shop offered 10 AED discount per person for relatively good quality products.
Amazing . Walking underneath the fish was amazing, especially the Sharks. Then upstairs to see the rest if the fish in tanks.

Under Water Wonder. Unlike any other aquarium which we have visited, this one can be found in a shopping mall. Lots to see from piranhas to a huge crocodile which has been relocated from Australia, extremely busy, so be prepared to wait.

Under Water in a Mall..!!. This Aquarium is not amongst the usual ones which you see in the middle of a city. It has a lot to see open-mouthed. The endless teething of the Piranhas or the longest Crocodile or the desert animals. An aquarium like this could not be expected inside a Mall. At times you drop your jaw, other moment you may think these poor animals are restrained from their right to live free. Anyways, a good place to visit in Dubai especially with a family...

EXOTIC . Omg!! Omg!! It was awesome!!I dont have words!! Would u mind if u see playful penguins...sharks above your head with their mouth wide open... Sting ray with a smiling face... Alligator!! It was a nice experience... Loved it all the way!! Kudos

Better than shopping. The fact that they have an aqarium in in shopping mall is quite something but it would be better if you could skip the mall bit. The aqarium is ok and there is a massive crocodile in there, my wife refused to believe it was real. One thing that is a bit negative is that you have to buy a ticket with a voucher for the gift shop (10aed each). As there were two of us we just about had enough to get a fridge magnet between us, which I think is a sneaky way to get people to spend money and wrong.

Sharks !!. It was awesome to see sharks swimming above your head and not being eaten alive by one of them. It had a huge variety of sea life on display. The glass bottom boat ride turned out to be a disappointment.

Great Fun for the Family. You walk past that wall of water in the mall and you might think like I did on my first visit to Dubai...this is enough. Why pay to go in. There is more than just the tunnel. Upstairs there is a whole exibit where your kids can touch a starfish (wash hands first) and enjoy looking at many different species. If you have young children make sure you download the cartoon Octonauts which teaches about the underwater. My son knew the names of some of the fish from watching this show and it was great getting to see him experience the real thing. Its worth the price.

Definitely worth a vist!. The aquarium is neatly maintained and the variety of aquatic species are too impressive. Don't miss the underwater tunnel and the fish feeding. It's noteworthy that they managed everything so clean and attractive within a mall..

Sea world in a desert?. Reasonably priced for the number of sea creatures displayed at the aquarium.it is VAST and covers a huge array of creatures from across the world ranging from sharks, turtles, crocs to penguins and jellyfish.It's a treat for the eyes, and a very new experience.

Worth a visit . Went with my 5 year old and 7 year old. The kids loved it. There's a large variety of animals from numerous types of fish to penguins, The Croc and nocturnal animals (our favorite part of the exhibit). Its not huge and you can factor in about 2 hours for the whole aquarium. We visited it in the evening (after Ski Dubai in the mall of Emirates) and ended the day with the dancing fountains which turned out great. Just try not to do it on a weekend as there can be quite a crowd. Also don't get suckered into buying the photographs they take. Some of them are forced on you and they do rack up quite a bill!

Fun place to visit at the mall. The aquarium is pretty cool and the up close view you get going through the tunnel is definitely a different experience than the "free view" you get in the mall. The underwater zoo is what makes it more worth the cost though. There are quite a few things to see in the underwater zoo. From the giant croc to the river otters it is a pretty fun stop for a family with small children. They have quite a variety of things to see for the family. On the downside they do take photos and then try to charge pretty crazy prices if you would like to order them. I would have actually liked a print but the prices were just too high and then they are going to turn around a throw away the print they made? This sort of thing always bugs me a bit. Overall I don't think it was a great value compared to other aquariums but it was a nice way to pass some time given the high price tag on many things in this area it seemed like a reasonable price overall especially with the gift store credit you get with your ticket purchase.

Great experience. We went to the aquarium with a five year old and a ten year old. Both kids just loved the experience. The walk through the tunnel stunning not just for kids but for us as well. The variety of fishes on display was amazing. The under water zoo was also wonderful. The exhibits were all unique and intriguing. The kids were thrilled.Over all a total value for money.

Nice Aquarium, but not sure about the "zoo". You can't miss the aquarium in the Dubai mall as it's in the centre and you can see it from all floors. It's huge and reaches almost through all floors and you see sharks and other fish swimming around. Once you pay the entry fee, you are allowed to walk by the aquarium from the outside and take pictures, then make a turn where they take pictures with you (which you can buy later for a hefty fee). You can then walk kind of inside the aquarium through a tunnel where you see water everywhere. It's roughly 25 meters long and that's it from the aquarium. You then proceed to the 2nd floor for the underwater zoo where you see different fish, crabs and crocodiles. On the upper floor, there were additional animals like owls and others that are active at night. It can be very crowded at times as it's not a huge area but a lot of things packed into a small room. Cost was AED for the cheapest entry which is fine.

Best Aquarium I have ever been to!. Great value for money. We went for the top package which is still pretty cheap considering what there is. We have been to a few aquariums and this is the best one yet- the underwater walk was very impressive and there were so many different types of marine life to see. The crocodile was pretty impressive!

Beautiful and worth to visit. As you will see there amazing architecture and beautiful animals living in sea of different spiecies then you can take a trip in small glassy ship after that you will visit the zoo ..after you exit it you they will give you a gift for you

Excellent Aquarium but less impressive shark dive expereince. The Aquarium is truely impressive from the outside and inside, so it's worth paying your entance fee. The tanks are well kept and interesting. My family decided to do the Shark Dive in the tank. Overall it took about 2 hours as you have to be there for your introduction, video and safety checks. The staff are very thorough and ensure you are happy about everything. We made one mistake and that was to ask for a video to be taken (an extra Dhs200). Most of the time diving was spent getting into a position for the video and this meant less time viewing the fish - the reason we decided to dive in the first place! Well we've done it once but it was too restrictive.
A good experience. Well worth going to see especially with children. The King Croc and explanatory video is very interesting. Seeing the divers in the tank also makes for an interesting experience

2nd biggest aquarium in the world.. This shopping mall needs to be seen to be believed, we weren't even going to buy anything in particular but I definitely wanted to see this aquarium for myself. It is stunning when you see it when you enter the mall, every type of fish you can imagine as well as stingrays and some pretty big sharks too. You don't have to pay if you just want to look at it from the outside only if you want to go throught the tunnel that goes through the bottom of the tank or go to the underwater zoo which is located on the first floor of the mall above the aqaurium. You can also pay extra if you want to go diving in the tank.We went to the underwater zoo which was quite good, it houses the king croc, penguins, pirhanas, otters, octopus and loads of other things. Some of the tanks and enclosures did look a bit small for the size of the animals that were in them though which wasn't good.This was a free attraction if you didn't want to pay for the zoo so that is a big plus and why I give it 5/5.
A must see. Not to be missed, aimed at the guest and well designed. There were animals I had not seen before or even heard before.
King Croc and Wife. I love the crocodile. I was told he is planning on raising a family soon. I also like the variety of underwater sea creatures. The desert animals are not well portrayed.

Penguins in the Middle East. where else but in the Dubai can you find penguins and sharks in the middle of a shopping mall. Worth paying the small amount extra to do the short glass bottom boat and access the zoo to see the Penguins and giant crocodile. You will be very disappointed if you only pay to access the very short tunnel through the aquarium.

Very good day out with family. For those who would love do dive in an shark infested ocean but are too afraid to try, this is the closest you can get to a full size shark and be safe and dry, plus, the kids love it.

Hyped attraction !. It may be a very popular attraction in Dubai but was more of hype to us...There are lots of small and large tanks with varieties of fishes and marine life including large crocs and penguins (which were interesting parts), but somewhere it disappoints....May be we expected too much. The underwater part comprises of just a short tunnel where you have to stop to see the marine life over your head and besides you. The free gift vouchers are only sufficient for an unattractive gift...for anything else you need to shell out good no. of dirhams. The kids enjoyed somewhat but as I mentioned earlier...we had expected something better and bigger.

Excellent Aquarium. Spent a couple of hours here very interesting with a vast variety of species, we did the fish feed staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. The entry price was very reasonable and included a free gift. Well worth a visit
Huge Aquarium. Different underwater species are found in this huge acquarium built inside the mall. Majestical setting.

Another jaw dropping Dubai attraction - some of it free. The world's largest aquarium wall in the world's largest mall at the base of the tallest building in the world... and the outside view is free! It costs a bit to go through the perspex tunnel and a bit more to visit the underwater zoo and a lot more to go diving. But probably the most awesome bit is the free bit! I can't recommend it enough.

Wow. must visit . Amazing experience.the place is surreal.even if it is quite a short tunnel, you continue with the underwater zoo, which is a very interesting place.we managed to take amazing photos in a very beautiful scenery.You can also see the tunnel from outside, it is very impressive like that but I suggest you to go inside for an amazing feeling.

Massive. It's the biggest "fish tank" I have ever seen with the biggest variety of fish species in it. You can buy different packages that allows you to do certain activities and there's a mini zoo on the inside. Lovely for the family.
Underwater tunnel. Can be visited once. The underwater tunnel is awesome and a very good aquarium. One can also try scuba diving inside but it is very expensive.

Impressive!. unexpected sight in a shopping mall. Very impressive and interesting and colourful. Did not like the many push to have your photos taken. On the day we visited, there were some wet areas which were not signed and could be dangerous. Other than this, it was most enjoyable.

A must do for the bucket list travellers!. It felt a little like we were on a conveyor belt, handing out money at different points of the journey, but the children loved it. To finish off the experience the jungle themed restaurant next to the pay-desk/exit of the aquarium is cool.
Nice aquarium.. Nice aquarium in Dubai Mall. We used our entertainment vouchers and paid just 1 entrance. The best were sharks and rays. You can also pay for a little zoo.

A Uniqu Experience. I found the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo to be one of the most surprising things I have done on holiday. At first we just went to look around the shops at Dubai Mall, then we realised there was an Aquarium in the middle of the mall. This sea life was amazing to see in such a random location for an aquarium. But well worth the visit. We did the boat ride on the aquarium with made this visit even more unique. Would highly recommend if you are in Dubai Mall with time to spare.

"GREATEST SHOW" under water ZOO. Wonderful way to start off a site seeing tour of DUBAI, you can find a major surprise at the Dubai Mall. If you enjoy watching sharks and rays face to face you and your little ones will truely enjoy amazing aquarium. This underwater zoo is the best I seen in my life full of 1000's of underwater sea creatures. Your visit should include the walk upstairs to see the main tank or even a dive in the aquarium once you completed the training a great experience for anyone.

Must see for all ages. Went with my wife and three year old son; amazing views from outside and incredible when you actually go inside walk through the glass tunnel. There are are several large sharks which swim next to the glass tunnel and the giant Manta Ray is something to behold. On the second level there are smaller tanks with more exotic fish, turtles, king crabs (about a metre in size), and penguins. The star of the show is the crocodile; there is a life size replica at the entrance but you only appreciate its size and power when looking at the real thing in its tank.Great place to go even if you're on a tight schedule as it will take about an hour to view everything (depending on how quickly you want to walk).

Unique Experience. This huge aquarium is located on the first floor of the Dubai Mall and can be seen as you walk around as well as on the next floor too. It contains so many fish and is certainly a unique experience, for anywhere, but especially in a mall.

Surprisingly big. At first I though that it will be only the visible tunnel (you can see the front of the aquarium in front of the Cheesecake factory) but it was a lot more than that. The zoo is a proper size underwater zoo that is worth the time and money to visit and the tunnel itself is just magical.

Loved it. Amazing aquarium. They have king croc hundreds of other species. The main tank in the mall is amazing. I loved watching the rays with there faces on the bottom lol would defiantly go just to do it. It was lovely. And the penguins were my highlight.

Kids and Creature lovers - Go for it!. Planned the visit for my 4 year old and i'm happy that she enjoyed every bit of it... Easy to access right in the heart of the Dubai Mall. Easy connectivity to Metro. The 10-million litre Dubai Aquarium tank, located on the Ground Level of The Dubai Mall, is one of the largest suspended aquarium in the world. It houses thousands of aquatic animals, comprising over 140 species. Over 300 Sharks and Rays live in this tank, including the largest collection of Sand Tiger Sharks in the world.There are numerous ways for visitors to experience the main Aquarium tank, which measures 51 metres in length, 20 metres in width and 11 metres in height.
Beatiful!. I loved everything about it. It is one of the most beautiful aquariums I have been to. Recommended stop when going to Dubai
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Wow, I was amazed and I have enjoyed Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo, if you are planning to visit Dubai you MUST visit this place as well.

Great experience but needed longer. So many things to see and do in the Dubai Mall so could only spend a short time watching the fish etc. Not realising the size of the Aquarium was a shame but it is on my list for next visit to Dubai. Advice to travellers is to take plenty time if you are doing a stopover in Dubai.

Nice!. Better than Hong Kong Ocean Park's aquariums — more variety of animals and the place is well kept. Good value of money especially seeing your child having so much fun and amazed. It's just difficult to get a nice photo without other tourists in the frame.

Awesome Experience. Located in the midst of what is in every intent and purpose a "shoppers paradise". It was a welcome, dazzling break from frenetic shopping in the Dubai mall. The Giant Crocodile was a special attraction and I found the boat ride and accompanying shark observation very exhilarating. it was an overall splendid experience!

Perfect when you need to pause yourself from the shopping. After you've spent a few hours among all of the shops in Dubai Mall this aquarium and underwater zoo is the perfect place to rest and relax. It's (of course, it's Dubai) an enormous aquarium and you can walk around and be amazed by all of the creatures existing underneath the surface. It's well worth the money.

Good couple of hours spent with our 1 year old here, great experience. The underwater tunnel gives great views, lots of sharks, rays & interesting fish to see, & the aqua zoo kept us entertained with all there was to see. Our daughter particularly enjoyed seeing the penguins, otters & turtles. We fed the fish & went on the short tour to see behind the scenes. Would have liked to go on to the water in the glass bottomed boat but our little one too young for that, so another time (think minimum age was 3 - am told well worth doing if you can). King Croc very impressive (over 5m long), but did feel the staff didn't know too much about the animal - I'd asked if he & his partner had had babies / if they'd lived together in the wild or been caught together etc, & didn't get the impression that they knew the answers... But other than that, a really good way to spend a couple of hours, we felt good value for money, & our daughter really enjoyed it.

a great experience... inside a mall!. I had the chance to visit the zoo inside Dubai Mall last week. It was a great experience, approaching underwater animals through a glass tunnel (sharks, stingrays ans so much more), as well as incredible animals like otters, giant crocs and so on. Definitely recommend

1 time drop. I liked the overall of the aquarium. so many types of underwater creatures. there is a glass bottom boat trip which and they will tell some good information. you can buy some souvenirs. it's a nice tour for all types of people (apparently people who doesn't hate the water!!).

Must see!. We loved this aquarium, located right in the Dubai Mall. You do not have to go inside the tunnel, however I recommend it. We thought it was a neat experience and we got some terrific photos. We also included the underwater zoo in our ticket which was pretty neat as well. This is another 'must see' of Dubai!!!

good experience - educational for kids. you can see the aquarium from outside. if you just want to see the fish, there is little need to go in. if you pay to do the whole thing it is a good experience, educational. do the whole thing - under the archway and the exhibits. nice experience. worth it but quite short for the price realistically

Well worth a visit. There is a lot more to this place than you realize take the full package (110 AED which includes 20AED for the shop) and you will visit not only the tunnel but a glass bottom boat ride a really extensive jungle themed aqua zoo complete with penguins and a giant crocodile.Great for the kids and the grown up kids!

Dubai Aquarium - Awesome. Ok, so after living in Dubai for 6 years, I can tell you that they Dubai Aquarium is an awesome place to spend time with your Kids. It's important to note that the underwater tunnel is like 30% of the experience and there is a whole aqua zoo, which you have access to, as part of your ticket. Keep in mind that if you go on a Friday or Saturday afternoon, it will be insanely packed out and wont be much fun at all, we used to go early in the morning as soon as they opened, and there would be no one there, so yeah, enjoy

An impressive aquarium. Dubai Aquarium has a lot of fish as one would expect from sharks to rays to other kinds of fish that i dnt care abt their names but that look good especially the tiger rays they'r extremely beautiful.. beside that there's a section for desert animals and insects and smaller fish and star fish which u can touch as well.. there are penguins, owls.. u can feed the fish or even swim with them for an extra charge. I highly recommend it. Go early in the morning when it's less crowded.

Lots of hype - if you've seen other aquariums. If this is your first - you'll be dazzled and go 'oh wow' but if you've been to other, more accomplished aquariums (my comparison is with the US and SE Asia), this is extremely average and fairly ordinary. It isn't close to what Dubai could have actually put up.

Unexpected Gem. Wow what a delight, im so glad i decided to go in and have a wonder. Honestly didn't think it would be that big. We even experienced the glass bottom boat and giant trevalli feeding. The aquarium and enclosure where amazing, not to mention the 6 meter long giant crocodile how the hell did they get it there, well there is a video on it must watch.A beautiful little sanctuary with 750mm thick perspex wall, that is unbelievable thick!! And i think 10million tones of water sitting in the middle of a shopping centre.

Amazing experience. The aquarium is huge and can see various fishes including sharks. The tunnel is also very nice.The place is fun for kids to look at sea animals and fishes. Our kid was very happy and really enjoyed . very pleasant break from shopping .Loved it.

stop over. This was part of our free entry via city sight seeing tour. Very good experience. The aquarium is amazing and the underwater zoo was great to. Would be a wonderful experience for kids. Such an amazing range of animals and water life.

Nice place to visit. The location is inside the Dubai Mall.. after shopping time you can enjoy. Its a biggest aquarium i would say.. where people can swim inside.charges are there but doesnt matter fun unlimited.

Overall good, but nothing spectacular. The aquarium tunnel was quite frankly disappointing. It was very short, and the alot of the aquarium can be seen from the outside for free. There was nothing very special or unique about it. If you ONLY wanted to see the aquarium, I highly recommend you DO NOT buy a ticket. Just look from the outside in the mall.The salesperson outside the aquarium, sold us the most expensive package without discussing the contents of the package we were purchasing or even mention the other cheaper packages and what they offer. It went like this: "How much does it cost to enter the aquarium tunnel?" "110 dirhams each". We only knew of the cheaper packages later on. It felt quite dishonest really. The Underwater Zoo was certainly better, but nothing special compared to other aquariums I've been to in other parts of the world. Fortunately our 'Ultimate Package' got us into a number of sub-attractions including a glass-bottom boat ride, fish feeding tour, and 20AED vouchers per person redeemable at their gift shop.The glass-bottom boat tour guide didn't look very passionate in what she was doing. It was like she didn't even want to be there. Our fish tour guide was good, but very short.So to sum up:- Dubai Aquarium: Bad value, not recommended- Underwater Zoo: Some ups and downs, overall was worth it.

Not bad. It's small.. if you want a real aquarium go to Atlantis resort. This one is good for kids only. And the tickets are over expensive. The good thing about it is that it's located in Dubai Mall So you can do 3 in one; shopping, eating and take a tour in the aquaruim.
