Aquarium in Dubai Mall. Aquarium itself is a bit disappointing, it's just a very short tunnel and in some respects you see just as much on the outside! However we did enjoy the underwater zoo which was worth the visit.

Underwater life and beauty captured in elegant shopping mall space!. The location was great as we were able to visit the mall for some shopping before entering the underwater zoo and the aquarium. The entrance tickets were a bit pricey we thought but the informative experience made up for it to some extent. We will certainly visit again when we return with our children.

It's okay. It is not really a underwater zoo. It is all right. Aquarium is like the one in lost world in Atlantis. It is very short. You can see the same things from outside in mall without buying a ticket.
Fantastic and enjoyable view . I was in dubai mall ago 1 day with my friends. I had fully enjoyed over view of attractions. This is a one of my favourite place . I will be their next time.

Plan to include in tour visit. An awesome experience when you see sharks just across glass! The kids were really thrilled. In the water zoo the variety of creatures is really good. You got to see king croc to believe that it can be kept in the large glass vessel

So close, So calm..Amazing underwater world.... One of the best attraction that Dubai can offer to its visitors from around the world. Amazing aquarium with best collection of aquatic life. Also an underwater zoo where one can watch all the exotic animals including amphibians like king croc, snakes etc. Glass bottom boat rides are a good experience with families... Diving classes are also arranged for interested people, but quite expensive. Overall a very exciting experience..and if you find good deals or dicounts on entry tickets, its awesome..
Dubai Mall Aquarium. Great, specially for children. You can spend some hours walking through the underwater zoo and feeding the fishes. Beautiful photos to be made.

Not just a fish tank. The architect did is well. Well planned with good view of the aquarium. Well defined areas made the fish more understandable. Loved the boat ride over the tank, although expensive. Bigger than what I expected.

360 degree view of aqua world!!!. Given its a bit of an expensive experience for Folks from USA when compared to some of the regional aquarium's in north east. The experience of witnessing cold water creatures in a desert is an unique experience in itself. The bottomless boat ride was a first time experience for our family in an aquatic setting, definitely worth the experience. Directions to get to inside Dubai Maill was bit confusing, once walling around one will understand their intention to make visitors walk through the mall, if you are not interested or spend too much time experiencing walking in a mall (which is no different than any decent mall in America, including the stores) look in the mall map and head your way ignoring the signs!!!Friendly staff were helpful with grinding and explaining all the attractions it's by their insight we learnt there was going to be a live feeding for crocodile at the Tim of our visit which lasted for about 15 min. Kids enjoyed watching the majestic crocodile get active for food with smell and the trainers presence. There was also bird feeding at same time in the same cage (2 PM local time).
Wonderful views of marine life. We saw more marine life than in any other aquarium. Great setting to stroll through with huge tanks surrounding visitors overheard and all around. A must see in Dubai!

More than meets the eye. Although visitors to the Dubai Mall can see lots of fish swimming around without paying to go inside the Aquarium, the inside displays and creatures found in this part of the world are quite interesting, lots of colourful exhibits from those living in the sand environment to water and airborne animals and mammals. Well worth the 80AED entrance fee, although when you are given 20AED as a voucher to spend in the Aquarium shop at the end of your visit, the t-shirts and usual tourist items are quite expensive, and the only thing you might get for the 20 AED might be a pencil or eraser, so a cheaper ticket would be more useful. Good entertainment for children fed up with shopping for maybe 90 minutes. Also a little awkward logistically as you have to keep your entry ticket after leaving the viewing tunnel to then go out, up the escalator, and then back in the upper floor to see the other exhibits. Not easy for less mobile visitors
The closest to a shark without getting wet. The aquarium is really great and it is much better if you go along the tunnel. You can have great photos here and the childeren will definetely love it
Emaar do it best!. Not really anyone to compare with Emaar in Dubai, everything they do seems to be done exceptionally well and the Dubai Aquarium is a stand out attraction.

Great for adults and kids. Visited twice now.No queues. Didn't bother with the optional "boat trip" etc. Very enjoyable. Interesting and fun to see, especially the large aquarium with full-size sharks etc. Kids also love it.

Gr8 fun for the family. Very entertaining waterpark with some unique rides and features.
Negatives though include:
1. Rides that end up in the lazy river and it is a hassle to go to the next ride easily.
2. Usually very crowded rides

a nice two hours. a good way to spend a couple of hours. it was well set out and we could walk round seeing all that was to offer. Also included in our ticket price was a boat trip. Good value and helpful staff

Recorded in the Guinness World Records. I visited Dubai Aquarium which I later learned That this is mesmerizing Aquarium which has world’s largest acrylic viewing panel’ (as recorded in the Guinness World Records ). This also, the largest attraction in Dubai Mall. This is a great attraction for families, armature photographers as well as people who enjoy marine life experiences. Best Wishes

A must see on any Dubai visit. Coming from Vancouver where there have a fantastic aquarium, I was not expecting too much, but I was surprised. This was a fun experience, I would have to say this is a definite visit on any visitors list of things to see. We book the pass that cost 110 AED per person this included the underwater zoo and boat ride. We spend almost 2 hours looking at the marine life. This is in the same mall as Burj Khalifa so you can do both on the same day! No need to pre book this, you can just walk up and pay. If you have young children they will love this trip!!

More than we expected . The aquarium and walk through was excellent and the zoo was even better, all creatures looked well looked after and in good condition, the croc was huge...not what you'd expect in a shopping mall....

Where other than Dubai could you see this?. Magnificent aquarium set in a huge shopping mal - where on earth could you possibly see something like this other than in Dubai? My children and grand children were absolutely mesmerised with its beauty and quantity of different sea creatures! Definitely worth a visit.

No information on what you will actually see. The attraction is overpriced and does not clearly state what you will see. We asked the lady on the front desk what we would see in the underwater zoo to which she responded 'there's too much to mention' I quizzed further how would we know whether it's worth 80AED per person (no child price) and the best she said was a crocodile and starfish.I would visit a proper marine zoo if you want to see these creatures, and urge the attraction to better educate their staff and remove demotivated employees from front desk!Save your money

Amazing experience!. Make sure you go to the aquarium and zoo it is definitely worth the money. My husband and I spent over 2 hours in them and both agreed it was fantastic. There is so much to see and the sheer size of the aquarium and being so close to the sharks and fish is amazing. Children will love it and you are able to take some fantastic pictures as you are so close to everything. My personal favourite was the penguins but plenty to keep everyone occupied.

Pleasant change from shopping. Huge aquarium in Dubai Mall. Reasonable price for entry and plenty to look at. We got the ticket where you do a glass bottom boat trip in the massive tank, good views of the fish and also of the people walking along the tunnel underneath. Made a very pleasant break from shopping and good value for money

One of the best world Aquarium.. Excellent place to see the sea life, with imaging zoo.
The large crocodile was scary.
My kids enjoyed like never been.
Excellent experience. Kids will love it - it is an excellent experience. Recommend the glass bottom tour. Make sure to give yourself atleast 2 hours to enjoy both.

A marvellous idea. I am giving this one extra star just for the fact that they have managed to construct a zoo in a Mall...at 80DHMS per head the pricing i would say is steep. But the experience does not let you down. You first go through the conveyor belt tunnel with underwater life coming alive in full splendour. You enjoy taking pics with Sting Rays and huge sharks really Up close and personal. Then you take the escalator to the second floor and you find the zoo ...yes a full fledged zoo in a mall!!!the king croc is a major attraction here...hats off to the Mall Management ...moving such a huge croc inside the mall requires some kind of an effort. Enjoy the Great display of a wide range of marine life.

Must visit !. This has to be one of the top attractions in Dubai ! Conveniently located in Dubai Mall, it's the perfect way to kill a few hours from the relentless summer heat ! Yes, it was 43 C outside. To say the least it wasn't cheap If it was very reasonably priced and our 2 for 1 entertainer vouchers made it even better. Just from the outside alone you can see how big the 'biggest aquarium in the world' actually is and together with it's underwater tunnel you can get a really feeling of being in the ocean. Everything is well looked after and themed very well on several floors. With it's multitude of animals from fish to penguins to crocodiles it's just incredible. The aquarium is incredibly big, clean and there are presentations several times a day. And it makes it a perfect spot for photography with perfectly blended colors and carefully controlled lighting. On the upper floors they even have a reptile house and various other attractions to keep you entertained.We visited the Lost Chambers aquarium at the Atlantis hotel in December 2010, so I think it's a close one !

Heavily advertised place. The place is heavily advertised, but nothing special in it. Overprices, the corridor is too short than it was expected, kids had no fun at all. Looking at fishes from outside is as just fine, as visiting the aquarium. Don't be fooled.

It's an aquarium..in a mall.. Visited a few weeks ago, still find it fascinating how they made such a huge feature in a mall but that's Dubai for you! it's expensive for what it is but it's a definite must do when you're here. I opted for the chance to feed the fish but it wasn't as expected as we were just given these pellets which you chuck into the water, wouldn't do that if i was visiting again. I did enjoy the place though but it's expensive for what it is so I would consider it a one-off.

It was OK - Spoilt by the photographers. The Aquarium is spectacular - however i would not bother purchasing a ticket, watch the fish on the outside, it's just as good. However 80D is not a lot to spend to go through the tunnel. It was amazing to see the fish lying on the tunnel floor.On a negative side - being in the Dubai Mall, you would expect that everything is ligit, but having some 'kid' (who is not a photographer) to take photo's of you when you are in the tunnel and then have them charge you 275 D for the photo afterwards is not acceptable. Needless to say I did not purchase the awful photo.
Beauty. Hi,Spend an hour and a half, good place for family and children, nice experience. We can see some beautiful fishes, Penguin, Sharks etc. Its on the bottom of Burj Al Khalifa.

SOMETHING I WAS TOTALY AMAZED. I came to the place for the first time and saw this Giant Aquarium from outside, I stood there watching all the fishes and then bought the ticket to enter and see from inside. My My walking thru the underwater tunnels to view fishes, sharks from the seas swimming just above your head, then move to other areas and see so many things, even opportunity to sit on a boat plying above in the aquarium with the live jackets on..Wonderful .. You can also buy soviniuers, advise bring your own cameras, so many photos to be taken but if you need a pro, upon entering they will take and upon leaving you pay and collect. Visit to the Aquarium is worth it for me.

Nothing Special. What a day make special if you come to Dubai and visit what it say the biggest aquarium. Just normal and nothing special inside and over priced. Not sure will be recommended and visit again.

Dubai Aquarium.. The view from the shopping mall is impressive, the tank is huge. After that it all goes down hill. the Tunnel is small, I have seen much better. The price of the photo is extortionate, we didn't buy. But what upset us most was seeing animals such as otters, crocodiles and penguins in small enclosures with no natural light or fresh air. I thought Dubai was a modern forward looking country, this was like going back 50 years.

Good experience. Visited Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo on 6th November 2014, was with wife and 6 year daughter. The aquarium is huge (two floors) and can see various fishes including sharks. The tunnel is also nice, kids will really enjoy. There are three different tickets AED 80, 90 & 110 and you get AED 10 per ticket to buy anything from the souvenir shop. Once you are out of tunnel then move to second floor using escalators and enter into the underwater zoo which has many aquariums with various see creatures. Do not miss different colored jelly fishes, king crock & penguins. If you are with kids then this is a must see place in Dubai, overall a very nice place to spend couple of hours.

its really great. i never experience such experience., Thanks to dessertsafaritours.com. Mr.Sunil +00971505754459 help me lot. my family enjoyed lot.His driver was well knowledgeable and took us the write place.

more professionality please !. I went to this place for a first time with my baby and 6 years old girl, once we attempt to inter a man asked us to stand in front of green background with no explanation..he just asked us to stand, I said 'thank you' and attempt to walk but he insist to take a shot for the kids, the girl refused so he insist to take a shoot for the baby..we moved and when we completed the underwater tunnel, a man came to take a ticket and then he showed me a pic for my baby..guess what..he take a pic for the buggy and his body..but there was no face..which means whether it is my baby or yours it does not make any difference !and the man said it is for 180 AED !!! surprisingly he also tries his best in very unprofessional way.. why?? I do not understand? my 6 years girl said in front of him that the pic was ugly! and he still trying with us..for that reason.. and for unprofessionality of those rude staff I recommend you to look from outside only..

A Not to be missed item. Nothing can prepare you and is quite bizzar to be shopping at Designer outlets in a Mall, turn the corner, and find a vast wall of glass 30ft high with Sharks, Rays and Grupers staring at you all happily swimming around.The total package to go thro the underwater "tube" and see the fish from a glass bottom boat + the sea zoo is around £20 each and in my opinion is worth it, but you can just stand in the mall and gaze in amazment for free....., not to be missed esspecially if you have youngsters with you.

Dubai Aquarium. Firstly the location of the Aquarium is good and well situated, The reception also is warm and wonderful, the site also contains various shops where you could carry out window shopping.The aquarium is the largest I have ever seen, so many different species of sea animals are present in the aquarium, it is also well maintained and neat, a wonderful sight for taking photographs, and also nice place to feed your eyes of various kind of sea creatures. it is a well recommended place for both family, couples and individuals.

Now here's an aquarium!. Loved it! Gets a bit crowded so you need to choose your time, but the size of the displays is simply remarkable. One could watch the tanks for hours. One tip is NOT to bother paying for the 'feed the fish' extra. One gets taken behind the scenes and basically drops a few pellets into the top of one of the big tanks. Nothing else to see. So unless you're interested in running an aquarium I'd give it a miss and enjoy the fish from the outside!

Impressive from outside. I had already pre booked the tickets while booking my tour from India so visited the same during our visit to the Mall. The place is fun for kids to look at different varieties of sea animals and fishes. The under water zoo is a better viewing experience with the dome shaped aquarium on top. Definitely not in the top To Do list when you visit Dubai

Must see attraction. If you have an hour or two to spare in Dubai then this attraction is definitely worth a visit. You get a great (free) view of the aquarium from inside the Dubai shopping mall where you will see plenty different species of shark and ray and various other fish. However, I would recommend paying the entrance fee (AED 70/90) and seeing the inner aquarium tunnel and zoo. The inner tunnel gives you an up close and personal view where you will get some amazing pictures. The zoo contains a large selection of tropical fish, otters, penguins, crocodiles and even desert creatures; scorpions, camel spiders, chameleons to name a few. You could easily fly through the entire zoo in under an hour but it should take 2 hours max at a leisurely pace to complete the entire attraction, taking in every single fish tank and animal enclosure.The only point to be wary of is the lowest entrance fee. The official website (http://www.thedubaiaquarium.com/en/Visitus/TicketInformation.aspx) shows that ticket prices start at AED 70 for adults, yet this price is nowhere to be seen at the actual ticket counter! The minimum package listed costs AED 90 which includes an AED 20 voucher for the gift shop; I don't like the way you are pretty much forced to pay for the AED 20 voucher! Another reviewer did say that if you are stern enough at the counter you can demand the lower entrance fee, without the gift shop voucher, so just something to be aware of. Overall great experience and would highly recommend

Combine with Burj Khalifa. When visiting Burj Khalifa get the combo ticket for the aquarium, it is a lot cheaper. The zoo is nice but nothing special really when you have seen other zoos in the world. The tunnel is also nice but again, nothing spectacular. The thing which does impres is the size of the aquarium- two storey glass wall is really something. I would advise to go there as an add on to the tower visit.

kids just loved it................. Its just amazing to watch the huge variety of ray fishes and others.......the zoo was spectacular... my kids just loved it......
Take your camera and keep clicking .......
The aquarium has a public viewing area . but is guarded strictly for 4-5 feet.its totally worth to pay and experience the spectacular sea life.

Impressive from the outside. Wouldn't bother paying to go in-the view from the outside is as good as it gets.The underwater tunnel is cool to go through but due to the curvature of the glass photos come out distorted.The "underwater zoo" consists of about a dozen fresh water displays and about half a dozen salt water displays.The crocodile and penguin enclosure are quite small and a bit sad. Get some photos from the outside and move on.

Exotic sea-life inside a Mall. When you walk into Dubai Mall you expect to see the largest number of retail shops under 1 roof but also see to the world largest in-house Aquarium & underwater zoo, was unexpected. The aquarium has a public viewing area but for 80 Dirhams you get to see some truly spectacular under sea life.. there is a 20 feet Crocodile, some scintillating star fish & jelly fish. Penguins keep the crowd fixed.. Then there is a Nocturnal section which is dark but looks natural with owls & chameleons.. The 50 Meter Tube is awesome with the Hammerhead sharks & sting rays clinging on to the glass gives you a feel you can touch the animal...

A must visit if you are in the mall . We decided to go into the aquarium after being so impressed with the wall outside - I've never seen anything like it! As well as the usual tour we did a behind the scenes tour and fed the fish which our children (8 & 11) really enjoyed. The aquarium itself is brilliant with lots of great displays especially king croc!! We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the mall. Like all these places you finish in the gift shop which was pretty expensive which is hm only criticism.

Amazing mall experience . I saw the whole project and the building phases of this aquarium on YouTube. And really appreciate the engineering. Every time I visited Dubai Mall I must pass the aquarium and just gaze into the amazing sea creatures. The idea it's self is amazing, going to a mall became boring, adding to it an enormous aquarium to it that's another story. Highly recommended.
Should surely see. I was happy to see 1 of or may be the worlds largest aquarium. If feels really great to walk through them & see them. A very very good experience. Loved it.
Dubai Mall aquarium. very good experience ,you can see many aquatic creature which are not normally seen,children will enjoy it

Must Visit. The Dubai aquarium is the worlds largest water tank with thousands of fishes located near the entrance of the Dubia mall.The aquarium is free to watch for all the mall visitors at a distance and looks massive with blue water and big fishes. If you want to go near then entrance fee is applicable. The entry has various options ... aquarium, underwater zoo and the boat ride.The aquarium is massive and has various shark and swordfish species along with other fishes. If you take the ticket, then you can go through the tunnel. The tunnel is not very long but provides a unique experience. Next stop is the underwater zoo on the higher level and provides all other animals. Not to miss out the giant crabs, jellyfish, crocodiles and alligators, penguins and many others.The best part of the aquarium is to enjoy a very short boat ride which is basically a transparent base boat ride on the top of the aquarium tank and last for about 10 minutes. The boat executive are very courteous and open to answering all questions. during the boat ride, one could see all the sharks and fishes beneath.Surely a must visit for all visitors coming to Dubai. Entire visit might take 2 hours.Can get crowded and hence plan in the first half of the day.
Nice. The aquarium is great, you come really close to the animals. Interaction and feeding of fish, sharks and salties.First time I've ever seen jelly fish in an aquarium, they are beautiful.

If You Don't Know About The Lost Chambers You Like It. Dubai Aquarium is what every disaster movie producer would like to have a screen play for. Housed in the worlds largest mall, you could visualise an earth quake, the aquarium wall begins to fracture, the crack gets bigger, then the earth shattering sound of the massive aquarium tank cracking, surging water in torrents as, marine life spill out, people run screaming, then it happens that large crocodile from Queensland called Harry, George or is it Steve cascades forward grabbing its first limb, as if biting into American tourist, who go swimming in a Billabong when told not to.Okay snap out of it, like I said if you haven't been to The Lost Chambers at Atlantis, you love it. Do note the view is actually better on the outside of the mall, where all shoppers can see it for free, that is unless you pay to meet George, Harry or Steve the smiling crocodile, who will look at you, like an appetiser, yummo.

Excellent to spend a few hours.. Want a break from the most fantastic shopping mall with out leaving the mall the Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo. It's well worth the money and takes 2 to 3 hours to cover it . Really interesting we loved it they have really interesting stuff not just fish. Snakes ,lizards, water rats, otters , salt water crocs from Australia . Great place. You can view the aquarium from a glass bottom boat and scuba dive as well .
Too expencive. Too much money for a small acquarium like this. The lost chamber of Atlantis the palm is better than this in my opinion!

Just OK . The (free) view as you are in the mall is amazing - such a huge fronted aquarium is a great to watch, however it is a shame about the advertising all over it and the guards standing in the way of most photo opportunities. The underwater tunnel is not too exciting - photos can also be hard to take against the curved surface. As you enter, a photo of you is taken (optional) which is very overpriced for what it is. How can these attractions get away with it! Glass bottom boat is very poor. Your in the roof space dragged around by an attendant who (in our case) didn't really speak to us. Glass bottom was wet and dirty so couldn't see clearly down. Zoo area was much bigger than we anticipated at first - some exhibitions are great, but as others have said the penguins and crocodile areas don't look too appealing - have seen much better conditions in the UK. Overall, if you have nothing better to do or want a break from shopping it's worth a visit but don't expect to go away mind blown - it was all just ok. Note that when we visited the pricing structures were quite complicated and the staff were not helpful (very rushed) in helping us choose which package to go for.

Great experience. Recent trip to Dubai. Had read the reviews on trip advisor saying it was a must see, and they were correct.Well organised, no mad queues for tickets, inside in less than 10 minutes. Might be because we went early.Entrance through a fantastic tunnel and I would definitely recommend paying the extra to take the boat ride. It was very enjoyable. Even my teenage son was impressed snd you know how hard they can be to impress sometimes :-).You can easily spend a very enjoyable 2 hours in there, and then exit for lunch in one of the best shopping malls in the world. (That's for a different review).

Very attractive Aquarium. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo located inside Dubai mall, the largest Mall in the region. It has one of the largest glass viewing Aquarium in the world. It has also underwater zoo in the first floor with large number of sea species. Also there is an opportunity to dive and do scuba diving with the fishes inside the Aquarium. It so attractive to walk through the vaulted tunnel inside the aquarium and watch the fishes around you. You can also take a boat on the surface of the aquarium to watch the fished underneath. Different packages available for different activities.

small and expensive. fan of fish or not this aquarium is not cup of my tea , small and not so interesting beside that u can watch it for free from outside of tunnel , is located inside the mall no need to pay extra for one tunnel which always is crowded with many people .

awesome. great attraction inside the dubai mall...the aquarium is a big one with a number of sharks and other sea creatures....the lights are changed to replicate the effects of day and night....there is also an underwater zoo with a nice variety of animals and fishes...they have recently imported an extremely big Australian crocodile...great place for someone who loves wishes and other creatures...nice place to unwind

Amazing visit with my children. We had such an Amazung visit , the glass bottom boat trip was fab with lots of information about all the creatures in the water, was quite amusing seeing a stingray get annoyed with himself . Old deo recommend to anyone of any age

not worth the money. The price is way to high for such aquarium. Poor crocs does not even have place to tun, the penguins are in a small , pretty filthy room without any sunlight, and so on The membership is worth it if they will actually give you the membership card. I paid over 2 months and half ago, was tad my card will be ready in 2 weeks, but as today, my card is still not ready . Ia sled them to check what happened to my card and to put a note there ( eventually to reprint it in case it was lost) but they refuse. They told me to come again and until then to use the brochure with the receipt. I usually do not keep receipts-and I did paid for a membership card which I did not get yet. Very upset with the way how they handle ( more not handle the problem) Very very disappointed especially that some people who apply after me got their cards
Awesome . Its a great place for those who love aquatic animals..a good place with great collection of all aquatic creatures..its a well maintained aquarium..loved it a lot

Not impressed. I took the VIP package when I went here, it cost 250 AED and it included all of the tours including "behind the scene" tour plus a personal guide. It has a huge collection of marine animals, 2 crocodiles and night desert animals.Now why did I give it a poor rating, two reasons:1. I have visited other oceanariums, same old stuff and nothing extra ordinary. 2. The cashier lacks proper training in handling customer queries, before I bought the ticket, I have mentioned that I have been to other oceanariums. She still sells me the VIP package, she reaffirmed me that I'll be impress. Although the personal guide and the tour was OK, it did not met my expectations. I already know half of the marine animals on display so having a guide telling me each and everything was no longer enjoyable. And lastly, tours were not fluid, meaning we have to go to the same place over and over again just to get to the next display. In conclusion, do not get the VIP Package if your not new to this kind of place. just get the basic package because their is nothing to miss.
Small but amazing. Well worth a visit if you are in the Dubai Mall, lots of fish to see and amazing to see them all up close, there is a great collection.

Kids will love it!!!!. Great for a one time visit. Located within the vast Dubai Mall, you need to pay AED 70 (adult) and AED 55 (kids) to visit the aquarium tunnel though external viewing is free. Though this rate is not advertised at the booking counter, one needs to be firm in asking for this particular offer at the booking counter. Other costlier options with glass boat and souvenir coupons are just tourist gimmicks.

Ok but have seen better. The Aquarium you can see free of charge as it is available for any visitor of Dubai Mall. The underwater zoo seems to me quite small. Tip: if you plan to visit Atlantis waterpark - try to see the zoo and aquarium there.

An amazing experience for people of every age. I was surprised very pleasantly on seeing this attraction. Its got one of the most exotic collection of fishes and is a very soothing and calming experience. ITs a must visit

Largest Aquarium in the World. It so beautiful to walk through the path inside the aquarium. After which you can take a beautiful boat road on the surface of the aquarium. Very good safely measures. Different packages available for the different activities. One could also do scuba diving. Lots of varieties of see creatures. The zoo is also well maintained and has some rare species.

Fun for 30 minutes. The aquarium is not the most spectacular. You pay a lot to walk under the glass tunnel and lines can be many times longer then the tunnel. Makes for a nice photo (don't pay for the formal photo). The zoo on the 3rd floor is way more fun for the kids. They can get closer to the creatures and the tanks are at perfect kid eye level. Is a nice break from whatever else you might be doing at the mall, just $$

Underwater in a tunnel. Great experience. Very beautiful and interesting. The glass bottom boat ride is disappointing though. Rather just do the tour. The glass bottom boat ride is not worth the money. You see more from the tunnel walk.
Unexpected goodness . Couldn't believe the amazing array of creatures in the underwater zoo. Just incredible. Such fun and much better than we expected it was going to be.

Good value. We visited and did the ultimate package which was worth the cost. Includes a walk through the aquarium, a boat ride on the top of the aquarium and a visit to the little zoo. The crocodile was so huge. When you first enter the aquarium tunnel there are several sharks and its really cool experience.

A surprise in a shopping mall. This is not something you normally see in a shopping mall, but it is Dubai and this is the biggest mall in the world so one should not really be surprised. This is a quality tourism attraction fully enclosed in amongst the shops. It is a pleasant distraction after hours of shopping to break your day up and do a tour of the aquarium and Zoo. The aquarium has a great tunnel through the middle so you feel like you are walking amongst the fish & sharks. The size a variety of sea creatures is impressive and interesting and if you have time you can pay extra to feed the fish or dive in amongst them. The underwater Zoo is also impressive with its setup and variety of animals from crocodiles (imported from Australia) to penguins, fish and much more. Definitely worth the visit if you are in the area a you will need at least an hour or more to see it properly.

Only interesting because is inside a Mall. If this Aquarium were outdoors would be in my opinion a poor one compared to Aquariums in many other cities. So do not expect nothing extraordinary unless is your first time or you have a lot of free time.
GREAT EXPERIENCE!. We loved the aquarium and zoo. It was better to spend our time here than it was to go in and out of shops. Every time you think its over there is more and more to see.

Beautiful Aquarium. I thought this was excellent value for money. Your ticket lets you walk through the tunnel of the giant fish tank as well as giving access to the under water zoo which has a whole host of creatures. You can see the fish tank from the mall anyway but it is well worth paying to see the rest.

Revisit To Dubai Aquarium. Last visit was about 5 years ago, am pleasantly surprised that it has improved so much. King Croc is a must see and their Night dessert is well done. Aquarium looks clean and lots of new exhibits.
Impressive. 3 storey aquarium in the middle of the Mall.The glass tunnel experience is amazing with fish gliding over you from all directions.

Deceptive. Having watched the big tank from outside for nothing we assumed there was loads more to see. Having walked through the tunnel and come out the other side I was thinking I'd been tricked into paying. Sent two floors up we saw the rest - loads there - as always some people crowd a tank and stop others seeing, but they do eventually move. Some great stuff here and very close up too. Star turnings at the end, though the otters come close second

Lovely Experience. Loved the fact this attraction is located within the Dubai Mall we arrived at 10 am one morning just as the divers were in feeding the Sharks & rays which made the viewing great. As the Rays wrap themselves around the divers backs. Going through the tunnel was ok but did enjoy the outside experience better.

'Nice', but only 'nice'. The walk through the tunnel is quite nice and impressive, the trip in the glass bottom boat a waste. The way fish and other creatures of the sea are displayed in the zoo is very nice, too, but not a reason really to drive to Dubai and spend quite a bit of money for the tickets..there are better and cheaper ways to look at fish...

Great value and good for all ages. Not sure how aquariums get a wow factor but this certainly does. As you enter the Dubai mall the sheer size of the glass underwater tunnels hit you. There are a differing ticket packages from around £15 adult, all include the underwater tunnels which are an absolute wow, with sharks, Rays etc. the water zoo is emense on level 2' only disappoint is the fish feeding which involves lunching 6 small fish pellets into a large tank from 20 ft up, that apart you can and will spend a Few hours here, oh and there is also an glass bottome boat and if you like shark diving! For kids of all ages even the big ones

Refreshing. This is located in the Dubai mall, and is an excellent attraction. The actual facility is not that large, but offers an excellent vista of sea life. Definitely worth a visit - kids will love it!

A serious aquarium!. We enjoyed this visit. The underwater zoo had quite a diverse range of life on show, but we felt that it lacked some signs to provide information on what we were looking at. The aquarium was impressive. If you just want to see the aquarium you can see 90% from outside: on the floors out the front and in the corridors that run behind the aquarium. However, the tunnel walk was enjoyable and the price of entry allows you to stand immediately next to the front of the aquarium, which is also worth it.

amazing. just to have such a huge aquarium in the middle of a mall is in itself amazing. buy your ticket and finish the tunnel and head 2 levels up for the underwater zoo. u will be amazed by the animals there and the HUGE salt water crocodile.

Glass Bottom Boat Is Worth It, Shark Feeding Not. Our kids are 7 & 8 and loved it! The tunnel is great anf the sea zoo part is excellent too. If you want to do the aquarium and fountain show, like we did, the shark feeding isn't worth getting there early for. We got there at 2pm for the shark feeding and had to wait around until 6pm for the fountains. Skip the shark feeding and get there about half three or four to give you enough time for the aquarium and then onto watch the fountains.

Excellent. We went to this attraction as an afterthought and were impressed with the aquarium tunnel and the underwater zoo, which is dominated by King Croc and his mate. He is huge, just lies there while the colourful parrots fly overhead. Well worth a visit.

Enjoyable. This attraction is in Dubai Mall. They had a huge aquarium with a large variety of fish, sharks and rays. Then you go to the underwater zoo two floors up. This was really enjoyable. We had fun watching the ever busy otters, the huge octopus, the barn owls feeding, touching the star fish, seeing spider crabs, tropical fish and crocodiles.Great fun. A definite must for animal lovers and families.

great experience but at times way to crowded. this is one of those magical moments that are waiting to happen, especially if you are coming with kids. This is located in the Dubai mall and is a nice break from all the shopping. But the problem is that its way to often too crowded and you loose that magic kind of a feeling.

dubai aquarium. its a brilliant thing to watch bt to buy a ticket and see its not worth it until you are with kids . coz u can actually see the aqarium from outside from the lobby or passage . its situated in the center of the mall . and you dnt see anyth different after buying a ticket xcept for the boat ride which is ok

BIG CROC. He was the highlight of our trip there and he was huge. Good to see him make light work of the chicken he was being fed and there were many other types of fish to be seen as well so worth a visit
Best place. Best place where animals and humans get connected. Couldn't believe my eyes when we saw those big and dangerous sharks swim right in front of us :)Located Dubai Mall

Not bad. We visited both parts of this attraction. The Aquarium is just walking through the tunnel of the tank you can see for free in the mall. The Zoo portion has fish, crocs etc...i've been to better but it killed an hour.

Dubail Aquarium : Must visit place. Aquarium in Dubai mall is a place to be for all visitors of Dubai... and specially, if you are with kids. Huge aquarium with various species and excellent maintenance keeps this place a must visit attractions for all ages. Under water boat ride is awesome and tunnel walk-through is also a nice experience. Really enjoyed and tickets are also reasonably priced at AED 110 for full tour package.

Better to just look at from the mall don't brother getting tickets. Not the first visit for me but first for the child Who is 3, and he was more happy to look from out side as after the tunnel the zoo part is pointless as when we went was so busy people sitting on the sides of fish tanks and on the small walls etc people walking all directions so no flow kids running crazy no flow inside the zoo.No staff to be seen when there was they seemed to be lost them self. Seems to have gone down hill a bit, as well as being over priced as the charge the same price for child who is 3 of the price of an adult, how the justify that is amazing as a 3 years old couldn't even see anything,(2 adults @ 160:00, 1 child @ 80:00 add) then they have the cheek to take a photo which they print out and try to sell at the end of tunnel again over priced why print them if people not buying them stop wasting paper, and ripping people off. been to many aquariums around the world all this has got for it is the shopping mall so people find it amazing for that reason apart from that nor thing special felt like we wasted our time by going in.
Well done. I Throughly enjoyed the aquarium, it is so beautifully put together. Clean and fresh. Gift shop is very expensive.

Was expecting a bit more. I was expecting it a bit bigger. Once we passed the tunnel through the aquarium, we thought that was all and were a bit disappointed. The under water zoo was located on a higher floor through the mall and had to enter with our previous receipt. It was quite nice for our little children.

Extreme animal torture. This place will leave you sad for days.. Please don't visit this place. I have never seen snow owls basically caged in a 3 metres to 2 metres concrete hell with no natural sunlight, penguins in a tiny filthy tank, a huge crocodile that hardly has enough room to turn around etc. These animals are basically sitting in this stinky mall awaiting their death as their only hope. I address this post to the responsible managers of this aquarium to at least re-place the penguins, owls and other birds and make Dubai a more sustainable place. How about using the space of this dreadful aquarium to teach children about bio-diversity and the distinction of our precious species? Our 2 children actually started crying when they saw those beautiful white owls sitting in that dark hole with nowhere to spread their wings to. I urge you to show mercy and re-place these poor creatures. It may not make a huge difference to the world but it would make the world to that crocodile, that lizard we saw endlessly climbing up the glass wall in a desperate attempt to escape and those magnificent snow owls staring into the empty. A truly disgusting place.

Not a Thrilling one, but an Enthralling Trip. The idea of seeing sharks and sting rays in captivity is really exciting and thrilling. But in actually it was an enthralling experience than a thrilling one. The thrill wasn't there as the sharks were more like pet rather than exhibiting their true nature. But one cannot maintain a tank with sharks as it will be in an ocean. Besides the thrill factor it is really a wow experience to see such big monster sea creatures and rightly named it as the underwater zoo. Better to get a good camera so that you can click some awesome photos to fled your social profiles.

Great to see. Right into the Dubai Mall, This aquarium is a MUST see. You have a chance to take the tunnels and see some of the biggest sea animals up close. There is also the Rainforest visit next that is worth a visit. enjoy

Unique experience. I've been to many aquariums before but the Dubai Aquarium was totally different experience.First you go through the tunnel with all the fish around you, you can take pictures with shark just next to you.It's all very well done and thought through to make it attractive for visitors, the displays are extensive and you can see many interesting animals.The glass-bottom boat tour is very interesting too, you could even dive there if you wish.I loved it, a must do while in Dubai mall.

All kind of sea creatures in a mall !! . In Dubai mall there is the the first access where you can get your tickets either for both entrance or one. The first is mostly as a hallway and see most of the sea creatures near you . After that the zoo mostly there you can find all kinds of sea creature from fishes to all new swimming creature you'll see for the first time of your life. Also there is a diving in the pool if your have experience but never tried it.

Amazing. The aquarium and underwater zoo has to be experienced......it is absolutely fascinating and totally mesmerising . Definitely do the glass bottom boat and take as long as you can to view all the exhibits. A great time out

AMAZING INDOOR ATTRACTION. Seeing is believing with this attraction - the aquarium is spectacular and the underwater zoo is worth the visit with good variety of displays - the king croc is amazing as are the king crabs. The only down side was that it was packed (it was the EID Mubarak holiday) and staff don't enforce the rules protecting the animals - nocturnal animals subject to flash photography and a giant pacific octopus putting up with some twit pounding on its tank..... Otherwise great fun

Feed the fish. We got the 90dhs package which allows you to go "backstage". You get a 30min guided tour and learn about the aquarium and the fish, very worthwhile, then you get to feed the fish from above which is very interesting. The while experience is excellent. Seeing the king crock is unbelievable he is an absoulte beast. The shark feeding at 4pm is very interesting watching these guys in action reminds you that they move slow but they can turn it up a notch when needed! 1.30hr needed to visit

Aquarium in a Shopping Mall. The aquarium is good BUT you can basically do it from the outside rather than paying to go in as what you see outside is basically what you see from inside. Fantastic array of sea life and I would say more for kids than adults. The glass bottom boat ride is a debatable trip unless you really are into seeing fish. Not a visit we would do again but would be great for kids.

One of the best indoor attractions in Dubai. This is well worth a visit, for tourists and residents alike. We first visited the aquarium when it opened, and it seems they have improved the experience with more to see now. There is a lot of interesting, weird and wonderful sea life to see in the zoo. The King Croc was feeding when we were there, great to see such a huge creature so close up; and the section on 'UAE's Night Creatures' was also good. Not what you expect to see in an underwater zoo, but nice to see local wildlife featured. The tunnel through the aquarium gives a great chance to get up close to the sharks - they seem to hang out here rather than at the front of the aquarium you can see from the mall. The only slight gripe is that we were told the basic ticket was AED 80 despite it being advertised as AED 70 on the website. After querying this, the cheaper ticket then became available.

Amazed. First let me say that you need 2 days to see everything is the Dubai Mall. I was amazed at everything it has to offer. We did the glass bottom boat ride, and my 6 year old was blown away. It reminded me of Sheds Aquarium in Chicago except we were inside of a mall. This is a must see while visiting, you won't be disappointed.
Breathtaking... I had no idea what to expect, but when we decided to go, we were amazed at how we felt we were part of the marine world. Great work done there..

Brilliant aquarium!. Brilliant place! did the underwater zoo first and got to see so many different animals and sea life, staff were so nice and helpful and really informative! We chose the ultimate package which included a glass bottom boat trip on top of the aquarium which we got to see great white sharks sleeping beneath our feet with a whole load of other sharks and tropical fish! brilliant adventure. With this package you also get 20 Dirhams complementary to spend in the gift shop which is nice! The walk through aquarium is brilliant walking through the tunnel and getting loads of pictures was brilliant! definitely worth the trip a great experience! definitely recommend! :)
amazed. just loved everything....it was simply wonderful and if i come to dubai again then its worth going there once more

Great Aquarium. Being a UAE resident I have passed the aquarium within Dubai Mall on many occasions, but never once been inside. I had heard that you can see as much from the outside as you can within...Recently I had visitors from the UK and they wanted to go to the aquarium and underwater zoo as part of their trip to Dubai. I must say that despite being dubious about what you would be able to see and value for money, it was definitely a worthwhile experience.The aquarium tunnel is a fully immersive experience and if you time your visit right you can see the sharks being fed which is amazing. Getting up close to the marine creatures especially the rays was awesome.Once you have completed your walk through the tunnel you take the escalator up to the underwater zoo where you can see tanks of fish and other animals such as otters and water rats, the whole exhibit is themed to look like a jungle and is really well done with rope bridges and suspended walkways which your children will love. The newest edition to the zoo section is the king crocodile which is absolutely huge and housed in a large display which can be viewed from underwater or above. There is also a section with penguins and a nocturnal walk through of UAE night animals.The whole experience is a nice way to kill an hour or two and is larger than the lost chambers aquarium out at Atlantis. Overall for the 80 AED entrance fee I would recommend a visit.

Must Do While Visiting. The aquarium is a must do while you are in the mall. part of the aquarium can be seen from the mall however, the experience is far greater than what you can see just walking by. The tunnel is great but the experience continues to get better the farther you go into the aquarium, however as mentioned the signage is a bit confusing to navigate through the rest of the aquarium.

Must do on at trip to the mall. Right in the heart of a shopping centre you come across an amazing site, seeing the fish and sharks close up was spectacular. Only one down to mention, the price of the photos was really expensive. Apart from that good value.

Not bad, but certainly not the greatest either. There seems to be some confusion as to what admission to the aquarium actually entails...to clear this up now: YOU DO GET MORE THAN THE WALK-THROUGH TUNNEL WITH YOUR TICKET!! This seems to be very confusing to some, and to be fair, the signage is not clear, but after you pay for your ticket and walk through the tunnel, you continue on up the escalators and go to the rest of the aquarium and especially the "underwater zoo". Remember, after passing through the tunnel, don't just walk back into the mall! Keep on going (follow the rest of the ticketed crowd,especially if they are going up the escalator!) and you won't miss out on what your ticket includes, OK? GOT IT?Now that this problem is cleared up...The real treat of the Dubai Aquarium is the amazingly gigantic main tank that can be viewed for free, as long as you stay behind the ropes. Virtually all of the best fish on display can be seen if you are patient and just stand and observe for awhile. If you feel that you simply MUST see more fish and whatever else they have hidden away in this aquarium, then you have a few choices: the cheapest ticket gets you into the rest of the aquarium and "zoo", for an additional fee, you can take a glass bottom boat ride on top of the huge tank to get a different perspective of the same fish. Finally, for an even higher fee (and if you are a certified diver) you can get real up-close and personal with the same fish by diving down into the same above mentioned tank.Like many other reviewers, our family went with the cheapest option. (NOTE: this is not actually listed at the ticket counter, you have to ask for the basic entrance choice) This got us closer to the main tank (on the "paying side" of the ropes) granted us entrance into the tunnel that takes you through the tank (cool views, especially of the sharks) and then UPSTAIRS to see the rest of the smaller tanks of assorted fish and enclosures of small creatures. The website, and especially other reviews and photos, pretty much show you literally everything there is to see. The rest of the fish "collection" is interesting, but nothing out of the ordinary. The "zoo" is a very limited selection of some night creatures, penguins in a too small enclosure (same for the otters) and some birds. Not exactly a "zoo", but it is just as well as I can't imagine subjecting anything but fish to a life inside a shopping mall. The biggest non-fish attraction is the KING CROC...who is joined by some smaller crocodile "friends" in his little pond. He is big. He is scary. You can watch him eat.I have been to world class aquariums in various countries (my daughter is quite the aficionado,seeing to it that I don't miss out!) and so I speak from experience when I say that this is in no way the best aquarium in the world, not even 2nd or 3rd...it is just average, but happens to have a super large main tank that is super cool AND it is located in the biggest mall in the world. If that appeals to you, then by all means go, if not, then enjoy the free view from the "other" side of the ropes and keep on shopping
FASCINATING. Very nice experience.My daughter and wife loved the aquarium.We walked through the tunnel and everything became blue.We loved this place.

A boat trip in a shopping centre! . Well, this wasn't something i expected to be doing in a shopping centre but it was great fun.The aquarium was stunning and the zoo was good, although it always makes me feel sad to see animals in cages and some of them really did feel like the cages were too small. The glass bottom boat was fun and you can also go diving with the fish and sharks but we didn't have the time to do this on this occasion. Another must do experience and a really good price if you buy the package for all three.
escaping from shopping. I got a package including tunnel , under water zoo and boat. With th package you can get a 20 dhs coupon from gift shop. Crocodile feeding time must be nice.

Dubai Aquarium. This aquarium is available for free picture taking on the main ground floor in front of Cheese Cake factory (good food). There is a rope to prevent anyone from getting near the glass, unless you pay for the tunnel experience.If you decide to go inside the tunnel, you will see it's very short and may not be worth the money, if you don't get the glass bottom boat ride, top floor. You can get a good view on the backside of the aquarium, just go up one floor and it's in front of Macaroni grill. It looks as if you are going into the restaurant but there is a small walkway there for you to take more pictures and you are right next to the glass. They do have Visa credit card specials so make sure to ask or they will just charge regular price. There is also a pretty good sea exhibition at the top floor, same place as the glass bottom boat. Finally if you are SCUBA certified, you can go dive there with a guide and it's something super special. They will provide all the gear and safety briefing. I did it when they first opened and it was very special for me as my family was there watching me inside the aquarium, with the fish and sharks passing by. It was a great experience and the crew keeps an eye of everything. Hope you enjoy the world record holding Dubai Aquarium. Enjoy!

Jaw dropping. Located in the middle of the Dubai Mall the aquarium cannot be missed, it is SO big! We went for the Ultimate Package which included a glass bottom boat ride, for about £20 which we found very reasonable, and this also included 40AED to spend in the gift shop! There is some wonderful marine life and you can tell they are very well cared for. The only thing that ruined it was some of the other visitors being somewhat inconsiderate, but that is no fault of the aquarium. We would recommend to anyone visiting Dubai!
Well priced attraction for dubai. Interesting displays and variety if fish my 2 year old loved it! Wasn't keen on the way they bated the crocodile to make him move!

Great break from shopping. The aquarium is located right in the middle of the Dubai Mall, making it a good point of reference for people trying to figure out where they are in the massive shopping complex. The main part of the aquarium is a multi-story tank with a walkway running through the middle of it. Upstairs one can get in small boats with see-through bottoms that run a short track around the top of the main tank. There is a separate area with numerous smaller tanks containing fish, jellyfish, and an area with penguins and what supposedly is the world's largest captive crocodile. An interesting experience, perhaps more suited for kids than adults, as there was relatively less info on the various species there than I've seen elsewhere. And the guide during the brief boat tour spoke so quietly and with a strong accent that at first we weren't sure what language she was speaking.

Many species of fishes. The place is a great place to take kids into. Very knowledgeable staffs when using the tour. Has a mini zoo once finish with the aquarium tour. We'll recommend to friends and family and it's a must to see once in Dubai

A must see attraction in Dubai. Magnificent aquarium at the center of Dubai Mall, a very well planned, and maintained attraction with sea water fish of all kinds. Got sharks and stingrays and other really colorful marine life fauna. A wonderful underwater walk in tunnel built in at floor level in the middle of the 4 stories high massive sea water tank. Also featuring a very nice zoo at the 2nd floor and a glass bottom boat ride at the top worth of taking. Well planned, nicely decorated with corals and very original marine environment, unique and very entertaining not just for kids. Superb place for families. A Must see attraction in Duba.... loved it.

Nice diversion. My daughter was very excited by the aquarium especially the first section where the fish swim all around you while you walk in a long corridor. The variety was great, from penguins to giant alligators.

Giant Aquarium With Scary Shark. This giant aquarium that's able to reach until level 4 of the mall floor is nicely viewed from the outside. However, the inside attractions is a major disappointment. Inside only consists of a small tube going across the aquarium about 500 meters long. If you're coming in to view this attraction, just do it outside please. The ticket is overpriced and not worth the inside visit. However, they do have varieties of fish and the most scariest was the shark. Not one, not two but several. Besides walking thru the inside tube, there's also other ways to view the aquarium (which I did not do) such as riding a boat with glass bottom or diving with gear to feed the fishes.
great experience. great experience ,Go inside, take photos as you wish . really Enjoy.The Aquarium is very well done. no mistakes .

Absolutely amazing. I have seen some of the best aquariums in the world, and this ranks at the top. it's not huge but the environment of the tanks is unique with a sort of Maya antique. the deep pool is the main attraction and seeing swimming such a large variety of fish is an incredbile show.

Good on the outside. On a wonderful afternoon at the Dubai Mall, I didn't even need to go inside the Dubai Aquarium to have a great time. You can view it from the outside. On the upper shopping level there is a great sweet shop that had delicious ice creams. What a way to spend some time with friends - ice cream in hand watching the fish swimming in the aquarium. This was after visiting the internal waterfall and watching the water spectacular outside. Had dinner, a show (the water works) and desert for very little, and enjoyed every minute of it.

For kids and old alike. Dubai Aquarium is located inside the Dubai Mall so it would be so convenient to go see while you are in the middle of your shopping spree. And the good thing is it is FREE!!! You only need to pay if you want to go inside but not recommended as you can very well have a view of the aquarium.

the largest aquarium in the world with diving chance. amazing place to visit and must not miss if you are visiting Dubai, full of marine life diversity and you can enjoy it either for free from out side or throw walking in the tunnake with entrance fees or diving which you can do a shark diving. which I’m highly recommend it.

Bigger than expected. The big, main aquarium can be seen from other parts of the mall, but the underwater zoo is only for ticket holders and includes many tanks of fish, otters, penguins and many other types of animals, making for a very impressive attraction.

DUBAI ACQUARIUM. Well placed and varieties of fishes .under water diving is arare experience. Under water tunnel is also amazing. Only the entrance fee is bit on a higher side .other wise worth seeing.

amazing. We spent two hours wandering through the aquarium and underwater zoo and also spent time viewing the "behind the scenes" aspect of the aquarium which was very interesting and gave us a good insight of the maintenance of this outstanding aquarium.

Very nice aquarium. The aquarium is in the Dubai mall, without paying entrance you can see part of the aquarium when you are shopping but it is worth going into the aquarium. First you pass through the tunnel where you got a good view of the sharks, rays and many other fishes. The rest of the aquarium is at the second floor and is also worth seeing. All smaller ones with different fishes. Worth seeing, we went twice in two days.

Excellent . I don't think people realise the bulk of this centre is on the second floor...That being said we found it to be an excellent activity filled with lots of amazing and exotic creatures. The two crocodiles were remarkable and the penguins were brilliant.We found it to be good value for money and the 20aed gift voucher for the shop is a nice touch.
Marine life. One of the USP's of Dubai mall. It is an outstanding idea to showcase the World's largest aquarium in the way they have done it.

A day well spent @ Dubai Aquarium. Dubai Aquarium has got a very good collection of fish. If you are looking from the outside, then ther e is no fee but in case you want to have a look at the marine fish from near, then you have to pay. The rate goes up based on the choices you make. For a certain fee, you can dive into the aquarium. It is a very good experience for the kids and very knowledgeable too, You can walk in the tunnel beneath the aquarium and that is an experience in itself. One should keep 2-3 hours aside if you wanna enjoyed it. The aquarium is located in Dubai Mall. There are attractions too in the mall.

Dubai Aquarium and Zoo. Not so much of a zoo but an amazing aquarium situated in the middle of the Dubai shopping mall. You can be in a shop but still admire the sharks as they swim by - Whacky but true. Definitely worth a visit.

Sharrrks!!!!!. It was awesome experience, I wish I had done the swimming with the sharks! :) I just wished the sharks were bigger though. But overall, it was fun and must do when one is visiting the Dubai Mall. It was cool to be the sharks, fish and other marine species up close.

Great but expensive . The tunnel is good but my advice to don't pay such amount just to walk in 100m tunnel... Apart from small tunnel, you will see Penguin, coloured fish & some Insects in the second floor... To be fair I did not enjoy my visit but others may enjoy... Of course the atmosphere is great and total experience was fine... No single comment...

the largest suspended aquarium in the world. It is amazing place to visit and must not miss if you are visiting Dubai, full of marine life diversity and you can enjoy it either for free while you are shopping in the mall or pay a ticket for the tunnel and the underwater zoo, which I’m highly recommend it.

Nice Experience. The Acquarium is huge and has a lot of marine life. However the underwater zoo is a bit over-priced in my opinion. you can get a nice up-close view from the 1st floor (near to Chilis restaurant). Besides that, its a great spot for your kids and to take some very nice shots!

Aquarium a great place. Spread over 3 floors a wonderful place with lots of variety of fishes and night animals.... main attraction was the king crocodile. had a wonderful time in the underwater tunnel......
A must in Dubai Mall. From all the amazing things you can do in the largest Mall! The aquarium is a must for everyone. Going through the tunnel is an experience by it self..kids love it! Love Dubai.

interesting especially for children. the aquarium is really nice and interesting although the thick glass can get you dizzy sometimes, but only if you get too close and stare. the underwater zoo on the last floor is very nice but i guess they could add more interesting creatures like seahorses or so, last time i went (May 2014) it mainly displayed different types of fish. The otters are cute but are always hiding inside and look sick, and their compartment wasn't that clean. but overall, it's a nice expereince especially if you're an animals lover. the tickets are expensive in my opinion (70 for adults) but we used entertainer vouchers so it was ok!

Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Well designed and very interesting spaceIn addition to the big aquarium, there are many small aquariums representing smaller species of fish, crabs, jelly fish, starfish and any other sea inhabitant you can think ofThere is also a pair of massive crocodiles (they probably need a bigger space)Penguins should have a bigger space tooYou can take a ride in a boat with a glass bottom in the big aquarium to observe the fish (lots of big sharks and stingrays too)I went on a weekend and it was a bit crowdedAt the entrance they take a picture of you (whether you like it or not) and at the exit they offer the same (framed) picture for sale. It is very pricey (56 Euros) but I bought it because it was my birthday and because I looked good in it.
Great value aquarium. Great selection of sea creatures from fish to sharks. Great value for money. New massive alligator on show
beautiful place. one of the greatest acquarium ihave seen so far.children will enjoy a lot .must visit again.cool place to hang out with family n frnds

Wonderful!. Wow. So many beautiful fish, sharks, marine life. If you can get past the fact that these poor creatures live in a shopping mall, you won't be disappointed. We loved it - much better than shopping!
Good but expensive.. A really lovely experience with some of the most beautiful fish I've ever seen. Don't go on a Friday as you cannot move.

Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is an excellent work by dubai government.fantastic place to see all the kind of water lives and it is full of fun and excitment.you have to purchase around 120dirham ticket and you can see the zoo and aquarium.must see if you are planing for dubai.

nice aquarium in an interesting location. I have now been to a few aquariums and have to say that this one is very well layed out. You cant really go wrong.Also included in the price is entry to the underwater zoo, which I probably enjoyed more than the actual aquarium.I did the package that included a boat ride over the top of the tank, which was very interesting and very reasonably priced. I also liked that the aquarium is open late, as it gave me more options to do other activities during the day and then do this at night time.
Incredible place. Super magical place especially in the entrance . I liked the lizards in the zoo very much too. If you have kids don't miss going there they will have a lots of fun.
It's ok. Was nice but nothing special, just normal aquarium, not so big, tools me about 40 min to look around.

Nice but not unforgettable. The Aquarium in the Dubai mall is definitely a nice attraction, especially for kids.The tunnel is amazing, but too short.The boat trip is a very touristic experience, that you can buy for just 20 dirhams more (and the value is really worth 20 dirhams and not more!!!).The animal selection is very nice, however cages are very small for so many/so big animals.I will not come back.

disappointing this time. All the creepy crawlies had been replaced by night time creatures. There were some barn owls stuck in this small enclosure looking sorry for themselves, with no space to fly and hunt, fruit bats in the same predicament. The penguins had been moved to a smaller enclosure to make way for King Croc and they all looked bored. Was disappointed this visit because I felt it was cruel keeping some of the animals in the enclosures they were in. I only hope that the birds in there get a chance to fly around sometime. I won't be visiting again.

I splurged on a shark dive....... An aquarium in a mall, I said. Gimmicky, I said. Waste of money, I said. And then I saw it and I couldn't help myself! It's built so that the aquarium wall from the mall side is impressive, taking up several floors, so if you are on family budget holiday you could spend a while just looking here. As a diver, I found out the tank dive with videos was equivalent £170. Having paid more than that for awful European weekend dives to look at rocks, hanging out with two dozen sharks for half an hour was well worth it! And yes, after all my moaning I was waving to the crowds in the mall from INSIDE the aquarium! I think they must have some sort if shark breeding programme as my friends went recently too and got to see shark eggs in the tank which were very cool to see. Worth asking about. Oh for the record it's all artificial, reefs and decent diving actually in Dubai is nonexistent, I think there is so much waste from construction coming off shore it ruins anything you may have seen.

Worth a look. We took time out to visit the aquarium when visiting the Dubai Mall.We purchased the lowest priced ticket option and felt this was good value.Tunnel was quite spectacular but particularly enjoyed the upstairs section. Look out for the otter putting on a show! I'm sure he knew we were there.

Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo. Wonderful aquarium for the varied and plentiful sealife. However it was upsetting to see the condition of the area in which the penguins are kept, in my opinion this was far to small I saw a number of penguins lining up to get inside a shelter that was inhabited by two other penguins, surely there should be more of these provided also the pool that the penguins have been provided with looks inadequate to say the least, but heyho as I have no experience in any marine biology maybe I am wrong but I am telling it as I saw it

Amazing fun for kids. Although I have been to many aquariums around the world and this one inside the Dubai mall with its 3 storeys is breath taking, simply amazing. The kids enjoyed watching the sea creatures with arrays of colours and thousands of species.A great aquarium though and the bill confirmed it.

Not a "must" during your visit. We have visited the park for second time in the last 5 years. Just wanted to see the "Croc". If you visit Dubai there are many other attractions to see. If you have been to other big aquariums, there is no reason to visit this one. Nothing special about it. The underwater zoo is a short exhibition of marine life and some reptiles. The big croc, like crocs usually do, is lying there completely motionless, easily to be confused with a statue. If you haven't been in such a place before, then do visit the aquarium, taking the cheapest ticket at Dirhams 80, which gives you a walk through the tunnel and a visit to the underwater zoo.

Awesome collection of aquatic & marine animals.. We are lovers of aquatic life. The starfish petting corner was fun. The penguins were so cute. One penguin was interactive by following the hand motions on the glass and swimming in directions of movements. The huge aquarium was breathtaking. With the sharks, sting rays, and a large variety of other fish. There is also a small desert animal corner in the zoo that features iguanas, desert owls, and a desert camp-out scene.

A wonderful experience. The view of the 3-storey aquarium wall as soon as you get in, with colourful fish swimming leisurely along with sharks and stingrays is simply breathtaking! We happened to be there for the shark guide talk in the tunnel and loved it. The upstairs aquarium has also got a great variety of sea life. We loved the otters and the penguins.

Great value for money. I recommend this place,especially if you have time to kill. We used the shuttle bus to and from our hotel and we visited here to kill time. The underwater zoo is ok but the aquarium upstairs is much better.

Boat ride is a joke as is the tunnel walk. Approx £20 a pop. The zoo is excellent, lots to see explore. Tunnel is a joke (it's not The Deep or Blue Planet) now here near and the boat trip with the wait and the life jackets etc is a complete damp squid. Worth £20 for the underwater zoo though.

Amazing afternoon. What a jewel of a place. Took my sixteen year old daughter who has recently shown a huge interest in fish and marine life in general. Have always thought it was just a tunnel view of what you seen from he outside. Wrong! Two floors above the main tank there is a huge underwater zoo which is amazing. From otters and sea rats to tiny tropical fish and the most enormous king crocodile I've ever seen. The staff were friendly and informative, especially the star fish and crocodile area and seemed to take so much care of the marine life. Everything was clean and well cared for.Would highly recommend this for all age groups and will definitely return. Really good value at AED 70 compared to other aquariums I've been to.

Fantastic. I took my kids here during the summer holidays at it was too hot to be outside. I didn't realize that there was more to it than just the tunnel that you walk under. The aquarium on the upper level was fantastic and feeding the fish was great fun. My kids absolutely loved going here.

Interesting. The aquarium is very cool with all the sharks, stingray and all the other fish. and the underwater zoo is full of amazing creatures, it's a must visit for marine life lovers. Don't take the package that includes feeding the fish, it's really not much and it's not worth it.

Enjoyed. My name is khalil and i'm from dubai. i went to this zoo with my family. i enjoyed my visit. You can also see the tunnel from outside, it is very impressive like that but I suggest you to go inside for an amazing feeling. You should go there to take nice pictures for memory and see underwater zoo.

Underwater, down under. Just a lovely place to be, immersed in the ocean surrounded by wild creatures that at this time is friendly enough to contained and be appreciated. Worth seeing and enjoying the moment.
mehh. to be honest, it was not that great. it was very short and there really wasn't that much to see. well there was a lot of fishes but it was not that great an experience.
Worth your time. This is a really nice aquarium for being inside of the Mall. I really enjoyed it even though it’s smaller. It took me about 1 hour to go through everything.

Nice place recommended. Amazing collection of underwater creatures. I went with my husband only but definatly going back with my daughter.
Recommended

Excellent. The tank capacity is enormous. Sharks were at the vicinity of all the other fishes. The distinction of the food chain is not visible. anyway that is the ubiquitous beauty of every aquarium in this category. People who are visiting this attraction for the first time must note down an important thing. There is a separate fee for the Dubai Aquarium and the Underwater Zoo, The fee for the underwater zoo is on the higher side. But, I wouldn't recommend spending money to visit the aquarium inside if you are in the pursuit of unique breeds of fishes. There is not much of difference than the varieties of fishes outside the aquariums than inside the aquarium for what you are supposed to pay for. But, I strongly exhort visiting the Underwater Zoo it is worth a visit although the price is on the higher side but I wouldn't consider the visit exorbitant. Excellent place in overall.
unique. its quite a unique aquarium with different kinds of fish.a walk inside is fascinating and the tunnel was great experiencewhile in dubai,this is a place worth visiting

Fantastic!. Such a nice place to visit if your in dubai mall! Big aquarium with big shark, stingray and etc. they also have this zoo where you can see different kinds of fish and animals! They have this huge crocodile also. They have this boat ride but its just a couple of minutes. You need to buy the expensive package to enjoy lot of things. All in all its very informative.

Puts a smile on your face. I have been here twice, once when it was first built and second time a few years later. This is definitely a very unique experience. A massive aquarium and aquatic zoo in a mall! How decadent! The tunnel was great especially near the cave where all the sharks gathered. Never been so close to sharks ever! The rest of the marine life was definitely interesting and fascinating to watch. I could literally spend hours and hours here and then coming out with a sore neck. The glass bottom boat was a bit of a let down though, although after several minutes in a small "almost flimsy" boat it did dawn on me that, hang on, those sharks that I saw earlier were actually somewhere down below! Slightly daunting. Walking around the rest of the zoo was also very good and interesting. The diversity of all the marine life and the effort the people make to preserve the lives of these marine animals must be applauded. Very unique and special day out.

Really enjoyed the experience!. Went to the Dubai Aquarium and thoroughly enjoyed it, even though have been to many others around the world.We got an upgraded ticket which included a glass bottom boat ride and a discount voucher to use in the gift shop. Really enjoyed the overall experience and the tunnel. Would highly recommend, wouldn't go again as I think it is one of them experiences you can do once. Gift shop is expensive but a good variety.

Good but spoilt. First off the aquarium is amazing and the 20,000+ fish are a sight to see. There are circa 70 sharks in the tank too and it's amazing to walk through the tunnel and see them swimming over the top of you. The boat trip is worth doing too. It's only 5 mins or so but interesting to look down and see all the fish below. Why spoilt? Well sorry but the zoo is awful from the welfare point of view. Sure all the animals are well kept but I fail to see the point of taking two crocodiles from their natural habitat and sticking them in a small tank/enclosure.
