The video commentary basically tells how the aquarium manager had an idea to bring crocs and thought it would draw the crowds. Yes that's right it is all about getting people in at any cost to the wild animals. Now the poor crocs will spend the rest of their lives in captivity. There was nothing wrong with them, they were not in danger, so why move them to Dubai? Money! I find this quite sad. I am all for saving and rescuing when there is a need but in this case it was driven by commercial gain. So the fact is I went and part of me enjoyed it but I can't help feeling a crocodile is a wild animal that should have stayed in the wild. Why not take one born in captivity?On this basis I would refuse to go again. I did not realise the crocs were there or their story.

Interesting!. It was good to finally visit the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo after having heard so much about it. The aquarium presented an opportunity to my kids to see different types of fishes and they sometimes even found it hard to believe they were real! The underwater zoo experience was also fun and I'm glad we were able to visit this unique attraction.

Brilliant Aquarium. Amazing to see 10,000,000 Liter aquarium within a mall, it houses 85 different types of fish. Ranging from sharks to sting rays. such a unique attraction as it is the last thing you would expect to see in the middle of a shopping mall. There are different packages available to buy. You can also go diving in the tank if you want a closer experience with the fish. Glass bottom boats also circle the top of the aquarium. Once you have went through the tunnel of the aquarium. Giving you a great view of all the fish hiding you get to go on the boat. There is also an aquatic zoo in with the price. Lots of cool animals to see from piranas to a king crocodile. Easily the biggest i have ever seen. Couldn't recommend this any more. Its a MUST if visiting the mall. Don't miss out.

Good to visit for once. I've been in Dubai aquarium with my friends. We had a nice time, the colors and fish environment is good relax. You can see the diversity of the fish and strange types of it. You should go there to take nice pictures for memory and see underwater zoo . Especially I recommend to take kids with you. they will enjoy well
Very Unique. Your Inside a mall and you can go inside an Aquarium. Cant beat it at all. Next time i go back i will be going again. Value for money for sure.

I would do it again. Amazing to see 10,000,000 Liters of water aquarium within a mall in addition to the 85 different types of fish you can see. It is quite expensive although different packages are available but it should be done.

Cage Snorkeling with Sharks. €40 for 20min cage snorkeling in submerged cage in the world's largest fish tank. Was good experience not as exhilarating as I thought it might be but still work the money. Staff are friendly and helpful. It's easy to find and you get complimentary tickets to the aquarium. Some large fish swim into the cage with you as you look down at the sharks below. The aquarium is a little disappointing as it's branded as the world's largest so don't expect sea world. Overall an enjoyable experience and worth the money.
Jaw-dropping!. The variety of fish and aquatic animals is extremely rich, and it was so wonderful to see them. I was a bit disappointed though that the Insect display was removed.
Fantastic Aquarium. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo Dubai Mall, Dubai, United Arab Emirates is very beautiful.We can see lot of different types of fishes.It's very nice.

Worth a visit. Located within the Dubai Mall, this attraction is a good place to visit. The time we visited it was feeding time and staff in their diving gear (frog suits and all) were inside the aquarium. They made it a point to put the feed into the mouths of the Sting Ray when they were facing the crowd. It was quite fascinating. Inside the tunnel, the shark with their sharp teeth could be observed above and it was a scary prospect if a similar encounter had to be faced by anyone in the ocean. Spotting the Leopard Ray was the highlight of my visit.
Beautiful... I couldn't believe how they managed to fit a whole underwater world in a mall. I thought it was a great location. I loved this experience and the different animals.

A new Attraction every time!. every time i visit the aquarium i find something new, this time it was the King Crocodile, a massive, huge, giant crocodile, which is biggest i ever saw, no extra charges, just the normal entrance fee and you can enjoy a full two hours+ (if you took your time in the aquarium, watching and reading the informations ) and watching the desert night life mini museum next to it. my kids, wife and my self really enjoyed the park alot.

Good but not outstanding. We made an adhoc visit to the aquarium and underwater zoo while in the Dubai Mall. There was no queue and we walked pretty much straight in. It wasn't busy so crowds were not an issue which was nice. The aquarium is very impressive and quite frightening when you first go in!! The sharks seem to be really close! After our visit to the aquarium, we made our way to the underwater zoo. We were filed to the zoo via the gift shop and were met by some staff who became rather pushy when it came to purchasing a commemorative photograph which we politely declined. We declined as we felt it was too expensive. The staff became rather dismissive at this point and barely registered us when we asked for directions to the underwater zoo, a point in the general direction was what we got! Not very friendly. The underwater zoo was busy with people enjoying themselves. The signs were informative and there were a few interaction stations. We didn't partake in this but we could see others enjoying it. The king crock was good to look at. He is huge, we did wonder if he had enough room in there. I hope he does. All in all a good trip, good to take visitors who enjoy sea life.

Dubai Aquarium &Underwater Zoo at Dubai Mall. Fantastic place with a significant number of animals I've never seen before. We went for a package including a glass bottom boat ride which let's you look at the acquarium from a different angle. Recently added crocodile and octopus in the zoo are spectacular getting you up close and personal. Package cost 110 dirhams which is about £18 each. Good value when you consider you also get a 20 dirham voucher to spend in the shop.

Not what i expected from the world largest in-door aquarium. it consists of two floors above each other. The upper one is like a mini aquarium where you walk in paths between cages and mini tanks , it has quite good variety of different beautiful creatures but the decoration and paths was average and pretty narrow.The lower floor is basically the tunnel where you walk inside a gigantic tank full of a wide variety of marine creatures.however, that tunnel is short and its very dark at the entrance and at the exit so basically it is even shorter.The tickets price was really higher than what it should be according to what i saw.

Good but nothing outstanding. It is part of Dubai mall , so generally crowded. The view from outside is inviting and once you buy the expensive ticket , it is not magical. Have visited quiet a few aquarium across the world , so this one is decent but not outstanding. You end up lot of pictures and see everyone indulging in it. Must go if you have children with you.

Disappointed. Found it very clean, friendly staff , however overpriced . Can see just as much on way round mall for free. Cost us both around £28 each. Save your money and treat yourself to dinner at cheese factory instead.

Interesting, but not special. Being in a shopping centre this can be busy, but ticketing is very fast. There are lots of photographers inside trying to get you to part with more cash, for very expensive photos. They would do better to have a deal price, so we only bought one and it was exorbitant. The SeaLife centre in London was a better deal if bought in advance, and although smaller was just as good in my opinion. Glass bottom bought ride was a bit naff. The shopping centre was manic, being Eid holiday, with marshalls on the escalators, so probably better to go another time.

I cant take my eyes of this tank. It is a thorough delight to watch this space in the dubai mall, even you are not a fan of the sea world , this place is a sure glue for the yes. from a toddler to a grandparent i saw everyone click pictures here and it has the highest number of footfalls.for me and many others this place is a blessing till my wife shops.

Immense!. You can't miss this aquarium while you are shopping within the mall, it is huge. Bought a ticket which gives you entrance into the tunnel where they give you a talk on the aquarium and it's marine life. We also had a glass bottom boat ride on the top of the aquarium which gives a different perspective as you are looking down on the people in the mall. The aquarium also has otters, beavers and an enormous crocodile. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful aquarium. Beautiful displays of aquatic animals, including an enormous crocodile. The large tank (from the tunnel through it) is not to be missed. We did the "shark walk" , where you are put in cage, lowered into the large tank & breath through helmets connected to the surface. Being close to the fish was pretty cool, although the sharks rarely came close to us... Ralph was a good guide!
Impressive. The Aquarium is situated inside Dubai Mall and you can't miss it. The are many exhibits and millions of fish so it's well worth a visit.

Pleasant. We were browsing the mall, so decided to add this into our day. My husband and I have visited many aquariums all over the world. This was a pleasant way to spend time, but compared to other aquariums, not worth the price. They really just have one exhibit, the King Croc, that is significantly different. We are a more mature couple, so we viewed the exhibit through that lens, but if you are a family, I am sure the children would have a wonderful time.

An aquarium in a shopping mall. We paid about $35 each to visit this place and it included a glass bottom boat ride at the top level before we worked our way down through the different levels. As with most things in Dubai, it was uniquely different and spectacular.
Magnificent. Awesome view of the creatures from the deep and the spooky night creatures....I liked the walk through the tunnel and standing above the aquarium on the glass floor.
The best. Feels like your back in your childhood. You will be amazing seeing to creatures and be delighted that they are so incredible made.
Diving was great. visited the aquarium, and it is very impressive. also went for a dive with sharks, and the guys are really good. it is a special feeling diving with multiple sharks surrounding you.

Beautiful aquarium . This time I decided to watch from the outside as I av already been inside previous times and the view isn't so much different. This is somewhere I will always go to if I go to the Dubai mall. Truly exquisite

unexpected surprise. For months and months I thought the aquarium was just the tunnel that you see in the mall. I was pleasantly surprised when somebody finally convinced me to pay the entry price and go in.The rest of the aquarium is upstairs, and holds a whole host of different sea life and creatures. Well worth the visit (if you like zoos and animal things).

Overpriced fish tank. Visiting what people call the biggest and best aquarium of Dubai, you are obviously disappointed after going through the glass tunnel... We took the tour @ 110 AED with the glass bottom boat ride (indoor).Of course it is wonderful to be able to walk below water, but for 80 AED (activity only), you expect a bit more than going through a fish tank of 30m, at least I did.Underwater zoo as many varieties of fishes, playful otters, sad king croc, and an overcrowded penguins box.Boat ride was not impressive and not worth the extra 30 AED.Advice to people who are thinking to dive in the tank: we thought about it, I would prefer to dive pay extra 300 AED and go open water than dive in such a small fish tank: only good if you want to brag about it with your friends: go open water, you will find rewarded any fished :)

Beautiful Aquarium!. This is a great venue for children an adults alike. There are numerous viewing options including glass bottom boats, diving and fish feeds. Take the time to visit the over 20,000 fish and 72 sharks!

Great View at the Underwater Zoo and Aquarium. Great to see the Dubai Underwater Zoo and Aquarium on my first visit to the mall. I spent hours taking pictures and enjoying the movement of different species. One of the most beautiful sites was when the water divers interacted with the sharks. Beautiful. Awesome. I will live to enter the aquarium when next I visit.
incredible aquarium. This is a must visit in Dubai if you are already inside the Dubai mall. Entrance fee is reasonable enough because you can watch a lot of underwater species of fishes and others.
Diving the Aquarium. Expensive dive, but it is Dubai. It was a guided dive and you felt as if you were part of the attraction.

Wonderful surprise!. We had meant to visit the aquarium & underwater zoo in Jan, but ran out of time, so it was on our must see list in July. We weren't dissppointed. The aquarium that you can see in the mall is only a small part of what your ticket buys. The underwater zoo is way bigger than we expected, and had otters, crocs and all manner of creatures we didn't expect. You can wander round at your own pace, there's nobody shuffling you along. A great way to spend an afternoon, thoroughly enjoyed it!
worth a trip!. Great little aquarium with a broad range of species and impressive display of stingrays and sharks. Takes about an hour if you meander slowly around and enjoy the seating areas,

The Best Thing in Dubai Mall. This shows how amazing Dubai has become. One of the outstanding attractions for kids and adults in Dubai Mall.The Aquarium was really large and the fishes were countless.Our kids loved it.Only one advice to you all' do not let the photo places to take your photo as they are totally overpriced'.You will definitely feel content once you visit Dubai Aquarium.

amazing gigantic aquarium. The main aquarium is so big and make us so curious to see what is inside of it. The many fishes inside this gigantic tank are very attractive. We purchase the ticket which include the tour by the boat that got a glassy ground on it at the bottom, and we came back for the second time and took the ticket that include fish feeding. There is this new citizen of this underwater zoo which is the 5 metre length crocodile, we could see the croc from the mezzanine level upstairs of its cage which is glass transparent at its ground, so it is quite chilly especially when the crocs are there beneath us. I guess the ticket price are reasonable enough as we could see so many underwater species of fishes and many more.The tank itself can compete with the Osaka aquarium at Japan which is also beautiful. I recommend it a must visit place at Dubai Mall if you happened to be around this mall and have quite a time to kill.

More than meets the eye. The well stocked aquarium is located in the Dubai Mall. You can see most of the tank from the Mall side. That said there is much more in the aquatic exhibitions away from public view, and if you want, you can have a glass bottom punt ride over the main exhibit,Feeding the trevally and odd reef shark was a highlight.Enjoyable and worth a visit.

Close encounter aquarium. The clear tunnel through the middle of the aquarium pool provides a very close up experience. The inside close up view is far superior to what you see from the outside and well worth the fee. The visit backstage at the zoo was interesting although the zoo itself was not particularly world class.
Only saw from outside. But it was so big. Really nice to sit and watch for a while. Would loved to have gone in but I just didn't have the time. Viewing from outside is an experience of its own.

Reverted back to childhood!. What an amazing feature within Dubai Mall! It really is worth paying to experience this aquarium and zoo. You could not possibly imagine there would be such a large aquarium and zoo inside a mall. Absolutely incredible - I was like a child all over again seeing all the amazing fish and underwater creatures. Well worth the money spent!

Great view from Outside!. I don't think entering the tunnel will make a big difference..What if it gets longer, with a glass floor, a place to sit down, a description of fish types, a restaurant may be with a playground for kids,...That will make entering it a plus, but else from outside is amazing too..The attached pic was shot from Chili's/Carinos area..I love it :)

Impressive!!!!. Great fun for the whole family, we got onto the glass boats and experienced sea life like never before! Take a camera, the pictures are very expensive and you are better off taking them yourselves. A walk through the tunnel was incredible, I felt like I was in the ocean…a must do for tourists.

Excellent view and experience. It is very nice experience specially for kids and taken pictures for marine life. They charge for adults and children and at the end you can have group photos for your family members. Do not miss it.
Limited variety of fish. The atmosphere was very good. The entrance fee was pricey for the limited variety of fish. The water in the tanks was not clear as in other aquariums.

Brilliant Setup. How can you miss out on this. It is impossible to think that you go to Dubai and miss out on this. The experience starts from the outside aquarium; even before you enter the aquarium; the starry ceiling and the huge setup given outside; gets you ready for the whole thing and once you are inside; every corner of this facility is worth paying attention to. Very very nice setup.
Disappointed. average thing, available in most other countries of the world, perhaps good for some fish enthusiast not very attractive for me.

Well worth a visit. An amazing experience walking through but to be in a glass bottom boat above the fish and people in the mall below is surreal . The fish species are spectacular and the Otters were so cute. Well recommended I am in my 60s and enjoyed so imagine what fun the kids would have.

feeding the fish and a boat ride!!!!. by far i would give the Aquarium itself is amazing and worth every penny but the glass boat ride and feeding the fish is not even close and very over priced. i mean i know it is an aquarium and there isnt much you can do on its surface but the couple of minutes tour is not worth it and so is throwing 5 pieces of food into the aquarium for a combined price of $30 per person!!! my suggestion is stick to the normal aquarium visit, it is much more fun

Great place to visit and not too expensive.. 10 times better than the Atlantis aquarium and fraction of the price. The prices without discount are not too bad however we got a voucher off eBay which was 2for1 entry, they advised it was 70 DHS for the two of us which at the time was around £10 for both!! Incredible value with plenty to see, the biggest single aquarium tunnel we have seen and the zoo was worth a visit with plenty of water based and night time creatures including a giant crocodile, otters, beaver, owls etc. A nice couple of hours and would recommend for adults/kids alike.

Not to bad. Too be honest i think this attraction is over priced for what it is. For example dont bother with the fish feeding as an extra as they take you out the back show you really nothing and give you a container with 4 small cube pieces of food to throw over the edge of a huge pool of fish, you are certainly not close or personal with them at all.It was a very well presented and well kept with a great variety of fish, just over priced.

Ok aquarium. This is a small, greatly overpriced aquarium. At the ticket counter, you have a number of options, to book just the tunnel, or do also the boat and the zoo. Whatever you pick, it will be overpriced. This acquarium is basically a one really big tank, full of very interesting fish. The tunnel is at the bottom of the tank, and the boat ride is at the top of the same tank. The boat ride is really worthless. And the zoo is ok. I think you get a better value for your money if you go to the acquarium at the Atlantis.

amazing experience. We were very impressed. Cost per person is from 80 dhs and up depending on what kind of experience you want. You can even go diving for about 1000 dhs or cage snorkeling for alot less. Amazing to see a shark so up close. We did feel that some fish were too crowded in their tanks at the zoo. We loved the penguins :)

Dubai Aquarium. Dubai aquarium was definitely on our to-do list, as we thought our son would certainly enjoy it. And He did.. Aquarium is must watch if you travel with kids. If not the entire aquarium can be viewed from outside without getting into the tunnel. Underwater zoo was not great, and nothing amazing.

Beyond comment. It's breath taking to me and my kids, the price is a bit high but we had coupons from our hotel so it took care of that. Lots of aqua animals and fishes it's the largest aquarium I have seen so far. The penguins made our day with their display.

Enjoyable experience!. We visited the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo in March 2014.I enjoyed my visit. There was a wide variety of fish and other animals. I saw some species here that I had not seen at any other aquariums or zoos in the world. We spent approximately 2 hours wandering through the various exhibits and participated in the fish feeding as well.Although this isn't a large attraction I found it worthwhile (even with the slightly high price)- it's not everyday you see an aquarium in a shopping mall!
Fun day. Not as big as other aquariums but plenty to see. My children (age 7 & 9) loved it as there was lots to see and learn about. Great for a break from shopping or escaping the summer heat.
Nice collection. Vast number of fishes...good way to teach young child about fish....price is bit high than its quality....ticket includes underwater zoo. ...
Small but nice . it was not as I expected but it was fun for my childrenthe price should be at least half what they offer since the large window is available for free to all mall visitors

Compact but interesting. The aquarium and underwater zoo is inside the Dubai Mall. Tickets are expensive, though not by Dubai standards, 85 Dirhams (about USD 24) for the basic entry ticket. You can add on all sorts of interesting activities from the basic glass bottomed boat to Scuba diving. We did not have a lot of time, so spent only about an hour here. The aquarium itself is the world's largest fish tank and gives you the nice opportunity to walk through the tunnel surrounded by sharks, sting rays and several other equally interesting fish. You can get a similar view from outside the aquarium for free but it does not quite give you the photo op of being inside the tunnel. And of course you don't get to see the underwater zoo.Once you pass through the tunnel, you go up a couple of levels to get to the underwater zoo, which we were pleasantly surprised by. Plenty of aquatic and amphibian species from all over the world, displays were very nice. The piece de resistance had to be the shark eggs with the embryo throbbing inside. The descriptions of the displays could do with some updating and better detailing, but all in all it was an interesting experience.Worth a visit especially if you have children with you.

It's a scam. Do not buy.. This is not an aquarium rather a big fish tank which is free from the mall side and cost AED80 for 15 feet steps along a tunnel in than tank (and other couple of small tanks) !!!
nice reprieve. fun to see and get out of the hustle and bustle of the mall impressive collection of sharks and ocean fish - the extra tours you can pass on
Lots to see. On our last visit we just looked at the fish from the mall but decided to go inside this time. Lots to see and very interesting.

good experience ... Brilliantly maintained aquarium and under water zoo in a mall ! you need at least one hour to thoroughly enjoy this aquarium but its slightly over priced . It s good for kids and you can visit once ...

Nice to pass an hour... Nice activity to do. Only takes probably an hour to do both the aquarium and underwater zoo though. We chose to do the fish feeding package. Little disappointing with amount of food you get & how far away you actually are from the fish when they get fed. Think would opt for the glass bottom boat if I went again.Had a picture taken at start in front of green screen and the opportunity to buy later on. Be warned these are the most expensive photos we have ever been offered. Absolute rip off! Would have got 5 stars if the photos weren't such a joke!The bats were pretty cool...got to see them eating, flying & hanging!Nice souvenir shop at the end!
Superb. Not what you expect to find in a shopping mal but truly outstanding! You can gain great views of the attraction without entering but walking through the tunnel is not to be missed.
Dubai is amazing!. I have never seen, in my life, so many fishes!Dubai is just great... Would love to go back there and do stuffs I did not do on my first visit.Manuel....
Great place to spend an hour. Definitely worth the walk through the tunnel and fish feeding. Was surprised that the zoo on level two had so much to see, my son loved it.

Interesting but disappointing. There is nothing underwater. You just pass through a small tunnel and thats it. Quite pricey for just a minute or two walk through the tunnel. Instead you better watch it from outside. However they have included other attractions into the ticket price so you may just have to pay it up. Total time required to visit other included attractions is not more than 30-40 minutes. However it is a long walk as each attraction are on different floors and within a mall.

Great view and in a shopping center. This is great but a little pricey if you had a family. You can walk through the centre and admire the many fish that inhabit the aquarium. Nice to see the regular divers constantly cleaning to make the aquarium pleasant to view. Feeding time is worth a visit.

Good experience for the kids, but nothing spectacular. It looked great from the outside and I personally thought that was the best part and the fact that it was in a shopping mall.You can tell that the kids really enjoyed the experience, especially the tunnel part. The aquarium itself is not big and it's not an attraction that would take hours to go through, i think we only spent about 40 minutes to go through the entire place. It's worth a visit if you have young children, otherwise I would say this can be skipped (especially given the price).

Appealing to both kids and adults. Dubai, the city of superlatives never fails to amaze and the aquarium in true blue Dubai style is no exception. Located inside Dubai mall it's tank capacity is 10 million ltrs!! Wide variety of marine animals and reptiles to watch........A strong resemblance to the Singapore aquarium however!! Nonetheless worth a visit when you are in the city if dreams!!!!!
Very interesting and worth a visit while you are in Dubai. Like a lot of things in Dubai - artificial and man made but worth a visit anyway. The types and amount of fish and marine is excellent.
Good!! Kids will love it!!. Our kid enjoyed the aquarium and zoo more than us. well maintained and neat. Lots of marine animals and variety of fish. But ticket seemed to be bit pricey.

"Good but can be skipped". The tickets to the Aquarium is 80 AED, expensive for people coming from India. The tunnel is not long and if you have seen Aquaria, Kuala Lampur than one will be disappointed. The ticket includes free purchase of 10 AED from gift shop which in itself is expensive for gifting souvenirs to friends back home. The best way to view this Aquarium is from the outside, i.e inside the Dubai Mall. The backdrop is so large and beautiful that, for free, you will love to click your photograph with giant fishes and scuba divers.

Great Aquarium - Worth A visit. This indeed is a visit that's worth every penny. Kids will have an awesome time visiting this, enjoying every single predator under-sea. Well maintained, clean and moreover, has great variety of marine animals to see and enjoy.

Great experience for children and adults. I really enjoyed the visit of the largest tank in the world (10 million liters) with many smaller aquariums located at the 2nd floor. The visit starts by the tunnel where you can observe closely many different species of sharks. The other varieties are smaller but usually very colorful. Beautiful experience

Just view from the mall side. Although it's pretty cool that this place houses 33,000 types of creatures, it's basically just another aquarium. When you can see the 10,000 liter tank from the mall side (including the sea life), I'm not sure why anyone would pay more to walk through unless you have children.

Astonishing Aquarium. Take 30-45 minutes of your time and visit this Aquarium at the Dubai Mall! Always has loads of people. Take nice pics of the sea underworld creatures lazying and swimming around. Great place for kids!

Amazing Aquarium. It was a great opportunity to see real big sharks. The aquarium is giant and for 4 floors height.The quantity of species is unbelievable. you may dive with all these fishes with professional divers.

They have aquarium inside the mall !. I think UEA is the only place in the world who offer "one stop for everything". You can find world's branded shops, all kind types of restaurants, amusement, even one of the world biggest aquarium inside the mall !!. This aquarium still amazed me even though I been there few times (most of the time I only see them from outside). I love to see this aquarium after my shopping or dined, its the best view ever to see sharks swiming around.

Was a pleasant Surprise. To say the least an aquarium in the mall was a surprise.. Was an nice experience.. we did the boat ride with the glass floor and the underwater zoo and then the gift shop and on the ground level we went through the tunnel.. so so many varieties of fishes , water is so clean and place so well kept..worth it

worth a visit. its not the biggest place as far as similar are compared but still worth a visit. the underwater zoo I enjoyed with all the different tanks of interesting things. Located in Dubai mall and spread out over 3 floors which was perhaps a bit annoying as one had to exit one are then Q again to get into the next area.. Nice little gift shop with fun things for sale at the end

Considering this is in a mall, fantastic. It's the usual 'huge' fixation with Dubai, that this one's been made in a mall. There are three levels, and you can even do a shark or scuba dive. They have a section with 'night animals' of the desert. A glass bottomed boat ride of 5 minutes which lets you see the animals from top as well. Plus a solid collection of different types of marine animals.

Dubai Dolphinarium - RFK Holidays. RFK was based on the establishment of giving a separated administration experience. They strive to go the additional mile and satisfy the needs of all their customers and clients.

Interesting but nowhere near as good as Sydney. When we had paid our 160 Dirhams for 2 and found ourselves walking through the inside of a transparent tunnel that anybody paying nothing could see from the outside, we wondered if we had taken leave of our senses. Especially as the fish and sharks were all quite small and there were no really strange specimens in the aquarium that you visit first. And the sharks seemed to prefer the unlit recesses, rather than the brighter more photogenic areas.But then we were sent upstairs to the Underwater Zoo, included in the price and 2 storeys up at the top of the Dubai Mall, and all our worries melted away as we got close to really interesting creatures such as Otters and Platypus.

overated and not value for money. i and my wife decided to visit the Dubai aquarium on 6/5/14. the hype about the aquarium was truly disappointed as the attraction is really poor compare to other country.It is only suitable for kids.It take u less then an hour to complete the whole aquarium and the so call underwater zoo.save your money for other attraction.

Must do. I thought it would be little bit boring... But, after a friend of mine recommended it to me, I decided to go and I must say that everyone in Dubai must try it !Recommended to do it once, specially with kids !

Good for kids.. not worth the cost!. We had very high expectations from this. But the attraction was just okay. The fish tank looks fab from outside (in the mall)... But the zoo is just average.. Maybe the kids or the aqua life lovers would like it better.The various types of marine creatures were good and the descriptions were also nicely given. but considering the price of the tickets (starting 70 AED pp), I did not feel worth it.Maybe you can give it a skip and perhaps try Ski Dubai in the Mall of Emirates

saturday out. We went on a saturday and it was not to busy. Entrance cost 80AED per person and you get admission to the Aquarium and Underwater zoo. The aquarium was nice, the kids enjoyed the view from the tunnel and the zoo was also ok. not to big so you're done withhin an hour.

Not too bad. We probably set our expectations too high thinking to see the worlds one of the biggest and most interesting aquariums as advertised everything as such in Dubai. However it was basically a big bowl with a tunnel and some more fish and sea life in the second floor. Not impressed at all, better visit the Tropicarium in Campona in Budapest, which is not as famous as this, but at least a proper and interesting one! Box ticked for what to visit in Dubai but that's all about it!

Maybe good for kids - but otherwise skip it!. On a day when I could not do another minute outside I decided to check out the Dubai Aquarium in the Dubai Mall. From the outside it looks impressive - so why not! The best part of the this was walking through the tunnel and seeing all the sharks and rays - and going early in the morning 10 am (during the work week) when it just opens is even better as it's pretty empty and you can get some good pics!! After your walk through here you have to go up the escalator to the second floor and there you enter the rest of the aquarium. For as big as everything is in Dubai and how much everything is generally overdone, it seems they skipped that in the Aquarium. It was okay and yes you could see some cool sea life, but it's quite small and I felt that there really wasn't much to it. You could walk through it quite quickly and I left feeling very unimpressed. I would say this attraction is better for families with kids and not for couples or individual travelers.

The most impressive sight is for free. My family and I visited this attraction last week and found that the price of admission is a bit steep for what you get. You basically get to walk inside the ropes (a few feet closer than the mall visitors) to a massive aquarium that everyone can see just as well from the mall. The tunnel is the coolest part of the attraction but a bit short lived. There are more fish on the second floor to see but after 10 minutes, my 5 yr old was bored. Beware of the up selling of behind the scenes and feeding the fish as we didn't find these activities worth it. Save a few bucks and look at the fish from the mall - the experience is just as impressive. If your really into marine life, spend the money on the dolphin adventure at Atlantis.

Very nicely done, but overpriced for wha tyou get. Amazing to see such a thing inside a shopping mall. It is fascinating to walk through the tunnel to see aquatic life swimming above and below you. However, that part is very short. Entry fee seems high.

All washed up. Great experience but the glass bottomed boat part was not all that and the pictures they took of you EVERYWHERE were far too expensive. The London Aquarium has better variety of fish to see.
Very nice with children. You can see all kinds of fishes just few centimetres from you ..) Its based in Dubai Mall where you have many many many shops .-)

Beautiful Experience!!. A wonderful array of exotic marine life!! Visually amazing and built with passion... Its right in front of your eyes and you almost feel like you are a part of it. Very well maintained and each section has been adequately divided with information on each spices and their uniqueness. Must visit!!

Aquarim in a Mall. It is like a small aquarium squeezed in a mall with a big fish tank. Tunnel experience is not bad at all as you can get a close look at the shark teethes while you are safe :)I think you can schedule this attraction in a weekday as it doesn't need a dedicated weekend. You might want to try the restaurant in your way out as this jungle themed. Tip: if you want to pay the photo negotiate or ask for the photo alone without the frame.

beautiful. the tunnel is stunning, seeing all those fishes swimming around you, and sharks swimming by, it's def worth it. the zoo was exciting as well, you get to see giant crabs, penguins, jellyfishes and more. i wouldn't recommend the glass boat ride though, it was kinda boring, plus you get to see everything better from the tunnel

Not very exciting. I wouldn't say I was excited with the experience I had in Dubai Aquarium. It was too small compared to other ones I visited (Barcelona, Melbourne, Durban).If you are bored, you can just give it a shot, but do not cancel your other plans just to see the aquarium, it is not worth it!

Don't Have to Pay. You can see the contents of the tank form the mall area itself. Pretty cool to see. I did not pay to inside so it may have been better there. Anyway, a huge tank inside the mall.. a must see while in town.

Not very big and special fishes but special view. This aquarium is not very big or special in types of creature, but by walking trough a underwater tunnel (about 30 meter long) you will have closer look and better view of fish, however no bizarre or unseen kind of creature but beautiful in fact. In addition there are more creatures (not underwater) you can see in other parts (more amusing than fishes). Worth to see once.

Adventure Hunting ;). This was November 22, 2010. I enjoyed touring inside Dubai Aquarium especially in the tunnel was awesome that have different kind of species and the fact that was my first time.... ;) The zoo was also good and entertaining. Adventure Bridge that looked we're hunting animals :P haha ! :D Very good for friends and family.

Average Aquarium. To begin with, it's expensive and not worth the money! the underwater zoo is a giant fish tank with sharks. Nothing entertaining about the aquarium other than the Penguins from Chile & moon jelly fish.

Pricey place with a small tank. For the first timer, you may be amazed with the shopping complex with their big aquarium view. This is the factor that dragging me to purchase the ticket to get in. Once you have entered, theres nothing much to see.
The place may be a favorite to your kids.

Good for families. The Dubai Aquarium is the biggest in the world (read - only the glass facade / the Aquarium tank wall which is visible from inside the mall).Kids will like this aquarium, you can also dive with the sharks. Its a good experience, however the entire setup looks claustrophobic.I have been to the one in Singapore and its much much better!

Pricey and not great. If you have been to Sea Life centres in the uk then give this a miss. It is very small, we looked round in about an hour. The tanks seem extremely small for the amount of fish. The otters and penguin exhibits are really small made me feel a bit sad. The best bit is seeing the massive tank that everyone can see from the shopping mall. The walk through tunnel is great too.My children aged 7 & 8 liked it!
nice :). Well, seen it, done it.. Nice, very nice to see it. I am not a big fan of water but enjoyed to visit once with my visitors. don't forget is BIGGEST, lots of fish, fund for kids
Excellent. It was the first time , i saw a lots kinds of fish. It is very nice and traveler can take many photos :x

Amazing!. It is really interesting to know that this attraction, which is one of the largest tanks in the world, contains more than 30,000 living animals, representing more than 85 species!! most of them could be seen while cruising via small boat above the entire aquarium. It's really an amazing attraction which taking place in a huge mall like Dubai mall. Some people would say it's pretty expensive in terms of entrance fees, but it's worthy visiting.

Not world's largest as they would make you to believe but still an enjoyble experience.... To start with I can’t understand why they call it “aquarium and underwater zoo”? It’s an aquarium and what they sell separately as the underwater zoo should also be a part of the aquarium. Anyway we bought the Ultimate Aquarium Package at AED 110 which included 1) Aquarium Tunnel 2) Underwater Zoo 3) Glass-bottom Boat ride and 4) Aquarium gift voucher worth AED 20. They very conveniently didn’t show me the option which is just for the tunnel and the zoo. Considering the glass-bottom boat ride is waste of time and the gift voucher is just a push sell (you can always buy from the gift shop on your own) I would recommend that you insist upon the simple combo ticket which is just for the tunnel and the zoo and costs AED 70 only. As I said the glass-bottom boat ride is waste of time… What they call the Zoo is what you would see in any regular Aquarium. It’s a small place… you just need 15 to 20 mins to see the whole place. But they have good collection of species. They must do something about the stench around the place though. The highlight of the place is the acrylic panelled aquarium tank. The 32.88M x 8.3M side viewing panels are not world’s largest, as they would make you believe, but it’s certainly worth seeing. You can see the whole tank from outside standing on the corridors of Level-2 and Level-1 of the mall. But, you must enter the tunnel at the bottom of the tank to get the best of it… particularly if haven’t been to any other tunnel aquarium. Also you can see a lot more aquatic activity inside the tunnel than you can see from outside. The tunnel itself is not huge… I have seen three times longer tunnel in Shanghai Aquarium. But as I said if it’s your first visit to a tunnel aquarium I am sure you will love it. Overall I would say it was an enjoyable experience. The gift shops are rip-offs… just ignore them. Since I had three AED20 vouchers I was forced to buy some exorbitantly overpriced stuff…There are different underwater diving activities but I would recommend to avoid them… If you want to experience the real thrill of underwater diving then go to the sea… you won’t get that in a fish tank!

Impressive. The aquarium and underwater zoo are in the Dubai Mall. The "aquarium" part is an underwater walkway through the huge tank of sharks, rays and other fish. The "zoo", is a series of smaller exhibits with otters, penguins, piranhas etc which lies above the aquarium, and is your route to feeding the aquarium fish or even cage snorkelling in the tank.My 3 yr old loved it.

Must see. Weeks family holiday started with a day at the Mall and a visit to the aquarium.
Brilliant must see when in a Dubai, huge viewing screens and a magnificent aray of fish, sharks etc etc you will ever see.
Wonderful for any age, a must visit.

The highlight of the Dubai Mall. The outside wall is spectacular and probably better than anything you pay for inside. It's still worth going in though to get a bit closer to the sharks. The underwater zoo doesn't have much you won't see elsewhere but you can't go wrong with penguins and otters.

Better than diving in the sea. I have dived in Dubai on a number of business trips and the water near Jumeirh Beach is not in great condition. Rather than the trek to the East coast the Aquarium is a god alternative. I agree with the other comments regarding cost £100 for 30 mins and the quality and service of both diving equipment and staff. The aquarium is small in comparison to say EPCOT in Florida but does deliver a different experience of. Dubai for the qualified diver. I would do it again if I was in town but only if really short on time otherwise take a full day and head for Oman or the East Coast of Dubai. Good full, not stretching but another opportunity to do something different in the crazy work that is Dubai!

Kiss a Shark. Imagine you and your family under water with a sharks. It is posible in Dubai Aguarium, and is awesome. Me and my family have realy enjoyed. We have been so close with a sharks, and in one moment I have been little scared. Dubai Aquarium and Under Water Zoo is one of the largest tanks in the world. Dubai Aquarium is located inside the Dubai Mall, in Dubai. The Dubai Aquarium is home to more than 33,000 living animals, including 400 sharks and rays and a close encounter via its acrylic walk through tunnel. Sharks and rays are top attractions, but other crowd-pleasers include a Sumo-sized giant grouper and massive schools of pelagic fish. Beautiful. I am sure, I will certainly back to see this again.
Worth a visit - great value!. Definitely worth a visit. Great location within the Dubai Mall. Walking through the tunnel and seeing the sharks above you was a highlight. Highly recommend

Take the premium ticket. The boat trip should not be missed, as it is different from other aquariums. The underwater zoo is excellent. The only negative thing is that the souvernirs at the gift shop are exteremly expensive, and even if you have a 40 dirham voucher, you won`t be able to buy much for these money.

an excellent day out in dubai. I loved it because I'd never been to anything quite like it. There are some who say that the sharks are too big for the aquarium, but they looked happy to me! My husband (a civil engineer specialising in water) was amazed at how that huge amount of water could be contained in the aquarium. And the "zoo" - well fantastic too - all the fish look happy and well looked after. We were delighted that it rained in Dubai that day, so that we decided to go to the Dubai mall. The aquarium was well worth the £15 each that we paid. Oh what fun

Small, but cool - Glass bottom boat not great. Walking around the outside edge is a must and free. Doing the middle tier package that gets you into the tunnel and the underwater zoo are an okay value. Don't recommend the glass bottom boat ride as you see more from the tunnel and outside windows. The zoo offer some fun sea otters that play with each other but refused to go down the water slide for our photo.

Nice Aquarium - Would NOT Recommend Diving There. I have been to a lot of aquariums, mostly in the US, but on this visit to Dubai, UAE I wanted to give this a try. They promote it as the largest aquarium in the world, but it really is small compared to EPCOT or the Georgia Aquarium in Atlanta. Arrived and we were greeted by friendly and knowledgeable staff. Their equipment is in great shape and they do a pretty good job. The educational program is lacking compared to stateside aquariums. It is a thirty minute dive and costs about $180.00 (US). All the coral in the aquarium is fake, painted cement, the rocks are real. If you are not comfortable in the water, the dive guides will drag you around the aquarium by your tank and set you in places they want you to sit and look at the fish. Fortunately as an experienced diver this was not an issue for me. I would recommend visiting the aquarium and looking at all the great fish and rays through the glass. Getting in the water is cool, but just not a top pick for me when visiting Dubai. Use your money to go the top of the tallest building in the world!

Small but good. To be honest, you can see most of it from the galleries of the mall but the walk through of the shark bit is quite good. Because it is an attraction in a shopping centre it isn't all that big but compared to some other attractions the price isn't all that steep. The underwater zoo has all the usual.

Standard fare!. Small aquarium - not in the league of sentosa or Sydney. as expected collection of stingrays and sharks. the underwater zoo was a bit more interesting with otters, water rats and penguins lending some varietywould recommend only if you have small kids or havent been to a similar attraction before - we had a lovely time given we had two kids aged 5 and 1 and this was the only place where our 1 yr old was visibly excited with all the moving underwater creatures in the brightly lit aquarium

Small, but visit at night. go for the complete package inc the glass bottom boat, it is great to get up close to these sharks who are well looked after, the Zoo is more large aquariums to see piranhas etc, the glass bottom boat over the top of the big tank is a excellent trip, but we went at 11pm and it was really quiet and there was no pressure or queues so just take your time and enjoy

Small but good. Seen a similar one but much bigger at sentosa island singapore. The aquarium is small and for the first timers is really good to see the fishes , sting rays and sharks up close. The fishes are cramped up ina very small area. The aquarium is free to view from outside but to get in and watch there is a fee. wouldnt recommend that. zoo is ok passable but the fact that these are within a mall is the only commendable fact.

saddest thing EVER. While it was quite amazing to see the fish and sharks etc in the aquarium so close up I had a real sense that they were swimming mindlessly up and down, it was smaller than I thought it would be. The zoo however was the saddest and most upsetting thing I have seen for such a long time. It is all very well to be able to see these fish and creatures up close but to what cost. I even fely sorry for the fish who were packed into small tanks. Children were banging on the glass and the noise and lights were pretty bad, but then we came to the otters, beavers and in particular the penguins. I defy anyone to say that this was a fair enviroment for them. Agaian the relentless noise and lights etc, but mostly the size of the enclosures/homes was terrible. The penguins were the saddest, standing around in a tiny enclosure. How nice for us to see them up close but how horrible for them. It reminded me of the scene in Happy Feet when Happy Feet finds himself in the zoo where all the other penguins have become like robots as they are so bored and confined. A mall for a zoo if horrible and while some may argue that they could be worse it doesn't justify it for me. My husband and I bothe felt moved to tears to see such beautiful creatures in this enviroment....all so children and adults can get a thrill of seeing something so cute close up. It was horrible.

Aquarium --OK . Zoo quite good. Well the whole idea of doing this in a mall and creating a 50 meter walktrhu/see thru tunnel aquarium is commendable. Pro and con to this is that its quite small and u can cover it pretty quickly. THe sharks looks amazing and so do rest of the aquatic life.The zoo on the other hand is quite big and also well worth it.Doable once.

Brilliant for the price. . The aquarium is in the middle of the shopping centre. Takes up about 3 floors. You can see it for free from behind the rope or if you go to the first floor you can see it up close (but most of the fish don't go that high) Cheapest option is about €16. Your ticket gives you €2 off at the gift shop. And there are a few things for about the price so no extra spend is required. (It's not €2 off per transaction or item so if more than one you can get all €2's off 1 item. Hope that makes sense)It's great to see the fish up close from the outside. You feel like there's nothing separating you. When you move past the outside you come back through the tunnel. It takes a bit of getting used to as the curve plays tricks with your vision. Saw many more of the sharks from inside the tunnel than I did from the outside. Well worth the time and the money.

Didn't expect this in the middle of the Dubai Mall!. Sharks swimming over your head and beautiful coloured and exotic fish are a plenty. The underwater zoo had penguins which I have to admit are my favourites so I was smitten! Well worth the admission fee and takes about an hour depending on how long you like to linger

A welcome break from shopping!. You can see the aquarium from the outside for free (from behind a rope), but it's worth paying for the cheapest combo ticket to walk under the tunnel and see the fish from underneath, only around £10 per adult. It's amazing to think that this is all inside a shopping mall. The zoo upstairs is obviously more aimed at children, but still enjoyable for 2 adults. Well worth a trip if you're in the Mall anyway and want / need a break from shopping. As with all these type of places though, the gift shop at the end is fairly tacky and over priced but you do get a free gift as part of the ticket price..

Beautiful and worth the ticket entry...!. This was such a huge aquarium, even though I am not aquarium loving person but I also enjoyed watching so many different species of fishes. Aquarium tunnel is real huge, even if you have already seen such tunnels before, you will feel the difference. In underwater zoo, at extreme end, there was 1 tank of penguins, it was real fun to play with the birds, you put your hands on glass and penguin will swim till it :)
a very unexpected site. yes, there is a fee to enter.however, i was really surprised after the experience.a must see for families and adults alike.

Fun for children, but not as unique as it's made out to be. If you're an adult, you'll be better off limiting yourself to the short (and much cheaper) tour of the outside of the fish tank. The children enjoyed this and they especially enjoyed being able to touch some of the water creatures, but the whole experience lasted a bit over half an hour, didn't feel more special than other aquariums we've been to and it definitely cost more than it tasted (though that's pretty much the rule with everything in Dubai). In retrospect, it might have been wiser to invest a bit more and see the larger aquarium at the Dubai Mall.

Penguins are the best!. It's a nice place and must see in Dubai. Aquarium tunnel is perfect. You can see even sharks so close to you that sometimes it is even scary. We liked underwater zoo very much, especially meduzas and penguins. The entrance is around 150AED and I think it's worth it. Just at the entrance they will take a photo of you and then at the exit they will try to sell it on you with around 175AED. Don't be surprised, it's a very common practice in Dubai ;)

lots of fun. made a full day out of the waterpark experience as a non-Atlantis guest. take the monorail out and back as the pirate taxis there will make your trip home 4 times more expensive than the trip out there. the monorail cost $15 return but with Entertainer coupons is half price, as is the waterpark with the couponswell planned out park with plenty of areas to park your butt and relax. Food inside is exteremly expensive ($90 for 3 sandwiches and drinks)

Diver’s experience.. Diving with sharks is always exciting. Like in all other PADI dive centers, we have a briefing before, explaining that once in the aquarium we cannot touch the glasses, don’t disturb sharks. The briefing has been done by Sam Thomas the Aquarium Dive Center Manager, very clear explanations about sharks and their life habits. Don’t think that you’ll be free to dive wherever you want; you have to strictly follow this 25 minutes trip. Descent; stay on the rock, go on till the bottom of the aquarium, dive all the way to the other side, wait to see sharks passing nearby. And finally go back to the starting point for the ascent.Price including the dive and all the rental equipment is quite a lot, AED675. About 185USD. This PADI team is professional and makes you confident. That’s a lot of money but it’s at least to be done once in your diver’s lifetime.

Good for Kids!. We had a 22 month old baby with us and she just loved it! We did the package with the tunnel + underwater zoo at AED 70 or 80. You can see most of the fish from the outside itself, but the sharks are very clearly visible from inside. Also, the underwater zoo is quite good. We got to see otters doing a short performance at the zoo and the penguins were cute too.The best part is that it is inside the Dubai mall and its very convenient if you're staying around.Its fun if you have kids with you. I would say one can do it if you havent seen other aquariums like Monterey Bay/ Singapore.. those are better.

Always worth taking visitors. Most aspects of Dubai Mall are awful and I avoid it like the plague, however, if you are looking after visitors you cannot avoid it. No need to go inside, just walk around the outside(behind the rope of course) to see the great array of life inside the tank.
very good experience. it was a great experience , we can see so many variety of fishes, once you enter it is like you are in a different world :)

Worth a visit . Although I was expecting a large aquarium this is still worth a visit. All you get to do is walk through a glass tunnel and look around but they do offer a large selection of fish. The zoo located on the 2nd floor is quite good. It is a bit expensive for what's on offer.

Overpriced for what it was.. Meh, it was average. I was expecting more for the $$. Sure the huge wall of fish that you can see from the mall is super impressive and the tunnel was fun--but after that it was just tanks of fish you'd see at any aquarium. We spent maybe 1/2hour total in the place max. If you LOVE fish, then go but otherwise just watch them for free from the mall side of the exhibit.

Underwater haven. It's true what they about seeing most of it from the shopping mall but there is something quite magical being in the tunnel within the aquarium. If you like watching fish this is a must - its not too expensive especially if you purchase a 'buy one get one free' voucher in advance. We found it tranquil and relaxing to watch the fish, sting rays and sharks go by. Your so close to them and they are huge!The underwater zoo is pretty cool to.We enjoy going to aquariums and while it's not the best we've been to it is worth it but you don't really need much more than 1 hour to see it all.

Good experience. Lovely tank which can be seen mostly from inside, but worth visiting the tunnel, which is one of the best I've seen, and also the underwater zoo is worth the visit, especially the watch the playful otters and penguins!

Beautiful. A very spread out attraction, we did the aquarium on the 3rd floor first which was great, lots to see, our daughter is just under 2 and she loved it. Our tickets also entitled us to access the tunnel which was very cool, sharks and all sorts swimming above your head. You can see the big tank without paying but having tickets enables you to walk thru the tunnel thru the tank and go to the 'zoo' which I'd definitely recommend for the kids, great to see and pass time.

Shopping mall aquarium. It's an unexpected surprise in a mall. If you stumble on it, shoot a pic or two and move on. Do not make a special trip for it. The Dubai Mall is the greater attraction itself.

Very cool experience. Amazing experience under the water tunnel to watch all the fish/sharks, etc. swimming around you. You can't get a full understanding of how large this aquarium is until you stand outside of it and just take in it's beauty.

One time is plenty... I am a resident of the UAE and therefore waited for someone to visit to go to Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. I'm glad I waited because I wouldn't go there again. I had a voucher so I paid half price which was ok. Full price (70AED/19$) is a bit much. The ticket lets you visit both the aquarium and "zoo".The Aquarium: It is huge and has interesting fish. Going through the tunnel is interesting but you see most of the fish OUTSIDE (for free) than you do on the inside. It is a maximum 3 minute stroll in the tunnel. When you first walk in, your picture is taken and you're asked to collect when you leave. The picture is filthy expensive! Its a rip-off! They first wanted to charge me 220AED/60$ for one copy with a fancy shmancy (plastic) frame. Then the salesperson said if I take a key chain for 95AED/26$ I'll get the pic for free but its the size of half my mobile phone. Again, rip off rip off..The Zoo: you go to the second floor for this and as soon as you step off of the escalator you can smell the rancid seawater smell. It is horrendous. I had to spray perfume on my hand and swab under my nose to not smell it but it was useless. Once inside, the aquariums are nice and plenty of fish to see. My favorite were the angel fish, the jelly fish and of course, the Penguins!! The penguins were the highlight of my whole trip!So in short, once was more than enough, all the times I watched the aquarium from the outside were more than sufficient.
'Look out, Sharks overhead!'. Brilliant, it was great to experience the aquarium after seeing so much on the TV and the internet. Great achievement and the fish look well looked after.
Family Fun. One of the highlights of Dubai. People from all age groups would enjoy this. Its a great value for money. Would recommend to take the full package rather than mini packages.
For the price you expect a little bit more.. For the Kids is really great experience, but the tunnel itself is a bit too small. The Guidance is a electronic machine.

superb. The kids loved the tunnel and seeing the fishes so close. Both were apprehensive when the shark came near by but loved it none the less. The underwater zoo was good too and they saw "Nemo" and then the glass bottomed boat ride just amazed them

Too expensive for what it is. They should have made this aquarium a separate attraction and not part of the Dubai Mall experience.I liked the tunnel and the displays at the ground floor.Then we had to go two floors up for the boat ride and which is not worth the bother.Overall it is overpriced for what it is.

Much Ado About Nothing.... Big huge waterwindow towards mall is nice, definitely worlds biggest one. But then, only tunnel is nice, and thats it... ? We buy tickets only because of kids. If i have been there myself, nou way...Tickets are 80, 90, 100 AED, 80 AED its enough. There is long lines, and prices are shown well in the waal, but still some groups negotiate 5-10min tickets and sametime lines waiting... (ARRRGGGGH) , but yes, kids liked. 2. floor is zoo,,, (?), well, some small aquariums where some fishs... ( i have seen better)

Nice aquarium. Who should visit?: EveryoneDuration of visit: 2 hrsEntry fees: YesBest Part: World Largest Acrylic PanelHow to reach?: Metro or CarCan you take pictures?: YesSouvenir to purchase: Yes; bit expensive
Masterpiece. The aquarium is an engineering masterpiece. The zoo is so interesting. I couldn't go up to Creepy Crawlies because I was too scared. It was nice.

Nothing special. It is very expensive for what it is.We have visited better places, for a lot less money.Enjoy the giant tank from the outside (from inside the Mall), it's free and you won't be wasting your money.I would imagine the whole set up would be better for school kids on a day trip rather than a tourist trap.
Every one liked it. We almost spent an hour in it and every one was happy. Best place for kids. We took the full package and it was worth it.
Wonderful. I visited this place for 3 times now and every time I discovered that I have missed a lil part to stop by,So clean and so organized.
Great fun and learning for kids. My kids really enjoyed watching sea creature. Cost is little bit on the high side but for kids, it was an interesting trip so we were happy in the end.

have to see to believe. amazing, what else can i say, well worth going to see even if you don't pay for the full experience you can still see the tank whilst in the mall, we paid for the ultimate experience with the boat trip as well, little bit pricey but to be honest it was a good way to spend a couple of hours

Expensive but worthy!. The three of us decided to spend the 240 AED (80 per person) to visit the underwater zoo and the Aquarium and we literally had the time of our lives. Though my mum was a bit bored, my sister and i totally went insane when we saw the live sharks, turtles, "Finding Nemo" themed aquarium, Shark eggs, Sea horses, Range of star fish, otters, penguins - you name it! It's definitely a unique experience but i am sure it could have been less expensive.
Nothing great..... If you have seen aquariums before...you won't find this interesting at all.....don't waste money on buying tickets.....it's the same wat you can see from outside....

Okay. This aquarium was okay, i have visited better and bigger aquariums in other places such as malaysia, but it was okay. I did get a ticket to go inside and take a look, thinking I would see something better, but sadly not. All what you could see from the inside, you could see from the outiside. I personally think this aquarium could have been better.

DON'T TOUCH ANYTHING or risk security being called upon and worst!. This was our first visit to Dubai and our family was eager to visit the much recommended Aquarium in the Dubai Mall. The experience was one large tourist trap within a mall and there are better aquariums around the wall and even in the Lost Chamber at Atlantis Dubai. But we were most SHAMED AND INCENSED when the Aquarium store, at the exit of the Aquarium, forced us to purchase an unwanted toy that our child had supposedly broken.The toy was obviously already broken and put back on the shelf. Our innocent daughter of 10 years old had the misfortune to touch it and it immediately fell off the shelf onto the ground. As the staff was adamant that we pay for it (a 40 AED whale grabber) and we refused, the dimunitive local store manager called security. They threatened to haul my husband away for disrespecting him. All this happened in front of our two children who were so scared that they were almost in tears. Even though we proved that our daughter could not have broken the toy (it turns out that it was missing parts, was already broken before she happened upon it and another perfectly fine item when dropped on the floor did not break), the store manager insisted that we pay for it or else... We have never encountered such an UNREASONABLE store manager who just used the THREAT OF SECURITY AND WORST PRISON to get us to pay for something. Having travelled the entire world, we have never come across such an unacceptable situation and paid as we did not want to end up in an Arab jail for no reason. For this and many other reasons, I would not patronize this Aquarium, the Dubai Mall or for that reason the region.

Breathtaking. I was really looking forward to see the Dubai aquarium, hence I listed it down as my first stop in my 11-day itinerary. I was not disappointed at all. In fact, I enjoyed it, I absolutely loved it. I could spend the whole day just watching the enormous tank filled with the spectacular range of underwater species. It was breathtaking. Everyone in my family (my husband, my two girls, my parents) was in awe at this attraction located inside the Dubai Mall. There were lots of bystanders watching the marine life, and taking photos of it. However, it is best that you go inside the tunnel to see them up close. The underwater zoo may not be as grand as the Dubai Aquarium but offers unique species in their own aquariums, very entertaining especially for small children who can only reach a certain height. Such a delightful experience for the whole family!

Average Aquriam. It was a good place but felt it could have been much better with better collections of Aquatic life. We took a Fish feeding tour, the guide was informative, but I personally felt it was a waste for me but my kids loved it. Overall i would say the is a huge scope for improvement.

LOVED IT!!!!!. We spent hours in the Dubai mall aquarium. My parents loved it, who are both aged over 50, and both me and my partner who are under 24 loved it too!! Id certainly go back. Hundreds of beautiful fish sharks penguins rays starfish jellyfish snakes lizards, otters and even some spiders are kept here in amazing lovely well kept cages. You can walk on a high canopy wich is suspended over the tanks for a better veiw, filled with foliage and in complete air conditioning it was a lovely afternoon. I love all zoos, I've read some reviews here that compare this place to ones in the US (such a sea world), and no it isn't like that, it is unique and just as much fun in its own way! After all it is placed in the middle of a mall in the desert!! I don't understand why people are comparing it to these other places. It is worth every cent you pay, My advice is lgo! Make the most of it, we paid a little extra on entry fee and were granted a ride on a glass bottom boat on the top of the main tank, it was great, got a great look from a different angle.

Fabulous!. As a diver, I love to view marine life. The range of species was spectacular. The tank was enormous & if I had more time, would loved to have dived in there. I spent ages just watching the tank - I was mesmerised by the rays. Amazing!

Worthfull. I have seen this kind of aquariums in singapore sentosa,bangkok & pattaya also every one of these has their own identification particularly Dubai Aquarium having small space to compare other ones but we can not say its small this is worth full and maintained good here we can watch penguins,jelly fish and other rare water animals also.

Awful Experience. One of the attractions in Dubai, especially for kids is the aquarium at the Dubai Mall. For Dubai, it is a decent attraction with a separate aquarium tank filled with sharks, other fish and rays and an aquatic zoo. It does not compare to a Sea World or Monterey Aquarium in any way but is a decent way to kill an hour in a mall if you need a break from shopping. However, it is expensive for what it offers and, worst of all, imposes a horrible souvenir shop at the end of the tour. The salespeople are overbearing and push very hard to generate revenueby any means necessary. I would recommend walking straight through it at the end of your tour if you want to avoid being hassled.

Incredible engineering but overpriced. First of all, you dont need to pay and get inside to watch the marine animals and sharks. You could do that standing outside the aquarium. I bought the tickets, got inside hoping that that i was in for a surprise. But sadly no! there is only one reptile park, mimicing the rainforest atmoshphere, disappointing- if you have been to bigger aquariums such as Ocean world etc. First timers and kids- yes! enjoyable. The glass bottom boat ride is a bit of a dissapointment, as the glass bottoms are not very clear and you will have difficulty watching the fishes through the glass. Kudos to the engineeting though. Full marks- 1. considering the fact that this is inside a shopping mall. 2. This is a built using a single acrylic glass panel- thats huge.

Excellent. I really enjoyed the underwater zoo and aquarium. The aquarium is in the middle of Dubai Mall, you don't have to pay to see it however you have to pay to go through it (which we did). The tunnel is actually tiny and overpriced but the zoo is really nice. It had lots of animals to see and I really enjoyed it. The best part is its INSIDE the mall, crazy!

Life underwater !. This aquarium is the largest in the world with a amazing reservoir of marine life covering three floors. An entrance fee of 110 dirhams allows you entry into the aquarium tunnel walk, the underwater zoo and a ten minute ride on a glass bottom boat. A walk through the aquarium is an experience that leaves you bewildered with the range of colours of fish in glass aquariums, the deep, yellow, orange swimming furiously in the transparent tank enclosures. The underwater zoo has all animal life from the different climatic zones kept under temperature controlled enclosures simulating their living conditions. Watching the penguins in Dubai was completely paradoxical just seeing these North Pole birds surviving in a desert climate. An entire area for reptiles housed in spooky surroundings with large tropical trees and hanging bridges gives the impression of walking through the rain forests. The glass bottom boat ride gives you a glimpse of the marine life floating under your feet coming as close as it can get. Life jackets are provided for safety and the boat operated on a overhead pulley is a break away from the open sea glass bottom adventure. The tunnel walk is just incredible with the fish swimming all around you at a hands distance, sometimes you get to touch the fish underbelly through the glass protective covers, a surreal feeling of wonderment. At the conclusion of the tour you get to pick a free gift valued at 25 dirhams per ticket from the souvenir shop at the exit gate. The huge aquarium is the central point of attraction in the Dubai Mall, also visible to the shoppers viewing from outside the aquarium enclosure.

BEST AQUARIUM EVER SEEN....A MUST VISIT!!!!. This was really the best aquarium i ave ever seen in my life,the fishes ,the water ,the atmosphere just was the best,its structure too was very good.Do visit it in dubai mall

Fantastic................ The location is convenient (right inside the mall), the underwater tunnel is really fun for kids and the zoo part is decent enough.Great experience....although we have seen in singapore........@Sentosa iceland......but remembered lot of old things.....

Worth a trip to see. Don't pay. A huge fish tank in a mall. What more can I say. There is a fee to go through the tunnel. We didn't. A good variety of fish. Giant sharks and rays. Divers cleaning and feeding. A nice site to visit.

Penguins in the desert. Awesome experience. I loved the shark tank you can walk through. Some really cool and interesting animals here and it is well worth the price of entry. The penguins were a particular highlight.

With a lower price, it'd be excellent. The location is convenient (right inside the mall), the underwater tunnel is really fun for kids (but only for about 5-10 minutes... its not that long), and the zoo part is decent enough (nothing spectacular, no "hands on" stuff for kids).This is Dubai... so, everything is expensive... but still, for this 2 (maaaaybe 3) hr experience, a family of four would get set back at least 250 dr or almost $100. Your call.
Nice. Right inside the Dubai Mall, the aquarium is worth a trip. Good variety of water creatures. Kids would love the experience.
not that special. we can find it anywhere, even better. The uniqueness only it's located inside the mall-Dubai Mall. Ticket price also too much for such attraction.

Another 'must-visit' in Dubai!. The huge aquarium in the Dubai Mall can be seen from the outside,free of cost. However, to go through the aquarium tunnel,you have to purchase tickets.We took tickets costing 110 dhm/person which included aquarium tunnel, underwater zoo, glass bottom boat ride and 20 dhm coupon which can be redeemed in the Aquarium store.Going through the aquarium,you can see hundreds of species including the mighty sharks just next to you! The glass bottom boat ride was also good,but the ride is short,and could have been better. The underwater zoo again,has so many exotic species,and it was so amazing to see penguins there! In the Aquarium Store you can purchase souvenirs with the coupons you get with the tickets,but mind you..they are too expensive!In short, you should never miss this spectacle when you go to Dubai.

Excellent. We decided to visit here on a trip to the mall as it was something different to do....and I'm so glad we did! From the very spooky, smiling sharks, the incredibly happy looking stingrays and the entertaining slightly madcap penguins to the huge spider crab and the cute playful otters, there's something for everyone here. The best thing was it isn't overly expensive for what you get and unlike some other places, there are varying ticket levels. All in all, it was a great afternoon!

Sharks smiling. It was a very good experience, the tunnel is very exciting with the shark and all these fishes!! We took the boat on the top of the aquarium (it's interesting too, we can see shark just Under your small boat). It's very secure and no risk for the child.It's quite expensive but with your tickets you can have a gift at the end of the attraction.

Family fun. We did the complete package, so we had the dubai aquarium and went on the boat ride. To be honest the boat ride didn't do it for me and I wasn't totally comfortable with being in a boat in a tank with sharks so I didn't relax and enjoy it. However the tunnel and the walk through we're fun. They have some shows with Otters. Children would enjoy it

WOW. Our daughter the mermaid swam in the tank (Dec 2013), her comments to this was thrilling and amazing.After swimming in the tank at Atlantis (April 2013), she enjoyed the Dubai Mall tank as with over 30,000.00 different types of fishes and also loads more sharks.The guys at the school/dive center were amazing.Were surprised they had a very young diver with them, was another proud moment for us as parents.A must do if you are in Dubai.

My son loved it!. My wife and I decided to take a morning and visit the Dubai Aquarium which is located in the Dubai Mall. While the cost of entrance is surely not cheap (I guess this depends on the package you select at the entrance), I can say that the entire experience was worth it. The walk through the glass tunnel which is under the aquarium that houses (they say) 20,000 species of fish is short, but the live corals and variety of fish make the walk through fun. Once through the tunnel, you have to take the elevators up two flights of stairs where you present your receipt again to enter another part of the zoo. This section houses more fish and animals like penguins.My son went crazy as he watched the keepers feed the penguins. It was honesty a good show. We also took a short 15 minute right in a glass bottom boat which gives you some prospective on the size of the tank and number of fish. For though adventure seekers, you can opt to scuba dive with a guide in the tank which is filled with fish and SHARKS! Worth the money and the time. I took my son there TWICE!

I couldn't believe we were in a Mall. The sea life were prolific in this aquarium and we got some excellent photos. I did feel that there may have been TOO many fish at some point, but still very impressive. and the fact that you can get on with shopping when you are done at this impressive sight is a boon!

swimming with the dolphin. You must visit the Aquarium it is the best experience.You can swimming with the dolphin ,you can see the underwater zoo ,rarely on fish ,sharks ..it is amazing..!the cost of the ticket it's not a very expensive.

lovely. its easy to forget that you are in the middle of the largest shopping mall in the world, was lovely to go round at your own pace, we enjoyed watching the divers with the sharks, think the underwater zoo is better for smaller children, but we still enjoyed it especially the penguins :)

astounding. What a marvellous thing to put a calming placid underwater zoo in the busiest malls of Dubai.
