This is an absolute masterpiece - 10m deep tanks house a multitude of fish, sharks, rays and indeed scuba divers (you can dive and be watched for a price - equipment provided). To top this, you can ride a glass bottomed boat on top of the tanks and then wander through smaller aquariums and reptile/insect displays further on. Fun for all the family, especially for the dads whom no doubt will be sick of the shopping (maybe)

Not worth it. I was pretty underwhelmed with the aquarium; for the cost of the ticket you get very little that you cannot see for free from the platforms around the outside of the aquarium. The internal tunnel is short and the view actually inferior to the outside. Compared to other similar aquariums with underwater tunnels such as Kelly Tarlton's in Auckland this one a vastly inferior. The underwater zoo is also pretty mediocre and not worth the price of the ticket.

Deep Sea in the middle of a mall. Very interesting to watch how the marine life is...specially considering that's it's the middle of the mall! Over 33 thousand "lives"!!! And it's for free!If you can afford to spend some cash on tickets (not pricey), it's worth going through the tunnel to watch the lazy sharks sleeping....and a visit to the "zoo", if ONLY you have young kids along. ;)

Worth a visit. Aquariums are on our list of attractions we visit everywhere in the world & while this is not the best aquarium we have ever visited it is impressive given it's location. You can view it from outside in the mall but it's worth the entrance fee for the full experience.
Its big fish tank. The biggest fish tank with variety of species with sharks and dolphins, delight & enjoyable for kids with toys and gift shop.

Welcome To The Ocean. This is another attraction in The Dubai Mall. The in-house giant aquarium is a delicacy in itself to witness. Never in my life did I imagine myself in front of a shark and smile, so that was a great feeling. You can even feed them and take a dive and get a first hand experience of what it is to be in water. A suggestion would be to use your credit card to buy your tickets, they usually have offers on them. And while you're at it, make a visit to the underwater zoo. Jelly fish, penguins, otters, piranha, you name them and they have them here. Overall, a great experience!

Would be fun for kids. Pretty much of the large aquarium can be seen from the mall for free, but you can get closer to the glass with your entry ticket. Up a couple of levels is the underwater zoo section which consists of a lot of small tanks displaying fresh and salt water fish. There are also otters that are especially fun to watch, three small crocodiles, penguins, and some South American Water Rats. A visit here would be a good way to break up the shopping for the kids. There is a ticket option including a boat ride on top of the main tank. More adventurous teens and adults could pay to get in the tank with the sharks.
Worth it. This was our second time visiting. It was very educational and the kids loved it! They also loved watching from the sides each time we visited the dubai mall

Worthwhile!. Very interesting and worthwhile! The aquarium is bigger than any I've ever seen and even contains a couple of species I've never even heard of...for example there is a 'shark' in there that looks more like a cross between a manta ray and some prehistoric creature than anything I've seen sharks to be on the Discovery channel. Freaky looking! The three story wall part of the aquarium is open to the mall and almost constantly lined by onlookers from all three levels...that's a nice touch and does invite you to go in and see more. You can even pay to dive in the aquarium though we thought the price for that was a bit too much. It costs about the same as diving in open waters of the gulf and my wife and I rather do that instead of the enclosed tank...but nonetheless it is nice that they offer that option. We almost missed the 'underwater zoo' part as the directions to get to it are not very clear. You have to walk to other levels above and around the aquarium to get to it and the signs are not very clear. If you just pay to see the aquarium, as we first mistakenly thought we had, then the entrance fee is not worth it...but once you find your way to the rest of the attraction, than it all makes sense why they charge what they charge. All in all, it's a great attraction most especially if you have kids along. Don't forget to use the ten Durham credit that you get per ticket in the gift shop...you can buy small items that cost not much more than the ten Durhams if you don't want to spend additional money.

A SHOPPING CENTRE AQUARIUM. An eye catching experience, as you are walking through the Dubai Mall see all these fish and sharks swimming around. They also had a large football in the tank. Not quite sure why, but it iscrowd pleaser.

World calss aquarium. The aquarium is situated in the Dubai mall . They have variious tickets but best to take a combi ticket for the aquarium , underwater zoo and glass bottom boat ride . Have done a lots of this before but this is in par with some of the good one .The aquarium is huge and runs from the ground to level 2 which is a great feat toi build such a huge standing aquarium . I have never seen such a tall aquarium The aquarium is a walk through and has over 150 species and though small walk is nice to pass through .One has then to proceed to the 2nd level for the underwater zoo which has a lot of more species and fishes which is euqally excellent and then follwed by the glass bottom boat ride . The ride seemed too short but good for kids to enjoy .All in all a good attraction . Excellent organisation and order . Keep it up guys

Fascinating !. The Aquarium is located inside the Dubai Mall on its ground level. It houses over 140 species .You first go thru the aquarium tunnel which gives you a spectacular view of the fish as they are swimming around. The tunnel is a 270 degree acrylic walk through tunnel. You may never want to leave! This was my favorite part. After leaving the tunnel you can walk along the rainforest, rocky shore and other environments. It is one of the best , if not the best aquarium I have ever visited. The entrance fee is well worth the price .

Great forbids. Entry is through the Dubai Mall. Pretty busy and there is a long queue to enter. Variety of tickets to buy from. We bought the one that included entry to the Aquarium, underwater zoo and glass-bottomed boat ride. Daughter enjoyed it immensely. Beware of the photographs - absolute rip offs!! Only sore point of the visit. You end up buying the photos and other memorabilia and then regret it immediately thereafter. Good fun though!!

Complete Family Fun!. We visited Dubai Aquarium recently and we have been visiting it every time our family, friends and relatives visit Dubai to have the World's best aquarium and underwater zoo experience! You get see a variety of species under one roof. It's an awesome experience for the entire family and it's always new when you visit it.
Biggest fish tank ever. Very nice experience. Especially kids will love the place. Separate section for reptiles. Overall thoroughly enjoyable.

Dubai aquarium and zoo. I went to Dubai aquarium in September 2013. There was 4 of us, 2 adultsAnd 2 children 9months old and 2 year old. We got a discount on the entrance fee because we had the entertain vouchers. Oh boy what can I say the aquarium was awesome with hundreds of go she right from sharks to exotic fish. Once inside we was given a time slot for the boat ride to get a birds eye view of the aquarium. While we waited we wondered around the zoo. My son found the animals very fascinating and enjoy this part a lot more. The animals ranged from reptiles snakes, lizards to penguins, etcOnce we arrived for our boat we was told the 9month old can't go due to age which we could understand why. So we took turns me and the wife along with the two year old who got to go twice with each of us. And now this is an experience to be able to see the wildlife swimming under your feet. The tour includes a guide which takes about the aquarium and how they care for the animals. Overall
Nice for kids!!!!!. Overall its an excellent place to watch thousands of fish so nearby in one place. Its very good for the kids general knowledge also.

Big Underwater Experience. We visited Dubai Mall which has a huge saltwater tank filled with fish and sharks. It's several stories tall and viewable by anyone walking by. Above that, on the top floor, is a set of much smaller exhibits that make up the Underwater Zoo. You can even stand over the giant tank to look town through the plexiglass. Thanks Country Travel Mart for all the arrangements.

Lovely visit with my baby. I had been to Dubai Mall for quite a few times but had never visited the aquarium and the underwater zoo. This time when I went with my family, we visited the aquarium and the zoo. It was a great visit. My baby really loved it. I myself really enjoyed the visit. Great variety of underwater creatures and kept and maintained in a great layout and environment.

Best bit you can see for free. The aquarium is in Dubai mall and you can view the large tank from the foyer without paying a penny, The cost of entry which was about £6.50 gets you into the underwater zoo - which does have a few interesting things to see - otters, penguins, some colourful fish etc. The second part is the ticket to walk through the tunnel - this is behind the main tanks you see for free so mainly the same things but the dark side of the tunnel is where all the big sharks hover about - so you can walk along the tunnel and feel like the sharks are right on your head. I love underwater life and photography so did enjoy this experience but for some they may not appreciate it anymore than they would the large free tank in the main mall. I didn't mind as I didn;t think it was that expensive but if you are a family I suppose the cost would soon add up.
fantastic. i really was in a different world when i was there,i recommend everyone who wants to see beauty on their own eyes,its highly recomended :)
Enjoyable trip with kids. Was a lovely trip to the aquarium. Our kids enjoyed it very much. The photos were very pricey. 200 dhms for one shot. A must visit if you visit Dubai.
Amazing. I took the ultimate package and it was mind blowing.. I watched the otters plant... everyone should visit.. Next time I am in Dubia. Will definitely do the diving...

Nice place to see!. It is located in Dubai Mall. It opens at 10 am and tickets starts from 70 AED per person. Tickets can be bought from there and you can choose from the usual tours to diving. You can see the aquarium for free from the mall, the diference is walking through the tunnel, which is great.In price of the ticket is included visiting the Underwater zoo which is a real specific desert and water animal zoo. After visiting the aquarium, climb to the top floor to visit the zoo. A real attraction in Dubai Mall.

Mega tank of water. The Dubai aquarium is in the Dubai mall. It is a must see experience even though you can see the same tunnel from outside for free (you can not get completely close because of the barrier, but good enough view for photos), you need a ticket to only walk through the tunnel. The tunnel is nice and fun having a shark swim overhead but a lot shorter than I had expected. After the tunnel there is a walk beside the Rainforest restaurant. The underwater zoo is on the upper floor (completely out of the tunnel area; you should take the elevator; no signs there). There are many small tanks of display of different varieties of fish and other little sea creatures. Within the underwater zoo area there is an elevated display area for few creepy creatures. There are few little and medium sized snakes ...We took a combo ticket ((Adult 70 AED, Child 3-12 years 55 AED)) which allows entry to the tunnel, underwater zoo only.We didn't try the glass bottom boat ride ( I heard that The ride itself will be over in 5 minutes or so) neither the fish feeding, and behind scene tour.The souvenir photos are pricey though.. so best to bring your own camera! All in all it was a pleasant way to spend an hour or two..

Go also to the underwater zoo. The aquarium is big with a lot of fish. Many nice sharks. Nothing special as such. However, we liked the under water zoo. There are many aquaries with fish, water mammals, reptiles and crocodiles. Take the whole package and take a ride in a boat with a glass flor and watch the fish from above.
Excellent, a must see. Well worth a visit, fabulous day out for kids, seeing fish in massive tank up close, you could also dive in the tank or go in boat and see fish from above.

excellent place. excellent place for enjoyment, especially for family with children. watching mermaid show is so amazing (it is having specific time schedule ) . it is so wonderful experience to see giant fish like shark moving above your head.....
Best I have seen so far. I liked the experience and the place is just so lovely. Indeed the best I've seen so far. Although a bit expensive but what else when on holiday if not to spend and enjoy
Well kept. We come often to the Aquarium with our son. Many times we eat at rain tree and enjoy the fish from the restaurant. Another thing to see in Dubai

Great for kids. This attraction is terrific for kids though if your kid is very young they could get just as much fun looking at the giant glass wall from inside the mall without paying the entrance fee. The aquarium is well stocked but we thought the "feeding the fish" was not well done. Not a cheap attraction but well worth it for 6 year old plus.

Amazing Shopping Mall Fish Tank!. Maybe not the cheapest attraction, but certainly worth a visit and value for money.The first large aqaurium we have visited anywhere - so maybe easily impressed?The fish feeding was good fun with a really helpful guide.Not sure about the penguins as they didnt seem have happy feet!
very small and normal. very small don't have a lot of sea animale every corner they write commimg soon comming soon the one thing i like only the panguin

Shopping fish. Dubai Mall is home a large aquarium where thousands of fishes and other aquatic creatures dart about amid the artificial coral housed within a large viewing panel, according to the Guinness book of World Records, the largest acrylic panel in the world.You can see a lot of it from the outside for free but if you want to walk though the tunnel there is a hefty entrance fee. We had discount vouchers collected from our hotel tourist board and we could also buy tickets for Sega World at a discount at the same time which made admission more palatable. Going through the tunnel and seeing the various fishes upfront was fun for the kids but once yopu have walked through you are done, so make sure you take a lot of pictures along the way.After the tunnel it was upstairs for a glass bottom boat ride which was part of our package. Its just a boat ride on top of the big tank. Again if you are lucky you can see the big fises swim by and again the kids liked it.Once that was done we went to the worthwhile Underwater Zoo. These houses aquatic and natural wildlife displays across eco-zones of the Rainforest, Ocean and Rocky shore. Its not limited to fishes, it has penguins, creepy crawlies and reptiles. A popular aspect again kids would dart for is the ability to have green screen pictures taken by the in house photographers.If it was not the fact that we had discount vouchers and got cut price tickets for Sega World I would say its very expensive for what you get for something that will take up about two hours. However the kids did find it fun and its rare to find something in such as grand scale in a shopping mall.
Excellent. Excellent Place to take the kids and enjoy the time. very clean ,properly handled. My kids really enjoyed it

Ok!!!. Nothing special about this hence my 3 star! My little boy couldnt bothered or get him going let alone me. Only thing is its a massive place thats all!Wasnt worth the money i spent on family of 3.

brilliant. It just proves Dubai just does everything on a grand scale. This is amazing and its inside the shopping mall. Dont forget to get your picture afterwards. I could of stood and watched the fish for hours. I was on my own but imagine the kids would have loved it.

Wow ... Dont Miss it .... Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo has everything to keep the entire family happy ... Located within The Dubai Mall, experience the largest Aquarium window in the world and walk through the 48-metre Aquarium Tunnel on Ground Level, and explore the Rainforest, Rocky Shore and Living Ocean environments at the Underwater Zoo on Level 2.Combo Ticket - Adult Aquarium Tunnel  Underwater Zoo - Aed 70Combo Ticket - Child (3-12 years)Aquarium TunnelUnderwater Zoo - AED 55

A very normal aquarium. The Dubai Aquarium compared to Kuala Aquarium according to size and the type of fish is about forth of it. I was not impressed compared to Kuala's aquarium but I guess it is a good start but they need to improve it. The entrance ticket is very expensive the cheapest one is around 80 AED and you have given a voucher of 10 AED which was nothing compared to the prices at the aquarium shop that was really expensive on a non attractive gifts.
Great Underwater Zoo and Tunnel. I really enjoyed the underwater zoo it has lots of fishes varieties that won't disappoint you. Also they have reptiles section.

Dubai Aquarium is ok …. Dubai Aquarium is ok …The best of the Dubai Aquarium is to see from the Dubai Mall.You pay a fee and only go through the tunnel, where you can see sharks and other animals and after that you can go to see underwater zoo in another floor.

Huge tank full of different fish. We only went to look at the tank and didn't go to the under water zoo. To look at the tank is free. We saw Sharks, Sting ray and all sorts of fish, we even saw the divers feeding them. Amazing.

Really superb. I thoroughly recommend spending some time at the aquarium in the Dubai Mall. The animals appear to be well cared for and the exhibits are clean and well-maintained. I used to live in Dubai and visited the aquarium a number of times - I can spend a long time in front of some of the exhibits just watching the behaviour of the animals. If you have children, you can make the day extra special by having lunch in the Rainforest Cafe - the food is very average but the experience is good.

View from outside. This is another place which gives a teaser from out. There are a lot of people who remain content with what is visible from out. There are mixed reviews about the ticket to the aquarium being worth it.From out you get quite a view. There are a lot of sharks and sting rays, but somehow I found the fish drugged as they were not as lively as they should be. Maybe they just had their fill.You can get a lot of god pictures taken. We visited Dubai Mall just to spend more time at the aquarium and it was well worth it.

Massive range of fish to see. I was here on a business trip and thought ill check this amazing aquarium out. The glass around the water is super strong and the fishes of so many variety's are brilliant. defo worth a visit if you in Dubai.

A must see. Although, it wasn't a long as I would have liked - - nonetheless, it was amazing to see the large number of species in this aquarium with sharks and various types of fish and sting rays. This is a must see and worth the price - although, i didn't find it to be really expensive for two people. It was 80AED per person (apprx $30USD). They also take your picture when you enter and show it to you at the end to see if you want to buy. This is a little pricey like any entertainment place - -but a one time experience so very worth it. For our picture and a tall coffee mug with the picture included was around 300AED ($80-90 USD). However, they do offer various packages you can pick and choose. We only wanted these two things so we spent a little more.

Good but pricey. Costs £20 per person, we went through the glass tunnel first of all - really awesome, especially as it was feeding time! After you have been through this you go upto the 2nd floor of the Dubai Mall and into the underwater zoo. There is a glass bottom boat you can go on - we weren't allowed as my wife is pregnant - but my dad went in and enjoyed. Some awesome fish to see ( the huge spider crabs are awesome as are the piranhas). We enjoyed - overpriced in my opinion but so are most things in Dubai. Worth a visit. Tip - if you get he Dubai Entertainer book (AED395) there is BOGOF vouchers in there which make it more affordable
Too expensive for what you get. You don't see much inside than you do from outside. And the water zoo is nothing special. Nor is the glass boat or the fish feeding experience.

Interesting couple of hours!. Went to the aquarium yesterday. Price was excellent as we had a 2 for 1 entertainer voucher. The tunnel under the aquarium made for some great photo opportunities! The glass bottom boat trip was a bit of a disappointment -short and we didn't really see anything - but the guide was nice and knew her stuff. It's definitely worth a visit with children, but for adults is only worth it if you have a deal - made for an interesting couple of hours and the location in Dubai Mall is excellent as it can just be part of your day out.

Awful to see the penguins!. Yes the aquarium is spectacular and breathtaking, but the impressive experience came to an abrupt end when we got to see the penguins inside (when you pay for the whole tour). They are clearly in a really bad shape and have developed OCD habits from staying in these conditions. Horrible, horrible to see. :(

Good time killer if you're at Dubai Mall, but overpriced and boring!. Meh! Nothing great about this. The price for the standard walk is around the same price as the Top of Burn Khalifa experience to put things in perspective.
Excellent place to watch fish and sea animals. Overall its an excellent place to watch thousands of fish so nearby in one place. Its very good for the kids general knowledge also.

This is nice specially for Kids and young people. You know that everything in Dubai is artificial , you cannot find a huge and brilliant history but you can spend times for shopping , Sahara , wild wadi ,Aquarium or Gulf. The Aquarium in Dubai Mall is nice specially for Kids.

Great Aquarium!. Loved the walk through tunnel! Seeing the fish/sharks that up close and personal is pretty cool. I also took the glass bottom boat ride that they offer and we had a shark swim right next to the boat...very cool!

Worth a visit. An amazing attraction for a shopping mall! Tip for aquarium...although its woth seeing don't rush past the front.you will get to see as much there as you will inside the tunnel, which will go remarkably fast. If you are paying for this I would recommend tagging on the zoo. Overall it's probably better for smaller kids ( pre teens). As always buy an entertainer book and get the discount!
Dubai Mall Aquarium. The Aquarium is well worth a visit and like most exhibits in Dubai has had no expense spared.The aquatic walk through was very good.

Awesome Experiance. We got the Ultimate ticked, for myself, wife and 2 kids aged 3 and 9 which was 110 AED per person and included access to all areas in the aquarium plus a 20 AED voucher each for use in the gift shop which we used to purchase two glass fish show pieces. We first booked the time slot for the boat ride near the entrance to the zoo and then went inside to zoo so by the time we complete, the boat ride will be ready. This place not to be missed as people of all ages can enjoy here. The penguins are so friendly that they pose for photography. The boat ride has a glass bottom boat so the aquatic life in the aquarium is clearly visible enjoyed by the kids most not to mention the tunnel where all types of fish are seen much more clearly as if you are under the sea and everything is swimming around you. The variety of aquatic life is also very vast.

Amazing Palce. Such a beautiful indoor attraction! A good place to unwind especially for kids. Good value for money. You'll see different sea creatures closely and some reptiles too on their underwater zoo.
Aqua zoo. Fairly good experience.... especially the penguins when they were being fed. The zoo is above the under water cyhing. Kids lovevit

Underwater zoo=penguins and crocs. I heard about the underwater zoo and thought it sounded amazing. Dubai is recognised as a city of extravagance. From sky scrapers to shaping luxuries islands and building hotels under the sea. So I thought: it'll be fascinating to see how they managed to recreate outdoors for zoo animals. I didn't think it would be a few pesky little water animals like crabs and crocs and penguins. We heard the Atlantis hotel had the biggest underwater zoo so we headed straight there. We couldn't see anything but images of aquariums so we headed to Dubai mall. In all we spent approximately 4 hours looking for this so called underwater zoo. When we finally fund it, we were thoroughly unimpressed. Ok the tanks are big. The sharks aren't amazingly big but there are lots of them. Sting rays are huge. But seriously?! This is an aquarium. Not a zoo. I felt cheated. U have the option to feed the sharks basically you r given a pot of 5 pieces of food and u chuck it into the tank from the top. Not that great. I think out of everything there I liked the fish embryo they display - a real fish egg with a live embryo growing. At different stages that was amazing. Apart from that - been there done that. So not interested.
Aquarium. Amazing experience within a large mall. Turtles are beautiful and the scale of the tank is impressive. Fairly crowded but keep under control by staff.

One of the Best. Termed as one of the best experiences of my life. Worth the price. Its on par with the Singapore aquarium and under water zoo and tunnel which i have been earlier. A must go on the Dubai attractions while on a holiday. Both kids and there parents would equally enjoy the experience. I took a combo ticket where i could go through the under water tunnel, behind the scenes, shark feeding etc. there are other combo tickets where one could take the glass bottom boat ride and see the sharks swimming under the boat. The species of fishes found are huge including various kinds of sharks, rays, eels, various aquatic fishes,and the list goes on. The best part of the exhibit is undoubtedly the under water tunnel where one walks through the tunnel and you see the sharks swim above your head, Its a wonderful experience of a life time.In the behind the scenes tour they take you through the whole aquarium to show how things work and all detailed aspect of the aquarium like shark feeding etc. You also get to see various fishes in close proximity and some of them which you can touch like the star fish. It was a one of a kind experience.

Nice one. I was expecting the tunnel to be longer but it was still nice to have all these fish swim around you. The zoo was cool, too. Good variety of exhibits, and not too many people even though it was Friday evening and the Dubai Mall was full!
Not special for the price. The entrance fee is high for the auquarium and after 1 hour you stand outside already. No value for your money. Only the shark tunnel is cool. The zoo is very poor.

Go sea this!. You might regret your trip to Dubai if you miss this! an amazing site and very reasonably priced attraction, walk under the aquarium, glass bottom boat and tour of the zoo is perfect! very very good value for money. Like most things in Dubai, done to the very highest standards and the animals and fish are well looked after!

Wow !!. Wow what a centre-piece for a hotel. The aquarium is huge and you could stand there watching the thousands of fish all day long. The snorkel experience in this aquarium is an excellent idea but very expensive.

Average!. If you have seen Baltimore aquarium then you might not find this one fascinating. Although there were varied species, one might not find a deal or package in which there is live show, exhibits and 3D or 4D movies for the kids altogether. If you have never seen big aquarium then it might be a treat for your eyes but then there are many better options in the world! Don't expect a dolphin show in your package. They have a separate place called Dolpharium which is not inside this place.

highly recommended. We went on an unplanned trip to the Aquarium while visiting the Dubai Mall. We thought it was excellent value for money and a very good aquarium. We paid a bit extra for the glass bottom boat - which takes you across the top of the aquarium tank - something we had never done before and it was very interesting. The gift shop is very reasonably priced with mainly very good quality souvenirs. Kids of all ages will enjoy this very much. Doesn't take too long to go around, about an hour and a half all in. Staff friendly and helpful and this is well worth a vist.

Take the kids. Although we had no kids this would be one place I would take them. No kids?still worth a visit fish tanks are amazing with a wide variety. Upstairs you have the chance to see many reptiles, creapy crawlys, penguins etc

The BEST Aquarium ever!. this is the best aquarium I have ever been to in my life. As with everything in Dubai, it is decorated to impress. and it certainly does. The huge tanks are incredible, especially the main one!

Amazing view. I visited the aquarium with my little one and I can say both of us were awed at the size of the tank and the fishes. Well worth the visit. We didn't go to the from like most viewers. We went behind the tank, a level up just next to the restaurants. And here we got an amazing view. Really up close and personal. It was a real wow, visit for me. Loved it. I wonder what they feed those fishes. They are ginormous

Good, but I was expecting slightly more. This aquarium is very beautiful, and not too highly priced so it is worth a visit. If you're lucky you'll get to see the divers or the fish feeding time which was actually quite interesting!It's note the biggest or best of aquariums out there, and chances are you would have been to one slightly bigger/better...however the layout and unique sea creatures do make the trip well worth it.The tunnel is also very pretty to have some photos taken in...quite spectacular! They also offer assisted tours free of charge if you wish, these are informative and helpful but perhaps use the guide for half the tour and do the final part alone.

Dubai Aquarium. We got the premium deal, which was 110 AED per adult and included access to all areas in the aquarium plus a 20 AED voucher each for use in the gift shop (which we used to purchase two free magnets). There was supposed to be some sort of boat ride included but we weren't sure where that was and the attendant couldn't tell us so perhaps that's on the "coming soon" list. The aquarium itself was very well set up, with clear paths that allow you to see all the features without getting rushed along by the people coming up behind you. It starts with a walk through a Perspex-lined tunnel, with a close up view of various fish, sharks, rays, corals and so on, leads on to a series of fish tanks and then upstairs to the "creepy crawly" exhibits. Would definitely recommend for kids, perhaps a bit of the same old for older visitors but a nice way to pass a couple of hours overall.

Great aquarium. We were exploring Dubai during the summer, so we definitely wanted to stay indoors. We wandered around the mall and decided to visit the aquarium. It's a very nice and very large attraction. We did a combination ticket that also let us visit the underwater zoo, which is also very well done and a lot of fun. Plenty of exhibits to keep you busy for at least an hour. great for both kids and adults.

Nice for kids but expensive. Its a nice place to visit if you have fish loving kids like I do. Only problem is i find the entry fee a bit high. There were 7 of bus in total. We paid 85 dirhams per head. My 2 yrs old did not pay.

A Day at the Dubai Mall. This is one of many attractions at the Dubai Mall! Pedestrians can look at the large tank from an outside 2 story viewing area. We opted to pay and go in. They have an aquatic walk thru area which is really nice! There were sharks, stingrays and some other large creatures, so enjoyed staying in the "tube" for a while just to observe. Then you go up 2 or 3 escaltors to visit the "zoo" portion. It is small, but for a mall, quite nice and worth donating to the cause. Remember, you are in a desert, so seeing something besides sand is nice!

Nice. We only seen aquarium in dubai mall it's free to see inside mall but if you prefer you can buy ticket and watch more but is west of money, you will find out when you get there . Dubai underwater zoo is one name as dubai aquarium it is NOT 2 different name it's same .. Do not west money watch for free,, use your brain

Excellent. My 13 year old son and I really enjoyed the aquarium and we have been to many in the past.If you just walk through glancing at the fish and other animals rather than spending some time watching and wondering you have missed out. Yes there could have been more information about the animals but this was my only criticism.No queues either!
Aquarium. Magnificent, wonderful, you can take great photos and see different kinds of creatures. Very good value for money. I would like to be there again.

Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Nice place for Kids. Good attraction for family as it is situated in Dubai Mall and near to Burj Khalifa So you can enjoy number of attraction with it. There is lot of kind of fishes and water animals which you want to see . Nice place to visit
World's largest Indoor Aquarium. One location which nobody should miss to visit. The underwater zoo and Dubai aquarium are fantastic. Eventhough costly, this is very nice..
A look from the mall is enough. Don't bother going in unless you've never been to an aquarium before - others we've seen before we're much better. The view from the mall is as good as it gets,

Free look from the outside. Being in a mall sometimes held some surprise, as this one does. An aquarium bigger than my house and the view is for free, on both floors. I saved the money and just enjoyed the view. Small hint, I was there on a Friday morning. All shops were closed, but I had the aquarium for myself.

Worlds largest fish tank window. Unbelievable size aquarium in a shopping mall and its free to see. You pay to walk through the tunnel and see the underwater zoo but its worth it. You can stand for hours just watching the massive sharks and fish

Great for kids. A very pretty aquarium in Dubai mall. The glass tunnel is very beautiful and you can spend some time just looking at the all the seal life gliding above you. The overall tour was good too and we saw quite a lot of sea life there. The kids absolutely loved the trip.

Great experience. We visited while in the Mall and spent most of our time there. The sharks hallway is a great place for taking memorable pictures and kids will enjoy the variety of fish and sea creatures despite it being relatively small.

Attraction value. The Dubai Aquarium is one of the largest, if not the largest Tourist attractions in Dubai, with its hugh water tanks and its lighting that makes you feel as if you were part of the whole nature environment. With its colourful fishes, both small and large, its curved construction, its global vision adds to its attraction for thousands who visit this scenario daily. Its both exciting and unique in that it creates a wonderful and warm environment where one feels you are part of the nature, with both animals and humans feeling so close to each other and as if playing with each other and a sense of belonging to each other. Its enormity od size also gives one a feeling of being in the sea itself as the its global construction enable's one to travel around it without missing anything. A unique and excellent experience for all, both young and old, that will stick in our minds for a long time.

"cool tour under the sea in a hot city". did u just the read the title? yeasss. . .. dubai aquarium is a great tourist spot. . . . one of my friend work there so i decided to visit, but dont worry i paid for the entrance. . . . its was nice seeing animals and colorful fish and creatures.. . . and going under the tunnel was really awesome. .. i wish i can swim the sharks one time with my own fin like a mermaid. . anyway, thats a joke dubai aquarium is awesome!

Great Experience. If you visit the Dubai Mall you will see the largest single sheet of acrylic in the world which is very impressive. Paying to enter the Aquarium was quick and easy. We paid for feeding fish and behind the scenes tour. A clean and highly professional set up indeed and an experience worth doing.

Great value. We visited here while in the Dubai mall and it was a grey experience after visiting the huge aquarium and I mean huge 40 metres by 11 metres and 10 million litres of water the under water zoo is great, from penguins to lizards, snakes and sharks, rays and crocs it has it all and puts the sea life centre in the uk to shame or a quarter of the price. Well worth a visit.

Amazing Aquarium. This place is pretty amazing! you can just look at the aquarium for hours. It is so relaxing, looking at these beautiful fish and manta rays gliding flawlessly in the water. Yes, it is small but they have so many sea creatures that you wouldn't see elsewhere! Paid the standard package (80dhs) and you get 10dhs voucher that you can spend at their souvenier shop right at the end of the aquarium.I would certainly recommend this place to everyone especially if you are travelling with kids.
WOW!!!. The feeling and experience is one to be experienced in a lifetime getting so close to the sharks and other sea creatures changed my approach to life. Simply out of this world

Had a good time. Excellent aquarium with rainforest theme. Great to view worlds largest acrylic panel guinness book of world records. Children overjoyed watching sharks close by....had wonderful experience

Amazing... The best money we ever spent. This is an amazing attraction and definitely worth a visit. We had an entertainer voucher, so we got a buy one get one free on the ultimate package for AED110 (around £20). This included the walk through the tunnel and around the edge, but also a glass bottom boat ride and a visit to the underwater zoo, which was amazing. There was lots to see and from the looks of it, lots of things for kids to do too. There was more than just fish too, creepy crawlies and also the penguins were amazing to see. I would recommend this package because of the boat ride and the zoo attraction. We had a great time and would definitely go back again.

See it for free from the Mall atrium. On balance, I am not sure whether its worth it to pay 80 Dirhams to walk through the tunnel and visit the underwater zoo. I would say the underwater zoo is less than spectacular for the cost. The wall of the aquarium, viewable for free (and up close) from The Dubai Mall atrium is spectacular, so paying the extra to walk through the tunnel to see the same fish (albeit from underneath) makes me question the value for money. Its a shame you can't pay a modest prIce to walk through the tunnel alone rather than have to pay for both the tunnel AND the underwater zoo, as the latter was mediocre. I didn't like seeing the penguins in indoor captivity either. There's no denying the wall of fish is spectacular though but why pay when you can see it at no cost? I fact, the more I think about it, all those fish species closely packed in one, albeit massive, tank are in an environment not replicated in nature and this alone, in retrospect, is perhaps not a venture worth supporting? Depends how you feel about fish in captivity.

The Biggest Aquarium and The Best. Aquarium TankThe 10-million liter Dubai Aquarium tank, located on the Ground Level of The Dubai Mall, is the largest suspended aquarium in the world.It houses thousands of aquatic animals, comprising over 140 species. Over 400 Sharks and Rays live in this tank, including the largest collection of Sand Tiger Sharks in the world.There are numerous ways for visitors to experience the main Aquarium tank, which measures 51 metres in length, 20 metres in depth and 11 metres in height.- The main Guinness World Record-winning acrylic panel in front of the tank provides free viewing to the public from all 3 levels of the mall- The 48 metre walk-through Tunnel provides 270 degree views from 11 metres below the surface of the tank- Visitors can go on a Glass-bottom boat ride, providing unique views of the tank from beneath their feetThose who want to experience a dip in the tank can opt for a Cage Snorkeling Experience

Aquarium on a Budget. The aquarium is "viewable" from the Mall at no cost. It does cost to walk through the tunnel or go in the glass bottomed boat but the free view from the outside of the tank is quite spectacular and well worth a look. The variety and quantity of fish is great and you can spot many species.

Not good value. If I had realised how little there was I would not have paid 80 dirhams each(children the same)The aquarium is the best bit and that can e viewed for free,you just don't walk through the tunnel.

Out of the World. The Aquarium in Dubai Mall spans over 3 floors and has a depth of 11 meters containing about 10000 litres of water. There are all kinds of fishes. I especially found the Sharks and String Rays very attractive. While the aquarium can be viewed without a ticket, there is a lot inside which cannot be seen without a ticket. Missing the secrets inside is a real loss after coming all this distance.On the second floor, the gallery of fishes is wonderful. There are so many varieties of wonderful fishes besides penguins, crocodiles, crabs, lobsters, etc. However, I found the Jelly Fish the best attraction.The boat ride is not worth it and could be avoided.

Insight into an underwater world. The Aquarium is conveniently located in the Dubai Mall. The tunnel is great to walk through. The sharks swim so close and it is great to see them from all angles.We also took part in the 'Behind the scenes tour' which gave an interesting insight into how the aquarium is maintained. The guide was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions.Moreover, there are many other species of fish, reptiles and insects to see. You also get to see crocodiles and penguins. Overall, it was a fun couple of hours but a bit pricey for what it offered.

Lovely Attraction. We enjoyed this Aquarium. The zoo has a mix of creatures including playful otters and penguins. To all manner of creepy crawlies. Upstairs they can offer a glass bottom boat ride over the aquarium - short but still fun and a nice way to see the animals while keeping your feet dry. We particularly liked the models which you could get photos by.

Good experience. Situated in The Dubai Mall, this place is a must visit. The under water tunnel is impressive. The entrance ticket includes a single visit to the tunnel and the under water zoo (which is situated in the next floor).

Dissapointed. My partner and I visted the Dubai Aquarium and I must say I was slightly disappointed when we booked the glass bottom boat toar.... we were asked some safety questions before hand and given a life jacket, you step into a wooden boat with a glass bottom which is fine until you realise the boat has no engine just a guy pulling you round with abit of rope...The underwater tunnel is good I would recommend this and the smaller fish tanks upstairs.... the boat ride was a let down though!!

somewhat dissappointing. when you first view the aquarium the impact is immediate and quite stunning.
sadly, this impact does not continue once you enter and walk through.
the underwater zoo part is far more entertaining especially for kids.
the penguins in particular were mesmerizing as they whizzed about the water narrowly avoiding crashing into each other!

Great experience !. Amazing aquarium, its moderate size aquarium but great managing for the space, nice activities including the boat ride which you can see the aquarium under you feet, diving as well but very expensive, nice water zoo creatures, but all & all it worth maybe one visit.

Worth maybe one visit. The most amazing thing is that it's located in a shopping mall - so you can take time out from shopping to entertain the children. There are different tours - the one we chose included a 'boat' trip which was just a short ride in a glass bottom boat around a large tank. You then go through the zoo section which is very small and some of the information plaques were at adult height so not well thought out for children. Tickets work out quite expensive considering the 'tunnel' is only about 100 yards long and clearly visible from the second floor landing of the Mall. The most annoying thing is that at every few yards there's someone trying to take your photo - and they're very expensive.

expensive,with no one to guide. you can go past that tunnel in 2 minutes, so it was expensive ticket, you can avoid buying the ticket and watch the aquarium from outside on the second floor, they should definitely reduce the price of ticket.there was no one to guide, we had no idea where to go after passing the tunnel, well you need to go to 3rd floor for another fish aquarium displays, which was worth the money. and the seals were good to watch and unexpected. there were also small snake like fishes which was surprise.

Excellent value. On first inspection it is amazing! Once you've gazed in wonder at the enormity of the Perspex wall you walk through the tunnel. Amazing to see so many huge sharks and rays. Then it's up to the second floor to marvel at the millions of fish, alligators, otters and even penguins! The glass bottom boat ride is great. If you like creepy crawlies, then there is another floor filled with lizards, spiders, snakes etc.The platinum ticket gets you 20 dirhams to spend in the shop - what a super idea. We had a great afternoon in the aquarium.

Best underwater aqarium. We went the the underwater aqarium in atlantic but was awful. This was the best. We also went on a boat that floatsat the top and you can see it all under your feet . You can even go scuba diving too. Its amazing.
nice aquarium. My two daughters love this acquarium so much, but my husband and I expected it bigger. The sharks were incredibles.

Ok aquarium but small. Everything in Dubai is big so we were quite disappointed with the the part of the aquarium which you have to pay for - about 80 dirham (£15) each for the basic package. Other aquariums we've been to are better - Deep Sea World in Edinburgh, Scotland and the one in La Rochelle in France. If you've not been to others before, it's might be worth a visit, otherwise it's not worth the time or money. Stick to looking at the impressive tank in the mall - it's free!

Good to see underwater life!. It was a nice experience to see underwater life. However, I wished the aquarium was larger, not only 50 meters of length. I liked the underwater zoo more than the aquarium.

Really cool aquarium. I visited the Dubai Mall and this was the main attraction for me. To be inside a mall it was HUGE! The only other place I can think of that you could find an inside aquarium as big would be to go to an actual zoo or dedicated aquarium. There are sharks, rays, and smaller fish and (for a price) you can don a wetsuit and dive into the tank! Walking through will take roughly 20 minutes (just walking through) but it is neat to have fish swimming OVER you as well as around you. Then you can immediately shop or eat afterwards at the world's largest mall. Absolutely worth a visit if in UAE.

Nice Experience!. Located INSIDE the Dubai Mall, this attraction was quite the treat! Although I was visiting by myself, I can imagine that this attraction would serve as an EXCELLENT way to pass time for those traveling with shop-a-holics! One could simply allow his power-shopping friends to enjoy shopping bliss while he allowed himself to be transported to an underwater adventure!

Nice aquarium but pricey. Visited Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo during a recent stay in Dubai. This place is located in the Dubai Mall has a very large tank with many fish, sharks, rays, etc, which can be seen from the mall passage in front of the aquarium. Buying a ticket is from AED 90 per person (about US$ 26) and up and allows one access to a single glass tunnel that traverses the bottom of the aquarium and to other exhibits. After walking through the tunnel one takes the escalator to the third floor to see the remainder of the collection--fish, penguins, and other water creatures. The penguin exhibit was our favorite, there are many other smaller fish tanks that contain species anyone who has ever visited a similar place has likely seen before, but it is well done. Compared to similar aquaria I have seen in the US (Camden, Baltimore, Oregon Coast) the overall size of the underwater zoo is quite small, and in addition to the penguins could do with another key attraction. We opted for the AED 110 package which includes a ten-minute glass bottom boat ride (pretty forgettable) and some vouchers for the gift shop. Overall worth a visit, but quite expensive. Budget two hours.

What a day out. Could have spent longer here. The prices we so reasonable even in the gift shop! The experience was amazing and also seeing some of the more exotic fish up close was one thing I will never forget. Didn't expect to see the crocodiles and also looking forward to their new exhibit with the penguins!

Show me the aquarium in YOUR mall. It is so cool that they have a full-size aquarium here!!. There are many animals to see. They did a nice job. Good presentation. The Underwater Zoo thing was cool, too. We took the boat ride, that was cool. All-in-all, nice trip.

Not the best aquarium experience. If you don't mind parting with the money this experience is not bad. Having visited many aquariums in the past this was not the best I have been to. The underwater tunnel and the penguins are the best part of the entire experience. This is a great experience for children who enjoyed the experience a lot more.The cheaper options are better as the glass bottom boat experience was very quick and the tour guide spoke very quietly and did not share much information. Rather just answered the few questions that my husband and I asked. This is probably because of how many tours they fit into a day. A different glass bottom boat experience in another country was much more enjoyable with a lot more information shared about the sea life within the aquarium.
A must to do. Great attraction and a reminder to all how precious the ocean is to us. Over 33000 'creatures' to see from the sea !! Loved it and would do it again and again.

Stunning. Definetly worth a visit, particular if you have children with you. It is crazy to go to a mall when on holiday, but features like this and SEGA Republic entertain both adults and children alike.

Underwater Tunnel is Best Part. We were short on time when we visited here, but were able to see the whole attraction within an hour. All you really need to do is the 70dhs option, which allows you to see the tunnel and walk round the rest up above. Anything over and above that does not seem to get great reviews on here. Also you don't get vouchers with the 70dhs option, so are not harrassed to buy anything in the shop. The Tunnel was probably the most impressive part for us. I can see how children would like this attraction and there certainly were plenty of children on the day we visited. However the big kids seemed impressed as well ! :-)

Very interesting. As we were there during the feeding time and the care taken by the officials to feed the creatures is very touching and nice. The glass bottom boat ride with the aquarium official was also very informative and enjoyable.

Diving with the Sharks- AMAZING!. My son & I did the Shark Dive at the Dubai Aquarium at Dubai Mall on July 5, 2013. I've done this in 2009 too but this time it was out of this world. Our two diver instructors, Irwin & Sam, did a great job briefing us and taking us down and around the tank. There are only 4 divers and 2 instructors. This time the sharks were really UP CLOSE & PERSONAL. They come close to you and then automatically move away- and the instructors gently guide them away if they still want to be inquisitive. It's one of the most memorable dives and attractions I've ever accomplished. Kudos to the Dubai Mall administration and to Al Boom diving for this experience. However, it is expensive- it me down by Dhs. 1600 (approx. US$450) for the two of us! Al Boom initially (the same morning) gave us a refresher course at their site at Al Wasl Road- there too, the instructor was an excellent guy who very patiently took us through all the theoretical steps and then into the swimming pool for the practical refresher. My son & I felt in very safe hands all the way.

Good but over priced and housed in 2 venues. It is over the top to ask 70dhs for this (we went with 2-for-1 vouchers as usual). You get to walk through the short tunnel underneath the aquarium. Then you have to walk through the mall and go up two levels with the lift or escalator to the underwater zoo where you see fish, penguins, crocodiles, snakes, lizards and so forth. Our little ones loved it but it was very crowded (it was a weekday but during school holidays) and everything was so narrow to manoeuver a pram. They also had two of these photo stops, which I hate (where they force you to pose for a picture in order to sell it to you for an exorbitant price a bit later on). this is not a must visit. you see the essence from the outside.

Shark tank was amazing but remainder was a bit disappointing. The shark tank that can be seen from the mall is something that shouldn't be missed, but I'm not sure I'd recommend spending the monthly to go through the aquarium unless it is something that you really enjoy. There were certainly some unique fish that I'll never see elsewhere, but it wasn't too extensive. We were VERY disappointed with the glass bottom boat and I would not recommend purchasing any of the optional tour items.

Dubai aquarium. Well made Aquarium and underwater zoo, great place for children to spent time for couple of hours.. The penguin area is quite smelly, can be better maintained. For those who enjoy diving with sharks, or watching them from nearby or bottoms up, its a nice fantastic experience. But note that along with the ticket, they mandatorily give coupons to purchase some stuff from aquarium store, we dint pretty much like the options available at the store, so were forced to buy something with the coupons.

Amazing. Underwater zoo is great keeping different species or rare sea creatures like octopus star fish jelly fish eels crabs penguins turtles and many more very interesting and informative for children
Awesome Trip. Would like to keep revisiting Loys to see People Fashion Interesting sites Newer Malls Clean Country

Fun place, with kids and family. This was my second visit to the aquarium; my kids wanted to see it again. A good outing with family for a few hours. Starting with the underwater tunnel on the ground floor, you enter the underwater zoo on the first floor. Interesting variety of underwater species. We had the glass bottom boat ride - nothing great there. Next time I am planning to have the dive with the fish and the (docile) sharks. The management will have to bring in something new as this was my second visit in 2 years and it is all the same. I doubt if I will go there the third time unless there is a new attraction. Not really for the lone visitor, you will enjoy more with young kids.

Better to see the fish from outside in the Mall and save your money!. There is not a whole lot more inside the Aquarium than what you see outside. Walk the tunnel which is the same fish as on the outside view, some tanks with different fish, a jungle bridge and some penguins behind glass. Wouldn't bother!

Lots of fun for divers and viewers. The Dubai aquarium was a unique experience. It's location in the mall attracted a lot of viewers. As divers, we were fortunate to have had the opportunity to dive in the large aquarium tank and enjoyed the interaction with the sharks and others fish species as well as the mall walkers!

Wish I had taken my kids with me. Had a blast. Had used the entertainer voucher and got a great deal. Took pics galore. Worth the visit. Even if you do not have the $$$ to go inside make sure you enjoy the tunnel view from the Dubai Mall. If my kids were with me they would have enjoyed it more and I would have had a hard time getting them home.

awesome species of fishes and scenery. i will really recommend this to the folks that have kids and holidaying with them, this will really open up their brains to nature. The underwater zoo is very nice, you can scuba dive and play with the fishes, they have sharks there but are a bit restricted. The view from the inside is awesome so malke sure you get the tickets (Dhs110) that gives you access to the boat ride, and the underneath.
Wow. After this aquarium I think that all the others will seem boring. Sharks, rays and all other kind of fish swimming above and around you.
Great Fun. Well worth the 110AED per person. This fee included visiting the Aquarium, the Zoo and a boat ride as well as 40AED voucher for the souvenir shop. The visit was amazing very interesting.

Extremely stupid. Complete waste of money!. The aquarium is completely stupid, only few meters to see the fishes, then you go to what they call"boat trip", it's eventually a silly floating box pulled by a rope!!!
This is the worst aquarium experience I've ever had...
Nice. Very very nice but if u dont wish to spend on it u can even just hav a look from outside 75 percent covers from the outer part of it inside the dubai mall
Imagine swimming with the fish and animals. An unforgetable experience for all the family. Imagine you are swimming with the fish and animals. Take loads of photo.s

Great place. Very good aquarium, it's one of my favourite places to go on holidays. And this will not let u down,
Got to feed fish and learned a good bit while I was here overall I'd definitely recommend it

A break from shopping. A large portion of the aquarium is visible from inside the Mall itself, and although the tunnel provided a nice experience of being surrounded by the water (and by many sharks!), i felt it wasn't worth the money we paid. However, I do think that younger children would find both the tunnel and the zoo great fun, and will also give you a break from shopping!

Great time!!. Kids had a wonderful time. Lots of nice aquatic life and animals. penguins are neat also. Do not pay to feed the fish, it is not worth it. Staff is very friendly. We will go again when we visit Dubai.

Take an underwater break from the shops!. The aquarium and underwater zoo are located inside Dubai mall. I went with my husband and 5 year old in February and we all thought it was magical. You will see sharks, sting rays and even penguins! It's fairly expensive but worth doing - it is after all the biggest indoor aquarium in the world! There is also the opportunity to get on a bottomless (glass) boat where you will see lots of underwater life. Highly recommended.

Glug! Glug!. It was gorgeous. If you like underwater life then I guarantee you will have fun. If you want you can pay and get a photo that looks like you had a photograph taken underwater. When you go through the tunnel you can sometimes see a manta ray asleep on top of the tunnel. There are lots of colourful fish. There is a gift shop and it will be amazing.

Glug! Glug!. It was gorgeous. If you like underwater life then I guarantee you will have fun. If you want you can pay and get a photo that looks like you had a photograph taken underwater. When you go through the tunnel you can sometimes see a manta ray asleep on top of the tunnel. There are lots of colourful fish. There is a gift shop and it will be amazing.

GREAT BREAK DURING YOUR SHOPPING. Located at the Dubai Mall, this is simply amazing aquarium. You could choose to enjoy the aquarium for free (from a distance) or for 80 Dhs per person you could enjoy the scenery from a close distance and also walk through a glass tunnel filled with sharks and sting rays. Highly recommended. Your kids would love it, and you will love it for certain.

Blah experience. The aquarium is pretty expensive for what it is. The tunnel is pretty much pointless paying for seeing as you can see a lot from the outside plexiglass wall. They also sell the ticked in packages which come with a 10 dirham voucher to use in the shop, but nothing in there can be bought for 10 dirhams or close to that, so unless you wanna spend more money, it's not worth it

Much better than the one at Atlantis. This underwater zoo has some features that make it better than the one at Atlantis. The walk through tunnel and the glass bottom boats for starters. Very enjoyable!

Amazing experience. The fish are all kept in beautiful tanks and there is a really good array of fish to see. This is topped off with the creepy crawly zoo too, which is amazing. The layout and information available is excellent.

A nice day to spend with your kids. Zoos and aquariums are not for me. I prefer seeing animals in the wild. My friend really enjoyed it. Its mostly for parents and kids to be introduced to nature. The one thing that bothered me the most is that the areas for the penguins, water rats, and alligators was just way to small. Its pretty large and there is a great variety of sea life to see. Walking through the tunnel was the best as you feel you are underwater. skip on riding the glass bottom boat you get a better view watching the fish in the tank.

Loved it. We loved the aquarium. My oldest daughter is 2 and was in awe of everything. She was too young to go on the boat ride but we did not mind. The underwater tunnel was brilliant. The zoo was really entertaining too. She just loved loved loved it all ! Yes it gets three loved!!!

Underwater Zoo is well worth a visit. The aqarium you can see from the mall and if this was all there was i would say dont bother however the zoo is fabulous.Lots to keep you going for a couple of hours and the kids could watch Nemo for ages!!They dont advertise it however there is a cheaper entry option of around £10 (55 Drm) which is better value if you dont want a glass bottom boat ride.

Jaw dropping. We opted for the platinum tour for AED110 per person. We were quit sceptical about paying so much but it was definitely worth while. The underwater tunnel is an amazing experience. Being able to walk through the fish tank is beautiful, seeing all the fish swim above you and getting as close as you can (without getting wet!).After the tunnel we strolled through the underwater world seeing various animals from around the world. We then moved on to the glass bottom boat ride! Life jackets on, we got on and "cruised" over the top of the tank. We literally saw the tank from 3 directions which was really great.Be careful, along the way you'll come across annoying photographers, taking pictures to sell to you later. Your purchase is optional.The cost of the ticket also includes a discount voucher at the souvenir shop, which is worth a visit. They stock generic aquarium memorabilia but there are a few worthwhile buys.In general, the experience is wonderfully unique and worth a visit!
Wonderful. Awesome water feature in the middle of a shopping centre. The Aquarium and Zoo was amazing for all ages.

Not much compared to the Atlantis aquarium. Pretty small and not that much variety to see. If you think the Mall is an attraction, then you will probably want to go through here, but you'll be in and out in minutes. The aquarium at Atlantis is far bigger and much more impressive (and free).

Lots to see. Very interesting with far more to see than expected. There are two areas covered in the entry price and kept us occupied for over 2 hours.
For us the pengiun feeding was the highlight. I would definately recommend.

A must when visiting the Dubai Mall. This attraction has many 'packages' on offer, just paying 55 dirham to visit both the aquarium and zoo was definitely worth the money. The tunnel inside the aquarium is beautiful, but, as pretty as this is, I did not feel it was the main attraction. The underwater zoo is really big and there is a lot of wildlife on show, even a couple of breeds of penguin! There are many opportunities to get your photo taken and buy it for an extortionate amount but just the same opportunity to take the photos yourself. Worth a visit!

Not that exciting. IT'S not worth spending 200+ dirhams on the Aquarium and zoo. Since the aquarium is very much visible from outside also, you don't find it much exciting when you enter. The glass inside tunnel is scratched, resulting in a not clear view of the tank. the boat used to give you a trip over the tank has same issue, the glass at the bottom of the boat is badly scratched, so view and the time you spent in boat is hardly 7-8 minutes.

Dubai Mall's highlight along with the Fountains. Crystal clear waters and a plethora of aquatic wildlife. You see white sharks as well in all their glory. We didn't actually go in, there is a brilliant view, floor to ceiling while walking in the mall itself and you get this for free.

walking with the sharks,. this was a really nice experience,so many sea creatures especially the shark all above your head,all the different colour fish,the penguins,snakes,crocs,we had so much fun,than coming out into the shop to buy gifts

Loss of a star for the price/value. Okay, so you want to see the world's biggest sheet of plexiglass and the creatures behind it? No joke, the plexiglass you see is ONE panel. It is truly cool to see this aquarium and the sharks that cohabitate with the other fish life. However, don't waste your money to go into the museum and walk under the thing. You're going to pay upwards of $40US to walk under a foot tunnel and out the other side. Waste of money, you can see the exact same thing by standing outside the tank, which is what MOST people do. The one thing that is kind of cool is you can book a dive with the sharks. I have no information on how to do that, just what I've heard that it's like $200 US. Want to see wildlife like this with a better experience? Stay at the Atlantis Palm Jumeirah.
Underwater Zoo in the Mall. We were shopping in the mall and we saw a crowd of people standing around and when we got close, we saw beautiful fishes.!!!WOW thats all I can say

Just amazing. May its not the biggest aquarium you have been to, but personally I felt like a child! It is really impressive and very clever located in the biggest shopping mall of the city. I could spend endless hours there, I loved it!

A must see attraction in Dubai Mall. A great attraction for all ages, ignore other reviews that state that the aquarium is 15 long. This is not the case as it actually is the biggest viewing panel in the world according to the guinness book of records. The tank dimensions are 51x20x11 METERS not feet! Anyway if you are going to purchase do not buy anything less than the zoo and aquarium ticket as the zoo is a major part of the attraction and is entered into from the top floor of the mall. My family had a great time there and dont forget the creepy crawlies section in the upstair section of the zoo.

Boring, don't waste your money!. From afar this looks amazingLocated in the centre of dubai mall, huge fish tank reeling kids in!The aquarium is not longer then 15 feet long, great for kids but you can walk through in no more than 3 minutesAs for the "underwater zoo" which requires u to wear A life jacket well lets just say its ermmmm a boat in a mini swimming pool with a man using a rope to take u from one end to the other, again was over in4 minutes FLAT.Do not waste ur money --- avoid!

Nice but ...... Look and admire the gigantic wall from the mall. But in terms of paying to walk under the tunnel don't waste your money. Plain and simple its not worth anything like the admission price. The only rip off in Dubai !

A must Visit wonder. Dubai Aquarium and under water zoo is a must visit wonders in Dubai.If you know swimming cand courageous enough you can go in to the water and touch and play with sharks and other big fishes.Otherwise enjoy watching the wonder presentation the under water zoo one of its kind in Dubai also you can go around watch various types sea life and son on I have visited with my family and we enjoyed it.I must visit place for the Dubai Visitor

Popular, Huge, and Beautiful. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uPSu2THfTH0&list=PLCk8vWTtXgUImXCtrSJr-lvxzOE_gKyrJ&index=6The above link shows the HD Video footage of aquarium and underwater zoo. When I visited the Aquarium, I noticed only a fraction of people buying tickets for inside tour. I bought the ticket and did the tour and came to conclusion, that its only worth for one time. The visuals from outside looks more amazing and that's what most of the locals do. But the whole concept and its execution needs to be admired for scale (largest acrylic) and location.
Good aquarium. The tunnel at the beginning is the best part of the aquarium. The rest is pretty standard for a city aquarium. Quiet pricey, but to be expected for Dubai. Overall a good experience.
Great for free!. I would say this is amazing to stand and watch from the mall, for free. Not sure what else you would get from paying the fee.
Don't miss !. This under water zoo is beautiful full of all kind fish and marine life.We can see sharks beside tuna fish and small fish.Also rare fish with a long panoramic view ( 30 m width)

what you see for free is better than what you pay for. Although it's quite impressive to find an aquarium in a mall, the aquarium itself it not that interesting.There is one huge fish tank and you see it from a side, from below and from above, but it's always the same tank.There is also a small exhibition of reptiles.Save the ticket money, the lateral view for free is the best.

Not worth the money!. The place was amazing, because of the size and being inside a mall, but other than, 80 DHS for a 10 meter tunnel?! I've seen better in thailand and malaysia! The zoo has only routine and avarage creatures, no surprise! Not much animal lives in desert!
Avoidable. Nothing much to see. Just an underwater tunnel, too short.A few fishes here and there, and they get your picture taken over a green background.

Good Education For the Kids. Took the full package that included the glass bottom boat tour. My kids loved it and totally lit up and seeing "Nemo" as the younger one screamed at seeing the colourful array of fishes in the aquarium. The penguins were also a delight. Overall it was worth every penny spent and I would probably do it agin

Informative and interesting marine exhibits. For me, the highlight of the Aquarium is gazing at the enormous tank in the mall (which you can see without purchasing a ticket). As a visual spectacle it's breathtaking. However, during my last visit to Dubai I bought a ticket to visit the Aquarium and was happily surprised by the quality and quantity of marine exhibits at the Aquarium. Informative and interesting. Kids will love this!

Enjoyable, even for adults. After stumbling upon the auarium and zoo while visiting the Dubai Mall I figured why not check it out. You really get some great pictures while in the aquarium tunnel. I enjoyed the visit.

Wet but not so wild - at least it did not involve shopping.. The aquarium and underwater zoo boasts being the largest elevated aquarium in the world - no doubt. The logistics are impressive given the location. However, if you have visited some of the other big aquariums (San Diego, Gold Coast, Vancouver) this will seem limited. The underwter zoo needs some work with labelling of the exhibits and the creepy crawlies were very tame.Gentou penguins seemed under stress and losing feathers.At USD20+ for the base package it is not a deal.

Not too bad. Aquariums aren't really my thing, as animals aren't really either, but my friends were quite keen on going to the aquarium while we were in the Dubai Mall (I would have rather spent the time shopping or having lunch), and I personally wasn't incredibly impressed, but I wasn't too discouraged, either. The aquarium part of the attraction on the mall's ground floor, next to the Rainforest Cafe, should take about a maximum of five minutes to get through; it's just a huge, four-sided tank containing an abundance of sharks, fish, seaweed, coral, and sting rays, with a tunnel through the middle of it, offering a more intimate view of the different sea creatures, which was quite nice. The aquarium staff take a picture of you at one stage, in front of a green screen, which you can purchase in leather binding for a ridiculous AED 200! We would have bought our picture, as it had come out quite favourably, but at that price we could have rather purchased dresses for the five of us instead! Afterwards, an inconvenient two levels up, you can go to the 'underwater zoo' portion of the attraction, which was a bit disappointing. It consists of hundreds of small tanks with different fish species, cooped up in the small, kitsch tanks, as well as an upstairs 'creepy crawlies' part, which was basically a bunch of snakes and spiders in tiny glass cages. At the end of the underwater zoo, there is a gift shop that leads out into the mall's food court, in which you can't really buy anything for less than AED 50. So, in other words, all of the merchandise was incredibly overpriced. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone without kids, as the children may still find some fun in spending an hour at most here.*By the way, there are three initial entrance packages for the Aquarium and Underwater Zoo that you can choose from. The first package, at a cost of AED 80 per person, offers nothing more than admission into both attractions. The second package, for AED 90 each, offers both admission to both the attractions, as well as the ability to feed some of the aquarium's fish at certain times every day.The third and final package, at a whopping AED 120 per person, offers only admission to both attraction, and a boat ride amid the fish and the opportunity to stand on top of some of the fish's suspended tanks.

Good experience !. The aquarium is situated in the Dubai mall and yet it is quite huge! It has a variety of marine life including sharks & sting ray! The glass tunnel is lovely and one is amazed to see the underwater world. Must do experience...

Go in the morning. See the Zoo. Avoid the crowds and go before lunch. Don't just look at the huge tank with its 3 foot thick glass walls. Take the time to go through the tunnel and then visit the displays of aquatic creatures in the "underwater zoo". Kids will love it. Take your time in the tunnel.
Enormous. This is a great aquarium and again the underwater zoo had many many aquariums which all provide a great opportunity to see many fish species.

Enjoyable experience. We went to the Dubai Aquarium with my 3 children. The glass tunnel is lovely to walk through and there is a good variety of sea life to look at. The glass bottom boat is great and gives a unique perspective of the fish the only downside is it doesnt last very long.
Nice. This is a major attraction within the Dubai mall and worth seeing. The aquarium does have a wide range of marine species including sharks and sting rays.Not as big as SeaWorld Orlando but nice!
Stopover attractions. Absoluetly amazing with huge variety of creatures. Great to watch divers feeding fish. Rain forest very realistic

Nice experience. I was not initially keen about doing the Aquarium, because we have seen many aquaria in different parts of the world, but for our kids. Once we started we enjoyed it. They part that is most impressive is the underwater zoo, I have never had the experience, it was fun to sit on top of the aquarium water and have a different view. The photographers do excellent job but also charge too high. Getting your camera along with you and take nice pictures will save you some money.

Didnt meet expectations. I dont think the Underwater Zoo and tunnel experience is worth 55 AED. Its great for very young kids but again the kid is charged at same cost. I have seen more worthful aquarium visits in other countries at same or lesser cost.Actually the Tank is covered over 3 floors and is visible to the outsiders as much as the insiders so you can have a great view even without the ticket ; it might sound cheap but i just felt it wasnt worth the money spent.

Worth a look. If you’re never returning to Dubai, and you’re in the Dubai Mall anyway, then I suppose @ AED150 it’s worth a visit to the underwater zoo. About 1 hour should be plenty, depending on the number of other visitors, to see the many animal & sea creatures – much more than I expected. I though the attraction well laid out – I’ve never seen jelly fish that close up. The glass floor over the enormous aquarium was novel, & the tunnel from which you can the large sharks et al great for the kids.

A bit fishy. We visited this whilst in the Mall, it wasn't a very long attraction with regards to time spent, but its very unique and I got some fabulous pictures of some very beautiful species. Its worth a look and I doubt you'll ever find another shopping mall with sharks in it....

Great for kids!. The Dubai Aquarium is located in the Dubai Mall. Visit early to avoid the crowds. The fish feeding experience not really worth the money but our two year old enjoyed throwing the food in. A good way to spend a couple of hours with children.

a must see. I live in the UAE and my son loves his place. It gets ridiculously crowded on Thursday evenings and Fridays, so best time to go is during the day and preferable during the week. We come here 2-3 times a year and I'm still not bored of it. It's great. Do the glass bottom boat if you have kids.

Worlds largest aquarium. It is inside the dubai mall ....tickets are very expensive..but you can watch the aquarium from the mall itself its onlu if you want to go to the 20 m underwater zoo which is worthless spend 150 AED or if you want to take A FOOLISH GLASS BOTTOM BOAT SPEND 200 AED

The tunnel!. The aquarium itself is not outstanding, but the tunnel through the aquarium is amazing!!! Don't be intimidated by the long line, it doesn't take long - and you get to see the tank on your way to the entrance.
-:) -:) -:). It was good fun for me and my 2year old. Seeing sharks and thousands of other water species paid the price :)Not to be missed at all....

Snorkelling in the shark tank at the Dubai aquarium. For 290 aed,(approx USD77) we donned a wetsuit, put on our goggles after a briefing session, and then descended into the shark tank to snorkel. Your movement is obviously limited to the shark cage, but it was great fun, and quite a few fish entered the cage, including barramundi and an eel, and one particular shark tried to get in three times, very exciting! We were in for about half an hour. So no danger, and quite a simple thing to do, but we thoroughly enjoyed it, and a great experience if you can't scuba dive in the aquarium at large.

Great for kids and something 'different' in a mall.
