Maybe I expected bigger (which is not always better), but it is one huge water tanks with lots of sharks and rays ... first you pass outside (you can actually pass the outside for free, but probably 5 meters away from the glass), then you walk through a glass tunnel under the fish, and if that was not enough, with the 'ultimate' package, you get a short glass bottom boat ride on the top. Somehow the 'behind the scenes' tour was not offered when we were there. The underwater zoo was also very interesting and informative. In other aquariums that is just 'part' of it, here it has it's own label and you feel like 'I got 2 attractions in one' ... There are plenty of options to spend extra money, shop corners, photographers with green-screens and terrible photoshopping skills ... the ultimate package comes with a 20Dhs voucher for the shops .. and there are actually items for 20Dhs (very small plush fish) and for 15Dhs you can get a lapel pin :)

Very enjoyable, yet small. I went here at the last minute and found it to be quite fun even though it is really not that large. There were lots of different species and the zoo was cool too. If you have a hour or so to spare, take a trip here and enjoy.

Wonderful. There is a very big window from which you get a very beautiful view of aquarium.Tickets are at moderate price.For first time experience, go for aquarium tunnel and underwater zoo.I missed underwater zoo, however nice experience of tunnel.You see beautiful aquatic animals and deadly tiger shark very very close to you.You can even count their teeths (lols)Little disappointment is that tunnel is very short.
Awesome.... nice aquarium and nice place to take children but since the aquarium is not the biggest in the world, Dubai aquarium was awesome and your not wasting your money to but your ticket.

Not as big as you think but very impressive. A visit to the Dubai Mall is a must and you get to see the massive viewing window without paying for the aquarium. The ticket is in two parts, first the underwater tunnel and then upstairs the underwater zoo, both are really good and not too expensive with young children going free. Young kids can't go in the glass bottom boat and I wouldn't bother paying for the fish feeding but do the basics and you will not be disappointed.
Nice but a bit poor. Nice aquarium in an unusual setting but not as big as expected nor as rich in terms of species and views.

Nice but not so big as I imagined. It is a nice aquarium and nice place to take children but since the aquarium in Osaka is one of the biggest in the world, Dubai aquarium was not so exciting for me. But if you haven't visited the biggest aquariums in the world then it is a must to see in Dubai.
Worth it!. My husband & I had BOGO coupon so we visited! It was nice, relaxing, interesting to visit simply because it was inside of a mall!!

Relatively small aquarium, decent zoo. The aquarium looks big from outside but there is nothing much extra inside. It's still worth a visit but I wouldn't consider it extraordinary. I was more impressed with the underwater zoo. Kids would enjoy the aquarium in general

Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo in Dubai Mall. Very nice place to visit, especially, if you are with kids. It is located inside the Dubai Mall and need around 2.5 hours to see it fully. There are different ticket packages available. There are many many species of colourful fish and also various other sea animals to see and it's simply amazing. It can be combined with Burj Khalifa - At the top view, as they are all located in the same place. After you are through with the aquarium and the underwater zoo, you can enjoy the musical fountain of 5 mins duration in the evening, starting from 6pm, every half-an hour.

Okay but not great. Big aquarium but not a lot of fish to see or maybe it is because the tank is so dark. On the smaller tanks it was okay but when I mean smaller I mean really small!!! Some are even home aquarium size. If you at the mall and looking for something to do its okay but I would not make a special trip to see it.

Water water everywhere! With lots of fish!. Dubai Mall is huge.. And as you near the aquarium you realise its even bigger! We just took tickets for the tunnel and the underwater zoo upstairs (55 AED). Both are amazing and should not be missed if you have time.
Wow. We only saw it from the outside, at the mall, we did not had the time to visit the tunnel ( 50 AED ) but what we saw whas very impressive.

Worth a visit!. It's nice, well set up and fun for a few hours. Worth a visit for sure! They offer several tickets packages. The simplest (and cheapest) pass costs around $20 and will give you a voucher for the gift shop which was quite nice. Most other packages also come with the voucher and offer some sort of backstage experience, or you can choose from a dive package, a glass boat ride and other combos.

A wonderful experience. The enormity of the glass wall is on view from the Dubai mall shopping walk way so if you are short of money just go and stand a few feet from it. It is worth the cost of going thru though and the tunnel is a wonderful experience - seeing sharks, rays and eels swimming over head. The staff were cleaning the areas with diving suits on and our 3 year old was fascinated watching them. It's her second visit with Mrs D so we opted to feed the fish as well this time and went on the behind the scenes tour of the sick animal area etc. Upstairs in the underwater zoo the jungle walk ways were great fun and of course the penguins and giant crabs were firm favourites.

WOW !. Title says it all, WOW, what a place.We spent an entire afternoon at the Aquarium, so much to see and do and very helpful and knowledgable guides, nothing was too much trouble for them.An absolute must if you visit Dubal Mall, yea thats the hard part to understand, this is inside a shopping mall!

Just an Average Place. If you are first timer and have never seen an aquarium than you can go and spend some money, otherwise there are many other great attractions in Dubai which you can enjoy. Thats my view only

Impressive!. It's enormous - it sits in the dubai mall and without even going inside you can have a great browse at the aquarium. The price of the ticket includes a few goodies on the way out as well as ride on the boat which floats on top of the aquarium - that's how big it is! It may not contain the largest variety of fish that a discerning aquarium fan may require but you have the staples of a good aquarium here, including sharks. It's easy to find as it's the centrepiece of the dubai mall - itself easy to find as it's the biggest mall in the world and takes up a lot of downtown dubai.
Good. Not the best aquarium I saw but still worth the visit. The number and variety of fishes is impressive so is the tunnel where you will see sharks.

TUNNEL WALK. This is something like Ushaka Marine world in Durban SA or The Two Oceans Aquarium in Cape Town SA. A different experience as this is located in the Dubai Mall. Did not think much of the zoo but good species of fishes. Excellent like you in a real forest.

had fun...but $$$$$. had fun...but $$$$$...yeah , its over priced but its kinda okay for one time visitors , Go for the transparent boat ride if possible... at the end they give you moments. Its a one time do thing... Have fun.

Just take pics from outside!!!. Don't waste your time. I wasn't really impressed with the aquarium or underwater zoo, its over hyped. It was really small. I think I wasted my money, its best to just take pictures from outside like the locals.

Dubai Aquarium. You may visit this during your visit to Burj Dubai, Dubai Fountains and the Dubai Mall. But you need to keep about one and a half hours to see this specataculat collection of underwater life. When you walk through the glass caves, you can see the large fish swimming over you. Occasionally you can see scuba divers inside the glass cases alongside the fish. An enjoyable site for adults and children

biggest but its too much. placing a biggest aquarium inside a mall? sounds like great idea. but it missed the basic things of it, water. everyone just can wacth it and it's amazing but no one can be wet. hahahaha.... just good for a show.

A Sight In The Mall You Wouldn't Miss. The huge aquarium definitely caught my attention as my family and I walked through it to go upstairs to see the wildlife. I find it confusing that they're not internally connected and we have to use the mall's escalator to go up to the zoo and then used the same escalator to come down to the aquarium again. You definitely should walk through the aquarium's tunnel. It gave me a feeling like diving into the sea and able to see fishes all over without carrying the tank and breathing through tubes. If this is your first time visiting a huge aquarium, I think it's definitely interesting to see many fish species and amazing to see huge stingray and sharks. Although, I've been to a huge aquarium in Lisbon, Portugal already and I find this Underwater Zoo small.

Aquarium inside the large shopping mall.... It was fun going to this place my 3 year old son appreciated it specially the dolphins and the hanging bridge at the second floor and the underwater zoo.We spent almost an hour and when we finish the whole place we ate at this area nearbyi think its chillis and continue shopping inside the mall later on.

Nice to find this in shopping mall. Very nice tunnel with all species of fish, including big sharks and stingrays ( paid part) and also the 1st floor cosy aquariums (paid part),especially for those seing something similar for the first time. They take picture of you and the family at the entrance. I have decided not to buy it later, but changed very quickly my decision,when they showed me the picture.Everybody looked somehow nicer on the picture, so I had to buy it anyway. I only took the picture in a paper cover, without expensive frame, so it was almost half price finally. Definitely recommended for young children to take them inside.
Fishy hour. Great tunnel with sharks and other fish. Not as much inside as we thought -didn't take long to get around. Reasonable price and good place to visit for an hour or two.

Didnt go inside, great to see from the outside though since it is inside the mall!. Purely wanted to see it as its a giant aquarium inside the mall, and that is not something you see everydayWe didn't go inside as to us an aquarium is an aquarium, and it is great to see it like a giant fish tank inside the shopping centre

Wonderful experience for the kids. The aquarium and zoo in Dubai mall is a wonderful experience for the kids as well as adults. Take the Dhr 110 package to get a chance to see behind the scene and boat ride along with viewing the zoo and the tunnel. Worth the money spent.

Great experience. Very huge aquarium inside Dubai Mall. Lots of variety of fishes. I did the scuba diving inside and what a great experience it was! Amazing sensation and highly recommended for scuba divers or new beginner that just wants to try. Do your booking and check the rates (different between certified and non certified divers) in advance with Al Boom diving tour.
great for the Family. What a place, getting to see all the fish, sharks etc etc and all under the one roof, So if your wife wants to shop this is the place to be
dubai aquarium. inside the worlds largest mall very good value for money with a voucher to spend in the gift shop afterwards and the option to dive in the tank and feed fish etc

Not worth the money. Not worth paying a hefty price for going through the tunnel and the boat ride. The people there will do their best to force an upsell on you and the photograph package is a highway robbery. For a one-time visit this is an ok place

Very nice!. i was very impressed. The aquarium is very big from outside, but the tunnel under it is not so long... Underwater zoo is very multifarious. I think, if you visit Dubai, you have to see Dubai mall aquarium too.

Very nice display and Caring staff. Great display, the venue is clearly well maintained and worth a visit. Staff extremely helpful and eager to share their passion about their work and provide explanations about the many species on display... All together, a very nice experience!

Okay for a onetime visit. We took the platinum package which included glass bottom boat ride, which turned out to be a damp squib, they just move the boat at the top of the aquarium and explain some mechanics involved in maintaining the aquarium, while you see fishes swimming below your feet in a semi transparent bottom of the boat. I would strongly suggest that you can just buy the basic package. One thing i noticed, that the glass walls act as a magnifier, so you see this massive fish, but actually it isnt that massive...it s the glass that magnifies the fish...i dont know if thats intentional or the fibre glass has a magnifying property. The sheer audacity to think of housing an aquarium of this scale needs to be lauded. The variety of fishes is good. The zoo part is just about ok. Now, they catch you at different points, take a snap and then pounce on you later with your printed photo in a frame, at a different spot and ask ridiculously high price for it...they have a class act in the aquarium, they should keep the standards in every aspect of the experience.

I'm not quite sure.... I had high expectations, and they almost got through, but not... It is not as big as I thought, and the tunnel is not so long. But standing nose to nose with a shark is always a thrill!!! We bought tickets for the tunnel and the underwater zoo, and paid 80 Dhs. Check prices on the internet, as all prices/types of tickets are not visualized at the counter. If you want to see without ticket, go to the second floor for the best views.
A complete rip off. I envy the people who just clicked the pics from outside without paying for the ticket. Nothing new really. A complete rip off.
family outing. fishes wwerre at easy, the ambience of underwater was good, it very accessioble from all the place, metro is connected to it, teh service at the aquarium was good

dissappointing. took our 14month old daughter. expected more than just a straight 10m tunnel through the large fish tank (which you can see more of from the Mall for FREE) underwater zoo was interesting but not worth the money. We should've just viewed the fish from the mall floor like most other passer bys.

unbeleivable place. excellent experiance it is like doing snorkilling but without getting wet.it is great momoents when you see that smile on your sons face when they touch these amazing big see creatures.
Visual Treat. The Aquarium is quite the sight to behold. You can easily see the tank from the Mall without paying the admission fee if you want to be frugal. Great for taking a break from shopping.

Ok, but nothing special really. 1st - you don't really have to pay to see everything there is to see, just standing a few meters away.. 2nd - just a few tanks, impressive for a mall, but not impressive if you compare it with a proper aquarium (incomparable to aquariums in Japan, Genova, Monterrey, Monaco and many others in my view).. Tanks are rather poorly decorated - lacks vegetation and colours, makes you feel sorry for the fish to be stuffed in this uncozy space.. Do see it if you're passing by, but don't go specially to see it..

Not bad, but nothing to write home about.. I could unfortunately not give this aquarium a fantastic review, as I feel I have been to better aquariums for the same price.The best thing about it is the location, in the Dubai mall, it's rather convenient for attracting tourists.It's not bad neither fantastic, if you've been to aquariums before there isn't anything new or better to see here, I 'm afraid I won't be visiting it again.

Top tips for visiting Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Tip 1: The entrance fee cost about 80 dirhams (roughly 14-15 british pound). The ticket comes with a 10% discount to spend in the gift shop.Tip 2: Since you are paying so much to get into the aquarium, i would suggest you to take as many photos as possible with stingray. There is one thing that you can do in the underwater aqarium is to be upclose and personal with the stingrays and sharks. They are not that visible when you view the tank from outside.Tip 3: You ticket also allow you to go into the creepy crawley sections where you can see crocodile, aligator, lizards, beetles and etc. I didn't find them amusing but if you are travelling with your family, it is worth bringing your kids there. Definitely very educational!Tip 4: Yes, camera are allowed in this premise.Tip 5: I personally will not visit here again because once is mroe than enough to see everything. If you think my reviews have been helpful to you, please click 'Yes' for 'Was this review helpful?'

Wow--an aquarium in a mall!. It was interesting to visit this aquarium in the mall. I got the full package for around 110 AED which included the zoo and the glass bottomed boat ride, as well as a 20 AED credit at the gift shop. The aquarium was nice--it's a tunnel that you walk through. I wish the tunnel had been longer--it seemed that I had walked through it in no time. There are HUGE rays and about 70 sharks. The aquarium boats the record for the world's largest single pane of acrylic glass. To ride the glass bottomed boat, you need to go up to the next level, and then to the next level again for the underwater zoo. The animals there are not ultra-exotic, but then again, we have pet tarantulas, snakes and lizards at our house, so I'm not awed by seeing more of them--they are common place for me/my family. Still, though, it's a great opportunity for people to see all sorts of animals, mainly aquatic, and it's a great activity for kids.

Good facility. Great facility in the middle of the desert. However if you have seen similar aquariums in hong kong or Singapore this might be a bit of a let down. However it is certainly worth visiting.

All splash and nothing else.. The underwater tunnel is impressive with views of sharks and sting rays swimming right above you. But the rest of the aquarium is a terrible disappointment. I think this is one of the most uninformed aquariums I have ever visited. The few information signage that was there is at knee level, fine for kids who aren't going to read it in any case. And then the fish that are described are often not even in the tanks.We opted for the visit for feeding the fish and a look at behind the scenes. All that was was dropping a few pellets into a large tank, a short explanation of how the sharks are fed and being told how much water the aquarium held. On our own we looked through the window of the lab. Who knows what went on there. The guide had already left.

Good but not great. The best thing about it is that it is located in Dubai Mall in the middle of the desert. If you have extra time in the Dubai mall or with kiddies who are tired of shopping, then I would recommend it.The underwater zoo is cool, nice variety of fish. It's not that large and can be done in about 30-45mins, maybe more for those who want to take a lot of photos. The aquarium is large and impressive but I don't know if it's worth the extra admission to go in. You can still get good photos walking by in the mall. Both the aquarium and underwater zoo were 55AED I believe.

Amazing experience!. It's amazing...in a desert, where water is generally scare, they have managed to make an 'underwater zoo' and even keep exotic animals there. Phew!We were lucky to have got a discount voucher for this place from the fortune pearl hotel we stayed at. When you enter, you first go through a glass enclosure with aquatic animals all around you. Then comes the zoo where there are quite a few arctic creatures and wild flora. there is also a action exclusive for reptiles. And also a restaurant. All around you find Chinese people who first click your photos and then try to get you to buy photo frames with pictures of you in a background of what is found there.We really enjoyed it.

Very Cool!. Beyond that is was not nearly as big as they make it sound this was very cool. You have a lot of options ranging from a quick walk through glass tunnel and the zoo to scuba diving in the tank. Well worth the money and make sure to bring the camera!
Really good attraction with lots to see. Fun and interactive water zoo with creatures I saw for the first time. Nice way to see more than the acquarium and kids would love this.

Over hyped. I still don't know what's so different or great about this place. Even my 7 yr old boy didn't enjoy it and thought there are better ones out there. Underwater zoo was still ok. Probably won't suggest anyone to visit here.

Special place to visit.. If you like fish go there. This aquarium is special because it is in the middle of the Dubai mall. On the ground floor ther eis a big tank with sharks, rays and other bigger fish. On the third floor are more aquariums with different kind of fish nd some other animals like otters and penguins. Don't try to compare this aquarium with others. The location makes it unique and after a day shopping it is nice to visit something else.

A bit overrated. The aquarium is only a few meters long with a huge (world's largest) panel to see the marine animals, however it ends there, pay extra to see more things, the underwater zoo is good but i think the aquarium is overrated.

Enjoy this while the women spend your money..... This exhibit is a great way to spend an hour while your bank account is getting drain. Seriously though the aquarium is really cool. The fish appear healthy. You really can see them up close. Watching the action of the gill slits of the rays while they perched on the glss tube was very interesting.
Good for children. Though bit small in size , good experience of ocean life. Nicely built in the surroundings of Palm Atlantis

Awesome is the word for this place. We experienced this during our visit to Dubai Mall. We wanted to spend some minimum time here and wanted to spend more time for shopping but in the end we spent almost 3 hrs here. To top it , Visa was running a scheme wherein we got 1 free ticket with every ticked purchased but some discounts on the ticket price which was great, possibly due to DSF.The aquarium was fabulous and so was the underwater zoo. The sharks and the sting rays were worth all the money spent. They were great. I had a nice time shooting all photos while passing through the shark tunnel. Avoid purchasing the photos from them as they are a costly affair.

Best View. The best view of the Dubai Aquarium in the Dubai Mall is from the outside where the general get ti see them. The glass of the aquarium is so thick that viewing from within the aquarium or from the top (boat ride) is just waste of time and money. The best view is from the outside..

Awesome and you will like it!. Entering into a magic world and walking under the deep sea - you will be totally surprised and curious being here. It was our day out after marriage it was a perfect day for us. For children or adults - regardless of the age - its a perfect place to enjoy and forget yourselves. You love each and every species there. Starting from the smallest fishes to the giant sharks and wavy eels, sea horse, everything you can enjoy here. Even you wish for underwater diving - here is your chance. You should pay some amount for that. Anyway its gonna be one of the precious moment in your life. You can go through different categories of aqua species and it will dd your knowledge. What I liked the most is the Penguins over there. When I moved around by touching my hands on the glass Penguins started coming in my directions following me. I played with them for sometime and even taken video and kept with me. I feel like very childish and my wife could stop laughing by seeing the child in me. Even the dancing crabs and silent sea horse you will be more curious like a kid. Roam around and enjoy! You will never feel to come back out of it. Its a perfect place to day out! Its located in Dubai Mall and you can spend a full day in the Mall - as there are lot more to enjoy there!

Great value.. Go in the mornings as from 4pm on all shops in Dubai get very busy. The Mall itself is massive. & very easy to get lost, even with a map. The aquarium is located quite near the main enterance. I don't think it's as big as they boast, Brest,France is larger! Experiance is great especially the glass tube. Spend as much time here as possible, it's the best bit of the tour. You thern proceed up 2 floors to continue the tour through smaller aquariums & creapy crawley floor.

Dubai Mall has it ALL!. This mall will blow your mind. Everything imaginable under one roof. You can understand why shopping is such a national past time in the UAE with places like this to shop. There's nothing compares with the magnitude and size of the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo.

USB Rip Off. My parents are visiting us from South Africa. We visited the Dubai Mall Aquarium. We took the photo at entry for a memo for my parents. we were then offered the photo ina frame for 200 UAE Dirhams which I was happy to pay, but was then offered a USB at a further 100 Dirhams. The sales lady informed me it has the memo photo and photos of the fish in the aquarium, which I then boughtI then veiwed the USB at home and to my disgust there were only 45 poor quality photos on the usb and it was the same photo was played 3 times over. My son would have been able to take better photos with his phone cameraI urge visitors not to purchase the usb as a 4GB usb is much cheaperMogamat Stayed January 2013, traveled with family

USB Rip Off. My parents are visiting us from South Africa. We visited the Dubai Mall Aquarium. We took the photo at entry for a memo for my parents. we were then offered the photo ina frame for 200 UAE Dirhams which I was happy to pay, but was then offered a USB at a further 100 Dirhams. The sales lady informed me it has the memo photo and photos of the fish in the aquarium, which I then boughtI then veiwed the USB at home and to my disgust there were only 45 poor quality photos on the usb and it was the same photo was played 3 times over. My son would have been able to take better photos with his phone cameraI urge visitors not to purchase the usb as a 4GB usb is much cheaperMogamat

Please Don't Buy tickets Rather see it from outside.. The aquarium can be completely seen by outside and you dont have anything else inside.Also need not to waste money in Boat Ride(Complete waste of money)Rather go for Zoo !!(Value for money)

Excellent place to be.. a different experience. The underwater zoo is wonderful expericnce to see wild life below water in their sort of natural habitat.The sharks spicies, angel and gold fishes, also different kinds of snakes and pythons are worth seeing.The best part is shark feeding where they put you in cage and take you down in water to feed sharks, this was experiece of life time :)Also, not to miss the Penguins are too cute to play with All in All, a place to go to enjoy the water animals

Zoo. We took a tour with fish feeding and i recommend taking someting else.Fish in big tank are beautiful so is the walking through the tunnel, however, 2nd floor with zoo is nothing special. Almost all best things can be seen from outside. Actually, i was amazed with shark fetus on 2nd floor.

Shark Diving Experience. Al Boom Diving run a diving experience in the Dubai Mall Aquarium which is a great experience at around 650AED pp. The dive last about 35mins and the entire experience lasts about 1hr 30mins which enables you to learn about sharks and more importantly dive with the sharks which swim all round you without being a threat.If you are into diving I would recommend during your visit to Dubai to dive the Mall Aquarium.We shopped then dived the aquarium and went back to shopping and tea straight after. There is a changing facility at the aquarium with hot showers and towels provided.
Impressive. Quite impressive, but the underwater zoo was quite limited and kind of anti-climatic. The penguins were the main event at the zoo and it was fun watching them being fed

Very Cool!!. Went to Dubai for the first time and saw the Dubai Aquarium. The price was right... but I found the tunnel was overcrowded... The photograph that they take of you and turn it into a key chain, magnet, etc is a great keepsake and I bought a couple. This was the best picture that I had of this experience as it was very hard to take pictures or sit back and enjoy the fish and sharks swimming by as there were too many people. Otherwise it was a great experience and I enjoyed being close up to the sharks in a mall :)

Day trip. The Dubai aquarium is massive and worth a visit. If you're brave you can dive with the fish. Only negative is that we could not find any descriptions on the tanks as to what fish you are watching.
Nice place.. but nothing different to see as an aquarium. You can see the main tank from the outside. You do not will get to much more buying the ticket. The water tune is nice.
Something different i guess. This place is located in the middle of Dubai mall and some of it can be seen without paying so beware.ideal if you have kids in tow i guess.
Lost Chambers. Amazing experience...never before seen underworld aquatic life like this....a lifetime experience to see almost all under sea life under one roof...

Great environment for the animals. There is a really interesting variety of different species at Dubai Aquarium, all of which have lovely spacious environments in which to live.The lighting was good and there was plenty of space for all visitors to look and enjoy the different creatures.My particular favourite were the very playful penguins. Entry is good value and includes a money-off voucher from the aquarium shop. Well worth a visit.
Nice Aquarium. Nice aquarium for dubai people... Nice fishes.. and especially the giant spider crabs and the snow penguins.... Amazing are they...

Educational but not quite what I expected. It has its own wonderful variety I agree, it has the amazing sharks go over your head that will excite you but then thats all there is to it. I think its a great places for kids since its so wonderful and educational, but the underwater zoo is a bit over rated I think
fish and creep. good place for kids! But unfortunately there was no pool or place where kids can interact with zoo or dip their hand in water.
Ok but..... Would be less than expectation if you expect something world class here in dubai. For folks who have seen it in Singapore, this is so so...

Very good value. If you go to the mall, check it out.. The view from outside does not dothe aquarium justice, once you get closer you notice a lot of beautiful fish you would not have seen otherwise. I was sceptical about going in, but it was well worth it. I wouldn't go to the mall solely for checking this out, but the mall itself is exellent, and I would highly recommend going to the aquarium and zoo if you are there. Costs a little less than 14 dollars for the basic tour.

Fantastic for adults & kids!. Let the shoppers loose in the Dubai Mall and take the time to visit this with the kids for a couple of hours. By the way definitely take the time to go upstairs to the Underwater zoo after you have seen the Aquarium which is just fantastic. By the way a delegation from the aquarium at Brighton should pay a visit here and then look at what they have to offer and I think they will see where they can improve etc (especially the pricing comparison)

Much better than I expected!. We paid 55AED each (£8) so was expecting something quite basic. The aquarium was exactly this although walking through the shark tunnel was pretty spectacular!But the real treat was the 'underwater zoo', which is strangely a few floors up! Full of animals of all kind, from insects to crocodiles to penguins! It's brilliant for kids and quite fun for the adults, too, as long as you're wearing comfortable walking shoes :)
Something a little different in a mall. It is definitely worth a visit but I recommend just buying the combo ticket, we had paid for me but having looked around did not feel it was worth it.
amazing. The Aquarium and underwater zoo is inside the Dubai Mall.They have a good collection of Marine life including Sharks also
Great views of Sharks etc. Wae all loved the fact that you could see all the sharks, manta rays were within virtual touching distance - the underground zoo was the best bit about!!

A wonder to behold. With over 300 species of aquatic animals beautifully contained and maintained in the world's biggest aquarium, be sure to be fascinated to the core. It's so magnificent and thrilling to see the penguins in there. Indeed money well spent.
Fish and more fish. Totally blown away with this attraction, especially great for children to get up close with our under water breathing species with a few otters, beavers and penguins etc added in!

Aquatic Wonder. A memorable aquarium experience. Be sure to walk through the tunnel when the sharks are being hand fed. Meticulously planned & displayed. Excellent array of sea life, aquatic animals, reptiles & bugs. The information screens could be more comprehensive.

Filler.. This is here as a filler only, its far from the main event. If you're in a mall to look around and soak up the shopping vibe then you're in the right spot. The view of the aquarium from the mall itself (head for Candylicious) is amazing and far more jaw-dropping than this attraction.

Hit and Miss at the Dubai Aquarium. My family spent two semi-enjoyable hours at the Dubai Aquarium and had a mixed time. The Underwater Tunnel is not that impressive considering you can practically see the same thing for free by standing at the huge aquarium wall in the mall. The best part of the experience was the ''zoo'' part on Level 2, as there were tons of interesting tanks and exhibits with a wide variety of land and sea creatures. The worst part is we paid extra money for the glass bottom boat ride. This was a total disaster. Five minutes - that's right - five minutes in a small glass bottom boat seeing the same thing you could see in any if the tanks. What a waste of money!Overall, if you have two hours to kill and are with young children, the Dubai Aquarium might be somewhat enjoyable. Just don't get the expensive packages. They are a waste of money. Get the cheapest one and hope your little ones enjoy the experience.

Loved it !!!!. One of the best places to learn and see about the underwater world. The huge fish tank facade in the middle of dubai mall is very attractive to all viewers, and I decided to take my 3 year old inside the tunnel to show her the different marine life.Took two combo tickets for the aquarium and the underwater zoo for 55 dirhams / per person. Was surprised to get one ticket free as a special promotion for visa platinum card holders. So ended up paying (55 AED) for 1 ticket only.The tunnel left us in awe as we felt as if we were inside the water and surrounded by sharks, eels and mantas. My daughter did not feel like leaving the tunnel !She learnt a lot about different species and types of underwater world/animals in the underwater zoo section and also in the creepy-crawlies section.Another highlight was the penguin shelters which were amazing for the kids. It took us about 2 hours to complete the tour and we had a very satisfactory experience.This attraction is much better and has more variety than the lost world aquarium at atlantis palm. Not to mention 50% cheaper also...I will surely go for the dive package next time and use my padi certification.

Quite nice for an hour or two. I've been eyeing tripadvisor before me + hubby decided to buy the cheapest ticket (AED 80) to get in. After walking 10 minutes through the tunnel, my hubby was disappointed because the tank's length was the same as you can see outside (without paying). Well, at least, inside the tunnel you can see the fish swimming above you & closer to you, while outside you have to be some metres away from the tank. Luckily the ticket was bundled with Underwater Zoo (two levels up), and it was a nice experience. We had fun for an hour at the zoo.

sharks, sharks and more sharks. Dubai aquarium has an amazing plethora of marinelife swimming in its huge tank, known to be one of the largest in the wrld and has allot of raggy-tooth sharks. Its a great place to go scuba diving for a reasonable price. Dare to dream and sive or snorkel inside a shark aquarium. A must see if you are a sea and fish lover.

A good way to appreciate underwater world. All those who walk through the glass tunnel are in awe of the sharks, sting rays, eels and all sorts of fish. Then we checked out the zoo located at the second level. While it may be true that this attraction is over-hyped, it does give kids (and the kids in all of us) a glimpse of life under water. Our group immensely enjoyed the experience.

Don't have to pay to enjoy this.. You can see the aquarium for free from the outside.The size of it is amazing.If you pay you get to walk through the tunnel then outside ( non payers are about 2 metres away behind a rope) then through the zoo area. The glass bottom boat ride is quick ( and really you have seen it all just from a different angel. The scuba diving is pretty much down have a look and back up. Save your money and watch it all for free.

Better than I had expected. I actually enjoyed the aquarium much more than I thought I would. We paid the admission to walk through the tunnel and go to the underwater zoo (also a lot of fun), and I think that it was worthwhile. There was just something amazing about walking through that tunnel and having these massive sharks and sting rays swimming right above your head. Definitely an experience I've never had before, my husband and I had a great time.

Superb. Last time I visited the Aquarium in the Dubai Mall, I hadn't realised there was an underwater zoo. It was amazing with fish, crocs, penguins and so much more. Ideal for children and they also offer a glass bottom boat, snorkelling, etc. the Aquarium is full of sharks and stingray and well worth a visit.

Overpriced extras but the free view worth all those money. Doesn't worth paying all these extra money to go inside, feed, dive, zoo, photo, etc.Spend this time in front of the Guinness-record plexiglass screen and you will not miss a thing.
Spectacular. It’s a mind blowing place. You would like to spend more time there. It’s a charismatic place. Kids love it. They have variety of marine culture.

Very informative. Amazing place with lots of aquatic animals. The walk through the tunnel gives you an experience of getting close to the sharks. There is a ide variety of sea animals. We took the behind the scene tours and it was very informative. We wanted to do the scuba diving and feeding the sharks, but the slot was full. May be next time.
Somehow over rated. The aquarium and the underwater zoo are interesting, but not quite matching my expectations. It surely can be much bigger and more interesting to match the level of Dubai

Dubai aquarium. The amazing views of underwater life living harmoniously together. The blue of the water, it was strange standing underneath looking up as the sharks swam above our heads. it was an interesting experience for the kids

Fantastic = Unbelievable. It is part of Dubai Mall and can be reached after entering first in the Mall main building . Amazing / Fantastic /Unbelievable !! Well I am short of words to describe the experience . The owner claims and I quote “The Dubai Aquarium is home to more than 33,000 living animals, including 400 sharks and rays and a close encounter via its acrylic walk through tunnel. The Underwater Zoo brings you face-to-face with piranha, giant catfish, otters and a penguin colony while walking through the Rainforest, Rocky Shore and Living environments” The claim seems to be justified .The collection ,display and keeping different types of fishes and other animals in a huge –huge aquarium which live in water are so large in “number” and “type of species” that visitor feel lost and only keep on staring with admiration . It is housed in three storied lay out with other attractions .Some of fishes with living man sitting amongst these big big fishes etc are visible even without going inside .Some feel it is better to see it from out side but I feel one should visit inside to feel the real environment .It is in side the tunnel experience brings you “face-to-face with piranha, giant catfish, otters and a penguin colony while walking through the Rainforest, Rocky Shore and Living environments from all side” .In side the tunnels it appears that you are in the deep sea surrounded by these water animals which are attacking you from all side. Penguin is added attraction Only when one visit it one can believe that such a collection exists . In Dubai this should be first attraction to be visited

Not worth it. Find yourself in Dubai Mall then go to level 1, ignore huge queues for aquarium and go left and you'll see the best view of the aquarium for free. This is the worst aquarium I've been in.

Over rated and over priced!. Visited with family on 25 Dec.The aquarium is located in three levels. 1st level - is massive fish tank, which is best viewed from out-side it self, though it has a short tunnel for closer look. It has sharks and other big fish. Options for scuba diving with sharks and glass-bottom boat ride is available in this tank. 2nd level- has smaller aquariums with variety of marine life, otters, crocodiles etc. One must not miss the feeding of Penguins. Check the feeding time displayed at the entrance or on the web-site. The show is of 30 min, free, its very amusing and interesting to see how penguins follow the gestures of their handler in queuing up for fish feed. My two children were delighted with show.3rd Level has insects, spiders, chameleons etc. With a small rope way bridge midst a small man-made artificial tropical foliage.The whole place does not have either travelators, escalators or any other resting place inside. Especially so, as its located in Dubai Mall, its a tiring experience as we had visited this place soon after visiting Burj Khalifa. Some chairs inside the aquarium would have been great.

Better to view free of charge from outside. The acquarium is one of the main attractions in Dubai Mall. This 2-storeyed acquarium is at the centre of Dubai mall and you cannot miss it. Kids will enjoy the place a lot because of the attractive ambience and different animals.But "Dont judge a book by its cover" is the best way to describe this attraction. The acquarium view is better from outside than inside.If you have been to the underwater world in Sentosa Island, Singapore, then please skip this attraction, its not worth the money. If you have time and money to waste, please visit it.

Fish but no chips. The Dubai Aquarium is one of the world's largest aquariums.It is very impressive with lots of large fish inside. The sharks are huge and swim just a few feet away from you. The tunnel is impressive if rather short. This is another string to the bow of Dubai Mall.If you like your fish in a tank then this is the place to go. It is like a bigger version of a fish tank that you get in a Chinese Restaurant.

a happy one hour tour. Dubai aquarium is just treat to your eyes. Situated in the Dubai mall it has a gial aquarium and exhibition of various creepy insects, fishes and other water being. Over all a fantastic time to spent between these water animals. A must visit. specially for children.

Very Nice but needs some improvements.... The place is spotted inside the Dubai Mall. Actually is a very nice and interesting place. We dont know if it is the bigger of the world or the city but still is something special and that you must not lost it.The cost is normal and the attractions has lots of things to observe, fishes, shaks, eel, penguins, serpents and snakes and also a jungle style zoo.The bad things was that the outside walls of the aquarium that can be photographed by anyone and is the first thing that you see whn you are entering are fascing some shops of Dubai full of lights that mirroring on the aquarium...so all your photos are ruined by this...They must do something about this.Also the zoo apart from being so nice it must be more well observed by making it more attractive and placing more species in better places.We would recommend this to anyone. It is something special and different.

Giant aquarium with a small walkthrough. Its really a giant aquarium.the aquarium is visible without entry tickets, but if you are willing to spend the minimum 55 AED, you can go through a small tunnel inside the aquarium and there is also a small water creatures zoo including penguins in a controlled environment.

Fish and more fish. This is great for families. If you have kids then take them there as they will love it especially as there is feeding times. The divers go into the huge tanks and you can watch sharks and other exotic fish being fed. Also great if you want to go and shop and eat afterwards. If your clostrophobic then forget it. Its lovely and cool to go there especially when it gets really hot out side

Very well done, a hidden gem. Took my teenage sons and they never lost interest. That alone says a lot! The animals are well kept and the staff appear attentive to their needs. Staff at the aquarium could use some upskilling on directing patrons where to go and what is next, they were very lax. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this attraction to families and zoologically inclined visitors.

Fun :). I thoroughly enjoyed walking through the Aquarium. Especially being able to see all of the different fish swimming around you. It is mesmorising! You can see the Aquarium from outside but I would recommend paying to walk through. The zoo upstairs is arranged well. There are not many animals but there were just enough! My favourite were the penguins! I enjoyed the walkway through the pretend jungle on the shaky bridge! The nemo tank was pretty cool. I would definately recommend to families as the children we saw whilst there seemed to love it!

Nice experience. At first I was skeptic about this visit but once I saw I knew it would a nice experience.First of all you must note that the fish, most of them can be seen from the outside and you do not have to buy a ticket. However if you decide to do, like us, you get to to explore two levels the top level has some nice animals, like penguins, water snakes, etc.The lower level you get to pass through the tank where sharks, octoups and others swim right next to you.

fishtank. Wow! this is an impressive fish tank with a lot of different kind of fish. You can buy a ticket and walk through a tunnel or dive among the fish, but watching it from the outside is already very nice to do.
Great acquarium but expensive. You really enjoy the scenes but the tickets are expensive for what you get as extras. Children below ten should get free entries

Unusual experience. If You are in the Dubai Mall, You have to see it (can be seen in Atlantis Palm Hotel also). The cheapest ticket is 80 AED (16 EUR), You can walk in the aquarium, and go into the tunnel with it. There are several more expensive tickets, which give some extra opportunity (such as diving with sharks, feeding fishes etc.).Walking in the tunel (underwater zoo) You will feel the fishses very close to you, it is really amazing.

No need to buy the ticket. The biggest aquarium in the world doesn't need a ticket to be appreciated. We did buy for us, more for my son, but actually there wasn't anything really special inside. Seeing it from the outside is enough.

Surprisingly god. Anyone can see the aquarium in the middle of Dubai Mall, but there is actually more to it - a whole zoo is upstairs. It is really well put together, informative and, with a few notable exceptions, most of the animals seem well cared for and in suitable enclosures. A good family activity.

very very enjoyable. i loved the place. i went gaga over the animals here. the sharks and the other fishes were huge. very clean and well maintained. i fancied a otter couple which kept me amused for long. the walk through the tunnel was simply amazing

An attraction worth visiting while in Dubai.. One of those unique opportunities to visit a real aquarium of such size in such a short time!
It worth visiting either by buying ticket and exploiting it fully or by just wondering around the main glass view for free.

interesting visit. The tank itself is EXCELLENT! As for the tunnel I wasnt a big fan. Its a really short stretch for the tunnel - I was definitely expecting more for the tunnel. The underwater zoo is quite nice. Personal opinion - if you have kids yes go ahead buy the ticket and head on through the tunnels and to the underwater zoo. For adults i'll say just seeing the tank from the outside will suffice. However having said this there was one thing Ii missed out on here which was a boat ride. Now I am not too sure of the details of this to comment but might make it a worthwhile visit so do check on that.
Fantastic. nice place to go with your kidz.. this aquarium have multiple type of sharks..fish..also penguin ....many..

Tunnel was amazing. My business partner loves aquariums so this was on our list of R&R activities. The wall of fish was incredible-am amazing variety of fish. We watched the divers feeding the rays by hand while all the other fish tried to grab a mouthful. You could see all this from the mall- no need to pay to get inside.If you wanted to spend the $$ you can go through this clear tunnel into the aquarium- which was great-you could get really up close to the sea creatures. We watched a diver cleaning it with a rag and occasionally interacting with little kids in the tunnel- that was fun. Admission included admission to their underwater zoo which is an area of small aquariums and displays containing all sorts of aquatic life. There were also 2 different groups of penguins to look at and a whole creepy creature exhibit of reptiles and snakes.

Worth a visit. You can view the outside of the aquarium for free inside the mall, which is an extensive area and good enough for photo opportunities but if you have the time I think its worth buying a ticket to walk through the tunnel and visit the underwater zoo. Its certaining not a full day trip but a nice way to spend a few hours. Staff were a bit over the top trying to take your photo at every given opportunity (for you to buy at the end) but we just said no and carried on.

Seen Better. The tunnel/ acquarium on Ground Level was quite small and the view for free from the outside was extensive anyway. The 'underwater zoo' on Level 2 was bigger but overall I found Sydney aquarium much better than this one in Dubai. It's location is convenient because it's close to Burj Khalifa and the fountains so it's worthwhile to see if already in Dubai Mall. The more expensive packages/ entry tickets are advertised but the basic entry at 55 dirhams is probably the best value if you're not diving.
Surprise. Nice Aquarium, very nice place, make you surprise.you can find inside this aquarium a very nice sea world, when you see it, you think you are inside a real sea

O.K if you consider that it is shoping mall but overall nothing special!. If you consider that aquarium is located in shopping mall (Dubai mall) it is definitely something special. Big selection of fishes swimming together and lot of spices in aquarium zoo. There is an option to dive in aquarium ! Nice underwater tunnel gives special impressions!However if you ever have dived or just snorkeling it is like to licking lollipop through window glass!If you been in one of big aquariums in for example in USA you will be definitely disappointment. This is rater for kids who might be bored by shopping and parents may leave them to watch fishes and have own fun with shopping without them!

great for the summer months. in soaring hot Dubai, this is a great attraction for the family during those long summer months. With an aquarium walk-through tunnel and a small but nice "aquarium-zoo" you are sure for a few hours of fun (that means, if you're not running). You could add the boat ride over the aquarium and feed the fish or do the scuba-dive session and dive between the sharks for added fun. Afterwards a diner at one of the many restaurants will make this a full afternoon out.

Impressive. Huge aquarium in the middle of a shopping centre! The walk through tunnel under the sharks was pretty cool. Cant really believe there is a decent aquarium and zoo inside a shopping mall! Great for kids - big and small!

Pleasant way to spend an hour or two but was expecting more. The Dubai aquarium is in the Dubai mall, on the basement level. I first saw it at night - when the lights make it a little more magical. There is quite a lot to see just from the outside - for free, and although you can not get completely upclose because of the barrier, its certainly a good enough view for photos, its also a good way to see the aquarium in its entirity. Having walked past it a few times I spontaneously decided to go in one Saturday afternoon. There are variouos packages - I went for the 90AED one which lets you into the aquarium tunnel and zoo as well as gives you a gift voucher for the shop (which I did not use) .There are however others which let you dive with the sharks, or take a boat ride over the top of the aquarium.The entrance to the aquarium takes you past the big window - which can be seen for free, although most people do not stop to take advantage of their close view as 1) you believe there is going to be something more inside, and 2) there are so many people looking at the window from behind the barrier that you almost feel part of the exhibit.However, my recommendation is to make the most of this time as for me, this panaromic view was the most spectacular part of the whole place.The tunnel part is fun- having a shark swim overhead or one of the flat fish pulll a smiley face while suckered to the transparent tunnel roof is enjoyable. The tunnel is however fairly short - alot shorter than I had anitcipated. After the tunnel there is a walk via the rainforest restaurant and then you get to view some more high walled parts of the aqaurium.After this, the aquarium visit is over - I had imagined it to be alot bigger but its not. I nearly missed the second part of the visit as there are no real signs or instuctions to tell you that the underwater zoo part is up 2 floors - I only found out as I wandered into the restaurant next door flashing my voucher thinking it was the gift shop and one of the waitresses ushered me in the rigt direction.So, two floors up (and out of the aquarium) you then go into the underwater zoo - you can first go and feed the fish. I think there was also supposed to be a behind the scenes type of tour but there was a lack of proactive personnel so either it did not take place or I missed it.The zoo part is great - there are various tanks with everthing from goldfish to squid, penguins and otters as well as crocodiles and turtles. All tanks are well kept and it looks as though all the creatures have enough room to live in. The otters are fun to watch for a while, as are the penguins. There are plenty of information signs around the tanks so you read up on the characteristics of each animal.The aqaurium is really designed around families and there were many very happy and excited children really enjoying their time there,All in all it was a pleasant way to spend an hour , however having seen the aquarium from the outside many times , I had anticipated that the inside of it would be just as spectacular - but it did not meet my expectations.

Wonderful experience for the family. Lots of exhibits in the underwater zoo and in the acquarium. The kids enjoyed watching the fish and other sea / desert creatures. The acquarium too was spectacular.

Sensational look at marine sea life. We visited the Dubai aquarium as a family and it was one of the highlights of our break in Dubai. The main tank is huge, well maintained and well stocked with a wide variety of exotic fish. The smaller tanks were equally as interesting and well maintained. A must visit when in Dubai.

Felt like a kid again!. It was so much fun, everyone should do it!It is located at the Dubai Mall and so it is easy to access and If anyone should get hungry there are plenty places to eat too.Unless you want to shop til you drop-Fashion Avenue is the place to be!

OK to kill a bit of time. The Aquarium is probably a lot better than we give it credit for as we were just killing time and only had the basic entry level ticket. I am sure that if you spend a little bit more and opt of feeding the fish or the glass bottom boat you get much better value for money.We went through the underwater tunnel which is fairly cool with lots of sharks and rays which are always lovely to see and through to the zoo (which is two floors up!) The zoo is great and aimed at kids which most of these things are - lots of fish, crabs and penguins as well as a creepy crawly section with beetles and snakes etc. Not to pricey and worth a visit if you have kids and you are at the Mall

Dubai Acquarium. Nice place. Its at Dubai mall and nice variety of fishes including sharks. Reaching at different places at Dubai mall is time consuming. Attractions are not time consuming but the time to reach the attractions inside the mall is time consuming. You can take Burj Khalifa and Acquarium visit together as entrance to Burj Khalifa is from Dubai mall. Directions are given inside the mall. You can reach Dubai mall 3 hours before your Burj Khalifa ticket in case you want to enjoy the Acquarium.

Fascinating!. Spent ages in here and found it fascinating - an ever-changing scene. Took the tunnel, zoo and glass-bottom boat tour, the zoo is brilliant with an amazing selection of fish, crocs, lizards & other creatures - the penguins were ever so funny! The size of the tak and the variety of fish, rays and sharks are simply outstanding. Well-worth spending the time here away from the Dubai mall and endless shopping! Follow up with the nightime fireworks outside the mall - brilliant!

Great entertainment for the kiddos at the shopping mall. A trully great aquarium with tons of fish and sharks and sting rays etc etc. really worth it to go in and to the whole tour even if you get a great view from outside as well. My daughter liked feeding the fish!
More then meets the eye. Really neat experience. It's not just the tunnel but also a full aquarium upstairs. Very cool pictures. I thought it was a really fun way to spend the afternoon!

Stop over visit. It was interesting and a good way to spend an hour, but not really special. Most exhibits were not clearly named, I felt sad to see the rays and sharks so contained in such a small area.

Not a big fan of these places, but ..... I'm not a big fan of these types of places but as they go this was well presented and had an excellent variety of creatures. A little overcrowded but no signs of ill health or in tank aggression. Several breeding tanks were active, fascinating 'Walking Fish'.

Great experience. Very well organised with lots of packages available. We bought the platinum package which included the aquarium, underwater zoo, behind the scenes fish feeding and a discount on one item in the gift shop. We thought the aquarium was very well presented and there were some very interesting specimens in the underwater zoo. The behind the scenes tour was very interesting and we had a very good guide. A very worthwhile experience.
Just there. If this one is in the mall then it is average. The one in Maui is much better, but for a desert it is great.

Heard it's a nice place to visit. We could not visit this tour destination because of time. We were told they are very nice places to visit. You pay to visit each of the facilities but one is through to the other, so pay for the underwater zoo and walk through the aquarium- wise advise! If you love nature, you will admire what the facility owners have done here...

better form outside. magnificent and huge from the mall, when you finally get in after a long queue you realize that you basically see the same things, the only thing is that you are in a tunnel underwater. a very nice experience but probably not worth the price and the waiting time. the most interesting part turns to be the museum, when you have smaller pools where you can see smaller fish and amphiboios varieties.

Too close for comfort but amazing!. Been here over 6 times now and always get excited to see the penguins and tiny sea horses. Great place and very nicely maintained..The tunnel is amazing and you can almost touch the sharks and sting rays..It is annoying sometimes to get loud guests posing for pics only but the attraction itself is worth a look!

not bad. It is a nice thing to do while in the Dubai Mall with children.It was slightly smaller than expected (the tunnel), but again the price is reasonableso I suppose you get what you pay for. The Underwater zoo was bigger and better in my opinion.

Aquarium. This has to be the largest aquarium i have ever seen. What a wonderful way to spend a couple of hours out of the desert heat.The aquarium is in The Dubai Mall and there is a fee to go in but you can see a beautiful display of fish on the outside.

Do it!!. This mall is huge! And incredibly well organised. I was struck speechless when rounding a corner we came across the indoor aquarium, if you think I mean some piddly Kyle thing think again, this thing is massive, something like 10 million gallons big and home to sharks, and hundereds of other sea creatures and fish. We had the 'deluxe package' which gave us access to the sea life centre in the mall and a walk through the tunnel in the aquarium AND a glass bottom boat ride on the aquarium tank - wow! All that cost about 120 dirhams a person (approx £25 a head). Great value, and that included a 20 dirham gift vouch for the shop per person. You have to see it to believe it - go and see for yourself!

Fish Tank. Right in the middle of the Dubai Mall is the most massive two storey fish tank with a tunnel walk through the middle that had the most amazing assortment of fish and beasts of the ocean.The sharks and the Rays were amazing. They were feeding the Rays while we were there and it is an amazing spectacle.Only in Dubai !!!!!!

Should do.. If you are travelling with children this is definitely a should do. Especially after lots of shopping in Dubai this is a reward for the kids behaving. But be aware as not all prices are on the banner at the ticket counter best is go online and see all the deal and package they have. As they try to sell you the expensive ones. We looked online and we could get into the aquarium and the zoo for 55 AED per person which is no where to be found there. So do a bit of research before.
Wonderful view. Right here in the mall is this huge aquarium. You can walk around it and even walk in it. If you want to you can even go diving! Wonderful design and best of all it is free!!!!

Great snorkeling experience inside the aquarium. Loved it, went with my daughter, very professional these guys both coach also Ernesto with you inside the cage while you swim around the sharks, unbelievable sea rays too, huge water tank, 10 million liters they say and it looks indeed massive with thousand of species. Definitely a must in Dubai after the ski and Atlantis.

So So. bit disappointed have been to better Aquariums expected more fish and not just a small tunnell which took a short time to walk though found the young lady that did the talk on feeding the fish was very interesting other than that if in to Dubai again would not make a point of going again

Just interesting. The "Aquarium" is basically a huge tank that contains the sharks and a few other big animals. The most interesting is in fact the "Underwater Zoo" (at the top of the mall) that has smaller tanks, insects, penguins, etc. Recommendation: in the entrace they will try to sell you a "Glass bottom boat-ride", that is completely uninteresting, or a "behind the scenes tour": they seem a waste of money.
Fabulous Aquarium. We visited in February 2011. This place is huge, they even have a glass bottomed boat in the Aquarium!Fantastic variety of sealife and animals. Well worth a visit

Go for it. A must visit attraction while you are at the Dubai Mall. Go for the 110Dm tour. You get to see the full trip. One of the better aquariums I've been to. You won't get good pictures on the glass bottomed boat but enjoy. Worth the money.

Amazing. These are based in the Dubai Mall, not really what you would expect to see when walking through a shopping Mall. The underwater zoo brings you right up close to all the fish including the small sharks, who just swim around looking very contented.Both venues are quite quick to get round, well worth getting the ticket that covers both venues

Underwater attrraction inside the Dubai Mall. For its price (AED 50 per person), i would say its reasonable experience especially for kids. The aquarium is really small - you can finish it in less than an hour. But its inside the mall (Dubai Mall) so you can do a this and shop / dine and the Dubai Fountain at the same location - a good option for entertaining visitors. The souvenir photos are pricey though.. so best to bring your own camera!

Shopping with a difference. At Dubai Shopping Mall, there is a treat. First you see fish swimming in a tank. OK, we have seen that before but this is just the start. The whole thing is a scientific experience as qualified staff monitor what the fish eat but allow you to inspect their work and if you like diving you are allowed to dive into the tanks and see for yourself. When you realise that some of the occupants are sharks you realise why this is special.

A beautiful experience, all the time. The Dubai Aquarium is a great experience, and a must for anyone visiting the Dubai Mall. The good thing is you could still enjoy the acquarium without paying for entrance fees. Or you could dine at Chili's restaurant and still get partial views of the aquarium. Should you decide to pay, you will certainly enjoy and get what you pay for. Kids will love it, and adults as well. It offers great opportunities to learn about several marine creatures. Since it is an indoor attraction, I usually save my visits for summers. However, it certainly worth visiting all year round.
shopping with sharks!!. this was a fantastic experience going to the mall shopping and then going to the underwater world quite surreal
Anytime. We visit this place everytime we go to Dubai Mall. KIds love and enjoy this place. One of many attraction of Dubai Mall.

you get more for free. the aquarium view itself is amazing and the best we ever saw. the underwater zoo is the money wasted though, really. the animals/fishes are not as many as you could think, and comparing to the external view of the aquarium itself (which is amazing and FREE) you pay 80-100 dirhams (some 25-30 bux) per person to see animals/fishes that do not impress at all. fish feeding we paid extra for was scheduled in 40 minutes after our entrance so we just skipped one. the photo the staff does was offered for 200 (!) dirhams - thats 57 US dollars. Man, i have a camera on my own, and my pics wont look worse but will cost me nothing. that was so overpriced that made us feel someone just wants to earn much doing standard automated job. the staff inside the zoo was just offering pics, no guide, no audioguide, no anything to help people understand why 270 dirhams spent for 3 people were worth of that. not recommending!

Exteremly small. it is not worth it at all if u have been to other aquariums coz it is exteremly small , kids can love it as u can see sharks . it is a very short tunnel . not much to see . but if u have never been to an aquarium before u will like it .

excellent few hours. We went here as we were early for a reservation and it was well worth the money (we used entertainer vouchers too). Great aquarium and plenty to see. We also did the glass bottom boat ride which was good to see behind the scenes of the aquarium.

Informative. The aquariumis beatiful. it is great to see sharks up close like that. At the end youcan do a little boat ride over the aquarium and a staff member explains everything about how they work. It's very interesting. The penguins are funny!

Superb. Its among the biggest aquarium made of single sheet of whatever polycarbonate plastic or glass... They have good variety of fishes... Good exhibits..... They even have an optional glass bottom boat ride from the top... which to me is pretty useless.. You can choose not to put in extra money for that. You dont get to see any more fishes.... Its just a gimmick that people fall for. We did.. :)But overall, even if you choose to do it, its good fun... You can easily spend 2-3 hrs in here. Kids will love it.
Nice. The aquarium is quite pleasant but as with all other aquariums in my opinion can get boring after a while. The sea life in the aquarium is impressive and yes you will get to see sharks!

A good experiençe while in a mall. Everything was good, the tunnel, the zoo the creepy zoo.
The boat ride was disappointing as the bottom was too scratched to have a good view and to take pictures.

A must-see. Walking through Dubai mall, we came across the Aquarium whilst shopping and had to visit. The tank is truly massive when you first see it and the variety of marine life is impressive. I do question the size of many of the enclosures for the animals, especially the otters and penguins. Worth a visit but once is enough. Kids would love it!

Zoo is great, Tunnel a waste of money. The Zoo here is the hidden gem, its wonderful. The Aquarium is great to be viewed from the Mall on all levels and you can watch for hours, pity there is no coffee shop overlooking it.The tunnel's entrance cost is the same as the Zoo, the tunnel is a passage under and through the Aquarium...do it once maybe never again.

Dive with sharks. 100 gbp if you have padi or 200 pounds if you need a try dive. You get 35 mins in the tank with the sharks and rays, lots of people taking your picture from the mall and tunnel so gibe them a wave. They are really safe and give a safety video and a talk about sharks and how they are good for the oceans and becoming endangered. you get close and brushed by 6 foot tiger sharks so not for the squeamish. Depth is about 11 mtrs.

Not worth the money and a little misleading. Somewhere I saw advertisements about this aquarium being the world's largest. It may be the largest single tank aquarium but that is primarily all it is. It is about $25US to walk in a tube under the water and go upstairs to see about 10-15 exhibits of a few fish and penguins. Regarding the few exhibits, I've seen more in local zoos.
Impressive fishes. Quite impressive aquarium located in dubai mall, used an entertainer voucher. Got to see the aquarium from below in the tunnel and above on a glass bottom boat

Amusing, not more..... Well, the evaluation depends on the approach you have. If you want to evaluate an attraction in a mall, this is quiet nice ("impressive" would be a big word). If you approach this as an aquarium, this is very average compared to the other "real" aquariums you can see in other countries. Let say, when it is very hot in Dubai and you do not know what to do with kids, this is a way to spend 2 or 3 hours (if you go to the rain forest restaurant, just after) and see something different. But if you have already visited other aquariums before, do not expect something special ... but what would you expect in a mall, at least this is to sale, not for the culture :-)

Tickle the tummy of a shark!. Well, not really....because there is how many inches of glass between you and the sharks. I paid for the aquarium tunnel and the zoo was a different ticket, I didn't have time for both. It's clean, the fish look happy enough, I don't really know how to tell if fish are happy because they don't smile, but none were dead, like I've seen in other places.... You can actually pay to scuba dive in the aquarium, that might be an niteresting option for next time.
Breathtaking. Explore the water world in this Aquarium, it is really breathtaking and amazing. The design of the big pools is really terrific. You have to explore this aquarium, dont miss it.

Good. Its clean, loads of fishes, fascinating for people who have not seen the underwater tunnel. I had a chance to see the fish feeding, which was amazing. I would advise to wait up until you reach the zoo for the picture coz the frames get cheaper to 70 AED vs. 200 AED at the enterance. Its worth taking the children, its quite enjoyable. I loved the rickaty bridge, though it was a short one was fun. Dont miss the penguins and the creepy crawlies....
Nice Place. Amazing place for family and kids, with a lovely view inside the aquarium and outside, you must give it a try!
Brilliant and in a mall. Brilliant aquarium and underwater zoo, we brought the package that includes a ride in a glass bottom boat which was amazing.

A great place to cool down. The Dubai Aquarium is in the heart of the Dubai Mall and you cannot miss it - it is a big old tank with thousands of fish, sharks, rays etc.As well as viewing the aquarium from the mall which is free you can pay to enter the tunnel - only takes a couple of minutes to walk through but you do get a fantastic view of the sharks.You can also take a glass bottom boat ride in the aquarium or you can jump into a cage and snorkel for a greater experience - I did this and it was a great experience. The staff were friendly and you get to jump in the tank along with hundreds of fish (some of them in the tank with you!) don't worry though as the sharks cannot get in.If you have a PADI you can scuba with the sharks but please note you will not be allowed up the Burj Khalifa for 48 hours if you do this!!!The website said no cameras but when we got there they said if we had underwater cameras then we were free to use them so take them and chance it.Overall a good 40 minutes experience.The underwater Zoo is very small and will not take you long to walk around.

This in A Shopping mall?. Well yes it is What a fantastic display of fish not only little ones but some big Sharks and Manta rays They even have penguins and Snakes .you can choose from different tours And even have a short ride in a glass bottom boat what a great idea whilst out shopping .Enjoy your visit I did .

very basic. It was similar to Sydney’s Aquarium and literally just a huge rectangular fish tank and an underwater tunnel similar to the one in Sydney. The tunnel goes under the aquarium and you can see reef sharks, large schools of fish and even a whale shark. The tank is themed to a shipwreck with several man-made barnacle ridden structures seen around the tank, giving it a rather weathered look.At the exit of the tunnel there is a rainforest café. It looked cool but we didn’t go inside. From there we went to second part of the zoo which is in the third floor.As soon as we enter the underwater zoo, it follows a rather linear route winding through the exhibits and passing through many tanks of fishes before moving onto the next. There are many kinds of fishes like piranhas and even playful otters. There were also some fishes native to the Amazon as well as south East Asia. There was a shark tank comprising of small reef sharks, jellyfishes which glow under synthetic florescent lighting as well as a few relatively exotic crustaceans such as Alaskan crabs. The deep sea areas of the zoo are nicely themed with waterfalls and fiberglass cave walls, giving it a subterranean atmosphere.Following the route, we eventually came to the bug section called creepy crawly where we could see scorpions and tarantulas and in the reptile section of the zoo where there were display of some lizards and snakes. There was also a mini suspension bridge made of rope up there which forms the rainforest “canopy walk” part of the park, allowing you to have an overview of the rainforest portions of the park. One of the best parts of the zoo was watching the penguins exhibit.

Another must do experience!. Okay so the tickets aren't cheap, but what do people expect? It costs a lot to maintain all the tanks especially the main tank, which is the biggest in door tank in the world. The ticket includes going in the tunnel where the tank is, you can get amazing views of stingrays, sharks and other fish, The only problem is when its busy, a lot of people just stand in your way so it can be difficult to get shots. The underwater zoo was lovely, lots of variety and it takes around an hour to get around. I did feel like a few other posters that the penguin enclosure could have been bigger, however they didn't seem unhappy. A lot of them were performing for people, showing off. It was quite sweet. I would recommend visiting because its not a normal aquarium experience.
Awesome. A breathtaking experience to see so many fish in one aquarium. It is enormous and you really feel very small standing beside it.

Beautiful Fish.. But Penguin Enclosure Distressingly Small. A zoo in a mall? They must be crazy! Nope. Just cruel. Like most visitors we were drawn into walking the aquarium tunnels from the mall-side view of the large tank. The tunnels didn't disappoint, the fish were stunning and you felt extremely close to them in the tunnels, where watching the under-belly of a shark feels quite eerie. Included in our ticket was a trip to the underground zoo, so we went to take a look.First impressions were good. It was July, low season for Dubai, so the place wasn't busy and we got a good look at everything. The spiders and snakes were interesting, as were the turtles and lizards. Though all these niceties are sort of irrelevant as I still can't get over the sadness I felt at seeing the two different penguin enclosures. They were no bigger than a small room, with air conditioning blasting, white painted rocks and perspex looking out onto the zoo floor. The smell was awful, but perhaps this is normal for any indoor enclosure. Each enclosure had a small pool for swimming, but no sooner had a penguin dived in, there was little room for swimming as they'd have to slow to a stop or jump out again. It was awful to think these penguins would not see any natural light. Some signs mentioned that one breed had been bred in captivity, but I don't think this is ever an excuse to keep these intelligent animals, who swim hundreds of miles in the wild, enclosed in the cramped area. They were showing signs of utter bordom, two were pacing the floor, turning, and heading back to where they'd started; over and over. There were some rattles and other 'stimulating' objects hung on a wall but they weren't being used.Dubai bragged about having the first penguins in the UAE and the worlds first underground zoo - but there's a good reason these things have never been done - they are cruel, unecessary money-spinners.

Big aquarium,not a lot of fish variety. The mall that house the aquarum is certainly impressive but the aquarium it self was rather dissapointing. Though the main tank is quite large the variety of its inhabitants is very limited. The tank held the obligatory number of sharks and rays but not much variety in the fish department. The smaller tanks up stairs weren't at all impressive with the reef tank only having a couple of anenomes and fake coral.
