Not what i was expecting as Dubai seems to do every thing else on a grand scale. Have visited much better displays than this. Dissapointd

The view is better from outside. One of the largest aquariums, located in one of the largest malls in the world, The Dubai Mall, the aquarium best view is from outside, the tunnel may be interesting if you would like to take photos while the fish is around you.I didn't like the underwater zoo. It might be useful for children, but not very interesting. Prices are a little bit expensive for families (between AED 110 - 80, depending on the package)Overall, I prefer to watch from outside rather going inside the tunnel and undrwater zoo.

Amazing Experience, Each time, Every Time!!. Every visit amazes me more and more. The fishes just beautiful and you feel as if you are floating in the water along with them. The variety of fishes simply amazes. The tunnel passing under the aquarium is a wonderful experience. A very well maintained place and quite a learning experience for the kids is the underwater zoo. The little one was so excited that he could not stop screaming each time he saw a new creature. A must see. The only dampener is the high cost of entry, which is reduced can increase the number of people who can partake the experience from much closer quarters.

Good aquarium, not big but impressive. The aquarium is not big (from where we see it) but there is a second level underwater zoo. What is impressive is the fact that it is a corridor in the middle of the shopping mall. You can even scuba dive in the aquarium!

Interesting and fun. We visited this as part of a ticket package with the Burj Khalifa and it was really good. 135.00 Dirhams package price. The aquarium tunnel is facinating and so are the huge glass pannels that you can view from the Mall. The types of marine life and the animals in the zoo up another two levels are interesting to all ages. A good attraction.
Shark dive. If you have tine go for a cage dive! It was incredible. The visibility was excellent and the proximity of the sharks and rays were mind blowing!

Loved the Aquarium, Not So Much the Zoo. The aquarium was lovely and enjoyable. Not much of a fish person, but it's amazing how close you can get to sharks and stingrays. It was fun watching them swim around you.. above you! Great experience here.The zoo was not that exciting, though educational. Kids would probably enjoy it more. The place felt stuffy and smelled rather musty. Felt a bit suffocating, or maybe it's because of the snakes and spiders and creepy crawlies that I'm just not into.Be careful of your belongings when roaming inside the zoo. Dropped my wallet, without knowing, when I crawled under one of the aquariums for a photo opp (my bad really!). So, a special shout out to that kid who returned my wallet. God bless that kid.
Amazing!. Between The Tunnel, the Zoo and the boat rides, its a great place to go!You won't regret it, trust me

Aquarium winner!. FANTASTIC...I'm not much of a fish person but jaysus it's just jaw dropping and you could look at it for long periods and then come back and look at it again it's that entrancing...a must for everyone simple as! Should be higher in things to see and do!

The kids had a great time.. The actual aquarium tunnel is not all that interesting and I was let down initially, thinking I had wasted my money. I didn't realize at first that there was more. The real fun is the underwater zoo on the next floor. I took my two children, aged 4 and 8 at the time, and they had a blast looking at all the fish, water critters, and bugs. We will probably be going again this year.

Lovely place!. Went there last year with my family and it was amazing! We all loved it it's better then our deep see world in Edinburgh! Kids loved this place is massive Especieally the shoping center! I wanna move to Dubai :) I recommend this place and the shoping center :)
the best. The best I have ever seen ,, and I seen a lot ! Its really place to see in Dubai I think everybody should visit , even just to say " I been there"

Dubai Mall - Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Top marks for the aquarium, which is superb but a low score for the underwater zoo. Enclosures were cramped, and worst of all were the penguin areas. The penguins did not look at all happy. There was evidence of repetitive pacing up and down, which we found upsetting. We were going to complete a comments form at the exit but there weren't any pens and we didn't have one to hand.

Great aquarium for in a mall. There are some really good sharks and rays in the aquarium worth seeing. The second floor is a lot of good fish too. Worth going to if you really like seeing fish and underwater life.You can also scuba in the aquarium, the price was reasonable too. About 400AED I believe. I didn't go because we had a flight that night, but would have liked too. No experience or license is required based on some of the people in the tank. Stop by for sure!

Fabulous Aquarium offering Unique Fun. This is simply a fantastic aquarium with so very much to see and do, it's mind-boggling. Walking through the tunnel is a splendid experience. The glass-bottomed boat ride gives much perspective to those who ride it. And one could spend hours in the underwater zoo, which is a real treat.It's also good value for money. TIP: I'd highly recommend getting the all-inclusive tickets for the tunnel, boat ride, and zoo, which give you the total aquarium experience at the pace of your choosing.My only complaint is minor enough to not take away from the stars I'd rate this place with -- the gift shop of the aquarium is pretty sorry. It has tons of items, but it feels like it has nothing at all. All very banal and unfortunately, like the several times they stand you to take pictures, where the commercialization bit stands out so glaringly. Still, the sea creatures and the displays speak for themselves. This is a no-brainer. Consider it a must-see if you're in Dubai, and especially if you have kids. Also, I'd devote an entire day to this. Our only regret was we couldn't spend more than two hours combined here. Next time, I'm diving in the tank!

Very nice. Imagine a full aquarium and zoo inside a mall...very ncie...u could cover both quite easily in about 2 hours...glass boat ride is nice...go inside the aquarium....however, quite expensive..but should not be missed

The most amazing Aquarium I've seen!. I'm a huge fan of marine life and fish and found the aquarium amazing! You could literally spend hours in there. It's a great experience and I'd highly recommend it.Look out for the Finding Nemo tank! Great day out for the kids.

Aboslutely a MUST. I was there with my family of young kids. We had a great time at the Aquarium and the ZOO also. Definitely a must especially if you are with kids.The view of the aquarium from the outside is Free for all. Only you have to buy ticket to go indie the underwater tunnel and the ZOO.

Only if you've never been to an aquarium. Its nice.. The Aquarium trip you just walk almost 15 meters in a tunnel inside the aquarium were you get surrounded by FISH!! nice for a couple of pictures, and thats it..The underwater Zoo, is very interesting, if you are interested in such stuff.Price is average, So if you really want some nice pictures, its a nice place to visit

Only in dubai. The palace is pretty big with more species than I could count. My kids were amazed at seeing the fish and loved it. Just make sure if you opt for the fish feeding when buying the ticket they tell you what time it is because we had to wait 30 mins for it to start.
love water creatures ?. this is great for kids and parents not so much of an amazing thing i mean once youve seen one aqarium youve seen them all ...

World Class Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. I went with my husband, daughter and twin granddaughters. The tiny girls were totally fascinated by the fist and animals being so close up. They just wanted to touch them. We have a world class aquarium in my home town, but not on this scale. The size alone is amazing
good. interesting, not as big as atlantis but very close to town
Sharks. I visited the mall of Dubai so had to visit the aquarium, tunnel brilliant enjoyed glass bottomed boat too, not bad for the money Dubai seems to be good value for money.
The best aquarium in the world .... The best aquarium in the world and probably the biggest, i loved the sharks, kids enjoyed it a lot.

A good place to see while you are in Dubai Mall. Various options are available when you buy the ticket..aquarium,underwater zoo,boating inside the aquarium,diving inside the aquarium etc.We went for the three i.e., aquarium,zoo and boating..Boating was the most enjoyable part of all and you will love sailing inside the artificial ocean midst of loads of fishes..

Not Worth It. We went to this overpriced aquarium in the mall. We probably spent no more than 30 minutes in the entire 'aquarium'. The coolest thing was the tunnel and that didn't last long at all. To top it all off, some woman cut in front of us just as we were about to purchase tickets and the cashier allowed it, and when we asked her why she just told us to keep moving. We were so annoyed it was difficult to enjoy the few cool things in the aquarium. Absolutely not worth it.

Nice Nice. I visited Dubai mall so many times but I only Went into this tunnel Twice. Excellen experience and relatively cheap. I wonder how they built it with this amount of water and animals. Some fishes cannot be usually seen from below tunnel since they are always sitting beside the oxygene ventilator at the top. You can see them from the Resturant's side (Chilli's Resturant).

Meh.. We felt that this was overpriced, primarily because we thought we would get to see more of the massive aquarium once inside, but as it turns out most of the fishes can be seen from OUTSIDE, and you pay to walk underneath the tunnel which doesn't actually give you a very good view. The underwater zoo is informative and it was really funny because we saw the same guy feed about three different animals, but the glass bottom boat ride is short and definitely not worth the extra money. However, the aquarium IS beautiful, and the behind-the-scenes tour is quite informative though very very short. Try and go for the cage diving option as it looked really fun!
Must Go !!. Nice place to see diff kinds of fishes.. n esp Sharks...
big aquarium ever seen!. that's a big aquarium I've ever seen in my life, and I like the Aquarium Tunnel...!

under the sea. very very beautiful.very well organized.it is worlds largest indoor aquarium.it holds 10 million liters of water,it has more then 30,000 species of animals.even sharks , dangerous Piranha, Giant Catfish, playful Otters, a Humbolt Penguin colony, and many more are there.

unbelievable. we visited this the day we visited the burj khalifa and its a truly amazing place! its full of sharks!!! your so close its fantastic!it has sharks, penguins, turtles and loads more!!! great tour available if your with kids and want to keep them busy! some great places to take pics!!! professional pics are available with a reasonably priced gift shop. i would deffo reccomend this place to visit!

Good Visit but could be better.. Great sight-seeing with the wife but there should be toour guides to tell you more about each of the species when walking through the Aquarium & Underwater zoo. Most of the time we were like "what is that" then got confused on which sign was for which species... a bit confusing throughout the whole tour.... the place is beautiful but the service is not well at all... We should have just saw it from the outside and kept shopping instead of paying for the "Ultimate tour" which wasn't anything special.

Awesome - What an attraction to have in a Mall!. This was fantastic, what a surreal yet great experience. One minute your shopping and the next your looking into an aquariaum with an abundence of marine life. I recommend going through the tunnel and spending an hour or two on this mini adventure. Well worth the entrance fee.(Don't bother paying the extra for the fish feeding and behind the scenes tour unless your really keen). A bit of a non entity, saying that I enjoyed the brief experience.

Cage snorkel was excellent. We hadn't visited the mall before so if traveling by metro note it's not on the line and you need to catch a bus to mall ( maybe in winter you can walk) this made us 30 mins late for our appointment, sorry guys but thank you for still accommodating us. The snorkel was excellent we were in the cage for 30mins with sharks and rays swimming past and fish in the cage, big salmon. Very exciting watching all the fish and stuff they get up to. Great value for money 220 each I think. Staff were very nice. If you want to know about the aquarium, fishes etc you still need to do the regular aquarium tour as we weren't told anything and would have liked to have known more. A real wow factor and experience we won't forget soon. It can get pretty cold after 30mins so it would have been nice if showers were hotter and hair dryer before you go back into the glam mall. Awesome mall activity!!!

a WOW.... ive been there twice during my many visits to dubai. ive always wanted to try diving in it.... but for some reason, the group im with is always in a hurry.... its still on my list to do...theres no need to go more than once... i liked it, but i get dizzy everytime im walking in the arc....
What an experience!!. Never had such a aquarium experience like this in 30 years!! And ticket prices were also not bad for AED 50.
family fun in dubai mall. it is interesting, especially for kids. it complements a visit in Dubai Mall. During the shopping, family can stop for visiting the Aquarium and Fountains.
Aquarium inside a mall!. I only was able to see the aquarium from the hallway in the mall, but not even going inside was amazing. Sharks and Rays in a mall! Not something you see everyday!
Fabulous...what will they think of next. The entry should have been either FREE or the charge should be nominal.. expensive as far as i was concerned. At least kids under 10 should go free
wonderful. amazing experience I would definitely go see it again

Lot more to see inside. I went for a dive in the aquarium. Was definately worth it! The shark dive lasts about 40mins. A little bit pricey but how many chances do you get to go diving in a shopping mall in the desert! The dive gear wasnt the best but you are not diving in the open ocean so I wasnt too worried. Its a little wierd looking out and seeing all the shoppers looking in at you. Would recommend it to anyone.If you go diving you also get to go inside the zoo and see all the other animals. Theres a lot more to see than just the large aquarium. Heaps of snakes, lizards, tropical fish aquarium and penguins. Not sure about the price to go into the zoo itself, but it is definatly worth a look. Im not sure if people realize there is more to see than just the free outside viwing panel.
Awesome. You will get an experience of lifetime! Simply unforgettable.
A huge Aquarium. This size aquarium is neither seen nor thought of. Kids enjoy the most over here.

Great hour for the whole family!. I live and work next to Dubai mall but only visited the underwater zoo recently when my parents were over at Christmas. we all LOVED it! penguins, fish etc, a really fun couple of hours.

Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. Nothing can beat this. This is for public viewing as well as for those who want to get inside after paying. World's largest single piece glass panel is here with the name in Guinness book of world record.

Good way to spend a couple of spare hours. Worthwhile, but o better than any major Australian aquarium. Novelty value is the size of the glass in the aquarium and that it is in a shopping centre. Not cheap though.
See it for free. Why pay to walk through the tunnel, just walk around and you get the exact same experience for free.

Good effort for a mall. We went to the Dubai Aquarium today and for an attraction located in a shopping mall it was not bad. However, if you have been to other modern aquariums then this will be a little disappointing. Putting 10 million liters of water in the middle of the largest shopping mall is no mean feat, but as an aquarium it is just okay. My advice stand outside and take in the view for free, the tunnel is a waste of money.

Impressive Fish Tank. Wow... Omg... Impressive.... my goodness... Yes first thing you think when you see the exceptionally large window of the fish tank.. It is pretty darn big which holds sharks, fish etc. Definately on a must do list this one.

Well worth it. Well worth a visit, it was great to go shopping and be able to visit this while there.
Kids and adults love it. Would definitely go abck

The Mall of Dubai is even better than The Mall of The Emirates!. While staying in Dubai recently on vacation, my family (wife and toddler) and I visited the Mall of Dubai. It was located a little farther away from the Jumeirah Beach resorts but wasn't unreasonably far. Maybe a 25-30 minute taxi ride from the resorts located along Jumeirah Beach. Our initial impression was very good, and we enjoyed all the visual interests such as the Atrium and Underwater Zoo and Aquarium. Although the aquarium could have been more entailed (only really a long glass tunnel which goes through the middle of the aquarium), the abundance of wildlife made up for it for sure! We saw so many sharks and species of beautiful species of fish! Additionally, there is an Ice Skating Rink for people of all ages to skate which looked like a lot of fun! The Mall has every type of store for those interested in shopping although prices are steep all over the middle east. If you are looking for a bargain this is not the place for you! Overall, this is a great place to visit for people of all ages and interests. There is definitely something for everyone!
Water Zoo. Visited the Dubai Zoo within the Dubai Mall this is amazing how it has been built and the animals are out of this world first class.
Not bad. An Ok thing o do if you need to get out of the heat. Very good if you hvae children

not worth paying. Heed my warning and stay outside since you see most of it. If you want a different vantage point head to the 2nd floor! Not worth paying to go through the aquarium.Visited March 2009
Nice big aquarium. Nice aquarium with different spieces of water creatures..MY kid luved it.
fish. visually stunning, saw so many different colourful and beautiful sea creatures and fish, amenities excellent., no crowds and easy access to viewing portals

You can see most of it from the outside. It's not too expensive to see the aquarium and zoo, but unless you really want to see the penguins, otters and snakes in the zoo it's not worth paying to go in. The aquarium is clearly visible from 2 floors of the Dubai mall so you can see the sharks and rays without paying. The underwater walk is the same as in any Sea Life Centre, though apparently the aquarium tank is the largest in the world.The price list does not show the cheapest option, Dhs 50, that lacks only the behind-the-scenes tour compared to the Dhs 75 one. So ask for that if that's enough for you.
Super cool experience. Worth visiting, alot of fun...take the kids. There's lots more to do in and around the area.

Afternoon at the mall turns into pleasure. Amazed to see all the animals on display here from the grey nurse shark to otters. As divers we haddock mixed emotions on the 35 grey nurse sharks enclosed within but I suppose that it is educational and hopefully people can appreciate their beauty and how gentle they are! We did feel however that they could improve by educating people about marine live and how we can preserve it!
An amazing experience. It is an unprecedented collection of aquatic life on land.

Don't miss this. If you think you get to see everything from the outside and you don't need to pay, think again. The tunnel through the aquarium was ok, but the real highlight is the underwater zoo. A behind the scenes tour is included in the basic entry ticket - it's short but interesting.It is also nice sitting in a nearby coffee shop, having a drink, and watching the fish in the giant aquarium.

Impressive display in the centre of a shopping mall.. I was amazed at the size of this giant fish tank located in the middle of a shopping mall. There is no need to do the tour unless you are really into your fish as almost everything is visible from the mall. The tank is massive and the Perspex is over 2 foot thick and like so much in Dubai is an engineering feat to look at in wonder and awe.

Don't need to go in!. You really don't need to pay to enter, since you can see everything from the outside. The walk inside tunnel (which is what you pay for) gets really crowded, and if you've been to any aquarium in the world, its nothing special.
Good inside a mall. Dont go here if ur staying at Atlantis, the aquarium at atlantis is much better, dont waste ur time & money goin inside, as the view from outside is good.
Fun............. I like things like this.........I enjoy going with friends and family or just by myself........... over and over again..........

It's an aquarium in a shopping mall!. The  aquarium is located in the Dubai mall with other tourist attractions in the same area such as the burj khalifa and dubai fountains.  There are several options to your ticket. You can just see the aquarium tunnel extra to take a glass boat tour extra to see the underwater zoo. You also get some credit to spend in the gift shop ( but we forgot to use ours).Option 1: It has a visible aquarium  with fish and sharks etc. wall facing the mall. For the average tourist to see an aquarium in the middle of a shopping mall is good enough especially since the only difference between paying and not paying is that you go through a tunnel and see it all around you up close.  Option 2: Then the glass bottom boat ride across the top of the aquarium. 3: underwater Zoo which shows the amount of species that are in danger from humansJust remember its an aquarium but in a mall so decide your reasons but hey I'm in Dubai so why not?
nice underwater tunnel. we had a great time at dubai aquarium.nice to walk in the underwater tunnel surrounded by various water species.need only about half an hour with nomianl fee
Amazing shark tunnel. A fun site to see with kids.... The shark tunnel is amazing. The rest of the zoo is not worth seeing.

No need to go in. Located in dubai mall, the same place as the burj khalifa so 2 birds, one stone etc. Worth a look especially for children, our 1 year old loved it. What you can see in the actual mall without paying to go inside is a huge glass wall of sharks and fish, this is probably the best bit. We paid and all it was a tunnel on the other side of the glass wall - so just the same and some big fish tanks in the dark in another room. There is a bit with creepy crawlys but we were bored by then.

Maginificent!. The Dubai Aquarium is worth visiting. The underwater life with varied fishes contained in a huge aquarium is a sight in itself. The Underwater Zoo is a fun thing for the youngster where they can witness underwater life upclose. Should visit at least once.

A highlight!. We really enjoyed our visit to the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. Plenty of underwater creatures to look at and was quite bizzare visiting an aquarium in the middle of a shopping mall! The only downside was that we paid for the ticket that included the glass bottom boat tour - this wasnt worth the extra cost at all.

Super duper !!!. Situated inside the Dubai Mall. Its huge. First the sight of such a large aquarium inside a mall leaves you in joy. The place is neatly and they have options for tourist to take a tour inside the aquarium and alternatively one can dive inside the aquarium with the help of professional divers. The fees are in the range of 115 Dhs to 275 Dhs.
expensive. nice enough but seen better. its not very big or interactive. child loved it though.

Awesome. A 3 in 1 experience. The Aquarium tunnel was wonderful, to be able to see so many speices up close. Then the glass bottom boat ride across the top of the aquarium. And finally the underwater Zoo which shows the amount of species that are in danger from man

Dive in the aquarium with the sharks!!. I decided standing outside the tank was ok but getting in with all the life would be better. You can actually dive in this aquarium with Al Boom diving. It costs about £120 which is a lot for one 40mins dive. I justified it by thinking of it as an experience like no other. You get all your equipment and a long briefing that scares you you a bit about what happens if the shark fancies your regulator. Don't exhale when a shark is overhead as it freaks them out! This is hard stuff to think about when floating with 16 Sharks in a glass bowl.Overall the experience was great, well organised. You do need to be a decent diver as there is not a lot of space and there are a lot of large fish, sharks, rays etc... You have to be able to control buoyancy as this is critical. It is crazy having loads of people looking at you as you float down into the aquarium which is around 12m deep.Well worth the money!
Best in Dubai. wow its truly amazing to see an under water aquarium and we saw lot of rare and coloured species
good selection , nice exhibits. enjoyable and informative place for both adults and kids . The facilty is huge and is extremely well maintained and organised .

Viewed from the Mall. Although we didn't actually go into the venue(exhausted from walking in the heat all day), we were able to view the aquarium through the vast glass wall from within the Mall, where we were able to witness divers feeding the various species of fish. Cost to enter this attraction started at about £13.
Scary and smelly. This was not very fun for me but I can see how people would enjoy this. You cannot see much and it is a boat sailing on top of the tank.

walk through underwater tank. very good and a lot of fish, children would be most interested especially as this was inside Dubai mall. The mall itself is very very large with a lot of shops of all types, lots of eating places and quite a few seats to rest on and lovely and cool

Good experience,. An attraction in the Dubai mall. The Dubai aquarium sports a gigantic tank which on one side is contained by tall clear glass; truly awe-inspiring. The underwater passage isn't very long; smaller than that in Underwater World SIngapore (UWS). Species diversity also seemed less than in UWS.
Good Aquarium. The lrgest plate of glass in the world. At one point you walk through a tunnel with the main tank above you. This was spoilt by lots of noisy children.

Cool. Whilst shopping in Dubai Mall, you come across the aquarium, which is full of all size and shapes of fish. It is a huge window of fish, which you can watch for free and take photos etc. It is worth paying the fee to walk through the tunnel through the middle of the aquarium if its your first visit where you can get a photo of yourselves with the aquarium as a backdrop. The underwater zoo was not so much underwater but had some interesting creatures in it which kids would enjoy looking at, although if like me you are not a lover of spiders I would suggest not to look at the spider crabs which are huge and the scariest creatures I have every seen. In fact after a shocking brief glimpse I refused to go near that particular tank again :)
Excellent display of amazing marine life.. Where else better to go to see a vast variety of marine life.

cool location- in the mall!. you get two passes (tunnel and "zoo") for 50aed, which is not a bad price. Skip the photos and gift shop and it's an affordable fun activity for an hour or so. Don't miss the giant crabs or silly penguins and go out to the glass viewing box and see the sharks swim below you. I normally skip the "creepy crawlies" upstairs, but if you have a little boy, I'm sure he will be fascinated.
Siply amazing!. The aquarium tonnel is amazing as well as the view from outside. Enjoy your food in forest garden nearby the Aquarium. The boating at the top and zoo are amazing.
A great variety of underwater and amphibians. its higly recomended for groups with children, they will have a great time for sure.
It has to be the wonder of the aquarium world!. Simply gigantic. Perhaps as tall as four stories with every concievable, beautiful marine life imaginable. A must see!

A new experience in aquariuns.. Huge glass structure, the largest I have ever seen.So big you can ride a glass bottom boat on the aquarium surface.Good collections of fish and sea and river fauna.Worth visiting.

85 AED to get 6 pieces of fishfood..... My son wanted to go thru the aquarium. We had seen the outside public area several times but had never really gone thru the interior walkway or the zoo part where the penguins and fish and insect displays were. i expected that this would be more of a learning experience but the zoo was poorly displayed and there were no guides to impart any information. We had to come back an hour after the zoo viewing to get the opportunity to "feed" the fish. Each of us were given six pellets to thrown over the side of the tank...not close at all to the fish. Well we can say we did it....

worth visiting this once. I was there in May'12... it is a well maintained aquarium and underwater experience... saw all the marine life that u wanna see, including the sharks, sting rays, penguins, piranhas, water rats, lion fishes, giant crabs etc... worth visiting...
Great Cage Shark Dive!. Great for a cage shark dive! You can wave at people down below in the shopping mall too! Use The Entertainer - Family Guide to save money on this!
Nice place to discover the fascinating water-world. Avoid Holiday time, you might not be able to enjoy it, however try to book your dive in the Aquarium to experience swimming with the Sharks.
Amazing. With every conceivable species of marine life, you can also swim in the aquarium

Save your money. Just spent 100 dhs ($30) to go through the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo. What a waste. Dubai has lots of "bad Disney" but this is worst I have seen. There is a small tunnel you can walk through and some tanks with fish. Poor penguins are in the back of a very dark area - you have to feel for these little critters. The "glass" bottom boat ride was a joke. The glass bottom was so scratched you couldn't see anything. And the "ride" was merely the boat being pulled along a rope by the "captain" in a very small pool. The best part is the free part. The large tank display you can see from the Mall. Don't spend your money on this one unless you have children under the age of 67 who have never seen a fish!.
Aquarium Dubai. A must see for all visitors , large and well worth the ticket price
Interesting. Expensive to go through the tunnel and see the zoo. It is just as interesting to stand in the Mall and watch the fish and save the money.
very interesting. It was one of the great aquarium and underwater zoo. The best one I think is placed in Istanbul

Place for kids. This is well maintained and value for money. The tunnel is very small and not equivalent to one in singapore, but still you can the enjoy the ambience. Kids would like this place than adults. It would not take much time to visit this place. It would take hardly 30 mins to finish.

Not bad. It was just all right... I had other aquarium experiences because of that I didn't like it very much... it was small one. U don't have to pay all that money, because you can see the same thing from the out side of the aquarium. But I should say that for a person who hasn't seen any other aquarium it's a nice experience. I loved the pinguins, because I haven't seen any before... And there were other kinds of animals in the underwater zoo for example reptiles
Nice day out.. Great place to entertain the kids on a day out to the mall. We visit regularly as my 3 year old loves it.

Amazing aquarium. Everything is the biggest, best, largest, widest or tallest in Dubai. The Aquarium is no different - in fact it sports a Guiness Book of World Records designation for the longest acrylic wall. It's a fascinating place with sharks, rays, tons of fish, etc... You can even pay to scuba dive in the aquarium. I would say visit it if you have a free few minutes there, especially w/children. The surrounding Dubai Mall is worth it as well.

amazing!!!. this is a place one should go and see to experience that it can have all of these creatures in such a small place. however, don't bother riding the glass bottom boat as not worth it at all.
Terrific!. The zoo was great and the aquarium is amazing. It is expensive but worth the money. Made a nice break from walking around the mall.

Great. For 50 dhs you can tour the aquarium & underwater zoo, there is also a glass bottom boat option that we didn't do. Some amazing underwater creatures that you can get close to - the sheer size of the aquarium is amazing. There was one REALLY annoying factor - the photographer that wants to take your photo in front of a backdrop of the aquarium - very tacky pictures. I've been here before and seen the pics so this time I said no thanks, and they refused to take no for an answer until I said a firmer NO. That stuff really annoys me - why would I want them to have a picture of me that I had no intention of buying. But that aside the rest was good - kids would love it in fact there were many there literally glued to the glass !
Great Experience. I just loved this experience as did my kids. I encourage everyone to visit.

Its a Nice Aquarium. I have been to some of the largest in the world, such as Atlanta's. While this one os not the same it still very nice with a huge selection of marine life. The kids will be in awe!
Fun for all. we all really enjoyed this visit though it seemed a bit pricey.
Lovely fish. The aquarium itself is OK but nothing particularly remarkable. The zoo is quite extensive with some excellent creatures - the spiny King crabs, amongst many others.
Great for a family. Spent 2 hours between the aquarium and the zoo. Took some amazing pictures too.
Must Visit. Its a musit visit to anyone who is travelling to dubai
Just do the Aquarium. I would not bother with the Underwater Zoo, really you can just stand the stare at the aquarium, which is really impressive.
Breathtaking. A must do if on holiday in Dubai. It will be a fun activity to do with the kids if your are a travelling family.

Aquarium. We viewed this from the outside only while walking through the Dubai Mall. It is very impressive and easy to find. Would reccommend it if you have never walked through a tunnel with fish swimming all around you.
Great to see once. Aquarium is worth a visit, not worth the price, even with the entertainer vochour.

A fish tale. Really enjoyed the visit, the best bit was waiting to go into the aquarium, stood outside the big tank when 2 divers appeared and were feeding the rays, stuffing food into their mouths, I thought they were cute and funny at the same time, (rays not divers) enjoyed the bottom glass boat and the tunnel into the aquarium and zoo. The zoo has some very interesting fish and I loved the Humbolt Penguins
Not Too Bad. We were expecting a longer tunnel, but as soon as you get in, you are already out. The zoo was more interesting though. But we definitely impressed by "The Lost Chamber" in Atlantis.

You have to see the Jelly fish !. I scuba dive so am quite used to getting up close to all sorts of creatures, but this was still great fun. So for anyone doesn't this is a fab way of getting that same experience. Another must do while in Dubai.
Bit expensive. Personally I would not have paid as much money had I known that you could see most of the thing form the mall area
Look at all those fish.. Another engineering marvel. Not what you expect to see in the middle of a shopping centre. Over the top like a lot of other stuff there.

Overpriced, but free of charge. Given the rather hefty admissions fee, it is ironic that most of what there is to see at the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo doesn’t cost anything. The massive viewing panel (according to their website, the “world’s largest acrylic panel”) is in the public area of the Dubai Mall, offering shoppers and unimpeded view of the main tank.By paying the admissions fee, you also get to walk through the 48-metre long aquarium tunnel eleven metres under the surface – which even in slow-motion takes less than five minutes. Then it is upstairs to the so-called “underwater zoo”, which, frankly, is a poor excuse for an interpretive centre and is plainly designed as a conduit to the aquarium shop.So rather save your money for some of the mall’s famous sales (GAP, which is next door to the aquarium, had a 60% off sale when we visited Dubai).
A must. A wonderful place for adults and kids alike, masses of fish to watch, but best to see the divers cleaning the stones at the bottom, I would happily volunteer to do that all day !!!
lovely. it was a lovely aquarium, very big and really nice to see the marine life.would defo recommend
Great fun. Well worth the trip. An excellent selection of sea animals and right in the Emirates mall. There is also the Ski dubai facilities near by

What a STUNNING aquarium - great to entertain the kids while mommy shops or when too hot outside. You think you saw it all while passing by shopping ? NO, do GET IN, there is A LOT MORE TO SEE1. when you go IN THE TUNNEL, there is a stunning close encounter where all the sharks gather..; brrrrrr2. Upstairs, the little BOAT RIDE is fun, not much to it though, but the kids liked it nonetheless3. the UNDERWATER ZOO is not bad considering, it s an add-on to the Mall : they have a lor of aquariums with fish, small gators, penguins, crabs, jellyfish, the usual Nemo enacting aquarium, etc.4. in addition, they have some insects / reptile area where YOU CAN HAVE PICTURE TAKEN WITH A SNAKE, brrrrBehold, it is 25 USD per head for aquarium + boat + zooIf I were to compare with a similar size and setting (iei an aquarium set in a city center, pretty muc "indoors" - Paris, Cineaqua) this was much much much betterNB you can also dive in the Aquarium.. haven't tried it
A fishy tale.. Brilliant. Fish of all shapes, sizes and colours. You feel as if you are in the water with them. Definitely up close and personal. A must do!

Very Cool, but not what I expected.. It is amazing that they built the aquarium inside the mall. Beautiful exhibit, but its hard to compare where you've visited some real, amazing aquariums like the Long Beach Aquarium or the Monterey Bay Aquarium. However, it is defintely worth seeing if you happen to be at the mall.
Bettetr to Vist from outside. U do not lost so many sea creatures to see while u vist it even from outside and save some money in this way
Amazing Experience. Diving with sharks and feeding them is simply amazing !!!!!!!!
The aquarium. Was a fantastic experience. I loved it. I was thrilled to see the otters and the beavers and the boat ride was an exciting experience too.
Impressive. i liked this very much. Visited twice. i was intrigued with the numerous species of marine life. it felt like one was living underwater. Recommend a visit there.

dubai at its best. If your at a mall the size of dubai mall us males need something else to do, the aquarium helps you relax and take you mind away from the shopping , what a good idea great for the kids as well

Wonderful. A nice selection of fish, from Sharks to String rays
You can just stand there and enjoy the soothing effect of the fish swiming . The tan is HUGE of of the biggest in the world. Located in Mall of Dubai. Those with PADI certification can dive with the fish

I loved the pinguins !. Even if it is a breathtaking aquarium, i loved the pinguins !
Fish are wonderfully selected and the glass wall is breathtaking, the glass boat was rather average but it was fun

great place to visit in short time. great place to visit. the tunnel and underwater zoo is very good. Space is a little bit issue inside the zoo. But this is because of the people who visit. ITs almost crowded all the time.
fascinating!!!. we visited it when first opened and was fun. My kids were amazed by the number of species there. I had an great time learning about some creatures i never seen before.
Simply stunning. Amazing experience. Abit pricey but something to do when in Dubai
Great value. So much to see and do. Our 17 yr old and 21 year old boys loved it!

Nice fo kids & parents !. The aquarium is very large. From the outside (in the mall, i.e free), you can already see many fishes, a few sharks.. Paying the entry fee, you pass in a tunel, spending time extremely close to sharks, taking nice picture of your family wth them. Without diving suits, with waranted luck, you see so many variety of fishes ! The museum in the first floor is far less impressive. Even if this is funny to see pinguins, very large crabs, etc...

Diving in the Aquarium = Amazing.. I booked a dive in the Dubai Mall Aquarium just before leaving Dubai (I had not realised it was possible to dive there but Al Boom Dive Centre were very accommodating and found a slot for me). It was hands down one of the best experiences of my life.I was given a quick refresher course as I hadn't done a dive for a couple of years, and a detailed briefing on considerations for the wildlife, shark conservation, and how to behave in the aquarium. The dive was unbelievable, and I was introduced to hundreds of rays (cownose, eagle, stingray, guitarfish) sharks (zebra, wobbegong, grey reef, sand tiger) and fish. An absolute MUST for divers who want to get up close and personal to marine wildlife whilst in Dubai.
worth a visit with kids. Kids loved it much bigger than Uk sealife centers, huge tank worth a visit
Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo. good only for toddlers. Adults dont waste your time and money!

Fish to admire, endlessly. Lots of people have fascination with fish and aquarium... as we can see this at some hotels, restaurant they use our love to admire peacefully swimming fish. Should you be one of those people, Dubai Mall Aquarium will not disappoint you... I always stop there and look for a while, oh, only half an hour or so... before I manage to drag myself away. Huge fish, circling with small ones, large sting rays, floating about, looking at you with huge eyes. The best is when the divers feed them... there will be a frenzy and rush of various colonies trying to get their fill. It spans two large stories, so one can see from the second floor as well and there is a tunnel (for pay) one can go through to be circled by the aquarium. Great fun for all... don't miss it. Buy a juice or ice cream treat and lose yourself in the moment...lots to see.

Great mall and informative displays. The aquarium has some exotic water creatures on display. It is very informative for children. They also have scuba diving every afternoon. So if you are into it you can try that as well. They also do scuba classes and do certifications as well I believe. I didn't have the time to try that out.

Amazing Aquarium. Although the aquarium experience is really quite short, when you walk by the side and look closely you will realise the perspex tank is over a foot thick when you see the faint joint lines. It's really an "a-ha" moment. The walk through the tunnel is also amazing when you see the sharks and stingrays floating by. The Underwater Zoo is also quite something else even though its not really a big zoo, its still a zoo in a shopping centre. How cool is that? :) I really liked the Piranhas tank as well as the archer fish that could shoot water to get their food.

Aquarium in dubai mall. There werent many types of fish. The underwater world was dark , and the lighting was not good. Many aquariums have better lights that you enjoy and love the color of the fishes. This aquarium is not the same.

Simply amazing. If you love aquariums, then this is definetly the place to visit - situated at the Dubai Mall (the worlds biggest mall). Also visit the musical fountains and Burj Khalifa situated in the same place. Musical fountains only opens at 6:00pm.
Good for Kids. Don't take the glass bottom boat, such a dissapointment.

Excellent...... An aquarium and Zoo in a SHopping mall, yeah right... but it really is there and if you go to Dubai you must go here. Get up close and personal with an array of sharks, pirannha and creepy crawliees. Bring your cameras as you'll need them.

Sharky swimming ahead!. We could actually see the outer surface of the aquarium from 1-3 floors in Dubai Mall. It’s opened view to visitors in Dubai Mall. If you feel like entering, you could buy tickets, to see more of the aquarium, if not, you could still enjoy part of the view. No harm. When we entered the aquarium, I was deeply impressed by the big sharkies swimming ahead; colorful and variety type of fishes swimming around. It’s such a huge and stunning aquarium! It’s nice to visit the Aquarium combine with the Dubai Mall/ Burj Khalifa within the same day :) Since they're just nearby!
Mesmorising. You get fantastic views of the Aquarium from outside so there's really no need to waste money to go inside!

Interesting zoo. I bought the Diamond package for 85 dirhams and I'd say it was worth it. I was surprised to see penguins; that was pretty cool. Feeding the fish was not what I thought it would be. I thought we were going to feed the ones in the tanks but we fed the ones in the aquarium during the behind the scenes tour. It was fun watching them all swim in unison to grab the food, though.I would have liked to try the diving and snorkeling but did not have the time to do so.
Amazing. U can actually smell the ocean in that place! Spectacular sight inside a Mall! Educational too. The children kept asking about the fish there.
Beautiful. I have been to many aquariums around the World, but this one is well done. Stunning tunnel and great variety of waterlife. There is also a small 'zoo' with snakes, geckos, amphibians etc.

Great Experience for first timers. Its one of the many showpieces inside Dubai Mall. Entrance is on the ground level with different pricing starting at 50 dh. Strange part if the charging of children above 3 years. As others have pointed out you can observe many of the sharks and rays from the outside without paying. However, that's only one side of aquarium wall and you cant really take good close up shots due to reflections of the glass and the queue which forms right in front of it.We had reserved half a day for Dubai Mall and believe me it ran out very fast. The tunnel, though a bit small was a unrushed experience. Saw some feeding and divers who stop around for pictures. Lots of lazy sharks just lying around stationary. If you are a shark fan, there is good variety to be spotted.The underwater zoo is also worth a walk, saw some foot-long crabs, baby crocs and penguins providing value to the tour.

Nice adventure!. This was my second time visiting the Dubai Aquarium and I must say that I enjoyed as much as the first time, my favorite part is the underwater tunnel where you can see huge sharks and other species, this is a must even if you are not travelling with kids, everyone will enjoy the experience.
rip off!!. dont go inside. u get better views outside for free!!
Dubai Aquarium and underwater Zoo are fantastic!. We are really enjoyed the aquarium and underwater zoo a little bit costly but it is worth. You can have a family photos for remembrance.

Fantastic View. I guess, this is the largest indoor acquarium in the world and it really means it. There are sand tiger sharks lurking under the shade, reef sharks and a lot of other species from the marine world. Its really worth the effort to visit this place and also there is a large display for the public to watch free of cost.

Good value. The top price ticket of 100 Dir makes this excellent value for money. This ticket gives you a ride in a glass bottom boat, tour of the water zoo and a walk through the tunnel. The tunnel is small compared to others around the world, however as part of the total package it's great value. I would highly recommend this activity for families. Even as a slightly interested adult filling in some time I spent 1 1/2 hours looking through this zoo.
Many Species. If you come from an inland country, then you must visit this zoo..So many different species to see..some I never thought existed!!
Nice!. Worthwhile your money. Ask for the 50 DH tour. The rest is nothing special. Don't go to the Atlantis aquarium. Not worthwhile your money.

The kids will love it. Amazing Aquarium with hundreds of different fish. The sharks normally hide in the dark quiet places, so a walk through the tunnel is a must if you want to see the sharks. If you time your visit well, you can get to see the divers feeding the fish which is quite a treat to watch.

Pretty cool. The aquarium is great. The fish are cool and we saw a scuba diver in there playing with there while we were there. You pay extra to go through the tunnel of the aquarium, but you don't really get to see any more than you do from standing out in the mall and seeing the main walls of the aquarium for no cost! The tunnel actually distorts everything, as well, making it not as good as watching from the outside!The Zoo is upstairs from the aquarium and there are a variety of reptiles, fish, penguins and otters. One of the beavers looked like it was almost dead, just floating on the surface of the water, which was a bit sad. The fish tanks were cool, lots to see. Both ice peguins and the water ones. As always a bit sad seeing the animals in captivity but everything seemed really clean and the aminals seemed healthy for the most part which was good.
underwater zoo sucks.... aquarium is good to look at for free, if you wanna go, you can only buy the tunnel part, but don't include the zoo in your package,,,, totally doesn't worth it T_T

Don't miss it, especially if traveling with young kids. The Dubai Aquarium is definitely a must-see, and it is certainly hard to miss from inside the Dubai Mall. My toddler was spellbound by the enormous tank and the rays and sharks swimming over his head in the tunnel. The underwater zoo had a huge variety of creatures to see, including king crabs and penguins. Highly recommended!

If you have never been in an aquarium go ahead. One of the things I am interested in is zoos and aquariums. I have been in many of them around the world ( Vancouver aquatium, Sea world in Florida and California ) an this is just a huge fish tank. I really don't know how they can call it an aquarium. I can't deny that for a mall it is big, but it isn't a aquarium. Price is high and the walk through the tank is not a big deal. There is no good information for what they display, but I can say that the Alaska crab display is good, penguins stink and for the reptile display, pet shops have a better selection. Save your money and just look outside. If you have childrens it is ok, they don't look for extended information but only fun.
Had a great fun watching the dolphins dancing. Its a must for everyone who is visiting Dubai. Kids just love it.All in all a great show by the dolphins as well as the seals.

A Little Piece of Underwater Heaven. The ticket price is slightly steep. It has a very nice variety of aquatic life. I enjoyed the visit. Best to visit during working hours if you are on leave. Tends to get over full on weekends and that can make it rather stressful especially when you want to take your time to enjoy the dainty little sea horses and other sea creatures.

Interesting Aquarium to visit for 2-3 hrs & great value!. With my second holiday in Dubai for 7 days & travelling solo I decided to visit the Aquarium on the 7th Feb/12, considering I didn't have the time during my 1st visit in 2010 I was more determined to make the time. The admission fee [one adult] is only AED 100.00 [approx $27.00 Australian Dollars] & extremely good value. Like may tourist attractions it all depends on your budget & time-frame, for instance if you take your time & read all the information provided in the aquarium you could spend between 2-3 hrs at your leisure. After viewing inside the aquarium your admission ticket will allow you a small free, or discounted gift, the staff at the aquarium will direct you to the gift shop with only a couple of min's to walk. Take advantage of the Dubai Metro system & again very cheap way of traveling around the city for only AED 16.00 for the entire day...... happy snaps! & enjoy the experience!

Dont miss this one. Inside a mall but thats an understatement. The experience is as if you are looking from below the sea to creatures swimming above you. Clearly modeled on the SIngapore UNderwater world but retaining its own charm. Its all Dirhams everywhere and sometimes that can be an annoyance at this 'brisk efficiency' but as an attraction one shouldnt miss it at all.
Worth a visit if you are in the area.. Worth a visit if you are going to see the fountain or Burj Khalifa, most impressive from outside in the mall.

Excellent, specially for younger kids. This was one of the top highlights of our visit, as my 2 year old boy went crazy about this place. It was a well worth 2 hours which we did again a second time. The best time to go there is maybe around 3PM as it is crowded the least.
Watch it from the mall. I was expecting much more, you will see the same things from outside the aquarium, do not take the ticket.
Great fun. This is something that both adults and children can do with enjoyment.

sooo interesting. we spent great time with our daughter in the Underwater Zoo, Aquarium & also the nearby restaurant which was decorated in the jungle style, so was consistent with the "animals" topic :) the kids will definitely enjoy
amazing. Loved all the different creatures and fish! The divers come and feed the fish at regular intervals and you can even go behind the scenes on the cheapest ticket.
Good close up of Sharks. Kids loved it. glass bottom boat was good for kids and the pengins were cute.
Fantaastic. Highly recommend and very resonable. My boys 1, 5 and 6 all loved it.
Every Thursday. We went every Thursday to the aquarium after daddy finished work, the kids love the underwater zoo
Modernistic Visit. Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo are quite an eye to watch. Its Vivacious, Heart Throbbing.

Great aquarium but smaller than expected. As with most things in Dubai, this was done really well. The aquarium itself is really large and the tunnel through gives you a great view of the various species (they have a lot) that they have. This make it great for children and although we enjoyed it would we have liked the experience to last a little longer.

Kids loved it! And so did we!. What a great experience. The aquarium itself is magnificient, the size and magnitude of it are unbelievable. The underwater zoo package is reasonably priced and includes walking through the underwater tunnel and enjoying the zoo at the end. They have different packages to choose from so you may also wish to feed fish, go on a glass bottom boat ride, or dive with the fish. It's very well done and enjoyable. Definite tourist must!
Fun in a mall. average, yet small aquarium. The tunnel is fun watching all the sharks overhead. Only go if you happen to be in the mall.
Seen one seen them all. Nothing special , there are lots better but it does attract the crowds especially in a shopping centre !
It is nice for an aquarium in a mall. I did enjoy it! the actual aquarium is small but what can you imagine with aquarium in a mall..I have been several times.

Don't know if its worth to buy a ticket with little ones. The aquarium itself is amazing and nothing like you would have likely seen before. It is HUGE (as is the mall it is in).Definitely check it out when you are at the mall, however I do not know (or think) the prices are worth it for ticketsThis is a general gripe I have of Dubai in general, if you wish to do the touristy things, be prepared to empty your pocketbook... a lot.
Stunning Aquarium. The zoo and the aquarium are positioned in the Dubai Mall, everything under one rooof. The aqarium is superb. You can watch from outside or pay a small amount to walk thru it.

Excellent. Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo is the best place to visit in Dubai Mall and also it's a nice place for shopping and there is Kidzania a fun place to learn and earn like what the child wants to be when he grows up there is a lot of things to learn for the kids

Easy access additional needs visitors!!. Well worth a visit - aquarium amazing, the zoo although not all the big has some interesting reptiles and animals. Last visit Feb 2011. Wheelchairs have no problem getting around.

Very average aquarium, a lot of hype. We went to Dubai aquarium with my two kids 9 and 7. We were blown away with the largest ever acrylic panel that the public can see from the mall side. In fact, it was such a let down after we bought the tickets. We bought the diamond package, check their website for features. Here's how it went:- after purchase of tickets (85 AED each) follow the cordon around the huge tank. You are approx 2 metres closer than the rest of the public watching. No advantage there.- Then you go into a very SHORT tunnel. Make the most of this tunnel, it is by far the best feature of the entire journey. These tunnels do exist in other far east countries, so if you've seen one before, it's pretty much the same. Still, it is amazing watching the sharks, rays and other fish float over you. - Once out of the tunnel, you have to travel 2 floors up using the escalator to enter the aquarium.- The aquarium is well stocked but the tanks look far too small to house the number of fish and animals. Most of the tanks contain small fish with the exception of the catfish. This bit takes around 30 minutes if you read as you go along.- Upstairs is a creepy crawly place, fairly sparse but interesting for lizard lovers, they have a few interesting species.That's it!- We then fed the fish, a bit of a rip off as you simply throw in a few bits of fish food into the tank far below. Some fish can be bothered to eat. This is followed by a 10 minute tour of the behind the scenes. This was quite interesting as we have never seen how an aquarium works, the guide was informative and friendly. Kids enjoyed this, though little kids wouldn't understand.After this short trip (we had planned 2/3 hours for this!) we decided we may as well go for the glass bottom boat ride. We paid 25 AED EXTRA each for this. There is perfect review of this by another senior contributor 'fipty801'. This review is spot on!- Get into boat with broken life jacket- Float along the top of the tank, try and see through the very scratched glass- Guide provides NO INFORMATION at all- The lights above make it hard to see through the glass and yes you have to avoid looking at each others feet. A HUGE disappointment, don't do it!!! (Unless you have money to burn and time to spend)This attraction is for young kids (except the tour) and for people who have not been to many aquariums. It's expensive and overhyped.
WOW. WOW, is the word to describe the beauty of Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo...Definitely A-Not-To-Be-Missed experience
Mind blowing. If you have kids up to the age of 40 they will all love it..... sharks to super cool penguins. A place to see and enjoy

it was good.... for the rest of the family but since i hate fishes the only things i loved were the tunnel and the cute penguins. the underwater zoo had a several different types of fishes and all in all the decoration and design were nice and i'm sure anyone who's not disgust of looking at fish will like this experience. upstairs on the last floor they have a few reptiles and unfortunately and shocking for me even some insects.
a view to behold!. how on earth did they fit this aquarium in a shopping center i will never know! amazing!

amazing!. The Dubai Aquarium is just fantastic. Don't be misled by the view's from the "outside" (mall) going through the tunnel and seeing the "inside" of the aquarium is a completely different thing.

Always a treat. The Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo is always a pleasure to visit.My family and I visit at least 6 times a year.Its just so calming yet exciting to walk through the tunnel. I do deep scuba diving and therefore feel comfortable saying this is almost the next best thing for those who cannot dive.Then after the walk through the tunnel you experience the Underwater Zoo that is magnificent. One could not imagine seeing Emperor Penguins and other rare creatures in Dubai Mall, let alone a mall!I highly recommend visiting and if you do dive, then sign up for a dive into the aquarium itself. I'll definitely do that when my little ones are 3 or 4 years old.
Don't bother. The price is extortionate and most of the aquarium can be seen from the shopping mall for free.
Nice. It is so calming to watch the fish pity the lights of the sweet shop reflect onto it though

Novelty Value Only - For Young Kids. As with most things in Dubai, it is the biggest, most expensive, and every other "one up" superlative you could through at it. In reality it's an indoor 11000 000 litre sea water tank, that is well and truly overstocked with a huge variety of fish, and an "underwater zoo" (a few fish tanks).The tunnel is interesting and it's hard to get sick of looking at the underbelly of a reef shark or ginat sting ray as they cruise around the tank.The "Underwater Zoo" part is more like a pet shop, with oversized fish in small tanks, but it is fairly well done. There's even a "creepy crawly" exhibit with spiders and other "nasties" as well.The "glass bottom boat ride" went something like this:- Get harassed by hawkers wanting to take your photo (seems to be the latest craze in Dubai) for viewing and purchase later.- Get given a (broken) life jacket to wear.- Sit in glass bottom boat and tour guide begins to explain about the aquarium: "Its 11 000 000 litres of sea water.....", and that's ALL the info you get.- stare down through everybody elses' feet for 10 minutes.- disembark the glass bottom boat and get channeled into the gift shop on your way out.Really, your kids, aged 13 and under will love the tunnel, and underwater zoo. Give the glass bottomed boat a miss.You can also snorkel, dive and do a "behind the scenes" tour.

How To Relax and Shop at the Same Time.... This I cannot resist! How many times have I opted to go shopping in Dubai Mall rather than anywhere else? Hundreds... And all because of the fish! They never cease to amaze me; such a wonderful and fascinating collection of sharks,rays and unusual fish. I stand and watch them swimming slowly by. It's so relaxing...just as well there are no seats provided or I'd be there until closing time!

good Aquarium. very good but not a patch on Atlantis the lost legend, bought the silver package (I think) it was the one with the glass bottom boat ride over the top of aquarium which was very good (short but sweet) Quite alot to see but I just thought that it would be better than it was. Didnt realise that people get to see alot outside of the place in the mall without having to pay, still good value as used a 2 for 1 voucher
The kids love it. My kid loves it, be careful of the upstairs zoo as some creatures are breading and seem to be popping out of the glass edges, CRAWLY THINGS!!!!
Stunning. This was a fascinating experience. To walk through a tunnel with a variety of fish and sharks floating over your head was amazing

wow. wow so may fish/sharks unreal! we bought a ticket to go through the tunnel which let us take amazing pics of sleeping sharks and manterray and also included entry to underwater zoo which took us on a glass bottom boat tour of the top/mouth of the aquarium and gave us an insight to how staff dive into tank to clean it and also how the feed sharks by using a cage. Because we bought 2 tickets (me and my new husband) we were give a gift voucher to reddem in the souvenir shop. great experience!
Aquarium In Dubai mall. This was a small aquarium..Sharks were all around you but you only walked through the tunnel once..Not really worth the money..
What a marvel. Just being at the mall is quite an experience but then having this aquarium also makes it a must see place to go.
Exceptional value for money. For the price you pay you and your children can view a lot and interact with the animals/fish/mammals. Kids love it.
Amazing. Was a real experience being so close to the sharks and all the different varieties of fish.

Unexpected sight.... The aquarium is nestled in the middle of the Dubai Mall. It has an enormous viewing section that you can take photos in front of if you do not want to pay the hefty price of going on the tour. There is also a viewing section upstairs where you can stand right next to the aquarium windows. The tour includes a walk through the tunnel where all the sea life is surrounding you and it is spectacular. You will also go on boat ride. If you pay extra, you can dive in the huge tank but you must be certified. Along with your ticket, you can enter the zoo and see the penguins :) You will also get a voucher to use in the gift shop on your way out.It is definitely worth a visit. We go to this mall each visit to Dubai and we always stop by the aquarium. The kids never get tired of it!

Quality but crowded.. A professional set up with some scientific bits (not just for entertainment). The tour was short and a bit pointless. Much better to guide yourself around. Our highlights were the scary giant crabs near the end and the sting ray the size of a bedsheet which attached itself to a diver's head.
Okay. Big tank, lots of fishes but you can see most of it for free. WHen you pay to go in, there isn't too much more too see
Amazing. An aquarium experience taken to another dimension.stunning! All these fishes, sharks all in a very colourfull and real feel. Kids loved it.

MUST see!! Penguins lovers delight!. We truly enjoyed both the aquarium and zoo. Lots of colourful fish, stingrays, king crab, PENGUINS and more. Truly a great attraction and lots of different, reasonable ticket packages. Very cool place to see.
Expensive. Too small, it took me 5 minutes to finish my tour; staff requires more patients in guiding visitors
must see. very nice, with one ticket you can see the aquarium, visit the zoo (and see the penguins :) ) and can go on the boat to watch the aquarium from above!!

Nice surprise. I've walked by this many times and not realized how much it has in it. I was nicely surprised at the quality of displays and the way they are kept up. I recommend the behind the scenes tour. I would go again with friends visiting.
Beautiful. Beautiful location in the Mall. nice fishes....great adventure

ok.... very touristy. I can see how peo0ple on this side of the world would find this place amazing, but us, being from New England and used to the Boston Aquarium and things like that, it really was not that impressive. However, it is kind of cool that we can say that we where in an aquarium in the middle of the dessert, I mean, who does that? And to have sharks swiming just inches from our heads, in the middle of the dessert????? definitely a must- do activity.

Nice thing to do in an Expensive Mall. The mall is beautiful and the Aquarium is just stunning, it is just a walk under the huge tank you see but it is still worth it.
The underwater Zoo is nice too and you get some money to spend in the gift shop.

Beautiful aquarium in the middle of the best mall (Emirates). There are a few things that can be done (tourist) inside the aquarium, such as a small boat ride where you can feed the swarming fish below, walk through the tunnel with sharks swimming above you, or even take a dive with the sharks and fish in the aquarium (must be diver certified). Even if you do not wish to pay, you can vies a large majority of the specimins from standing a few yards away from the aquarium in the mall foyer.

A lovely aquarium. Fun walking in through the tunnel and seeing the fish swimming over your head. The giant glass wall from the mall side is astonishing. Feeding the fish from the boat was a nice experience. Fun on the whole, but not as great as we had expected.

Not that great if you have to Singapore or Hong Kong!. Well having seen the underwater zoos at Singapore and Hong Kong,it might be a bit boring. It is literally the same thing. Same sharks,penguins,giant crabs,etc.They have a glass bottom ride too which was boring.May be you can ignore but for first timers I would definitely recommend it.It is nice but not a wow thing.

Amazing - in a shopping mall. If you have been to Sea Life in the UK, this is a million times better and in a shopping mall. Not cheap but includes the underwater aquarium, glass bottomed boat which are normally total rubbish ( the sea life "run away" from the engine noise) but this is totally silent and is pulled along by the crew in silence, excellent. In addition there is a "zoo", penguins, reptiiles, other sea life etc. Another must see on any visit.

another dubai WOW effect. It is another one of those amazing surprises when you are walking around Dubai Mall and all of a sudden you turn to see a gigantic two storey high water tank packed with all sorts of fish and if you are lucky even a couple of scuba divers! The underwater walk is really short and I am not sure it is worth the ticket price, but the children surely liked the idea of catwalking with the fish and pretending to scratch the rays' bellies. As for the zoo, it is really tiny but the penguins are a must see!
Very comprehensive and professional help at hand. The size of the display was fantastic and there were many very knowledgeable staff at hand to offer additional information.
It a OK. But we have seen many places which is much better.

Not on my top list. Been here few times. i say that the experience is satisfactory, well, the tunnel is not that long, just a few meters. I've been to other aquariums before and this has the shortest length so far. if you have viewed the aqaurium from outside, then there's no point in going into the tunnel

Surprisingly small. I was short on time so took the 45 minute tour (which isn't advertised). It cost AED 50 and did not include the glass bottom boat ride or any diving. The exhibits are nicely displayed and well cared for. The best part is the big aquarium which you get to see for free from outside. Inside the underwater zoo the tour is actually quite short - I was surprised at how small it was and was glad I'd only paid AED 50 for 45 minutes. A half hour tour would have been long enough.
A great view of the fish. We went through the Mall and wow, all these fish were right in front of you,you can walk in the Mall and see plenty of fish.

Expensive.... Let down...was expecting more.....walk through a tunnel, see the all different types of fish,the sharks amazing so close,but only took me 15 mins to walk through,with time take the photos

One of the highlights of the trip. This Aquarium and Zoo is simply sensational. To walk through the tunnel with stingrays and sharks swimming above you is quite humbling. The tunnel may be short but the quality of what you can see is fantastic.We then went up to the Zoo which was amazing. The penguins were being fed and are literally swimming right in front of you on the other side of the glass.There are giant spider crabs walking around not to mention endless wonderful fish.This is the sort of stuff kids dream of.You can do all sorts of crazy things like dive with the fish and go on a glass bottomed boat and feed the fish. There is a very educational behind the scenes tour of how the Aquarium operates which is very interesting and educational.We really really loved it.
sea. give us a free picture instead of paying for it.. hehe but its so nice, wonderful place

Tough it will be bigger. It's a very nice aquarium but very small....in fact, it is just a tunel of about 20 feet long. That is it !!! The underwater zoo, is in fact some aquarium with fish....and some insects. In some case, you don't even know what you are looking to cause the sheet facts around the little aquarium or windows doesn't match. Be carreful, the price they annonce on the internet is 50 Dirhams per personn (around 15 $ US) but when you arrive they only offer you the big packages wich cost much more. I've had to ask for it and the girl told me that the cheapest package was the platinium one. I ask for the manager and then, they gave me the cheapest one wich is the visti of the aquarium and the zoo. Don't forget that this aquarium is inside Dubai mall so you can see the majority of it without paying. For the price, I will not return again....cause the aquarium is nice but the zoo is average.
World Class - Don't Miss. What can you say. Dubai Mall is my second home. I could stay there 24hrs a day. Speechless. A must visit
You and your kids will love it. Very nice, take a good camera to take amazing shots there :)
Loving Dubai. This is an excellent Aquarium and very reasonably priced. Well worth a visit.
a must see. you could see a lot of marine fishes and life including corals, sharks, stingray and many more!!!
Perfect, and good. one of the best thing to see in dubai don`t miss the wacth this Aquatium
Big. You can go in it and pay, but you can also enjoy it from the mall for free. Make sure to check out the fountain next door.
Wow. Well maintained and one of the best in the world...

Impressive, but worth to pay?. Yes, the tunnel is impressive, but not sure if worth the price ... the most of the attraction you can see from outside (without paying). I suggest travelling to Atlantis at the Palm and enter the caves and aquarium there.
Very Exciting. It's worth visiting this place. More modern, very educative and also much relaxing. I love the variety of very color ful under sea creatures. good to visit with your family
Empressive. It's a great experience, especially if you are travelling with kids.
good place for children. i can say this is very good place for children they enjoy lot
Its ok. You have seen one aquarium you have seen them all, I supose it is quite imressive for the kids, but you see just as much for free from the shopping mall side as you do paying to go in!

Worth a visit - don't forget the underwater zoo. A bit pricy for my 3 year old who paid full price. Make sure you go to both as they don't direct you from the aquarium to the zoo. You just walk out the zoo is on the upper level, so quite easy to miss.
Amazing. it's so worth paying to visit the underwater zoo - it's brilliant for kids and adults. Fabulous.

View from outside. We paid to go through the aquarium tunnel but to be quite honest you can see just as much for free from the mall outside. The cost also lets you go upstairs to see some more fish and reptiles so may be good for kids.

Beautifully made !. Beautifully made place inside the shopping mall. Wide variety of fishes, kids were shocked to see sooo many fishes! The maintenance surely takes a lot of money too but it is excellently maintained.......but the only problem is that the entrance fee is alot and i do not feel that anyone would pay so much money when everything is seen from the outside already. i feel that they should reduce the prices a bit

Better view of aquarium without a ticket. Typically of Dubai, this is one of the largest fish tanks, if not the largest, in the world. It is amazing that it is in the middle of a shopping mall (the world's largest, of course!). We thought you actually get a better view of the vast amount of fish species from the free view within the mall rather than paying to go through the short tunnel inside the aquarium. After you exit the tunnel, you need to go up 2 levels to the underwater zoo. This, we thought was very good, including a wide selection of aquatic life, including penguins. If you are tiring of shopping, this is a nice distraction.

Sucker for Fish. Okay, I love aquariums so I might not be the best to rate them. This was over priced but so is much of Dubai. The tour is very short and does not explain much. But if you love aquariums or have kids it is a fun and quick thing to do to brake up the day.
enormous. it is really bigger than i thought. the marine life is varied and definitely fun to watchnegatives - can't understand cordoning off the sides and asking for fee to take close ups

Spend hours watching the underwater world. There were different varieties of fish including the sharks, stingrays and many other species I failed to name. However I enjoyed the beauty of underwater for hours together. You would never like to move ahead from the sight. Find out the feeding times from the website which could be a little added entertainment. There is also an opportunity to dive into the water at an additional fee. Coming to the zoo, my marks will be 25% to the zoo which exhibits penguins, gel fish, seals etc. and 75% to the aquarium. Overall a 100% experience.
a big water tank with huge fishes inside .. amazing fish home in dubai aquarium, different kinds of fishes which you can rarely gets to see.

Lots of creatures...small space. Dubai Aquarium has expanded a little from the early days. A lot of it can be seen from Dubai Mall without aging any entrance fee. If you wish to pay, you get to go through a short tunnel over which sharks pass(too many for the space) after which you have to go upstairs to a completely different part to see more critters in tanks. This section now has overhead walkways. It is quite small and needs to be taken slowly. You exit into the souvenir shop. No surprises there. On the way in a photo can be taken and purchased later. This is not cheap. Al Boom Diving will arrange dives in the aquarium. Qualified divers pay less and they will offer some training for those who need it. Diving in the aquarium is very expensive(more than $250) so it is only for those with deep pockets and those who wish to be seen by the world passing by. I suspect the latter might out some people off. There is also cage diving so you can descend to those sharks.
great. very big screen, a lot of families around, every one is happy
You might as well watch for free from outside. Looks better than it is although the penguins are great.Avoid the restaurant-very poor and very expensive
nice time pass. this is situated in dubai mall and its a pretty fab little aquarium albeit slighltly pricey but it was great to leave wife with kids while you stroll through this

Really nice!. it is truly a excellent place with a good variety of species of fishes inside but who would spend so much money going inside when you can see everything from outside? i guess they should do something about it

Impressive shows!!. The shows here were fantastic. I have never seen otters trained to do the things that they show here. I was extreamly impressed and so was my family.The giant water rats were also a favourite of ours. The staff seemed very friendly and posed for photos which was entertaining.With the ticket we purchased we also got a free gift at the gift shop which was nice as I got to take home something to remember the trip :)The fish feeding wasnt too exciting as we went at the end of the day so I think the fish had enough to eat so they were not really paying attention to us.
Incredible tunnel. What an experience to walk under a shark!! The place is small but the fish are amazing.
