a unique habitant. this amazing Aquarium is located in the Dubai mall, u can feel the hard work made to bring this Aquarium. i enjoyed watching the sharks along with other fishes.

Torture. Disgusted to see all these beautiful creatures crammed in such small spaces so that vanity of a human being can be entertained. During shark feed dive the sharks are not interested in food , they have been already force fed out of their natural instincts. We have Discovery channel to show all same creatures in their natural elements. And those who actually are interested in wild life will go to the creatures natural environment to be fascinated by them. Boo Dubai!

Built in a beautiful way but a bit expensive. Beautiful place for kids, amazing fishes and plenty of them too. My kids really liked it. Most of it visible from the outside so i dont think any one would pay so much money to go inside. But it is a bit expensive.
amazing. snorkel wth sharks and all those fishes - u have to try it :)))))
Good management. Very excellently managed place......beautiful animals .....a must go when in dubai:)

Too much hype. Best experience is from the outside.. We have been to similar attractions in Singapore, Hong Kong and the US, and this one is nice because is it located inside a huge shopping mall. However, the best experience is to look at the large aquarium from the shopping mall rather than pay to go in. Inside is ok but nothing special.
Not That Exciting Inside. I would advise friends against paying for this and instead would advise them to take their time looking at the large shark and ray tank that can be seen without paying.

Fun for everyone!. We loved the wide variety of sealife,there was somebody in the large tanks in diving gear who took the time to wave to each of my children and pose for photos which was a nice touch...the sealife was so colourful and some of the fish were huge. Would reccomend.

Good experience but overpriced. Was fantastic to see and we both enjoyed it but at 100 AED for the aquarium (which isnt very long), the zoo and a glass bottom boat ride we thought it was a little expensive. However don't regret going but would not return.
magic tunnel. laugh at sharks with no danger whatsoever, gr8 fun

The Dubai mall aquaruim.. The aquarium which is located in the Dubai mall is a good attraction that our son really enjoy.
Having the opportunity to see most of the see life life.
We only have to pay for me and my wife since entry is free for kid.And the price depend on which package you are going for.
the best. one of the best attraction of this amazing city is the aquarium in the Dubai mall. You will walk among big sharks, just 30 cm above your head. Just go and don't miss the scrabs
Boat Trip down under.. Enjoyed trip but suffice to say a one off visit is enough.

Marvellous!. What makes the Dubai Aquarium such a wonder is not that its a giant fish tank with a glass panel 51 meters long, containing 10 million litres of water... its the fact that its contained within a mall and visible over 3 levels of the mall! Visitors to the Dubai Mall are free to watch the amazing display of underwater creatures from the front of the aquarium, but there's a whole host of other aquarium experiences that you can purchase tickets for including fish feeding, a glass bottomed boat ride and even diving with the sharks. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the Dubai Aquarium is running a promotion with Visa, and holders of Platinum Visa cards are entitled to a 50% discount on entrance tickets. This meant that we only ended up paying a total of 50 dhirams (about USD15) for 2 people, and this gave us entry to the short but spectacular underwater tunnel through the aquarium and then on to the mini zoo on the upper floors. The underwater tunnel is highly recommended as this is where their fabulous sharks and rays are best viewed from. A completely magical and colourful adventure in the heart of the world's largest mall
Pretty Cool!. Seriously, who builds the biggest Aquarium in a shopping mall?? Oh yeah, of course the crazy guys who finance Dubai! Loved the penguins!

Free Viewing of Giant Aquarium. We opted not to pay the price for admission, content to circumnavigate the giant aquarium (over 150 feet in length and @ 60' in height) on all floors of the mall for a "free" experience. No doubt there is more to see with a paid admission, but it's hard to believe that there is anything more impressive than the sheer volume/scale of this single aquarium.

Very Impressive Attraction. The Dubai Aquarium is literally the first thing that you see when you walk in the front door of the Dubai Mall. The pure size of the mylar holding back the water is impressive even before you consider the fish, rays, and sharks swimming just behind it. Although you can see most of the aquarium from outside, the walk through the tunnel was equally impressive and allowed for some up close time with some very large sea creatures! The glass-bottom boat ride was not nearly as impressive as the rest of the aquarium and I would recommend skipping it. All in all, the Aquarium was well worth the time spent there!

Both Kids and adults, your all love this. Yes it's a big fish tank, but it's quite amazing looking at the beast of the sea from a mall. Full of sharks, sting Reyes and other fish that I don't actually know the names of, it's impressive. And you can dive in as well for all you adventures out there!
dubai. marvellous experience outstanding sight lots of photo shots
Incredible!. 50 million litres of water in a Mall - only in Dubai! Unbelievable structure, amazing fish, sharks & Rays - only disappointment was glass bottomed boat - dont bother!

Underwater zoo is interesting, but don't pay to go through the aquarium tunnel. It's not really worth going through the aquarium tunnel - what you see on the outside is more than enough if not better. The underwater zoo might be interesting to people with children and to see all the different kinds of underwater creatures. Overall you leave feeling a bit let down. Wouldn't really recommend the experience - there are much better things to spend your money on in Dubai.
Incredible!. I wasn't quite prepared for the size of the aquarium and the variety (and sizes!) of the fish!

you have to see it. i loved aquarium walk through. you will stand right to sharks, i didn't enjoy the zoo that much except the Penguin. i loved to try the glass boat but it's not allowed for children ( our boy only 3 months) i will recommend it for everyoneprice for entrance is 85 Dh and if you will go for the package that include the glass boat it will be 100 DH. they also have a package for 75 as i remember.

Most cool. Quite spectacular, really. I've seen it from the outside many times and the first time did make me think, "wow!" but that was it. After that, I certainly wouldn't say I was completely blasé about it... I did enjoy walking past it whenever I did and I'd even stop and look, but it became 'normal'. Today was the first day we went inside. And although it's only little inside (I always imagined a bit of a labyrinth!), it was quite breathtaking.
Enjoyable!. Thought the aquarium walk through was worth it, the zoo not so much. If you are already at the mall this is worth a look!

Awesome. Located in the Dubai Mall this is an impressive aquarium which also sets the record for having the worlds largest pane of glass!! Like everything else in Dubai this tries harder by having bigger/more/newer etc. but well worth a visit.

Interesting. It is a really fun experience. The underwater zoo has really exotic sea creatures that will truly amaze you, the upper floor of the zoo is however a little more disgusting with lizards and geckos and weird insects; some people find it fun but it was disgusting for me. The aquarium is amazing though; it is a tunnel inside the fish tank so you can see sharks and all types of fish swimming next to you which was really fun. I have been to aquariums before; that's why i was not fascinated with the zoo. So i would totally recommend you go to the aquarium especially that its ticket is half the price of the ticket for the zoo; the zoo ticket is inclusive of the zoo and the aquarium, but you can buy only the aquarium./

underwater shopping........... the only time i have been in a shopping mall with a shark swimming over my head......
this has to be one of the best things to see in Dubai, complete with glass bottom boat trip
Amazing. Buy the ticket for the complete attraction. The aquarium and underwater zoo are worth the time.
Great!. One of the longest indoor Aquariums in the World. A vast selection of sea life and well worth a visit when you are at Dubai Mall.

Not all that. Yes it's a big tank in the biggest mall in the world.
But don't pay to go in. You go through a tunnel to only see the same fish you see on the outside for free!

worth a visit. fish fish everywhere really well made this people here can create amazing things
our little one loved the penguins
BIG!!. This big aquarium and in middle of shopping mall is a must see... Big tanks and lots of interesting and beautiful fish. In the zoo I absolutely loved the penguins!
one of kind. always you will find you self floating with fish even if you are standing in front of it. trip is short but I think they offer diving experience

Nice aquarium inside Dubai Mall. Entrance of the aquarium is from inside the Dubai Mall. The aquarium is nothing extraordinary but it is big. Some people just click pictures from the outside and that is good enough. The underwater zoo is interesting. Nothing that you would really miss, if you miss visiting the aquarium. Good for kids though.
interesting. scientific and curious. the guides were welcoming us and explaining in detailed manner
... It was fun and interesting. Most of the staff really knew what they were talking about.
fantastic!!!. its just fantstic!!! i have been twice with my kidz and they loved it, as well as the price is right!!

Bit of a disappointment but still had fun!. I bought the tickets where you can feed the fish. I was thinking this was more like they do in the states and it was just throwing chunks of food down the fish below in the tanks. Don't waste your money on this one. Go for the glass bottom boat ride instead!Walking through the walkway/tunnel was awesome to be that close to sharks, see their teeth in all their glory, and only a couple of feet above your head...awesomeI loved seeing all the fish but again I was equating it to say the Baltimore Aquariam, US, and in that regard it wasn't all that impressive size wise. Definitely a nice place to visit, the penguins were cute, I found NIMO, and got some great pics of the turtles and other residents.

~The Kids Enjoyed It!!. ~Our kids ages 6,8 and 13 enjoyed The Aquarium & Zoo. The Underwater Zoo is upstairs, The Aquarium downstairs. The facilities are not that big. Worth a visit if you have kiddies with you. Located across from the Candylicious Candy Store

Nice for kids. Our daughter enjoyed the visit. She is still under two years old so she got in for free. Hubby and I used the Dubai Entertainer voucher so we got one free ticket...great deal! The aquariums got so many varieties of marine life. The glass bottomed boat was not so fantastic though but still an experience. The Rainforest cafe right next t the aquarium is a good place to go afterwards...use your Entertainer voucher again to get a great deal on main menus.

Cool, specially for kids. If you visited the Dubai mall, you will definitly see the aquarium, at least from outside wich is seen not to forget. Although the entrance fee was a bit high (50 DHS), the main advantage is that yiou come closed to the fish and can have clear pics. The zoo was not special except for soe crabs and snails which were so big. There is a diving option for experts and amatuers, howver we visited it at night and it was closed at that time. I would highly recommend if you have 5-10 years childern.

Medium cool factor. I took advice of others to just look at what was visible from the mall's public area. Glad I did. It kept my attention for a solid 15-20 minutes and I was glad I saved the money on the "tour."

Huge indoor aquarium. Only in Dubai will u find this huge aquarium inside a mall. There is an option to pay for an entrance to walk through the aquarium, but save your money as you can simply walk down the other side and see just as much and take pictures. Don't waste your money on the entrance fee.
Cool that's in the mall. I wasn't totally impressed with the aquarium. Don't get me wrong it's cool but if you have been to the one in Okinawa it doesn't compare.
no need to see the tunnel. The big aquarium is already seen from within the mall, the tunnel they advertise is just the opposite side. No need to see it. The zoo upstairs is small.

big fat fishes. i really like that aquarium, it is full of big fat slow fishes like napoleons, groupers, sharks and more , they say 33 thousand fish life there , even scuba diver was fat, he,he,he. best distraction from shopping and spending $ in that hudge mall .
Cool to visit if you're in the mall. Inside the Mall of Dubai while you're at Burj Khalifa visiting tallest building you can check this out in the mall at the bottom.

You can't but love it. Really nice to experience it while shopping at Dubai Mallthe huge windows, the largest in the world, let you preview what's inside, and then, really a good experience for kids once you are insideamazing, we also saw a mini cooper car inside the acquarium...like a hidden trasureDo not forget paying a visit while at The Dubai Mall...your kids would love it!

OK to just pass by when in Dubai Mall. No need to plan a special trip to visit his place. It's located in Dubai Mall. If you happen to be there for shopping you can just pass by. There is ticket to pass through the tunnel, but not worth spending time & money. The sea creatures are better experienced in their natural habitat
Can't believe its inside a shopping Mall. Nice aquarium. Been to several elsewhere so nothing new but it is nice its in the middle of a shopping mall good distraction after walking around the mall

Overpriced. This is quite normal and overpriced for what you see. The aquarium on the outside where its for free is quite enough really..unless you have children and want to spend some time doing something, i wouldn't really pay to go in.
No words to express my feelings. i have no words to explain the great view and experience.Thanks Dubai
sharks. i cant belib=ve it that i saw a shark in a large sised aquarium and i thought that the shark would see us human and crack open the aquarium!

Probably worth it if you like fish or have children. We bought the 50 AED tickets which cover the aquarium and the underwater zoo. Much of the aquarium you can see for free from the Mall but with tickets you get to walk through the tunnel. It is a good experience. The ticket also covers the zoo on the second floor in the Mall. This is also worth a visit with more aquariums and penguins on display.Didn't feel cheated at 50 AED a ticket but would be very happy had I got a 2 for 1. Worth a visit.

Nice Experience. located inside dubai shopping mallprice is around 45 dhmsgood place and must visit for all ageslocated on the second floorhave a large aquarium with sting rays and diff species of fishes of different sizes shapes and colorsa must see when u visit dubai shopping mall

Nice change from shopping. A definate with children but still worth doing as an interlude from shopping for a couple. Being within the Dubai Mall it is very handy. We did the cheapest option and had an entertainer 2 for 1 vouchure. Probably spent about 3/4 to 1 hour in there.

Awesome!. I've been to many aquariums in my life and this one was my favorite. Yes, you can see a lot from the outside but you have to walk inside it. It is amazing when you see the little and big fish swim by. If you get the cheapest package, you get to do the walk and then the Underwater Zoo. The Underwater Zoo is amazing. You get to see all the different types of fish and insects while you walk through an area that makes you feel like you're in the rainforest. There is even a rope bridge that suspends you over all the different tanks. There is also penguins! I highly recommend to anyone who is visiting Dubai.
Impressed. We were impressed by the exhibits and the faces on the children around us were a picture
nice experince. a different place for a different experience but to visit one time
In a mall?!. Right...Actually in the biggest mall of the world! Can you imagine an acquarium in a mall? Yes, in Dubai!

Great for the family!. This is perfect attraction for children and the family. I've been several times and will go again with my nieces as there is a wide variety of animals, reptiles and insects that amaze their young and bright eyes!
This was fun!. I enjoyed walking through and seeing all the fish and other sea life there. It doesn't take long, tickets a bit pricey but I suppose they must feed the fish. Lots of sharks!
LOVED IT!!!!. So much to see it was just beautiful. All conveniently located within a mall! Just crazy! Def worth a visit.

A must with kids. The entry is 50 Dirham, you get access to the tunnel and the zoo. The aquarium is good enough without the tunnel but it's neat getting so close. The underwater zoo is a must for anyone, especially with kids.

What you see from the mall is just as good as walking through. If you don't have a coupon - buy one get one free just view the aquarium from the mall. When we walked though the tunnel to the other side my children asked where the entrance was. I got a good laugh and so did they when they realized the experience was over.

Nice Aquarium, Interesting Zoo. The aquarium size is impressive, the variety of fishes is great.We do prefer this aquarium rather than the more scenic Atlantis Lost Chamber, the Underwater Zoo is really designed for scientific education interest rather than purely touristic.This is really a successful achievement ... but its location in a shopping mall.

Worth the money - the aquarium is a must see.. Even if you dont visit the zoo - you can buy a ticket just for the aqaurium. well worth it. The sheer size of the tank and vast numbers of sharks and other sea life is what makes this aquarium far more spectular than the ones i have visited in australia and in Singapore.You can acutally see the tank jusy by visiting the mall. So really this can be done for no cost. Admire the views from the outside!
great to see different marine life,. with the 75 dirham (the cheapest) tour you get to see behind the scenes and a tour, also you get to feed the fish above the huge tanks, great experience
soo many types of fish !!. very interesting ... you see things you would never see anywhere else

Average. 85 AED p/p and pretty average. You buy your tickets on the ground floor and go through a tunnell. When you come out of the tunnell you get confused ...... you have to ask a guard who'll tell you to go through to the second floor and you have to present your ticket again... the fish feeding is a small tub of fishy foodstuff that you get to throw into a tank after a pep talk. The aquarium is o.k. - we've seen better ..... and at the end you get to walk through the overpriced shops and out again. Anything like this is keeps the kids occupied for an hour or so, but I would not say that I was impressed.

Great and a must visit place, if you are with kids. A good learning for kids and fun visit for adult. some of the goodies offered like 20 buks free gift included in ticket and torch offered for AED 10 are value addition to already augmented fun ride at Aquarium.Not liked is boat ride, where kids below3 years where not allowed and the boat ride was simply boring.

Fab attraction if you're in Dubai Mall. There is an entry fee to walk through the underwater tunnel and visit the zoo. I think it was roughly about £8 per adult. The tunnel was ok, you got to see all the fish and sharks swimming above your head etc. The best bit for me was the zoo, lots of fish, penguins etc, thee staff do feeding shows and tell you lots about them. Was really good and we spent a bit of time in there. If you're in Dubai Mall, it's worth going to see.
Dont pay for it. Its better just standing outside and looking at the free stuff, much better... did i mention free.

Good price to get see the underwater fsh. We visited the dubai mall and were impressed by the enormous aquarium. We took the aquarium and underwater zoo and payed 100 Dirham (20 Euro) each. We took our time and watched all the aquariums. On the second floor are all sorts of creepy insects, nice! Highlight for us were the quite new pinquins! They gave us a nice show, swimming and jumping in front of the audience.

full of fun trip to under water life. really if you want your children and all your family members to enjoy all together and live the experience of under water life with some feeling of fear and suspense do not miss this place to visit with your family i will make it one of my plane next time i will visit dubai.

Dubai Aquarium & underwater zoo, is the place to visit when in Dubai. The aquarium is located in Dubai Mall, it is a great place to visit when in Dubai. It is an attraction that can be visited with family, just a couple, or even if you are on a business trip. They have a wide variety of fish. My family and I we preferred the tunnel as we saw many sharks and ray fish. We have been to a number of aquarium before, but we were happy to see a different and interesting shark species. I would highly recommend this attraction to anyone visiting Dubai.
Really good experience. Very fun thing to do whilst you have some spare time, definitely need at LEAST an hour to do this justice so keep this in mind.
Record holder. Its the largest in the world with a tunnel,under water zoo and oh my god fish feeding. With lots of animals to see.

Good Aquarium in Dubai. Holds the largest indoor aquarium in the world. The underwater zoo is good fun for children and has exotic species like penguins. Bit expensive since its a private institution.

Best aquarium in Dubai. This aquarium is my favorite in Dubai (I.e. better than the Lost Chambers) because in addition to offering the opportunity to see many different types of aquatic life, it offers educational information about each of the exhibits. The staff is also very friendly and informative if you have further questions. If you are trying to decide between a visit to the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo or The Lost Chambers, definitely go with the former!

well worth the money and time. for 100 aed you first visit the aquarium with a view from underneath through a clear tunnel. from here you go up two floors to the underwater zoo and it is much bigger and complete than you are likely to guess. A full and wide collection hosted by informed staff willing to tell you more about every aspect of the fish and underwater life on show. The zoo could easily take an hour to view and finally you have a short glass bottom boat ride on top of the aquarium which lasts about 10 minutes. Included in your ticket price is a 20aed vouchr for use in the shop so for 80 aed a very enjoyable 2 hour visit. the aquarium offers diving inside the aquarium for an even closer experience at an additional 250 aed. Add to your list of must dos!

the largest glass I have ever seen!. it's amazing that it is free to look at, unless you want to go inside the zoo, and walk inside the tunnel...impressive! wish I could do a shark dive too! the zoo was great! the children were squealing with delight next to the seals as them swam along the glass! Penguins were stars!
sharks are amasing. worth visiting! many species of sea animals in one certain place.
oh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. the best i ever been crazy for kids and adults also dont forgert to the backstage of the apuarium is very interesting

Waste of time. We were totally disappointed. The outside free area of the aquarium has better views thqn the tunnel which is by short and pretty useless. The underwater zoo has a few nice species, but it's not a big aquarium. The penguins were a pleasure to watch but certainly not worth the money. I would rather do the one at Altlantis, the palm.

Must see. It is a must see experience even though most of pond you can see for free from Dubai mall....50 Dh combo ticket is most convenient and worth it....those who want more adventure and observation can buy more options like boating in glass boat and diving etc....amazing variety of fishes and water animals...Must see....
HAVE NOT SEEN AS MANY MARINE LIFE AS THIS. This is really a huge aquarium with all sorts of marine life. Almost similar to the Atlantis Aquaventure.
Beautiful. Really lovely trip though the glass bottom boat was a little disappointing

Great fun for all!. Walked around the corner in the mall and jaw dropped open. Huge tank! Beautiful fish and underwater zoo. Had glass bottom boat ride and fed the fish. There is also a very friendly penguin that will follow you along his tank!
come alle maldive. mi è sembrato per un attimo di essere alle Maldive; pienissimo di pesci, anche se un pò caruccio...

Very impressive. The main tank in the mall is very impressive, with a great range of species. I was surprised that the viewing experiences from different viewpoints (main viewing windows, underwater tunnel and snorkelling cage) were so different. A must for anyone interested in marine life - snorkelling vouchers are available from the Dubai entertainer but timeslots must be booked in advance. Our snorkelling guide, Randy, was absolutely brilliant. Although slightly cheaper, the snorkelling experience in Aquaventure at the Atlantis is shorter, generally features smaller fish but you can swim more freely around the tank.The Underwater Zoo's collection of animals is outstanding, with some really rare and fascinating creatures. Better signs would be appreciated, but it's a wonderful collection.
interetsing. Very interesting, but I expected to be larger. I have visited the aquarium in Bangkok, which is really huge and i was a little disappointed from the size of this one

Just be early to avoid the crowds!. The aquarium is great stuff, especially if you're lucky enough to get a voucher for a dive in it. It's just annoying that it's always packed with people all silly enough to flash-photograph....

Ask about options before you purchase tickets. What the posted sign doesn't tell you, is that you can order some of the attractions and skip others, thereby saving a lot of money. The underwater tunnel is fantastic, and if I were to return, I'd do only that---the rest of the aquarium is just average, so avoid the packages and pay for only what you really want to see.

Must see Duabi Aquarium and underwater zoo. Amazing experience...worth buying combo ticket worth 50 dirhams for both....boating and diving depends on individual preference...great variety of fishes and sea animals to look...great experience and learning specially for kids....must sea....

Disappointing. The size of the aquarium is certainly amazing particularly as it is in a shopping mall. The fish, sharks and sting rays are lovely to look at but you can see them without paying. If you pay, you can walk through the tunnel and see the fish on both sides and above you. There was a member of staff in the tunnel talking to visitors. We thought she was going to tell us about the sealife but instead she focused on the divers who were in the tank and their equipment which was not really of interest. The glass bottom boat was not worth the effort - we had to queue and put on life jackets but it was a real waste of time as all we did was look at the same sealife from the top of the tank. It is starting to look uncared for in this area with the fake rocks coming apart & rusting in places and looking quite tacky. I just hope they spend enough time looking after the fish.
nice for kids. take the boat ride it'ss a must; avoid buying the overpriced rediculous mugs or photos as they are meaningless and your photos can be better. dont miss the pinguins.

OK if you are sick of shopping. I have been to lots of wonderful aquariums so maybe I am spoilt, but this one is very ordinary. The tanks are quite fun but the glass bottomed boat was poor as was the fish feeding tour. I wouldn't do it again.
worth a visit. impressed by the size of this fish tank, will give the scuba experience a go next time I'm here. bit pricey but I'm on holiday.
Awesome Aquarium. My annual membership allows me to receive a discount on people I bring, and it is a great way to spend the afternoon in Dubai. The aquarium has cool piranha's.
Real good. To build such a structure inside a shopping mall was really a feat to see. Its worth spending those extra bucks to go inside than just stare at it from outside. Very well done.
it could be better. It was huge and lovely., but you expect more when you go inside . I liked the lost chamber in Atlanis Hotel more.

Amazing Things To See. We didn't do this first time around so we went this time. It is truly amazing what we saw inside. A great variety of fish to many to name and watching the divers feed the sting-ray and sharks was pretty cool. On level 2 they had otters, penguins, piranah and much more. We also saw snakes, lisards, insects all very interesting. The glass-bottom boat is a bit of fun.There is also a restaurant which looks like it's out of the jungle.
Browsing around the mall!. Worth a visit if you have nothing to do before the cinema or shopped out.Lots of great wildlife close up and well showcased.Feeding time was fun too.
giant aquarium. An Aquarium full of all the kinds of fish that i have never seen in my life.it impressed me by the different colours and sizes of fish
aquarium. Very nice for kids and adults!!! so many different fish.... just beautiful

Not what I expected, but interesting nonetheless. The underwater shark tunnel entrance was really cool, but the rest of the aquarium not so much. There were lots of open tanks all over the place with all types of sea life cohabitating. I got really bored after about five minutes, but grinned and beared it through. This place needs to find a way to keep adults entertained/interested so you will want to come back.

all this in a Mall?!. If you are not a shopper, dont despair...the Aquarium and inderwater zoo will keep you fascinated.I loved to just stand before the giant glass wall and watc the sealife from the outside.Did not go into the Aquarium, but for me there was enought to see from the different levels of the mall...wow...

Not bad at all !. The fish (in the tunnel and zoo) are changed in variety and number throughout the year. Took the membership for myself and kids and have enjoyed it a lot. Though have heard, its not much different (the tunnel) from Aquaria (in Malaysia) so if you have seen that, maybe can skip it. The penguins in the zoo are the major crowd pleasers as are the sharks. Its fun going on the roped bridges in the 'creepy crawlies' section.
Worse and smaller than expected. It is basically enough to see the aquarium for free from outside. The tunnel is nothing special and the underwater zoo absolutely a waste of time!

Feels like being in the water. The biggest aquarium in the world. That says it all. A tunnel goes through the aquarium, giving a cool feeling of actually being in the water. The aquarium in located in the Dubai Mall. Try to get there during a week day - not Thursday of Friday (weekend in Dubai) there will be too many people. You can have a picture-souvenir, a little tacky, but nice.
Good but not good enough. It is inside a mall, that's about it........and it holds somekind of Guiness world record for something........it has fishes inside.....and that's about it.

Free massive aquarium. Whilst shopping stop and take in the free to view moster fish tank has sharks and diving and snorkelling experiences, this all take place in a mall. the underwater zoo is good too but you pay for that

Very enjoyable!. I love the way so many attractions here in the U.A.E. are so clean and the staff are so very helpful. We have been to the Atlanta aquarium in Georgia, the Tennessee aquarium, and one in Atlantis in Nassau. This one is every bit as exciting, colorful, and enjoyable as any of those. I love the way they have utilized the space, added the moving sidewalk to make gazing overhead more comfortable and the feeling of awe one feels while moving from tank to tank.
Good, but expensive for what it was. Liked the zoo part more than the aquarium. The "boat ride" on top of the aquarium is not worthwhile, but the otters and other animals are lovely
wonderfull place. In dubai mall you will fin all, the aquarium is amazin along with the water zoo. I really recommend it

More hype than substance.... The high points: 1) Features in Guneiss Book of World Records for largest single sheet of acrylic panel- which is worth a view2) Kids will love it - even from the outsideThe Low:1) Too expensive2) Not many variety of aquatic life (especially when compared to the "Lost World" at Atlantis, the PalmVerdict: Your call, really.. If you are a wildlife/ aquatic life enthusiast, or love spending some time sitting and simply watching the fish fly around you... go for The Lost Chambers at Atlantis. If you have but a passing interest in the marine life, the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater zoo is the place for you (Located as it is in the Dubai Mall) !!!

A must see in DUbai mall. Whenever we go to Dubai mall we must spend sometime watching the biggest fish basin in the world. It's free to watch from the outside , however there's a reasonable fee to walk in the tunnel.

Disappointed but ok as a holiday experience. TunnelAs you walk around the area you can see the display of fish in tall and curvy tanks. You don’t need a ticket to see this. Though you can also see the tunnel from outside without a ticket, you need one to walk through it. The tunnel is nice but not something that makes you ‘wow’. Underwater zooThe underwater zoo is on the upper floor. There are few small tanks of display of different varieties of fish and other little sea creatures. Again this is nothing compared to some of the popular aquariums around the world. Within the underwater zoo area there is an elevated display area for few creepy creatures. There are few little and medium sized snakes on display here. Nothing spectacular to talk about. Glass bottom boat rideThis is also on the same floor as the underwater zoo. If you have ticket for this then go to the desk for the boat ride and get a time for your ride. Once you made the booking for the ride timeslot you can then walk around the underwater zoo area and get back to the boat ride nearer to the allocated time. The boat sails on top of this mega tank of water and through the thick glass panel at the bottom of the boat one can get a clear view of the fish and the settings below. If you have bought the tickets for the fish feeding then you must have been give the feed that you now throw onto the water to attract few medium sized fish. There were few good sized sharks and fish around but nothing big to make you really excited. The ride itself will be over in 5 minutes or so. I think the diving and the shark cage experience also done on this floor. Though didn’t experiment but I saw the diving gears and other accessories while taken to the boat ride area.TicketsYou can either buy an all inclusive kind of ticket which allows entry to the tunnel, underwater zoo, fish feeding, glass bottom boat ride, behind scene tour or something like that. Or you can choose to buy (or upgrade) tickets separately for the underwater zoo and glass bottom boat ride. The ticket price is bit high for what is on display here.The Entertainer Dubai voucher allows to get 1 free entry for the tunnel and underwater zoo for a paid ticket for the same. You need to buy the glass bottom boat ride and other options separately. As of December 2011 it was AED 25 per person for the glass bottom boat ride. If you are a first timer to an aquarium then you may find this place interesting. Also, if you would like to take this as part of the Dubai holiday experience then you can spend some time here and have fun. For others, except the gigantic tank, I guess there is nothing much as an aquarium as such.

A brilliant and educational experience. It is extremely worthwhile planning a visit to this attraction whilst inside the Dubai Mall commercial and entertainment centre. The aquarium employees have so much enthusiasm and are delighted to impart their knowledge and information to all visitors ... very educational and brilliantly displayed.To date, I have never seen a better (or larger) or more impressive aquarium anywhere in the world. For visitors to Dubai with limited time, without actually having to enter the aquarium, one can see the grandeur of the exterior of the main part of the aquarium from the interior of the Dubai Mall from various levels ... the viewing windows are no less than two storeys high, and provide a wonderful insight into various forms of marine life and, if luck is on your side, you may even witness the aquarium keepers descend in cages to feed the sharks.
Dubai Aquarium. Cool that it is in a Mall. A good Aquarium. Zoo bit is small. Boat rid is very tame.

Must Visit!. If you've gone all the way to The Dubai Mall and not seen the Dubai aquarium & underwater zoo, you have really missed something! It is the holder of the Guinness World Record for the 'World's Largest Acrylic Panel', which means it is larger than Japan's Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium. The 10 million litre aquarium tank is the largest suspended aquarium in the world and has various species like the giant spider crabs, sea jelly, sea horse, clown fish(nemo), the giant puffer fish, the humboldt penguin (they were the cutest) and a lot more creep crawly creatures. I went for the platinum package(AED 75) which included:1. aquarium tunnel & underwater zoo2. behind the scenes tour3. gift shop voucher worth AED 10The Ultimate Aquarium package includes the glass-bottom boat ride and fish feeding in addition to the ones mentioned above.Once you get to the Rainforest level, do get some photos clicked with a live python.

Aquarium. This was too good. If you are visiting with kids this will be a good place to visit. though I felt the entrance fee was too high it was worth it. The underwater zoo was stinking and for sometime we had to cover our nose. Apart from this it was good.

AMAZING. This is one amazing stuff, a huge aquarium in the middle of the Dubai Mall with real life aquatic life and whats more you can go deep sea diving there. What mesmerized me was how the glass could hold so much water. Just crazy. Seeing is believing!!

Diving within the Tank. As diving is one of my favourite sports, I have found diving inside an Aquarium with live black tip sharks and having the opportunity to feed them an even better affair. The wall itself is known as one of the largest Acrylic walls in the world, but the main attraction for myself was (again) the diving. While inside the tank, one can see various rays and mantas, while also seeing a few groupers, tame nursing sharks, one or two flathead hammerheads, and a few larger black-tips.The Zoo itself is mostly aquatic lifeforms, and some of the more rare options could also be found. The tanks however, I felt were on the little of the small side, as they also have penguins, I felt that the space for these little animals to play in was not very adequate. Nonetheless, the option to have had three dives, and complete a PADI Speciality Dive for the experience was well worth it. The dive operator was actually Al Boom Diving, and the dive instructor Ryan was extremely helpful, even with my poor scheduling with him. Overall Experience: A
Nice. Nice, the biggest in the world. But to entry fee is very expensive.

Fantastic underwater viewing tunnel. Fantastic viewing tunnel, largest in the world. Well worth the trip. I did prefer the Atlantis Lost Chambers Aquarium but we went to both as we wanted to experience the tunnel. Amazing variety of marine life! The largest tank can be viewed from within the mall and you don't have to pay to see that part. You can also arrange to go diving with thin tank!

Scuba Diving at the Dubai Aquarium. Perhaps not once in a lifetime, but close! Exhilarating experience with Al-Boom Diving at the Dubai Aquarium. Dive Instructor/Leader Randy was great --- Informative, professional, friendly, energetic, confident, and easy to talk to. The water was colder than I expected (go for the 7mm if you might be nervous about diving with sharks!).

Spectacular!. A wonderful spectacle, much of which is visible from within the Dubai Mall, but it's not expensive and the close-up views are amazing. Always on the look-out for Napoleon wrasse when snorkelling - here there are four of them mixing it with all the rays, sharks etc.
Super for children and adults alike.. Loved seeing the sharks so close. You can see such detail on all the fish.

The largest Aquarium!. The size of the main tank takes your breath away as you go about your shopping in the Mall. The water is so clean and the tank is very well maintained. The Zoo, though intended for children, was excellent and as adults, we really enjoyed the visit.

Easy to access and entertain the children.. We enjoyed the aquarium, the tunnel was great, and paid extra to get into a little boat, no engine, and drop food over the side to feed the fish which the children loved!
Sea Life. Wonderful display of aquatic life. you will be mesmerised by the stints of bat rays.
Beautiful. A nice feeling to walk around exotic fish and being able to study them up close. Sharks are ugly and scary.

Top 5 attraction in Dubai. A very neat aquarium and zoo - comparable and better in some aspects (aquatic life) than most I've seen in the US. For 50 AED you get the aquarium and zoo package - a very good deal. the majority of the big aquarium can indeed be seen for free from the inside of the mall, however that is only a small part (albeit a spectacular one) of the whole exhibit. Very worthwhile to pay and see the whole thing.

aquarium is smth, the zoo is not so impressive. It's definitely worth visiting, especially with the kids. Part of the aquarium can be seen from inside the Mall, but I think it's worth paying and entring the tunnel and going through all those interestingly arranged halls of the aquarium. Very impressive. I don't feel sorry for the money I spent to visit the aquarium (but I do think it was a waste of money to pay for the visit to the aquarium in Palm Atlantis hotel, no comparison! If you visit the one in Dubai Mall, don't pay for the pricey aquarium in Palm Atlantis, spend your money on smth more worthy!)
it's fun and it's something to do. if you are with kids, then you must see this. it's pretty good and it's a getaway from all that shopping, very relaxing!! :)
Interesting and huge. The aquarium has lots of fishes, and you can cross it through an underwater tube. The fishes swim around you.
A break from shopping. Well worth a visit to see quite a variety of fish and sharks etc.
Amazing!!. The tank is absolutely stunning. Well worth the time and money to go see.

great aquarium but a bit pricey. The animals and sea creatures were beautiful in there but would have liked a touch tank for the starfish etc. Wasn't that fussed on the tunnel, that should be free for all the shopping centre visitors as you can see most of it anyway without entering, but the underwater zoo had plenty of interesting photo opportunities. Tip- the funniest creatures are near the end!
Beautiful.... We had access to the aquarium with the day pass for the water park and it really is a must. So beautiful.
Fun and educational. The place was arranged nicely and my kids loved it.Educational and interesting.
Lots of fish. Fish, fish and more fish! Not worth paying the fee to walk through the tunnel, as what u see on the outside is exactly the same on the inside!
Expensive but worth it. Not cheap but really has been done well. An amazing experience well worth visiting, especially if you have children.
great. good experience, big varieties of fishes, acceptable prices , nice view,clear view , helpful staff.
Not Worth the Money. Basically, save your money and view the aquarium from the exterior.
worth seeing. You get to get very close to sharks etc, well worth seeing.
Over rated. Good only for a one time. Great for kids. Very expensive

Diving Experience at the Dubai Aquarium. My newly PADI certified teenage son and his friend enjoyed a diving experience in the Dubai Aquarium as a birthday treat. 40 minutes in the aquarium with professional divers, much to the excitement of the crowds outside! The boys thoroughly enjoyed it - and it makes quite a unique entry in their log book!

Fascinating - worth a look. Quite amazing this is within a mall. Worth seeing, the basic package isn't too expensive and you can even do proper diving with sharks. Very well maintained and looked after

Fish aquarium. Dubai aquarium is fully visible from outside. You should not waste any money to go inside. The underwater tunnel is totally useless, and it ends before it starts. The aquarium on the top floor is also nothing great.
Well worth a visit. The first thing that hits you is the size of the tank ! for AED 100 you can visit the aquarium, underwater zoo & glass bottom boat. Great value !

Not so impressive. The Aquarium is just OK and is quite small. It is a very small passage to visit and see the Aquarium and ticket is quite expensive, I believe that Singapore Aquarium and Kasai Rinkai Park/ Shinagawa Aquariums in Tokyo are far better that this

Excellent attraction for adults and children. Yes you can see the fish swimming around for free, but it's well worth paying and walking through the tunnel which is amazing and the zoo is one of the best things. Lots of very odd fish and crabs (huge land crabs from the Phillipines are one of the most terrifying things I have seen!) and seals and penguins. Recommend it to young and old.Lots of things to buy on the way out and you can get your photo taken which is then put on the Aquarium as a background, lovely momento for visitors.

OK but little disappointed. We went with kids thinking we can spend few hours. Aquarium is one fish tank. All species are in single tank. We were done in 15 minutes. If you are in the mall then you can see it from outside rather than buying the ticket. Underwater zoo was an experience as it had a section of Amazon rain forest theme. I'm little disappointed.
Impressive. Impressive, but you can see almost all of it from the outside not paying the money to get in
Great aquarium!. A great place to visit. You can see a lot of species. We also fed the fish! I recommend taking the complete tour.
a great place to visit. Located at Dubai mall, it is a great place to visit with or without kids
so close to under sea creatures. WOW experirence i like the underwater creatures as well as the under water zoo in dubai mall it is excellent you should try it

Free bit great, otherwise only okay. Fantastic to be able to look at the big tank (free) from the mall, except that seom of the view was impaired by the refecltion of the candy store opposite. Have seen better acquaria overall elsewhere, especially given the the cost of getting in.
nice aquarium and zoo!. Very very nice! children love the zoo and aquarium.. spent 1 whole day there and our children loved it. the aquarium was state of the art..
Captivatingly Mezmerizing. Good for adults and kids alike. Very informative - queue is likewise long on site, suggest to buy tickets online - good deals with Cobone.com at times. Kids loved it.

Hundreds of species... Best aquarium ever!!!. We went to this aquarium a lot. It is the best place for families entertainment in dubai. Beautiful creatures. Worth the money.
There are packages like shark feeding too.

Better than expected. This is a really good experience especially if you go behind the scenes and see how the tanks are maintained and the fish kept in good health, very good value perfect for children and adults alike
Excellent!. If visiting the Dubai Mall, spend time here also. Excellent small aquarium with some interesting exhibits you don't see everywhere.

Nothing special beyond the fact it is in a mall. Nice large aquarium with a tunnel. That said, there are many much nicer such tunnels around the world. What makes this one special is only the fact the aquarium is in a mall. Worth a visit though if you are in Dubai. The "zoo" is somewhat interesting. Glass bottom tours are also organised (didn't try). And for the scuba divers, just dive in the aquarium. Absolutely worth it although expensive (about USD 170 all included for one dive). Not sure though the Padi speciality they try to sell is worth it (3 dives for about USD 500).

Loved it!. It's worth paying the fee to visit the 'zoo' attached to the aquarium. The exhibits are extremely interesting - everyone from my 50+ year old sister to her teenage son enjoyed themselves (and me too). Every time we go to Dubai Mall we stand and watch the sharks, rays and colorful variety of fish in the aquarium (the huge outside tank viewing is free). Totally worth a trip to the mall to see it.

Great Experience for kids (and parents). We enjoyed our tour there even if the full package is a bit pricey.Do not miss the indoor boat trip with seethrough bottom which is quite an experience to observe the underwater animals.
Brilliant and worth a visit. Absolutely a little gem in a shopping mall..Will be going again on next visit to dubai, loved the little trip to feed the fish.
Nice aquarium. I wasnt ale to go inside but the view from outside at Dubai Mall is just great one.

Nice trip especially with kid. Going there with family and to be honest my kid loves it a lot. It is a quite nice especially you want to spend some time in Dubai mall. The zoo is quite complete with enough entertainment for young ages. While for adult it is just an OK stuff.

good for kids. You can see the huge tank without paying anything to get in, but it is worth a visit to the underwater zoo as well. After walking through the tank you head upstairs to the zoo. My daughter loved it, Water rats, otters, penguins and many other creatures to see up close.
for kids. If you have kids it is definitely worth a visit.All in all it is ok , my favorite part of it all was the different species of penguins.
Beautiful. Again this was breath taking and amazing how they have built this. If you go to Dubai you have to visit it.
amazing. great and wonderful for us and our kids as it is amazing to see such a diversities of fishes, sharks... so close to you and in a huge aquarium in a shopping mall

Inside the Dubai Mall. We visited the Aquarium and underwater Zoo on a trip to the Dubai Mall which has a fantastic frontage - it was very good but felt it was a bit pricey for what you got - the photos was very expensive but good quality. We did not do the creepy crawlie part so cannot comment on this.

Worth seeing. Amazing to see such a huge aquarium inside a mall! Get the ticket that takes you out the back to see and hear about how they look after the fish. The Underwater Zoo with its penguins and beavers and lots of other interesting animals was really worth the visit.

A Fun Day. Used Entertainer vouchers to gain 2 for 1 entry. Good aquarium, think the most amazing thing is the giant wall that goes around the entrance of the aquarium, I've never seen anything like it! Convenient as it is located inside the Dubai Mall.
Largest viewing panel!. 100 dirham is excellent value to see everything.. including a turn on the 'boat' with viewing floor.
Worth the trip. Really good to see this with my son and he rated it very highly
Soo Colourful. Could have spent hours there just observing all the aquarium live, there are little sitting areas where you can do just that.

Day at shopping centre. When looking round the shops at the Dubai Mall we came across the Aquarium and Underwater zoo. This is a lovely look at different fishes etc and breaks up the shopping for the kids
A huge selection of sea life. This was a huge aquarium with lots of beautiful marine life in amazing colours. A must see for adults and children ;0)

UNFORGETTABLE EXPERIENCE. Visited Dubai Aquarium and the underwater Zoo, which was life-time opportunity and unforvgettable experience. You dont realise how your time flies once you are around the different species of fish. I would definitely recommend - one visit is a must.
Its HUGE !. A must visit for any tourist ! They've got all kinds of fish and creatures . . kids will go wild !

Cool. Lots Of Sea Creatures
Like Sharks And Jellyfish
A Very Good Experience
Worth visiting with kids. My daughter loved it and so did the adults. Watch out for the hugely overpriced souvenir photo.
Interesting Aquarium in the Mall. It was interesting, specially with the mini-cooper inside. The tank is large and has many kinds of fish. Very interesting concept.
NOT exactly what i expected.... BUT who would have imagined the largest aquarium to be in the world in the largest mall in the world....next to the largest bldg in the world...lol
Unreal. This is based in the Dubai Mall, it is in the centre of the mall covering three levels. Well worth a visit if you have children.

Great idea but tragic for the fish!. The Guiness world record holder for the biggest viewing window how disappointed I was to discover that only the fish are real! The aquarium is doing a great education job for kids who may never have the opportunity to see the fish in the wild but for a South African tourist I would not put this on my to do list.

thought there would be more to see. the tunnel is a short walk through tunnel the underwater zoo i found disappointing we were asked if we wanted our picture taking with a snake which looked sleepy and docile and kept in a plastic box we declined. on the whole no i wound not go again to this place

What else can you fit into a Shopping Mall...?!!. Along with hundreds of stores and every luxury brand imaginable, the Dubai Mall is home to some odd things; an ice rink, an indoor theme park (Sega Republic), and the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo.As some reviewers have pointed out, much of what's on offer in the main aquarium can be seen for free from inside the Mall, but the trip through the tunnel and upstairs into the Underwater Zoo does provide an opportunity to see the creatures at closer quarters and is worth the relatively small entrance fee.An entertaining way to pass an hour or so, if only because it will stop you from clearing out your bank account in the fabulous Mall stores!!

Big big ridiculously big aquarium tank with a more normal aquarium tagged on. Typically Dubai attraction that is largest in the world as apposed to tallest or most expensive. You can join the crowds who stare at the tank for free in the Mall, or pay to see it from a tunnel inside or above in a glass bottomed boat (this was an anticlimax & can be missed). The rest of the aquarium (called an underwater zoo) is more conventional and not strictly accurate as it did have snakes, lizards, spiders too. All beautifully laid out and immaculate as you would come to expect in Dubai.

Don't miss it, it's relaxing. :-). I took advantage visiting Dubai Aquarium before the Gulf Food started. I would say, from the scale of 1-5, 5 being the highest. I would rate the place at 5. So, when you go to Dubai, don't miss the Dubai Aquarium and underworld, It's relaxing!
Busy but fun. Quite crowded but interesting, lots to see and bigger than I expected it to be. Worth the money

Good Afternoon Out. Regularly take our daughter as she loves the aquarium. Gets very busy in the afternoons so best to get there early to avoid queues and hoards of tourists. The penguins smell really bad :-)

Plenty of see. Plenty of animals to see. We bought a combined ticket including the tunnel, the underwater zoo and a backstage tour. Tunnel gives a better perspective of the size of the tank, and you can see sand tiger sharks which you cant see from the mall. Underwater zoo if pretty cold - bring a jumper! Backstage tour gives and insight on how the tank is maintained and how the fish are looked after and fed.
Largest in world. awasomeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee

The best Aquarium in the Arabian Gulf Region. you can go under the tunnel and see the fish and turtles all over the tunnel. The Zoo is good and the kids will enjoy it, but be patient and teach them about the different specious there.
My daughter loved it. We took the trip on the boat and fed the fish.Very manufactured "nature" experience but my daughter is 11 and loved it.

From the free perspective, it was great. First off, the aquarium is inside the mall! it is massive. I was going to pay to see it and I over heard people saying that it was not worth it. So, I looked at what seemed to be most of the exhibit from outside the mall. The only thing that paying a fee will get you will be to be closer to the fish. It was not a big deal to me because i was not going swimming with them or anything. Well worth the time.

Interesting concept, but limited compared to standalone facilities. We visited the aquarium, which is in the center of the Dubai Mall. The multi-story fish tank with underwater tunnel entrance is amazing to see, filled with all sorts of sea life. The ticket includes the option for a glass bottom boat ride, which we paid for. It was a small boat which floated around the top of the tank, and we did not think it worth the experience. Upstairs were a variety of fish in the 'zoo' section. All in all, it took under an hour to see and was not as exciting as standalone facilities we have visited in other cities. But if you want an interesting experience as a distraction from shopping, this is a nice activity to do.

Very cute!. Firstly, what I would say is that the entrance ticket is 50AED for both attractions (or 25 for 1) In English pounds this is approximately £9. You would need to allow at least an hour to do both attractions justice. We felt that this represented excellent value, regardless of how the rest of my review is perceived!The Aquarium is pretty much plain to see. For the most part, you wouldn't necessarily have to pay the entrance to see most of the fish as it's slap bang in the middle of the main atrium in the Dubai Mall! But, the entrance ticket enables you to walk through the underwater tunnel running the length of the giant tank. It's very cool walking through the sharks and it's lovely seeing the rays gliding around - we saw a particularly cute one playing a game sliding down the curve of the tunnel :o)You do have to poke up with the omnipresent naffness of posing for a staged photo which you can buy out through the other end of the tunnel, but the staff don't hound you into buying.For the Underwater Zoo, you then go up the escalator to level 2 (be warned all you broody potential parents, it's up in the incredibly cute baby section of the Dubai Mall)In here were all the usual suspects you might find in a fishy exhibit - clown fish, pyrrhanas, angel fish, angler fish etc etc There were also other creepies like tarantulas, snakees, lizards as well as the fluffier otters and water rats.My favourites were the very cute penguins which I could have watched frolicking for hours.An ideal way to spend family time in the air-conditioned coolness, but also great for anyone else in touch with their inner child!

Great experience but quite pricey. Very pricey but a good quality establishment where animal welfare seems at the forefront. You can walk through the tunnel (amazing experience), go to the underwater zoo and also take a short boat ride to feed the fish! My 3yr old loved it. You can see the enormous acrylic side of the tank from the Dubai Mall for £0 though, so be sure you'll enjoy the inside experience before parting with your money. We did really enjoy it but don't think we'd do it again.
Wonderful waterpark. The waterpark has got amazing view,one of the largest i would like to say. so criss cross amazing fun i had.

Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo. Dubai aquarium and underwater zooThis is located inside the dubai mall, its amazing the size of the aquarium, and to be inside a mall, you have to see it, it won the guiness record for larger acrylic panel, but besides that non useful fact, its great, specially for kids there are some many fishes and all kind of marine wild life. you will go to the dubai mall, so you cannot miss this while you are there

Too commercial and overpriced.. If I was to make a recommendation I would look at the aquarium from outside in the mall. Paying to go in simply gets you to walk through the aquarium tunnel and you don't really see much more. The captive annimals in tanks are quite distressing if you're an animal lover as some of them are in small areas compared to where they would live normally. The penguin habitat I found quite upsetting. Much better to see these animals in their natural habitat and watch a good David Attenborough film about them.

Nice Place!. One of the largest aquariums in the world and surely one of the most beautiful also. I bought the 50 AED package for the tunnel and the zoo. I felt that the tunnel was too short and that the one in Singapore was much better. The sharks were awesome, but the the whole length of the tunnel could be seen without entering it! Then we visited the 'Zoo' on the 2nd level. That place was fantastic. The fishes were beautiful and we got some amazing pics! The reptiles were good and the atmosphere of the zoo was amazing. It was peak summer and it was about 40 C outside the mall and I was surprised to see emperor penguins swimming around in freezing cold waters! The penguins were beautiful and we thoroughly enjoyed this bit.In short, a very beautiful and informative place to visit.

Fantastic underwater aquarium. We saw this incidentally when out shopping.It is excellent.You can see most of it in the shopping mall free but if you want a closer look you can pay to do so and even pay to swim with the fish and sharks in Scuba diving gear!

Great for all sealife lovers. Having been to Seaworld Florida which is pretty special i have to say this is also pretty special. Just the sight of the "sea" in a shopping centre is awesome. There is something very special about seeing this kind of view and if you don't scuba dive going through the tunnel under the whole thing is a great experiance. It's probably the next best thing to a dive. The "zoo" section is good too. Not great but with someone who is interested in in all things natural well worth the visit. The way the cafe inside is decked out is also worth a mention. A bit "Kitsch" but good fun. Make sure you take your camera.

Aquarium in a Shopping Mall?. Not the normal place I would expect to see a stunning aquarium. It is located in the centre of Dubai Mall which currently holds the title of the world's largest mall. The mall is located in Downtown which is easy to get to. There are a number of other sights to see close by such as the Burj Khalifa, Dubai Fountains as well as some retail therapy in Dubai Mall itself.The aquarium itself like most things in Dubai is gigantic. It is well stocked with a variety of exotic fish and it's free! If you want to go through the tunnel then you pay extra, we decided to go through the tunnel but it was over to quickly. The underwater zoo although small was interesting and well worth the visit.

Incredible wall of fish, tunnel and zoo good too. After being taken a back at the sheer scale of the main aquarium that everyone can see from the mall we discovered that there was a tunnel through it that you had to pay for, so we decided to go for that too. It turned out to be a good choice as most of the big sharks hide in the caves that you can only see when you go through the tunnel. We spent a long time in the tunnel watching the various animals swim past and posing for photos next to sharks.Afterwards we went upstairs to the underwater zoo where there was another good selection of marine life to see including penguins.

Loved the huge wall of fish & sea life!. We went because my husband wanted to go and he loved it. the tunnel where you walk through to view the sharks was pretty amazing to see. it was worth checking out, they have lots of neat creatures and also the huge wall which faces into the mall was so big, very nice set up.

So Good I Feel Like I'm a Fish!!. I went to the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo with my partner during the week and it was not too overcrowded which was great, as we could see each section at our own pace. They have a few options of how you would like to see the Aquarium & Underwater Zoo, either on your own; with a guided tour or there is also an option of going on a tour, glass bottom boat and fish feeding! They also give you vouchers and extra things with these options. We chose just to walk through on our own, but all options were very reasonable rates.The underwater zoo had great ocean and rainforest backdrops for each display of marine life or 'creepy crawlies'. There were lots of different fish, turtles, otters and crustaceans and the rainforest section included a suspension bridge which overlooked the marine life below it. I thought the best part in the zoo were the penguins, there were two different breeds and they were so adorable.The aquarium is known for having the largest viewing panel, and you can walk along the outside of it and then go INSIDE it through a see through tunnel where you are surrounded by fish, sharks, stingrays and divers!!Definitely a must see in Dubai and suitable for all ages!

wonderful. My first time was in january 2010. Had a nice time especially watching the maintainance guys swimming among the animals and also cleaninig the various portions of the aquirum. It was a delight to see.

Fantastic for all ages!!. This is just fantastic for all. The Aquarium can be seen from the outside for free but do buy a ticket to walk though the tunnel and to the underwater zoo as I saw marine life I did not know even existed!! The giant crabs look like something out of a sci fi movie!!!! Great value for money and for all ages..

Aquarium was good but don't bother with the glass bottom boat ride. Enjoyed the aquarium, didn't look at the zoo much as it's not my thing, went on the glass bottom boat trip which was a great disappointment - would recommend the rest but don't bother with the boat - was not worth paying extra for. Think we paid about £16.50 each to get in, including the boat 'trip'.

Unforgetable Experiance. Inside the Dubai Mall there is an amazing underwater zoo and aquarium, I personally like the underwater zoo more than the aquarium. There are feeding sessions in the zoo from time to time which are just amazing. There is also a glass bottom boat service from which you can see fishes at the bottom, the experience is just amazing. I suggest to go when you have lots of free time so that you can have maximum fun, although the ticket is a little expensive still its worth every penny!! and now they also have a creepy crawlers section upstairs don't forget to visit that.

A real delight and fantastic value for money!. This was one of the most surprisingly fantastic parts of your stay in Dubai. After visiting many aquariums in the past I wasn't expecting too much different from the Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo at the Dubai Mall, but I was very wrong! For less than half the price of an entry to a Sea life centre in the UK you get to walk through one of the largest underwater glass tunnels in the world through the world largest aquarium tank! The spectacle of the giant glass window looking into the aquarium from the Mall is where most people stand but I highly recommend paying the small entry fee, it's well worth it! It's a great experience and there is plenty of sharks and fish to see. This was fantastic as it was but it's only half the story!The underwater zoo was up one level and was an amazing walk through experience that took about one hour to visit. It included many more fish and animals including Perinea's, Penguins, Stingrays, Otters, Lizards, Snakes, Starfish, Jellyfish and much much more. It was great fun too with rope bridges to adventure across and a glass floor you can walk over above the giant tank. It's a fantastic venue and offer something for all ages. It's also many times better than any Sea life centre I have ever visited with my Merlin Annual Pass in the UK! Don't miss out on this well looked after and organised attraction in Dubai!

It's ok. From the outside you think you will walk thru a big aquarium. Although it's massive the attraction only takes a mere 3 minutes to walk thru. Something for the kids to do. The underwater zoo is a little more detailed and keeps kids attention also. Definitely get the combo pack for the zoo and aquarium.

Decent - at best.. Skip the view from top.... Nothing jawdropping here. Having been to other aquariums in the US, this was decent at best. Can't complain because this was at the mall..The tickets were pretty pricey for the amount of fish and the wildlife being offered. The tour from top was pretty lame. Just take the underground tunnel and mark this thing off your things to do list...

Wow,interesting!"'. Its superb,the sharks and other fishes are a must to see in dubai.From the mall there are splendid views of the aquarium but when you go through the tunnel you get the chance of taking splendid shots.Staff in the tunnel will answer your questions to the best of their ability,its truly a place to visit.

A good opportunity to get close to sharks!. We planned to go here before we went to Dubai and were not disappointed. You can see into the tank for free from the Mall and it really is HUGE! But when you pay and go in you get to experience the fish up close! The fish and animals all seem to be well looked after and in good health so I hope they are all well looked after! The tunnel is short but we were asking staff all about the fish/sharks what they were called and there was a member of staff who was happy to chat and share his knowledge with us.

Aquarium's tunnel was short. more impressive from the outside (free). underwater zoo was better. I was a bit disappointed since the aquarium's tunnel was quite short. If you've never seen/been to an underwater tunnel before, I suppose maybe it's worth the 25 dirhams, but to be honest, I thought it was more impressive looking at the tank from the outside (mall) which was free. It was packed with loud tourists when I was there so it was not a tranquilizing experience. The underwater zoo upstairs was better, but also packed with loud tourists tapping on the glass and taking flash photography (not allowed but there was no stopping such annoying behavior). Being in that environment was giving me a headache (opposite of what an aquarium should do), but the underwater zoo itself is not too bad (another 25 aed to get in). I personally enjoyed the Lost Chambers at Atlantis the Palm better even though it was twice as expensive to get in (100 aed) and seem to have less fish.

Great family attraction. We had great fun with all the different parts of this attraction. The views from outside drew us in, the tunnel walk was amazing. We then went to the zoo which was great and not too much information but lots for the kids to see. Finally, the glass bottomed boat was great and the kids got to feed the fish. Really good value for money.

absolutly fabulous. just got back from a holiday in Dubai and loved the aquarium. the shark tunnel was great as you could see the sharks from a different angle. the glass bottomed boat trip was good and loved the penguins and the water rats were funny as they were just sat there eating with looks of concentration on their faces.

Shark Tunnel is a must!. The Underwater Zoo was awesome! I think you have to pay seperately for the shark tunnel and the Aquarium. I can't recall. The Shark Tunnel has such great photo ops and it is so neat to see the sharks that close up and not to mention all the other fish in the water. The Aquarium on the 2nd floor of the mall was fun too though. Most of the fish tanks are open ones so you can bend over and see the fish from the top so that was neat. They have a tank which has all the fish portrayed in Finding Nemo. Only complaint I have about it all is the other patrons. Other people were tapping on the glass and scaring the fish. It was ridiculous. Obviously they've never seen Free Willy. The best exhibit was the Penguins though! They have a few different kinds such as Emporer Penguins etc. and they are very friendly. The tanks are really designed to give you the closest experience possible to the animals. I had fun but it's not that big so remember that if you are wary of paying a high admission fee.

Diving @ dubai Aquarium. i'm a certified diver and always wanted to experience diving into the Dubai aquarium @ Dubai Mall, the experience was phenominal, the dive master and the instructor who accompanied my two daughters (10 and 14) were very professional and safety oriented. my daughters had no diving experience and they were training at the al-boom dive center, and they were very comfortable in the water, thanks to the instructor.the tank had around 91 different shark species, and the tour inside the tank was great, for Dhs 625 if you are a certified diver and Dhs 825 if not.we had a great time, my daughters went back to saudi and now they finished the open water PADI certification course.if you want to experience a nice dive with over a thousand species in one place this is the place to go if you are in teh dubai area.

Amazing. Live in Dubai and frequented Dubai mall every week and didnt realize what a great attraction was under our noses. Amazed at the underwater zoo and what great value it was for AED 50 each. A price of two coffees is normally AED 50 in Dubai so very competitively priced. You think because you see the big mall aquarium you have seen everything but its totally different in the underwater zoo. We saw penguims otters, eels, pirahnas, sea horses, massive crabs and a variety of wierd and wonderful fish that were fantastic. Well worth a visit.

Worth a visit. Located inside the Dubai mall, the aquarium is dubbed the largest in the world… having won the Guiness Book of World Records as the largest acrylic viewing panel of the world. It takes its role of educating the public very seriously and its tours are designed with this in mind, in an enjoyable hands-on way.Highlights include feeding time for the enormous Sand Tiger Sharks and the majestic Stingrays. The aquarium & underwater zoo is a mecca for marine-loving individuals a large collection of over 30,000 types of sea life.Everyone there is sure to enjoy the view and immerse your senses in a stimulating environment of vivid underwater colours and stunning marine life. They have an experience called shark dive – an opportunity to have a diving experience in an aquarium environment. I didn’t do it this time, but next time, I certainly will ditch my street threads for a wetsuit to dive with sharks.(www.perfyi.wordpress.com)
